我有 G2，我有 G3。然后，对于 E2，我有减去 G3。好的，我将其简单地表示为元件电压乘以括号中的某些项，并将我的外部源放在右侧。同样，我继续在这里做同样的事情。在这个例子中，让我将我的源移到右边。所以，我得到了 I1，我得到了 V nought G4。

I have G2, and I have G3. And then, for E2, I have minus G3. OK, so I’ll simply express this as the element voltages multiplied by some terms in parentheses, and I put my external sources on the right hand side. Similarly, I go ahead and do the same thing here. In this instance, let me move my sources to the right. So, I get I1 coming out there, and I get V nought G4 coming out there.

顺便说一句，我只想告诉你们，如果你想睡觉，现在是个好时机，因为我一写下这两个方程式，好了，从现在开始就是午睡时间了。从现在开始你们不会学到什么新东西了。只是 Anant Agarwal 在黑板上玩得很开心，把符号推来推去。

By the way, I just want to mention to you that if you’re looking to fall asleep, this is a good time to do so because as soon as I write down these two equations, OK, from now on it’s nap time. There’s nothing new that you’re going to learn from here on. It’s just Anant Agarwal having fun at the blackboard, pushing symbols around.

所以，一旦你写下这两个节点方程，剩下的就只是肮脏的数学了。所以，让我玩得开心一点。让我继续做下去。所以我把电压和电流移到了另一边。让我在这里收集 E1 的所有系数。所以，E1 减去 G3，我想就是这样了。

So, once you write down these two node equations, the rest of it is just grubby math. So, let me just have some fun. So let me just go ahead and do that. So, I moved my voltages and currents to the other side. And let me collect all the coefficients for E1 here. So, E1 minus G3, and that’s it, I guess.

好的，然后我将对 E2 执行相同的操作。这样，我得到了 G4，得到了 G3，得到了 G5。好的，请注意，这里我有两个方程和两个未知数。好的，这两个方程在右边，我有一些电压和电流，它们是干电压和干电流。好的，实际上这变得相当无聊。我要在这里暂停一下，谈谈其他事情。

OK, and then I’ll do the same for E2. So, I get G4, and I get G3, and I get G5. OK, so notice here that I have two equations, and two unknowns. OK, the two equations are on the right hand side, I have some voltages and currents which are my dry voltages and dry currents. OK, so actually this is getting quite boring. I’m going to pause here, and talk about something else.

矩阵形式

Matrix Form

所以，你可以把它变成矩阵形式，我在第十页已经为你做了。都是矩阵形式。是的，我知道。你可以用任何技术来解决它，使用代数技术，使用线性代数方法来解决这个问题，使用计算机，无论你想要什么。还有，当计算机分析电路时，它们会写下这些方程式，并处理矩阵求解。

So, you can take this and you can put it in matrix form, so I’ve done that for you on page ten. It’s all matrix form. Yeah, I know that. You can use any technique to solve it, use algebraic techniques, use linear algebraic methods to solve it, use a computer, whatever you want. And, computers, when computers analyze circuits, they write down these equations, and deal with solving matrices.

那么，当你学习线性代数时，这里有多少人上过线性代数课？这里有多少人听说过高斯消元法？听说过高斯消元法的人怎么会比上过线性代数课的人多呢？好吧，现在你知道你为什么要上那些线性代数课了。如果我把它们收集成矩阵形式

So, when you take the linear algebra across, how many people here have taken a linear algebra class? How many people here have heard of Gaussian elimination? How can more people have heard of Gaussian elimination than took a linear algebra class? Well anyway, so now you know why you took those linear algebra classes. And so, if I just collected these into matrix form

好的，我刚才简单地用线性代数形式表达了这两个方程，这是我的未知数列向量，你可以应用你在线性代数中学到的任何技术来求解这个方程。高斯消元法有效。好的，在计算机领域，从事计算机技术研究或求解此类方程的人只需处理像这样的大型方程，构建计算机程序，给定这样的方程，就可以继续求解它们。

OK, so I just simply expressed those two equations in linear algebraic form, and here’s my column vector of unknowns, and you can apply any of the techniques you’ve learned in linear algebra to solve for this. Gaussian elimination works. OK, and in computer, people doing research in computer techniques, or solving such equations simply deals with huge equations like this, building computer programs that, given equations like this, can go ahead and solve them.

好的，让我在这里停下来并再次强调，你所做的是从麦克斯韦方程到使用块状物质学科到 KVL 和 KCL 的一次巨大飞跃，最终给出了一个简单的代数方程来求解，而不必担心麦克斯韦方程形式的偏微分方程。

OK, so let me stop here and reemphasize that what you’ve done is made a huge leap from Maxwell’s equations to using the lump matter discipline to KVL and KCL, which ended up giving a simple algebraic equation to solve, and not having to worry about partial differential equations that were the form of Maxwell’s equations.

Lec 3 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 3 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 51:13 https://youtube.com/watch?v=RsJ1eg7XNVs

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 51:13 https://youtube.com/watch?v=RsJ1eg7XNVs

让我们开始吧。你们能听见我说话吗？大声点，听清楚点。好的。让我们开始吧。在我开始之前，我先宣布几件事。Brad Buren 是我们这里的一名学生，他需要一名笔记员。这是一份有偿工作。所以如果你有兴趣，可以在课后顺便过来看看他。他就坐在这里，好吗？第二，提醒一下，6.002 确实有先决条件。

Let’s get started. Can you hear me back there? Loud and clear. OK. Let’s get started. Before I begin, just a couple of announcements. Brad Buren is one of our students here and he needs a note taker. It’s a paid position. So if you are interested you can stop by after class and see him. He’s sitting right here out there, OK? Second, just a reminder that 6.002 does have prerequisites.

先决条件是 8.02 和 18.03。因此，让我从常规开始。快速回顾一下我们迄今为止所做的工作。所以我们开始研究物理定律和麦克斯韦方程等。这些太难了，所以我们说让我们让自己的生活变得轻松。所以我们选择在这个游乐场玩耍，我们说我们将坚持集中物质学科。

And the prerequisites are 8.02 and 18.03. So with that let me start off with the usual. Do a quick review of what we’ve done so far. So we started out life looking at the laws of physics and Maxwell’s equations and so on. And those were way too hard so we said let’s make life easy for ourselves. So we chose to play in this playground in which we said we shall adhere to the lumped matter discipline.

好吗？LMD。所以我们就在那个操场里。所以整个课程，以及 EECS 的大部分内容都在那个操场里，其中应用了集中物质学科。所以一旦我们进入操场，LMD 操场，我们就可以采用麦克斯韦方程并将其抽象为两个非常非常简单的规则。非常简单的规则是 KVL 和 KCL。

OK? The LMD. So we are in that playground. So this entire course, and for that matter large parts of EECS are within that playground, within which the lumped matter discipline applies. So as soon as we jumped into the playground, the LMD playground, we could take Maxwell’s equations and abstract them out into two very, very simple rules. And the very simple rules were KVL and KCL.

KVL 简单地说，我可以对电路中任何环路的电压求和，结果将为零。同样，我可以对进入或离开任何节点的电流求和，总和也将为零。所以现在你可以做的是，如果你愿意，你可以四处炫耀。哦，是的，我们在日常生活中使用麦克斯韦方程组，是的，这是好东西。

KVL simply said that I can sum the voltages in any loop in a circuit and the result then would be zero. Similarly, I can sum the currents that enter or exit any node and the sum will also be zero. So what you can now do is, if you feel like, you can go around and brag. Oh, yeah, we use Maxwell’s equations in everyday life and, yeah, it’s good stuff.

关键在于，这实际上是麦克斯韦方程在我们所在的这个操场内的封装。所以我在上节课中谈到了电路分析的第一种方法。该方法简单地采用了 KVL 来表示所有环路，KCL 来表示所有节点，并写下元素 vi 关系。然后一起给你一大堆方程。

And the key is that this is really an encapsulation of Maxwell’s equations within this playground that we are in. So I talked about the first method of circuit analysis in the last lecture. And that method simply took the, wrote KVL for all the loops, wrote KCL for all the nodes and wrote element vi relationships. And together gave you a big bunch of equations.

你坐下来，仔细研究方程式，并求解支路电压和电流。所以我们回顾了第二种电路分析方法。我将其简称为电路组合。

And you sat down and grunged through the equations and you solved for branch voltages and currents. So we reviewed a second method of circuit analysis. And I’ll simply call it circuit composition.

该方法背后的基本思想是学习电阻如何增加、电导如何增加等一些简单规则，观察电路，通过电阻串联等方式进行串联简化来简化电路，然后对其进行组合和操作，直到我们得到所需的电流和电压。这是直观的方法。

The basic idea behind this method was to learn some simple rules of how resistors add and conductances add and so on and so forth and look at a circuit and simplify the circuit by making series simplifications when the resistors are in series and so on and so forth, and compose it and play around with it till we end up with the current, the voltages that we are looking for. This is the intuitive method.

因此，我认为课程笔记第 2 章中有一节讨论了使用此方法的几个示例，并尝试将此方法中应用的直观方法稍微正式化一些。所以我们接着研究了节点方法。节点方法只是应用 KVL 和 KCL 的一种特殊方法。还记得节点方法吗？我们采用了一个接地节点。

And so a section in Chapter 2, I believe, of the course notes discusses several examples using this method and attempts to make a little bit formal the intuitive approach that is applied in this method. So we then looked at the node method. And the node method was simply a particular way of applying KVL and KCL. Node method, remember? We took a ground node.

然后我们标记了相对于地面的剩余电压的节点。然后我们为每个节点写下 KCL。当我们为每个节点写下 KCL 时，请记住，KVL 隐含在我们用于每个节点流出电流的表达式中。

Then we labeled the nodes of the remaining voltages with respect to that ground. Then we wrote KCL for each of the nodes. And when we wrote KCL for each of the nodes, remember, KVL was implicit in this expression that we used for each of the currents that were exiting each node.

因此，如果 Ej 是节点电压，那么 Ej 减去 Ei 乘以电导 Gi 就是流经其中一个节点的电流，我应该称之为 Gij。这是连接节点 I 和 j 的电导。这给了我们输入到同一系统的 KVL。所以这是三种方法。顺便说一下，节点方法是 6.002 行业的主力。

So if Ej was a node voltage, then Ej minus Ei multiplied by the conductance Gi was the current that was going through one of those, I should call it Gij. This is a conductance that connects nodes I and j. That gave us the KVL that fed into the same system. So these are three methods. The node method, by the way, is sort of the workhorse of the 6.002 industry.

对于整个电路行业来说也是如此。如果有疑问，请应用模式方法，你会没事的。这适用于线性电路、非线性电路等等。我今天要做的是再介绍两种方法。请注意，本课程的前几节课，前三节课只是将你从物理世界过渡到 EECS 世界。

And for that matter for all of the circuits industry. When in doubt, apply the mode method, you’ll be OK. That applies to linear circuits, nonlinear circuits, what have you. What I’m going to do today is go through two more methods. So notice that the first few lectures of this course, the first three lectures simply comprise transitioning you from the world of physics to the world of EECS.

然后两堂课会教你很多技巧。所以我们会先教你各种工具，比如木槌、凿子等等。这五种方法就是你的工具。今天我们来学习两种方法。一种方法叫做叠加法，第二种方法叫做戴维南法。这些方法只适用于线性电路。

And then two lectures on giving you a bag of tricks. So we start you off with the sort of tools, your mallets and chisels and so on and so forth. And these five methods are your tools. We’ll look at two methods today. One method is called the method of superposition and the second method is called the Thevenin method. And these methods apply only to linear circuits.

因此，我们看一下线性电路的子集，这两种方法仅适用于这些电路。这些方法与直觉相结合，确实可以让你非常非常快速地解决非常有趣的电路。因此，让我使用通常的节点方法举一个例子。然后使用相同的例子介绍叠加方法和戴维南方法。因此，让我在这里给你画一个示例电路。

So we look at the subset of circuits that are linear, and these two methods apply to only those circuits. These are methods that combined with intuition really enables you to solve very interesting circuits very, very quickly. So let me do an example using a usual node method. And then jump into introducing the superposition methods and Thevenin methods using that same example. So let me draw you an example circuit here.

再次，我将使用这个例子，我将使用这个例子来介绍叠加法和戴维南法。所以我要做的是从通常的方式开始，使用您现在知道的方法，即节点法来分析电路。我将通过应用节点法写下节点方程。所以如果你还记得节点法。我选择一个接地节点。

So, again, I’m using this example, I will use this example to introduce the method of superposition and the Thevenin method. So what I’m going to do is start off the usual way and analyze the circuit using a method that you know now, the node method. And what I’ll do is write down the node equations for this by applying the node method. So if you recall the node method. I choose a ground node.

我要选择这个节点。它既有电压源与之相连，也有许多其他边缘与之接触。所以我要选择它作为接地节点，并用电压标记其他节点。所以这是一个未知数。我将其标记为 e。我想我们只有一个未知的 e。我知道这个节点的电压，也就是 V。

I’m going to choose this node. It’s got both the voltage source connected to it, and it’s also got many other edges impinging on it. So I’m going to choose that as my ground node and I’m going to label the other nodes with their voltages. So this is an unknown. I’ll label it as e. I guess we just have one unknown e. And I know the voltage of this node, and that is simply V.

由于它是 V，所以接地节点和该节点之间有一个电压源。所以我接下来要做的是写下这个节点的节点方程，然后从那里开始。让我继续做这件事。让我把流出、流出的电流加起来。

Since it’s V, there’s a voltage source between the ground node and that node. So what I can do next is that I can write down the node equation for this node and then go from there. So let me go ahead and do that. So let me sum up the currents going outside, going outwards.

因此，e 减去 v 除以 R1，e 减去零除以 R2，然后减去 i 等于零。这是一个节点方程。我希望您首先注意到的是，这个方程在 V 和 i 上是线性的。我所说的线性是指您看不到 Vi 或 V 平方之类的项。

So I have e minus v divide by R1, I have e minus zero divide by R2, and I have minus I equals zero. This is a node equation. The first thing I want you to observe is that this equation is linear in V and i. What I mean by linear is that you don’t see terms like Vi or V squared and things like that.

它是某个常数乘以 V 加上某个常数乘以 I 等于某个其他常数。所以这很不错。所以我将按以下方式重新排列这些项。我将把已知源移到右侧，并将 e 的系数收集在此侧，这样我就得到了 R1 的一个系数加上 R2 的一个系数。

It’s some constant times V plus some constant times I equals some other constant. So that’s quite nice. So I’m going to rearrange the terms in the following manner. I’ll move the known sources to the right hand side and collect the coefficients of e on this side, so I get one by R1 plus one by R2 over here.

盯着这个看一会儿，再次注意，这里有 e，我的未知节点电压，有一个常数乘数，它等于 V 的某个函数与 i 的某个函数相加。再次注意，这是 V 和 i 的线性组合。没有乘法项等等。这是一种非常标准的形式，我们经常用它来表示方程式。

So stare at this for a moment and notice again here I have e, my unknown node voltage, there is some constant multiplier, and that equals some function of V summed up with some function of i. And, again, notice that this is a linear combination of V and i. No multiplication terms and so on and so forth. This is a pretty standard form in which we will represent equations quite often.

只是为了标记它，这通常被标记为 G，即电导矩阵。当然，这是 e，即我们的未知节点电压，这是源的线性和。因此，这是我们表示方程的一种非常标准的方式。

And just to label it, this is often labeled G as the conductance matrix. Of course this is e, our unknown node voltages, and this is a linear sum of sources. So this is a very standard way that we will represent equations.

我们上周也做过这个，或者说是在周二，我取了一个电导矩阵，将其乘以未知节点电压的列向量，并将其等同于我的源电压的某种线性组合。电路是线性的，是因为电路中只有线性元件。我没有任何非线性元件。因此，我可以按以下方式重写它。

We did that last week as well, or rather on Tuesday where I took a conductance matrix, multiplied that by a column vector of unknown node voltages and equated that to some linear combination of my source voltages. The reason the circuit is linear is that I have only linear elements in the circuit. I don’t have any nonlinear elements. And because of that I can rewrite this in the following manner.

我将把 e 表示为 V 和 I 的函数，并将其带到这一侧。所以它是 i 的某个函数。所以我得到 R1 R2 除以 R1 加上 R2。然后我将 R1 R2 带到这一侧。这就是我得到的结果。盯着这个看几秒钟，非常常见的形式。我的未知节点电压等于右侧的这个值。

I’m just going to express e as a function of V and I and bring it over to this side. So it’s some function of i. So I get R1 R2 divide by R1 plus R2. And I bring R1 R2 to this side. That’s what I get. So stare at this for a few seconds, very common form. My unknown node voltage is equal to this stuff on the right hand side.

右边的内容有一个项乘以源电压 V，另一个项乘以电流 I。如果我把它以符号的形式表示出来，那么我的未知节点电压就是某个常数乘以 V1 加上某个常数乘以，形式为常数乘以源电流、常数乘以源电压等等。

The stuff on the right hand side has a term multiplying the source voltage V and some other term multiplying the current I. And if I were to put this in sort of symbol like form my unknown node voltage is some constant times V1 plus some constant times, is of the form constant times the source current, constant times the source voltage and so on.

A 和 V 的单位不同，因为在这种情况下 A 没有单位，因为 V 是电压。e 也是。在这种情况下，V 的单位是电阻。所以 V 乘以 I 得到电压。所以盯着这个等式看几秒钟，这应该有助于我们建立一些洞察力，让我们几乎通过检查就能写下答案。

The units of As and Vs are different because in this case A has no units because V is a voltage. And so is e. In this case V has units of resistance. So that V times I gives me a voltage. So stare at this equation for a few seconds and this should help us build up some insight that will allow us to write down the answer almost by inspection.

现在，我将在几分钟内向你们展示一种方法，这种方法可以让你只需盯着电路就能写下答案 e，而不必经过节点方程等。我教给你们的方法越多，你们就越能够完全独立地完成很多事情。

I’m going to show you a method now, in a few minutes, which will allow you to write down the answer e just by starring at the circuit without having to go through node equations and so on. The more and more methods I teach you, the more you will be able to do a lot of this completely by yourselves.

在这个特定示例中，这是一个相对简单的电路，但这些方法在情况更复杂时尤其有用。但在我继续之前，请允许我花几分钟时间阐述一下线性。这是一个线性电路。这个方程给出未知节点电压 e，它是源电压和源电流的线性和。线性意味着两个属性，即同质性，也赋予叠加性。

In this particular example it’s a relatively simple circuit but these methods would be particularly useful when you have more complicated situations. But before I go on let me spend a few minutes pontificating on linearity. So that’s a linear circuit. And this equation gives me the unknown node voltage e as a linear sum of source voltages and source currents. Linearity implies two properties, the property of homogeneity and also gives vice to the property of superposition.

我们先来做同质性。这句话的意思是，如果我有一个电路，某个电路，我给它输入某种输入，A，那么我的输出就是S。如果你饿了，就把它们想象成苹果，电路会把它们转换成苹果酱。

Let’s do homogeneity first. What this says is if I have a circuit, some circuit and I feed it some sort of inputs, A, then let’s say my output is S. If you’re feeling hungry think of these as apples and the circuit converts them into applesauce.

因此，同质性意味着，如果我拿出每个苹果，而不是喂它一整瓶苹果，如果我给它四分之三的苹果会怎么样？假设我将所有输入乘以某个常数 alpha，即四分之三。这意味着在输出端，我将得到四分之三瓶苹果酱，而不是一整瓶苹果酱。

So what homogeneity says is that what I can do is if I take each of my apples and instead of feeding it an entire apple what if I give it three quarters of an apple? Say I multiple all my inputs by some constant alpha, three quarters. What that says is that at the output instead of getting one full bottle of applesauce I’m going to get three quarters of a bottle of apple sauce.

因此，如果我按比例减少所有输入，并且如果这是一个线性电路，那么我的输出也将按相同比例减少。这就是同质性。接下来，让我们看看叠加。叠加的性质如下。同一种电路。如果我给它苹果，我就会得到苹果酱。我采用相同的电路，这一次，如果我给电路输入一组不同的输入，比如蓝莓。

So if I proportionately reduce all the inputs and if this is a linear circuit then so shall my output be reduced in the same proportion. So that’s homogeneity. Next, let’s look at superposition. The property of superposition says the following. The same kind of circuit. If I feed it apples then I get applesauce. I take the same circuit, and this time around if I feed the circuit a different set of inputs, say blueberries.

假设我的输出是，哎呀，让我这样做。因此，如果存在蓝莓酱，我的输出就是蓝莓酱。因此，苹果是苹果酱，蓝莓是蓝莓酱。那么，如果我将两者混合在一起，我会得到什么呢？假设我采用我的电路，同样的电路有一组输入，在这个例子中有一个输出。

And let’s say my output, oops, let me do it this way. So as my output I get blueberry sauce, if such exists. So apples applesauce, blueberries give me blueberry sauce. Then what I’m going to get if I mix up the two, so let’s say I take my circuit, the same circuit with a set of inputs and in this example one output.

假设我按照以下方式混合我的输入和一些输入，在这里我输入 A1 加 B1，在这里输入 A2 加 B2，依此类推，那么在输出时我将得到一团苹果酱和蓝莓酱。所有这些都表明，如果我只应用苹果，我会得到苹果酱。如果我只应用蓝莓，我会得到蓝莓酱。

Let’s say I mix up my inputs and some of my inputs in the following way, here I feed an A1 plus B1 and here A2 plus B2 and so on then at the output I am going to get a mush of apple sauce and blueberry sauce. All this says is that if I apply just apples I get applesauce. If I apply just blueberries I get blueberry sauce.

然后，如果我要弄清楚如果我输入苹果和蓝莓的组合，这个搅拌机将如何工作，那么为了理解这个搅拌机，我所能做的就是获取两个输出，然后自己将它们混合在一起，这就是我得到的。所以如果我把输入加起来，我的输出也将是输出与输入本身的总和。

Then if I were to figure out how this blender would have worked had I fed in the combinations of apples and blueberries, then for the purposes of understanding that blender all I could have done was taken by two outputs and just mixed them up together myself and that’s exactly what I’d get. So if I sum up the inputs my outputs would also be the sum of the outputs with the inputs applied by themselves.

所以让我拿这个来，用 hit 捣鼓几秒钟，从中得到一些有趣的东西。所以请注意两个输入，两个输入，输出。在你的笔记中，我为你提供了另一个模板，用于我将在这里进行的下一组涂鸦。所以使用第三页上的下一组模板。

So let me take this here and munge around with hit for a few seconds and get something interesting out of it. So notice two inputs, two inputs, outputs. In your notes I’ve given you another template for the next set of scribbles I’m going to make here. So use the next set of templates on page three.

我在这里要做的非常简单，将一个输出设置为零并输入电压 V1。也就是说，输入电压 V1 并将另一个输出设置为零。假设我得到 Y1 作为输出。在这种情况下，我将第一个电压设置为零，并在第二个输入上输入不同的电压 V2。

What I’m going to do here is something very simple, set one output to zero and feed a voltage V1. So that’s feed a voltage V1 and set the other output to zero. And let’s say I get Y1 as an output. And in this case I set the first voltage to zero and feed a different voltage V2 on the second input.

假设我的输出是 Y2。这只是我刚刚概述的叠加原理的一个特定应用。应用 V1 将一个输出设置为零。应用 V2 将原始输出设置为零。然后我会发现答案看起来就像这样，只需用我刚才所做的替换 A 和 B，我们就会得到这里的 V1 和零，然后我们得到这里的零和 V2。

And let’s say my output is Y2. This is just a particular application of the superposition principle I just outlined. Apply V1 set one output to zero. Apply V2 set the original output to zero. Then what I’m going to find is that the answer will simply look like this, just replace for As and Bs what I just did and we get V1 and zero here and we get zero and V2 here.

我的输出将精确地等于 Y1 加 Y2。这只是叠加的一个特殊应用，我要说的是以下内容。如果你有效地观察一下这个电路，我做了什么？实际上，我所做的就是在一个输入上施加电压 V1，在另一个输入上施加电压 V2。这里是 V1。这里是 V2。输出是 Y1 加 Y2。我要说的是现在回顾一下。

And as my output I’m going to get exactly the sum Y1 plus Y2. This is simply a particular application of superposition where what I’m saying is the following. If you look at this circuit here effectively what have I done? Effectively what I’ve done is apply the voltage V1 on one input and a voltage V2 on the other input. V1 here. V2 here. And the output is Y1 plus Y2. What I’m saying is look backwards now.

我的意思是，输出 Y1 加 Y2 的整个分量可以按照以下方式单独得出。我可以通过简单地施加其中一个电压并将另一个电压设置为零来获得分量 Y1。我可以通过将另一个输入设置为零并施加电压 V2 来获得另一个分量 Y2。然后加起来，这就是我的答案。

What I’m saying is that the whole components of the output Y1 plus Y2 could individually be derived in the following manner. I could get the component Y1 by simply applying one of the voltages and setting the other to zero. I can get the other component Y2 by setting yet another input to zero and applying the voltage V2 to get Y2. And sum then up and that’s my answer.

举个例子，这个会更清楚。再说一遍，记住，如果我将一堆输入应用到电路中，V1、V2 等等，然后得到一些输出，那么这意味着我可以交替地通过只施加一个电压、将所有其他电压设置为零、测量输出、施加第二个电压、将所有输入设置为零、测量输出以及苹果酱和蓝莓酱的总和来找到答案，这样你就可以得到答案了。

This will become a lot clearer with an example. Again, remember if I have a bunch of inputs applied to a circuit, V1, V2 and so on, and I get some output then what this is saying is that I can alternatively find out the answer by applying just one voltage, setting all the others to zero, measuring the output, apply a second voltage, set all inputs to zero, measure the output and sum of applesauce and blueberry sauce and there you get the answer.

让我们举个例子。在讨论之前，我谈到了将电压源和电流源设置为零。首先，将电压源设置为零是什么意思？这与此相同。将电压源设置为零只是用短路替换电压源，将电流源设置为零只是意味着开路。

Let’s do an example. And before we go into that I talked about setting voltage sources and current sources to zero. First of all, what does it mean to set a voltage source to zero? This is the same as this. Setting a voltage source to zero is simply replacing the voltage source with a short, and setting a current source to zero simply implies an open circuit.

因此，当我说将电源归零时，如果是电压源，则将其短路；如果是电流源，则将其开路。我可以取世界上的任意两个节点并测量它们之间的电位差。因此，这些节点之间可能存在一些电位差，这些电位差是由我在此未向您展示的电路设置的。可能还有其他电路控制这两个节点的电压。短路也是一样。

So when I say zero that source, if it’s a voltage source short it, if it’s a current source open it. I can take any two nodes in the world and measure the potential difference across them. So there may be some potential difference across these set by the circuit that I haven’t shown you on this side. There might be some other circuit that is controlling the voltage of these two nodes. The same with the short.

V 会是多少？但是 V 是存在的。它是零。所以这是方法四，叠加法。这种方法表明电路的输出再次提醒，我关注的是线性电路。记住，我有一个应用 LMD 的操场。在这个操场中，我在南球门区域玩耍。在南球门区域，操场子集中的电路是线性的。

What’s V going to be? But there is a V. It’s zero. So that’s method four, method of superposition. And this method says that the output of a circuit Again, remember I’m focusing on linear circuits. Remember, I have this playground where LMD applies. And within that playground I’m playing in the south goal area. In the south goal area, in that subset of the playground circuits are linear.

因此，在操场的这一部分，叠加适用，因为电路是线性的。因此，电路的输出由对每个单独作用的源的响应求和来确定。现在，在这个陈述中，这个源代表独立源。我还没有谈论独立源与依赖源。我们将在几周后讨论依赖源。

So in that part of the playground superposition applies because there circuits are linear. So the output of a circuit is determined by summing up the responses to each source acting alone. Now, in this statement here this source stands for independent source. I haven’t talked about independent versus dependent sources. We’ll talk about dependent sources a few weeks from today.

为了不让您感到困惑，对于依赖源，您将查看课程笔记的第 3.3.3 节，以了解叠加如何与依赖源一起工作。但请记住，我们还没有介绍依赖源。我们将在大约两周后介绍它们。所以让我们回到我们的例子并将叠加方法应用于一个例子。

And just so you don’t get confused, for dependent sources you will be looking at Section 3.3.3 of your course notes to see how superposition works with dependent sources. But remember we haven’t covered dependent sources yet. We will be covering them about two weeks from now. So let’s go back to our example and apply the method of superposition to an example.

该方法表示，将每个子电路的输出相加，其中我应用一个单独作用的源。所以我就在这里做这件事。让我从电路开始。让我从关闭 I 开始。所以我有电压 VI 有 R2。我正在关闭 I。所以我用开路替换了它。所以 I 为零。

So the method says sum up the outputs of each of the sub circuits where I’m applying one source acting alone. So let me just do this here. Let me start with the circuit. And let me start with shutting I off. So I have voltage V I have R2. And I’m shutting I off. So I have replaced this with an open circuit. So I is zero.

我将节点电压称为 eV，以反映由于 V 单独作用而产生的节点电压分量。您应该看一下这里的模式，并能够很快写出这种电压模式的答案，即两个电阻。这称为电阻分压器。它会一次又一次地出现。eV 就是 V 乘以 R2 除以 R1 加 R2。这仍然是我的接地节点。

Let me call the node voltage eV to reflect that component of the node voltage that arises due to V acting alone. And you should look at this pattern here and very quickly be able to write the answer for patterns like this voltage, the two resistors. That’s called a resistive divider. It will appear again and again and again. And eV is simply V times R2 divided by R1 plus R2. That’s still my ground node.

因此，这里的电压就是这个电压除以两个电阻，得到电流，再乘以 R2，得到 R 两端的电压。记住这个模式。你应用分压器模式的次数可能比你能想象到的任何其他模式都要多。这是 V 单独作用的情况。现在，让我来计算 I 单独作用的情况。因此，对于 I 单独作用的情况

So the voltage here is simply this voltage divided by the two resistors to give you the current multiplied by R2 to give you the voltage across this R. Remember this pattern. You apply voltage divider patterns probably more times than any other pattern that you might imagine. So that’s with the V acting alone. Now, let me do I acting alone. So for I acting alone

这次我做的是用短路来代替它，将电压源替换为短路。我将这个电压称为 eI，它是电流 I 引起的电压分量。

And what I do this time around is replace this with a short, replace the voltage source to the short. And let me call this voltage eI for the component of the voltage due to the current I.

在这种情况下，eI 只是由另一个模式给出，一对电阻上的电流就是有效电阻乘以电流，所以它是 I，有效电阻是 R1、R2 或 R1 加 R2。这就是 eI。这是电流 I 导致的节点分量。现在，该方法就是这样说的。然后取这些分量，将它们相加，你就得到了答案。

And eI, in this case, is simply given by yet another pattern here, the current across a pair or resistors is simply the effective resistance multiplied by the current so it’s I and the effective resistance is R1, R2 or R1 plus R2. That’s eI. That’s a component that node due to the current I. Now, so the method says that. Then take these components, sum them up and there you have the answer.

因此 E 就是 ev 加 ei。V 和 I 的分量单独作用，就是 V 乘以 R2 除以 R1 加 R2 加 R1，R2。就是这样。幸运的是，命运对我们很仁慈，答案与我们用节点法得到的答案相同。这并不奇怪。所以这实际上是一种非常简单的方法。所以你可以采用非常复杂的电路。你在这里到底做了什么？

So E is simply ev plus ei. The components of V and I acting alone, just simply V times R2 divided by R1 plus R2 plus R1, R2. There we go. Fortunately, the fates have been kind to us and the answer is the same as the answer we obtained with the node method. No surprise here. So this is actually an incredibly simple method. So you can take a very complex circuit. What have you really done here?

你可以将一个非常复杂的电路分解成许多简单的子问题来解决它。你会在 EECS 中一次又一次地这样做。无论是在软件系统还是硬件系统中，你经常会构建复杂的系统。还记得这边的末日吗？

You can take a very complex circuit and you can solve a very complex circuit by breaking it down into many simple individual sub problems. You will do this in EECS time and time and time again. Whether it’s in software systems or hardware systems or what have you, you’re often times building complicated systems. Remember doom on this side?

当你把这些东西组合在一起时，比如说一个大型软件系统，你不会从主要部分开始编写整个软件。你会构建许多小组件，并将这些组件连接在一起。同样，在这里，你采用一个大电路，你会发现它的行为对于每个单独起作用的源都是如此。许多小而简单的小电路。

And the way and when you put these things together, let’s say a large software system, is you don’t write the whole piece of software starting main and grunge down. You build a lot of little components and tie the components together. In the same manner here you take a big circuit and you find its behavior for each source acting alone. Lots of little inky dinky simple little circuits.

你会在作业中看到这样的例子：你得到一个大电路，或者因为它将所有 I 设置为零，其他 V 也设置为零，整个电路几乎消失，剩下的只是一个或两个小电阻。所以这是非常非常有效的方法。我想为你做一个小演示。我要向你展示的是一桶水。

And you will see examples in your homework where you’re given a big circuit or because it set all the Is to zero and the other Vs to zero the whole circuit almost vanishes and all that you’re left with is a little resistor or two. So this is the very, very powerful method. I’d like to do a little demonstration for you. And what I’m going to show you is the demo is a vat of water.

实际上，我马上就会告诉你它是什么。但现在假设它是盐水。我将施加两个电压。在这种情况下，我将施加一个正弦波。这不是很好。一个正弦波和一个三角波。我要做的是测量此处的响应。现在，这是一桶盐水。我会告诉你它的行为就像一个线性系统。

Actually, I’ll tell you what it is in a second. But assume it is salt water for now. I’ll apply two voltages. In this case I’m going to apply a sinusoid. That’s not very good. A sinusoid and a triangular wave. And what I’m going to do is measure the response at this site. Now, this is a vat of salt water. And I’m going to tell you it behaves like a linear system.

如果你观察每一个小颗粒，或者每一立方厘米的水，它都会表现得像一个小电阻。所以这桶盐水就像一个大的分布式电阻，如下所示。等等。这是一个由小电阻组成的大网格，但都是电阻。这是一个线性电路。所以我要施加两个电压，一个三角波和一个正弦波，然后我们将观察输出。

If you view each little particle, or each little cubic centimeter or whatever of water, it’ll behave like little resistor. So this vat of salt water behaves like big distributed resistor in the following manner. And so on. This of this big mesh of little resistors, but it’s all resistors. It’s a linear circuit. So I’m going to apply two voltages, a triangular and a sinusoid, and we’re going to observe the output.

您希望在那里看到什么？您将看到两者的叠加，也就是您会看到一个正弦波。然后您会看到锯齿状的三角形物体，它表达了正弦波模式。我现在要做的是，先不要放水。现在这个桶里什么都没有。里面都是空的。我们可以展示这边的屏幕吗？示波器屏幕？好的。哦，就是这样。

And what do you expect to see there? You will see the superposition of the two, which is you’ll see a sinusoid. And then you’ll see the jagged triangular thing articulating the sinusoid pattern. What I’m going to do right now, don’t put any water yet. This is the vat of nothing right now. It’s all empty. Can we show the screen on this side? The oscilloscope screen? OK. Oh, there you go.

这是现在示波器的屏幕​​。请注意，我有一个正弦波和一个三角波，输出为零。原因是这个桶里什么都没有。它是空的。所以以前我教这门课的时候，我会拿盐水倒出来。后来我们发现了一种更好的水源，它像一种真正的平均流体一样导电。剑桥水。它工作起来非常愉快。

So this is the screen of the oscilloscope now. Notice that I have a sinusoid and I have a triangular wave and the output is zero. And the reason is there is nothing in this vat. It’s empty. So previously when I taught this course I would get saltwater and pour saltwater. Then we discovered a much better source of water that conducted electricity like one real mean fluid. Cambridge water. It just works very pleasantly.

它就像什么都没有一样导电。我一直在考虑下次使用查尔斯河的水，看看会发生什么，尽管我们可能会看到一些生物有机体对你做出奇怪的事情。但请继续。我们友好的演示专家洛伦佐会将一些水倒入桶中。你应该开始看到输出是两者的叠加。所以当他倒水时，你看到了吗？

It just conducts electricity like nothing at all. And I’ve been thinking of using Charles River water next time and see what happens, although there we’d probably get some biological organisms doing strange things at you. But go ahead. Our friendly demonstration expert, Lorenzo, will pour some water into the vat. And you should begin seeing the output being a superposition of the two. So as he pours, there you go, do you see that?

所以你确实看到了正弦曲线和锯齿状波形。为了增加一些趣味，我可以做的是增加其中一个电压。你会看到，现在你知道如果我使用查尔斯河水会发生什么。因此，当我增加相应的波形时，我的输出不断增加。我可以这样做，这很有趣。所以让我在这里暂停一下，然后进入下一个话题。

So you do see the sinusoidal articulation and the jagged wave form. And just to have some more fun, what I can do is increase one of the voltages. And you’ll see Now you know what would have happened if I had used Charles River water. So my output keeps increasing as I increase the corresponding wave form. I could do this, this is fun. So let me pause there and go onto the next topic.

所以这个小演示向你们展示了，即使是像这个物理实体水桶这样简单的东西，其行为也像一个线性系统，我们可以将该线性系统建模为一组电阻器。你们可能不知道，现在，在过去的十秒钟里，我引入了一个新概念。它被称为潜意识广告。因此，我们在 EE 中经常做的事情之一就是对真实系统进行建模。

So that little demonstration showed you that even something as simple as this physical entity vat of water behaves like a linear system, and we can model that linear system as a set of resistors. Unbeknownst to you, right now, in the past ten seconds I introduced a new concept. It’s called subliminal advertising. So one of the things we do in EE a lot is model real systems.

所以很多时候，如果我想观察盐的行为、一桶水的行为，我可以将其建模为一组电阻器，用于某些类型的活动。在以后的职业生涯中，请保留这个想法一段时间。好的。这是方法四，叠加法。记住，正是这样的方法会让你的生活变得非常非常轻松。

So often times if I wanted to look at the behavior of salt, behavior of a vat of water, I can model it as a set of resistors for certain kinds of activities. Just hold that thought for some time later in your careers. All right. That’s method four, the superposition method. Remember, it is methods like this that will make your life really, really, really easy.

如果你发现你必须做很多繁琐的作业或其他事情，那就退一步思考叠加，思考戴维南或思考组合规则。通常一定有更简单的方法。让我们来做下一种方法。这称为戴维南方法。为了推导这种方法，让我首先将叠加应用于某个电路。假设我有一些任意网络 N。

If you find that you are having to do a lot of grunging homework or something, just step back and think superposition, think Thevenin or think composition rule. There must be a simpler way usually. Let’s do the next method. This is called the Thevenin method. To derive this method let me start by applying superposition to some circuit. So let’s say I have some arbitrary network N.

假设它是一个线性网络，网络中有很多好东西。它有一堆电阻器，有一堆电压源，还有一堆电流源。很多电流源。很多电压源。很多电阻器。一些杂乱的电压源、电流源和电阻器。我看这个网络中的两个节点。这是网络中的两个节点，网络中的两个点是元素的连接点。

Assume it’s a linear network and the network has a whole bunch of goodies in it. It has a bunch of resistors, it has a bunch of voltage sources, and it has a bunch of current sources. Many current sources. Many voltage sources. Many resistors. Some jumbled voltage sources, current sources and resistors. And I look at two nodes in this network. Here are two nodes in the network, two points in the network were elements connect.

我正在查看这两个节点，我只想做以下事情。我想弄清楚如果我拿一个很小的电流源并将其应用在那里，我只想弄清楚什么是 V，什么是 I。这里有一个 mongo box，一个装有电阻器、电压源和电流源的黑盒子，数不胜数。

I’m looking at those two nodes and all I want to do is the following. I want to figure out if I take a rinky dinky little current source and apply it there, all I want to figure out is what is V and what is I. There is this mongo box out here, a black box of resistors, voltage source and current sources, too many to count.

我选择两个节点，应用一个电流源，我所关心的只是通过在这里应用它来测量电压是多少。注意这里的电流将是 I，因为这里的电流是 I。我在这里应用它。我想测量电压是多少。现在，凭借你从叠加中获得的洞察力，你应该能够跳起来说出答案的形式。

I pick two nodes, apply a current source, and all I care about is what is the voltage that I will measure by applying it here. Notice the current here will be I because the current here is I. And I apply it here. I want to measure what the voltage is. Now, with the insight you’ve obtained from superposition, you should be able to jump up and state the form of the answer.

因此，通过叠加，我们知道以下内容。我们知道电路的效果将与元件相加的总和相同。元件之和，元件之和，一堆元件加在一起。每个元件都将是一个单独作用的源的响应。

So by superposition we know the following. We know that the effect of the circuit will be the same as the sum of components being added up. Sum of component, sum of component, a bunch of components added up. Each component will be the response of one source acting alone.

所以如果我能找出一个源单独作用的影响并将其记录下来，然后对所有源做同样的事情，我就会得到这个结果。所以对于源 Vm 来说，它是一个线性电路。所以我知道我的答案将是，最终答案将是 Vm 项，它将乘以某个 alpha M 项。我知道这一点。

So if I can figure out the effect of one source acting alone and put that down here, and do the same thing for all the sources, that’s what I will get. So for the source Vm it’s a linear circuit. So I know that my answer is going to be, in the final answer is going to be a Vm term and it’s going to be multiplied by some alpha M term. I know that.

这是一个线性电路，所以我知道答案应该是 Vm 项乘以某个常数。很简单，我知道。同样，对于 Vm 项也是如此。我能做的就是通过将所有其他源设置为零来测量这种影响。

It’s a linear circuit so I know that the answer shall have a term Vm multiplied by some constant. Simple, I know that. Similarly, the same is true for, oh, this is the term Vm. And what I can do is I can measure just this effect by setting all the other sources to zero.

因此，我可以将所有其他电流源设置为零，并将除此之外的所有电压源设置为零，然后我就可以得到该答案。因此，同样，对于每个电压源，我都会得到一个项。因此，对于每个电压源，M1、M2、M3 等，我都会得到这样一个项，它们都会相加。同样，我将得到 In 的一个项。

So I can set all the other current sources to zero and all voltage sources, except for this one, and I can get that answer. So, similarly, for every voltage source I am going to get a term. So for every single voltage source, M1, M2, M3 and so on I’m going to get such a term and they’re all going to sum up. Similarly, I’m going to get a term for In.

我知道会有一个输入项，我知道它会是某个常数 beta 乘以输入项。在这个例子中，记住 alpha 是这个常数，beta 是这个常数。这里有一个常数 beta，一个常数 alpha。因为我有一大堆电流源，所以每个电流源都会有一个这样的项。

And I know there will be an in term, and I know it’s going to be some constant beta multiplying In. In this example of ours here, in this example, remember alpha was this and beta was this constant here. There’s some constant beta, some constant alpha. And because I have a whole bunch of current sources there’s going to be such a term for each one of them.

并且，如果我将所有其他 Vms 设置为零，并将除该电流源之外的所有其他电流源设置为零，则这些项 Vm、In 中的每一个都将是我在这里看到的电压。我遗漏了什么？是这个吗？这里的响应，这里的 V。我遗漏了什么吗？是这个吗？现在，不要同时大喊大叫。我遗漏了什么？正是电流源 i。

And each one of these terms, Vm, In will be the voltage I would see here if I set all the other Vms to zero and I set all the other current sources, except for that one to zero. What am I missing? Is that it? The response here, V here. Am I missing anything here? Is that it? Now, don’t all yell at once. What am I missing? Current source i, exactly.

所以如果我有一个电流源 I，那么这个电流也会有影响。所以我也把 I 写在那里。它将是一个常数，乘以 I。这个常数看起来像一个电阻，对吧，因为这个电路包含电流源、电压源和电阻。如果我把所有的电压源短路，把所有的电流源开路，这里还剩下什么？只有一大堆 R。

So if I have a current source I then there’s an effect of this current as well. And so I write down I there, too. It’s going to be some constant multiplying I. And that constant is going to look like a resistor, right, because this circuit contains current sources, voltage sources and resistors. If I’ve shorted all my voltage sources and opened all my current sources, what’s left in here? Just a whole caboodle full of Rs.

它看起来就像是某种电阻 R。这就是我在这里得到的。所以这就是 V 看起来的样子，这是一种形式。那么让我们来看看这些组件。让我们先关注简单的部分。它是什么样子的？这个组件看起来像一个 I，它看起来像一个电流，并且有一些电阻。这个电阻是由什么给出的？

It’s just going to look like some resistance R. And that’s what I get here. So this is what V is going to look like and that’s a form. So let’s take a look at these components. Let’s focus on the easy part first. What does this look like? This component looks like an I, it looks like a current and has some resistance. What is that resistance given by?

假设我给你这个网络和这个电流源，并让你告诉我 R。你会如何测量 R？你要做的是打开所有电流源，短路所有电压源，将欧姆表放进去，然后测量电阻 R。这就是 R。好的，所以我们理解了这个术语。这里的这个术语呢？有人能告诉我这个术语的单位吗？这个大词？电压。这是一个电压。

Supposing I gave you this network and this currency source and I asked you tell me R. How would you measure R? What you would do is open all the current sources, short all the voltage sources, put a ohmmeter in there and measure the resistance R. That’s R. OK, so we understand this term. What about this term here? Can someone tell me the units of this term here, this big thing here? Voltage. This is a voltage.

这是一个电压。iR 是一个电压。因此，它的行为确实像电压。它的行为就像某个电压 V。因此请注意，就这个电流 I 而言，宇宙的其余部分看起来就像一个电阻器和一个以某种方式运行的电压源。现在我先把它称为 Vth，你马上就会知道为什么。电压有一种形式，某个电压加上 Ri。

This is a voltage. iR is a voltage. So this does behave like a voltage. And it behaves like some voltage V. So notice that as far as this current I is concerned the rest of the universe looks like a resistor and a voltage source behaving in some manner. And let me just call it Vth for now, and you’ll know why in a second. The voltage has a form, some voltage plus Ri.

换句话说，就这个 I 而言，这个充满各种好东西的整个网络 N 与这里的这个 I 是无法区分的。所以我的 I 就在那里向两个节点注入电流。如果我是 i，我看着这个，这个网络看起来与与电阻器 R 串联的电压源没有什么不同。

So, in other words, as far as this I is concerned this whole network here N full of all the nice stuff is indistinguishable to this I here. So my I is sitting out there injecting a current into two nodes. If I am i, I’m looking at this, this network looks no different than a voltage source in series with the resistor R.

请注意，这个简单电路的公式是这样的，所以 I 等于 V 减去 Vth 除以 R。记住，这是一个电路。换句话说，坐在这里的 Agarwal 无法分辨出我在这里测量的电压是看起来像与电阻串联的 Vth 电路，还是这个巨大的电压源和电流源等杂乱无章的电路。现在，我们来谈谈 Vth 和 R。

Notice that the equation for this simple circuit is this, so I is given by V minus Vth divided by R. Just remember. It’s a circuit. In other words, Agarwal sitting here cannot tell the difference if I’m measuring the voltage here between a circuit that looks like a Vth in series to the resistor or this huge mess of voltage sources and current sources and so on. Now, we will talk about Vth and R.

R 是所有电源关闭时从端口看到的网络电阻。同样，Vth 是什么？Vth 是开路电压。换句话说，如果我在这里施加电压，这是所有电流源和所有电压源共同作用的响应。所以这就像我把它拿出来，然后在这里简单地测量我的 V，就好像我不存在一样，对吗？

R is called the resistance of the network as seen from the port with all the sources shut off. And similarly Vth, what is Vth? Vth is the open circuit voltage. In other words, if I apply the voltage here this is the response of all the current sources and all the voltage sources acting together. So it’s as if I took this out and simply measured my V here as if I didn’t exist, correct?

因为这是 i 的分量。所以如果我打开 I 并测量 V，我会在左侧得到一个大项。那就是我的 Vth。因此，这启发了下一种方法，称为 Thevenin 方法。在这个方法中，我要做的是取一些电路，我在第 9 页，里面有一堆乱七八糟的东西。这是一堆乱七八糟的东西。

Because this is the component of i. So if I opened I and measured V, I would get that big term on the left hand side. That’s my Vth. So that inspires the next method called the Thevenin method. In this method what I’m going to do is take some circuit, I’m on Page 9, with a mess of stuff. It’s a big mess of stuff.

如果我关心它对我从外部添加的其他东西的影响，那么就外界而言，这与看起来像这样的电路没有区别。所以我能做的是，如果我想弄清楚这里发生了什么，那么为了我的分析，这个带有 R 和 Vth 的简单网络就成为整个混乱的替代品。

And if I care to look at its impact on something else that I add from the outside then as far as the outside world is concerned this is indistinguishable from a circuit that looks like this. So what I can do is if I want to figure out what’s happening here then, for the purpose of my analysis, this simple network here with R and Vth becomes a surrogate for this entire mess.

因此，为了找出此时的行为，我可以把这个巨大的混乱用它的戴维南替代物或戴维南等效物替换掉。这被称为这个大网络的戴维南等效物。让我举一个例子来完全说明这个方法。再次提醒，在 EECS 中，我们生活中的大部分事情都是关于如何让事情变得如此简单，以至于可以通过检查进行分析？

So for the purpose of finding out the behavior at this point, I can take this huge mess and replace it with its Thevenin surrogate or Thevenin equivalent. This is called the Thevenin equivalent of this big network. Let me do an example that will make the method completely clear. Again, remember in EECS, most of our lives are about how can we make things so simple as being able to be analyzed by inspection?

这是一种让你更进一步的方法。让我使用之前使用的相同电路，电压 V、R1、R2。这是一个 R。我快 55 分钟，所以我们还有三四分钟。这是我的电路。假设我关心的只是找出 i1。这就是我关心的一切。

And so this is a method that takes you further down that path. So let me use the same circuit that I’ve been using before, my voltage V, R1, R2. This is an R. I’m 55 minutes fast so we have another three or four minutes. So this is my circuit. And let’s say all I care about is finding out i1. That’s all I care about.

我要做的是把它装箱，看看我是否可以用它的戴维南等效物替换它。所以我要把它装箱。我的意思是，我要把它装箱，然后用这个戴维南等效物替换它。我现在不知道 Vth 和 R 是多少。我只是为了好玩才叫它 Rth。

And what I’m going to do is I’m going to box this up and see if I can replace that with its Thevenin equivalent. So I’m going to box that up. What I’m saying is that I’m going to box it up and replace it with this Thevenin equivalent. I don’t know what Vth and R are at this point. I’m just calling it Rth for fun.

我不知道这两个值是什么，但如果我知道这两个值是什么，我就可以按如下方式轻松确定 I。我可以通过简单地将 V 减去 Vth 除以 R1 加上 Rth 来得到 i1。因此，如果我知道 Vth 和 Rth，我可以通过这种方式检查记下 i1。那么接下来，最后，我如何获得 Vth 和 Rth？

I don’t know what these two values are, but if I knew what these two values were I can determine I really trivially as follows. I can get i1 as simply V minus Vth divided by R1 plus Rth. So if I knew Vth and Rth, I can write down i1 by inspection in that manner. So next, finally, how do I get Vth and Rth?

通过查看这个网络并关闭所有电压源并测量那里的电阻，您可以获得 Rth。所以我短路了我的电压源，即 R1。哎呀，错了。我需要往这边看。所以往这边看，这就是我得到的。那么 Rth 是什么？Rth 就是 R2。所以我打开了我的电流源。

You get Rth by looking at this network and shutting off all the voltage sources and measuring the resistance there. So I short my voltage source, that’s R1. Oops, wrong way. I need to look this way. So looking this way, that’s what I get. So what’s Rth? Rth is simply R2. So I have opened my current source.

同样，对于 Vth，请记住，我要做的就是查看两个节点，退后一步，在那里放一个电压表，测量电压，这就是我的开路电压。所以我的做法是，我接上电路，然后简单地测量那里的电压。那是 R2。那是我现在的大写 I。我只想测量这里的开路电压，它是什么？

Similarly, for Vth, remember all I want to do is look at the two nodes, step back, put a voltmeter there, measure the voltage, that’s my open circuit voltage. So the way I do it is I take the circuit and simply measure the voltage there. That’s R2. That’s my current capital I. And I simply want to measure the open circuit voltage here, which is what?

简单来说，如果我站远一点，小心翼翼地测量这里的电压，不干扰任何东西，我就会得到 IR2。所以 Vth 是 IR2，Rth 是 R2，当我将电压源和电阻 R1 应用于此处的小电路时，这是该分支中电流的公式。好的，让我们暂停一下，让我在大约十秒钟内总结一下。我有这个电路。

Just simply if I stand back and I kind of gingerly measure the voltage here without disturbing anything, I simply get IR2. So Vth is IR2 and Rth is R2 and here is the formula for the current in this branch when I apply a voltage source and a resistor R1 to this little circuit here. OK, let’s pause and let me summarize this in about ten seconds. I had this circuit here.

我想找出 i1。所以我说我要做的就是把这个复杂的问题，好吧，它不是一个复杂的问题，但假设它是，并用它替换通过关闭所有电源得到的电阻 Rth。串联电压 Vth，我只需拉出这个东西，取出我的输入，取出这部分，然后简单地测量那里的开路电压 Vth 即可获得。然后我用这个他们称之为戴维南网络的新网络替换整个网络，瞧，我一秒钟就得到了答案。

I wanted to find out i1. So what I said I’d do is take this complicated mess, well, it’s not a complicated mess but assume it is, and replace with it a resistance Rth got by turning off all the sources. And the voltage in series, Vth, which I get simply by pulling this thing out, taking my input, this part out and simply measuring the open circuit voltage out there, Vth. And then I replaced the whole network with this new network that they call the Thevenin network, and voila, I get the answer in a second.

Lec 4 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 4 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 49:07 https://youtube.com/watch?v=4TCnYYpZxEc

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 49:07 https://youtube.com/watch?v=4TCnYYpZxEc

今天，我们将讨论另一种归并过程或另一种离散化过程，这将导致数字抽象。今天的讲座主题是“走向数字化”。让我先从常规回顾开始。在第一堂课中，我们首先查看元素并将它们归并。

So today we are going to talk about another process of lumping or another process of discretization what will lead to the digital abstraction. So today’s lecture is titled “Go Digital”. So let me begin with a usual review. And so in the first lecture we started out by looking at elements and lumping them.

例如，我们取一个元件，并说为了分析电气特性，让我们把这个元件集中到一个称为电阻 R 的集中值中。这导致了集中电路抽象。集中电路抽象说让我们把这些元件用电线连接起来，然后使用某种分析技术分析它们的属性。所以这是一套方法。我们已经研究了 KVL、KCL 方法。

For example, we took an element and said for the purpose of analyzing electrical properties let’s lump this element into a single lumped value called a resistor, R. And this led to the lumped circuit abstraction. The lumped circuit abstraction says let’s take these elements, connect them with wires and analyze the properties of these using a sort of analysis technique. So a set of a methods. We’ve looked at the KVL, KCL method.

我们研究的另一个方法示例是节点法。您应该记住，这个类别中有一种方法，您可以将其应用于每个电路，并且它很有效，那就是节点法。对于线性电路，其他方法也适用，这些方法包括叠加法、戴维南法，在复习或课程笔记中，您可能已经看过诺顿法。这就是我们到目前为止所做的。

Another example of a method we looked at was the node method. And of this category there is one method you should remember, which you can apply to every single circuit and it will simply work, is the node method. For linear circuits other methods also apply, and these include superposition, Thevenin method, and in recitation or in your course notes you would have looked at the Norton method. So that’s what we did so far.

这就是工具包。现在你有了一条工具带，里面有一堆工具，你可以从这些工具中取出。就像任何优秀的木匠一样，你知道，木匠必须切割一块木头。他可以使用凿子。他可以使用锯子。他可以使用电锯。

So this is a toolkit. So now you have a utility belt with a bunch of tools in it, and you can draw from those tools. And, just like any good carpenter, you know, the carpenter has to cut a piece of wood. He could use a chisel. He could use a saw. He could use an electric saw.

你之所以给波士顿地区的木匠支付每小时 80 美元的工资，是因为他们知道该用什么工具做什么工作。今天我们要学习的是，这是一个离散化的过程。我们将物质离散化。这给了我们决定遵循的学科，即集中物质学科，它将我们从麦克斯韦方程转移到这个名为 EECS 的新领域。

And the reason you pay carpenters $80 an hour in the Boston region is because they know which tool to use for what job. So what we’ll learn today is, so this was one process of discretization. We discretized matter. This gave us the discipline here that we decided to follow, lumped matter discipline, that moved us from Maxwell’s equations into this new playground called EECS.

所有元素看起来都像电阻、电压源等这些微不足道的小值。如果这还不够简单，我们今天要做的就是进一步简化我们的生活。我们要做的是再集中一些。那么我们还能集中什么呢？我们已经集中了物质，所以所有物质都得到了处理。那么我们可以集中什么来让生活变得更轻松呢？

Where all elements looked like these rinky dinky little values like resistors and voltage sources and so on. What we’ll do today, if that wasn’t simple enough, let’s simplify our lives even further. What we’re going to do is lump some more. So what else can we lump? We’ve lumped matter, so all matter is taken care of. So what can we lump to make life even easier?

如果事情很复杂，如果有疑问，就将其离散化或集中化，对吗？那么你觉得呢？我们今天要做的是集中信号值。所以我们只处理集中值。这将导致数字抽象。相关阅读材料是课程笔记的第 5 章。所以在我们进行这种集中之前，让我先解释一下我们为什么要这样做。

When in doubt, if things are complicated, discretize it or lump it, right? So what do you think? What we will do today is lump signal values. So we’ll just deal with lumped values. And this will lead to the digital abstraction. And the related reading is Chapter 5 of the course notes. So before we do this kind of lumping, let me motivate why we do this.

其中一个原因是简化我们的生活，但没有必要仅仅因为我们可以就去简化事情。让我们看看是否还有其他原因促使数字抽象。所以我想从一个简单的模拟处理电路示例开始，现在您应该能够分析它了。所以我将激励数字化。

One reason is to simplify our lives, but there is no need to just go around simplifying things just because we can. Let’s try to see if there are other reasons motivating the digital abstraction. So what I would like to start with is a simple example of a analog processing circuit that you should now be able to analyze. So I’m going to be motivating digital.

那么让我们从看起来像这样的模拟电路开始，两个电阻器，R1 和 R2。我要做的是在这里应用一个电压源 V1，在这里应用另一个电压源 V2，然后建立此连接。我将这个电压称为 V 0，并将其称为我的输出。这个电压相对于接地节点，而不是在这里画这条线，我经常在这里画一个地线，然后将地线放在我想要的任何地方。

So let’s start with an analog circuit that looks like this, two resistors, R1 and R2. And what I’m going to do is apply a voltage source here, V1, apply another one here, V2, and make this connection. And let me call this voltage V nought and call this my output. This voltage with respect to ground node, rather than drawing this wire here, I often times draw a ground here and simply throw ground wherever I want.

这个符号只是表示另一个端子接在接地节点。所以这是我的 V 零点。现在，让我们分析一下，看看它给出了什么。在这个例子中，V1 和 V2 可能是两个传感器的输出，可能是热传感器或类似的东西。这是房间那边的热传感器，这是房间这边的热传感器。

This symbol simply refers to the fact that the other terminal is taken at the ground node. So here is my V nought. Now, let’s go and analyze this and see what it gives us. In this example, V1 and V2 may be outputs of two sensors, maybe heat sensors or something like that. This is a heat sensor on that side of the room and this is a heat sensor on this side of the room.

我将它们的信号通过两个电阻，然后观察那里的电压。所以现在你应该能够通过检查写出答案 V nought，或者值 V nought。为了向你展示，让我使用叠加。当你看到多个源时，你应该首先考虑的是，我是否可以使用叠加来简化我的生活？让我这样做。

And I pass their signals through two resistors and I look at the voltage there. So by now you should be able to write the answer V nought, or the value V nought almost by inspection. Just to show you, let me use superposition. When you see multiple sources, the first thing you should think about is can I use superposition to simplify my life? And let me do that.

这里的 V nought 是两个电压之和，一个是 V1 单独作用的结果，另一个是 V2 单独作用的结果。那么，这里由于 V1 单独作用而产生的电压是多少？为了找出我是否短路了这个电压，我将这个电压归零，然后查看 V1 的影响。因此，如果短路了 V1，其影响就是 V1 x R2 / R1 + R2。这现在是一个分压器，对吗？

V nought here is the sum of two voltages, one due to V1 acting alone and one due to V2 acting alone. So what’s the voltage here due to V1 acting alone? To find out that I short this voltage, I zero out this voltage and look at the effect of V1. So the effect of V1, if this were shorted out, is simply V1 x R2 / R1 + R2. This is now a voltage divider, right?

电压 V 施加在两个电阻上，输出通过一个电阻获得。这就是这个值。然后我可以做第二部分。要查看 V2 的效果，我要做的是短路这个电压并查看它的效果。现在，这个电压通过这个电阻分压器。所以我得到了 R1 / (R1 + R2)。

A voltage V applied across two resistors and the output taken across one resistor. So that’s this value. Then I could do the second part. To look at the effect of V2, what I will do is short this voltage and look at the effect of this. Now, this voltage is across this resistor divider. And so I get R1 / (R1 + R2) here.

所以你会注意到，对于这样的问题，如果我应用节点法的 KVL 和 KCL，我会得到一堆方程式，但这里我只是通过检查来写。你应该能够查看这样的电路图并很快写下答案。

So you’ll notice that for something like this, if I had applied KVL and KCL of the node method I would have gotten a bunch of equations, but here I wrote it just by inspection. You should be able to look at circuit patterns like this and write the answers down very quickly.

假设我选择 R1 等于 R2，那么 V nought 就是 (V1 + V2) / 2。因此，如果这两个值相等，我得到的只是输出，即两个电压的平均值。所以这是一个加法电路。它将这两个电压相加。但更准确地说，它是一个平均电路。它需要两个电压并给出平均值。

Let’s say if I chose R1 to be equal to R2 then V nought would simply be (V1 + V2) / 2. So if these two values were equal, I simply get the output, the average of the two voltages. So this guy is an adder circuit. It adds up these two voltages. But more precisely it’s an averaging circuit. It takes two voltages and gives me the average value.

现在，如果房间里有两个传感器，您可能会想为什么要取平均值来控制房间的温度。但可以说 V nought 是两个值的平均值。所以让我向您展示这个示例的快速演示，然后看看这个示例有什么问题。

Now, if you have two sensors in the room, you might think of why you want to take that average value to control the temperature of the room. But suffice it to say that V nought is the average of the two values. So let me show you a quick demo of this example and then look at what the problems are with this example.

举个例子，我在 V1 处应用了一个方波，也就是上面的曲线，绿色曲线，我在 V2 处应用了一个三角波，也就是第二个。正如您所期望的，输出将是两个电压经过适当缩放后的总和。请注意，我有一个方波，上面叠加了一个三角波。我可以随意尝试一下。

So let’s say, as one example, I applied a square wave at V1, which is the top curve, the green curve, and I applied a triangular wave at V2, that’s the second one. As you expect, the output is going to be the sum of the two voltages scaled appropriately. So notice that I have a square wave with a superimposed triangular wave on top. And I can play around.

我可以做的是改变波形的振幅。而且，正如你所注意到的，输出分量的振幅也会相应改变。所以这是一个加法器电路的简单示例，两个波形相加，我得到了输出。所以我将切换到第 3 页。让我在这里为你画一个小草图。

What I could do is change the amplitude of my wave form here. And, as you notice, the amplitude of the output component also changes accordingly. So this is one simple example of an adder circuit, and the two wave forms get summed up and I get the output. So I’ll switch to Page 3. Let me just draw a little sketch for you here.

这里，我向你展示的是，其中一个输入端有一个三角波，另一个输入端有一个方波，输出看起来是这样的。好吗？这并不奇怪。这是一个简单的模拟信号处理电路，它给出了两个波形的平均值。现在，让我做以下事情。很多时候，我可能需要在远处查看这个值。

Here, what I showed you was I had a triangular wave coming on one of these inputs and I had a square wave on the other one, and the output looks something like this. OK? No surprise here. This is a simple analog signal processing circuit which gives me the average of two wave forms. Now, let me do the following. Often times I may need to look at this value some distance away.

假设这个人想看看这个值。所以我把这根电线带到这里。我还带上地线，然后我查看它。我在这里查看这个值。当我有一根长电线时，我会在电路上添加噪音。假设一堆噪音被添加到那里的信号中。

So let’s say this person here wants to look at the value. So I bring this wire here. And I also bring the ground connection and I look at it. I look at this value here. And when I have a long wire I can get noise added onto the circuit. So let’s say a bunch of noise gets added into the signal there.

我最终看到的不是这个样子，而是那个样子。这并不罕见。问题是，现在当我看到这个样子时，如果我想区分 3.9 和 3.8，这真的很难，因为我的噪音压倒了我的信号。我有一个真正的问题，一个真正的问题。噪音是生活中的现实。

And what I end up seeing here is not something that looks like this but something that looks like that. That’s not unusual. And the problem with this is now when I look at this, if I’m looking to distinguish between, say, a 3.9 and a 3.8, it’s really hard to do that because my noise is overwhelming my signal. I have a real problem, a real problem here. Noise is a fact of life.

那么我们该怎么做呢？这是非常基础的。电气工程的大量课程都致力于如何在有噪声的情况下仔细分析信号？您将学习语音处理课程，这些课程将介绍在有噪声的情况下识别语音的巧妙技术等等。我们将在这里讨论的一种技术是使用数字抽象，它是 EECS 的基础。

So what do we do? This is so fundamental. Large bodies of courses in electrical engineering are devoted to how do I carefully analyze signals in the presence of noise? You’ll take courses in speech processing that look at clever techniques to recognize speech in the presence of noise and so on and so forth. One technique we adopt that we’ll talk about here, which is fundamental to EECS, is using the digital abstraction.

让我来告诉您它如何真正帮助解决噪音问题。因此，这个想法是值集中或值离散化。就像我们将物质集中起来一样，我们将物质离散化为离散块，让我们将值离散化为两个块。简单地说，现在我要处理两个值，我可以称它们为高、低。我这里有很多选择。我可能称之为 5 伏和 0 伏。

Let me show you how it can really help with the noise problem. So the idea is value lumping or value discretization. Much like we lumped matter, we’ve discretized matter into discrete chunks, let’s discretize value into two chunks. Let’s simply say that now I’m going to deal with two values and I can, say, call them high, low. I have a bunch of choices here. I may call it 5 volts and 0 volts.

我可能称之为真和假。我所做的只是限制我的宇宙只处理两个值，零和一。这就像处理只有两位数的数字系统。它们是零和一。

I may call it true and false. What I’m doing is I’m just restricting my universe to deal with just two values, zero and one. This is like dealing with a number system with only two digits. And these are zero and one.

所以我现在要做的是，我不再处理所有可能的连续值，0.1、3.9999 循环等等，而是只处理一个最高值和一个最低值。处理这整个数字连续体确实很复杂。让我简化一下，假设我要查看最高值和最低值。

So what I’ve now done is I’m saying that rather than dealing with all possible continuous values, 0.1,3.9999 recurring and so on and so forth, what I’m going to do is simply deal with a high and a low. Dealing with this whole continuum of numbers is really complicated. Let me simplify my life and just postulate that I am going to be looking at high and low.

每当我看到某样东西时，我都会看着它，说它是高还是低，是黑还是白，就这样。这里没有选择，只有两个单独的值。这听起来很简单，也很好，但重点是什么？这样做能得到什么？让我们举个例子。让我们以数字系统为例。让我们以数字系统为例，假设我有一个发送者。

Whenever I see something I’ll look at it and say high or low, is it black or white, period. There’s no choice here, just two individual values. So that sounds simple, and nice and so on, but what’s the point? What do we get by doing that? Let’s take our example. Let’s take what might be a digital system. Let’s take a digital system and let’s say I have a sender.

就像我将信号值发送到很远的地方一样，我有一个发送器，还有一个接地线，这里还有一个接收器。这个符号只是表示它们两者共用一根接地线。所以有发送器和接收器。而我感兴趣的是，发送器感兴趣的是向接收器发送信号。

Much like I sent a signal value a long distance, let me have a sender, and I have a ground as well and here is a receiver. This symbol simply says that both of them share a ground wire. So the sender and a receiver. And what I’m interested in doing, the sender is interested in sending a signal to the receiver.

在数字系统中，我发送数字信号的方式就是我只能使用 1 和 0，对吧？假设发送者发送了类似这样的信息。发送者想要发送一个值。这是我的时间轴，这是 2.5 伏，这是 0 伏，这是 5 伏。

And in the digital system, the way I would send a digital signal is all I can use is ones and zeros, OK? So let’s say the sender sends something like this. The sender wants to send a value. This is my time axis and this is 2.5 volts, this is 0 volts and this is 5 volts.

我的发送者与接收者达成了某种协议，并表示我将只向你发送低值和高值。这里的信号将对应于“0”“1”“0”。这是一个符号。这就是为什么我在这里用引号输入零。我们稍后会更详细地讨论这一点，但现在可以说我在这里发送了一组信号“0”“1”“0”。

My sender has some agreement with the receiver and says I’m just going to be sending to you low values and high values. And this signal here would correspond to “0” “1” “0”. It’s a symbol. That’s why I have input zero in quotes there. We’ll go into this in much more detail later, but for now suffice it to say that I’m sending a set of signals here “0” “1” “0”.

这种过于简单的方案在很多情况下都行不通，但请坚持几秒钟。所以我在这里发送信号序列“0”“1”“0”。注意，这里有一个高电平和一个低电平。发送方和接收方达成的协议是，看，如果你看到一个高于 2.5 伏的值，那就是高电平。如果你看到电线中一个低于 2.5 伏的值，那就是低电平。

This simplistic scheme will not work in many situations but go along with this for a few seconds. So I send the signal sequence “0” “1” “0” out here. And notice that there is a high and a low. And the agreement the sender and the receiver have is that, look, if you see a value that’s higher than 2.5 volts that’s a high. If you see a value below 2.5 volts in the wire that’s a low.

我将从这里发送 0 伏和 5 伏。现在在发送站点，假设这个系统中没有任何噪音。假设这是我的 Vn，添加了一些噪音。假设 Vn 为 0。那么在这种情况下，我将收到发送的确切值“0”“0.5、2.5、0 伏。这是时间。这里没什么特别的，对吧？我的接收器收到“0”“1”“0”。

And I’m going to send a 0 volt and a 5 volt from here. So now at the sending site let’s say I don’t have any noise in this system. Let’s say this is my Vn, some noise being added. And let’s say Vn is 0. Then in that case I will receive exactly what is sent “0” “0.5,2.5,0 volts. And this is time. Nothing fancy here, right? My receiver receives a”0” “1” “0”.

现在，这个方法的妙处在于，现在假设我要施加噪声，就像我在那里有噪声一样，并且 Vn 不为 0。相反，Vn 是一些噪声电压，假设峰峰值为 0.2 伏。假设它只是叠加在信号上。在这种情况下我会得到什么？我最终得到的是一个看起来像这样的信号。

Now, the beauty of this is that now suppose I were to impose noise much like I had noise out there and Vn was not 0. Rather Vn was some noise voltage, let’s say 0.2 volts peak to peak. Let’s say that simply got superposed on the signal. In which case what do I get? What I end up here with is a signal that looks like this.

因此，接收器接收到该信号，因为在我的信号中添加了噪声，这就是我得到的。但猜怎么着？没问题。接收器说哦，是的，这是 0，因为值小于 2.5，这是 1，这是 0。“0”“1”“0”。所以在这里我的接收器能够接收信号并正确解释它，没有任何问题。

So the receiver gets that signal because a noise is added into my signal and that’s what I get. But guess what? No problem. The receiver says oh, yeah, this is a 0 because the values are less than 2.5, this is a 1 and this is a 0. “0” “1” “0”. So here my receiver was able to receive the signal and correctly interpret it without any problems.

因此，由于我使用了这种值离散化，并且由于我与接收器达成了一致，因此我具有更好的抗噪性。因此，我拥有所谓的噪声容限。噪声容限表示我可以容忍多少噪声？在这种情况下，由于发送方发送 5 伏和 0 伏，5 伏可以一直下降到 2.5，我仍然没问题。

So because I used this value discretization and because I had this agreement with the receiver, I had better noise immunity. Consequently, I had what is called a noise margin. Noise margin says how much noise can I tolerate? And in this situation, because the sender sends 5 volts and 0 volts, the 5 volts can creep all the way down to 2.5, I’ll still be OK.

同样，0 可以一直上升到 2.5，我还是没问题的。所以在这种情况下，1 的噪声容限为 2.5 伏，同样，0 的噪声容限为 2.5 伏，因为 0 伏和 2.5 之间有 2.5 伏。所以请注意，我这里有一个不错的小噪声容限，这只是术语“噪声容限”的英文含义。

Similarly, 0 could go all the way up to 2.5, I’d still be OK. So in this case I have a noise margin of 2.5 volts for a 1 and similarly 2.5 volts for a 0, because there are 2.5 volts between a 0 volt and 2.5. So notice that I have a nice little noise margin here, which simply is the English meaning of the term there is a margin for noise.

即使我可以将信号值改变多达 2.5 伏，接收器仍会正确解释信号。因此，我决定将值离散化为高点和低点。因此，如果我一生中想做的只是发送高点和低点，我可以非常有效地发送它们。

And even though I can change the signal value by up to 2.5 volts, the receiver will still correctly interpret the signal. So I’ve decided to discretize values into highs and lows. And because of that, if all I wanted to do in life is send highs and lows I can send them very effectively.

虽然有很多复杂之处，但如果我只关心发送高点和低点，那么我可以以很大的噪声容忍度发送它。很多人都在说，但是这个怎么办，但是那个怎么办？这里有很多但是。让我们来看看其中的一些。如果你往上看。我最终做的是创建一个看起来像这样的设计空间。

There are many complications, but if all I care about is sending highs and lows I can send it with a lot of tolerance to noise. So many of you are saying but what about this, but what about that? There are lots of buts here. And let’s take a look at some of them. If you look up there. What I ended up doing was creating a design space that looked like this.

这是第 6 页。我所做的是，我指定了从 0 到 5 的值范围，我要做的是在 2.5 处画一条线，并指定作为发送方，如果您想发送 0，那么您将在此处发送一个值。如果您想发送 1，那么您将在此处发送一个值。对于接收方，情况也类似。

This is on Page 6. What I did was I said with a range of values from 0 to 5, what I’m going to do is at 2.5 I drew a line and I said as a sender if you wanted to send a 0 then you would send a value here. And if you wanted to send a 1 you would send a value here. Similarly, for a receiver.

如果发送方发送的值高达 5 伏，那是最好的事情，但从技术上讲，发送方可以发送 2.5 到 5 之间的任何值。如果没有噪音，则接收器可以正确地解释为 1（如果高于该值）和 0（如果低于该值）。

And if the sender sent a value all the way up in 5 volts that was the best thing, but technically the sender could send any value between 2.5 and 5. And if there was no noise then the receiver could correctly interpret a 1 if it was above this and 0 if it was below this.

这种方法的问题在于，如果我允许发送方发送任何高于 2.5 的值，一直到 5，那么在这种情况下实际上就没有噪声容限。好吗？因为如果我允许发送方发送任何介于 2.5 和 5 之间的值，那么如果我将 2.5 的值作为 1，会怎么样？那么我最终可能会在另一侧获得非常小的噪声容限。

The problem with this approach really is that if I allow the sender to send any value above 2.5 all the way to 5 then there really is no noise margin in this situation. OK? Because if I allowed the sender to send any value between 2.5 and 5 then what if I have a value 2.5 for a 1? Then I may end up getting very little noise margin on the other side.

更糟糕的是，如果我得到的值是 2.5 怎么办？情况就更糟糕了。如果接收方收到的值是 2.5 怎么办？现在怎么办？接收方会做什么？接收方无法分辨它是 1 还是 0。接收方会非常困惑。因此，为了解决这个问题，我要解决这个问题，我要做的事情如下。

Worse yet, what if I get a value 2.5? That’s a much worse situation. What if the receiver receives a value of 2.5? Now what? What does the receiver do? The receiver cannot tell whether it’s a 1 or a 0. The receiver gets hopelessly confused. So to deal with that, I’m going to fix this, what I’m going to do is the following.

切换到第 7 页。我在这里要做的是为了防止接收器产生混淆，如果接收器看到 2.5，我要做的就是定义所谓的“无人区”。我要定义我的电压空间区域，称为禁区。

Switch to Page 7. What I’ll do here is to prevent the receiver from getting confused, if the receiver saw 2.5, what I’m going to do is define what is called “no man’s land”. I’m going to define the region of my voltage space called the forbidden region.

我要做的是，假设我将其定义为 2 伏、3 伏和 5 伏，0、2.3 和 5。在我的禁区中，如果我有一个发送者，那么我会告诉发送者你可以发送 3 到 5 之间的任何值来表示 1。你可以发送 2 到 0 之间的任何值来表示 0。要发送符号 0，我可以发送 0 到 2 之间的任何电压，对于 1 也是类似情况。在接收端，如果我看到 3 到 5 之间的任何值，我会将其读为 0，而 0 到 2 之间的任何值我都会将其读为 2 伏。

And what I’m going to do is, say, let’s say I defined it as 2 volts, 3 volts and 5 volts, 0,2.3 and 5. With my forbidden region, if I have a sender then I tell the sender you can send any value between 3 and 5 for a 1. And you can send any value between 2 and 0 for a 0. To send the symbol 0, I can send any voltage between 0 and 2, and similarly for 1. At the receiving side, if I see any value between 3 and 5, I read that as a 0, and any value between 0 and 2 I read that as 2 volts.

因此，我可以将此值标记为 VH，将阈值标记为 VL，这样就有一个高阈值和一个低阈值。这样就解决了一个问题。现在，接收方永远无法看到禁区中的值。现在，我可以站在她面前，自以为是地说，哎呀，那是禁区，你不能去那里。但是，如果我听到一些噪音，一个值进入那里怎么办？在实际系统中，值可能会进入那里。

So I may label this value VH and label this threshold VL, so there’s a high threshold and a low threshold. So this solves one problem. Now the receiver can never see a value in the forbidden region. Now, I can stand her and pontificate and say, oops, that’s a forbidden region, thou shalt not go there. But what if I get some noise and a value goes in there? In real systems values may enter there.

但我想说的是，这就是使用学科的美妙之处。让我用我的游乐场来比喻。这是我的游乐场。我们使用学科的离散问题进入这个游乐场，即 EECS 的游乐场，但在那个游乐场中，游乐场的某些区域只处理高值和低值。我进一步限制了游乐场，我说我只关注那个游乐场，其中所有信号值都有一个禁区。

But what I’m saying, so this is the beauty of using a discipline. Let me use my playground analogy. This is my playground. We got into this playground using the discrete matter of discipline, the playground of EECS, but in that playground some region of that playground deals with just high and low values. I further restrict the playground and I say I’m only going to focus on that playground in which all signal values have a forbidden region.

所有发送者和接收者都遵守禁区。如果这个空间里有任何信号，在禁区里，我的行为就是不确定的。我不在乎。你想去那里吗？当然。我不知道你会怎么样。现在，我们是工程师，对吧？所以我们已经训练自己在这个操场上玩耍。就像我告诉我 9 岁的孩子，不要去那里，对吧？当然他想去那里。

All senders and receivers adhere to a forbidden region. And if there is any signal in this space, in the forbidden space then my behavior is undefined. I don’t care. You want to go there? Sure. I don’t know what’s going to happen to you. Now, we’re engineers, right? So we’ve disciplined ourselves to play in this playground. It’s like I tell my 9 year old, don’t go there, right? And of course he wants to go there.

他说如果我去那里会发生什么？这里的答案是不确定的，好吗？你可能会遇到一些非常糟糕的事情。我不知道那是什么，但确实会很糟糕，你知道，一道闪电或者谁知道是什么，但确实会很糟糕。你作为电路设计师，假设你是英特尔。英特尔设计自己的芯片。

He says what will happen if I go there? And the answer here will be undefined, OK? Something really bad could happen to you. I don’t know what it is but something really bad, you know, a lightening bolt or who knows what, but something really bad. And you as a designer of a circuit can, let’s say you were Intel. Intel designs its chips.

假设英特尔决定在这个游乐场玩耍，而那里有一个禁区。那么英特尔说，哦，这对我来说真的很容易，如果芯片在禁区内燃烧并着火，我们就会卖出更多的芯片。没问题。随你便。

And let’s say Intel decides to play in this playground and there is a forbidden region. So Intel says oh, it’s really easy for me if in the forbidden region the chip simply burns up and catches fire, we’ll sell more chips. That’s fine. Whatever you want.

这里的关键是，我要说的是，我要约束自己在这个操场上玩耍，我会在那里制定规则，你要遵守界限，所有规则都适用。这就叫“纪律”。你要约束自己遵守纪律。这没什么逻辑。这只是一种纪律。只要照做就没问题。

The key here is that all I’m saying is that I am going to discipline myself into playing in this playground and that’s where I will define my rules, and you stay within the boundaries and all the rules will apply. It’s called a “discipline.” You’re disciplining yourselves to stay within it. There’s no logic to it. It’s just a discipline. Just do it and you’ll be OK.

当我们研究实际电路等时，我们必须解决当东西进入电路时会发生什么的问题。但让我们推迟讨论这个问题。现在我已经解决了我的一个问题，即之前的问题是，如果接收器看到 2.5，它会做什么？现在它看不到 2.5。但接收器会问，阿加瓦尔，但如果我看到 2.5，该怎么办？

When we look at practical circuits and so on, we have to address the issue of what happens when things go in there. But let’s postpone that discussion. For now I’ve solved one of my problems, which is, the previous problem was what does a receiver do if it saw a 2.5? Now it can’t see a 2.5. But then the receiver asks, Agarwal, but what if I see a 2.5?

我可以告诉接收者，你可以做任何你想做的事。你可以踩踏它。你可以压扁它。你可以烧毁它。你可以扔掉它。无论你想做什么。这取决于你。做任何你想做的事。你不会看到值。如果你这样做，做任何你想做的事。它是未定义的。这样就行了。

I can tell the receiver you can do whatever you want to do. You can stomp it. You can squish it. You can burn it. You can chuck it. Whatever you want. It’s up to you. Do whatever you want. You won’t see a value. If you do, do whatever you want. It’s undefined. That works.

因此，作为接收器设计师，当您看到 2.5 时，您可以做任何您想做的事情。您可以说，是的，如果我看到 2.5 或 2.6，我就输出 1。我会做点什么。没人在乎。所以这很好。这很好。但我们仍然有一个问题。人们看到这里的问题了吗？这仍然不太管用。

So you, as the receiver designer can do whatever you want when you see a 2.5. You can say yeah, I’ll just put out a 1 if I see a 2.5 or a 2.6. I’ll just do something. No one cares. So this is pretty good. This is pretty good. We still have a problem, though. Do people see the problem here? This still doesn’t quite work.

如果英特尔这样做，您的笔记本电脑就不会每小时出现一次故障和蓝屏，而是每毫秒都会出现一次。因此，问题在于，这种规则允许发送方将 3 到 5 之间的任何值发送为 1。而接收方将 3 到 5 之间的任何值视为 1。您知道问题出在哪里了吗？是的？发送方发送 1.99，噪声将其泵入禁区。没错。

If Intel did this, instead of your laptops failing and blue screening every hour they’d be doing it every millisecond. So the problem is this discipline have allowed the sender to send any value between 3 and 5 as a 1. And any value between 3 and 5 at the receiver is treated as a 1. Do you see where the problem is? Yes? The sender sends a 1.99 and the noise pumps it into forbidden region. Exactly.

因此发送者说这是合法的，我是英特尔。他们告诉我要坚持使用 0 和 2。英特尔部件将发送 0 到 2 之间的值。而摩托罗拉部件，它们是接收者，你知道它们必须接收 0 和 2。因此英特尔可以发送值 2。他们可以发送，因为它是 2 中的 1.9。这是合法的。这样我就可以制造非常便宜的零件。

So the sender says it’s legitimate, I’m Intel. They’ve told me stick to 0 and 2. And Intel parts will be sending to values between 0 and 2. And Motorola parts, which are receivers, you know they have to receive 0 and 2. So Intel can send the value, 2. They can because it’s 1.9 out of 2. It’s legal. This way I can make really cheap parts.

但现在的问题是，即使是最小量的噪声也会将其撞入禁区，因此这个方法存在问题。问题是这个方法的噪声容限为零。没有噪声容限。这个学科没有噪声容限。好吧，各位，回到绘图板上。切换到第 8 页。让我们摆脱所有这些东西，回到绘图板上。

But now the problem is that even the smallest amount of noise will bump it into the forbidden region, and so therefore this one has a problem. And the problem is that this one offers zero noise margin. There is no noise margin. There is no margin for noise in the discipline. All right, back to the drawing board, folks. Switch to Page 8. Let’s get rid of all this stuff and go back to the drawing board.

好的，那么我们现在该怎么做呢？接下来呢？就像我之前说的，作为接收者，如果你看到 3 到 5 之间的值，你会将其视为 1，而看到 0 到 2 之间的值，你会将其视为 0。没有区别。因此，作为接收者，情况与之前相同。但现在我要做的是，我对发送者采取更严格的标准。

OK, so what do we do now? How about the following? How, about as before I say, as a receiver, if you see a value between 3 and 5 you treat that as a 1 and a value between 0 and 2 you treat that as a 0. No difference. So as a receiver same as before. But now what I do is I hold the sender to tougher standards.

我会严厉要求发件人遵守更严格的标准。所以我要做的就是要求发件人遵守更严格的标准，也许是四面墙。

I hold the feet of the sender to the fire and say you have to adhere to tougher standards. So what I’m going to do is hold the sender to tougher standards, maybe four walls.

也就是说，告诉发送方，如果你想发送 0 或 1，对于 1，你必须发送一个介于 4 和 5 之间的值，对于 0，你必须发送一个介于 0 和 1 之间的值。发送方现在要遵守更严格的标准。这就是我的图表。所以现在我确实有一些噪声裕度。有人能告诉我 1.1 伏的噪声裕度是多少吗？

That is tell the sender that if you want to send to 0 or a 1, for a 1 you have to send a value between 4 and 5, and for a 0 a value between 0 and 1. Sender is now held to tougher standards. This is what my chart looks like. So now I do have some noise margin. Can someone tell me what is the noise margin here for a 1.1 volt.

原因是发送器可以发送的最低电压是 4 伏，对吧？如果 4 伏泄漏到 2.99，即禁区内，我就有麻烦了。2.99。这是我的禁区。2.99 也在禁区内。我就有麻烦了。因此请注意，接收器可以接收的最低值是 3 伏。

And the reason is that the lowest voltage a sender can send is 4 volts, OK? If the 4 leaks down to 2.99 that’s in the forbidden region, I’m in trouble. 2.99. This is my forbidden region here. And 2.99 is in the forbidden region. I’m in trouble. So notice that the lowest value that the receiver can receive is 3 volts.

因此，如果我发送 4 并通过长电缆将其发送给您，该值可能会受到噪声的严重影响，以至于您可能会开始收到 3，但不会低于 3。所以这是噪声容限，1 伏。同样，对于 0，噪声容限也是 1 伏。让我给它们贴上标签。这里有四个重要的阈值。这个阈值称为 VOL。V 输出低。

So if I sent the 4 and sent this over a long cable to you, the value can be beaten up by noise to such an extent that you may begin receiving 3s but nothing lower than a 3. So this is a noise margin, 1 volt. Similarly, for a 0 the noise margin is also 1 volt. So let me label these. There are four important thresholds here. This threshold is called VOL. V output low.

这些具有特殊含义。这里的阈值称为 VOH，即 V 输出高电平。这里的阈值称为 V 输入高电平，这里的阈值称为 V 输入低电平。因此，VOH 只是表示发送方必须发送高于 VOH 的电压。接收方必须接收高于 VIH 的值（即 1）。因此，这四个阈值加在一起就是您的阈值。如果发送方得到 2.5，那么发送方会做什么？它可以做到。

These have special meanings. This threshold here is called VOH, V output high. This threshold here is called V input high and this threshold here is called V input low. So VOH simply says that senders must send voltages higher than VOH. Receivers must receive values higher than VIH as a 1. So these four thresholds together give you your threshold. For the sender gets 2.5, what does sender do? It could do that.

所以，在这种情况下，你可以这样做。如果你只想在这里得到一个值，那么你在这里得到的就是禁区的一个无穷小值。没问题。这取决于你如何设计它。你可以。但事实证明，当你设计电路时，当我们在下一讲中看到一些例子时，这样做是相当实用和容易的。

So, in that case, you can do that. If all you want to do is have one value here then what you have is an infinitesimal value here for the forbidden region. That’s fine. It’s up to you to design it that way. You can. But it turns out that when you design circuits, when we see some examples in the next lecture it turns out to be fairly practical and easy to do it this way.

但是，再说一遍，这些都是设计选择。如果我是英特尔，英特尔希望所有部件都能协同工作。因此，遵循共同原则的部件可以协同工作，对吗？因为发送方将发送值，接收方将接收这些值，所以它会正常工作。因此，这里 1 的噪声容限就是 VOH 减去 VIH，而 0 的噪声容限就是 VIL 减去 VOL。

But, again, these are design choices. If I’m Intel, Intel wants all its parts to work together. So parts that follow a common discipline can work together, right? Because senders will send values, receivers will receive these values here, so it will simply work. So the noise margin for a 1 here is simply VOH minus VIH and the noise margin for a 0 is VIL minus VOL.

VIL 减去 VOL 就是 0 的噪声容限。那么我们这里有什么呢？我们这里有一个我们同意遵循的规则，即发送方要遵守严格的标准，而接收方要遵守不同的标准，这样我就可以给自己留出一些误差的余地。而作为设计师，你可以选择禁区的范围。

VIL minus VOL is the noise margin for a 0. So what do we have here? What we have here is a discipline that we’ve agreed to follow where senders are held to a tough standard and receivers are held to a different standard so that I allow myself some margin for error. And it’s up to you as a designer to choose ranges for the forbidden region.

现在，你可能会说我想让禁区尽可能小。但你会发现在实际电路中很难做到这一点。你得到的实际设备都有一个自然区域，很难被打破，这往往会决定该区域的样子。所以继续举一个例子，我可能有以下发送器的电压波形。

Now, you may say that I want to make my forbidden region as small as possible. But you will see in practical circuits it’s very hard to achieve that. Practical devices that you get, they have a natural region that gets very, very hard to break apart, and that tends to establish what that region looks like. So to continue with an example here, I may have the following voltage wave form for a sender.

所以我有一些发送器，我这里有一个发送器。我有 VOL、VIL、VIH、VOH 和其他一些高电压。然后，作为发送器，如果我想发送“0”“1”“0”，那么我发送 0。我必须在这个频段内。然后对于 1，我必须在这个频段内。所以这是“0”“1”“0”“1”的一个例子。在接收器处

So I have some sender, I have a sender here. I have VOL, VIL, VIH, VOH and some other high voltage. And then, as a sender, if I want to send a “0” “1” “0” then I send a 0. I have to be within this band. And then for a 1 I have to be within this band. So this is an example of, say, “0” “1” “0” “1”. And at the receiver

假设有 VOL、VIL、VIH、VOH。因此，在接收器处，我将任何低于 VIL 的信号解释为 0。因此，我可能会收到一些看起来像这样的信号。我仍然会将其解释为“0”“1”“0”“1”。因此，总结一下，构成数字系统基础的这一规则称为“静态规则”。静态规则表示输入是否满足输入阈值

Let’s have VOL, VIL, VIH, VOH. So at the receiver, I interpret any signal below VIL as a 0. So I may get some signal that looks like this. And I’ll still interpret that as a “0” “1” “0” “1”. So to summarize here, this discipline that forms the foundations of digital systems is called “a static discipline”. The static discipline says if inputs meet input thresholds

因此，如果数字系统的输入满足输入阈值，则输出也将满足，或者数字系统应确保输出满足输出阈值。这意味着，如果我有这样的系统，那么如果我给它好的输入。通过给它好的输入，我的意思是对于 1，我有大于 VIH 的信号值，对于 0，我有小于 VIL 的信号值。这些是有效输入。

So if an input to a digital system meets the input thresholds then outputs will meet, or the digital system should ensure that the outputs Output thresholds. So this means that if I have a system like this then if I give it good inputs. And by giving it good inputs I mean for 1s I have signal values that are greater than VIH and for 0s signal values which are less than VIL. These are valid inputs.

因此，如果我的输入有效，即 0 低于 VIL，1 高于 VIH，则该数字系统 D 将产生遵循输出阈值的相应输出。对于 1，它将产生大于 VOH 的输出，如果它需要产生 0，它将产生小于 VOL 的输出。

So if my inputs are valid, that is below VIL for a 0 and above VIH for a 1 then this digital system D will produce corresponding outputs that follow output thresholds. For a 1 it will produce outputs that are greater than VOH and if it needs to produce a 0 it will produce outputs that are less than VOL.

因此请注意，数字系统有一项严格的要求，即对于输入，我应该将高于 VIH 的任何值识别为 1。但如果我想要产生 1，我必须产生一个严格的 1，例如 4 伏 1。因此，我的所有数字系统都必须遵循一项规则，这项规则称为静态规则。

So notice that there is this tough requirement in digital systems that for the inputs, I should recognize as a 1 anything higher than a VIH. But if I want to produce a 1, I have to produce a tough 1 like a 4 volt 1. So there is a discipline that all my digital systems must follow, and that discipline is called a static discipline.

因此，静态规则对阈值进行编码，对所有数字系统必须遵循的四个阈值进行编码，以便它们能够相互通信。因此，如果英特尔和摩托罗拉想要制造与 Pentium 4 设备兼容的部件，那么他们都会通过电话或其他方式进行交谈并就静态规则达成一致。我们会说，好吧，我的所有外围设备都将遵循静态规则，并遵循以下电压阈值。

So static discipline encodes the thresholds, encodes four thresholds that all digital systems must follow so that they can talk to each other. So if Intel and Motorola want to make parts that are compatible with, say, Pentium 4 devices then they will all talk over the phone or something and agree on a static discipline. We will say that, all right, all my peripherals will follow a static discipline with the following volted thresholds.

这样，不同制造商生产的部件就可以互操作，同时仍能提供抗噪声能力。是的。问题？当然。作为设计师，选择噪声容限有很多限制。作为设计师，您希望噪声容限尽可能大。噪声容限越大，您可以更好地容忍噪声，这就是为什么有多少人听说过一些称为抗辐射设备、抗辐射设备的设备？

And this way parts made by different manufacturers can interoperate and still provide immunity to noise. Yes. Question? Absolutely. There are many constraints on how you as a designer choose the noise margin. As a designer you want to make your noise margin as large as possible. The larger the noise margin the better you can tolerate noise which is why, how many people have heard of some devices called rad hard devices, radiation hard devices?

你们中有些人已经这样做了。有很多设备。不同的制造商为不同的市场生产不同类型的设备。对于消费市场，他们使用的部件可能具有相对较差的噪声容限，因为消费者可以容忍更多的故障。但是如果你正在为医疗行业或宇宙飞船等制造设备，你需要遵守更严格的标准。
