Some of you have. There are a bunch of devices. Different manufacturers make different kinds of devices for different markets. For consumer markets they use parts which may have relatively poor noise margins because consumers can tolerate more faults. But if you’re building devices for, say, the medical industry or for spaceships and so on, you need to be held to a much, much tougher standard.

因此，对于这些设备，你最终可能会有更严格的工作频带，因此噪声容限会更高。因此，考虑到这些电压阈值，我们现在进入数字世界。在数字世界中，我们可以构建一堆数字设备。我们将要研究的第一个设备称为组合门。

So for those devices you may end up having much, much tighter bands in which you have to operate so you have a tougher noise margin. So that leads us to, given these sort of voltage thresholds, we now move into the digital world. And in the digital world we can build a bunch of digital devices. The first device we will look at is called a combinational gate.

组合门是一种遵循静态原则的设备，第 11 页，这种设备的输出仅取决于输入。因此，我可以构建一些小盒子，接收一些输入，产生一个输出，而输出取决于现有输入。这种设备称为组合门。我可以分析这种设备，看看是否能完成我想要做的事情。

A combinational gate is a device that adheres to the static discipline, Page 11, and this is a device whose outputs are a function of inputs alone. So I can build little boxes which take some inputs, produces an output where the outputs are a function of the existing inputs. And this kind of a device is called a combinational gate. And I can analyze such devices for the kinds of things that I would like to do.

在介绍我想制造的设备类型之前，让我们花几分钟讨论一下如何处理信号。如何处理数字信号，第 10 页。请注意，您有两个值，0 和 1。因此，像我的组合门这样的设备只能处理 0 和 1。

Before I go into the kinds of devices I’d like to build, let’s spend a few minutes talking about how to process signals. How to process digital signals, Page 10. So notice that you have two values, 0 and a 1. So devices like my combinational gate, for example, can only deal with 0s and 1s.

所以我必须想出某种数学或某种处理方法，可以处理 0,1 值。​​因此 0,1 完全自然地映射到逻辑真和假。所以我可以借鉴逻辑并使用真和假来处理信号。所以如果我关心的只是处理逻辑值、0 和 1、真和假，那么这就是我所需要的。

So I have to come up with some kind of a mathematics or some kind of a set of processing that can work with 0,1 values. So 0,1 map completely natural to the logic true and false. So I can borrow from logic and use true and false to do my processing of signals. So if all I care about is processing logic values, 0s and 1s, trues and falses then that’s all I need.

我也可以使用数字。我如何表示数字？3.9 是 0 和 1。事实证明，这本身就是一个完整的领域。您将在复习中听到更多关于这方面的内容。我还想指出课程笔记的最后一部分，我相信是第 5.6 章，其中讨论了如何表示数字。

I can also use numbers. How do I represent a number? 3.9 which is 0s and 1s. It turns out that this is a whole field in itself. You’ll hear more about this in recitation. Let me also point you to the last section of the course notes, Chapter 5.6 I believe, that talks about how to represent numbers.

基本见解就像您可以用相同的方式用数字 0 到 9 表示任意长数，但连接数字后，您可以用 0 1 1 1 0 0 等表示任意长数。因此，您可以得到一个完整的数字序列，并且可以构建一个二进制数字系统。所以我相信您可以阅读 A&L 第 5.6 节。这是关于数字的最后一节。您明天的复习课也会讨论这一点。

The basic insight is much like you can represent arbitrary long numbers with the digits 0 through 9 in the same way, but concatenating digits you can represent arbitrary long numbers with 0 1 1 1 0 0 and so on. So you can have a whole sequence of digits and you can build a binary number system. So you can read A&L Section 5.6, I believe. It’s the last section for numbers. And you will also discuss this in your recitation tomorrow.

让我再花点时间谈谈布尔逻辑、二值逻辑以及如何处理这些系统。处理它的一种方法是使用以下形式的逻辑语句。如果 X 为真且 Y 为真，则 Z 为真，否则 Z 为假。所以这是一个逻辑语句。它表示如果 X 为真且 Y 为真，则 Z 为真，否则 Z 为假。

Let me spend some more time talking about Boolean logic, two valued logic, and how to process these systems. So one way of processing it is using logic statements of the following form. If X is true and Y is true then Z is true, else is Z false. So this is a logic statement. It says if X is true and Y is true then Z is true, else Z is false.

所以我可以用 0 和 1、真和假来处理它。我一直这样做，所以我有一个简洁的符号。我将其表示为 Z 是 X 与 Y 的与。X 和 Y 是 Z。所以如果 X 为真且 Y 为真，则 Z 为真。对此的简写符号只是一个点。对此的电路符号称为“与门”。这是一个小电路。

So I can process this with 0s and 1s, trues and falses. And I do this all the time so I have a succinct notation for this. I express this as Z is X anded with Y. X and Y is Z. So Z is true if X is true and Y is true. A shorthand notation for this is just a dot. And a circuit notation for this is called an “AND gate”. That’s a little circuit.

我还没告诉你里面有什么。这是一个抽象的小装置，称为与门，它接受两个输入，产生一个输出 Z，输出与输入的关系如下。这是一个称为与门的小装置。我也可以用真值表来表示逻辑。真值表只是列举了所有值和相应的输出。

I haven’t told you what’s inside it. It’s an abstract little device called an AND gate which takes two inputs, produces one output Z where the output is related to the inputs in the following manner. That’s a little device called an AND gate. I could also represent logic in truth tables. And truth tables simply enumerate all the values and the corresponding outputs.

输入可以是 0 0 0 1 1 0 或 1 1。对于 AND 系统，只有当两者都为 1 时，输出才为 1，否则为 0。所以这是 AND 门的真值表。因此，我们从 0 和 1 开始处理逻辑，并创建像 AND 门这样的设备来处理数字信号。我们要做的是查看一大堆像这样的小符号，例如用于处理输入信号的 AND 门。

Inputs can be 0 0 0 1 1 0 or 1 1. For an AND system output is 1, only if both are ones, it’s a 0 otherwise. So that’s a truth table for AND gate. So from 0s and 1s we deal with logic and we create devices like the AND gate to process digital signals. And what we will do is look at a whole bunch of little symbols like this, like the AND gate to process our input signals.

这些设备可能看起来像其他功能，如或门等。让我给你看一个简单的演示。我要向你展示的是一个馈入与门的信号。一个信号看起来像这样，我的信号 Y 看起来像这样。所以你期望一个处理后的输出。所以 1 0 1 0 1 0 1。输出将是 这是我的时间轴朝这个方向。

And these devices might look like other functions like OR gates and so on. Let me show you a quick demo. What I’m going to show you is a signal feeding an AND gate. And one signal is going to look like this, and my signal Y is going to look like this. So you expect a processed output. So 1 0 1 0 1 0 1. And the output is simply going to be This is my time axis going this way.

它将是这两个信号值的 AND 运算，就像这样。我还要向你们展示的是，我将在这根电线上叠加噪音。我将在这根电线上叠加噪音，我希望你们观察的是这个数字门的输出。即使我施加了噪音，输出仍将保持原样。这是终极测试。所以就待在那里。让我们做这个演示。

It is going to be an AND ing of these two signal values like so. What I’m also going to show you is I’m going to superimpose noise on this wire. I’m going to superimpose noise on the wire, and what I want you to observe is the output of this digital gate. The output will stay exactly like this, even though I impose noise. The ultimate test. So stay right there. Let’s do this demo.

给我几秒钟。如果你看看上面的信号，看看中间的波形，我会在嘈杂的环境中建立一个数字系统，例如在木材场，或者在后院砍一堆树，在旁边建立数字系统。如果我让我的伙伴们开动电锯，在我的第二个输入上叠加噪音，但看看输出。

Give me a couple of seconds. If you look at the signal up there, look at the middle wave form, and I’m imposing let’s have a digital system in a noisy environment like a lumberyard, for example, or chopping a bunch of trees in my backyard and building digital systems on the side. And if I have my buddies revving up chainsaws superimposing noise on my second input, but look at the output.

为了证明我不是在虚张声势，我会让噪音通过，并使噪音更大。你会注意到，当噪音开始超过噪音容限时，输出开始变得狂暴。看。你能逐渐增加它吗？

And just to show that I’m not bluffing here, what I’ll do is I’ll pass the noise through and make the noise larger. And you’ll notice that when the noise begins to surpass the noise margins the output begins to go berserk. Watch. Can you increase it gradually?

请注意，当我输入更多噪音时，输出开始变得狂暴，但只要我的输入在噪音容限内，我的输出就会保持完全稳定。这就是“数字系统简介”。您将在复习中看到数字。我们将在周二的讲座上见到您。

Notice that as I put in a lot more noise then the output begins to go berserk, but as long as my input is within the noise margin my output stays perfectly stable. So that’s the “Intro to Digital Systems”. You’ll see numbers in recitation. And we’ll see you at lecture on Tuesday.

Lec 5 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 5 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 51:08 https://youtube.com/watch?v=v6vqWasIHaw

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 51:08 https://youtube.com/watch?v=v6vqWasIHaw

好的。早上好。我们开始吧。上一节课我们向你们展示了如何实现数字化。数字化对我们有一些关键的好处。今天我们要做的就是进入数字化的大门。让我们快速回顾一下。我们的生活始于观察自然。我们说那些麦克斯韦方程很难。让我们通过离散化或集中化物质来简化我们的生活。所以我们得到了集中电路抽象。

All right. Good morning. Let’s get started. So the last lecture we showed you how to go digital. The fact that going digital had some key benefits for us. And what we’ll do today is go inside the digital gate. Let’s do a quick review. We began life by observing nature. We said those Maxwell’s equations are tough. Let’s simplify our lives by discretizing or lumping matter. So we got the lumped circuit abstraction.

然后我们遇到了噪音问题。为了能够处理这个问题，我们需要进行更多的离散化，更多的集中化。所以我们说让我们将值离散化并处理两个级别，一个高电平和一个低电平。这就是二进制电压电平出现的地方，一个高电平和一个低电平。然后我们说在离散化时我们必须做出一些假设。我们必须对自己施加一些约束。

Then we had this noise problem here. In order to be able to handle that let’s do some more discretization, some more lumping. So we said let’s discretize values and deal with two levels, a high and a low. That’s where the binary voltage levels come up, a high level and a low level. And then we said that in discretizing it we have to make some assumptions. We have to impose some constraints on ourselves.

就像集中物质学科一样，我们在从连续物质世界转向集中物质世界时施加了一些约束。同样，在从连续价值体系转向数字价值体系时，我们必须对自己施加一些约束。这种学科被称为静态学科。

Just as with the lumped matter discipline, we imposed a couple of constraints in going from the continuous matter world to a lumped matter world. Similarly, we have to impose some discipline on ourselves, some constraints on ourselves in going from the continuous value regime to the digital value regime. And that discipline is called the static discipline.

静态原则的意思是，如果数字系统中有发送器和接收器，那么它们都需要遵守一些标准。如果我是发送器，我必须遵守一些严格的输出标准。我必须确保转移超过某个高压阈值的值。如果我发送的是低值，我必须确保我的值低于某个输出低电压阈值。

And what the static discipline says is that if you have senders and receivers in a digital system then they all need to adhere to some standard. If I was a sender I had to adhere to some tough output standards. I had to be sure to shift values that exceeded some high voltage threshold. And if I was sending a low value I had to make sure my values were lower than some output low voltage threshold.

同样，如果我是接收方，那么我必须保证将所有高于某个输入高电压阈值的电压识别为 1。同样，我必须保证将低于某个输入低电压阈值的电压识别为 0。因此，只要系统中的发送方和接收方遵守这些电压水平和规则，那么它们在数字系统中就能非常轻松地正常工作。

Similarly, if I was the receiver then I had to guarantee to recognize as a one all voltages that where above some input high voltage threshold. And similarly I had to guarantee to recognize as a zero voltages that were below some input low voltage threshold. So provided senders and receivers in a system adhere to these voltage levels, to this discipline then they would all very comfortably work correctly in a digital system.

然后我们还说，一旦你处理了这些值，一旦你处理了数字值，我们现在就可以假设一堆数字元素以一种非常类似于我们获取模拟信号的模拟电路的方式处理这些值。你已经学会了如何处理模拟信号。你已经了解了电阻分压器等等。你输入一个模拟信号，你也会得到一个输出模拟信号。

Then we also said that once you deal with such values, one you deal with digital values we can now postulate a bunch of digital elements that process these values in a manner very reminiscent of our analog circuits where we get analog signals. And you’ve already learned how to process analog signals. You’ve learned about resistor dividers and so on and so forth. You feed in an analog signal and you get an output analog signal as well.

现在，模拟域中的电阻器、电阻器和电压源等元素就是您处理的符号。在数字域中，我们将使用的原始元素称为门。举个例子，这称为 NAND 门。因此，我们在上一节课中研究了 AND 门。这是另一个称为 NAND 门的门的示例。NAND 门具有以下真值表。

Now, here the resistor in the analog domain, elements like resistors and voltage sources were the symbols that you dealt with. Here, in the digital domain, the primitive elements that we will be using are called gates. As one example, this is called the NAND gate. So we looked at the AND gate in the previous lecture. This is an example of another gate called the NAND gate. The NAND gate has the following truth table.

我们的两个输入是 A 和 B，输出是 C。NAND 门的工作原理如下。输出 用英语来说，我可以将其属性描述为，当这些输入中至少有一个为低值时，输出始终为高。因此，只要至少一个输入为低，输出就为高。所以这里是高。这里是高。哎呀，这里是高，这里是高。当，哎呀。

Our two inputs A and B and this output C. And the NAND gate works as follows. The output In English I can describe its properties as the output is a high at all times when at least one of these inputs is a low value. So it’s high whenever at least one input is a low. So it’s high here. It’s high here. Oops, it’s high here, high here. And when, oops.

当两个输入都为高时，输出为低。这是一个 NAND 门。请注意，它们与 AND 门完全互补。AND 门输出为 0 0 0 1。AND 门符号如下所示。一般来说，请注意这里的小气泡，它被称为气泡。该气泡表示否定，即反转。因此，我们取 AND 门，反转输出并否定输出，您就得到了 NAND 门。

And when both inputs are a high the output is a low. This is a NAND gate. Notice that these are exactly complimentary to the AND gate. The AND gate outputs were 0 0 0 1. And the AND gate symbol looked like this. In general, notice that this little bubble here, it’s called a bubble. That bubble implies a negation, an inversion. So we take the AND gate, invert the output and negate the output and you get the NAND gate.

因此这些元素就是组合门。组合门遵循两个属性。一是它们必须满足静态规则。数字领域中的所有系统、所有元素都需要满足静态规则。组合门的属性是其输出仅是输入的函数。换句话说，它不存储任何状态，也不存储任何历史记录。

So these elements are combinational gates. And in combinational gates they adhere to two properties. One is that they must satisfy the static discipline. All the systems, all the elements in our repertoire in the digital domain need to satisfy the static discipline. And the properties of a combinational gate are that its outputs are a function of inputs alone. In other words, it doesn’t store any state or doesn’t store any history inside it.

您只需查看当时的输入即可确定其输出。将其视为一个完全透明的实体，其输出反映了每个时刻输入的某些功能。所以我将向您展示一个数字电路的示例。我可以将电阻器、电压源和电流源连接起来以构建模拟电路，我现在可以使用诸如此类的原始元素来构建数字电路。

You can figure out its output just by looking at the inputs at that instant. Think of it as a completely transparent entity where its output reflects some function of the inputs at every instant of time. So I’ll show you an example of a digital circuit. So much as I could interconnect resistors and voltage sources and current sources to build analog circuits, I can now build digital circuits using primitive elements such as these.

例如，我可以构建一个如下所示的简单电路，这里有两个输入 A 和 B，我得到一个输出。然后我将其馈送到另一个具有另一个输入 C 的 NAND 门。此设备称为反相器。反相器只是翻转输入的方向。因此，如果 C 为 1，则输出为 0，如果 C 为 0，则输出变为 1。它是一个反相器。它只是反转其输入。

So, for example, I could build a simple circuit that looked like this, two inputs A and B here, I get an output. And I feed that to another NAND gate with another input C. This device is called an inverter. The inverter simply flips the sense of the input. So if C is a 1 the output is a 0, if C is a 0 the output becomes a 1. It’s an inverter. It simply inverts its input.

又一个原始设备。这是我的输出 D。所以这个设计有三个门。我可以用一些非常简单的布尔代数或处理布尔值来快速写下输出的样子。所以对于 AND 门，输出是 A 和 B。记住点是 and 的简写形式。但是有一个否定，即反转，所以用竖线表示反转。所以我的输出是 A 点 B 竖线。

Yet another primitive device. And this is my output D. So there are three gates in this design. And I can quickly write down what the output looks like using some very simple Boolean algebra or dealing with Boolean values here. So for AND gate the output is A and B. Remember dot is a short form for and. But there’s a negation, inversion, so represent inversions with a bar. So my output is A dot B bar.

这里有一个 C。所以这是我的输出 C 条。这是一个 NAND 门。所以它需要一个输入 A 点 B。它接受第二个输入 C 条并将它们进行 AND 运算并反转。这就是输出。所以这个例子中有三个门。所以你可以想象构建包含大量门的非常复杂的电路。

There is a C here. So this is my output C bar. And this is a NAND gate. So it takes one input A dot B. It takes the second input C bar and ANDs those and inverts them. So that’s the output. So there are three gates in this example. So you can think of building very complicated circuits containing large numbers of gates.

实际上，笔记本电脑中使用的微处理器包含大量门。有人能猜出 Pentium IV 中大约有多少个门吗？大概有多少个？Pentium IV 中有多少个门？4000 万。1 亿。Pentium IV 中大约有 2000 万个门。Pentium IV 中有 2000 万个门。

In fact, the microprocessors that you use in your laptop contain a large number of gates. Can someone guess how many gates are in the Pentium IV, roughly? Approximate, how many? How many gates in a Pentium IV? 40 million. 100 million. In the Pentium IV you have on the order of 20 million gates. 20 million gates in the Pentium IV.

生命从 002 年开始。在这里，你将了解一门和两门，而在现实世界中，你将与数千万个门打交道。但这是奔腾 IV 的。我在计算机科学实验室的研究小组制造了一个名为 Raw 芯片的芯片。这个芯片有 300 万个门。

And life begins in 002. Here you learn about onsies and twosies, and in the real world you will be dealing with tens of millions of gates. But this is for the Pentium IV. My research group at Laboratory for Computer Science built a chip called the Raw chip. And this chip has 3 million gates.

因此，有几名大三本科生参与了这个项目，他们开始处理数百万个门。因此，要记住的关键是，002 提供了从模拟信号切换到数字信号或从连续物质切换到集总物质的基础。并了解这些原始元素的基础。

And so there are several undergraduate students involved in this project in their third year, and they’re beginning to deal with millions of gates. So the key thing to remember is that 002 provides the foundations where you make the switch from the analog signal to the digital signal or from continuous matter to lumped matter. And learn about the foundations of these primitive elements.

在本课程结束时，您将开始处理小型系统，即包含 10 到 20 个原始元素的模拟系统。您还将开始处理包含数十个门的小型数字系统。在您的最终项目中，您将构建一个涉及音频播放系统的混合信号电路。

And by the end of this course you will begin dealing with small systems, analog systems that contain on the order of 10 to 20 primitive elements. You will also begin dealing with small digital systems that contain tens of gates. In your final project you will build a mixed signal circuit involving an audio playback system.

您将在内存芯片中存储数字数据，然后构建电路来提取数据、过滤数据，然后将其转换为模拟域，然后在一组扬声器上播放。这大约有 50 到 100 个原始元素。因此，到 002 结束时，您将学会处理数百个元素。

You will have digital data stored in a memory chip and you will build a circuit to extract that data, filter it and then convert it to the analog domain and then play it on a set of speakers. And that has on the order of about 50 to 100 primitive elements. So by the end of 002 you will have learned to deal with hundreds of elements.

然后，您将学习其他课程，例如 004 等，在这些课程中，您将进一步学习进一步的抽象，这些抽象将带您从子系统到具有数百万个门的系统。因此，关键是管理处理数百万个门的复杂性，这一切都与抽象有关。您必须构建抽象和双重抽象，这样您才能处理复杂性。

And then you will take other courses like 004 and so on where you will then make the leap to learn further abstractions that will take you from subsystems to systems with millions of gates. So the key is to manage the complexity of dealing with millions of gates it’s all about abstractions. You have to build abstractions and double abstractions so you can deal with complexity.

因此，EECS 的其余部分将带您从三个门到 2000 万个门，以及在 2000 万个门上运行的软件系统，或者其他。所以还有很长的路要走。我们的朋友 Lorenzo 已经带来了我们今天忘记带来的演示。它将以模拟形式向您展示那个小数字电路。那么今天的讲座是关于什么的呢？今天的讲座将讲述门里面有什么？

So the rest of EECS will take you from three gates to 20 million gates and software systems that operate on 20 million gates or whatever. So there is still a ways to go. Lorenzo, our friend has gone to bring a demonstration that we forgot to bring today. That will show you that little digital circuit in a mock up form. So what’s today’s lecture about? Today’s lecture is going to be about what’s inside a gate?

如何构建门。构建门后，您可以将数百万个门放入计算机系统或模拟系统或其他类型的系统中。我们在这里要做的是了解这个抽象概念里面有什么。这是一个抽象元素，看起来像一个小圆圈和一条线，里面有一些东西，具有一些属性。但必须有人来构建它。它不是来自大自然。

How to build a gate. Once you build a gate you can then put millions of them into computer systems or analog systems or other sorts of systems. And what we’ll do here is understand what’s inside this abstraction. This is an abstract element that looks like a little circle and a line with some stuff inside it, with some properties. But someone’s got to build that. It doesn’t come from nature.

你不会去从树上摘取门，你必须去建造它，而且必须有人去做。所以这里要学习的是我们如何建造门？在这里你将看到如何实际处理满足给定静态规则的电压阈值？所以在我开始建造门之前，让我试着建立一些直觉。

You don’t go and harvest gates from trees, you got to go build that, and someone has got to do that. So what to learn here is how do we go about building a gate? And here you will see practically how do you deal with voltage thresholds that satisfy a given static discipline? So before I jump into building a gate, let me try to build up some intuition.

按照我的惯例，我希望您能够对如何构建门有一些直觉。然后我们将介绍构建门的机制。为了建立直觉，让我向您展示流体中的类似情况。假设我有一锅水。这就像一个电源。我需要将这种流体输送到某个输出源。

As is my usual practice, I’d love to get you to build some intuition as to how to build a gate. And then we’ll go through the mechanics of doing it. So to build intuition, let me show you an analogous situation in fluids. So let’s say I have a cauldron of water. This is like a power supply. And I need to feed this fluid down at some output source.

我在中间做的是安装几个水龙头，水龙头，好吗？那么这些家伙是做什么的呢？在什么情况下，另一端的管子会有液体流出？如果会有液体流动，那么让我称之为 A 和 B。如果 A 是开着的，B 也是开着的，那么 C 就有水。

And what I do in the middle is put in a couple of taps, faucets, all right? And so what do these guys do? Under what condition do you have fluid flow out of the tube at the other end? You will have fluid flow if So let me call this A and B. If A is on and B is on then C has water.

否则，如果 A 和 B 都不开启，那么 C 就没有水。所以这听起来就像是一个与门，没错，只有当 A 和 B 都开启时，才能有水。所以我们将利用这一见解，在某种流动的流中放置一些东西来阻碍流动。当两个障碍物都被解除时，我得到了输出。

Otherwise, if both A and B are not on then C has no water. So this is already beginning to sound like a AND gate, correct, where you get water only if A and B are both turned on. So we’re going to use this insight, a stream of some flow and I put things to obstruct the flow. And when both the obstructions are lifted I get the output.

我想利用这种直觉来构建一个与门。同样，我可以构建一个系统，使我能够构建以下结构。因此，在这种情况下，我将其称为 A 和 B 的信号。在这种情况下，如果电源中有水，在什么条件下我会流出水？在这种情况下，如果 A 或 B 打开，我就会流出水。

I want to use that intuition to build an AND gate. Similarly, I could build a system that allows me to build the following structure So in this scenario let me call this the signal of A and B here. And in this situation under what conditions, provided the power supply has water, under what conditions do I get water out? In this situation, it is I get water if A or B are turned on.

所以我不需要同时打开 A 和 B。如果其中任何一个打开，我就会在这里得到流体流动。所以这将有助于我们构建内部以构建或门。这是一个涉及我们日常生活中看到的物品的类比。现在让我进入电气领域。在电气领域，我的类比将是这样的。

So I don’t need to turn both A and B on. If either one of them is on, I’m going to get fluid flow here. So this will help us build the inside to build the OR gate. So that’s an analogy involving items we see in everyday life. Let me now move into the electrical domain. In the electrical domain my analogy would be something like this.

假设我有一个电源，有两个开关 A 和 B。我使用几个开关构建一个小电路，将该电压源连接到灯泡上。在这种情况下，如果开关 A 和 B 都打开，灯泡就会亮。我的灯泡亮了。如果我关闭其中任何一个，我的灯泡就会熄灭。

Let’s say I have a power supply and I have two switches A and B. And I build a little circuit that connects this voltage source across the bulb using a couple of switches. In this case, the bulb is on if both switches A and B are on. My bulb turns on. If I switch either one of them off my bulb turns off.

请注意，如果我有这个元素，我就可以开始实现类似的事情。我已经有了来源。我知道如何处理灯泡。我将它们建模为电阻器。所以我需要对这个称为“开关”的新元素做些什么。所以让我构建一个抽象设备。我马上告诉你如何在现实生活中做到这一点。所以如果我有开关，我就可以构建类似的东西。

So notice that I can begin implementing things like this if I had this element. I had sources already. I know how to deal with bulbs. I model them as resistors. So I need to do something about this new element called a “switch”. So let me build an abstract device. I’ll tell you how to do that in real life in a second. So if I had the switch I could build things like this.

我可以将开关串联在电路中，这样就得到了类似于 AND 函数的东西。那么让我继续为开关构建一个等效电路。开关在这里有几个端子，我有一个控件。开关有一个控件，它们有一对端子。它的等效电路如下所示。这是我的开关。

I could put switches in series in a circuit and get myself something that looks like a AND function. So let me go ahead and build an equivalent circuit for a switch. So the switch has a couple of terminals here and I have a control. Switches have a control and they have a pair of terminals. And the equivalent circuit for this looks like this. This is for my switch.

因此，当控制为 0 时，我的开关打开，从而在电路中形成开路，我在这里向您展示过。同样，如果我的控制为 1，那么输入和输出之间就会连接。这是短路。

So when control is a 0. Then my switch is open to give me an open circuit in the circuit that I’ve shown you here. And, by the same token, if my control is a 1 then I have a connection between in and out. And this is a short circuit.

换句话说，如果我的开关控制的是 0，我会讨论如何实现这一点，如果是 1，则会出现短路。这是一个开关打开和关闭的过程。现在，在传统开关中，机械压力是我的控制信号。如果我施加机械压力，我的开关就会打开。如果我拿走机械压力，我就可以得到关闭的情况。

So, in other words, if my switch has 0 at its control, I’ll talk about how to get that, I have an open circuit, and if it’s a 1 then I have a short circuit. This is a switch going on and off. Now, in traditional switches mechanical pressure is my control signal. If I apply mechanical pressure my switch could turn on. And if I take away the mechanical pressure then I could get an off situation.

现在让我们想象一下我们有一个开关。我还没有告诉你如何在现实生活中得到一个开关。让我们想象一下你有一个开关。它是一个三端设备。有一个控制装置。输入和输出。让我们构建以下包含开关的小电路。我要做的是，我将取一个电阻 RL 并将其插入这里。

So let’s for now imagine that we have a switch. I still haven’t told you how I am going to get a switch in real life. Let’s imagine you have a switch. It’s a three terminal device. There’s a control thingamajig coming in. Input and an output. So let’s build the following little circuit containing a switch. So what I’m going to do, I will take a resistance RL and plug it in here.

像这样连接我的电源。我构建的小电路有一个电阻。我按照这种模式连接开关，得到一个 VS。Lorenzo，如果你愿意，你可以在那里设置它。没问题。所以我在这里得到一个 VS。现在，几节课前我告诉过你，6.002，就此而言，004 和我们的许多其他课程都涉及元素的组合。

And connect my power supply like so. So the little circuit that I build has a resistor. And I connect the switch in this pattern and I get a VS. Lorenzo, you can set that up there if you’d like. No problem. So I get a VS here. Now, a couple of lectures ago I told you that 6.002, and for that matter, 004 and many of our other courses deal with combinations of elements.

我们经常会一次又一次地处理相同类型的组合。我们看到相同类型的模式正在发生，我们需要开始学习识别这些模式。这是一种非常常见的模式。我向你保证，在 6.002 中，你会比任何其他模式都更频繁地看到这种模式。电源连接到电阻器，并连接到一些有趣设备的几个端子。

And we often deal with the same kinds of combinations again and again and again. We see the same sorts of patterns happening, and we need to begin to learn to identify these patterns. This is an incredibly common pattern. You’ll see this pattern more times in 6.002 than any other pattern, I promise you. A power supply connected to a resistor and connected to a couple of terminals of some interesting device.

我保证，例如，测验中至少会有一个这样的模式。这些模式非常常见。那么让我们来看看这个模式的有趣属性。由于这种模式如此常见，我将创建一个简短的形式。我已经创建了一个简短的形式，即此处的这个基本节点。

I promise there will be at least one such pattern on the quiz, for example. These patterns are incredibly common. So let’s take a look at the interesting properties of this pattern. Since this pattern occurs so commonly, I am going to create a short form. I have already created a short form which is this ground node here.

通过放置接地 0，我真正想说的是，有一根电线连接这两个，这就是我的接地。所以我这里已经有了一个简短的形式。我的第二个简短形式是当我将电源连接到节点时。然后我要做的是想出另一个简短的形式，看起来像这样，一个向上的箭头，上面写着电压。

By putting ground 0 all I’m really saying is that there is a wire connecting these two and that’s my ground. So I already have a short form here. My second short form is when I connect a power supply to a node. Then what I’m going to do is come up with yet another short form that looks like this, an up arrow with the voltage written there.

这个符号只是表示这个节点连接到一个带电压的电源，或者一个电压源电压 VS。所以我只是想出了一个稍微简单的表示方法来表示我所拥有的小图案。现在让我们来看看这个小系统的属性。让我们首先看看当 C 为 0 时会发生什么。当 C 为 0 时，让我用那里的开路画出它的等效电路。

This symbol simply says that this node is connected to a power supply with voltage, or a voltage source voltage VS. So I just have come up with a slightly simpler representation for the little pattern that I have. Now let’s take a look at the properties of this little system. Let’s first look at what happens when C is 0. When C is 0, let me draw the equivalent circuit for this using the open circuit out there.

这就是我得到的，好吗？所以当 C 为 0 时，如果 VS 是高电压，比如说 5 伏，如果 C 为 0，你期望输出是什么？这个电压 VS 出现在 V out 处，因为这里是开路。记住，RL 和这个小装置形成了一个分压器。但由于它是开路，它的电阻是无穷大。

That’s what I get, OK? So when C is 0, if VS is a high voltage, let’s say 5 volts, what do you expect at the output if C is a 0? This voltage VS appears at V out because this is an open circuit here. Remember, RL and this little device form a voltage divider. But since it’s an open circuit its resistance is infinity.

因此，在这个电阻分压器中，所有电压都落在这个开路上。所以，在这种情况下，v out 是 1 或高电压。但让我们看看当 C 为 1 时会发生什么。在这种情况下，我有我的 RL，这就是我所拥有的。这是开关处的短路，C 为 1。那么在这种情况下电压 v out 是多少？

And so therefore in this resistor divider all the voltage falls across this open circuit. So, in this case, v out is a 1 or a high voltage. But let’s take a look at what happens when C is a 1. In this situation, I have my RL, that’s what I have. It’s a short circuit at the switch and C is a 1. So what’s the voltage v out in this case?

毫不奇怪，因为我已将此节点短接至地，因此此点的电压为 0。因此，如果我有低电压，则它对应于逻辑 0，这对应于 0。因此，我可以为 C 构建一个简单的真值表，并在此使用逻辑符号。因此，当 C 为 0 时，我在输出端获得高电平，而当 C 为 1 时，我在输出端获得低电平。

Not surprisingly, since I’ve shorted this node to ground the voltage at this point is 0. So if I have low voltage that’s corresponding to logical 0s that corresponds to a 0. So I can build a simple truth table for C and use logical symbols here. So when C is a 0 I get a high at the output and when C is 1 I get a low at the output.

到目前为止，您见过像这样的设备吗？这是一个小型逆变器。这就是逆变器的确切行为。所以我在这里写的是逆变器的真值表。请注意，仅用一个简单的小开关和一个电阻器，我就成功地构建了一个逆变器。在我继续之前，我想我们要向你们展示一些东西。让我暂停几秒钟，然后这样做。

Have you seen a device that behaves like this so far? That’s a little inverter. That’s the exact behavior of an inverter. So this thing I’ve written here is a truth table for an inverter. So notice with just a simple little switch and a resistor, I have managed to build an inverter. Before I go on, I guess we have some things to show you. And let me pause for a couple of seconds and do that.

首先，我想向你们展示的是以下想法。昨晚我在准备这次讲座时说过，现在我要告诉 6.002 班的同学们，你们需要学习模拟电路和电阻器以及所有这些东西，你们还需要学习数字系统以及所有这些东西。我说，因为这两个非常常见，而且它们经常一起出现。

First of all, what I want to show you is the following idea. So as I was preparing for this lecture last night I said, now here I am telling the 6.002 gang that you need to learn about analog circuits and resistors and all of that stuff, and you also need to learn about digital systems and all of that stuff. And I said, because these two are very commonplace and often times they occur together.

所以我说，好吧，如果我真的相信自己的 BS，那么我周围应该有一些东西可以让我瞬间找到它们。所以我说让我做下面的实验。让我闭上眼睛，伸出手，看看我触摸到了什么。所以我闭上眼睛，伸出手，猜猜怎么着？我触摸到了那只孤独的老鼠。老鼠。所以我说让我看看老鼠里面有什么。

So I said well, if I really believe in my own BS then there should be something around me where I can find both of them instantaneously. So I said let me do the following experiment. Let me close my eyes and reach out and see what I touch. So I closed my eyes, reached out, and guess what? I touched the lonely mouse. The mouse. So I said let me see what is in side the mouse.

如果我相信我的 BS，我们应该在里面找到模拟、小元件和数字元件，对吧？那么让我们看看鼠标里面有什么。好的。我们开始吧。不要在家里尝试这个，就像我们在课堂上做的许多其他事情一样。来吧。让我看看我想看的东西。好的，我们开始吧。还不错。让我给你看看我们在这个可怜的破碎鼠标里有什么。那是我的手指，傻瓜。

And if I believe in my BS we should find analog, little components and digital components in there, right? So let’s see what is inside the mouse. All right. There we go. Don’t try this at home, as with many other things we do in lecture.come on. Show me what I want to see. OK, here we go. Not bad. Let me show you what we have here in this poor shattered mouse. That’s my finger, silly.

你应该认出这个小电阻。那个带小条的东西，哦，我们来看看。我们会用到它。这是一个电阻。大约四周后你会看到电容器。这是一个电容器。这里有一个数字 IC。这是一个数字 IC。里面有一堆门。所以这只老鼠并没有让我变成骗子。

You should recognize this little resistor here. That thing with the little bands, oh, here we go. We’ll use this. That’s a resistor. And you’ll see capacitors in about four weeks. That’s a capacitor. And there is a digital IC here. That’s a digital IC. That contains a bunch of gates inside it. So this mouse has not made a liar out of me.

我刚才向你展示的是我们日常生活中使用的一种小型设备，它既有模拟元件，也有数字元件。我们日常生活中使用的大量设备都是这样的。你可以对你的笔记本电脑做同样的事情。你可以去试试。你会发现一堆模拟元件和一堆数字元件。你真的真的需要了解这里面的所有东西。

So what I just showed you was a little device that we use in everyday life that has both analog components and digital components. A large number of devices that we use in daily life are this way. You can do the same thing to your laptop. You could go try it out. And you will find a bunch of analog components and a bunch of digital components. And you really, really need to understand the whole caboodle here.

让我给你展示一个有趣的小演示，演示中涉及到门。现在，我希望你在这里要非常小心。这里有很多注意事项。如果你的祖母问你门有多大，不要说这么大。我想说，当门刚被发明时，它就是这么大。当他们用离散真空管等制造门时，门就是这么大。大概就是这么大。

Let me show you a fun little demo involving gates. Now, I want you to be very careful here. Lots of caveats here. If your grandmother asks you how big is a gate don’t say this big. This is how big gates used to be, I would say, when they were first invented. When they built gates out of discrete vacuum tubes and so on, this is how big a gate used to be. This is roughly that big.

如今，在一块芯片中，在一块小型 VLSI 中，在一块边长约为 1 厘米的超大规模集成电路中，您认为在拇指指甲大小的芯片中可以容纳多少个门？猜猜看？以当今的技术，一块芯片上可以容纳多少个门？肯定超过一百万，因为我刚刚告诉过您，奔腾 IV 是 2000 万，那是一年前的事了。有多少？

Today in a chip, in a small VLSI, very large scaled integrated circuit in a chip, which is about 1 cm on the side, how many gates do you think I can fit in a thumbnail sized chip? Any guesses? With today’s technology, how many gates can I fit on a chip? It has to be more than a million because I just told you that Pentium IV was 20 million and that was a year ago. How many?

4000 万是个不错的猜测。因此，1 平方厘米内大约有 4000 万到 8000 万个门。英特尔刚刚宣布，他们将推出一款包含 10 亿个开关的芯片。记住，这整个东西就是一个门，对吧？反相器、电阻器和开关。这个东西就是一个开关。因此，英特尔将推出一款包含 10 亿个小元件的芯片。请记住这些大数字。

40 million is a good guess. So on the order of 40 to 80 million gates in a 1 square centimeter. Intel just announced that they will be shipping a chip containing 1 billion switches. Remember, this whole thing is a gate, right? Inverter, a resistor and a switch. This thing is a switch. So Intel is going to be shipping something containing a billion of those little elements. Just keep those large numbers in mind.

这是我展示的一个小电路，A、B、NAND 门、输出端的 NAND 门和反相器。因此，只要 A 或 B 之一关闭，输出 A 就会为 1。因此，在这种情况下，当 A 和 B 都关闭时，输出为 1。

So here is a little circuit that I showed you here, A, B, the NAND gate, the NAND gate at the output and the inverter. So this output A is going to be 1 whenever either A or B is off. So the output is a 1 in this case when both A and B are off.

我将 A 变为 1，输出仍为 1。因此，当我将这两个输入都变为 1 时，它们都是 1，输出变为 0。这就是 NAND 门的行为。如果我将任何一个输入切换为 0，输出应该变为 1。同样，对于此处的反相器，当输入为 0 时，输出为 1。当我切换它时，输出也应该如此。

I turn A to 1, output is still a 1. So the moment I turn both of these inputs into a 1, these are 1s, the output goes to 0. That’s behavior for NAND gate. If I switch any one of the inputs to a 0 the output should go to a 1. Similarly, for the inverter here, when the input is a 0 the output is a 1. And when I switch it so should the output.

现在想象一下一个电路，一个包含数十亿个此类设备的小芯片。想象一下所有这些 1 和 0 到处乱飞。因此，输入中的一个简单开关，例如单击按键，实际上可能会导致电路中的十亿个信号翻转。这会导致一些有趣的事情发生，我们将在几个月后了解这些事情。

Now imagine a circuit, a little chip containing billions of these devices. And just imagine all of these 1s and 0s flying around. So one simple switch in the input, like a click of a keystroke could actually cause a billion signals in your circuit to be flipping around. And that causes some fun stuff to happen, which we will learn about a few months from now.

但现在我们只是快速展示一下看起来像这样的小电路。让我回过头来谈谈如何构建其他类型的门。这就是反相器。现在你知道了。你几乎已经能够构建奔腾 IV 了。你已经从大自然一路走到了门。奔腾 IV 包含 2000 万个门，所以你现在知道了门是如何构建的。这就是反相器。

But for now that’s a quick show of a little circuit that looks like that. Let me go back to talking about building other types of gates. So that was an inverter. So now you know. You’re almost halfway to being able to build a Pentium IV. You’ve come all the way from nature to gates. And Pentium IV contains 20 million of them so you now know how gates are built. So that’s an inverter.

让我们看看如何构建其他形式的门。要构建另一个门，让我这样做。这个模式怎么样？如果我构建一个这样的模式，A 和 B 进入这里，我放置两个开关，它们的输入为输入和输出，所以两个开关串联。让我们写下这个的真值表。让我们看看。当 A 和 B 都为 0 时，输出应该是什么？

Let’s look at how we can build other forms of gates. To build another gate let me do this. How about this pattern? If I build a pattern like this with A and B coming in here and I put two switches with their inputs in and out, so two switches in series. Let’s write down the truth table for what this looks like. Let’s see. When A and B are both 0, what should the output be?

这两个开关都关闭，因此输出直接为 VS，即高电平。当这两个开关之一关闭时，输出为 0 1 或 1 0。如果任何一个开关关闭，则此节点与地面断开。这里没有电流流动。因此，整个电压都会在此无限电阻上下降，因此输出端也会得到 1。如果两个开关都打开，会发生什么？

These are both off so the output is directly VS which is a high. When either of these switches is off 0 1 or 1 0. If either switch is off then this node is cut off from ground. There is no current flowing here. So this entire voltage drops across this infinite resistance here, and so I get 1s at the output as well. If both switches are on what happens?

如果 A 和 B 都打开，那么我会得到一个接地短路，我的输出为 0。那么有人能告诉我这是什么门吗？太棒了。我们只需构建一个 NAND 门。这真是令人难以置信。五堂课，你已经从大自然一路走到了微处理器的原始构建块。这真是太神奇了。那么这个呢？这是什么？

If both A and B are on then I get a short circuit to ground and my output is a 0. So can someone tell me what gate this is? Awesome. We just build a NAND gate. This is unbelievable. Five lectures and you’ve already come all the way from nature to the primitive building blocks of microprocessors. It’s pretty amazing. So what about this one here? What’s this?

我之前没告诉过你，但是如果 AND 门变成 NAND 门，这是一种 OR 排列，OR 应该变成什么？NOR。这完全合乎逻辑。所以你可以回家练习一下真值表。A、B 和 C。我只需填写其中一行。

I haven’t told you this before but if an AND gate becomes a NAND gate, this is kind of an OR arrangement, what should an OR become? NOR. It’s all completely logical. So you can go home and practice a truth table for this. A, B and C. I’ll just fill in one of the rows.

因此，在这种特定情况下，如果 A 和 B 均为 0，如果 A 为 0 且 B 为 0，则两个开关均关闭，因此就好像这里的小吸盘与地面断开，VS 从 C 落到地面，输出为 1，依此类推。因此，我可以构建其他有趣形式的门。假设我构建了类似这样的门。

So in this particular situation, if both A and B are 0, if A is 0 and B is 0, both the switches are off, so it’s as if this little sucker here is cut off from ground and VS falls across from C to ground here and the output is a 1, so on and so forth. So I can build other interesting forms of gates. So let’s say I build something that looks like this.

我构建了类似的东西。您可以为此编写真值表，也可以查看此并写下它支持的功能。请注意，只有当这两个都不接地时，此处的输出才会为高。如果您再仔细看看它，就会发现它所呈现的功能，这是我的 AND 函数。假设这个不存在，那就是我的 AND 函数。

I build something like this. You can write the truth table for this or you can look at this and write down the function that this one supports. Notice that this output here is going to be a high only when both of these are not connected to ground. And if you stare at it some more the function this one presents, this is my AND function. Suppose this one didn’t exist, that would be my AND function.

但是因为这个存在，所以它处于 OR 配置中，所以我得到了 C。因此我得到了类似这样的结果。所以这是我的 A 点 B，这是我的加号，因为这里有一个并联，最终这导致了这个门的反转。所以原始模式在输出中内置了一个通用反转。

But because this one exists that’s in an OR configuration and so I get a C. And so because of that I get something that looks like this. So this is my A dot B, this is my plus because of a parallel here, and ultimately this caused an inversion in this gate. So the primitive pattern has a generic inversion built into the output.

这就是为什么他们通常最终会构建 NAND 门和 NOR 门等作为最简单的门。我们不构建 AND 门和 OR 门。我怎样才能将这个转换为 AND 门？有人知道吗？在输出端放置一个反相器。所以我能做的就是把这个小吸盘拿在这里，在这里放一个反相器，我就得到了一个 AND 门。所以电路中真正的原语往往是 NAND 和 NOR。好的。

That is why they commonly end up building NAND gates and NOR gates and so on as the simplest gates. We don’t build AND gates and OR gates. How can I convert this one to an AND gate? Anybody? Put an inverter on the output. So what I can do is take this little sucker here, put an inverter here and I get an AND gate. So the real primitives in circuits tend to be NANDs and NORs. OK.

所以你们当中真正务实的人此时应该会说，好吧，好吧，如果存在开关，我就买这个。如果存在开关，我确切地知道如何从自然界转向制造奔腾 IV。所以对我来说，下一步显然是向你们展示一个开关，一个物理开关设备。为了介绍开关设备，让我向你们展示一个三端元件。

So the real practical among you should be saying at this point all right, all right, I buy this, if there existed a switch. I know exactly how to go from nature to building Pentium IVs if there exists a switch. So that the obvious next step for me is to show you a switch, a physical switch device. And to introduce a switch device, let me show you a three terminal element.

请记住，开关有三个端子，一个输入端、一个输出端和一个称为控制端 C 的端子。因此，我将介绍一种称为“MOSFET 器件”的新基本元件。MOSFET 代表金属氧化物半导体场效应晶体管。缩写为 FET 或晶体管。现在我将向你们展示它的工作原理就像一个开关。事实上，在此之前，我先来做一下。然后我会向你们展示其他东西。因此，该器件具有以下符号。

Remember, the switch has three terminals, an input, output and something called the control, C. So I’m going to introduce a new primitive element called “The MOSFET Device”. MOSFET stands for metal oxide semiconductor field effect transistor. This is shortened to FET or transistor. Now I’m going to show you that this works like a switch. And before I do that, in fact, let me do that first. Then I’ll show you something else. So this device has the following symbol.

它有一个称为栅极的端子，还有漏极和源极。栅极、漏极和源极。三个端子。这是构成当今制造的几乎所有电子元件的基本元素。这是宇宙的基础。因此，我们可以看看这个小型 MOSFET 器件是如何工作的。我马上就会在屏幕上向你们展示这个东西，但它的工作方式与我之前假设的这个器件非常相似。

It has a terminal called a gate, the drain and the source. Gate, drain and source. Three terminals. This is the primitive element that forms virtually every electronic component built today. This is the foundation of the universe. So this little MOSFET device, we can look at how it behaves. I’ll show you this thing on the screen in a second, but this guy behaves very much like this device I was postulating earlier.

让我们在示波器上看一下这个设备。为此，让我标记一些电压和电流。因此，让我将此电压标记为 vDS。让我将此电压标记为栅极和源极之间的 vGS。让我将进入此节点的电流标记为 iG。

Let’s take a look at this device on the scope. To do so let me label some voltages and currents. So let me label this voltage as vDS. Let me label this voltage as vGS between the gate and the source. And let me label the current coming into this node iG.

在这个设备中，也就是我将要展示的物理设备中，进入栅极的电流始终为 0。因此，对于 6.002，iG 始终为 0。在现实生活中，存在一些泄漏等。但在 6.002 中，我们目前处理一个非常简单的抽象模型，iG 为 0。让我将这里的电流标记为 iDS。

In this device, the physical device that I’m going to show you, the current going into the gate is always 0. So iG is always going to be 0 for 6.002. In real life there is some leakage and so on. But in 6.002 for now we deal with a very simple abstract model, iG is 0. And let me label the current here as iDS.

为了正确命名，流入节点 D 的电流应标记为 iD，但由于 iG 为 0，iD 也会通过源流出，因此我将其简称为 iDS，这样我就可以显示 vDS 和 iDS 是我要处理的两个电压和电流。这就是我的小设备。请注意，源极端子是公共端。

To be correct with the nomenclation, the current into node D should be labeled iD, but because iG is 0 iD flows out through the source as well, so I would simply call it iDS just so that I can show that vDS and iDS are the two voltages and currents that I am going to deal with. So that’s my little device here. And notice that the source terminal is common.

我使用源极作为控制 GS，也​​使用源极作为漏极。因此，您可以将其视为输入，将其视为输出，并且如果您愿意，可以将其抽象地视为控制。因此，让我向您展示其行为的图表。为了了解其行为，我可以为其绘制一个等效电路。

I use the source both for the control GS and I use the source for the drain as well. So you can view this as input, view this as out, and you can view this, if you like, as the control abstractly. So let me show you a plot of how this behaves. To understand how it behaves, I can draw an equivalent circuit for it.

因此，在这种特殊情况下，如果其行为由施加到 vGS 的电压来表征。与开关上的控制非常相似，vGS 是我的控制。因此，如果 vGS 为 0，哦，对不起。如果 vGS 大于或等于某个阈值电压 VT

So in this particular situation, if its behavior is characterized by the voltage applied to vGS. Much like the control on the switch, vGS is my control. So if vGS is 0, oh, I’m sorry. If vGS is greater than or equal to some threshold voltage VT

因此，如果 vGS（此处施加的电压）大于某个电压，如果 VT（阈值电压）或开关的压力大于某个阈值压力，则这家伙的行为就像短路一样。这是 iDS，这是我的漏极，这是我的源极。因此，如果施加在栅极和源极之间的电压高于某个阈值，则这就像短路一样。

So vGS, the voltage applied here is greater than some voltage, VT, a threshold voltage, or the pressure of the switch is greater than some threshold pressure then this guy behaves like a short circuit. This is iDS, this is my drain and this is my source. So if the voltage applied between the gate and the source is higher than some threshold then this behaves like a short circuit.

类似地，如果电压 vGS 小于某个阈值 VT，那么在这种情况下，我会得到一个开路。当 D 和 S 之间有开路时，电流 iDS 将为 0。所以这是理想模型。这个理想模型被称为“MOSFET 的开关模型”。MOSFET 的开关模型或 S 模型。

Similarly, if the voltage vGS is less than some threshold VT then in that situation I get an open circuit. And when I have an open circuit between D and S then the current iDS is going to be 0. So this is the idealized model. And this idealized model is called “the switch model of the MOSFET”. The switch model or the S model of the MOSFET.

好吧，如果你想看看 MOSFET 的内部结构，我不会在讲座或复习课中讲解。你可以看看课程笔记的第 6.7 节，里面有 MOSFET 的内部结构，以及如何物理地构造这样的设备。所以我在这里能做的就是退后一步，盯着这个设备看一两秒钟。

Well, if you want to see the internals of the MOSFET, I won’t cover that in lecture or recitation. You can look at the section, I believe Section 6.7 of the course notes. That has the internal structure of the MOSFET and how you physically construct such a device. So what I can do here is step back and stare at the device for a second or two.

它的意思是，如果我施加很大的压力，如果 vGS 大于阈值 VT，那么我这里就会短路，就像我的开关一样。如果有疑问，可以想象一下水龙头。如果你对水龙头施加压力，就把它想象成关闭，当我打开它时，当 vGS 小于 VD，小于阈值时，我就会卸下压力，然后它就会变成开路。

And what it says is that if I apply a lot of pressure, if vGS is greater than a threshold VT then I get a short circuit here just like my switch. When in doubt think faucet. If you put pressure on the faucet, think of this as closing, and when I open it, when vGS goes less than VD, less than a threshold, I take off the pressure and then it becomes an open circuit.

因此我可以绘制以下图表。就像我绘制两个终端元件的 iV 特性一样，我可以按照以下方式绘制此三终端元件的 iV 特性。我可以专注于两个终端，查看该终端对的 vDS 和 iDS，并绘制曲线以了解当我更改所应用的 vGS 时其行为方式。

So I can plot the following. Much like I plotted the iV characteristics of two terminal elements, I can plot the iV characteristics of this three terminal element in the following way. I can focus on two terminals and look at vDS and iDS for that terminal pair and draw the curves for how it will behave as I change vGS that I applied.

因此，我要向你们展示的是，如果 vGS 小于阈值，则其行为类似于开路。因此，无论电压是多少，电流都是 0。同样，如果 vGS 大于等于某个阈值电压，则我得到短路的行为 iV 曲线，其中电流可以是任何值，并像任何短路一样受外力控制。让我在屏幕上向你们展示。

So what I’m going to show you is that if vGS is less than a threshold then this behaves like a open circuit. So no matter what the voltage is the current is 0. Similarly, if vGS greater than equal to some threshold voltage then I get the behavior iV curve of a short circuit where the current can be anything and controlled by external forces like in any short circuit. So let me show you on the screen.

Lorenzo 已经贴出了图表。我展示的是开关的 iV 曲线。请注意，当 vGS 大于 VT，大于阈值时，我会得到与短路相对应的垂直线。是这个吗？就是这个。好了。所以我要在这里做的是将 vGS 降低到 VT 以下。你应该看到发生了什么？

Lorenzo has kindly put the graph up already. So I’m showing the iV curve of a switch. Notice that when vGS is greater than VT, greater than a threshold I get the vertical line corresponding to a short circuit. Is it this one? This one. There we go. So what I’m going to do here is I’m going to reduce vGS to below VT. What should you see happening?

曲线从短路开始，应该逐渐变成开路。这是我为您绘制的开路曲线。VGS 压力不够。压力很大，砰，就是短路。我真的很喜欢用这个压力类比，如果我每次看到 MOS 晶体管时感到困惑，我需要查看 vGS，等等，我总是认为 vGS 大于 VT。

The curve, from being a short circuit, should hammer down to becoming an open circuit. That’s the curve for an open circuit as I drew out there for you. VGS pressure ain’t enough. Lots of pressure, boom, it’s a short circuit. I really like to think of this pressure analogy if I get confused whenever I look at a MOS transistor and I need to look at vGS and so on I always think vGS is greater than VT.

开关上的压力很大。只要记住这一点，你就不会忘记这里的 vGS 东西。这就是开关的行为。好了，这就是我们的开关。我给你一个三端元件，它是一个像机械开关一样控制的开关。所以我可以构建一个，如果我替换这是我之前的开关。

Lots of pressure on the switch it turns on. Just remember that, and then you won’t forget this vGS thing here. So that’s the behavior of a switch. And so viola, there’s our switch. So I’ve given you a three terminal element that is a switch that is controlled like a mechanical switch. So I can build a, if I replace This was my switch earlier.

我可以做的是将其替换为我的 MOSFET，这就是我得到的。我不会费心向您展示这是您的逆变器。所有这些都用物理开关替换了抽象开关，其行为如上图所示。所以我在这里应用输入，然后在这里获取输出。所以作为 6.002，您可以看到这个并说啊哈，这是一个逆变器。

And what I can do is replace this with my MOSFET and that’s what I get. And I won’t bother showing you this is your inverter. All of that has replaced the abstract switch with a physical switch which behaves as shown in the graph up there. And so I apply an input here and I take the output here. So as 6.002 you could look at this and say ah ha, that is an inverter.

当你进入 004 时，你要做的就是构建这个三角形并在其周围构建一个圆圈，然后忽略内部内容，只看它。因此，在 002 中，我们向你展示了内部结构看起来像一个带有 MOSFET 和电阻器的图案，但从外部看，它实际上是一个抽象的反相器。

When you go to 004 what you will do is build this triangle and a circle around it and you will ignore what’s inside and just look at that. So in 002 we showed you that the internals look like a pattern with a MOSFET and a resistor, but it’s really the abstract inverter looking in from the outside.

我要关闭数字门内的环路，这是在你的小型逆变器内，带有一个电阻器和一个开关。让我在这里继续讨论这个问题，并做一些我们喜欢做的事情，即绘制所谓的输入/输出曲线。假设这里施加的电压为 v in，我们将其称为 v out。

I’m just going to close the loop inside the digital gate, and this was inside your little inverter with a resistor and a switch. Let me continue with this for a little longer here and do something that we like to do a lot, which is plot what are called input / output curves. So let’s say the voltage applied here is v in and let’s call this v out.

为了好玩，我们来绘制这个逆变器的 av 输入与 v 输出的关系图。因此，当输入为 0 时，假设逆变器的 VT 为 1 伏。阈值电压为 1 伏。阈值压力为 1 伏。因此，当输入为 0 时，假设 VS 为 5 伏。因此，当输入为 0 时，这个家伙就关闭了。那么输出是多少？输出电压是多少？

For fun let’s plot a v in versus v out for this inverter. So when input is a 0, let’s say VT is 1 volt for the inverter. The threshold voltage is 1 volt. The threshold pressure is 1 volt. So when input is a 0, and let’s say VS is 5 volts. So when the input is a 0, this guy is turned off. So what’s the output? What’s the output voltage?

如果关闭它，输出电压是多少？是电源。电源直接显示在这里。因此，只要输入为 0，输出就是 5 伏。直到输入达到 1 伏，情况都是如此。只要输入小于 1 伏，我的输出就保持高电平。

If this is turned off, what’s the output voltage? It’s the supply. The supply directly shows up here. And so as long as the input is 0 the output is at 5 volts. And this is true until the input reaches 1 volt. As long as the input is less than 1 volt my output stays high.

然后，当我的输入超过或达到 1 伏时，开关打开，MOSFET 打开并将输出短路到地，在这种情况下，这就是我得到的。然后，无论我将输入增加多少，我的开关都会保持打开状态，输出在输出端跟随零伏。所以这是我的逆变器的输入电压与输出电压的关系曲线。

And then when my input exceeds or hits 1 volt then at that point the switch turns on and the MOSFET turns on and shorts the output to ground in which case boom, this is what I get. And then, no matter how much I increase the input, my switch stays on and the output follows a zero volts at the output. So this is my v in versus v out curve for the inverter.

我们经常做的一件有趣的事情就是看看这是否满足某个电压阈值。假设我的 VOL 为 0.5 伏，VOH 为 4.5，VIL 为 0.9，VIH 为 4.1 伏。那么 VOL 的低值表示输出是否小于 0.5？是的，输出小于 0.5。高值表示输出是否大于 4.5？

One of the interesting things that we do a lot is see whether this satisfies some voltage threshold. So let’s say I have a VOL of 0.5 volts, VOH of 4.5, VIL of 0.9 and VIH of 4.1 volts. So VOL says in its low value is the output less than 0.5? Yup, output less than 0.5. In its high is it more than 4.5?

是的，它大于 4.5。它是否将所有低于 VIL 的值视为低输入？是的。因此，任何低于 0.9 或 1 的值都被视为低。这很好。所以这些都通过了。而高，任何高于 4.1 的值，都被视为高吗？是的。因此，任何高于 4.1 的值都被视为高，输出变为低。

Yup, it’s more than 4.5. Does it recognize all values below VIL as a low input? Yup. So anything below 0.9 or 1 for that matter is viewed as a low. That’s good. So these pass. And high, anything above 4.1, is that treated as a high? Yes. So anything above 4.1 is treated as a high and the output goes low.

因此，我在这里为你们设计的这个反相器满足静态原则，并且这个反相器可用于符合此值的电路或其他设备。在复习中，你们将看到一个稍微详细一些的开关模型，其中开关的行为类似于电阻器。

So therefore this inverter that I’ve designed for you here satisfies the static discipline and this inverter can be used in circuits or other devices that conform to this value here. In your recitation, you will look at a slightly more detailed model of the switch where the switch behaves like a resistor.

Lec 6 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 44:51 https://youtube.com/watch?v=OGtElTMJidE

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 44:51 https://youtube.com/watch?v=OGtElTMJidE

在本讲座结束时我会再试一次，希望下次您能向大家展示这些内容。今天我们将从非线性分析开始。在此之前，我想先做一点回顾。我想让大家了解过去三周的情况，并向大家展示所有这些内容是如何融入到宏伟计划中的。

Will try it again at the end of this lecture and you show you that stuff hopefully next time. For today we are going to start with nonlinear analysis. Before we do that I wanted to do a little bit of review. I wanted to give you the past three weeks in perspective and show you how all of these things fit into the grand scheme of things.

我们首先构建了一个很棒的小操场，在这个操场中，我们说通过强制执行集中物质规则，我们创建了集中电路抽象。因此，在这个操场中，我们假设 dq 乘以 dt 和 d phi 乘以 dt 为 0，这样就得到了集中电路抽象。

We began by building a great little playground, and within that playground we said that by enforcing upon ourselves the lumped matter discipline we created the lumped circuit abstraction. So within that playfield we assumed that we had dq by dt and d phi by dt to be 0 so that gave us as the lumped circuit abstraction.

在集中电路抽象中，我们在这个操场上研究了几种分析电路的方法，包括 KVL、KCL 方法。我们还学习了涉及组合电阻、分压器等的方法，以及直观地解决电路的方法。我们还研究了节点方法，这是电路行业的主力。因此，当您有疑问时，请应用节点方法，它将带您到达您想要去的地方。

And within that lumped circuit abstraction, within this playground we looked at several methods of analyzing circuits, including the KVL, KCL method. We also learned the method involving composing resistors, the voltage dividers and so on and solving circuits intuitively. And we also looked at the node method, which is kind of the workhorse of the circuits industry. So when in doubt apply the node method and it will get you where you want to go.

现在，我们还说这很好，这里就是我们的游乐场。我们说，嘿，如果我们专注于那些线性电路，我们就会来到游乐场的左侧部分。我们说，对于游乐场这一部分的线性电路，我们可以进一步使用一些技术，一些技术，叠加、戴维南、诺顿等等。

Now, we also said that this is good, here is our playground. We said hey, if we focus on those circuits that are linear we come to the left part of our playground. And we said that for linear circuits in this part of the playground we can further use a couple of techniques, a few techniques, superposition, Thevenin, Norton and so on.

因此，这些技术可以让你非常快速地分析复杂的电路，特别是当你想找到单个电流、电压或一些感兴趣的参数时。如果你看到一个包含多个电压源或两个或多个电压源或电流源的电路，第一步就是想想叠加。所以这些是非常强大的技术，可以让你非常有效地分析非常复杂的电路。

So these techniques allow you to very quickly analyze complicated circuits, especially when you’re looking to find a single current, or voltage or some parameter of interest. Whenever you see, if you see a circuit containing multiple voltage sources or two or more voltage sources or current sources, as a first step think superposition. And so these are very powerful techniques that let you analyze very complicated circuits very effectively.

做完这些之后，我们说，哦，让我在这里画另一个游乐场。这是我们游乐场的另一部分。如果这些是线性电路，那么游乐场的这一半就是非线性电路。我们说，如果你进一步关注离散值，如果你将值离散化，只关注处理二进制信号、高低点的电路，那么我们就进入了游乐场的这个小区域。

After we did this we said, oh, let me draw another playground here. This is another piece of our playground. And if these are linear circuit then this half of the playground is nonlinear circuits. And we said that if you further focus on discretized values, if you discretized values and focused only on circuits that dealt with binary signals, highs and lows, then we came into this small regime of the playground.

请注意，数字电路本质上是非线性的。还记得电路 A、B 吗？这是我们的 NOR 门电路之一。如果您查看传递函数，那就是如果我绘制一些输入值组合的图。假设我绘制了 v 输入与 v 输出的关系图。

And notice that digital circuits are, by their very nature, nonlinear. Remember the circuit, A, B, this was one of our NOR gate circuits? And if you look at transfer functions, that is if I plot, let’s say for example, for some combination of input values. Let’s say I plot v in verses v out.

举例来说，我通过将 B 设置为 0 来关闭这个家伙，然后我只需在 v in 处应用从低到高的转换，那么我在输出处会看到以下传递函数，其中 v in 改变输出在某个点切换然后保持在低值。

Let’s say, for example, I turned this guy off by setting B to 0 and then I simply apply a low to high transition at v in, then what I would see at the output is a transfer function of the following sort where as v in changes the output switches at some point and then stays at a low value.

因此，当 v in 为低时，v out 为高，而 v in 为高时，v out 为低。因此，当 B 设置为 0 时，这就是 v out 与 v in 的关系。因此请注意，这是一条非线性曲线。这不是直线。这是一条非线性曲线。因此，在数字域中，我们会看到高度非线性的函数，如下所示。但是，请看一下这个电路。

So when v in is low v out is high and v in and high v out is low. So that’s kind of the v out versus v in when B is set at 0. So notice that this is a nonlinear curve. This is not a straight line. It’s a nonlinear curve. And so therefore in the digital domain we see highly nonlinear functions that look like this and so on. However, take a look at this circuit.

假设我专注于给定一组开关设置的电路。例如，假设我专注于 A 和 B 均为 1 时的电路。对于给定的一组开关设置，请注意，我将处于此区域或此区域。请注意，此区域是一条直线。因此，如果我同时关注 A 和 B，那么我会得到类似这样的结果。

Suppose I focus on the circuit for a given set of switch settings. Let’s say, for example, I focus on the circuit when A and B are both 1s. For a given set of switch settings, notice that I’m going to be either in this region or in this region. Notice that this region is a straight line. So if I focus on let’s say both A and B at once then I get something like this.

在这种情况下，对于给定的一组开关设置，请注意，我的数字电路现在可以使用线性技术进行分析。因此，对于给定的一组开关设置，我的数字电路被移到线性域中。因此，如果我修复开关设置并查看电路，那么对于给定的一组开关设置，每个电路都由电压源和一些电阻器组成，这是一个线性电路。

And in this situation, for a given set of switch settings, notice that my digital circuit now can be analyzed using linear techniques. So therefore my digital gets moved into the linear domain for a given set of switch settings. So if I fix my switch settings and look at the circuit then each circuit, for a given set of switch settings, is comprised of voltage sources and some resistors and it’s a linear circuit.

再次，我可以回过头来将所有线性技术应用于您将在 6.002 中处理的几乎所有数字电路。再次记住，如果我修复了开关设置，如果我修复了输入，那么可以使用线性技术确定输出。因为我们在 6.002 中向您展示的数字电路仅包含电压源和电阻器等线性元件。您稍后会看到更多。

Again, I can go back and apply all my linear techniques to virtually all the digital circuits that you will be dealing with in 6.002. Again, remember if I fix my switch settings, if I fix the inputs then the output can be determined using linear techniques. Because the digital circuits we’re showing you in 6.002 simply comprise linear elements like voltage sources and resistors and so on. You’ll see some more later.

但是你可以应用线性技术并进行分析。这里很酷的一点是，只需两周时间学习 6.002 课程中学到的知识，你就能分析给定一组开关设置的特定类别的数字电路以及许多线性电路。我们今天要重点关注的是非线性电路。所以我们来看看这个领域。

But you can apply your linear techniques and analyze them. The cool thing here is that with just two weeks of stuff that you’ve learned in 6.002, you are well on our way to being able to analyze certain classes of digital circuits for a given set of switch settings and many, many, many linear circuits. What we will do today is focus on nonlinear circuits. So we look at this space.

请再次注意，到目前为止，我们已经处理了这三种方法，它们适用于这个集总电路领域中的所有电路。它的子集是线性域。我们可以用这种方式分析线性电路。对于给定的一组开关设置，数字电路也属于这一类别。因此请注意，您可以继续使用叠加或其他类似技术来分析数字电路。

Notice again that up until now we’ve dealt with these three methods, which apply to all circuits within this playground, the lumped circuit playground. And the subset of that is the linear domain. And we can analyze linear circuits in this way. And digital circuits, for a given set of switch settings, also fall within this category. So notice that you can go ahead and analyze the digital circuits using superposition or other techniques like that.

我们下一步要做的事情就是开始分析非线性电路。需要记住的是，非线性电路也属于这个大领域，我们将在这个领域中研究集总物质。因此，非线性电路也是集总电路。因此，因为我们处于这个领域，所以我们可以使用我们的任何一种技术，KVL、KCL 或节点法来分析非线性电路。

The next big step for us is to begin our analysis of nonlinear circuits today. The important thing to remember is that nonlinear circuits are also within this big playground in which we are going under the lumped matter discipline. So nonlinear circuits are also lumped circuits. And therefore because we are in that playground we can use any one of our techniques, KVL, KCL or the node method to analyze nonlinear circuits.

所以如果你看到一个非线性电路，不要害怕。只要记住这很简单。所以让我简单地写下节点方程并分析它。今天的讲座实际上没有什么新内容。我只是要向你们展示一个非线性电路，并使用你们已经知道的技术进行分析。今天是非线性电路。我们来看看分析非线性电路的几种方法。我们来看看“分析方法”。

So if you see a nonlinear circuit, don’t get daunted. Just remember this is meant to be simple stuff. So let me simply write down the node equation and analyze it. There is really nothing new in today’s lecture. I’m just going to show you a nonlinear circuit and analyzing using techniques that you already know. Today nonlinear circuits. And we look at several methods of analyzing nonlinear circuits. We look at the “Analytic Method”.

我们来看看“图解法”。您将在书中看到“分段线性法”。我不会在讲座中介绍这一点。您可以阅读第 4.4 节中的分段线性法。在这种方法中，您可以获取曲线，并使用一堆直线段对其进行近似，有点像我在那里向您展示的 v out、v in 曲线，并使用任何给定直线段内的线性技术分析电路。

We look at a “Graphical Method”. You will look at a “Piecewise Linear Method” in the book. I won’t be covering this in lecture. You can read Section 4.4 for the piecewise linear method. In this method you take your curves and you approximate them with a bunch of straight line segments, kind of like the v out, v in curve I’ve shown you there, and analyze the circuit using linear techniques within any given straight line segment.

我们还将进行增量分析。这也称为小信号分析。今天我将介绍这两个，我将在今天介绍这个，并在下一节课中总结。让我们从一个简单的例子开始。所以我有一些电压，V，一些电压源 V。我有一些电阻器，R。我这里有一个虚构的设备，我将其标记为 D。我们将这个虚构的设备称为“Expo Dweeb”。

We will also do incremental analysis. This is also called small signal analysis. So I will cover these two today, I will introduce this one today, and wrap that up during the next lecture. Let’s start with a simple example. So I have some voltage, V, some voltage source V. And I have some resistor, R. And I have a fictitious device here that I labeled D. Let’s call this fictitious device the “Expo Dweeb”.

我特意选择了一个时髦的名字，因为这是一个虚构的设备。我们把它称为 Expo Dweeb。让我写下这个设备的相关变量，如下所示。iD 是流入此端子的电流，vD 是跨此设备的电压。所以这是一个非线性设备。该设备的特征如下式所示。

I purposely chose a funky name because this is a fictitious device. Let’s call it the Expo Dweeb. And let me write down the associated variables for this device as follows. iD is the current flowing into this terminal and vD is the voltage across this device. So this is a nonlinear device. And this device is characterized by the following equation.

就像电阻器的特征是 iV 关系一样，V 等于 iR，或者 I 等于 V/R。该设备还具有以下元素关系。它是 ae 升到 bvD。所以这里有一个指数。再说一次，这是一个虚构的设备。我将在一秒钟内展示它的一些有趣的事情。这是一个非常简单的关系。

Much like resistors were characterized by an iV relation, V is equal to iR, or I is equal to V/R. This device is also characterized by the following element relationship. It’s a e raised to bvD. So there is an exponentiation here. Again, this is a fictitious device. And I’ll show some funky things that it does in a second. It’s a very simple relation.

这是一个指数关系，其中电流与元件两端电压 vD 的指数值有关。因此，我可以绘制此元件的 iD 与 vD 的关系，如下所示。请注意，当 vD 为 0 时，iD 为 a，因此我这里有一个，它看起来像这样。这是一个有趣的设备，一个虚构的设备。

It’s an exponential relation where the current relates to the exponentiated value of the voltage vD across the element. So I can plot iD versus vD for this element as follows. Notice that when vD is 0 iD is a, so I have a here, and it looks like this. It’s a funny device, a fictitious device.

因此，当 vD 为 0 时，设备中会有一些电流流过，而随着 vD 的增加，流过该设备的电流会呈指数增加。这个设备很有趣，因为它不是无源设备，请注意，当 vD 和 iD 为正时，乘积为正，这很好，说明它正在消耗功率。

So when vD is 0, I have some current flowing the device, and as vD increases I get an exponential increase in the current through that device. This device is funny in the sense that it is not a passive device in that notice that when vD and iD are positive the product is positive, which is fine, which says that it is consuming power.

另一方面，请注意左侧的 vI 关系为负，这意味着当我在其上施加负电压时，它仍然可以维持正电流。这一定意味着该设备正在产生电力。但出于非线性分析的目的，我们不必担心这一点。让我们用数学方法做一下，看看它是什么样子。所以再回到这个问题。

On the other hand, on the left hand side notice that the vI relation is negative, which means that when I put a negative voltage on it, it can still sustain a positive current. This must imply that the device is producing power. But for the purpose of a nonlinear analysis we don’t have to worry about that. Let’s just do it mathematically and find out what it looks like. So back to this again.

我有一个电压源、一个电阻器和我的 Expo Dweeb，它们以这种方式连接在一起。现在，再次思考一下这个模式。一个电压源或电流源、一个电阻器和一些设备。这是一个非常标准的模式，你会一次又一次地看到它。特别是，如果你看一下这个设备，你会发现它是一个非线性设备。面对非线性设备的是与电阻器串联的电压源。

I have a voltage source, a resistor and my Expo Dweeb connected in that manner. Now, again, reflect on this pattern. A voltage source or a current source, a resistor and some device. This is a very standard pattern you will see again and again and again. In particular, if you look at this device, it’s a nonlinear device here. And facing the nonlinear device is a voltage source in series with a resistor.

我之所以说这是一对非常重要的配对，原因如下。请注意，如果左侧有任何线性电路，并且该电路中有一个非线性元件。请注意，通过您学到的戴维南简化，您可以解决这一混乱局面。

And the reason I say that this is an incredibly important pairing is the following. Notice that if on the left hand side I had any linear circuit and I had a single nonlinear element in that circuit. Notice that by a Thevenin reduction that you’ve learned you can take this entire mess.

如果您只关心非线性设备的行为，那么为了分析这种非线性设备，您可以采用整个线性电路，无论它有多复杂，电压源、电流源、电阻器和一堆其他古怪的东西，您都可以将所有这些归结为戴维南等效电路，即串联的电压和电阻器。这样我们就可以欺骗您了。

If all you care about is the behavior of the nonlinear device, for the purpose of analyzing this nonlinear device, you can take this entire linear circuit, no matter how complicated it is, voltage sources, current sources, resistors and a bunch of other funky stuff, you can boil all of that down to a Thevenin equivalent, a voltage and a resistor in series. So we can trick you.

我们可以给你一个复杂的电路，然后说，啊哈，告诉我如果我施加一些电压，比如 3 伏，通过这个设备的电流是多少。你可以说，啊哈，我不关心这里发生了什么，所以我要用戴维南等效电路来代替整个电路。现在你已经完成了作业，你可以计算电路的戴维南等效电路了。

We can give you a complicated circuit and say ah ha, tell me what the current is through this device if I apply some voltage, 3 volts there. What you can do is you can say ah ha, I don’t care what happens here so I’m just going to replace the whole thing with a Thevenin equivalent. And you’ve done your homework now and you can calculate Thevenin equivalents for circuits.

只需替换它，然后继续解决电路问题。再次提醒，记住我们是工程师。我们正在寻找答案。我们正在寻找构建有趣的系统。而且，一般来说，我们喜欢采取最简单的方法来解决问题。所以简化你的生活，创建一个与非线性设备耦合的简单戴维南，然后你就可以顺利前进了。

And simply replace this and then go ahead and solve the circuit. Again, remember we are engineers. We are looking for answers. We are looking to build interesting systems. And, in general, we like to take the simplest path possible to the solution. So simplify your lives and create a simple Thevenin coupled to a nonlinear device and then you will be rolling.

当我们在本课程的其余部分讨论各种其他电路、非线性电路、时变电路等时，我们会一次又一次地看这个模式，直到我们脸色发青。

When we talk about a variety of other circuits, nonlinear circuits, time varying circuits and so on in the rest of this course, we will look at this pattern again and again and again and again until we are blue in the face.

而且，请记住，我们不断研究这种模式的原因是，每当您将一些大的线性混乱连接到某个有趣的设备时，您可以做的是，如果您所关心的只是分析该设备的行为，那么您可以将这种线性混乱简单地找出戴维南等效项，或者如果您愿意的话，可以找出诺顿等效项，然后将整个东西替换为其等效项，然后继续进行分析。

And, just remember, the reason we keep looking at this pattern is that whenever you have some big linear mess connected to some interesting device what you can do is if all you care about is analyzing the behavior of that device, you can take this linear mess and simply figure out the Thevenin equivalent, or the Norton equivalent if you like and replace this whole thing with its equivalent and then go ahead and analyze it.

因此，将任意电路归结为这种非常简单的模式。这意味着，由于这种出色的戴维南简化，在本课程的其余部分中，我们将主要处理像这样的非常简单的电路，电压源、电阻器和设备。就是这样。你很少、很少、很少会在电路中看到多个电源和大量电阻器。它通常都是简单的东西。

So boil an arbitrarily circuit down to a very simple pattern of this sort. What this means is because of this brilliant Thevenin simplification, going forward through the rest of this course we will mostly deal with very simple circuits like this, voltage source, resistor and the device. That’s it. Very, very, very rarely will you see multiple sources and lots of resistors in a circuit. It’s usually going to be simple stuff.

回想一下我们是如何走到这一步的，通过对线性混乱进行戴维南简化。好吧。如果在家庭作业、测验或现实生活中，或者在现实生活中的许多例子中，如果你发现你必须处理很多垃圾和很多混乱，请退后一步，稍微思考一下。试着使用直觉，看看你是否可以使用一些巧妙的技巧或方法来简化事情。分析方法 1。

And remember how we got here, by making a Thevenin simplification of a linear mess. All right. If in homeworks or quizzes or in real life, or in many examples of real life, if you find that you have to deal with a lot of grunge and a lot of mess, step back and think a little bit. Try to use intuition and see if you can simplify things using some clever trick or method. Method 1 of analysis.

让我们继续分析这个模式，这个模板电路，如果你愿意的话，是一个电压源、一个电阻和一个非线性器件。这是分析方法。记住，节点方法适用，所以让我继续应用节点方法。要应用节点方法，我该怎么做？我首先必须选择一个接地节点。让我将其隔离为接地节点。让我用它们的电压标记所有节点。

Let’s go ahead and analyze this pattern here, this template circuit, if you will, a voltage source a resistor and a nonlinear device. This is the analytical method. And remember the node method applies, so let me go ahead and apply the node method. To apply the node method, what do I do? I first have to select a ground node. Let me insulate this as my ground node. Let me label all the nodes with their voltages.

因此，此节点的电压为 V，并且此节点的标签为大写 D。因此，让我继续使用节点法进行分析。因此，节点法表示，对于电路中电压未知的每个节点，继续记下 KCL，隐式应用元素关系将电流值替换为电压值。让我们从沿该方向流动的电流开始。

So this node has voltage V and this node has label the capital D. So let me go ahead and analyze this using the node method. So the node method says for each of the nodes in the circuit whose voltage is not known go ahead and write down KCL implicitly applying the element relationships to replace the current values with the voltage values. Let’s start with the current going in that direction.

电流从 vD 节点流过电阻 R，如下所示，vD V 除以 R。这就是流向那个方向的电流。流向下方的电流是 iD。一般来说，当我应用节点方法时，我不会在这里写 iD，而是继续在这里写元素关系 ae 与 bvD。然后我得到一个 vD 方程，然后我只需求解模式电压。

Current going from the vD node through resistor R, which looks as follows, vD V divided by R. That’s a current going that way. And the current going down is iD. In general, when I apply the node method, I don’t write iD here but I go ahead and write the element relation ae to the bvD here. Then I get an equation in vD and I just solve the mode voltage.

但是，为了稍后再补充几点，让我分两步来做，写下这个，然后继续将 iD 单独记为 ae 到 bvD。再次提醒，不要混淆。在节点方法中，我没有写下第二步。我直接将 ae 写到 bvD 代替 iD。我得到一个 vD 方程，然后去解它。

However, just to make a couple of extra points later, let me go ahead and do that in two steps, write down this and then go ahead and write down iD separately as ae to the bvD. Again, remember, don’t get confused here. In a node method, I don’t write down a second step. I directly write down ae to bvD in place of iD. I get one equation in vD, I go solve it.

今天只是为了好玩，我在这里采取了两个步骤，写下 iD 并明确将 iD 作为 ae 放到 bvD 中。现在，就是这样。我的意思是这就是全部了。你们现在可以继续分析非线性电路了。你会得到一堆方程式，一堆未知数，去解。我这里有两个方程式。vD 和 iD 是我的未知数，我可以继续解它们。

Just for fun today, I’m taking two steps here, writing iD and explicitly putting down iD as ae to the bvD. Now, that’s it. I mean this is all there is to it. You guys can now go ahead and analyze nonlinear circuits. You get a bunch of equations, a bunch of unknowns, go solve. I have two equations here. vD and iD are my unknowns and I can just go ahead and solve for them.

现在，一般来说，对于非线性电路，通常很难得到闭式解，因此你可能不得不使用一堆方法。你可以尝试闭式解，也可以尝试数值解，或者你可以反复试验。在这种情况下，我会直接告诉你。

Now, in general with nonlinear circuits, often times it’s hard to get a closed form solution so you may have to use a bunch of methods. You can try a closed form solution or you can try numerical solutions or you can do trial and error. In this case, I’ll just go ahead and tell you.

假设我选择 V 为 1 伏，R 为 1 欧姆，b 为 1/伏，a 为 º 安培，对于这些值，vD 大约为 0.5 伏，iD 大约为 0.4 伏。您可以使用反复试验或其他方法来实现这一点。在 6.002 中，我们不会花太多精力去解决这类方程式。

Suppose I choose V as 1 volt, R is 1 ohm and b is 1 over volt and a is º amps for those values, approximately vD is roughly 0.5 volts and iD is roughly 0.4 volts. You can do this by using trial and error or other methods. In 6.002 we don’t dwell on working too hard to solve equations of this sort.

如果您无法在此处代入并直接求解，我们不会要求您去学习数值方法和技术等来求解。但请记住，您可以使用反复试验，也可以使用反向代入和其他技术，这些技术将在未来的数值方法课程中学习并应用于此处。

If you cannot substitute this in here and solve it directly, we don’t ask you to go and learn numerical method and the techniques and so on to solve it. But just remember that you can use trial and error or you can use back substitution and other techniques that you will learn in future numerical methods classes and apply it here.

但可以这么说，如果您愿意，我们可以继续反复试验。对于这些值，vD 和 iD 分别为 0.5 和大约 0.4。您已经完成了。真的就这么简单。是的。哦，对不起。很好。我知道这里有一个人没有睡觉。很好。所以，正如我所说，这没什么大不了的。

But suffice it to say that, for here we can stick with trial and error if you like. And for these values, vD and iD are 0.5 and approximately 0.4. You’re done. It’s really that simple. Yes. Oh, I’m sorry. Good catch. I know there is one person that’s not sleeping here. Good. So, as I said, there’s not a whole lot to it.

不管是非线性电路还是线性电路，只要我在这个集总电路抽象成立的操场里，我就可以应用我的节点方程，然后继续解决它。让我向你们展示更多的方法，这样我们就可以阐明你们用于非线性电路的工具库。我想向你们展示一种图形技术。我个人很少使用图形技术来解决电路问题。

Whether it’s a nonlinear circuit or a linear circuit and as long as I am inside this playground here where the lumped circuit abstraction holds, I can apply my node equations and then go ahead and solve it. Let me show you a few more methods so we can articulate your repertoire of tools for nonlinear circuits. And I’d like to show you a graphical technique. I personally rarely use a graphical technique to solve circuits.

我为什么要和你们分享这个？事实证明，通过图形化查看事物，你往往可以更好地了解电路行为。当你展示响应图时，你还可以展示很酷的演示，就像互相玩耍一样。所以这对于获得直觉和诸如此类的东西很有趣。从图形上讲，我真正要做的就是用图形解这两个方程。

And why am I sharing this with you? It turns out that often times by looking at things graphically you can get some better insights into circuit behavior. You can also show cool demos when you show graphs of responses kind of playing with each other and so on. So this is fun for getting intuition and things like that. Graphically all I’m really going to do is solve those two equations graphically.

我要绘制方程式一。让我将方程式一重写如下。iD 是 我只是将方程式一重写如下。V/R vD/R。我还可以绘制第二个人 好的，我也可以这样做。我可以绘制 iD 与 vD 的图。在这种特殊情况下，您已经看到了，这就是我的 iD 与 vD 曲线。我可以对这里的这个做同样的事情。

So I’m going to plot equation one. Let me rewrite equation one as follows. iD is I’m just rewriting equation one as follows. V/R vD/R. And I can also draw the second guy OK, I can do this as well. I can do an iD versus vD plot. And in this particular situation, you’ve seen this already, that’s my iD versus vD curve right there. And I can do the same for this one here.

因此，这个方程建立了以下直线关系。它表示当 vD 为 0 时，iD 为 V/R。这就是这里。同样，当 iD 为 0 时，vD 等于 V，所以我在这里得到了一些东西。这就是我与此处方程相对应的直线关系。

So this equation establishes the following straight line relationship. It says that when vD is 0, iD is V/R. So that’s here. And similarly when iD is 0 then vD is equal to V so I get something here. So that’s my straight line relationship corresponding to this equation here.

因此，我能做的就是通过将两条曲线叠加在相同的 vD、iD 模板上并找到曲线的交点来简单地解决这些问题。因此，我可以取对应于 2 的这条曲线，也可以取对应于 1 的这条曲线，这是 V/R，这是 V, 0，然后我可以找到交点。

So what I can do is I can simply solve these by superimposing the two curves on the same vD, iD template here and finding the intersection of the curves. So I can take this curve corresponding to two and I can take this curve corresponding to one, and this is V/R and this is V, 0, and I can find the intersection point.

这条曲线被称为负载线，原因大概在三周后就会显现出来。它被称为负载线。在后面的讲座中，你会明白为什么会这样。所以我在第 6 页给你提供了一个模板，将这两个归结为一个方程。

This curve here, for reasons that will be obvious about three weeks from now, is called the load line. It’s called the load line. You will understand why that is so in a later lecture. So I’ve given you a template on Page 6 to boil these two down into one equation.

因此，您可以再次代入 V 为 1 伏、R 为 1 等值，并得到与之前相同的结果。所以这里真的没有什么新东西。我在第二种方法中所做的只是将两个方程以图形方式组合起来，并通过查看两条曲线的相交位置来找到解决方案。

So there, again, you can substitute the values for V is 1 volt and R is 1 and so on and so forth and get the same kind of result as you did previously. So there is really nothing new here. All I’ve done in the second method is combined the two equations graphically and found the solution by looking at where the two curves intersect.

在讲座开始时，我还告诉过你，你可能想去看看课程笔记第 4.4 节中的分段线性技术。好的。今天，我来介绍第三种方法，称为“增量分析”。这种技术也称为小信号方法。

At the start of the lecture I also told you that you may want to go and check out the piecewise linear technique in Section 4.4 of the course notes. All right. For today let me do a third method called “Incremental Analysis”. This technique is also called the small signal method.

在介绍方法之前，在今天的讲座中，我将向你们展示一个激励性的例子，说明为什么我们需要小信号方法。我将给出一个激励性的例子，并向你们展示一个小演示。

I’m going to show you, before I go into the method, in today’s lecture what I’ll do is I’ll give you a motivating example for why we need the small signal approach. I’ll give you a motivating example and show you a little demo.

然后，我将以向你们展示一个应用标准方法的问题作为结束，我会要求你们看看是否能在下一堂课之前找到一种方法来处理这个问题。所以，让我在这里给你们提供动机。这就是我想要做的。你们中的许多人都见过那种电眼车库门开启器，对吧？

And then I will close with showing you a problem with applying a standard approach, and I’ll ask you to see if you can figure out a way to handle it in time for next lecture. So let me give you the motivation here. So here is what I want to do. Many of you have seen one of those electric eye garage door openers, right?

一端有一个接收器，另一端有某种光束，当你走过时，它会停止，或者更确切地说，它会切断电路，阻止门关闭。当没有人通过时，它会保持连接并让门关闭。

You have a receiver at one end and you have some kind of a light beam at the other, and when you walk through it stops, or rather it cuts the circuit and stops the door from closing. And when no one is going through it maintains a connection and lets the door close.

所以我们去了家得宝 (Home Depot) 或类似的商店，买了一个非常标准的设备，当光线照射到它上面时，它基本上会产生一些反应。我的目标是看看我是否能用一个简单的车库门开启器通过光束发送音乐。下面是我要制作的小电路。我们真的去了那里并建造了这个。我还会向你们展示一个演示。

So what we did is we went to Home Depot, or one of those stores, and bought a very standard device that essentially produces some response when light impinges on it. And my goal will be to see if I can send music over the light beam using a simple garage door opener device. So here is the little circuit that I will do. We actually went there and built this. I will also show you a demo.

这是随时间变化的电压 vI(t)，这是一些音乐信号。然后获取一些音乐信号。我想将其连接到这个设备，这是车库门开启器中的设备。我将其称为 LED。如果您愿意，可以将其视为，这与我们的 Expo Dweeb 非常相似。这被称为“发光 Expo Dweeb”。这就是它为什么是 LED 的原因。

Here is my time varying voltage, vI(t), and this is some music signal. And get some music signal. And I want to connect this to this device, which is a device found in garage door openers. I am going to call it a LED. If you like, you can view it as, this is very similar to our Expo Dweeb. This is called a “Light Emitting Expo Dweeb”. That’s why it is LED.

LED 的作用是，当我在 LED 上施加电压时，相同的电压会出现在发光 Expo Dweeb 上。并且有一些电流流过该设备。为了进行分析，我们将假设该设备实际上具有与 Expo Dweeb 相同的 iD 特性，只是它会发光。因此，当我让电流通过它时，它会发光。

So what the LED does is, as I apply this voltage across it, that same voltage appears across the Light Emitting Expo Dweeb. And there is some current that flows through the device. And for our analysis we will assume that this device virtually has an identical iD characteristic to the Expo Dweeb just that it emits light. So when I pass a current through it, it emits light.

光强度与流过的电流成正比。所以它会发光，光强度 LD 与 iD 成正比。这是我的小发光装置，当电流流过时，它会发光，因为光强度与电流成正比。我要做的是将接收器粘在这里。

And the light intensity is proportional to the current that flows through. So it emits light and light intensity, LD, is proportional to iD. Here is my little light emitting device, which when current flows through it, itproduces light because its intensity is proportional to the current. And what I will do is I will stick in the receiver here.

把它想象成一个光敏电阻或其他设备，我要把它连接到电路中。我不会在这边花太多时间。我将重点介绍左侧。假设我有某种放大器和扬声器等等。

Think of it as a photo resistor or some other device where I am going to connect that in a circuit. I am not going to spend too much time on this side. I’m going to focus on the left hand side here. And let’s say I have some kind of amplifier and speakers and so on and so forth.

可以这样说，当光照射到这个设备 PR 上时，通过这里的 iR 与接收到的光强度成正比。因此，如果电流与接收到的光强度成正比，那么我就会在放大器中放大该信号，然后就可以在这里播放音乐。请注意，以下依赖关系链适用。所以我有一个输入音乐信号 VI。它会被转换为某个 iD。

Suffice it to say that when the light falls on this device PR that iR that goes through here is proportional to the received light intensity. So if the current is proportional to the received light intensity then I amplify that signal in my amplifier and I get the music playing out here. And notice that the following chain of dependences apply. So I have an input music signal VI. That gets converted to some iD.

这些都是随时间变化的信号，因此 VI 是随时间变化的信号，iD 也是。iD 被转换为一定强度 LD 的光。这反过来又会有所衰减，并被光敏电阻接收。然后我会得到一定强度 LR 的光，它会撞击该设备。这反过来会产生电流 iR，然后 iR 被放大并通过扬声器等产生声音。

These are all time varying signals, so VI is a time varying signal and so is iD. And iD gets converted to light of some intensity LD. This in turn gets attenuated somewhat and is received at the photo resistor. And I get some intensity LR impinging on that device there. And that in turn produces a current iR and then iR is amplified and goes through a speaker and so on and produces sound.

请注意，我使用这个链在这里接收音乐信号，然后在这里播放。想象一下，这是您的车库门开启器，其中发出的光由电压信号 VI 表达。并在这里接收。所以请注意，如果我切断它，如果我在这里粘一些东西并挡住它，那么我在这里得不到任何反应，但如果我把手拿开，那么我会得到一些反应。

Notice that using this chain I’ve taken a music signal here and I am playing it here. And just imagine that this is your garage door opener device here where the light emitted is being articulated by the voltage signal VI. And received here. So notice that if I cut this, if I stick something in here and block it then I get no response here, but if I take my hand away then I do get some response.

但这没问题。这应该可行。如果你愿意，你可以在家里试试。如果你有车库门开启器，只需插入一个像这样的小电路，它应该就能正常工作。但我们有一个问题。问题是，正如我所说，我在这里使用的是 Expo Dweeb，发光的 Expo Dweeb，它的特性如下。iD 与电压 vD 呈指数相关，因此这是非线性的。

But this is fine. This should work. You could try this at home if you’d like. If you have a garage door opener, just stick a little circuit like this and it should simply work. We have a problem, though. The problem is that, as I said, I’m using the Expo Dweeb here, the light emitting Expo Dweeb, and its characteristics are as follows. iD is exponentially related to the voltage vD, so this is nonlinear.
