这才是真正的问题。因为这是非线性的，所以我会得到失真的输出。让我给你展示一个小波形，一个小图表来展示失真是如何发生的，然后给你展示一个小演示来展示失真。让我用图形向你展示这里发生的失真类型，我将通过绘制下图来做到这一点。这是我们设备的 vD、iD 曲线。

And that’s a real problem. Because this is nonlinear, I am going to get a distorted output. Let me show you a little wave form, a little graph to show you how the distortion happens and then show you a little demo showing you the distortion. Let me graphically show you the kind of distortion that is happening here, and I will do it by drawing the following graph. So this is the vD, iD curve for our device.

我要为您绘制的是，如果我有一个随时间变化的 vD 电压，我只想看看随时间变化的 iD 电流是什么样子。绘制它的一个技巧是像这样获取输入电压。假设我应用了一个正弦波。所以我只是取一个随时间变化的正弦电压并将图旋转 90 度，这样我就可以看到这些点在曲线上的对应位置。

And what I’m going to plot for you is if I have a time varying vD voltage, I just want to see what the time varying iD current looks like. And a trick to plot that is to take your input voltage like so. And let’s say I apply a sinusoid. So I am just taking a time varying sinusoidal voltage and rotating the plot 90 degrees like so, so I can see where these points correspond to on that curve.

所以这说明，在某个时刻，例如，vI 在此处，此时此刻，vI 在此处。请注意，vI 和 vD 是同一个东西，因为 vI 施加在 vD 上。vI 直接施加在设备上，因此 vI 始终等于 vD。因此，此处的电压对应于该电压，对应于该电流，然后我可以找出该电压对应的电流。

So what this says is that at some point here, for example, where vI, at this point and time, vI is here. Notice vI and vD are the same thing because vI is applied across vD. vI directly applies across the device, and so vI equals vD at all time. So this voltage here corresponds to this voltage, it corresponds to this current and then I can find out what the current is for that voltage.

通过使用相同的技巧，我可以像这样绘制输出电流 iD。因此，对于这个值，我在这里得到一些电流。因此，在时间 T0，我从这里开始。请注意，随着这个信号在这里向上移动，我可以通过查看直线在这里相交的位置并在这里绘制值来找出 iD 的相应值。我有一个漂亮的小图形动画来向您展示这一点。

By using the same artifice I can plot the output current iD like so. So for this value I get some current here. And so at time T0 I start here. And notice that as this signal moves up here, I can find out the corresponding values of iD by looking at where a straight line intersects here and plotting the values here. I have a nice little graphical animation to show you this.

希望明天笔记本电脑能正常工作，我们可以检查一下。我在这里没有做任何新事情。只是向您展示一个技巧，可以基于某种传递函数绘制 vI 与 v out 的关系，或 vI 或与其他关系。所以您最终得到的是这样的。为什么会这样？请注意，这里的曲线对应于信号。

Hopefully, the laptop will work tomorrow and we can check that. I am doing nothing new here. Just showing you a trick to be able to plot vI versus v out relationships, or vI or versus other relationships based on some kind of a transfer function. So what you end up getting is something that looks like this. Why is that? Notice that this curve here corresponds to the signal.

当这个信号从这里移动到这儿时，这个点从这儿移动到这儿，这对应于这个 iD。当它从这儿移动到这儿时，这对应于一个点从曲线的这一部分移动到这儿，看起来是这样的。然后对于整个负向入侵，请注意整个负向入侵都移动到这儿，因此对于整个负向入侵，我得到的输出看起来是这样的。

As this signal moves from here to here, this point moves from here to here and that corresponds to this iD. When this moves from here to here that corresponds to a point moving from this part of the curve to here, and that looks like so. And then for the whole negative incursion, notice that the whole negative incursion moves here, so for that entire negative incursion I get an output that looks like this.

请注意，该设备已完全切断并消除负向信号。它所做的不是在这里给我一个漂亮的负尖峰入侵，或在这里偏移，而是将这个偏移简单地降低到这个值。然后，当我再次返回时，我在这里得到这个峰值。

Notice that this device has completely cut off and hammered negative going signals. What it’s done is that rather than giving me a nice little negative spike incursion here, or excursion here, what this is doing is that it is taking this excursion and simply slamming it down to this value here. And then again, when I go back up, I get this peak here.

因此请注意，原本漂亮的小正弦波被挤压成这个有趣的曲线。该设备的作用是，对于正值，它倾向于产生指数级更大的电流，因此我得到了与这两个相对应的高上升峰值，而对于负电压，它只是将它们压缩为一个低正值。这就是我在这里看到的与负偏移相对应的结果。

So notice that what was a nice little sinusoid out there gets hammered and squished into this funny curve here. What this device is doing is for positive values it tends to produce exponentially greater current so I get boom, high rising peaks corresponding to these two, and for negative going voltages it simply compresses them to a low positive value here. And that’s what I see here corresponding to negative excursion.

请注意，如果我查看声音，如果我在这里输入声音，并且声音有负向偏移，它只会压缩它们。但或多或少会让正向的东西通过。这将导致我的信号出现大量失真。所以我想给你们展示一个小演示。实际上，我们已经开始制造一个这样的小装置。

So notice that what this will do, if I view sound, if I input sound here, and sound has negative going excursions it will simply scrunch them. But more or less let the positive things through. And that is going to give rise to a bunch of distortion in my signal. So I would like to show you a little demo. Actually, we’ve gone ahead and built a little device like this.

我们有一个真正的小装置，价格大概是 50 美分或 1 美元左右，它是一种小电压，它发出的光与流经它的电流成比例。我有一个接收器。我要播放一些音乐，您可以在这里听到输出。希望您能看到我向您展示的效果所产生的大量失真。

We have an honest to goodness little device costing, I don’t know, 50 cents or $1 or something, which is a little voltage, it’s a device that emits light proportional to the current flowing through it. I have a receiver. And I am going to play some music, and you will listen to the output here. And hopefully you should see a bunch of distortion because of that effect that I showed you.

在我们这样做之前，你会看到上面的两条曲线。黄色的，我相信是 vI，是输入，绿色的，我相信是与 成比例的信号。哦，我明白了。所以绿色是输入。所以绿色，下面的是输入，上面的是失真的输出。

And what I will do is, before we do that, you will see two curves up there. The yellow, I believe is the vI, is the input, and the green, I believe, is a signal proportionate to The other way around. Oh, I see. So green is the input. So green, the lower one is the input and the upper one is the distorted output.

因此，我们将通过它播放一些声音、音乐，然后您可以通过一个小型 CD 播放器收听。所以有几件事。好消息是它能正常工作。但是，如果我制作的产品的质量如此之高，我怀疑音乐艺术家是否会来我的录音室录音。请注意，上面的曲线几乎没有任何负向偏移，对吧？

So we are going to play some sound through it, music through it and you can listen, through a little CD player. So a couple of things. The good news is that it works. However, I doubt that music artists will come to my studio to record if this is the quality of what I produce. Do notice that there are hardly any negative going excursions in that curve up there, right?

所有负片都像被挤压成一条平线一样，这就是我得到这种失真的原因。为了向你证明我确实在使用车库门开启装置，而不是在这里伪造，我将在这里用一张纸挡住灯光，从而关闭信号。

All the negative ones have been like scrunched up down into a flat line there, and that’s the reason I get this distortion. And just to prove to you that I am indeed using a garage door opener device and not faking it here, I am going to just shut the signal off by stopping the light using a piece of paper here.

请注意，这个装置是一个小装置，光束从中心穿过，我要拿这张纸，你能把它调大吗？让我们来玩玩这个。如果我把这张纸放低一半，强度应该会减半，对吧。所以我的声音应该会稍微减弱一点。也许这样会起作用。让我们看看它是否有效。

So notice that this device here is the little device that has a light beam going through the center, and I am going to take this piece of paper, can you turn it up? So let’s have some fun with this. If I were to put this piece of paper halfway down, I should get half the intensity, right. So my sound should diminish in volume a little bit. Maybe that will work. Let’s see if it works.

与 002 无关，只是好玩而已。声音大点。你可以把声音调大点。咖啡喝多了。我的手在发抖。我想你确实看到了音量降低了，对吧？好的。咖啡喝多了，所以我的手抖得太快了，在信号上叠加了自己的正弦波。我给你看了什么？这是垃圾，对吧？

Nothing to do with 002 but it’s just fun. Louder. You can make it loud. Too much coffee. My hand is shaking. I guess you did see the lowering of volume, right? OK. Just way too much coffee, and so my hand was shaking too fast imposing its own sine wave on top of the signal. What did I show you? This was garbage, right?

我们有一个很好的小信号输入，但输出完全失真，因为我正在播放声音，这就是发生的情况。切换到第 9 页。现在，这就是我希望发生的情况。在第 9 页上，我希望看到的情况是这样的。假设我有一个看起来是线性的发光装置，一条直线，其中电流与 vD 呈线性关系。

We had a nice little signal input, and the output was completely distorted because I was playing sound over this and this is what happened. Switch to Page 9. Now, this is what I would have liked to have happened. On Page 9 what I would have liked to see happen is this. Suppose I had a light emitting device that looked linear, a straight line where the current was linearly related to vD.

那么我会看到，如果我这里有一个正弦波，那么我在这里也会得到一个正弦波。那里没有失真，对吧？如果一切都如我所愿，如果我有一个线性设备，但我没有线性设备。我有一个 Expo Dweeb。现在你知道我为什么叫它 dweeb 了。好吧，我想要一个线性设备，它是指数的。但这就是我想要的。

Then what I would see, if I had a sinusoid here then I would get a sinusoid here. No distortion there, right? If only things were like I wanted them, if I had a linear device, but I don’t have a linear device. I have an Expo Dweeb. Now you know why I call it a dweeb. Well, I’d like a linear device and it’s exponential. But this is what I would like.

如果我有这个，我今天就不会向你们展示它了。如果我有这个，我的音乐就不会失真，我也不必在阁楼里布线。我可以用车库门开启器播放卧室和客厅等的信号，对吧？所以这里的关键是我如何实现这一点？我希望你们自己思考一下。

And if I had this I wouldn’t show it to you today. If I had this my music would go through without any distortion and I wouldn’t have to run cables through my attic. I could just use my garage door opener to play signals from my bedroom and living room and so on, right? So the key thing here is how do I get this? And what I would like you to do is think about it yourselves.

我得到的答案是这样的。你们自己会怎么做？明天或星期四上课前来找我，告诉我答案，好吗？

What I am given is something like this. This about it yourselves, you know, what would you do? See if you can come to me before lecture tomorrow or Thursday and tell me the answer, OK?

Lec 7 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 7 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 50:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=JqvKtMNz3RQ

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 50:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=JqvKtMNz3RQ

介绍

Introduction

好的，大家早上好。在我们开始之前，我想给大家看一则我偶然读到的新闻，它与我们最近在 6.002 中讲到的内容非常相关。还记得几天前上周四我们讲数字部分时，我们谈到了转换。

OK, good morning all. So before we begin, I just thought I’d show you a little news item that I happened to read that was very relevant to what we covered recently in 6.002. So you recall when we did the digital section a few days ago last Thursday, we talked about a switch.

我们谈到了 MOSFET 开关，当输入信号打开或关闭时，它可以帮助构建门，然后以数千万个数量组合起来，并进入奔腾 4 和 AMD Athlon 64 等芯片，等等。所以我刚刚看到这则新闻，说他们正在重新考虑产品的基本结构。

We talked about the MOSFET switch, which when turned on and off, by input signals could help build gates which would then be combined in tens of millions of quantities and go into chips like the Pentium 4 and AMD Athlon 64, and so on it so forth. So I just saw this news item that I came across, and this says they are rethinking the basic construction of the products.

它谈到了 AMD、英特尔等制造数字芯片的半导体制造商。他们正在重新思考产品的基本构造，直至晶体管的架构。这是一个 MOS 晶体管，以及芯片内的开/关开关。好吧，现在这可能意味着芯片内有一个开关，但事实并非如此，芯片内有数千万个晶体管或数千万个开关。

It talks about the semiconductor manufacturers like AMD, Intel, and others that build digital chips. They are rethinking the basic construction of the products down to the architecture of the transistor. That’s a MOS transistor, and the on/off switch inside the chip. OK, now this might imply that there is a single switch inside the chip, but no, there’s tens of millions of transistors, or tens of millions of switches inside a chip.

而且，对基本晶体管所做的任何改进几乎都可以产生 1000 万到 2000 万倍的效果，因为单个芯片上有很多晶体管。所以我认为这非常合适。好的。让我们快速回顾一下。

And pretty much any advancement that can be made to the basic transistor can have a 10 million to 20 million times effect because there are that many of them on a single chip. So I thought that was very appropriate. OK. Let’s dive into a quick review.

本周，我们开始了非线性分析，我想快速浏览一下我制作的一些动画，试图让你们更深入地了解我们所做的事情的行为。现在，首先，就像我上次做的那样，让我试着从整体上介绍一下你们迄今为止学到的大部分内容，以及我们今天将要学习的内容。

So this week, we had begun nonlinear analysis, and I just thought I’d blast through a few animations that I’ve created, trying to give you more insight into the behavior of some of the things that we have done. Now first of all, as I did the last time, let me try to put it in perspective most of what you’ve learned thus far, and what we will be learning today.

所以过去一周，我们一直专注于非线性分析。

So the past week, we have been focusing on nonlinear analysis.

非线性分析

Nonlinear Analysis

正如我指出的那样，这就是它与大局的关系。所以，我们有了 6.002 世界，我们说我们是工程师。我们将设计自己的游乐场，按照自己的规则玩耍。这就是我们的游乐场。这就是我们将在 002 中学习的内容，就此而言，也是麻省理工学院 EECS 的其余部分。

And as I pointed out, here is how this fits into the big picture. So, we had our 6.002 world, at what we said is that we are engineers. We are going to devise our own playground in which to play with our own rules. And that’s our playground. That’s what we’re going to learn about in 002, and for that matter, the rest of EECS at MIT.

一切都在这个操场里。这个操场采用了集总电路抽象，以及经典的 KVL、KCl、节点方法，您的基本合成规则适用于这个操场，这些规则直接来自麦克斯韦方程，因为您已经做出了集总物质学科假设。

It’s all within this playground here. And this is the playground with lumped circuit abstraction, and good old KVL, KCl, node method, your basic composition rules apply within this playground that directly come from Maxwell’s equations because you have made the lumped matter discipline assumptions.

好的，那么我们说操场的很大一部分是线性的，并且一些其他更直观的技术适用于操场的线性部分，例如叠加、戴维南和诺顿技术。在现实生活中的大多数练习、测验和实验等中，您几乎可以应用这些简单的技术。

OK, so then we said a large part of the playground is linear, and some other much more intuitive techniques apply within the linear portion of that playground, techniques like the superposition, Thevenin and Norton. In most exercises, and quizzes, and experiments, and so on that you do in real life, you can pretty much apply these simple techniques.

对于比单源和几个元件更复杂的电路，您很少需要使用节点方法。然后，还有非线性部分。请记住，我展示这个的原因是因为这是同一个游乐场。好的，线性和非线性是同一游乐场的一部分。好的，即使是非线性元件也是集总电路元件，它们遵循 KVL、KCl、节点方程等。

Very rarely do you have to go into the node method for circuits that are more complicated than single source and a couple of elements. And then, there’s the nonlinear part. Remember, the reason I showed this is that this is the same playground. OK, linear and nonlinear are part of the same playground. OK, even nonlinear elements are lumped circuit elements, and they follow KVL, KCl, the node equation, and so on.

然后，上周我们花了一些时间讨论数字抽象。所以我们专注于操场的较小区域。我们在那里做出的假设甚至更加严格。我们说这是操场的一部分，我们只处理二进制值。我们将把值数字化或集中为高点和低点，这就是我们的电路所在的地方。而这些电路，从整体上看，是非线性的。

And then, last week we spent some time talking about the digital abstraction. So we focused on a smaller region of the playground. And the assumptions we made in there were even tighter. We said that it is part of the playground we shall only deal with binary values. We’ll digitize or lump values into highs and lows, and that’s where our circuits are going to be. And these circuits, when looked at as a whole, were nonlinear.

这是一个简单的 NAND 门电路。这是输入/输出特性。例如，如果我将 B 保持在零，并在 A 处应用从零到一的转换，那么这就是我在 C 处看到的输出。请注意，这显然是非线性的。然后我说，看，假设我们必须将输入值固定在给定的集合上。

So, this is a simple NAND gate circuit. And this is the input/output characteristic. So, for example, if I hold B at zero, and I apply a zero to one transition at A, then this is the output that I will see at C. So notice, this is decidedly nonlinear. Then I said that, look, suppose we had to fix the input values at a given set.

好的，那么假设我将 A 固定在 1，将 B 固定在 1。好的，然后观察这种情况下电路的情况。我发现了什么？我发现，对于给定的一组开关设置，我们所观察的整个数字电路组都移到了线性空间中，好吗？

OK, so let’s say, for example, I fix A at one, and B at one. OK, and then look at the circuit in this situation. What do I find? What I find is that the entire digital set of circuits that we were looking at move over into the linear space for a given set of switch settings, OK?

因此，当我将 A 设置为 1 和 B 设置为 1，A 等于 1，B 等于 1 时，我的 NAND 门将变成这样。好吧，这是一个带有电压源 VS 的简单电阻网络。因此，对于一组固定的输入，对于一组给定的输入，如果我不改变输入，那么我的电路看起来就像一个线性电路，并且我的旧线性分析技术适用。那是上周的事。

So, when I set A 1 and B 1, A equal to one and B equal to one, my NAND gate becomes like this. OK, it’s a simple resistive network with a voltage source, VS. So, for a fixed set of inputs, for a given set of inputs, if I don’t change my inputs, then my circuit looks like a linear circuit, and my good old linear analysis techniques apply. So that was last week.

本周，我们将讨论非线性空间。我们研究了非线性空间中的几种技术，分析技术和图形技术。然后，我向你们展示了一个例子。好的，我向你们展示了一个示例电路，这是我想构建的，涉及发光的 expo dweeb，我的小车库门开启器，我想通过光束传输音乐。

And this week, we are looking at the nonlinear space. And we looked at a couple of techniques in the nonlinear space, analytical techniques and graphical techniques. And then, I showed you an example. OK, I showed you an example circuit that was something that I would like to build involving the light emitting expo dweeb, my little garage door opener thingamajig, and I wanted to transmit music over that light beam.

我还向你们展示了它的高度扭曲，因为它处于非线性空间中。所以，今天我要介绍的是游乐场的一个新部分。

I also showed you that it was highly distorted because it was in the nonlinear space. So, today what I’m going to do is introduce a new part of the playground.

这是操场上的一个新的部分，我将向你们展示一种技术，通过专注于操场的这一部分，并约束我们应用于电路的输入类型，我将向你们展示某些类型的非线性电路也会移动，当以特定方式使用时，也会进入线性分析领域。

There’s a new part of the playground, and I’ll show you a technique whereby by focusing on this part of the playground and disciplining ourselves in the kind of inputs we apply to circuits, I’m going to show you that certain kinds of nonlinear circuits also move over, when used in a particular way, also move into the linear analysis domain.

好的，我现在先不讨论这个，而是快速回顾一下上次所举的激励音乐例子。

OK, so let me leave that for now and go back into quickly reviewing the motivating example of music that I had taken last time.

例子

Example

好的，下面是一个小例子。我有一个音乐源 VI，我应用了它。这个我随便称之为 Light Emitting Expo Dweeb 的设备有一个电流 VD，或者一个电压 VD，还有一个电流 ID 通过它。

OK, so here was a little example. So I have a music source, VI, and I apply that. This device that I call the, lightheartedly, the Light Emitting Expo Dweeb has a current, VD, across it, or a voltage, VD, across it, and a current ID through it.

我说，光强度与电流成正比。正因为如此，我能够让光照射到接收设备上，从而产生与照射到其上的光强度成正比的电流。然后该信号会以某种方式被放大。我们还没有讨论所有这些事情。这将在下周发生。

And the light intensity, I said, was proportional to the current. And because of that, I was able to get the light to impinge on a receiving device, which produced a current that was proportional to the intensity of light falling on it. And that signal would then be amplified somehow. We haven’t talked about all of this stuff yet. This will happen next week.

但是，假设我们以某种方式放大信号，然后通过一组扬声器播放出来。好吧，如果我这里有某种音乐信号，那么我就可以把音乐信号传输到这束光束的顶部。

But let’s say we somehow amplify the signal and then played out through a set of speakers. All right, so if I had some sort of a music signal here, then I could then transmit the music signal over to the side on top of this light beam.

但问题在于，就像我上次说的，我们的设备 Light Emitting Expo Dweeb 具有指数特性，因此我很难获得不失真的音乐。因此，我的设备的 VI 特性如下所示。ID 与 VD 曲线如下所示。好吧，它显然是非线性的。

But the problem, as I said the last time, was that our device, the Light Emitting Expo Dweeb had an exponential characteristic, so that I had some trouble in getting undistorted music. So, the characteristic of the VI characteristics of my device looked like so. The ID versus VD curve looked as follows. OK, it was decidedly nonlinear.

因此，我的信号出现了很多失真，我向你们展示了一个绘图小技巧，给定一个传递函数的输入波形（例如这里），绘制输出函数。好的，让我向你们展示我在这里为你们制作的另一个小动画，它应该能让你更直观地了解它是如何发生的。所以，这是我在这里向你们展示的一个特性。

And because of that, I was getting a lot of distortions in my signal, and I showed you a little trick to plot, given an input waveform at a transfer function such as here to plot the output function. OK, let me show you another little animation that I have created here for you that should give you even more intuition in terms of how it happens. So, this is a characteristic I showed you up here.

它位于两边，但我想除非我来回穿梭得非常快，否则它只指向一个。所以平均而言，我会在两个地方。但无论如何，这是我的 ID 与 VD 特性。正如我所说，有一个指数 ID 与 VD 曲线。我想看看输出是什么样子，例如正弦输入。

It’s on both sides, but I guess it points to only one unless I shuttle back and forth really fast. So on average, I’ll be in both places. But anyway, so here’s my ID versus VD characteristic. And as I said, there’s an exponential ID versus VD curve. And I want to see what the output looks like, for example, a sinusoidal input.

所以我说，让我们把输入放在一个小图上，旋转它，取一个正弦波，并将正弦波应用于输入 VI，这也会出现在 Light Emitting Expo Dweeb 上。然后，我想看看输出是什么样子的。好的，让我告诉你，输出将看起来像这样。好的，输出将看起来像这样。

So I said, let’s place the input along a little graph, rotate it so, and take a sinusoid, and apply a sinusoid to the input, VI, which would also appear across the Light Emitting Expo Dweeb. And then, what I wanted to see was how the output looked. OK, so let me tell you that the output is going to look like this. OK, the output is going to look like so.

发现这种曲线的一个小技巧是考虑这里的一个点与这里传递曲线上的点相对应，因为这是 VD，查看 Y 截距。这是 ID 的值，这是这里的 ID 值。时间在这里移动，时间在这里移动。所以，我做了这个小动画。你一定会印象深刻。我花了六个小时才做成。所以，就是这样。

And, a little artifice to discover curves like this is to think about a point here corresponding to the point on the transfer curve here, because this is VD, looking at the Y intercept. That’s a value of ID, and that’s a value of ID here. And, time moves along here, and time moves along here. So, I did this little animation. You’d better be impressed. It took me six hours to do it. So, here it goes.

假设我首先关注这个小点，它对应于传递函数上的这个点，然后，它又指向时间零点，即我的 ID 曲线上的这个点。好的，我希望这能奏效。因此，当我的点向下移动时，我向你保证，这很有趣。因此请注意，由于这个点有以下偏移，因此这里有以下偏移。好的，好的。

So, let’s say I start by focusing on this little point that corresponds to this point on the transfer function, which then, in turn, points to a time, zero, this point on my ID curve. OK, I hope this works. So, as my point moves down this was fun to do, I promise you. So notice that as this point has the following excursion, this had the following excursions here. OK, all right.

所以让我暂停一下那个小动画。在讲座结束时，如果你们愿意的话，我会再次放出它，你们都可以来玩一下。所以，你们实际上可以在 PowerPoint 中做到这一点。虽然我花了不少时间才弄清楚怎么做，但这很有趣。

So let me pause that little animation there. At the end of the lecture, I’ll put that up again if you like, and you all can come and play with it. So, you can actually do this in PowerPoint. It took me quite a bit of time to figure out how to do it, though, but it’s fun.

好的，让我给你展示一个小演示，给你看一个正弦波，并向你展示如果我将正弦波应用于 VI，输出会是什么样子。所以，当 VI 是正弦波时，我将向你展示 ID 作为 VI 的函数。就是这样。所以，我应用了正弦波 VI，这是我得到的电流。

OK, so let me show you a little demo, and show you a sinusoid, and show you what the output looks like if I apply a sinusoid for VI. So, I’ll show you ID as a function of VI when VI is a sinusoid. There you go. So, I applied my sinusoid VI, and this is the current that I get.

请注意，这是我谈到的传递函数，即我的 Light Emitting Expo Dweeb 的 ID 与 VD 曲线。当我到达输出时，我得到了输入的高度非线性变换。好的，所以这是一个问题。然后，我还为你播放了一些音乐。我们也这样做吧。我为你播放了一些音乐。我将音乐作为电路的输入，这就是输出。

And notice, this is the transfer function that I talked about, the ID versus VD curve of my Light Emitting Expo Dweeb. And I get this highly nonlinear transformation of the input as I get to the output. OK, so that is a problem. And then, I also played some music for you. Let’s do that, too. I played some music for you. I applied the music as an input to the circuit, and that’s the output.

好的，这是我在放大器上观察到的输出。它严重失真。好的，我们可以阻止它。就是这样。好的，这就是我的问题。好的，我们已经讲过了，上周二我们已经讲到了这里。

OK, that’s the output that I’m observing at the amplifier. It’s highly distorted. OK, we can stop that. There you go. OK, so that was my problem. OK, so we had covered, we had gone this far last Tuesday.

我为你们设置了问题，激励了我们要做的事情，并向你们展示了我能够通过车库门开启器传输音乐，但我认为我不能长时间听音乐。所以，我挑战大家思考我可以使用什么技巧来传输音乐并获得线性响应。所以，你们有时间思考这个问题吗？

I set the problem up for you, motivated what we had to do, and showed you that I was able to transmit music over my garage door opener, but I did not think I could listen to that music for very long. So, I challenged all of us to think about how a trick that I could use to be able to transmit music and have a linear response. So, did you people get time to think about it?

那么这里有多少人认为他们知道答案？没关系，别谦虚。说吧。你能大声点说吗？是的，你找到了另一种东西，一种元素，它有相反的图形，所以当你把它们加在一起时。哦，这家伙想作弊。不。他想要一个新元素。所以，不，没有新元素。什么？建立一个 MP3 编码器。啊哈，那将在很久以后发生。是吗？

So how many people here think they know the answer? It’s OK, don’t be modest. Go ahead. Could you speak louder? Yeah, you find another something, kind of element, that’s got the opposite graph so that when you add them together. Oh, this guy wants to cheat. No. He wants a new element. So, no, no new elements. Pardon? Build an MP3 encoder. Ah ha, so that will happen much later. Yes?

在将信号发送到 LED 之前先将其数字化？在将信号发送到 LED 之前先将其数字化。但从某种意义上说，这些解决方案中的每一个都是一种解决问题的强大方法。我可以在这里应用一种更简单的技术。是吗？添加电压偏移。啊哈，这可能有用。还有什么？那么假设，这是我的信号，对吗？

Digitize the signal before you send it to the LED? Digitize the signal before you send it to the LED. But in some sense, each of these solutions is a huge sledgehammer approach to look at solving it. There’s a much simpler technique I can apply here. Yeah? Add a voltage offset. Ah, ah ha, that might work. What else? So let’s say, here’s my signal, right?

如果我添加电压偏移，这只会使信号在这里上升。然后曲线仍然是非线性的。但你正在到达那里。好吧，我告诉你。让我们在这里暂停一下。让我在前面停下来。好的，所以这里的答案，伙计们，是禅。

If I add a voltage offset, that will just bump the signal up here. Then the curve is still nonlinear. But you’re getting there. Well, I’ll tell you what. Let’s pause here. Let me quit while I’m ahead. OK, so the answer here, folks, is Zen.

好的，我要你做的是，在禅宗中，你必须坐在庭院里，看着一块石头，比如地上的一块小石头。你的注意力必须集中在它身上，直到地球的其他部分都消失了。只关注石头。好的，现在假设你在一个庭院里，你正在看着这里的这个小区域。看看这个。

OK, what I want you to do is, so, in Zen, what you have to do is you have to sit down in a courtyard, and look at a rock, like a small rock on the ground. And you got a focus on it till the rest of Earth kind of vanishes. Just focus on the rock. OK, now make like you’re in a courtyard, and you’re looking at this little area here. Just look at this.

好的，我给你们十秒钟。静静地坐下，不要发出任何声音。只是盯着这里。好的，假装这是你的小石头，站在那里思考。好的，我给你们五秒钟时间。只是盯着它。很快，答案就会浮现在你们的脑海里。好的，你看到了什么？

OK, and I’ll give you ten seconds. Sit down quietly, and no sounds. Just stare at the spot here. OK, make believe this is your little rock, and just stand there and think about it. OK, I’ll give you five seconds to do that. Just stare at it. And very soon, the answer should pop into your heads. OK, what do you see?

如果我把注意力集中在图表的这个非常小的区域上，这个小块看起来或多或少是线性的。嗯，这应该能给我一些启发。整个宏观图是非线性的。但我把注意力集中在图表的一个小而细小的部分上，就像这样，它看起来或多或少是线性的。如果它足够小，它看起来是线性的。所以，我盯着这个看，它看起来是线性的。

This guy, if I focus on this really small region of the graph, this small little piece looks more or less linear. OK, hmm, so that should give me some insight. This whole thing, the macrograph is nonlinear. But I focus on a little rinky dinky piece of that graph like so, that appears more or less linear. If it’s small enough, that appears linear. So, I’m staring at this, and that appears linear.

问题是，我如何利用这个小小的线性区域来从我的设备获得线性响应。好的，这是我要使用的技巧。我要使用的小技巧如下。请注意，让我将此区域中心的电压称为大写 VD。我可以做的是，如果我获取输入信号，我刚才指出，我会将其提高。

The question is, how do I exploit this little small, little, linear region to get a linear response from my device. OK, so here’s the trick that I’m going to use. The little trick that I’m going to use is the following. Notice that, let me call this voltage at the center of this region capital VD. What I can do, if I take my input signal, and I just pointed out earlier, I bump it up.

我将其放大。好的，所以我将直流偏移量应用于我的输入信号，就像这样。所以我应用了一些输入信号 VI，如果我查看非线性元素上的变量，它也等于 VD。如果我应用直流偏移量 VI，并将音乐叠加在其上，让我称其为我的音乐，只是为了区分两者，大写 VI 和小写 vi。好的，这就是我的音乐。

I boost it. OK, so I apply a DC offset to my input signal, like so. So I apply some input signal, VI, which is also equal to the VD if I look at a variable across the nonlinear element. If I apply a DC offset, VI, and I superimpose the music on top of that, let me call my music, just to distinguish between the two, capital VI, and the small vi. OK, that’s my music.

这是我的大写 VD，即我的 DC 偏移。我想将我的音乐叠加在上面。好的，我已经完成了一半。通过在这里叠加我的音乐，而不是在这里进行偏移，我现在在这里进行偏移。好的，所以我在这里使用图表的某个部分。但这仍然远远超出了那里的小元素。

So here’s my capital VD, my DC offset. And I want to superimpose my music on top of that. OK, so I’ve gotten halfway there. By superimposing my music here instead of having excursions out here, I now have excursions out here. OK, and so I’m using some portion of the graph here. But that’s still way beyond the small little element there.

因此，除了增强信号之外，我还会考虑缩小信号。想想增强和缩小，废话。所以我想做的是使用直流偏移增强信号，然后缩小信号。好的，所以我要使用一个小信号并将其增强。好的，现在发生的事情是，小信号在其偏移中仅使用图表的一小部分。

So a second think that I do in addition to boosting up the signal is shrink it. Think of boost and shrink, BS. So what I want to do is boost up the signal using a DC offset, and shrink the sucker. OK, so I’m going to go with a small signal and bump it up. OK, so now what happens is that small signal in its excursions, only uses that little portion of the graph.

好的，再次记住：增加和缩小，增加和缩小，两个东西，增加和缩小。那么你觉得这个技巧怎么样？通过这样做，会发生的情况是，在这里发生偏移的信号将在此区域产生相应的响应，好吗？我认为，由于这或多或少像一条直线，我在这里引用禅宗，并认为这个小信号现在被转换了，我得到了一个线性响应。

OK, again, remember: bump and shrink, bump and shrink, two things, boost and shrink. So what do you think of that trick? So, by doing that, what happens is that signal that has excursions here will produce a corresponding response in this region, OK? And I argue that since this is more or less like a straight line, I invoke Zen here, and argue that this little signal now gets transformed, and I get a linear response.

好的：提升和缩小。就我的电路而言，让我为您画出来。我的 Light Emitting Expo Dweeb，整个信号就是我以前称之为 V 大写 I 的信号，现在它由两个部分组成，一个凸起偏移和一个缩小的电压 VI。它缩小了，因此我使用了小的 v 和小的 i，非常非常小。

OK: boost and shrink. So in terms of my circuit, let me draw it out for you. My Light Emitting Expo Dweeb, and this whole signal was what I used to call V capital I, and that’s made up of two components now, a bump offset, and a shrunk voltage VI. It shrunk, so therefore I’ve used the small v and small i, like, really, really small.

以同样的方式，我得到了 LED 上的 VD ID，而此处的相应值也将具有 DC 偏移和小响应。我将其称为 ID 加 I 小 d。我也会在一秒钟内用数学方法完成所有这些操作，但首先让我完全直观地完成它，以便您了解正在发生的事情。而且，VD 只是大写 VD 加小写 vd。

In the same manner, I get a VD ID across the LED, and the corresponding values here will also have a DC offset and a small response. Let me call that ID plus I small d. I’ll do all this mathematically in a second as well, but first let me do it completely intuitively so you get some insight into what’s going on. And, VD is simply capital VD plus small vd.

好的，这与 VI、I 和 VI 相同。好的，那么我做了什么？我做了两件事。我说过，作为一名工程师，我关心如何通过车库门开启器播放音乐。我会尽一切努力做到这一点。好的，作为一名工程师，我会做两件事。我要增加信号并缩小信号。增加和缩小信号，我会这样做。

OK, and this is the same as VI, I, and VI. OK, so what have I done? I’ve done two things. I have said, as an engineer, OK, I care about getting music across my garage door opener. And I’ll do what it takes to do that. OK, so as an engineer, I’ll do two things. I’m going to bump my signal up and shrink it. And the bumping and shrinking, and I do it like this.

我缩小信号，即这里的音乐信号，并添加直流偏移。好的，我声称现在我在另一边听到的音乐，只要我在那里有足够的放大，就不会失真。好的，到目前为止，我已经完全直观地使用小草图向您展示了这一点，没有数学。我向你保证，我会在几秒钟内给你一堆数学知识，但只要了解基本概念，并了解其背后的直觉。

I shrink my signal, the music signal here, and add a DC offset. OK, and I claim that the music I listened on the other side now, provided I have enough amplification there, is going to be undistorted. OK, so far I’ve showing this to you completely intuitively using little sketches, no math. I promise you, I’ll give you a bunch of math in a few seconds, but just get the basic idea, and get the intuition behind it.

凹凸收缩

Bump Shrink

让我们回到我们的演示并看一下。记住，BS，对，增加和缩小。所以我要做的是，首先，让我增加信号。所以我要做的是，我想为我的输入添加一个偏移量，然后让我增加它。让我先缩小它。这会让要点更清楚一点。所以，大输入，绿色，是一个大输入。让我缩小它。

So let’s go back to our demo and take a look. So remember, BS, right, bump and shrink. So what I’m going to do is first of all, let me bump up the signal. So, what I’ll do is I want to add an offset to my input, and let me bump it up. Let me shrink it first. It’ll make the point a little clearer. So, the big input, green, is a big input. Let me shrink it.

好的，我把输入调小了，在图片中间，你可以看到传递曲线的区域。好的，曲线的这个区域由小信号表达。这是一个小得多的信号。输出仍然失真，因为我必须做两件事：增加和缩小。我只缩小了。好的，现在让我增加它。黄色曲线是什么？

OK, so I’ve made my input small, and in the middle of that picture out there, you see the region of the transfer curve that’s being articulated. OK, this region of the curve is being articulated by the small signal. It’s a much smaller signal. And the output is still distorted because I have to do two things: bump and shrink. I’ve only shrunk. OK, let me bump it up now. What’s the yellow curve?

它会变成线性的。它会与输入成比例。然后我现在把它调大。我可以把它调小，调得更小，就这样。这不是很棒吗？所以，我让大自然听从我的命令，好吗？所以，这就是其中之一，当我很多年前学习电子学等知识时，这对我来说是一个真正伟大的时刻，说，哇，这东西很酷。

It’s going to get linear. It’s going to get proportional to the input. Then I’m bumping it up now. I can make it smaller, make it even smaller, there you go. Isn’t that fantastic? So, I’m making nature do my bidding here, OK? So, this is one of those, when I learned electronics and so on many, many years ago, this was one of those really big ah ha moments for me, saying, wow, that stuff is cool.

这是我自己想不到的，而且并不明显，通过严谨和创造性地使用电路，我可以做出非常非常酷的事情。好的，记住这对你来说是一个重大的顿悟时刻。

It’s something that I couldn’t think about myself, and it’s not obvious, and by being disciplined and creative in how I use circuits, I can do really, really cool things. OK, remember this as a big ah ha moment for you.

直觉

Intuition

所以，这是我缩小并增大的小信号，我的输出是正弦波，而不是这种奇怪的失真波形。请注意，这是曲线被表达的区域。

So, here’s my little signal that I’ve shrunk and bumped up, and my output is a sinusoid, and not this funny, distorted waveform. And notice that this is the region of the curve that is being articulated.

所以，如果我喜欢，我可以把信号调得更小。好的，接下来我想做的是播放音乐给你听，如果你不相信自己的眼睛，至少可以相信自己的耳朵。让我再次转到失真信号，切换到音乐，然后调高它。好的，现在我们要做的就是缩小音乐信号，然后调高它。我可以把音量调低一点吗？很好。

So, I can make the signal even smaller if I like. OK, and what I’d like to do next is play music for you, and if you don’t believe your eyes, you can at least believe your ears. Let me go to the distorted signal again, switch to music, and raise it up. OK, now what we’ll do is shrink the music signal and then bump it up. Can I turn the volume down a little bit? That’s good.

好的，如果我把音量缩小一点，现在让我把它调大。记住这是一个很大的顿悟时刻。好的，信号非常非常小。我喜欢这样。我喜欢这种热情。好的，信号非常小，我得到的响应或多或少是线性的。好的。

OK, so if I shrunk the volume a little bit, and let me bump it up, now. Just remember this as a big ah ha moment. OK, the signal is really, really small. I like that. I like the enthusiasm. OK, so the signal’s very small, and I get a more or less linear response. OK.

好的，这就是直觉，我所采用的方法被称为小信号分析、增量分析、小信号方法、小信号学科，无论你想要什么。

All right, so that’s intuition, and the approach that I’ve taken is called, it’s variously called small signal analysis, incremental analysis, small signal method, small signal discipline, whatever you want.

小信号分析

Small Signal Analysis

好吧，这只是说通过增强和缩小信号，即使我使用的是非线性设备，我也能得到或多或少线性的响应。这种技术称为小信号方法。

OK, this simply says that by boosting and shrinking my signal, I get a response that’s more or less linear even when I have a nonlinear device. And this technique is called the small signal approach.

因此，为了再多关注一下，请切换到笔记的第五页，让我为您画出一些东西。好的，我这里有，这是我的偏移 VD，从 VD 偏移，我得到我的小信号 V 小 d，总信号称为 V 大写 D。偏移，小信号，这就是我的总信号。好的，请注意偏移全部是大写。

So, just to focus on that a little bit longer, switch to page five of your notes and let me draw something out for you. OK, so what I have here, this is my offset VD, and from the VD offset I have my little signal V small d, and the total signal is called V capital D. Offset, small signal, and that’s my total signal. OK, notice the offset is all capital.

总信号是小 v 大写 D，音乐或小信号是小 v 小 d。同样，输出将如下所示，在这里我得到输出 ID 中的偏移量。我得到一个相应的信号，I 小 d，我得到一个总信号，I 大写 D，好吗？

The total signal is small v capital D, and the music or the small signal is small v small d. Similarly, the output is going to look like this, and here I get an offset in the output ID. I get a corresponding signal, I small d, and I get a total signal, I capital D, OK?

值得注意的是，这里的信号，这里的输出信号对应于输入信号，音乐信号，VD，是小 I 小 D，这或多或少是线性的。好的，我甚至可以像这样绘制信号。这是我的输入，v 大写 D。那是 T。这是 VD，V 小 d。这是我的总输入。同样，我有一个输出。这是我的输出 ID。

The cool thing to notice is that the signal here, the output signal here corresponding to the input signal, the music signal, VD, is small I small D, and that is more or less linear. OK, and I can even plot the signal like so. This is my input, v capital D. That’s T. This is VD, V small d. That is my total input. And similarly, I have an output. And this is my output ID.

看起来就像这样，I 大写 D，小 I 小 d，总信号 I 大写 D。好的，这就是小信号方法。让我为您总结一下。该方法有三个步骤。首先，在某个直流偏移下操作。这也称为直流偏置，在该示例中为 VDID。好的，我选择一个操作点，它会在某些感兴趣的区域中增加操作。

And, that looks like this, I capital D, small I small d, total signal I capital D. OK, so that’s the small signal method. So, let me summarize that for you. There are three steps to the method. So, first of all, operate at some DC offset. This is also called DC bias, and in that example it’s VDID. OK, so I choose an operating point that bumps up the operation in some region of interest.

第二步是在 VD 上叠加小信号，大写 V 大写 D，叠加一个小信号，第三步是观察响应，响应，小 I 小 d，即响应的音乐部分，ID，近似为线性。好的，这里的方法有三个步骤，只要记住这个符号即可。我在小信号模型中的符号如下。

The second step is to superimpose small signal on top of VD, capital V capital D, to superimpose a small signal, and the third step is observe the response and the response, small I small d, that’s the music part of the response, ID, is approximately linear. OK, three steps to the method here, and just remember this notation. And, my notation in the small signal model is as follows.

我的总信号 ID 是两个信号的总和，大写 I D 加上小写 I 小 d。这称为总信号。这称为直流偏移。这是叠加的小信号。好的，总信号、直流偏移加上小信号。

My total signal ID is the sum of two signals, I capital D plus small I small d. This is called the total signal. That’s called the DC offset. And this is the superimposed small signal. OK, total signal, DC offset, plus the small signal.

有时，尤其是在进行数学运算等时，我们可能经常将 ID 表示为 delta，即 I 大写 D，OK，以表明 ID 是 I 大写 D 值的增量变化。因此，这种方法也经常被称为增量方法、增量分析。OK，到目前为止，我所做的只是给你一些直觉。

And sometimes, especially when doing math, and so on, we may oftentimes represent ID as a delta, I capital D, OK, to show that ID is incremental change in the value of I capital D. And because of that, this method is also often called the incremental method, incremental analysis. OK, so far what I’ve done is given you some intuition.

我开发了一种简单的小方法，让你们了解我们为什么使用这种方法，并向你们展示了一些演示，这些演示表明，当我撞击和收缩并观察响应时，我确实得到了或多或少线性的响应。现在让我用数学方法做这件事，并向你们展示，从数学上讲，你也可以得出你的响应是线性响应。这是第七页。

I’ve developed a small, simple method, given you some insight into why we use this method, and also shown you some demonstrations that show that when I bump and shrink, and observe the response, I do get a more or less linear response. So let me now do this mathematically and show you that mathematically, you can also derive your response to be a linear response. This is page seven.

所以，我知道 ID 是二极管电压的某个函数。F 是我的非线性函数。好的，所以我的函数 F 是一个非线性函数。因此，ID 与 VD 呈非线性关系。所以，让我们来算一下。因此，作为第一步，我们所做的是用直流偏移、小信号方法、直流偏移加上小的增量变化来替换 VD。

So, I know that ID is some function of the diode voltage. F was my nonlinear function. OK, so my function F was a nonlinear function. So therefore, ID was nonlinearly related to VD. So, let’s do the math. So as a first step, what we did was replace VD by a DC offset, the small signal method, a DC offset, plus a small incremental change.

好的，通过计算，我简单地使用 delta VD 符号来向您展示我正在处理的是小增量，也因为在数学界，当您学习其中一些技术时，他们会使用增量变化符号，即 delta VD 符号。在电气工程中，我们使用小 v、小 d 符号。所以，这是一个大的直流偏移，这是关于该偏移的一个小变化。

OK, by doing the math, let me simply use the delta VD notation to show you that I’m dealing with small increments, and also because in the mathematics community, when you learn about some of these techniques, they will use the incremental change notation, which is the delta VD notation. In electrical engineering, we use a small v, small d notation. So, this is a large DC offset, and this is a small change about that offset.

所以，你们以前上过数学课，一直在寻找函数的值，即输入值的微小变化，即大输入值的微小变化或大 DC 点，这就是泰勒展开式。好的，让我们使用泰勒级数展开式，好的，将 VD 加 delta VD 代入其中，看看 ID 是什么样子。再次，让我告诉你们我要怎么做。

So, you folks have taken math courses before, and been looking at finding out the value of a function, which is a small change for an input value, which is a small change about a big input value or a big DC point is Taylor’s expansion. OK, so let’s use Taylor’s series expansion, OK, and substitute VD plus delta VD into this, and see what ID looks like. Again, let me tell you where I’m going with this.

ID 等于 VD 的 F。这是一个非线性函数，对吧？我认为，通过用 DC 偏移加上一个小值替换输入 VD，对这个小值的响应将是线性的，对吧？

ID equals F of VD. This is a nonlinear function, OK? I claim that by replacing VD, the input, with the DC offset plus a small value, the resulting response to the small value will be linear, OK?

所以我接下来要做的是用这里的总和替换 VD，然后进行计算，并向你展示响应对应，或者 ID 的变化对应于 VD 的变化将是线性的。好的，让我们使用泰勒级数在 DC 偏移点附近展开这个函数，大写 V 大写 D。

So what I’m going to do next is replace VD with this sum here, and then do the math, and show you that the response corresponding, or the change in ID corresponding to the change in VD is going to be linear. All right, so let’s expand this function using Taylor’s series near the DC offset point, capital V capital D.

好的，所以 ID 很简单，根据泰勒级数，我想找出接近 V 大写 D 的函数值。好的，所以我取该点的函数值，然后在泰勒级数展开式中添加一些项。第一项就是老套的泰勒级数。好的，第一项是函数的一阶导数乘以变化量。

OK, so ID is simply, by Taylor’s series, I want to find out a value of the function close to V capital D. OK, so I take the value of the function at that point, and then I add a few terms in my Taylor’s series expansion. The first term is simply the good old Taylor’s series stuff. OK, the first term is the first derivative of the function times the change.

然后，第二个是二阶导数。好的，然后我得到更高阶的项。所以这没什么新鲜的。这是老套的泰勒级数展开，再说一遍，让我告诉你我要讲什么。

And then, the second one is second derivative. OK, and then I get higher order terms. So this is nothing new here. This is good old Taylor series expansion, and again, let me tell you where I’m going.

我想查看类似这样的输入的响应，最终我想向您展示 ID 中的响应，使用类似这样的输入对 ID 的影响，就好像这种影响，增量变化与小输入 delta VD 线性相关。所以这是我对 delta V 的泰勒级数展开。

I want to look at the response for an input that looks like this, and I want to show you at the end of the day that the response in ID, the effect on ID of using an input like this is as if that effect, the incremental change is linearly related to the small input, delta VD. So here’s my Taylor’s series expansion for delta V.

现在记住，我告诉过你 delta VD 比 V 大写 D 小得多。好吧，这是一个非常非常小的量。但这个量确实非常小。那么我将得到的输出是，我可以开始忽略我的二阶项。好吧，delta VD 非常非常小。然后，我要做的是忽略高阶项。所以我会忽略高阶项。

Now remember, I told you that delta VD is much, much smaller than V capital D. OK, it’s a very, very small quantity. But that quantity is really very small. Then what I’m going to get is that my output is, I can begin to ignore my second order terms. OK, delta VD is very, very, very small. Then, what I’m going to do is that ignore higher order terms. So I’ll go and ignore higher order terms.

它们都会归零。记住，我可以这样做，因为根据设计，我已将 delta VD 选得非常非常小。好的，记住，我们是工程师。我已将其选得非常小。好的，我告诉您情况就是这样，在这些条件下，我可以忽略第二个高阶项，在这种情况下，我剩下这个表达式。让我重写一下。让我在这里重写一下。

They’ll all go to zero. Remember, I can do this because by design I’ve chosen delta VD to be very, very, very small. OK, remember, we are engineers. I’ve chosen it in a way that this is very small. OK, so I’m telling you that’s the case, and under those conditions, I can ignore second higher order terms, in which case I am left with this expression here. So let me rewrite this. Let me rewrite this down here.

好的，我刚刚复制了这个结果，我忽略了这里的所有这些术语，所以我有一个或多或少等于符号。所以我要做的是，当我将这种形式的小输入应用于大直流偏移时，我的输出也将看起来像一些输出偏移，输出偏移会发生变化。

OK, I’ve just copied this turnout, I’ve ignored all these terms here, and so I have a more or less equal to sign that remains. So what I’m going to do is when I apply a small input of this form to a large DC offset, my output is also going to look like some output offset with a change in the output offset.

我将输出偏移量 I 称为 D，将输出增量 ID 称为一些小变化。好的，我们将确保我们能够说服自己确实如此。请注意，这里的 F 是 V 的 F，D 是常数。这是相对于增量变化 delta VD 的常数。同样，这里的这部分也是常数。

And let me call the output offset I capital D, and some small change in the output delta ID. OK, we’ll make sure we can convince ourselves that this is indeed the case. Notice that this guy here, F of capital V capital D is a constant. That’s a constant with respect to the incremental change, delta VD. Similarly, this part here is a constant.

请注意，此处的此项是函数在直流偏置点 V 大写 D 处求得的一阶导数。所以，此项也是相对于 delta VD 的常数。因此请注意，我有一个常数项加上一个常数项，乘以一个小的变化 delta VD。

Notice that this term here is the first derivative of the function evaluated at the DC bias point, capital V capital D. OK, so this term is also a constant with respect to delta VD. So notice, then, I have a constant term plus a constant term multiplying a small change, delta VD.

那么我接下来可以做的是，在这种情况下，假设两边都有一个常数项，而这一边是一个时变项，我可以做的是将这两个常数项相等。我可以继续将这两个项相等。记住，我有一个常数加上一个时变项，好吧，如果我在这里假设 delta VD，我的小音乐信号是一个时变项。

So what I can do next is, in this case, given that I have a constant term on both sides, and on this side it’s a time varying term, what I can do is equate the two constant terms. I can go ahead and equate these two terms. Remember, I have a constant plus a time varying term, OK, if I’m assuming here that delta VD, my little music signal is a time varying term.

因此，这个常数将等于这个，所以 ID 必须等于 F 除以 VD。我知道情况就是这样，因为在直流偏移处求值的函数给出了直流电流 ID。同样，ID 等于该分量。Delta ID 等于 D，F 除以 OK，因此输出的增量变化是一阶导数乘以电流的微小变化。好的，我差不多完成了。

So, this constant will equal this, so ID must equal F of VD. And I know that’s the case because the function evaluated at the DC offset gives me the DC current ID. And similarly, ID is equal to that component. Delta ID is equal to D, F of OK, so my incremental change in the output is the first derivative multiplied by the small change in the current. OK, so I’m pretty much done.

因此，请注意，delta ID 与 delta VD 成正比。好的，这就是我要展示的。请记住，我打算展示的是，只要我的输入是围绕大直流偏移的小偏移，那么我的输出也可能是大直流偏移，并在其上有一个小偏移，其中两个偏移，输入偏移和输出偏移将呈线性相关，如下所示。

So, therefore, notice that delta ID is proportional to delta VD. OK, and that’s what I had set out to show. Remember, I had set out to show that provided my input is a small excursion around a large DC offset, then my output could also be a large DC offset with a small excursion on top of it where the two excursions, the input excursion and the output excursion would be linearly related like so.

好的，方法很简单。我只是将函数展开到那个点，那个 DC 点，忽略高阶项，注意我的增量项只是导数加上增量变化，导数乘以输入的增量变化。转到第 9 页，我想快速用图形解释一下。所以我之前给出了一个直观的解释。

OK, and the method is very simple. I simply expanded the function about that point, that DC point, neglected higher order terms, and notice that my incremental term was simply the derivative plus the incremental change, a derivative times the incremental change in the input. Move onto page nine, and I’d like to give you a quick graphical interpretation of this. So I gave an intuitive explanation earlier.

这是一个数学解释，它表明输入可以与输出线性相关，前提是输出与输入线性相关，前提是输入具有直流偏移，并且围绕该直流偏移有小的偏移。所以，让我用一个小图表给你一些直观的印象，让你了解一下你在这里真正做了什么。

This is a mathematical explanation that shows you that the input could be linearly related to the output, provided, the outputs would be linearly related to the input, provided the input has a DC offset, and small excursions about that DC offset. So, let me give you some intuition in what you’ve really done here, using a little graph here.

因此，我将绘制 ID 与 VD 的关系图，请注意，我这里有一个点，大写 V D，大写 I D。这是我的直流偏置。因此，我这里有一个直流偏置点。好的，这是什么？这只是该点处的曲线斜率。好的，这是在该点处评估的该曲线的斜率。因此，这里这个点只是在 ID VD 处评估的该曲线的斜率。

So, I’m going to plot ID versus VD, and notice that I have some point here, V capital D, I capital D. That’s my DC bias. So, I have some DC bias point here. OK, what is this? That is simply the slope of the curve at that point. OK, it’s the slope of this curve evaluated at this point. So this guy here is simply the slope of this curve evaluated at ID VD.

好的，现在，我关心的是这里的这个点，以及这里的这个点。假设这是 delta VD，好吧，它对应于这里的这个点。所以我做的是取斜率并将其乘以 delta VD。所以我取了斜率，并将其乘以 delta VD，好的，这给了我这里的这个分量。好的，这就是我要得到的点。

OK, now, what I care about is this point here, and this point here. So let’s say that this is delta VD, all right, and that corresponds to this point here. So what I’ve done is taken the slope and multiplied that by delta VD. So I’ve taken the slope, and multiplied it by delta VD, OK, and that gives me this component here. OK, and so, this is the point that I’m going to get.

换句话说，我所做的就是使用泰勒技巧通过点 B 来近似点 A。好的，这是一个点 A，这也是我真正想要的，我通过取函数在 V 大写 D 处的斜率并将其乘以输入的变化来获得相应的 Y 偏移量，从而近似得到它，这就是我得到的点。

So in other words, what I’ve done is approximated point A using the Taylor trick by the point B. OK, so this is a point, A, which is what I really want, and I’ve approximated that by taking the slope of the function at V capital D, and multiplying that by the change in the input to get the corresponding Y offset, and that’s the point that I get.

请注意，如果我将这个 delta VD 设得足够小，那么这两个点之间的误差就会变得越来越小。回到我们的例子，ID 就是 ae 除以 BVD。这是我们的 Expo Dweeb 的关系，让我代入这些值。所以，ID 加上小 id。注意，我只是在 delta VD 符号和小 v 小 d 符号之间来回切换。 

And notice that if I make this delta VD small enough, then the error between these two points becomes smaller and smaller. So back to our example, so ID was a e to the BVD. This was the relation for our Expo Dweeb, and let me just plug in the values. So, ID plus small id. Notice, I’m just shuttling back and forth between the notation delta VD, and small v small d. 

好的，所以这是由 ae 到 BVD 给出的，哎呀，加上，我刚刚在上面写了那个方程。让我把这个方程称为 X。所以，我得到第二项是导数，ab 乘以 e 到 BVD 乘以 delta VD，小 VD，并将该项等于 DC 偏移。

OK, and so that is given by a e to the BVD, oops, plus, I’m just writing that equation up there. Let me call this equation X. And so, I get the second term is the derivative, ab times e to the BVD times delta VD, small VD, and equating this term that the DC offset.

请注意，这是输出中的直流偏移，小信号 ID 是，进一步注意，在这个特定示例中，它是什么？ae 乘以 BVD。这又是 ID。在这个示例中恰好就是这样。因此，我得到 ID 乘以 BVD。因此，对于我的输入，小 id，输出中的增量变化是 ID 乘以 B 乘以 VD。请注意，这是一个常数。

Notice that this is the DC offset in the output, and the small signal, ID is, further notice that in this particular example, what’s that? a e to the BVD. That’s simply ID again. It just happens to be that way in this example. So, I get ID times BVD. So, for my input, small id, my incremental change in the output is some ID times B times VD. And notice that this is a constant.

因为这是一个常数，所以我的小信号行为 ID 将与信号 VD（输入信号 VD）线性相关。好的，在最后三分钟，我想给你一个额外的见解。到目前为止，我们已经展示了如果我有一个偏移量和它上面的一个小变化，那么我的输出 ID 将与我的输入线性相关。现在让我们再看看这个东西。让我重写它。

And because that is a constant, my small signal behavior ID is going to be linearly related to the signal, VD, the input signal VD. OK, in the last three minutes, I’d like to give you one additional insight. So what we’ve shown so far is if I have an offset and a small change above it, then my output ID will be linearly related to my input. Now let’s stare at this thing again. Let me rewrite it.

它是某个常数 IDB 乘以 VD。那么，我们以前在哪里见过这样的表达式？好的，其中 ID 是某个常数乘以 VD。好的，记住，I 等于 V 除以 R：欧姆定律。我现在想向你展示的是我们如何不断简化我们的生活。

It’s some constant IDB times VD. So, where have we seen such an expression before? OK, where ID was some constant times VD. OK, remember, I equals V divided by R: Ohm’s law. What I want to show you now is how we constantly keep simplifying our lives.

当我们遇到一些复杂情况，事情变得难以分析时，作为工程师，我们会想出一些巧妙的技巧，使电路的分析和使用再次变得简单。因此，请注意，这类似于一些 1 乘以 RD VD 的电路，其中 RD 只是 IDB 的 1。我只是将其定义为 RD。这意味着我可以采用如下所示的非线性电路。

The moment we hit some complication and things get too painful to analyze, as engineers, we come up with some clever tricks to make an analysis and use of circuits simple again. And so, notice that this is similar to some, one by RD VD, where RD is simply one over IDB. I’m just defining this to be RD. And what that means is that I can take a nonlinear circuit that looks like this.

好的，我能做的就是用增量等效电路替换它，并构建所谓的小信号电路。我在这里只介绍它。几周后，我们将更详细地重新讨论该电路。

OK, and what I can do is replace this by its incremental equivalent, and build what is called a small signal circuit. And I’ll just introduce it here. And we will revisit the circuit in much more gory detail a couple of weeks from now.

因此，我可以做的是构建一个小信号电路，其中有所有小信号变量，并用一个简单的小电阻器（其值由 IDB 给出）替换非线性设备。好的，因此，我可以做的是采用我的非线性电路，对于小的增量变化，用这个等效的小信号电路替换该电路，然后再回到做简单的事情。谢谢。

So, what I can do is build a small signal circuit where I have all the small signal variables, and replace a nonlinear device by a simple little resistor whose value is given by IDB. OK, so therefore, what I can do is take my nonlinear circuit, and for small, incremental changes, replace that circuit with this equivalent small signal circuit, and go back to doing simple stuff again. Thank you.

Lec 8 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 8 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 52:26 https://youtube.com/watch?v=bEJ0-8pANA4

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 52:26 https://youtube.com/watch?v=bEJ0-8pANA4

好的，早上好。今天，我们将讨论放大器，它本身既是一种基本设备，也是非线性分析和小信号分析的一个真正关键示例。今天，我们将讨论相关源和放大器。首先，让我花几秒钟时间向大家介绍一下我们之前讲座中的一些要点。

All right, good morning. So today, we are going to talk about what is both a basic device in itself, the amplifier, and it also serves as a real key example of both nonlinear analysis and small signal analysis. So, today, dependent sources and amplifiers. So, let me first spend a few seconds just pointing out to you some of the key points from our previous lectures.

我还想指出，课程笔记中的每一章末尾都有总结。如果你快速浏览一下每章末尾的总结，你会发现它突出了每章的主要要点。它强调了什么是重要的，如果你必须记住几件事，那么要记住的是什么？

I also want to point out that each chapter in the course notes has a summary at the end of it. And if you take a quick scan of the summary at the end of each chapter, it highlights the major takeaway points from each chapter. It stresses what’s important, and if you have to remember a few things, what are those things to remember?

为了快速复习，我们讨论了一些基本元素：电阻器、电压源等。现在，您应该能够使用这些设备元素。然后我们讨论了节点方法，这是 6.002 的主力。如有疑问，请使用节点方法。好的，这适用于线性电路和非线性电路。

So, to quickly review, we talked about a few primitive elements: resistors, voltage sources, and so on. And by now, you should have the facility to play around with these device elements. And then we talked about the Node method, and this is kind of the workhorse of 6.002. When in doubt, use the Node method. OK, and this will work both for linear circuits and nonlinear circuits.

好的，所以如果你发现一个问题，或者如果你发现现实生活中需要分析的情况，那么第一步，你应该试着想想是否可以应用一些关键的直观快捷方法，叠加。我最喜欢的方法之一是戴维南方法、诺顿方法，或者涉及合成的方法，它可以非常快速地分析具有串联和并联电阻的电路。

OK, so if you see a problem, or if you see a situation in real life that requires analysis, then as a first step, you should try to think of whether you could apply some of the key intuitive shortcut methods, superposition. One of my favorites, the Thevenin method, the Norton method, or the method that involves composition, that is very quickly analyzing circuits that have resistors in series and parallel.

好的，如果你能应用这些快速、直观、快捷的方法之一，那就去做吧。如果你不能，那么通常你可以求助于节点方法，而不管电路是线性的还是非线性的。所以上周的重点是非线性方法或非线性电路，我们在第一堂课上讨论了节点方法的直接应用，这给了我们一堆我们必须求解的非线性方程。

OK, so if you can apply one of these quick, intuitive, shortcut methods, go do so. If you can’t, then usually you can resort to the Node method irrespective of whether the circuit is linear or nonlinear. So the last week was focused on the nonlinear method or nonlinear circuits, and we spent the first lecture talking about a straightforward application of the Node method, which gave us a bunch of nonlinear equations that we had to solve.

在上一节课中，我们讨论了小信号技巧。我们说的是，如果你观察整个非线性电路空间，那么在这个空间中，如果我们关注工作点的小变化、小扰动，那么即使是非线性电路在那个小范围内的行为也会是线性的。所以这就是小信号方法。

In the last lecture, we talked about the small signal trick. What we said is if you look at the whole space of nonlinear circuits, then within that space, if we focus on small variations, small perturbations about an operating point, then even the behavior of nonlinear circuits in that small regime would be linear. So small signal method.

举个例子，我向你们展示了如何利用高度非线性的设备，比如车库门开启器 LED，并利用它构建一个可以传输音乐的非常不错的发射器。只要我们保持信号较小，并在传输曲线相对平滑的区域中操作设备，并且我适当地偏置或设置操作点，我就会得到线性的小信号响应。好的。

And as an example, I showed you how I could take a highly nonlinear device like the garage door opener LED, and using that, build a pretty nice transmitter that would transmit music. And as long as we kept the signal small, and operated the device in a region where its transfer curve was relatively smooth, and I biased, or set the operating point appropriately, I would get a linear, small signal response. OK.

所以今天，我们要做几件事。我们将研究依赖源。这方面的阅读材料是课程笔记的第 2.6 节。依赖源将成为您工具箱中的新元素。我们还将研究放大器，放大器在课程笔记的第 7.1 节和第 7.2 节中。所以，在我开始研究依赖源之前，我非常相信用现实世界的例子来激励事物。

So today, we’re going to do a couple things. We’re going to look at dependent sources. And the reading for this is section 2.6 of your course notes. And, the dependent source will be a new element in your tool chest. We will also do amplifiers, and amplifiers are in section 7.1 and section 7.2 of your course notes. So, before I begin with dependent sources, I’m just a huge believer in motivating things with real world examples.

好的，让我先从动机开始：为什么我们需要放大器？为什么我们需要做这样的事情？或者我们为什么要费心去做？花几分钟时间让你真正认识到放大是根本。好的，它就像高脂肪薯片之类的东西一样是生活的基础。那么，让我们在这里举一些基本的例子。首先，让我谈谈，为什么我们需要放大信号。为什么要放大？

OK, so let me start by motivating: why we need an amplifier? Why do we need to do things like this? Or why do we even bother? And, spend a few minutes really getting you to appreciate that amplification is fundamental. OK, it’s as foundational to life as high fat potato chips and stuff like that. So, let’s do some basic examples here. So first, let me talk about, why do we need to amplify signals. Why amplify?

我们为什么要关心制造放大器？放大器就像一个小盒子，输入一些小信号。然后我得到一个更大的输出。在这个例子中，这可能是一个摆幅为 10 mV 的电压，在这种情况下，输出可能是另一个摆幅为 100 mV 的电压。

Why do we care about building an amplifier? So, an amplifier, think of a little box, and apply some sort of small input. And I get a larger output. In this example, this may be a voltage with a swing of 10 mV, and in this case, the output might be another voltage with a swing of, say, 100 mV.

通常，放大器除了输入和输出、输入端口和输出端口之外，还可能包含电源端口，这样我就可以为放大器供电，因为通常作为放大器信号，我也在寻找功率增益，即输出提供的功率的增加。

And commonly, the amplifier, in addition to an input and an output, input port and output port, may also contain the power port, OK, so that I can apply a power supply to the amplifier because commonly as an amplifier signal, I’m looking for a power gain as well, an increase in the power provided by the output.

这就是放大器的抽象定义，让我们看一个例子来说明为什么我们可能需要它。假设我有一个很小的有用信号，假设该信号的峰峰值为 1 mV。我想通过电线将信号传输到其他点。但是假设在这个环境中，我得到了一堆噪音，这些噪音来自一个嘈杂的环境。

So, that’s an abstract definition of an amplifier, and let’s take a look at an example of why we may need this. So let’s say I have a small, useful signal, and let’s say the signal has 1 mV peak to peak. And, I’m looking to transmit the signal over a wire to some other point. But let’s say that in this environment, I get a bunch of noise that is in a noisy environment.

在这种环境下，我们假设可能会叠加一些噪声。如果我有一个 1 mV 的信号和 10 mV 的噪声，那么最终的输出结果将是这样的。而且很难将我的 1 mV 信号与大量噪声区分开来。

And in this environment, let’s assume that some noise may get superimposed. And if I have a 1 mV signal, and 10 mV of noise, then what I end up with at the output is something that looks like this. And it’s really hard to distinguish my 1 mV signal from that large amount of noise.

另一方面，如果我执行以下操作，如果我获取信号并将信号传递给放大器，并且我将信号放大为相同信号的更大版本，假设在这种特殊情况下峰峰值信号为 100 mV。

On the other hand, if I do the following, if I took the signal and passed the signal to an amplifier, and I amplified the signal to be a much larger version of the same signal, let’s say in this particular situation 100 mV peak to peak signal.

好的，我将信号放大了 100 倍。好的，假设它是一个线性放大器，我将信号线性放大到 100 mV，那么在这种情况下，如果在此基础上有噪音，它将更难辨别。信号将看起来像这样。好的，我的 10 mV 噪音会加到它上面。但是，这仍然相当不错。我仍然可以识别输入。

OK, so I magnified the signal by a factor of 100. OK, let’s say it’s a linear amplifier, I linearly amplified signal to be 100 mV, then in that case, if I had a noise on top of this, it’s going to be less discernible. The signal will look like this. OK, my 10 mV noise would add on to it. But, this is still pretty decent. I can still recognize the input.

这就是放大的一种应用。如果我需要将某物从 A 点发送到 B 点作为模拟信号，那么放大的信号比小信号更不容易受到噪声攻击。毫不奇怪，日常生活中使用的大量设备都内置有放大器。所以，拿一部小手机来说，几乎每部手机都包含一个放大器。

And so, this is one application of amplification. If I need to send something from point A to point B as an analog signal, then an amplified signal is less prone to noise attacks than a small signal. Not surprisingly, a large number of devices that are used in everyday life have amplifiers built into them. So, get a little cell phone, and virtually every single cell phone contains an amplifier.

顺便说一句，这是一部全数字手机。这是京瓷的，我现在忘记了号码。它是完全数字化的。好吧，虽然他们说它是完全数字化的，但事实证明，很大一部分电路是模拟的，所以数字化是一种营销术语，用来表示这款手机有些特别。但请记住，它有很多模拟的东西。所以，这是我手机上的小天线。

By the way, this is an all digital cell phone. It’s a Kyocera, I forget the number now. It’s completely digital. OK, although they say it’s completely digital, it turns out that a significant fraction of the circuitry is analog, in particular, so digital is sort of a marketing term to say that there’s something special about this. But remember, there’s a bunch of analog stuff. So, here’s my little antenna from the cell phone.

好的，通常，信号从手机天线发出时，首先发生的事情是，看看手机电路或手机系统，它看起来像这样，好的，这个，可能有一个标签 LNA。如果有人猜一下 LNA 代表什么？那是什么？线性放大器。这很好。所以这就是 LNA。很接近。A 是正确的。它是放大器。

OK, and typically the first thing that happens to a signal as it comes out of the antenna in your cell phone is, look at cell phone circuits, or cell phone systems would be something that looks like this, OK, this, and may have a label LNA. If someone were to take a guess at what LNA might stand for? What’s that? Linear amplifier. That’s pretty good. So that’s LNA. Close enough. A is correct. It’s amplifier.

L 和 N 代表什么？低噪声。好的，这代表低噪声放大器。因此，我在这里得到一个非常小的信号，然后低噪声放大器放大信号。在真正的手机中，以及在 802.11b、802.11a 或 802.11g 无线网卡中，情况也一样。天线、低噪声放大器，然后你可能要进行一系列处理。通常，你会进行一系列模拟处理。

What does L and N stand for? Low noise. OK, so this stands for low noise amplifier. So, I get a really rinky dinky small signal here, and then the low noise amplifier amplifies a signal. And in real cell phones, and for that matter, in your 802.11b, or 802.11a, or 802.11g wireless cards, same thing. Antenna, low noise amplifier, and then you may have a bunch of processing. And commonly, you have a bunch of analog processing.

然后，将模拟信号转换为数字信号。好的，我记得上周我问过班上的某个人，我们如何将信号从 A 点传输到 B 点而不会受到太多噪音的影响，他说，哦，用数字信号。好主意。好的，如果我用数字信号，我就可以传输信号而不受噪音的影响。

And then, you convert the analog to a digital signal. OK, I recall last week I asked somebody in class here, how would we transmit the signal from point A to point B without it being impacted way too much by noise, and he said, oh, go digital. Good point. OK, so if I go digital, I can transfer the signal without noise being a real factor.

但是模拟数字转换器需要将信号强度设为给定值，然后才能将其分解为数字电平。好的，放大器是非常基本的。好的，在这种情况下，几十微伏的信号可能被放大到足够大的值，以便可以进一步处理。所以，这就是放大在模拟域中的应用。

But the analog to digital converters need the signal strengths to be a given value before it can chop it up into digital levels. OK, so an amplifier is very fundamental. OK, and so in this case, what may be a signal of a few tens of microvolts to be amplified to some large enough value that it can be further processed. So, that’s application of amplification in the analog domain.

让我来谈谈数字领域的放大。所以，这是在模拟领域。这种放大是在我既有模拟又有数字的领域。好的，现在让我谈谈数字领域的放大，好吗？我要说的是，放大绝对是数字领域的基础。好的，如果我没有基本的放大，数字抽象就不会发生。

Let me talk about amplification in the digital domain. So, that’s in the analog domain. This amplification is in the domain that I have both analog and digital. OK, and now let me talk about amplification in the digital domain, OK? I’m going to argue that amplification is absolutely foundational to the digital domain. OK, the digital abstraction would not occur if I did not have basic amplification.

好的，接下来的 1 分 37 秒我会向你证明这一点，好吗？那就开始吧。假设我有一个非常简单的数字系统，这个系统只包含一对反相器。如果我在这里发送一个 1，这里就会是一个 0，这里就会是一个 1，这是一个非常简单、平凡的数字系统。这是输入。这是输出。

OK, and the next minute and 37 seconds I will prove that to you, OK? So, let’s do so. So, let’s suppose I have a very simple digital system, and the system simply contains a pair of inverters. So, if I send a one here, it’s a zero here and a one here, which is a very simple, trivial, digital system. And here’s the input. Here’s the output.

我们说过，要使这种数字系统正常工作，它们必须遵循静态规则。好吧，我们的信号和电路必须遵循规则，才能协同工作。我们描述的规则包括遵循某些电压阈值的信号，以便系统中的所有组件都能就什么构成零、什么构成一达成一致，好吗？

And we said that for digital systems of this sort to work, they have to follow a static discipline. OK, our signals and our circuits must follow a discipline for them all to work together. And, the discipline we described comprised of signals adhering to certain voltage thresholds so that all the components in the system could agree on what comprised a zero, and what comprised a one, OK?

因此，我们这样做的方式是，我们说您将有一个阈值，称为 VIH，V 输入高，另一个阈值称为 VIL，V 输入低。好的，我们说这个电路必须将高于 VIH（例如 3 V）的信号识别为 1，同时，任何电压电平低于 VIL（例如 2 伏）的信号都应被识别为 0。这是输入约束。

So the way we did that was we said that you would have a threshold called VIH, V input high, and another threshold called VIL, V input low. OK, and we said that this circuit must recognize signals that are higher than VIH, 3 V for example as a one, and simultaneously, any signal that has a voltage level less than VIL, say, two volts, should be recognized as a zero. That was the input constraint.

在输出方面，它有一组类似的约束，我们对设备有更严格的约束，我们说输出必须满足输出低约束和输出高约束。这意味着，要使这个电路被称为满足静态约束的良好数字电路，这里的信号应该被识别为 1。

On the output, it had a similar set of constraints, where we had tougher constraints on devices, where we said that the output had to satisfy a output low constraint, output high constraint. What this said is that for this circuit to be called a good digital circuit that satisfies the static discipline, signals that were ones here should be recognized as such.

如果我输出的是 1，那么信号电平应该高于 VOH。同样，如果信号为 0，那么它应该低于 VOL。例如，这可能是 2 V，这可能是 3 V，这可能是 4 V，这可能是 1 V。

And if I am producing a one as an output, then the signal level should be higher than VOH. Similarly, if the signal’s a zero, then it should be less than VOL. So as an example, this may be 2 V, this may be 3 V, and this may be 4 V, and this may be 1 V.

好的，那么输入时，我应该将 2 V 及以下识别为零，但在输出时我必须产生一个非常非常低的值，即 1 V。因此，我有一些噪声裕度。例如，如果我绘制了输入/输出图，那么我在这里得到 VIL，在这里得到 VIH。这是时间。这将构成一个有效的数字信号：零、一、零、一，等等。

OK, so input, I should recognize 2 V and less as a zero, but at the output I have to produce a very, very low value, 1 V. So, I have some noise margin. So as an example, say if I made a plot of the input/output, so I get my VIL here and VIH here. This is time. This would comprise a valid digital signal: zero, one, zero, one, and so on.

好的，现在，我在输出端有了更严格的约束。我会有 VOL、VOH。所以，在输出端，好的，我需要将 1 和 0 拉得更远，以便获得噪声容限，我们小电路的相应信号将如下所示。对，如果这是一个有效输入，那么这将是相应的有效输出。好的，我还需要多说吗？

OK, now, I had a tougher set of constraints at the output. I would have VOL, VOH. So, at the output, OK, I’m required to stretch the ones and zeros to be further apart from each other so that I get noise margin, and the corresponding signal for our little circuit there would look like so. Right, if this is a valid input, then this would be the corresponding, valid output. OK, and need I say more?

好的，您可以直观地看到，这里发生了放大，原因是 VOL 被选择为小于 VIL，而 VOH 高于 VIH。因此，信号必须被拉伸。信号必须被放大。好的，系统工作所需的最小放大率是多少？最小放大率是如果我有一个看起来像这样的信号。好的，这几乎略微超过了 VIL、VIH 水平。

OK, you can see that, intuitively, look, there’s amplification happening here, and the reason is that VOL is chosen to be less than VIL, and VOH is higher than VIH. So therefore, the signal has to be stretched. The signal has to be amplified. OK, and what’s the minimum amplification needed for the system to work? The minimum amplification is if I had a signal that looked like this. OK, that barely skimmed the VIL, VIH level.

好的，那么如果信号峰峰值这么高，VIH 减去 VIL，输出端的绝对最小信号是多少？它看起来会像这样。好的，几乎略过 VOL 和 VOH，好的，所以相应的输出电平将是 VOH 减去 VOL。好的，所以这是我的数字电路必须提供的绝对最小放大倍数。好的，请注意，VOH 大于 VIH。VOL 小于 VIL。

OK, so if signal were this high peak to peak, VIH minus VIL, and what’s the absolute minimum signal at the output? It would look something like this. OK, barely skimming VOL and VOH, OK, so the corresponding output level would be VOH minus VOL. OK, so this is the absolute minimum amplification that my digital circuit has to provide. OK, and notice, VOH is larger than VIH. VOL is smaller than VIL.

因此，这个数量需要大于 1。好的，我已经向你们展示了一个简单、图形化、直观的解释，这是一个稍微更正式的证明，即使是数字电路也确实需要内置放大功能，如果它要满足有效的静态学科。是吗？是的。问题是，这和增益一样吗？好问题。是的，放大这个术语有很多变体。你可以说是增益。你可以说是放大。

Therefore, this quantity needs to be greater than one. OK, so I’ve shown you both a simple, graphical, intuitive explanation, and this is a slightly more formal proof that even the digital circuit really requires to have amplification built into it, if it is to satisfy valid static disciplines. Yes? Yes. The question is, is that the same as gain? Good question. Yes, the term amplification has many, many variants. You could say gain. You could say amplification.

您可以说信号强度增加，等等。事实上，当谈到低噪声放大器时，人们有时会谈论在输入级使用低噪声、高增益放大器。好的，让我在这里暂停一下，谈谈动机。所以，我相信我已经从各个方面激发了动机：纯模拟、模拟/数字和数字。好的，我已经涵盖了这里的所有基础知识。因此，我们需要放大。

You could say increase in signal strength, and so on and so forth. And in fact, when talking about low noise amplifiers, people sometimes talk about having the low noise, high gain amplifier at the input stage. OK, so let me pause there in terms of motivation. So, I believe I’ve motivated every which way: pure analog, analog/digital, and digital. OK, so I’ve covered every single base here. And so, we need amplification.

好的，让我们看看如何构建一种基本的、原始的设备，即放大器。不过，在我们这样做之前，让我先绕个弯。当我向你们展示如何构建放大器时，为了方便，我引入了一种新设备，一种新元素，称为从属源。

OK, so let’s look at how to build a fundamental, primitive device called the amplifier. Before we do that, however, let me take a quick detour. It will be convenient for me, as I show you how to build an amplifier, to introduce a new device, a new element, called the dependent source.

好的，让我介绍一种新设备，加入你们的设备库，以及电阻器，你们了解了 MOSFET、开关、电压源、电流源，现在又了解了从属源。从属源看起来像这样，好的，有一个输出端口，还有一个控制端口。因此，从属源的最简单形式有两个端口：一个输入端口和一个输出端口。

OK, let me introduce a new device for your arsenal of devices, along with resistors, You learned about a MOSFET, a switch, voltage source, current source, and now a dependent source. So, a dependent source looks like this, OK, has an output port, and has a control port. So, a dependent source in its simplest form has two ports: an input port and an output port.

请记住，端口是方便的终端配对，我将信号应用于此类终端对。但这是依赖源的抽象图，为了更具体一点，让我向您展示一个依赖源的示例。假设这是我的输入，我为输入标记了终端变量。VC 是施加到输入的电压，IC 是流入此终端的电流。

Remember, a port is a convenient pairing of terminals, and I apply signals to such terminal pairs. But this is a abstract diagram for a dependent source, and to get a little bit more specific, let me show you an example of a dependent source. So, let’s say, here’s my input, and I label the terminal variables for the input. VC is the voltage applied to the input, and IC is the current into this terminal here.

这是从属源的符号。就像电流源或电压源周围有一个圆圈一样，从属源的相应符号是这样的。例如，这个例子是一个从属电流源。我可以应用相应的输出变量 I0，OK，我可以说电流 I 是某个函数。

And, here is the symbol for the dependent source. Much like a current source or a voltage source has a circle around it, the corresponding symbol for a dependent source is like so. So this example, for instance, is a dependent, current source. I can apply the corresponding output variables, I0, OK, and I can say that the current, I, is some function.

在这个例子中，我设计了一个示例，即流过电流源的电流 I 是输入电压或控制电压 VC 的某个函数。请注意，流过电流源的电流，流过该电流源的电流 I 是另一个变量的某个函数。在这个例子中，它是控制端口上的电压。毫不奇怪，这种设备被称为电压控制电流源或 VCCS。

In this example, I’ve designed the example that the current through the current source, I, is some function of the input voltage or the control voltage, VC. OK, so notice that the current through a current source, the current through this current source, I, is some function of another variable. OK, in this example, it’s the voltage across its control port. Not surprisingly, this device is called a voltage controlled current source or a VCCS.

因此，同样，我也可以设计其他形式的电源。你可以认为这是一个电压控制输出电流的设备。你可以考虑所有其他组合，电流控制电流、电压控制电压、电流控制电压等等。另一个例子是，我给你另一个依赖源，在这种情况下，我的输出电流由输入电流 VC 控制。而不是 IC。

So, in like manner I can also devise other forms of sources. You can think of this is a device where a voltage controls an output current. You can think of all other combinations, current controlling current, voltage controlling voltage, current controlling voltage, and so on. So, another example, I give you another dependent source, and in this situation, my output current is controlled by an input current, VC. IC rather.

我声称，对于这个，I 是电流 IC 的某个函数。好的，这是另一个从属源，其输出端口的输出电流与电流 IC 相关。这是一个电流控制的电流源。好的，这是一个电流控制的电流源。如果我有很多空闲时间，并且想消磨时间，我会坐下来为您绘制其他类型的从属源。

And I claim that I for this one is some function of a current, IC. OK, it’s another dependent source where the output current for its output port is related to the current, IC. And, this is a current controlled current source. OK, it’s a current controlled current source. And, if I had lots of time on my hands, and I was wanting to kill time, I’d sit around drawing for you, other types of dependent sources.

我会为您绘制一个电流控制电压源，我也可以为您绘制一个电压控制电压源。好的，这是此类电源的抽象图。那么，让我们举几个涉及此类元素的例子。

I would draw for you a current controlled voltage sourced, and I could also draw for you a voltage controlled voltage source. OK, so that’s an abstract diagram for such a source. And so, let’s do a few examples involving elements like this.

首先，为了让你建立起直觉，让我先做一个非常简单的电路，包括一个独立的电流源，好吧，这样我们就可以回顾一下我们到目前为止所做的事情。假设我有一些电阻器，我有一个电流为 I naught 的标准电流源。这是一个独立的电流源。还记得圆圈吗？

To begin, just so you can build up your intuition, let me start by doing a very simple circuit, involving an independent current source, OK, just so we can relate back to what we’ve been doing so far. So, let’s say I have some resistor, and I have a standard current source with current I nought. This is an independent current source. Remember the circle?

还有一个电阻 R，假设我关心电阻两端的电压。好的，电流 I nought 流过它。因此，我可以很快地将 VR 写成 I0 R。好的，它是电流 I nought 流过电阻时电阻两端的压降。好的，这就是你习惯的做法。相应地，我可以用依赖电流源来举一个例子。

And, some resistor, R, and let’s say I care about the voltage across the resistor. OK, so I have a current I nought flowing through it. So, I can very quickly write down VR as, simply, I0 R. OK, it’s the drop across the resistor when a current I nought flows through it. OK, so this is what you’ve been used to doing. Correspondingly, I can do an example with a dependent current source.

举个例子，我将使用电压控制电流源。电压控制电流源是一种依赖电流源，其输出电流取决于施加在电流源控制端口的电压。那么让我建立一个小电路。这是我的电流。假设它是控制端口的 VC IC，同样，假设我的电流 I 是控制端口电压的某个函数。

And, as an example, I’ll use a voltage controlled current source. OK, a voltage controlled current source is a dependent current source whose output current depends on the voltage applied at the control port of the current source. So let me build a little circuit. OK, so here’s my current. And let’s say it’s VC IC for the control port, and similarly, let’s say my current I here is some function of the control port voltage.

具体来说，假设有某个 K 除以 VC，某个函数。好的，可以构建各种依赖源，这是一个假设的设备，其输出电流以以下方式与输入有数学关系。那么，让我构建一个以下形式的电路。那么，让我们添加电阻器 R，这就是我的电路，好吗？和之前一样，让我弄清楚 VR 是什么。

And let’s say, to be specific, there is some K over VC, some function. OK, there are a variety of dependent sources that can be built, and here’s a hypothetical device where the output current is mathematically related to the input in the following manner. So, let me build a circuit of the following form. So, let’s add the resistor, R, and here’s my circuit, OK? And, as before, let me look to figuring out what VR is.

因此，请注意，我必须在输入端提供一些电压，以便输出可以依赖于输入，因为现在我不知道这里的输入是什么。所以我要做的就是让我在这里应用 VR。好的，让我建立这个连接。好的，让我从这里到这里建立连接。我所做的是在从属电流源的控制端口应用 VR。

So, notice that I have to supply some voltage at the input so that the output can depend on the input because right now I don’t know what the input here. So what I’ll do is let me apply VR over here. OK, so let me make this connection. OK, let me make the connection from here to here. What I’ve done is I’ve applied VR at the control port of the dependent current source.

好的，我经常画这样的电路。这看起来很乱。我经常会这样画电路：R，VR。好的，简短的电路图看起来是这样的。这是一张完整的图，我向你展示了控制端口的明确连接，但很多时候，当控制端口对电路没有任何其他影响时，你可以消除，不要明确显示控制端口。

OK, and I often draw a circuit like this. This looks pretty messy. I will often draw the circuit like so: R, VR. OK, short form circuit drawing would look like this. This is a complete drawing that I show you the explicit connections of the control port, but oftentimes, when the control port does not have any other impact in the circuit, you can eliminate, don’t explicitly show the control port.

相反，您可以简单地显示输出电流对您所想的任何电路变量的依赖性。因此，您可以像这样画出菱形，并看到其电流是 VR 的某个函数。在这种情况下，VR 是 K 除以 VR，好吗？好的，让我们继续分析这里的这个小电路，看看这会给我们带来什么。我们的目标是像以前一样找出值 VR。

Rather, you can simply show the dependence of the output current on whatever circuit variable you have in mind. So, you can draw the diamond like this, and see its current is some function of VR. VR in this is case is K divided by VR, OK? OK, so let’s go ahead and analyze this little circuit here, and look at what this might give us. Our goal, as before, is to find out the value, VR.

因此，在这种情况下，我们将 Node 方法应用于此节点，并将流入该节点的电流总和为零。好的，因此将流入该节点的电流总和为零。流下的电流只是 VR 除以 R。好的，这等于流出节点的电流。因此，这等于 VR 的 F。

So, in this case, let’s apply the Node method to this node, and sum the currents into that node to be zero. OK, so sum the currents going into that node to be zero. The current going down is simply VR divided by R. OK, and that is equal to the current that is going out of the node. And so that is equal to F of VR.

我知道 VR 的 F 等于 K 除以 VR。好的，这是 Node 方法的简单应用。然后，我在左侧收集 VR，得到 VR 平方等于 K 乘以 R，好的，VR 就是 KR 的平方根。好了：我完成了。

And I know that F of VR is given by K divided by VR. OK, a simple application of the Node method. So then, I collect VR’s on the left hand side, and I get VR squared is K times R, OK, and VR is simply the square root of KR. There you go: I’m done.

好的，我已经将节点法应用到这个，当需要计算出这里的电流时，我只需反映出它依赖于 VR 的事实，然后我就可以继续解决电路问题。请记住，电路行业的主力，节点法，如有疑问，请应用它。它很有效。请注意，这是一个非线性电路。好的，依赖关系是非线性的，我得到的响应是这样的。

OK, I’ve gone ahead an applied the Node method to this, and when have to figure out the current here, I simply reflect the fact that it depends on VR like so, and I just go ahead and solve the circuit. Remember, the workhorse of the circuit industry, the Node method, when in doubt, apply it. It simply works. And notice, this is a nonlinear circuit. OK, the dependence is nonlinear, and I get the response like so.

因此，代入一些数字，假设 K 为每伏 10 的负 3 次方安培，R 为一千欧姆，那么我可以代入这些数字，这里的千欧姆与 10 的负 3 次方取消，得到 VR 等于 1V。好的，这只是说，如果我建立一个这样的电路，那么这里的电压就是 1V。

So, to plug in some numbers, supposing K was 10 to the minus 3 amperes per volt, and R was one kilo ohm, then I can plug the numbers in and the kilo here cancels with the 10 to the minus 3, and I get VR equals 1 V. OK, this simply says, if I build a circuit like this, then this voltage here will be 1 V.

所以，再说一次，只要您记住从属源只是另一个小电路元素，并且您通常只绘制从属源的输出端口，并反映控制影响电流的方式，这就足够了，并且您可以通过应用 Node 方法获得您感兴趣的变量。让我们再举一个例子，另一个有趣的电流源，一个电压控制的电流源，然后以这种方式查看它。

So, again, as long as you remember that the dependent source is simply another little circuit element, OK, and you usually draw just the output port for dependent sources, and reflect the way that the control affects the current, that’ll suffice, and you get, through the application of the Node method, the variable you’re interested in. Let’s do another example, OK, of another fun current source, a voltage controlled current source, and look at it this way.

假设我有一个电阻，还有一个电流源，一个电阻 RL，然后我在这里应用一个 VS。记住这个简写形式；这只是在该节点和地之间应用一个电源 VS。好的，假设通过设备的电流 IV 是其控制端口电流的某个函数。好的，所以我不打算向你展示这一点。

So, let’s say I have a resistor, and I have a current source, a resistor, RL, and this goes to some, I apply a VS here. Remember this short form notation; that’s simply applying a supply VS between that node and the ground. OK, and let us say the current IV through the device is some function of the current at its control port. OK, so I’m not going to show you that.

但请记住，设备已经看起来像这样，这里有一个控制端口。我不会向你展示它。假设我在输入端口施加一些电压 VI。我们经常不显示输入端口的原因是，对于许多实际依赖源，输入对电路没有其他影响。因此，例如，在这种情况下，输入具有无限大的电阻。

But remember that the device already looks like this, that there is a control port here. I’m not showing that to you. And let us say that I apply some voltage, VI, to the input port. The reason we often don’t show the input port is for many practical dependent sources, the input has no other effect on the circuit. So, for example, in this case, the input has infinite resistance looking in.

因此，如果我在这里应用 VI，它不会从 VI 中汲取任何电流。我只是施加电压 VI。除了控制电流 ID 的方式外，它不会以任何其他方式影响电路。因此，假设电流 ID 是 VI 的某种函数，因为 VI 是在控制端口应用的。好的，正如我之前指出的那样，我经常只是为了清楚起见，明确显示这个依赖源。

So therefore, if I apply a VI here, it doesn’t draw any current from VI. I simply apply the voltage, VI. It doesn’t affect the circuit in any other way except in terms of how it controls the current ID. So let’s say the current ID is some function of VI because VI is applied at the control port. OK, and as I pointed out before, I oftentimes, just for clarity, just to show this dependent source explicitly.

好的，让我们来举例。正如我所说，我将选择 ID 为 VI 的 F，让我们在这里选择一些特定参数。假设它是 K 乘以 2 VI 减 1，两者均为平方。好的，假设这对于小于等于 1 伏的 VI 成立。我们还假设对于小于 1 伏的 VI，ID 等于零。

OK, so let’s work the example. So as I said, I’m going to choose ID to be F of VI, and let’s pick some specific parameters here. Let’s say it’s K by two VI minus one, both squared. OK, and let’s say this is true for VI less than equal to one volt. And let us also say that ID equals zero for VI less than one volt.

好的，它是一个依赖源，它可以对输入具有各种形式的依赖性。我刚刚举了一个假设的或目前假设的依赖源的例子，通过它的电流与输入使用平方律关系，只要 VI 大于 1，电流就是 VI 减 1 的平方。如果 VI 小于 1，那么电流就是零，它会关闭。

OK, it’s a dependent source, and it can have various forms of dependences on the input. And, I just picked an example of some hypothetical, or as yet, hypothetical dependent source, the current through which is related to the input using a square law relation, VI minus one all squared as long as VI is greater than one. And if VI is less than one, then the current is simply zero, it shuts off.

所以，我可以继续应用。假设我想找出 V0 与 VI 的关系。我关心的是找出 V0。V0 是此节点相对于地的电压。好的，所以这是一个比你在这里看到的电路稍微复杂一些的电路。所以，让我们继续做这个例子。
