So, I can go ahead and apply. So, let’s say I want to find out V0 versus VI. So, I care about finding out V0. V0 is the voltage of this node with respect to ground. OK, so it’s a slightly more complicated circuit than you saw up here, than you saw up there. So, let’s go ahead and do this example.

首先应用电路业务的主力——节点方法，让我们从对 VI 进行此操作开始。让我们首先对大于 1 的 VI 进行此操作，请注意，对于不同范围的 VI，此行为是不同的。因此，让我们首先对大于或等于 1 的 VI 进行此操作并应用节点方法。节点方法表示将进入此节点的电流相加；我们知道此节点的电压。它是 VI。

Start by applying the workhorse of the circuits business, the Node method, and let’s start with doing this for VI. Let’s first do it for VI greater than one, notice the behavior of this is different for different ranges of VI. So let’s first do it for VI greater than or equal to one and apply the Node method. Node method says sum the currents going into this node; we know the voltage at this node. It’s VI.

我们知道这个节点的电压。它是 VS。好吧，唯一未知的是 V 0。那么，让我们继续写出该节点的节点方程。所以，电流上升，让我简单地将上升的电流等同于此处特定节点提供的电流。

We know the voltage at this node. It’s VS. OK, the only unknown is V nought. And so, let’s go ahead and write the node equations for that node. So, the current going up, let me simply equate the current going up to the current that has been supplied by this particular node here.

而且，这应该等于它们两个之和应该为零，上升电流加上下降电流之和应该为零。所以，我得到 V0 减去 VS 除以 R。这就是上升电流。另外，下降电流之和必须为零，加上 ID 之和必须为零。而 ID 将是 K 除以 2 VI 减去 1 的平方。这必须等于零。

And, that should equate that the two of them should sum to zero, the current going up plus the current going down should sum to zero. So, I get V0 minus VS divided by R. That’s the current going up. Plus, the current going down must sum to zero, plus ID must sum to zero. And ID is going to be K divided by two VI minus one all squared. That must equal zero.

直接应用节点方法，此节点的上升电流加上下降电流应等于零，因为离开节点的总电流必须为零，好吗？所以我可以继续简化它，将其乘以，我在这里称之为 RL。因此，将其乘以 RL，并将所有这些移到另一侧，这样我得到 VS 除以 RL，将其乘以 RL。

Straightforward application of Node method, current going up plus the current going down at this node should equal zero because the total current leaving the node must be zero, OK? So I can go ahead and simplify this, multiply it throughout by, I call this RL here. So, multiply it throughout by RL, and move all of this to the other side, so I get VS divided by RL, multiply it throughout by RL.

我在这边得到 VS。我将这个项移到另一边。这变成一个减号。RL 在这里相乘，所以我得到了 KRL。这就是我得到的表达式。V 零是 VS 减去 KRL 除以两倍 VI 减一的平方。让我在这边画一个方框，因为出于各种原因，我将在 6.002 中引用这个方程的次数比地球上任何其他方程都要多。

I get VS at this side. I take this term to the other side. This becomes a minus. RL multiplies here, so I get KRL. That’s the expression I get. V nought is VS minus KRL divided by two times VI minus one all squared. Let me put a box around this because I will be referring to this more times in 6.002 for a variety of reasons than probably any other equation on Earth.

好的，这是你第一次看到它。你在这里看到了它。好的，记下来。每次你在测验中看到它时，你都会微笑，你会发现为什么它在 6.002 中经常出现。所以，我只给你几秒钟的时间来品味你 6.002 生活中的这个重要时刻。好吧，好吧，其实很简单。我的意思是，真的没什么。

OK, this is the first time you saw it. You saw it here. OK, mark it down. You’ll smile every other time you look at it in quizzes, and you will find out why this comes up very often in 6.002. So, I’ll just give you a few seconds to savor this big moment in your 6.002 life. All right, OK, so it’s pretty simple actually. I mean, there’s really not much.

很多东西只是 Node 方法的简单应用，结果就出来了。就是这么简单。所以，对于 V 零，我应用了 Node 方法，我得到了这个非线性电路的 V 零。我也可以得到小于 1 的 VI。对于小于 1 的 VI，当 VI 小于 1 时，会发生什么？ID 为零。好的，由于 ID 为零，因此可以将其视为开路。

A lot of this stuff is just a plain old, simple application of the Node method, and things just fall out. It’s just so simple. So, the V nought, I apply the Node method, I get V nought for this nonlinear circuit. I can also it for VI less than one. For VI less than one, when VI is less than one, what happens? ID is zero. OK, since ID is zero, think of this as an open circuit.

好的，所以 RL 上没有电压降。而且，这个电压 V nought 等于 VS。所以，我喜欢用图片来看待事物。我不是那种喜欢用方程式的人。我更喜欢用图形来表达。所以，让我画一个小图来展示 V nought 是如何的，看看 V nought 的形式，然后让我们更仔细地研究一下这个小系统。

OK, so there’s no voltage drop across RL. And, this voltage V nought is equal to VS. So, I like to see things in pictures. I’m not an equations kind of person. I’m much more of a graphical person. So, let me draw a little graph to show how V nought, to see the form of V nought, and then let’s study that little system a little bit more carefully.

这是第七页，我们为您绘制了 V nought 与 VI 的关系图。让我们来看看这个非常简单的电路是什么样子的。它什么都没有。它有一个连接到电源的 RL 电阻和一个从属电流源，我在输入端施加了一些电压 VI。这是一个非常非常简单的电路。所以，让我们看看。只要 VI 小于一，输出就保持在 VS。

So, this is page seven, and we plot V nought versus VI for you. And let’s take a look at how this really simple circuit looks. This has got nothing. It’s got an RL resistor connected to a supply, and a dependent current source, and I apply some voltage VI at the input. It’s a very, very simple circuit. So, let’s see. So as long as VI is less than one, the output stays at VS.

好的，这很直观，对吧？只要这里的电流为零，这就像开路一样。如果这是开路，那么实际上，V nought 就是电压 VS。V nought 只是出现在这里。如果您想通过 KVL 和 KCL 进行计算，请继续。VS 减去 RL 乘以电流等于 V nought，电流为零，所以是的。所以，这只是 VS。

OK, that makes intuitive sense, right? As long as the current here is zero, this is like an open circuit here. If this is an open circuit, then effectively, V nought is simply the voltage VS. V nought simply appears here. If you want to grunge through KVL and KCL, go ahead. VS minus RL times the current is V nought, and the current is zero so it’s, yes. So, this is simply VS.

当 VI 超过 1 伏时，有趣的事情就开始发生了。好的，当 V 0 超过 1 伏时，这个等式适用，因为 VI 大于 1。这个等式适用。并且，当 VI 为 1 时，1 减 1 等于 0。这个项被抵消，所以这就是 VS。好的，呼！那么，我从这里开始。随着 VI 的增加，现在会发生什么？随着 VI 的增加，这里的这个项变得越来越负，好的，从 VS 中减去。

When VI goes above one volt, fun stuff begins to happen. OK, when V nought goes above one volt, then this equation applies because VI is greater than one. This equation applies. And, when VI is a one, one minus one is zero. This term cancels out, so this is VS. OK, phew! So, I start off here. As VI increases, what happens now? As VI increases, this term here becomes increasingly negative, OK, subtracting from VS.

好的，所以我得到了一些类似这样的行为。V nought 开始下降。这很直观，对吧？随着 ID 开始增加，这里的电压将开始下降，因为我正在通过 RL 吸收越来越多的电流。我在 RL 上下降得越来越多。因此，RL 上的电压下降越来越多，因此 V nought 也开始下降。所以，它看起来像这样。

OK, so I get some behavior like this. V nought begins to drop. And it makes intuitive sense, right? As ID begins to increase, the voltage here will begin to drop because I’m drawing more and more current through RL. I’m dropping more and more across RL. So more and more drops across RL, so V nought begins to drop too. So, it looks something like this.

我会给你看一个小演示，但我的主张是你刚刚看到了一个放大器。哇。你刚刚看到了一个放大器。所以，我偷偷地把一个放大器放在你身边，好吗？所以，我刚刚偷偷地把一个放大器放在你身边。我马上就告诉你为什么。那么，让我们看看这里的波形。我们不要担心这里会发生什么。我们稍后再讨论。但是，看看这里的曲线。

I’ll show you a little demo, but my claim is that you have just seen an amplifier. Whoa. You just saw an amplifier. So, I snuck an amplifier by you, OK? So, I just snuck an amplifier past you. I’ll show you why in a second. So, let’s take a look at this waveform here. Let’s not worry about what happens way down here. We’ll talk about that a little later. But, look at this curve here.

我认为存在以下意义上的放大。关注输入电压的一些变化，delta VI，好的，对于输入电压的这种变化，我得到了输出电压的一些变化。好的，对于输入电压的一些变化，delta VI 得到了输出电压的一些变化。猜猜怎么着？

I claim there is amplification in the following sense. Focus on some change in the input voltage, delta VI, OK, and for that change in input voltage, I get some change in the output voltage. OK, for some change in the input voltage, delta VI get some change in the output voltage. And guess what?

至少我是这样画的，delta V 除以 delta VI，如果我能找到曲线上大于 1 的区域，那么我就得到了放大。好的，那是什么意思？那是什么意思是，如果我在这里施加一些电压，好的，我将电压从 2 V 稍微改变为 2.1。好的，我要找到输出电压。

In this, at least the way I have drawn it, delta V nought divided by delta VI, if I can find regions of the curve where this is greater than one, then I have amplification. OK, so what’s that saying? What that’s saying is that if I apply some voltage here, OK, and I change that voltage by a small amount from, let’s say, 2 V to 2.1. OK, I am going to find the output voltage.

假设我从 2 V 变为 2.1。好吧，抽象地说，我的输出可能从 3 V 变为 2 V。好吧，对于这里的 0.1 变化，我将得到更大的下降，即从 3 V 变为 2 V，从而在这个小电路中产生放大。好吧，我们会反复看到这一点，你会真正理解它。

Let’s say I go from 2 V to 2.1 here. OK, abstractly out there, I might have an output that goes from three to, let’s say, two V perhaps. OK, so for a 0.1 change here, I’m going to get a bigger drop here, so from 3 V to 2 V, giving me an amplification in this little circuit. OK, so we’ll see this again and again, and you’ll really understand it.

因此，我的输入发生了微小的变化，而输出也发生了相应的较大变化。因此，我向你展示了一个放大器。我还没有向你展示线性放大器。线性放大器需要额外付费。好的，稍后再介绍。好的，到目前为止，我向你展示的只是一个放大器，而这恰好是一个糟糕的放大器。它是一个非线性放大器，因为，请注意，这不是线性的。

So, I have a small change in the input, and I have a corresponding larger change in the output. So, I’ve shown you an amplifier. I haven’t shown you a linear amplifier. There’s an extra charge for that. OK, that’ll happen later. OK, all I’ve shown you so far is an amplifier, and this happens to be a crummy amplifier. It’s a nonlinear amplifier because, notice, this is not linear.

这是一条漂亮的小曲线，所以它不是线性的。但是，我答应给你一个放大器，而且我很便宜，这就是你现在得到的全部。好的，我们稍后会看到线性的东西，但现在，我有一个小放大器。所以，让我们做一些实数，并绘制一些数字，并查看一个演示。所以，让我们做一个例子。

It’s a nice little curve, and so it’s not linear. But, I promised you an amplifier, and I’m cheap, and that’s all you get for now. OK, we’ll see linear stuff later, but for now, I have a little amplifier. So, let’s do some real numbers, and plot some numbers down, and also look at a demo. So, let’s do an example.

假设 VS 为 10 V，K 为每 V 平方 2 毫安，RL 为 5 千欧姆，好吗？那么，让我将这些值代入该公式，我得到 V 为零，VS 为十。所以，它是十减去 KRL 除以二。所以，K 为 2 毫安。2 毫安乘以 5 千欧姆等于十除以二，得到 5，VI 减去一平方。这就是我得到的。

Let’s say VS is 10 V, that the K is two milliamps per V squared, and let’s say RL is five kilo ohms, OK? So, let me substitute these values into that equation, and I get V nought is, VS is ten. So, it’s ten minus, KRL divided by two. So, K is two milliamps. Two milliamps times five kilo ohms is ten divided by two gives me five, and VI minus one squared. That’s what I have.

我只需插入一堆数字，就可以得到结果。所以，我要做的是，让我为您做一个小表格，并使用实数进行绘图，为您简单地绘制这些值。所以当 VI 为零时，我的电流为零，我得到哦，顺便说一下，该方程不适用；当 VI 大于一时适用。好的。

I just plug in a bunch of numbers, and that’s what I get. So, what I’ll do is let me just do a little table for you, and plot using real numbers, simply plot those values for you. So when VI is zero, my current is zero, and I get oh, that equation doesn’t apply, by the way; that applies when VI is greater than one. Ok.

所以只要 VI 小于 1，我的输出就是 VS，输出就是 10 伏。好的，所以一直到 1，我的输出 V 是所有单位都是伏特，这就是我得到的。我降到 2，我为 VI 代入 2，2 减 1 等于 1。所以它是 1 的平方。5 乘以 1 的平方等于 5。10 减 5 等于 5。我在这里得到 5。好吗？

So as long as VI is less than one, my output is simply VS, the output is simply ten volts. Ok, so all the way up to one, my output V is all the units are all volts that’s what I get. I come down to 2, I plug in two for VI, 2 minus 1 is a 1. So it’s 1 squared. 5 times 1 squared is five. And 10 minus 5 is 5. I get 5 out here. Ok?

然后，我可以进行计算。如果是 2.1，我在这里得到 4 伏。如果是 2.2，我得到 2.8。等等。好的，请注意，这里 0.1 伏的变化导致电压上升，而这里 0.1 伏的变化导致那里电压下降 1 伏。因此，输入上升了 0.1 伏，我的输出下降了整整 1 伏。好的，这里的一个小变化导致那里发生了更大的变化。

And then, I can go and do the math. If it’s 2.1, I get 4 volts here. And 2.2, I get 2.8. And so on. Ok, notice that the .1 volt change here resulted in a go up a .1 change here results in a minus 1 volt change there. So input went up by .1 volts, my output. kerplunked down by one whole volt. Ok, so a small change here resulted in a bigger change there.

这就是我在这里声称的放大。好吗？那么。让我向你展示一个我构建的涉及这种依赖源的小型设备的小演示。让我们在这里做。好的。所以在我的 s 轴上，这是 VI。VO 在我的 y 轴上。关注这里的这个小点。好吗？现在我的 VI 为零。因此，这就是我的输出。

And that’s the amplification that I am claiming here. Ok? So. Let me show you a small demo of a small device that I built involving such a dependent source. Let’s do it here. Ok. So on my s axis, here is VI. And VO is on my y axis. And focus on this little point here. Ok? Right now my VI is zero. And so therefore that’s my output.

我会逐渐增加 VI，我们将观察输出并观察其行为。就像我为您绘制的小图一样。所以我在增加 VI。好的，请注意，电流源关闭，从属源关闭，所以我直接向下移动。好的，什么也没发生。直到我达到电流源开始开启的值。

I will gradually increase VI, we’re going to watch the output and see how it behaves. Pretty much like the little graph I drew for you. So I’m increasing VI. Ok, notice that invitially the current source is off, the dependent source is off, so I move straight down. Ok, nothing happens. Until I hit a value at which the current source begins to come on.

然后，当电流源开始传导电流时，我开始看到输出下降。所以当我增加电压 VI 时，你会看到，砰！你看到了巨大的下降。好的，请注意，对于一个小小的变化，我现在得到了输出的大幅下降。好吗？让我们在这里暂停一下，在最后几分钟，我想讲最后一点。

And then I begin to see a drop in the output as the current source begins to conduct current. So you see that as I increase the voltage VI, boom! You see the huge drop. Ok, notice that for a small change, I’m now getting a big drop in the output. Ok? So let’s pause here for a second, and in the last couple of minutes, I want to cover one last point.

请注意，我上面展示的曲线看起来就像这里的曲线：它爆炸了！然后根据我在这里展示的某种公式下降。在最后几分钟，让我讨论一个小问题，这是一个实际问题。在我展示的曲线中，在我给你的数学中，如果你只按照数学来做的话。

Notice that the curve I’ve shown you up there looks like the curve up here: it goes kaboom! and drops according to come kind of formulation that I’ve shown you here. In the last couple of minutes, let me discuss a small point that’s a practical issue. In the curve that I showed you, in the mathematics that I gave you, if you just go by the math.

因此，我将要向你们展示的将区分数学家和电气工程师。数学家会采用曲线，并像这样报告它。这是零。从数学上讲，该方程表示从这里开始，电流只是下降。但如果我告诉你我这里的这个设备，这个从属源是一个实际从属源，是我物理构建的设备，我也会说它是一个无源设备。

So what I’m about to show you will differentiate a mathematician from an electrical engineer. Mathematicians would have taken the curve, and reported it like this. This is zero. Mathematically, that equation says that starting here, this current simply goes down. But if I told you this device that I have here, this dependent source is a practical dependent source, a device that I have physically built, and I also say that it’s a passive device.

换句话说，它不能产生电能。它就像一个小电阻。它不产生电能。它是一个无源设备。所以如果我告诉你它是无源设备，那么你会说，这里有些地方不合理。从数学上讲，它应该是这样的。但是这里的一个点有什么特别之处呢？这里的点表示输出已变为负值。这里是零。输出已变为负值。

In other words, it cannot produce power. It’s like a little resistor. It doesn’t produce power. It’s a passive device. So if it’s a passive device, if I tell you that, then you’ll say, Something doesn’t make sense here. Mathematically, it says it should look like this. But what’s special about a point down here? The point down here says the output has gone negative. This is zero here. The output has gone negative.

我的电流源仍在提供电流。好的，所以在这里，设备两端的电压是正的，它提供电流，所以它像电阻一样消耗功率。就像所有坏的小电阻一样，它们会消耗功率。所以在这里，另一方面，我的输出将为负，但它仍然在那里吸收电流。

And my current source is still supplying a current. Ok, so up here, the voltage across the device is positive, and it’s supplying a current, so it’s consuming power like a resistor. Like all bad little resistors do, they burn power. So here, on the other hand, my output is going to be negative, but it’s still sitting there sinking current.

好的，因为 VO 是负的，但我的电流仍然在同一方向，现在发生的事情是设备已开始供电。所以从数学上讲，这条曲线表明设备已开始供电。事实证明它不是实用设备，而是无源设备。所以它不能到这里。所以发生的事情是，我们的模型在这里的某个地方崩溃了。我向你展示的电流源方程，它在哪里？

Ok, because VO is negative, but my current is still in the same direction, what has now happened is the device has begun to supply power. So mathematically, this curve says the device has begun to supply power. It turns out it’s not a practical device, it’s a passive device. So it cannot go here. So what happens is that somewhere along here, our model breaks down. The equation I’ve shown you for the current source, where is it?

这个模型失效了。当 V0 变得非常小的时候，这个模型失效了，它不再像电流源那样工作。它开始越来越像电阻器。而实际发生的情况是，输出下降，然后变成一条接近零的线。我马上给你演示一下。对于这个特定的设备，它不会真正下降。让我给你演示一下那部分。

This model breaks down. When V0 becomes very small, the model breaks down and it no longer behaves like a current source. It begins to behave more and more like a resistor. And what happens realistically, is that the output goes down and then kind of becomes a zero hugging line. I’ll show you that in a second. And it doesn’t for this particular device it doesn’t really go down here. Let me just show you that part.

因此请注意，对于该设备，从数学上讲，仅根据该模型，它应该穿过地板并指向下方的走廊，但这是一个实用的设备。因此请注意，模型崩溃了。这就是开始发生的事情。好的，该设备不再像依赖电流源那样工作，而是像一些陈旧的电阻器或类似的东西一样工作并饱和。好的。

So notice for that device, mathematically, just by that model, it should have just gone through the floor and it points through to the corridor below, but this is a prcatical device. So notice that the model breaks down. And that’s what begins to happen. Ok, the device stops behaving like a dependent current source, rather it behaves like some corny old resistor or something like that and saturates out. Ok.

Lec 9 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 9 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 50:34 https://youtube.com/watch?v=Nijya-QJ45Y

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 50:34 https://youtube.com/watch?v=Nijya-QJ45Y

介绍

Introduction

好的。我们开始吧。我想这个手表会快几分钟。首先要快速通告一下。如果您忘记了，您的实验室笔记本将于明天到期，其中包含第一个实验室的实验后练习。好的，今天我将继续讨论放大器。

All right. Let’s get started. I guess this watch is a couple minutes fast. First a quick announcement. In case you have forgotten, your lab notebooks are due tomorrow with the post lab exercises for the first lab. OK, so I am going to continue with amplifiers today.

为了让您了解我们的主题，我们安排了五个讲座系列，涵盖了带从属源的放大器的不同方面，并在周二展示了如何用它构建放大器。今天我将向您展示一个实现从属源的真实设备。然后下周二我们将讨论放大器的分析。周三是我们的测验。

And to just give you a sense of where we headed, we have this five lecture sequence covering different aspects of amplifiers with dependent sources and showed how we could build an amplifier with it on Tuesday. Today I am going to show you a real device that implements a dependent source. And then next Tuesday we will talk about analysis of an amplifier. Wednesday is our quiz.

周四和下周二我们讨论放大器的小信号分析和小信号使用。

Thursday and the Tuesday after that we then talk about small signal analysis and small signal use of the amplifier.

审查

Review

今天我们将讨论 MOSFET 放大器。让我们先快速回顾一下。在上一讲中，我向您展示了我可以使用从属源构建放大器。从属源的工作原理如下。假设我有一个电路，我将一个从属源连接到该电路中。

Today we will talk about the MOSFET amplifier. So let’s start with a quick review. And in the last lecture, I showed you that I could build a amplifier using a dependent source. And a dependent source worked as follows. Let’s say I had a circuit and I connected a dependent source into the circuit.

假设在这个例子中我有一个电流源。所以这是某个电路。电流 I 是电路中某个参数的函数。这就是为什么这是一个依赖源。这是一个依赖电流源。所以可能是我里面有一些元件。然后我测量，我采样元件两端或电路中任意两点之间的电压。

Let’s say in this example I have a current source. So this is some circuit. And the current I is a function of some parameter in the circuit. That’s why this is a dependent source. This is a dependent current source. So it could be that I have some element inside. And I measure, I sample the voltage across the element or between any two points in the circuit.

在这个小例子中，电流可能依赖于电压。因此请注意，尽管我向您展示了承载电流的从属源的两个端子，但那里还有另一个隐式端口，另一个隐式端子。那里的端子称为从属源的“控制端口”，我在此施加电压或电流来控制电流源的值。顺便提一下。

And, in this little example here, this current could be dependent on that voltage. So notice that although I showed you the two terminals of the dependent source that carried a current, there is another implicit port, another implicit terminal there. And that terminal there is called the “control port” of the dependent source at which I apply a voltage or current that will control the value of the current source. As a quick aside.

您的工具箱中的工具有点小问题。我们讨论了叠加技术，在该技术中，您被教导一次打开一个源，对于线性电路，一次打开一个源，然后汇总所有源的响应，每次只作用一个。那么，您对依赖源做什么呢？依赖源就是一个源。

There is a small glitch with the tools in your tool chest. We talked about the superposition technique where you were taught to turn on one source at a time, for a linear circuit one source at a time, and then sum up the responses to all the sources acting one at a time. Well, what do you do about dependent sources? A dependent source is a source.

我们必须稍微修改一下叠加语句。有关详细信息，您可以查看课程笔记第 3.5.1 节，其中有详细信息和一些示例。因此，这种方法实际上非常简单。为了实现叠加，这种方法不将您的依赖源视为您打开和关闭的源。

And we have to modify the superposition statement just a little bit. And for details you can look at Section 3.5.1 of your course notes on the details and some examples on how to do this. So the approach is very simple, actually. The approach is, for the purpose of superposition, to not treat your dependent source as sources that you turn on and turn off.

因此，当您对相关源进行叠加时，您要做的就是将所有相关源留在电路中。只需将它们留在那里，然后只打开和关闭独立源。因此，通过一次打开一个独立源并汇总响应来查看电路的响应。您的相关源留在电路内，并像做其他事情一样简单地分析它们。

So what you do is when you do superposition with dependent sources simply leave all your dependent sources in the circuit. Just leave them in there and turn on and off only your independent sources. So look at the response of the circuit by turning on your independent sources one at a time and summing up the responses. And your dependent sources stay within the circuit and simply analyze them as you do anything else.

因此，它本质上说的是，当你有从属源时，要小心一点，但基本方法几乎​​无需任何改变即可应用。今天讲座的阅读材料是第 7.3 节至第 7.6 节。既然我们要建立从属源放大器，让我先快速回顾一下该放大器。我们按如下方式构建了放大器。我们按以下方式连接从属源。

So essentially what it says is that just be a little cautious when you have dependent sources, but the basic method applies almost without any change. The readings for today’s lecture are Section 7.3 to 7.6. So since we are going to build up on the dependent source amplifier, let me start with a quick review of that amplifier. We built our amplifier as follows. We connected our dependent source in the following manner.

在我们举的例子中，流过从属源的电流与输入电压 vI 有关。所以是某个电压 vI。因此这两个是从属源的控制端口，并且 vI 被应用在那里。我向你们展示了一个用从属源构建的简单放大器，它以这种方式运行。

And the current through the dependent source in the example we took was related to an input voltage vI. So some voltage vI. And so these two were the control port of the dependent source and a vI was applied there. And I showed you a simple amplifier built with a dependent source that behaved in this manner.

我会再次提醒您，请记住，依赖源实际上是这里的这个框，即控制端口和输出端口。通常，我们不会明确显示那些依赖源的控制端口，因为控制端口对电路没有任何其他影响，例如它不会吸收任何电流或诸如此类的东西。

And again I will keep reminding you, just remember that the dependent source is actually this box here, the control port and the output port. And commonly we don’t explicitly show the control port for those dependent sources for which the control port does not have any other affect on the circuit, like it doesn’t draw any current or things like that.

因此，在这个特定示例中，我们说，当 vI 大于或等于 1 伏特且 iD 为零时，其行为方式如下。因此，我们可以分析电路以找出 vO 将会是什么样子。在此循环中简单应用 KVL，再次说明，当我在此说此循环时，我指的是此处的某个东西。

So in this particular example we said that this behaved in the following manner for vI greater than or equal to 1 volt and iD was zero otherwise. So we can analyze the circuit to figure out what vO is going to look like. And a simple application of KVL at this loop here, again, you know, when I say this loop here, I am pointing at something here.

这是隐含在这两个节点之间的 VS 源。同样，这是一个简写符号，这里的小向上箭头表示我在这两个端子之间连接了一个电压源。因此这里有一个涉及 VS 的环路。所以 Vo 就是 VS 减去这个电阻上的压降。所以 VS 减去这个电阻上的压降就是 vO。

That is the VS source that is implicitly across these two nodes. Again, this is a shorthand notation where this little up arrow here implies that I have a voltage source connected between these two terminals here. And so there is a loop here that involves VS. So Vo is simply VS minus the drop across this resistor. So it’s VS minus the drop across this resistor gives me vO.

电阻两端的压降就是 iD RL。iD 是这里的电流，也就是电阻两端的压降。我可以通过将 iD 代入 vI 减 1 的平方，得到 vO 与 vI 的明确关系。因此，vO 与 vI 的关系如下。到目前为止没有什么新东西。我基本上回顾了我们上次所做的内容。

And the drop across the resistor is simply iD RL. iD is the current here and that’s the drop across the resistor. And I could get the explicit relationship of vO versus vI by substituting for iD as vI minus one all squared. So vO relates to vI in the following manner. Nothing new so far. I have pretty much reviewed what we did the last time.

这是我们利用一些新材料向前迈出的下一步。到目前为止，我都像理论家一样谈论过，我说想象一下你有球形牛或类似的东西。在这里，我只是让你想象这个理想的从属源、控制端口和输出端口，它以这种方式运行。

Here is where we take our next step forward with some new material. Up to now I have talked as a theoretician would where I said just imagine that you had spherical cow or something like that. Here I just asked you to imagine this ideal dependent source, control port and an output port, and it behaved in this manner.

因此，下一步我想做的是向你们展示一个实际的依赖源，它比我向你们展示的理想依赖源在很多方面要复杂一些。现实生活往往会给你带来一系列实际限制，我们稍后会讨论这些限制。如果我能找到一个像这样的依赖源

So as a next step what I would like to do is show you a practical dependent source which turns out to be a little bit more complicated than this idealized dependent source that I showed you in many dimensions. Real life tends to impose a bunch of practical constraints on you, and we will look at those in a second. If I could find a dependent source that looked like this

我们有一个控制端口 A 和输出端口 B。我看了一些例子，其中流经从属电流源的电流是输入电压的某种函数。这是一个“电压控制电流源”。我要说的是，一个可以给我这种行为或某种近似行为的设备。

We had a control port A prime and output port B prime. And I looked at some examples where the current through the dependent current source was some function of the input voltage. This is a “voltage controlled current source”. What I am going to do is talk about a device that can give me this behavior or some close approximation to it.

事实证明，在某些条件下，您已经看过的 MOSFET 会以这种方式运行。您看到的 MOSFET 的行为方式大致如此。让我向您展示 MOSFET 在什么条件下会以这种方式运行。让我为自己留出一些空间。请注意，我需要一个控制端口，需要一个输出端口。我将以与您之前看到的略有不同的方式查看我的 MOSFET。

It turns out that under certain conditions the MOSFET that you have already looked at behaves in this manner. The MOSFET that you’ve seen sort of behaves like this. And let me show you under what conditions the MOSFET behaves in that manner. Let me create some room for myself. Notice that I need a control port, needed an output port. And I am going to view my MOSFET in a slightly different manner than you have seen before.

我在这里画了这两个端子。这是一个三端子 MOSFET。这是我的漏极、栅极和源极端子。这是一个三端子器件，但我对 MOSFET 的看法略有不同。我将只使用这个端子作为栅极和漏极之间的公共端。因此，这里的电压是 vGS。

I draw these two terminals here. And this was a three terminal MOSFET. This was my drain, my gate and my source terminal. It was a three terminal device, but what I do is I view the MOSFET slightly differently. I will just use this terminal to be common across both the gate and the drain. And so this voltage here is vGS.

我只是使用源端口、源端子和栅极作为端子对。我使用相同的源和漏极作为另一个端子对。因此，我有一个 vDS，并且有一些电流 iDS 从这里流出。

I am just using the source port, the source terminal along with the gate as a terminal pair. I am using the same source along with the drain as another terminal pair. So I have a vDS out there and I have some current iDS that flows out here.

请注意，当我以这种方式查看 MOSFET 时，我已经完成了第一步，也就是说，我似乎有一个盒子，它有一个端口在这里，一个端口在这里。我还向您解释了 MOSFET 的行为方式。首先，当这是 vGS、G、漏极和源极时，输出端口在某些条件下表现为开路。

Notice that when I view the MOSFET in this manner I have accomplished my first step, which is I seem to have a box which has a port here and a port here. And I also explained to you that a MOSFET behaves in a particular manner. For one, the output port behaved as an open circuit under certain conditions when This was vGS, G, drain and source.

当 vGS 小于阈值电压 VT 时，该 MOSFET 具有如下所示的等效电路。因此，当 vGS 小于某个阈值电压 VT 时，漏极和源极之间就会出现开路。您之前也见过这种情况。到目前为止，这里没有什么新东西。但是，当 vGS 大于或等于 VT 时，vGS 大于 VT。

When vGS was less than a threshold voltage VT this MOSFET had an equivalent circuit that looked like this. So when vGS was less than some threshold voltage VT then there was an open circuit between the drain and the source. And you saw this before. So far nothing new here. However, when vGS is greater than or equal to VT vGS was greater than VT.

我们之前研究过的 MOSFET 行为表明，它要么表现得像一个短路（最简单的形式），要么表现得像一个电阻器（稍微详细一点的形式）。我们称之为 MOSFET 的 SR 模型。因此，当 vGS 大于 VT 时，我们说，近似 MOSFET 行为的一种简单方法是将其视为连接在漏极和源极之间的电阻器。

The MOSFET behavior we looked at earlier showed that this behaved either like a short circuit in the simplest form or in a slightly more detailed form it behaved like a resistor. We call that the SR model of the MOSFET. So when vGS was greater than VT we said that a simple way to approximate MOSFET behavior was to view this as a resistor connected between the drain and the source.

那是我们在 SR 模型中对 MOSFET 的使用。结果发现我们撒了谎。我们以一种非常有趣的方式看待 MOSFET。我以一种非常非常聪明的方式展示了 MOSFET。好吧，我不应该说聪明。这是一种非常非常狡猾的方式。并欺骗您相信它只是一个电阻器。我们限制了您使用 MOSFET 的方式。

That was our SR model use of the MOSFET. It turns out that we kind of lied. We were sort of looking at the MOSFET in a really funny way. And I shone the light on the MOSFET in a really, really clever way. Well, I shouldn’t say clever. A really, really tricky way. And tricked you into believing that it was just a resistor. And we constrained how you use the MOSFET.

所以这种行为确实是一种电阻行为。但事实证明，在现实生活中，漏极和源极之间的 MOSFET 行为比您看到的有限形式要复杂得多。所以今天我要做的是揭开完整的 MOSFET 的面纱，向您展示其所有可怕的全部行为。

So that behavior was indeed a resistive behavior. But it turns out that in real life the behavior of the MOSFET between the drain and the source terminals is much more complicated than the limited form in which you saw it. So today what I am going to do is take the wraps off the complete MOSFET and show you its full behavior in all its gory glory.

我将花一点时间来清楚地强调 MOSFET 在什么条件下表现得像电阻器，就像您在制作数字电路时看到的那样，或者在其他使用领域表现不同。让我暂停一下，将此处留空。让我们做一些调查。让我把这个留在这里。我暂时不会画任何东西。您将自己弄清楚在某些条件下它是什么样子。

And I will spend a bit of time on that to clearly emphasize under what conditions the MOSFET behaves like a resistor, as you saw when you did digital circuits, or behaves differently in other domains of use. Let me pause for a second and leave this space blank here. And let’s do some investigations. Let me leave this here. I won’t draw in anything yet. You will figure out what it looks like yourselves under certain conditions.

我接下来要做的是在 MOSFET 上施加一些电压，观察电流与 vDS 行为的关系，并在示波器上绘制并查看它。我要做的是弄清楚 iDS 是什么样子的，记住，6.002 中进入栅极的 iG 始终为零。在对 MOSFET 进行更详细的分析时，在未来的课程中，您可能会看到稍微复杂一些的行为。

What I will do next is apply some voltages on a MOSFET and observe the current versus vDS behavior and plot that on a scope and take a look at it. What I am going to do is figure out what iDS looks like for Remember iG into the gate for 6.002 is always going to be zero. In much more detailed analyses of the MOSFET, in future courses you may see slightly more complex behavior.

但就我们而言，从栅极看，这是一个开路。因此，我将在 MOSFET 上应用 vGS，在 MOSFET 上应用 vDS，并绘制 iDS 与 vDS 的关系图。首先，让我向您展示您已经知道的内容。您已经知道的内容这是 vDS。我将尽可能多地介绍您已经知道的内容。

But as far as we are concerned it is an open circuit looking into the gate. So I am going to apply a vGS across the MOSFET, apply a vDS across the MOSFET and plot iDS versus vDS. First let me show you what you already know. What you already know This is vDS. I will just keep doing as much as I can of what you already know.

然后，当我做一些新的东西时，我会明确地告诉你。你以前见过。当 vGS 小于 VT 时，MOSFET 的行为就像开路一样。也就是说，当 vG 小于阈值电压 VT 时，流过 MOSFET 的电流为零。当 vGS 大于 VT 时，MOSFET 的 S 模型（开关模型）简单地说，看，我们可以将 D2S 建模为短路。

And then when I do some new stuff I will tell you explicitly. You’ve seen this before. The MOSFET behaves like an open circuit when vGS less than VT. That is when vG is less than a threshold voltage VT, I have zero current flowing through the MOSFET. And when vGS was greater than VT then the S model of the MOSFET the switch model simply said that look, we can model the D2S as a short circuit.

您在实验室中看到过这种情况，发现漏极和源极之间的电阻非常小，有点像短路。但我们说，情况并非如此。存在一些电阻。所以我们说，稍微精确一点的模型会让这条线稍微下降一点，暗示漏极和源极之间存在一些电阻 R_on，因此 vDS iDS。

You saw this in your labs and you saw that it was a very, very small resistance between the drain and the source and it kind of looked like a short circuit. But then we said well, that’s not quite it. There is some resistance. And so we said a slightly more accurate model would have this line droop a little bit to imply that there was some resistance R_on between the drain and the source, so vDS iDS.

这是当 vGS 小于 VT 且 vGS 大于或等于 VT 时的情况。我有一些阻力。这向我展示了一种直线行为。我向你们展示了这种行为。到目前为止，绝对没有什么新东西。现在我为你绘制的就是这种行为。请注意，这是 vDS 轴，这是 iDS 轴。我正在绘制 iDS 与 vDS 的关系。当 vGS

So this was when vGS less than VT and vGS greater than or equal to VT. I have some resistance. And that showed me a straight line kind of like behavior. And I showed you that behavior. So far absolutely nothing new. Now what I have plotted there for you is that behavior. Up here notice that this is the vDS axis, this is the iDS axis. I am plotting iDS versus vDS. And when vGS

栅极电压超过阈值，请注意，我看到的东西或多或少像一条直线。这是一条有一定斜率的直线，或多或少是一条直线，暗示着电阻行为。我们在这里也玩了一些有趣的游戏。我们说，嘿，如果我关闭 vGS 会怎么样？砰。

The gate voltage is more than a threshold, notice that I see what looks like something more or less like a straight line. And this is a straight line with some slope, more or less a straight line implying resistive behavior. And we also had some fun and games here. We said hey, what if I turn vGS off? Boom.

那将是我的 iDS 为零，这意味着 MOSFET 的行为就像漏极和源极之间的开路。我施加了一个比 VT 更大的正 vGS，它开始看起来像一个电阻器。开路，电阻器，开路，电阻器，好吗？到目前为止没有什么新东西。所以在今天的讲座中，你不应该学到任何新东西。现在看。

That would be my iDS of zero implying that the MOSFET behaved like an open circuit between the drain and the source. I applied a positive vGS more than VT and it began to look like a resistor. Open circuit, resistor, open circuit, resistor, OK? Up until now nothing new. So you shouldn’t have learned anything at all that is new until now in today’s lecture. Now watch.

我要做的是，正如我所说的，我一直在撒谎，我只是向你展示了这种行为。我一直在做的是小心地使用非常小的 vDS 值。注意，这是一个很小的 ​​vDS 值。我还没有告诉你随着 vDS 的增加它会是什么样子。好吧，让我们去尝试一下。我们这里有一个示波器。我们这里有 MOSFET。

What I am going to do is, as I said, I kind of lied all this time and I just showed you this behavior. And what I have been doing all along is very carefully using a very small value of vDS. Notice it’s a small values of vDS. I haven’t told you what it looks like as vDS increases. Well, let’s go try it out. We have a scope here. We have the MOSFET here.

现在，我不确定会发生什么。你可能会看到烟雾或爆炸，谁知道呢？但请往上看一眼。我只会增加 vDS，你可以自己弄清楚会发生什么。我增加 vDS。哇，真是个骗子。阿加瓦尔是个骗子。我一直在欺骗你。我一直在

Now, I am not sure what is going to happen now. You may see smoke or have an explosion, who knows what? But look up there for a second. I am just going to increase vDS and you can figure out what happens for yourselves. I increase vDS. Whoa, what a liar. Agarwal is a liar. I have been kind of tricking you. I have been putting

覆盖这部分内容，只显示 vDS 值较小的曲线区域。但是，当我增加 vDS 时，这看起来与电阻行为完全不同。那么这里发生了什么？发生的事情是，当我增加 vDS 时，iDS 曲线逐渐变细，并在某个电流值处饱和。注意，它在某个电流值处饱和。

Covering up all this part here and showing you just this region of the curve for small values of vDS. But as I increase vDS this is nothing that looks even close to that of resistive behavior. So what’s happening here? What’s happening is that as I increase my vDS the iDS curve tails off and saturates at some value of current. Notice it saturates at some value of current.

因此，我将研究该行为区域。请注意，到目前为止，我们研究的是小型 vDS 的行为。它看起来有点电阻性。但是，当我增加 vDS 时，用更大的 vDS 非常用力地敲击该节点，人们会说，哦，我放弃了。电流饱和并趋于平稳，并将值稳定在某个值。那么，这种行为是什么样的呢？

And so I am going to look at this region of behavior. Notice that what we have looked at so far was the behavior for small vDS. It kind of looks resistive. But when I pump up the vDS, really whack this node really hard with a much larger vDS the guy says, oh, I give up. And the current saturates out and flattens out and holds the value steady at some value. So what’s that behavior look like?

就 VI 元素而言，X 轴上方的水平线是什么？这种行为是什么样的？确切地说，是电流源。所以这是类似电流源的行为。因此，让我先为您绘制一个小模型，然后更详细地解释一下。

What is my horizontal line above the X axis in terms of V I elements? What is that behavior like? Current source, exactly. So this is current source like behavior. And so let me start by drawing you a little model and explaining it in more detail.

MOSFET 模型

MOSFET Models

发生的情况是，在某些条件下，条件如下，当 vDS（即我的漏极到源极电压）大于或等于 vGS 减去 VT 时。

What happens is that under certain conditions, and the conditions are the following, when vDS, that is my drain to source voltage is greater than or equal to vGS minus VT.

当我的漏极电压超过 vGS 减 VT 时，如果 vGS 为 3 伏，而 VT 为 1 伏，那么如果 vDS 超过 2 伏，如果我用更高的电压敲击 MOSFET 的漏极，那么这个人会说我放弃了，无法向您展示良好的电阻行为，并且电流饱和，它不允许您抽取比最大值更多的电流。这就是电流源行为。

When my drain voltage goes above vGS minus VT, so if vGS is 3 volts and if VT is 1 volt, then if vDS goes above 2 volts, if I am hammering the drain of the MOSFET with a higher voltage then this guy says I give up, can’t show you nice restive behavior, and the current saturates out and it doesn’t allow you draw any more current than a maximum value. And that’s the current source behavior.

这个表现得像一个电流源。电流 iDS 由以下表达式给出。电流 iDS 等于常数 K 除以两倍 (vGS VT) 的平方。有点让人想起精心挑选的依赖源示例，只是这里的是 VT。

This one behaves like a current source. And the current iDS is given by the following expression. The current is given by iDS is equal to a constant K divide by two times (vGS VT) all squared. Kind of reminiscent of the carefully chosen dependent source example, just that this one here is VT.

此模型适用于当 vGS 大于 VT 时，MOSFET 必须导通，并且 MOSFET 中的漏极到源极电压必须大于某个值，该值等于 vGS 减去 VT，然后该器件开始表现得像电流源。此 MOSFET 模型称为“开关电流源模型”。

This model, which applies when vGS is greater than VT, the MOSFET has to be on and the drain to source voltage in the MOSFET must be larger than some value, and that value is vGS minus VT then this guy begins to behave like a current source. This model of the MOSFET is called the “switch current source model”.

因此，在 MOSFET 特性的区域中，当 vGS 大于 VT 且漏极到源极电压大于 vGS 减去 VT 时，MOSFET 的行为就像其漏极和源极端子之间的电流源。而在这一部分中，我们将 MOSFET 建模为电流源。因此，毫不奇怪，该模型的这一部分被称为 SCS 模型，与带有电阻器的 SR 模型形成对比。

So in the region of the MOSFET characteristics where vGS is greater than VT and the drain to source voltage is larger than vGS minus VT, the MOSFET behaved like a current source between its drain and source terminals. And in that part we model the MOSFET as a current source. And so not surprisingly that part of the model is called the SCS model in contrast with the SR model where we had a resistor.

再次提醒，请记住，这并不是相互冲突的。这并不是说，MOSFET 看起来像电阻器，然后突然间它变成了电流源。好吧，这两个区域是不同的。并不是说它在相同参数下表现为电流源，不是。当 vDS 小于右侧时，它确实表现为电阻。SR 模型适用。

Again, remember, this is not meant to be conflicting. It is not like gee, how can the MOSFET look like a resistor, and then suddenly what happens it becomes a current source. Well, the two regions are different. It is not that it is behaving as a current source for the same parameters, no. When vDS is less than this right hand side it does behave resistive. The SR model applies.

但是，如果将 vDS 增加到超过某个点，电流就会饱和，SCS 就会像这样应用。让我们画出来。SCS 行为可以在这里画出 vDS 和 iDS。正如我之前提到的，对于较小的 vDS 值，假设我选择某个 vGS 值，假设是 vGS3，某个 vGS 值，它看起来就像一个电阻，直到 vDS 等于 vGS3 减去 VT。

But increase vDS beyond a point, the current saturates and the SCS applies like so. So let’s draw. The SCS behavior can be drawn here vDS and iDS. As I mentioned to you, for small values of vDS, let’s say I pick some value of vGS, let’s say vGS3, some value vGS, it is going to look like a resistor until vDS becomes equal to vGS3 minus VT.

之后，它会饱和并开始看起来像电流源。这个点就是 vDS 等于 vGS 减去 VT 的地方。这样，当这个等号变成大于号时，vDS 就会变大，然后我就会进入曲线的这一部分。同样，对于 vGS 的其他各种值，它看起来会像这样，依此类推。

And after that it saturates out and begins to look like a current source. And this point is where vDS becomes equal to vGS minus VT. And this way is when this equal sign becomes a greater than sign, vDS becomes larger then I move into this part of the curve. Similarly, for various other values of vGS it will look like this and so on.

当 vGS 小于 VT 时，它的行为与之前一样，就像开路一样。当 vGS 小于 VT 时，它仍然表现得像开路一样。因此，当我增加 vGS 时，只要我保持 vDS 大于 vGS 减去 VT，我就会得到类似电流源的行为。请注意，这是在增加 vGS。

And it behaved like an open circuit as before when vGS less than VT. When vGS less than VT it is still behaving like an open circuit. And so as I increase my vGS, provided I keep my vDS greater than vGS minus VT, I get current source like behavior. And notice that this is increasing vGS.

我故意将这些曲线画得彼此相距较远，以表明这是一种非线性关系，即如果我将 vGS 增加一定量，vDS 的增加与 vGS 的平方有关。它是 vGS 减去 VT 的平方。所以我得到了一组看起来像这样的曲线。这是在工作区域中，其中 vDS 等于 vGS 减去 VT。

I have purposely drawn these curves at greater distances from each other to imply that it is a nonlinear relationship in that if I increase vGS by some amount, the increase in vDS is related to the square of vGS. It is vGS minus VT all squared. So I get a family of curves of that look like this. And this is in the region of operation where vDS equals vGS minus VT.

这适用于 vDS 小于 vGS 减 VT 的情况。正如您所预料的，这个工作区域被称为“饱和区”。我们说 MOSFET 受到重击，MOSFET 受到重击，MOSFET 处于饱和状态。因此 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。与此相对应的这个区域称为三极管区域。这真的非常简单。

And this applies in this regime where vDS less than vGS minus VT. This region of operation is called, as you might expect, the “saturation region”. We say the MOSFET has been hammered, the MOSFET has been walloped, the MOSFET is in saturation. So the MOSFET is in saturation. This region, corresponding to this, is called the triode region. This is really very simple.

我们所做的就是说，当 vDS 超过某个限度时，假设我的 vGS 减去 VT，MOSFET 开始像电流源一样工作。它不能再吸收任何电流。它像电流源一样将电流限制为给定值。但在左边，它表现为电阻。所以我想做的是

All we are doing is saying that when vDS is increased beyond a certain limit, given my vGS minus VT, the MOSFET begins to behave like a current source. It cannot draw any more current. It limits the current to a given value like a current source. But on the left hand side of this it behaves in a resistive manner. So what I would like to do is

我要做的是，我们为您绘制了 MOSFET 的所有特性，包括一系列 vGS 值和一系列 vDS 值。让我和您一起盯着这些曲线看几秒钟，并带您了解它们。那么我这里有什么？其中一条曲线对应于给定的 vGS 值。这可能是 vGS 等于 2 伏。

What I will do is, we’ve plotted for you, for the MOSFET, all its characteristics in its full glory for a whole bunch of values of vGS and a whole bunch of values of vDS. And let me stare at those curves with you for a few seconds and walk you through them. So what do I have here? One of these curves corresponds to a given value of vGS. This may be vGS equals 2 volts.

这是 vDS，即漏极到源极的电压，这是电流。所以现在请关注这条曲线。一开始我隐藏了右侧的行为，只向您展示了这里的电阻行为。当我将 vDS 增加到更大时，曲线饱和，我得到了 MOSFET 的饱和区操作。

This is vDS, the drain to source voltage, and this is the current. So focus on this curve for now. In the beginning I hid the right hand side behavior from you and showed you just the resistive behavior out here. When I increase vDS to be much larger the curve saturated and I got the saturation region operation of the MOSFET.

请注意，随着 vGS 值的增加，饱和电流也会按照平方律行为增加。所以这些是 MOSFET 的整个曲线。真相终于浮出水面。请注意，当 vDS 小于 vGS 减 VT 时，我的电阻行为或多或少。但当 vDS 大于 vGS 减 VT 时，我得到类似电流源的行为。

And notice as I increase my value of vGS the saturation current also increases according to a square law behavior. So these are the entire curves of the MOSFET. Finally the truth comes out. And notice that when vDS is less than vGS minus VT, I have more or less resistive behavior. But when vDS is greater than vGS minus VT I get current source like behavior.

因此，您可能会问一个问题：我何时使用一个模型或另一个模型？我何时使用 SR 模型，何时使用 SCS 模型？如果您想进行真正详细的分析，那么当 vDS 小于 vGS 减 VT 时，您可以使用 SR 模型。当 vDS 大于或等于 vGS 减 VT 时，您将使用此模型。这很简单。

So one question you may ask is when do I use one model or the other? When do I use the SR model and when do I use the SCS model? If you want to do a real detailed analysis then you can use the SR model when vDS is less than vGS minus VT. And you would use this model when vDS is greater than or equal to vGS minus VT. That is simple enough.

在 6.002 中，为了消除困惑，我们对看待事物的方式进行了更严格的限制。我们的做法是，对于整个数字分析，对于整个数字世界，我们专注于 SR 模型。我马上就会告诉你为什么。

In 6.002, to eliminate confusion we constrain how we look at things a little bit more stringently. And what we do is that for our entire digital analysis, for the entire digital world we focus on the SR model. And I will tell you why in a second.

因此，对于所有数字电路、逆变器、逆变器功率、延迟等，我们将在 6.002 中使用 SR 模型。稍后我将告诉您原因。对于模拟电路（即放大器设计和类似情况），我们将在饱和区操作 MOSFET。稍后我将讨论这一点。

So for all digital circuits, invertors, look at power of invertors, look at delay, a bunch of other things, we will be using the SR model in 6.002. And I will tell you why in a second. And for analog That is for amplifier designs and situations like that, we will be operating the MOSFET in a saturation region. And I will talk about that in a second.

我在这里要说的是，在 6.002 中，当我们进行模拟设计时，我们将严格限制自己只在这个区域使用 MOSFET。我们将限制自己只在这个 vDS 相当大的地方玩耍。为什么？因为我要求你这么做。我是说让我们在操场的那部分玩耍，并保持你的 vDS 很高。

What I am saying here is that in 6.002, when we do analog designs, we are going to discipline ourselves to using the MOSFET only in this region. We are going to constrain ourselves to play in only this region of the playground where vDS is quite large. Why? Because I am asking you to. I am saying let’s play in that part of the playground and keep your vDS high.

因此 MOSFET 将在某处工作。因此我们可以只应用 SCS 模型，即该区域中的电流源行为。还有一个重要原因，我稍后会讲到。对于数字设计，我们将只使用 SR 模型。

And so the MOSFET is going to be operating somewhere in here. So we can apply just the SCS model, just the current source behavior in that region. There is another important reason, which I will get to in a second. And for digital designs we will simply use the SR model.

事实证明这是现实的，因为在你们已经看到和将在本课程中看到的数字设计中，下拉 MOSFET 处于打开状态，或者当这些下拉 MOSFET 处于打开状态时，输出电压被拉低至接近地。因此 vDS 非常非常小。因此，应用此模型确实有意义。当我们谈论放大器时，我要求你们遵循这一原则。

And it turns out that this is realistic because in the digital designs that you have you seen and will be seeing in this course, the pull down MOSFET is on, or when these pull down MOSFETs are on, the output voltage is pulled down close to ground. So vDS is very, very small. So it does make sense that this model apply. And when we talk about amplifiers, I am asking you to follow this discipline.

我马上告诉你为什么。我是说模拟设计遵循这个我称之为饱和原则的原则。它说简单地将饱和状态下的 MOSFET 作为电流源运行。我们马上看一个放大器，我会告诉你为什么。

I will tell you why in a second. I am saying analog designs follow this discipline that I call the saturation discipline. It says simply operate the MOSFET operating in saturation as a current source. We will look at an amplifier in a second, and I will tell you why.

MOSFET 放大器

MOSFET Amplifier

现在让我们做一个 MOSFET 放大器。记得我的放大器有一个输入端口和一个输出端口。

Now let’s do a MOSFET amplifier. Remember my amplifier had an input port and an output port.

一般来说，在使用中，我们会有一个公共接地。这里也有一个 VS 和一个接地。这是放大器的电源端口。输入端口和输出端口。让我重新绘制电路，用 MOSFET 代替电流源、RL、VS、vO、漏极、栅极、源极、vI。所以我的输入是 vI。同样，MOSFET 的输出是 vO。我有一个电阻器 RL。

And in general in our use we are going to have a common ground. And we have a VS and a ground here as well. That is the power port of the amplifier. The input port and the output port. And let me redraw the circuit putting a MOSFET in place of the current source, RL, VS, vO, drain, gate, source, vI. So my input is vI. Again, the MOSFET output is vO. And I have a resistor RL.

嘿，我们以前见过。事实证明这并不奇怪。你以前见过。这是我们的原始反相电路。那么这里有什么不同？我们向你展示了作为反相器的电路。这里的不同之处在于，当我们将 MOSFET 行为视为电流源时，它的行为就像一个放大器。换句话说，当 vDS 大于某个值时，它的行为就像一个电流源。

Hey, we’ve seen that before. It turns out this is not surprising. You’ve seen this before. This was our primitive inverter circuit. So what’s different here? We showed you the circuit as an inverter. What’s different here is that when we look at MOSFET behavior as a current source, this behaves like an amplifier. In other words, when vDS is greater than some value then this behaves like a current source.

当 vDS 较小时，换句话说，在数字设计中，当 vDS 较小时，因为当 MOSFET 导通时，它会将电压拉低至地，我们可以将此行为视为电阻。完全一样，它是一个放大器。对于数字设计，我用 5 伏和 0 伏驱动它，就是这样，轨对轨。

When vDS is small, in other words, in the digital design when vDS was small here, because when the MOSFET was on it pulled the voltage down to ground, we could view this behavior as a resistor. And exactly the same thing, it is an amplifier. And with digital designs, I was driving it with 5 volts and 0 volts and that was it, rail to rail.

作为放大器，我现在要做的是观察当 vDS 大于 vGS 减去 VT 时其行为的一小部分。我的意思是，对于放大，让我们遵循饱和原则。原因是，当它表现得像电流源时，我已经向您展示了，如果它表现得像电流源，我已经向您展示了上面的表达式会给您放大。

As an amplifier, what I am doing now is looking at a small region of its behavior when vDS is greater than vGS minus VT. What I am saying is that for amplification let’s follow the saturation discipline. And the reason is that when this behaves like a current source, what I have shown you is that if this behaves like a current source I have shown you that this expression up here gives you amplification.

在上一节课中，我们绘制了一系列 vO 与 vI 的值，我们发现它们得到了放大。vI 的微小变化会导致 vO 发生较大变化，这时我得到了电流源方程。

In last lecture we plotted a bunch of values for vO versus vI, and we saw that we were getting amplification. For a small change in vI was getting a larger change in vO, and that was when I had the equation for a current source in there.

因此，我们确实知道，如果我可以将其作为电流源，并合理选择值，我将能够获得放大。我没有告诉您的是，如果在线性区域内操作，实际上不会获得放大。我不会介绍这一点，但您可以在课程笔记中查看讨论，也可以自己尝试一下。

And so we know for a fact that if I can operate this as a current source, with a reasonable choice of values here, I am going to be able to get amplification. What I haven’t told you is if this is operated in the linear region, in fact, you do not get amplification. I won’t cover that, but you can check that out in your course notes as a discussion or you can try it out for yourself.

将其替换为小 vDS 的 SR 模型，您会发现自己没有得到任何放大。为了获得放大，我们告诉自己，让我们专注于操场的这一部分，其中 vDS 大于或等于 vGS 减去 VT。并且 vGS 大于或等于 VT。因此，当 vGS 大于 VT 时，MOSFET 处于开启状态。

Replace this with the SR model for small vDS and you can show yourselves that you don’t get any amplification. In order to get the amplification we are telling ourselves let’s focus on this part of the playground where vDS is greater than or equal to vGS minus VT. And for vGS greater than or equal to VT. So when vGS is greater than VT the MOSFET is on.

此外，当 vDS 很大时，大于 vGS 减去 VT，它就像一个电流源。所以我们现在为自己创建了一个小型游乐场，我们可以在那里构建许多有趣的小型放大器和其他电路。

Further, when vDS is large, larger than vGS minus VT this behaves like a current source. So we have now created a small playground for ourselves where we can build lots of fun little amplifiers and other circuits.

如果我们的电路遵循饱和原则，其中对于电路中的 MOSFET 或 MOSFET，这些表达式成立，那么 MOSFET 将处于饱和状态，电流源模型适用，并且我确实会得到饱和。在未来的课程中，您可能会看到 MOSFET 出于各种原因在其他操作模式下使用。

And provided our circuits follow the saturation discipline where for the MOSFET or MOSFETs in the circuit these expressions are true then the MOSFETs are going to be in saturation, the current source model applies, and I will be indeed getting saturation. In future courses you may actually see the MOSFET used in other regimes of operation for a variety of reasons.

但在 6.002 中，当我们讨论放大器等时，我们将采用饱和原则。您的家庭作业问题等将说明这一点。假设 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。这意味着您可以开始将它们建模为电流源，并相应地分析它们的行为。一个小问题。请注意，MOSFET 的 vDS 与 vO 相同。

But in 6.002 when we talk about amplifiers and so on we will be adopting the saturation discipline. And your homework problems and so on will state that. Assume that the MOSFETs are in saturation. What that means is that you can begin to model them as a current source and simply analyze their behavior accordingly. One minor nit. Note that vDS for the MOSFET is the same as vO.

MOSFET 的 vGS 与 vI 相同。因此，如果您看到我反复使用 vO 和 vI 或 vDS 和 vGS，它们在这个电路中是相同的。如果您处理的电路有许多 MOSFET，那么您将拥有 vDS1 和 vGS1 等等。但对于这个简单的电路，vO 和 vDS 相同，vI 和 vGS 相同。

And vGS for the MOSFET is the same as vI. So if you see me jumping back and forth using vOs and vIs or vDSs and vGSs they are the same thing in this circuit. If you are dealing with circuits with many MOSFETs then you will have vDS1s and vGS1s and so on and so forth. But for this simple circuit, vO and vDS are the same, vI and vGS are the same.

所以我们可以继续分析该电路。

So we could go ahead and analyze that circuit.

MOSFET 处于饱和状态

MOSFET in Saturation

我分析电路时会告诉你这一点。我告诉你 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。我告诉你这一点。我们已经训练自己说，在那个电路中 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。一旦我们告诉你这一点，我们就可以继续分析该电路。

What I do to analyze the circuit, I am telling you this. I am telling you that the MOSFET is behaving in saturation. I am telling you this. We have disciplined ourselves to say that in that circuit the MOSFET is in saturation. As soon as we tell you that we can then go ahead and analyze that circuit.

要分析该电路，您只需用等效模型替换 MOSFET，如下所示。由于您已被告知它处于饱和状态，我们可以用其电流源模型替换 MOSFET。MOSFET 的电流 iDS 由 K/2(vI VT)^2 给出。最好将隐式工作的约束写在旁边。

And to analyze that circuit what you will do is simply replace the MOSFET with its equivalent model, and that looks like this. Since you have been told that it is in saturation, we can replace the MOSFET with its current source model. And the current iDS for the MOSFET is given by K/2(vI VT)^2. And it is always good to write the constraints under which you are implicitly working close by.

因此，约束条件只有一个，即 vGS 大于或等于 VT，vDS 大于或等于 vGS 减去 VT。这些约束条件直接源于我们在饱和规则下操作或 MOSFET 处于饱和状态的陈述。让我将此等式标记为 A，我们将再次引用它。

So the constraints are one, vGS is greater than or equal to VT, vDS is greater than or equal to vGS minus VT. These constraints immediately follow from a statement of the type we are operating under the saturation discipline or the MOSFET is in saturation. Let me just mark this equation as A, and we will refer to it again.

因此，有了这个新的小电路，MOSFET 充当电流源，让我们继续分析我们的放大器。请注意，要分析电路，我有一个电流源。它是一个依赖电流源，电流取决于输入的平方。所以我想去分析它。这是一个非线性电路。所以我可以应用我们上周讨论过的用于非线性电路的任何一种方法。

So with this new little circuit with the MOSFET working as a current source, let’s go ahead and analyze our amplifier. Notice that to analyze the circuit I have a current source. It’s a dependent current source where the current depends on the square of the input. So I want to go and analyze it. This is a nonlinear circuit. So I can apply any one of the methods that we talked about last week for nonlinear circuits.

为了分析它，我将继续使用分析方法。

To analyze it I will go ahead and use the analytical method.

分析方法

Analytical Method

我的目标是获得 vO 与 vI 的关系。再说一遍，还记得我们现在在哪里吗？MOSFET 电路处于饱和状态，因此我可以用电流源代替它。它是非线性的。因此我可以应用两种方法中的一种，即分析方法或图形方法。让我们同时使用这两种方法，并从分析方法开始。

And my goal will be to obtain vO versus vI. Again, remember where are we here? The MOSFET circuit operating in saturation so I can replace this with a current source. It is nonlinear. And so I can apply one of the two methods, the analytical method or the graphical method. Let’s do both and start with the analytical method.

分析方法只是说继续，应用节点方法并求解。很简单。让我们继续这样做。节点方法。我这里有一个感兴趣的节点。我知道这个节点的电压 vI。我知道这个节点的电压 VS。所以唯一未知的是 vO。所以我继续这样做。让我继续将进入节点的电流设为零。

The analytical method simply says go forth, apply the node method and solve. Simple stuff. Let’s go ahead and do that. Node method. I have a single node here that is of interest. I know the voltage vI at this node. I know the voltage VS at this node. So the only unknown is here at vO. So I will go ahead and do that. Let me go ahead and equate the currents into the node to be zero.

因此，此处节点的流出电流为 iDS。这等于流入同一节点的电流。因此，iDS 必须等于 VS 减去 vO 除以 RL。iDS=VS vO/RL。

So the currents out of the node here are iDS. And that was equal the current into that same node. So iDS must equal VS minus vO divided by RL. iDS=VS vO/RL.

简化

Simplifying

为方便以后参考，我将其称为 B。简化一下，我能做的是，我们知道 iDS 由 K/2(vI VT)^2 给出。因此，我用这个表达式替换 iDS，并将其乘以 RL。这样我就得到了 K/2(vI VT)RL。

For later reference, let me call that B. Simplifying, what I can do is, we know that iDS is given by K/2(vI VT)^2. So I replace iDS with this expression and I multiply that by RL. So I get K/2(vI VT)RL.

因此，iDS 乘以 RL，得到这一边的 vO，VS 留在这里。我所做的就是将两边都乘以 RL。因此，它是 RL iDS，将 RL iDS 移到这一边，也就是这里，我得到负号，VS 留在这里，vO 留在这里。所以这是我的最终表达式。请记住，这在某些条件下是正确的。

So iDS gets multiplied by RL and I get vO on this side and VS remains out here. All I have done is multiplied both sides by RL. So it is RL iDS, taken RL iDS to this side, that is here, I get the minus sign, and VS stays here, vO comes here. So that is my final expression. Remember this is true under certain conditions.

我会不断强调这一点，因为人们最常犯的错误之一就是忘记了获得这一结果的约束条件。而获得这一结果的约束条件是饱和度原则。当 MOSFET 的 vGS 大于或等于 VT 且 MOSFET 的 vDS 大于或等于 vGS 减去 VT 时，情况确实如此。我还知道，对于小于 VT 的 vGS，vO=VS。

I will keep hammering that home because some of the most common errors made by people is in forgetting the constraints under which this was obtained. And the constraint under which this was obtained is the saturation discipline. And that was true when vGS for a MOSFET was greater than or equal to VT and vDS for a MOSFET was greater than or equal to vGS minus VT. I also know that for vGS less than VT, vO=VS.

因此，当 vGS 小于 VT 时，该电路将关闭。这就是为什么它是 SCS 模型，即开关电流源模型。当 vGS 小于零时，它会关闭，VS 直接出现在 vO 处。我想和您一起盯着这个约束看一秒钟，这里的 vDS 大于或等于 vGS 减去 VT。而 vDS 就是 vO。我想用 iDS 重写这个约束。

So when vGS is less than VT then this one turns off. That’s why it is the SCS model, switch current source model. When vGS is less than zero it turns off and VS directly appears at vO. I would like to stare at this constraint with you for a second, vDS greater than or equal to vGS minus VT here. And vDS is simply vO. I want to rewrite this constraint in terms of iDS.

它会派上用场。所以 iDS 是 K/2(vI VT)^2。这是 vI VT。所以 vI VT 只是 2iDS/K 的平方根。换句话说，我可以写出 iDS 小于或等于 K/2vO^2。因此，用 iDS 表示的这个约束就是 iDS 小于或等于 K/2vO^2。所以我在这里所做的就是分析这个非线性电路。我也可以使用图形方法进行分析。

It will come in handy. So iDS is K/2(vI VT)^2. This is vI VT. So vI VT is simply square root of 2iDS/K. In other words, I can write iDS less than or equal to K/2vO^2. So this constraint expressed in terms of iDS is simply iDS less than or equal to K/2vO^2. So all I’ve done here is analyzed this nonlinear circuit. I can also analyze it using the graphical method.

为了实现这一点，对于我的非线性电路，为了实现这一点，我所要做的就是绘制图表。我们在这里画出 iDS，在这里画出 vDS。就像我们用非线性指数 dweeb 做的那样，我所做的就是绘制器件特性 iDS 与 vDS 的关系。饱和状态下的器件特性如下所示，因此 vGS 增加。iDS 与 vDS 有一系列曲线，看起来像是值增加的电流源。

And in order to do that, for my nonlinear circuit, in order to do that, all I have to do is plot. Let’s have iDS here and vDS here. And as we did with a nonlinear expo dweeb, what I do is I plot the device characteristics iDS versus vDS. The device characteristics under saturation look like this, so vGS increasing. iDS versus vDS has a bunch of curves that look like current sources of increasing values.

这仅仅反映了方程 A。然后我在其上叠加方程 B 得出的表达式，即 iDS 等于，让我把它写在这里，iDS 等于 VS/RL vO/RL。这是 B。让我画出它。这是 iDS 和 vO 之间的直线关系。因此，当 vO 为零时，iDS 为 VS/RL。当 iDS 为零时，vO 等于 VS。请记住，vO 和 vDS 相同。

That simply reflects equation A. And then I superimpose on top of that the expression that comes up due to equation B which is iDS equals, let me write that down here, iDS equals VS/RL vO/RL. That’s B. And let me plot that. That is a straight line relationship between iDS and vO. And so when vO is zero iDS is VS/RL. And when iDS is zero vO equals VS. Remember, vO and vDS are the same.

所以我得到的是这样的。这是对应于方程 B 的直线。和之前一样，我们只需找到两者相交的点。假设我得到了一些 vGS 值。假设我得到了一些已知的 vDS 值。因此，我可以继续从该图中找到相应的 iDS 值。

So this is what I get. This is the straight line corresponding to equation B here. And, as before, we just find the point where the two intersect. Let’s say I am given some value of vGS. And let’s say I am given some known value of vDS. So for that I can go ahead and find out the corresponding value of iDS from this graph.

正如我在做 expo dweeb 东西时告诉您的那样，这里的线称为负载线。您将一次又一次地看到它，其中我们有与此处显示的方程相对应的方程，该方程是针对叠加在设备特性上的输出环路编写的。这称为负载线。

Just as I told you when we did the expo dweeb stuff, this line here is called a load line. You will be seeing that again and again and again where we have the equation corresponding to the one shown here, the equation written for the output loop superimposed on the device characteristics. That’s called a load line.

因此，我可以使用图解法得到该点，该点对应于该 iDS、vDS 和 vGS 的 MOSFET 工作点。在下一讲中，我们将研究，给定这种类型的设备，我们如何找出有效操作的边界，以使 MOSFET 保持饱和状态？

So I can get this point corresponding to the operating point of the MOSFET for this iDS, vDS and vGS by using the graphical method. In the next lecture we are going to look at, given a device of this sort, how do we figure out the boundaries of valid operation so that the MOSFET stays in saturation?

Lec 9B | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 9B | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 50:36 https://youtube.com/watch?v=jURSAKBlIZA

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 50:36 https://youtube.com/watch?v=jURSAKBlIZA

大家早上好。我们开始吧。我想你们昨天已经复习过测验了。希望你们没有太过责​​备（助教姓名）和其他人？（助教姓名）。如你所知，测验在明天进行。不幸的是，麻省理工学院无法给我们一个大房间，所以我们被分成三个房间。你们将根据姓氏的首字母进入自己的房间。

Good morning, all. Let’s get going. So I guess you had your quiz review yesterday. I hope you guys didn’t beat up on (name of TA) and who else was it? (Name of TA) too much. As you know, the quiz is tomorrow. And unfortunately MIT couldn’t give us one big room so we are broken up into three rooms. And you will go to your room based on the first letter of your last name.

好的，今天我们将讨论一个名为“大信号分析”的主题。所以在前几节课中，我们抽象地研究了一个从属源，然后我们研究了一个使用称为 MOSFET 的实际从属源构建的放大器。现在，MOSFET 必须在其工作的特定区域内运行才能像电流源一样工作。当它表现得像电流源时，你会得到放大或 FET 放大器。

OK, so today we shall cover a topic called “Large Signal Analysis”. So in the last couple lectures we looked at one dependent sources abstractly, and then we looked at an amplifier built using a practical dependent source called the MOSFET. Now, the MOSFET had to be operated in a given region of its operation in order to behave like a current source. And while it behaved like a current source you would get amplification or a FET amplifier.

那是在过去两次讲座中讲到的。今天你们要做的是大信号分析，这是一个含义丰富的术语。因此，大信号分析在我们的业务中具有非常具体的含义，我将描述它的含义。这种分析涉及查看包含例如 MOSFET 的电路，并找出如何让该设备以 MOSFET 始终处于饱和状态的方式运行。

So that was in the past two lectures. What you are going to do today is called large signal analysis, and this is a loaded term. So large signal analysis means something very specific in our business, and I will describe to what that is. This analysis involves looking at a circuit containing, for example, a MOSFET and figuring out how to get that device to operate in a way that the MOSFET was always in saturation.

因此，您必须根据可以控制的参数确定如何建立这些参数，以便电路以 MOSFET 始终处于饱和状态的方式运行。因此，大信号分析涉及这一点。虽然我们使用的示例使用的是 MOSFET，但同样的分析可以应用于任何其他设备。请记住，您的 MOSFET 是我们在本课程中用作示例的原始元素。

So you had to figure out, based on parameters that you could control, how to establish those parameters so that the circuit operated in a way that the MOSFET was always in saturation. So large signal analysis involves that. And although the examples we use, use the MOSFET, the same kind of analysis can apply to any other device. Remember, your MOSFET is a primitive element that we use as an example in this course.

您还可以使用其他基本元素。例如，课程笔记讨论了其他几种设备。一种是“双极结型晶体管”，即 BJT，并从头到尾讲解了一个完整的示例，涉及包含双极结型晶体管的电路。您还可以对该设备进行大信号分析。

There are other primitive elements that you can use. The course notes, for example, discusses a couple other devices. One is the “bipolar junction transistor”, the BJT, and works through a complete example from start to finish involving a circuit containing a bipolar junction transistor. And you can do a large signal analysis of that device as well.

事实证明，您需要在设备操作空间中一个有趣的区域内操作该设备，这样您就可以对包含该设备的电路进行大信号分析，并找出最佳操作该电路的方法。这就是大信号分析，今天我们将举一个例子来解释如何做到这一点。

It turns out that you need to operate that device in an interesting region of its operating space, and so you can conduct a large signal analysis of a circuit containing that device and figure out how best to operate that circuit. So that is large signal analysis, and we will do an example and explain how this is done using an example today.

为了快速回顾一下到目前为止的内容，我们研究了这里的小结构，即我们的 MOSFET 放大器。请注意，当我在节点上写入电压时，这是一种简短的形式，表示我正在查看接地节点和记录电压的节点之间的电压。所以这里是 VO，这里应用了 VI。这是我们使用的非常非常常见的电路。

So to quickly review where we have been so far, we looked at this little structure here, our MOSFET amplifier. Notice that when I write a voltage at a node, that’s a short form for saying I am looking at the voltage between the ground node and the node at which the voltage is written down. So VO here and VI applied here. This is a very, very common circuit that we use.

再强调一点，一般来说，无论是在本课程中还是在现实生活中，我们研究的电路类型中，有一些我们非常常用的模式一直在重复。很多时候，你不必考虑所有可能的排列组合来连接事物。这种连接方式非常非常常见。你会看到很多这种模式。

To emphasize one more point, in general, in the kind of circuits we look at both in this course and in real life, there are a few patterns that we use very commonly that keep repeating all the time. Very often you don’t have to look at every possible permutation and combination of how things could be connected. This sort of connecting thing is very, very, very common. And you will see a lot of this pattern.

我们为此制作了等效电路。在等效电路中，我们用从属源替换 MOSFET，前提是它在饱和区内工作。所以我只想说，在饱和状态下工作时，等效电路将如下所示，VO、VI。从属源的 IDS 由 K/2 (VI VT)^2 给出。所以这是一个放大器。这是该设备处于饱和状态时的等效电路。

And we do the equivalent circuit for this. In the equivalent circuit we replace the MOSFET with a dependent source provided this operated in the saturation region. So I will just say while operating under saturation the equivalent circuit would look like this, VO, VI. And IDS for the dependent source was given by K/2 (VI VT)^2. So this was an amplifier. Here was the equivalent circuit while this device was in saturation.

为了在饱和状态下工作，我说过 MOSFET 需要具备某些特性。要使其在饱和状态下工作，有两个特性需要满足。一个是栅极到源极的电压需要大于 VT，因此 MOSFET 的 VGS 应该大于 VT。第二个是输出电压需要大于输入电压减去一个阈值压降。

And to operate in saturation, I said that certain properties need to be true for the MOSFET. And there are two properties that need to be true for this to be operating in saturation. One is that its gate to source voltage needs to be greater than VT, so VGS for the MOSFET should be greater than VT. And the second one was that the output voltage needed to be greater than the input voltage minus one threshold drop.

这与 MOSFET 的 VDS 相同，这与 MOSFET 的 VGS 相同。那么我们在这里真正要说的是什么？我们要说的是，看，我们使用 MOSFET 构建了这个电路，作为工程师，我们有责任选择其工作点，以保持这两个属性。

And this was the same as VDS for the MOSFET, this was the same as VGS for the MOSFET. So what are we really saying here? What we are saying is that look, we built this circuit using a MOSFET, and it is up to us as engineers to choose its operating points in a way that these two properties hold.

例如，为了使第一个条件成立，我可以训练自己，使 VI 始终大于 VT。同样，我可以选择 VS、RL 和 VI，以使这个条件成立，也就是说，我的 MOSFET 漏极和源极之间的漏源电压应大于 VI 减去 VT。

For example, to make the first condition true, I can discipline myself to operate such that VI is always greater than VT. Similarly, I can choose VS, RL and VI in a way that this condition is true, which says that the drain to source voltage across my MOSFET drain and source should be greater than VI minus VT.

例如，如果 VI 为 2 伏，而 VT 为 1 伏，那么我要说的是 VO 应该大于或等于 2 减 1 或 1 伏。所以我需要保持这个高电压，2、3、4、5 等，这样这个家伙才能保持饱和状态。

As an example, if VI was 2 volts and VT was, say, 1 volt, then what I am saying is that VO should be greater than or equal to 2 minus 1 or 1 volt. So I need to keep this high, 2,3.4,5, whatever, a high voltage so that this guy stays in saturation.

我们将在课程笔记中介绍的材料的相关阅读在 7.5.1 和 7.6 中。所以这基本上是对我们所学内容的回顾。我们说我们可以建立一个放大器。它的等效电路显示在右侧。

The relevant readings for the material that we are going to cover in the course notes are in 7.5.1 and 7.6. So that is pretty much a review of where we were. We said we could build an amplifier. Its equivalent circuit was shown on the right.

并且，只要我训练自己在饱和区内工作，或者让 MOSFET 在饱和区内工作，那么它就会像放大器一样工作，一切都会好起来。所以今天我们来看看电路的大信号分析。一个例子就是上面这个包含 MOSFET 的电路。

And, provided that, I discipline myself to operate in the saturation region or to have the MOSFET operating in the saturation region, then this would work like an amplifier and all would be good with the world. So today we look at large signal analysis of a circuit. And an example would be this circuit up here containing a MOSFET.

再次，正如我之前提到的，大信号分析是 6.002 课程中的一个重要术语，或者说是电路中的术语。大信号分析涉及两个步骤。第一步是写下小电路的传递函数。在我们的例子中，VO 是输出，VI 是输入，因此需要写下 VO 与 VI。只需写下传递函数即可。

And, again, as I mentioned earlier, a large signal analysis is a loaded term in 6.002, or for that matter in circuits. And large signal analysis involves two steps. The first step involves writing down the transfer function of your little circuit. In our case, VO is the output, VI is the input, so involves writing down VO versus VI. Simply write down the transfer function.

换句话说，就是该电路的输出和输入之间的关系。在我们的例子中，我们再次严格遵守“饱和原则”。大信号分析的第二部分是找出有效的输入工作范围。找出给定电路参数，假设我应用 VS，使用某个 RL 值，使用给定 MOSFET，其具有给定的 VT 值。

In other words, the relationship between the output and the input for that circuit. And, in our case, again, we’ve disciplined ourselves to adhere to the “saturation discipline”. And the second part of large signal analysis is to find out the valid input operating range. Find out for the given circuit parameters, let’s say I apply a VS and I use some value of RL and I use a given MOSFET, which has a given value of VT.

那么问题是，一组有效的输入电压是多少，才能使电路以饱和状态运行。因此，找出有效的输入范围，这将为 MOSFET 的饱和运行提供相应的输出范围。这就是我们今天在讲座中要讨论的内容。

The question then is that what is a valid set of input voltages that would operate the circuit in a way that I would be in saturation. And so find out the valid input range, and this would give me a corresponding output range for saturation operation of the MOSFET. That is what we will dwell on in the lecture today.

因此，我们在这里要说的是，如果我在给定 RL 和 VS 值的情况下谨慎地应用 VI，并且对于给定的 MOS 晶体管选择，那么只要我仔细选择输入电压，我就可以保持在饱和范围内。我们今天将进行的分析将确定输入电压的范围。再次，我将以此为激励示例，即 MOSFET 放大器。

So what we are saying here is that if I am careful with how I apply VI for a given value of RL and VS and for a given choice of my MOS transistor then I can stay within saturation provided I select my input voltages carefully. And the analysis that we will go through today will figure out what that range of input voltages is. And, again, I will use this as a motivating example, the MOSFET amplifier.

但一般来说，大信号分析也适用于任何其他电路。例如，在复习课上，你可能会学习包含 MOSFET 的其他电路。你可以对包含 MOSFET 的其他电路进行大信号分析，或者你可能会学习其他一些器件，如双极结型晶体管，你可以对该器件进行同样的分析。所以请记住，这里的 MOSFET 放大器就是一个例子。

But in general large signal analysis would apply to any other circuit as well. For example, in recitation you may learn about other circuits containing a MOSFET. And you can do a large signal analysis of other circuits containing a MOSFET or you might learn about some other devices like the bipolar junction transistor, and you could do the same kind of analysis for that device. So remember that the MOSFET amplifier here is an example.

我将以此作为解释大信号分析的驱动示例。因此，正如我之前提到的，第一步是获取 VO 与 VI。一般来说，对于您构建的某些电路，输出甚至不会是电压。有些电路的输出可能是某种电流。

I will be using that as a driving example to explain large signal analysis. So the first step, as I mentioned earlier, is to get the VO versus VI. And in general for some circuit that you build the output will not even be a voltage. There are certain circuits where the output might be some kind of a current.

假设我正在构建某种电路，我希望输出电流或通过电路某个边缘的电流取决于某个输入。在这种情况下，传递函数将是输出电流与 VI 的关系。如果我这里有输入电流，它将是输出电流与输入电流的关系，你知道，无论给定的问题告诉你什么。所以这是在饱和规则下。

Let’s say I am building some kind of a circuit where I would like the output current or the current through some edge of the circuit to depend on some input. In that case the transfer function would be the output current versus VI. And if I had an input current here it would be output current versus input current, you know, whatever the given problem tells you. So this is under the saturation discipline.

我不会为你重新推导这个。你可以应用像分析方法这样的老方法。或者你可以使用图解法来得到适当的答案。我想快速指出一下，我们为什么要关心图解分析？一旦你有了分析方法，为什么还要关心图解法？

And I will not rederive this for you. You can apply a good old technique like the analytical method. Or you can use the graphical method to get the appropriate answer here. I wanted to point out in a quick aside that why do we care about graphical analysis? Once you have the analytical method, why do you care about the graphical method?

上周四课后，一位学生问了我一个问题，我突然想到，为什么需要图形方法并不明显。所以，很多时候你没有描述设备的方程式。比如说，我是一家制造商。假设我是 AMD。作为 AMD，我坐下来，我的半导体部门制造了一个 MOSFET。

And a student asked me a question after lecture last Thursday, and it occurred to me that it’s not obvious why you need the graphical method. So it turns out that often times you do not have an equation describing the device. So let’s say, for example, I am a manufacturer. Let’s say I am AMD. As AMD I sit down and my semiconductor division builds a MOSFET.

当你制造一个 MOSFET 时，你的实验和制造部门通常不会给你一个 MOSFET 方程。他们制造一些东西，然后你看它并对其进行实验。你施加各种输入电压，测量电流和输出电压等等。所以你最终得到的是一张描述 MOSFET 行为的图表。

And when you build a MOSFET your experiments and your fabrication division often times doesn’t give you an equation with the MOSFET. They build something and then you look at it and you experiment with it. You apply various input voltages and you measure currents and output voltages and so on. And so what you end up getting is a graph that describes the behavior of the MOSFET.

您在实验室中也见过这种情况，您的 2N7000 或 2000.7000。因此，您在实验室中使用的 MOSFET 2N7000 也为您提供了数据表。在该数据表中，您会看到一堆曲线。因此，设备通常都附带数据表。当您有数据表但没有方程式时，您可以应用图形方法并解决电路问题。

And you have seen this in your lab as well, your 2N7000 or was it 2000.7000. So your 2N7000, the MOSFET you use in the lab also gives you a data sheet. And in that data sheet you see a bunch of curves. So very often devices come with data sheets. And when you have a data sheet but no equation then you can apply the graphical method and solve your circuits.

在这个例子中，假设我可以应用分析方法，这是我在上节课中为您推导的表达式。因此，VO 与 VI 的关系是使用平方律关系。我们可以用这个方程来绘图和做其他有趣的事情。这是输入电压 VI。这是我的 VT。请注意，VO 是 VS。

In this example, assuming I can apply the analytical method, here was the expression that I had derived for you in the last lecture. So VO was related to VI using the square law relationship. And we can plot and do other fun stuff with this equation. So here is the input voltage VI. That is my VT. So notice that VO is VS.

当 VI 大于或等于 VT 且 VO 大于或等于 VI 减 VT 时，情况确实如此。因此，这些是饱和度约束。在我们的特定情况下，当 VI 小于 VT 时，输出将只是 VS。如果 VI 小于 VT，则 MOSFET 将关闭，关闭，并且 I 将没有电流流过 RL，VS 将出现在输出端。

This is true when VI greater than or equal to VT and VO greater than or equal to VI minus VT. So these are the constraints of the saturation discipline. And in our particular situation when VI was less than VT output would simply be VS. If VI is less than VT the MOSFET would turn off, switch off, and I would have no current flowing through RL, and VS would appear at the output.

因此，在 VT 之前，我有 VS，然后我得到了这个方程所表达的平方律行为。这只是 VS K/2 (VI VT)(RL^2)。这是第一部分。您之前已经看过了。传递函数显示 VI 和 VO 之间存在平方律依赖关系。所以现在我可以开始大信号分析的第二步了，我的目标是找到有效的输入操作范围。

So until VT, I have VS, and then following that I get the square law behavior articulated by this equation. And this was simply VS K/2 (VI VT)(RL^2). So that’s the first part. You have seen this before. The transfer function shows that I have a square law dependence between VI and VO. So now I can embark on the second step of my large signal analysis, and my goal is to find the valid input operating range.

那么这是什么意思呢？对于这个小电路，我要做的是漏极、源极、栅极、VI、VO、RL 和 VS。我要做的是，给定电源 VS、RL 和 MOSFET 的值，在我们的例子中，给定一个 MOSFET 意味着它是该 MOSFET 的给定 K 值和给定 VT 值。

So what does that mean? What I am looking to do here is, for this little circuit, is drain, source, gate, VI, VO, RL and VS. What I am looking to do is that given the value of the supply VS, RL and a MOSFET, in our case given a MOSFET implies that it is a given value of K and a given value of VT for that MOSFET.

所以我要做的是找出答案，假设 VI 是我的自由变量。所以我的目标是找出该设备保持饱和状态的 VI 范围。我将使用几种方法来做到这一点，我将结合使用图形方法为您提供直观的理解，然后应用分析来得出具体答案。

So what I am going to do is find out, let’s assume VI is my free variable here. So my goal will be to find out the range of VI for which this device stays in saturation. And I will use a couple of methods to do that, and I will use both a combination of a graphical method to give you intuition and then apply analytical analysis to get down to specific answers.

让我们从直观的部分开始。这是 VI，VO。我将使用 VO 与 VI 的传递曲线来帮助建立直观。这就是它的样子。第一步，看这张图，我们知道这里的这个点，VI 需要大于 VT 才能满足第一个方程。让我把这两个方程都写下来。

So let’s start with the intuitive part. So here is VI, VO. I will use the transfer curve VO versus VI to help build intuition here. So that is what it looks like. So the first step, looking at this graph, we know that this point here, that VI needs to be greater than VT to satisfy the first equation. Let me just write down both equations here.

因此，VI 大于或等于 VT 是其中之一，VO 大于 VI 减 VT 是第二个等式。请记住，这与 VDS 相同，与 VGS 相同。因此，VI 必须大于 VT 才能使 MOSFET 导通。因此，有效工作范围从此点开始，并位于此处的某个位置。因此，第一部分非常简单。

So VI greater than or equal to VT is one of them, and VO is greater than VI minus VT is a second equation. And just remember that this is the same as VDS and this is the same as VGS. So VI must be greater than VT for the MOSFET to turn on. And so therefore the valid operating range starts at this point and is somewhere up here. So the first part is pretty easy.

在某个地方，在某个点，我的输出电压 VO。我不太确定那个点是什么。我的输出电压 VO，随着它不断下降，我的输出电压 VO 低于 VI 下的一个阈值。在那个点，它进入三极管区域，我需要找出那个点是什么。

Somewhere here Somewhere at that point, my output voltage VO. I’m not quite sure what that point is. My output voltage VO, as this keeps falling down, my output voltage VO goes lower than one threshold below VI. And at that point it goes into its triode region, and I need to find out what that point is.

因此，在这里的某个地方，我进入了三极管区域，并开始表现出与放大平方律关系不同的行为，并进入了三极管行为。所以我需要找出这一点。一旦我找出了这一点，那么这将是我的有效操作范围。所以让我们弄清楚这一点是什么。在这一点上，以下是正确的。当然，VI 大于 VT。

So somewhere here I go into my triode region and begin to show a different behavior than the amplifying square law relationship there and go into my triode behavior. So I need to find out what this point is. Once I find out what that point is then this will be my valid operating range. So let’s figure out what that point is. At that point the following is true. Certainly VI is greater than VT.

此时，输出低于一个阈值，即输入减去一个阈值。因此，此时以下公式成立，VO 等于 VI 减去 VT。此时，输出电压等于输入减去 VT。如果输出低于这个阈值，就会违反这里的等式。它不再大于该数字。那么我们如何找出这个点呢？原理直觉。

And at that point the output goes below one threshold, the input minus one threshold. So at this point the following is true, VO is equal to VI minus VT. At that point the output voltage is equal to the input minus VT. And if the output goes lower then it will violate this equation here. It is no longer greater than that number. So how do we find out what this point is? The principle intuition.

我们在这里画几条线。假设 VI 和 VT 使用相同的刻度，比如伏特。所以如果我画一条 45 度的直线，那么这就是一条表示 VI 等于 VO 的曲线。我们都知道这一点。没什么大不了的。所以这里 45 度的线就是 VI 等于 VO 的线。如果我现在取这条线，即 VI 等于 VO 线，然后我开始将其向右平移。

Let’s draw some lines here. Let’s assume that VI and VT use the same scale, say, volts. So if I draw a straight line at 45 degrees then that is a curve representing VI equals VO. We all know that. No big shakes. So the line at 45 degrees here is the line at which VI equal VO. And if I take that line now, the VI equals VO line, and I begin translating it to the right.

所以让我们在这里画一条线。让我们在那里画一条线。那条线将简单地等于 VO 等于 VI 减去 VT。我已将其向右平移。所以这条线就是 VO 等于 VI 减去 VT。所以这条线是 VO 等于这个值的点的轨迹。这减去 VT 显示为向右平移。

So let’s take a line here. Let’s take a line there. That line will be simply equal to VO equals VI minus VT. I have translated that to the right. And so this line is simply VO equals VI minus VT. So this line is a locus of points at which VO is equal to this value. This minus VT shows up as a translation to the right.

因此，我将 VO 等于 VI 的线向右平移，它变成 VO 等于 VI 减 VT。初等几何 101 或其他。那么我们这里有什么？在此之上，我们有条件 VO 大于或等于 VI 减 VT，在此之下，我们有 VO 小于 VI 减 VT。如果我们查看此处的图表，这就是有效输入操作范围。

So I take my VO equals VI line, translate that to the right and it becomes VO equals VI minus VT. Elementary geometry 101 or whatever. So what do we have here? Above this we have the condition VO greater than or equal to VI minus VT, and below that we have VO less than VI minus VT. If we look at this graph here, this is the valid input operating range.

从大于 VT 的这个点开始，此时我的输出等于 VO 等于 VI 减去 VT。这一定是输入从这里到这里的有效操作范围。相应地，输出从这里到这个点再到这里，就像这样。所以这是我的有效输入操作范围，这是我的有效输出操作范围或相应的有效输出操作范围。那么这说明了什么？

Starting at this point greater than VT, and at this point my output equals VO equals VI minus VT. This must be the valid operating range for the input here to here. And correspondingly the outputs are from here to this point to here like so. So this is my valid input operating range and this is my valid output operating range or the corresponding valid output operating range. So what does this say?

这句话的意思是，如果我作为电路设计师，能够足够自律地应用这个范围内的输入，将 VT 设置为这里的某个值，以图形方式显示在这里。那么我的 MOSFET 将保持饱和状态。相应地，我的输出将在 VS 和这里的某个值之间。所以希望这能让你对我们如何得到它有一些直观的了解。让我们继续。让我把这个点标记为 X。

What this is saying is that if I, as the designer of the circuit, am disciplined enough to apply inputs that are in this range, VT to some value here, graphically shown here. Then my MOSFET will remain in saturation. And correspondingly my outputs will go between VS and some value here. So hopefully that gives you some of the intuition behind how we get it. And let’s continue. Let me label this point X.

因此继续使用 2 来获得有效操作范围。我已经直观地向您展示了该点的位置，但接下来我要做的是为您实际计算该点。这是一个非常简单的计算。请注意，点 X 是两条曲线的交点 VO 等于 VI 减去 VT。第二条曲线是 VO 等于 VS 减去 K 除以 2，VI 减去 V2 全部平方 RL。

So continuing with two to get the valid operating range. I have shown you intuitively where that point is, but what I will do next is actually compute that for you. It is a pretty simple computation. Note that point X is the intersection of two curves VO equals VI minus VT. And the second curve is VO equals VS minus K divide by 2, VI minus V2 all squared RL.

因此点 X 位于这些曲线的交点处，我可以非常轻松地得到它，如下所示。我要做的是，我只需用这个等式中的 VI 减去 VT 代入，然后求解，这样我就可以得到 VO 等于 VS 减去 K 除以 2 VO 平方 RL。这样我就得到了 VO 的二次函数。我可以非常轻松地求解它。

So the point X iss at the intersection of these curves, and I can very easily get that as follows. What I will do is I will simply substitute for VI minus VT from this equation here and then solve for it, so I get VO equals VS minus K divide by 2 VO squared RL. And so this gives me a quadratic in VO. And I can solve for it pretty easily.

我得到二次方程 AX 平方加 BX 加 C 等于 0。解为 VO 减 B 加/减 B 平方的平方根减 4AC 除以 2A。所以我要在这里得到这些数字。所以 VO 的系数，也就是 B，是减 1。取正根，因为我们这里是正电压。

And I get for a quadratic AX squared plus BX plus C equals 0. The solution is given by VO is minus B plus/minus square root of B squared minus 4AC divided by 2A. And so I am just going to get those numbers here. So the coefficient of VO, that is B, is minus 1. Take the positive root because we are up in the positive voltages here.

再将 B 平方的平方根减去 1，即减去 4AC。因此，我得到一个加 4 倍 K 除以 2 RL 的结果。而 2A 就是 2 倍 K 除以 2 倍 RL。这就是我得到的结果。这给了我 VO。因此，它告诉我，当输出刚好等于低于 VI 的一个阈值时，VO 由其他电路周边（例如 VS、RL 等）给出。

And square root of B squared, that is 1, minus 4AC. So I get a plus 4 times K divide by 2 RL. And 2A is simply 2 times K divided by 2 times RL. So that is what I get. That gives me VO.
