So it tells me that VO, at the point where the output just equals one threshold drop below VI is given by the other circuit perimeter such as VS, RL and so on.

哦，我这里漏了一个 VS。我刚才忘了这里的 VS。那是我的 VO。那么 VI 等于什么？请记住，此时 VO 等于 VI 减去 VT，因此 VI 就是 VT 加上。我在这里没有教你任何惊天动地的东西。我只是在这里做了一些肮脏的数学运算来解这两个方程。

Oh, I am missing a VS here. I just forgot the VS up here. That is my VO. So what is VI equal to? Remember that at this point VO equals VI minus VT, so VI is simply VT plus I have not taught you anything earth shattering here. I have just done some grubby math here to solve these two equations.

这是一条与 VT 成 45 度角的直线，这是传递函数。我需要找到交点。交点由这个点给出。所以那个点，VI 是 VT 加上某个值，只是 X 轴上的第二个点。所以我基本上完成了。我的 VI 的有效输入范围从 VT 开始。所以它从 VT 开始。这就是晶体管刚打开的地方。

So this is a straight line at 45 degrees from VT and this is the transfer function. And I need to find the intersection. And the intersection is given by this point. So that point, VI being VT plus something, is simply the second dot on the X axis. So therefore I am pretty much done. My valid input range for VI goes from VT. So it starts at VT. That is where the transistor just turns on.

然后一直到这个点，VT 加减 1 加 1 的平方根加 2 K RL VS K RL。所以这是我的有效操作范围。再次记住，我不会详细讨论这个等式，因为在某种意义上，对于其他设备、包含 MOSFET 的其他电路，你会得到一组不同的限制。或者，对于人们可能关注的其他输出。

And then goes all the way to this point, VT plus minus 1 plus square root of 1 plus 2 K RL VS K RL. So this is my valid operating range. And again remember I won’t dwell on this equation because, in some sense, you will get a different set of limits for other devices, for other circuits containing a MOSFET. Or, for that matter, for other outputs that one may be focusing on.

因此，这里更重要的不是您看到的结果，而是我经历的过程。因此，这里更重要的是我是如何到达这里的？我到达这里的方法是查看图表并说，看，MOSFET 在那种状态下处于饱和状态。我正在寻找饱和操作状态的边界点。

So what is more important here is not so much the results that you see but the process that I have gone through. So what is more important here is how did I get here? And the way I got here was looked at the graph and said look, the MOSFET is in saturation in that regime. And I am finding the bounding points of the regime of saturation operation.

所以现在，作为一名工程师，我可以说，嘿，看，如果你像这样构建一个 MOSFET 电路，具有给定的 RL 值、给定的 MOSFET 和给定的 VS，那么如果你限制自己，你在这个范围内使用输入电压，你会很高兴。如果你超出这个范围，那么你将违反饱和原则。因此相应的输出范围

So now, as an engineer, I can say that hey, look, if you build a MOSFET circuit like so, with a given value of RL, a given MOSFET and a given VS, then if you limit yourself you are operating with input voltages in this range thou shalt be happy. If you go beyond that range then you will be violating the saturation discipline. So the corresponding output range

我可以写出相应的输出范围，从 VS 开始，当输入为 VT 时，输出为 VS，然后从 VS 下降到输入减去 VT。这仅仅是减 1 加 让我回过头来快速向你们展示一个小的 MOSFET 电路，放大电路，这样你们就可以自己看看真正的传输曲线了。

I can write the corresponding output range, and that goes from VS, when the input is at VT the output is at VS and goes from VS down to the input minus VT. Which is simply minus 1 plus Let me go back and quickly show you a little MOSFET circuit, amplified circuit so you can stare at a real transfer curve yourselves.

确实，您可以确信，在曲线上按比例显示的点处，MOSFET 确实进入了三极管区域并开始脱离饱和区域。请注意，这是同一条曲线，即传递函数。放大的输出处于 VS，直到输入达到阈值电压 VT。一旦输入超过 VT，输出就会开始急剧下降。

And indeed convince yourselves that roughly at the point where proportionately shown in the curve up there the MOSFET indeed goes into its triode region and begins heading out of its saturation region. Notice that here that is the same curve, the transfer function. And the amplified output is at VS until input reaches a threshold voltage VT. And once input goes beyond VT the output begins to drop precipitously.

在某个时刻，它开始进入三极管区域。我要做的就是增加输入电压 VI，您会看到输出开始进入三极管区域。它不断下降。正如您所看到的，输出开始进入增益不再大于 1 的空间。这是 MOSFET 操作的三极管区域。

And at some point here this begins to go into its triode region. And what I am going to do is simply increase the input voltage VI, and you will see that the output them begins to go into its triode region. It keeps dropping. And, as you can see, the output begins to go into a space where the gain is no longer more than 1. And this is a triode region of MOSFET operation.

因此 MOSFET 处于饱和状态，一切进展顺利。当我增加 VI 时，注意到在某个点我开始脱离 MOSFET 的饱和区。在这里的某个地方，我从饱和区过渡到三极管区。这里显示的这个值给出了相应的输入电压和输出电压。

So the MOSFET is in saturation, things are going great. As I increase my VI notice at some point I begin to go out of my saturation region of the MOSFET. And somewhere here I go from the saturation region and transition into the triode region. And this value shown here gives you the corresponding input voltage and the output voltage.

其他实用器件，如双极结晶体管或 MOSFET 和其他电路等，也可以进行类似的分析。您还可以找出该器件或该电路的有效工作区域。因此，下一步我想做的是

Other practical devices like bipolar junction transistors or MOSFETs and other circuits and so on can be subjected to a similar analysis. And you can find out the valid operating regions for that device as well, or for that circuit. So as a next step what I would like to do

在这里，我首先查看传递函数，即 VO 与 VI 曲线，并以此来推动我们如何计算边界区域背后的直觉。您可以直观地查看另一条曲线、另一组您熟悉的图表，即负载线特性，从而进行同样的分析。获得两种解释很有趣。您可以使用您觉得合适的任何一种。

Out here I began by looking at the transfer function, the VO versus VI curve, and used that to drive the intuition behind how we calculated the bounding regions. You can do the same kind of analysis intuitively looking at yet another curve, another set of graphs that you are familiar with, and that is a load line characteristic. And it is interesting to get two interpretations. And you can use whichever one you feel comfortable with.

因此，我将交替进行两项操作，并向您展示另一组可用于获得该结果的曲线。在这里，我将绘制 IDS 与 VDS 的关系，VDS 与 VO 相同。这是我们之前看到的负载线图。仅供参考，请记住，对于饱和操作，VI 必须大于 VT。同样，对于饱和操作，VO 应大于或等于 VI 减去 VT。

So I will do two alternatively and show you another set of curves that you can use to get that. Here I am going to plot IDS versus VDS, which is the same as VO. This was the load line graph that we had seen earlier. And, just for our reference, remember that VI must be greater than VT for saturation operation. Similarly VO should be greater than or equal to VI minus VT for saturation operation.

这些是我的极限。我们得到负载线图的方法是将负载线方程叠加在器件特性上。所以让我在饱和区绘制器件特性。请记住，这个约束可能与电流有关，正如我在上一节课中为您推导的那样。IDS 小于或等于 K 除以 2 VO 平方。

Those are my limits. The way we got the load line graph was we superimposed the load line equation over the device characteristics. And so let me plot the device characteristics in the saturation region. Remember that this constraint could be related to the current as I derived for you in the last lecture as follows. IDS being less than or equal to K divided by 2 VO squared.

因此，就我的 IDS 与 VDS 关系而言，这种横向约束相当于 IDS 小于 K 乘以 2 VO 平方。这就是那个等式。所以这条线是 IDS 等于 K 乘以 2 VO 平方。在这个区域中，我有一个有效的操作区域，其中 IDS 小于该质量。所以这里是我针对各种 VGS 值的所有其他曲线。所以这里是我的设备曲线，IDS 与 VDS。

So in terms of my IDS versus VDS relation, this lateral constraint is equivalent to IDS being less than K by 2 VO squared. So this is that equation. So this line is IDS equals K by 2 VO squared. And in this region I have the valid operating region where IDS is less than that quality. So here are all my other curves for various values VGS. So here are my devices curves, IDS versus VDS.

请记住，对于 MOSFET，这些曲线是这样的，对吧？我们只关注右侧，因为 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。而在这一侧，MOSFET 处于三极管区域，我们要求自己不要让 MOSFET 处于三极管区域。这些就是器件特性。然后我可以绘制负载线方程。

Remember that these curves come down like this, for the MOSFET, right? Just that we focus on the right hand side because that is where the MOSFET is in saturation. And on this side the MOSFET is in its triode region, and we discipline ourselves not to operate the MOSFET such that it is in its triode region. So those were the device characteristics. And then I could plot my load line equation.

如果您还记得的话，我的负载线方程是 IDS = VS/RL VO/RL。这只需在包含输出节点和电源 VS 的环路中写入 KVL 即可获得。请注意，VO 等于 VS 减去 IDS 乘以 RL。只需在两边除以 RL 并将 IDS 移到左侧，我们就可以得到这个方程。这个方程产生的曲线如下所示。

My load line equation, if you recall, was IDS = VS/RL VO/RL. This was simply obtained by writing KVL at the loop containing the output node and the supply VS. Notice there that VO is equal to VS minus IDS times RL. And that is simply by dividing by RL on both sides and moving IDS to the left hand side we get this equation. And this equation gives rise to a curve that looks like this.

这里的这个点是什么？这个点就是 VO 为 0 的地方。所以当 VO 为 0 时，我的 IDS 就是 VS 除以 RL。这个点是在 IDS 为 0 时获得的。在这些条件下，VS 和 VO 相等，所以这是 VS。这是我的饱和区，这是三极管区。这是另一个有趣的图表。我们经常亲切地称之为负载线图。

And what is this point here? This point is where VO is 0. So when VO is 0 my IDS is simply VS divided by RL. And this point is obtained when IDS is 0. And under those conditions VS and VO are equal so this is VS. This is my saturation region and this is the triode region. This was another interesting graph. We often times fondly call it the load line graph.

这是一条叠加在 MOSFET 器件 IDS 与 VDS 曲线上的负载线，适用于各种 VGS 值。通过查看这条曲线，我们还可以直观地确定有效工作范围。那么这里的两点是什么？我让你们自己盯着它看几秒钟，弄清楚这里的哪两点限制了 MOSFET 的有效工作范围，即电路的有效工作范围。

So here is a load line superimposed on the MOSFET device IDS versus VDS curves for a variety of values of VGS. So by looking at this curve, we can also intuitively determine the valid operating range. So what are the two points here? I will let you stare at it for a couple of seconds yourselves to figure out what two points here bound the valid operating range of the MOSFET, the valid operating range of the circuit.

我先开始。一个是这个点，因为此时输出为 VS，而 VGS 刚刚开始等于 VT。因此，请考虑有效操作的第二个点在哪里。它就在这里，并且位于该负载线的某个位置。请记住，负载线是输出 VO 必须满足的约束。它是 KVL 对输出施加的约束。

I will start. One is this point, because at this point the output is VS and VGS has just begun to equal VT. So think about where the second point is for valid operation. It is here, and, somewhere along that load line. Remember the load line is a constraint that must be met by the output VO. It is the constraint imposed by KVL on the output.

因此，对于各种 VGS 值，输出都受限制地在此范围内运行。因此，随着输出从这里一直到这里，在某个点我会退出饱和区。另一个点由此点给出。因此请注意，这是边界曲线。在此曲线的左侧，MOSFET 不再处于饱和状态。

So the output is constrained to operate in this regime for various values of VGS. So as the output keeps going from here all the way here, at some point I exit my saturation region. And that other point is given by this one. So notice that this is the curve that bounds. On the left hand side of this the MOSFET is no longer in saturation.

它在右侧，因此这是有效操作区域。从这里到这里。这很好。这是 VS。知道这一点很好。对于这一点，我知道 VI（即 VGS）等于 VT。我知道 VO 等于 VS。此时 IDS 为 0。因此，当 VI 等于 VD 时，VO 和 IDS 分别为 VS 和 0，因此是输出操作范围。所以这是一点。

It is on the right hand side, and so therefore this is the valid operating region. Here to here. This is good. This is VS. That is good to know. And for this point I know that VI, which is VGS, equals VT. I know VO is equal to VS. And IDS, at this point, is 0. So VO and IDS being VS and 0 correspondingly are the output operating perimeters when VI equals VD. So that is one point.

让我们找出这个点是什么。此时，我的输出刚好进入 MOSFET 三极管区域操作的范围。请注意，这个点是两条曲线的交点，这条线和这条曲线。所以这条曲线由 IDS 等于 K 除以 2 VO 平方给出。这是我的负载线方程。也就是 VS 除以 RL 减去 VO 除以 RL。就是这样。

And let’s find out what this point is. At that point I get my output just entering the range of the MOSFET triode region operation. Notice that this point is the intersection of two curves, this line and this curve. So this curve here is given by IDS equals K divided by 2 VO squared. And this is my load line equation. So that is VS divided by RL minus VO divided by RL. That’s it.

所以我不会继续为你解决这个问题。你可以去看看，并说服自己，如果你解这两个方程并找出这个的 VO，它应该与你使用另一个图获得的 VO 相同。我在这里所做的，获得有效的操作区域与我在这里所做的没有什么不同。这两种方法是到达同一位置的替代方法。

So I won’t go ahead and solve that for you. You can go and check it out and convince yourselves that if you solve these two equations and find out the VO for this, it should be the same VO that you obtained using the other graph. What I have done here, obtaining the valid regions of operation is no different from what I did here. The two are alternative approaches to getting to the same place.

只是多年来我发现，有一类人是输出传递函数人，也就是这张图，而另一类人是喜欢这样思考的负载线人。我自己一直是传递函数人，但你们中的一些人可能是负载线人，所以你可以利用这一点来驱动你的直觉。这真是太神奇了。

Just that over the years what I have discovered is that there are one class of people that are output transfer function people, this graph, and another set of people that are load line people that like to think that way. I have always been a transfer function person myself, but some of you may be load line people and so you can use that to drive your intuition. It is pretty amazing.

随着我们进入这个行业并继续前行，令人惊讶的是，有些人真的了解负载线，而其他人对传递函数更熟悉。所以，随便选一个吧。到目前为止，我们已经对 MOSFET 放大器进行了大信号分析。这是对电路的分析，我们发现了两件事。

As we get into this business and keep going down the path, it is amazing how some people really kind of get the load line thing and others feel much more comfortable with the transfer function. So pick whatever you want. So what we have so far is we have conducted a large signal analysis of a MOSFET amplifier. It is an analysis of a circuit, and we found two things.

一个是饱和操作下的传递函数，我们发现了电路的有效输入操作范围和相应的有效输出操作范围。在最后五六分钟，让我谈谈其他几个问题。第一个问题是，到目前为止，我们所做的就是直观和数学地向您展示有效区域是什么。现在你认为这很好，但我该如何实现呢？

One is the transfer function under saturation operation, and we found the valid input operating ranges and the corresponding valid output operating ranges for the circuit. In the last five or six minutes let me talk about a couple of other issues. And the first issue is what we have done so far is intuitively and mathematically shown you what the valid regions are. Now you are thinking that’s fine, but how do I get there?

这个区域很好，VT 通过另一个点，很好，但我如何到达那里？我如何让我的放大器在该区域运行？答案很简单，让我再次使用图表来驱动直觉。所以这是一张图表。我向你展示了这是我的有效区域。

This region is good, VT through that other point, that’s good, but how do I get there? How do I make my amplifier operate in that region? The answer is pretty simple, and let me drive the intuition again using a graph. So this is a graph. And I showed you that That was my valid region here.

取一条 45 度线，找出它与传递函数的交点，那么这就是这里的有效区域，VT 通过我们在那里开发的协调函数。如果我有一个输入，看起来像这样，某个输入的旋转落在这个范围内，将不断保持 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。相应的输出将看起来像这样。如果我的输入在这个范围内，我的输出将在这个范围内。

Take a 45 degree line, find out where it intersects the transfer function, then this is the valid region here, VT through that coordinating function that we developed out there. If I have an input that looks like so, some input whose gyrations fall within this range, will constantly keep the MOSFET in saturation. And the corresponding output will look like this. If my input is in this range, my output will be within this range.

那么我如何将输入信号调到这里呢？假设我有一个正弦波，其峰峰值为 1 伏特。我如何将正弦波调到这里呢？好了，您已经学会了如何增强信号的技巧。还记得增强吗？您所要做的就是将信号增强某个大写 VI 值。方法如下。VS、RL、VO。

And how do I get my input to be here? Let’s say I have a sinusoid that is 1 volt peak to peak or whatever. How do I get my sinusoid up there? Well, you have learned the trick on how to boost things. Remember boost? All you have to do is boost up your signal by some value capital VI. And the way you do that is as follows. VS, RL, VO.

你要做的是将直流偏移应用于输入。你取正弦波并将其提升，以便输入的所有旋转都在有效范围内。这是我的输入，一些 VA。然后我应用一些直流偏移大写 VI，由此处的值给出。并提升有趣的输入？我有趣的输入是 VA。

What you do is you apply a DC offset to your input. You take your sinusoid and boost it up so that all the gyrations of the input are in the valid range. This is my input, some VA. Then I apply some DC offset capital VI given by this value here. And boost up the interesting input? My interesting input is the VA.

我将其提升到大写 VI，这样它就始终处于饱和状态。我现在想向你们展示一个小演示。我将向你们展示一个三角波输入。我们将使用各种偏移电压。这个是三角波。

And I boost it up by capital VI so that this guy is always in saturation. I would like to show you a little demo now. I am going to show you an input that is a triangular wave. And what we will do is I’ll play with a wide variety of offset voltages. This guy is a triangular wave.

我要做的是应用三角波，我们将查看输出并确信当 VI 足够大以至于输入进入有效操作范围时，我会得到放大。我们将在这里查看各种范围。你可以把它放大一点。好的。所以三角波是我的输入。这是我的输出。这看起来一点也不像三角波。

And what I am going to do is apply a triangular wave and we’ll look at the output and convince ourselves that I get amplification when VI is big enough that the input goes into a valid operating range. And we will look at a variety of ranges here. You can put it a little larger. OK. So the triangular wave is my input. And this is my output. This looks nothing like a triangular wave.

原因是我没有正确的偏移。所以我要做的是逐渐增加 MOSFET 上的偏移。所以此时偏移非常低，非常小，接近零偏移。因此我的输出是一场灾难。我的 MOSFET 并非一直处于饱和状态。所以我要做的是应用某种偏移。是这个吗？我们要切换。

And the reason is that I do not have the right offset. So what I will do is gradually increase the offset on the MOSFET. So at this point the offset is very low, a very small near zero offset. And so therefore my output is a disaster. My MOSFET is not in saturation all the time. So what I will do here is apply some sort of offset. Is this the one? We want to switch.

这是输入。你可以看到我通过增加和提升输入来应用偏移。两端都没有发生削波，但我得到了一些东西。而且我得到了放大。现在让我应用过多的偏移。有了这个偏移，我在这里进行操作。我现在要做的是应用更高的偏移，以便这个三角波开始在这里移动。

This is the input. You can see I am applying an offset by bumping and boosting up the input. I don’t have clipping happening at both ends, but I get something. And I get amplification. Now let me apply way too much of an offset. With this offset I am kind of operating here. What I will do now is apply an even higher offset so that this triangular wave begins to move here.

如果我施加非常高的偏移量，我所做的就是使放大器超速，将其提升到如此之高，以至于 MOSFET 将进入其三极管区域，您将看到我不会有任何增益。如果我使输入超速，我的输出将明显缩小。您会注意到输入越来越高。将触发点拉低。就这样。

If I apply a very high offset what I am doing is overdriving the amplifier, boosting it so high that the MOSFET is going to go into its triode region and you are going to see that I won’t have any gain. My output is going to shrink noticeably if I overdrive the input. You will notice the input going higher and higher. Pull the trigger point down. There you go.

请注意，当我将输入提升到更高的水平时，输出实际上是正确输入的很小的镜像。当然，这里的正确答案是，我应用一些适当的偏移量来将输入提升到正确的状态，这样输出就被视为该输入的放大版本。所以我向你们展示了三件事。一是偏移量非常小。

Notice that as I boost up my input even higher notice that the output is a really small image of what the right input should be. The right answer here, of course, is that I apply some right amount of offset to boost up the input into the right regime so that the output is seen to be some amplified version of this input. So I showed you three things. One is very little offset.

就像这样，当事情发生时。一个非常高的偏移，它又被杀死了。并且偏移量是正确的。但请注意，即使偏移量正确，我们仍然有一个问题。输出与输入不是线性相关的。它是非线性的。而获得线性响应的答案是老式的小信号方法。我们将在下一讲中讨论小信号部分。

That was like so, as the thing comes down. A very high offset, it gets killed again. And the right amount of offset. But notice that we still have a problem, even with the right offset. The output is not linearly related to the input. It is nonlinear. And the answer to get a linear response is good old small signal stuff. And we will be looking at the small signal part in the next lecture.

Lec 10 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 10 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

14 年前 (2010 年 9 月 9 日) — 50:30 https://youtube.com/watch?v=9RqFFlZgf60

14 years ago (Sep 9, 2010) — 50:30 https://youtube.com/watch?v=9RqFFlZgf60

介绍

Introduction

大家早上好。早上好。我希望你们昨晚没有花一整晚的时间庆祝红袜队的胜利，但今晚还有一场胜利。好的。让我们看看。我相信测验进行得还不错。我今天要做的是从周二结束的地方开始。继续讨论放大器的大信号和小信号分析。今天的重点是“小信号分析”。

Good morning, all. morning. I hope you guys did not spend all of last night celebrating the Red Sox victory, but there is one more tonight. OK. Let’s see. I trust the quiz went OK. What I will do today is take off from where we left off on Tuesday. And continue our discussion of the large signal and small analysis of our amplifier. Today the focus will be on “Small Signal Analysis”.

首先，让我回顾一下一些材料。如你所知，我们的 MOSFET 放大器如下所示。正如我在本课程中一直提到的那样，你会在电路中注意到的一件事是，某些类型的模式会不断重复出现。这就是其中一种模式。

So let me start by reviewing some of the material. And, as you know, our MOSFET amplifier looks like this. One of the things you will notice in circuits, as I have been mentioning all along in this course, is that certain kinds of patterns keep repeating time and again. And this is one such pattern.

像 MOSFET 这样的三端器件，其输入和漏极到源极端口以以下方式串联连接 RL 和 VS，这是一种非常常见的模式。还有其他几种模式。分压器是一种常见模式。我们一次又一次地遇到这种情况。戴维宁形式，即电压源与电阻串联，是另一种非常常见的形式。

A three terminal device like the MOSFET with an input and drain to source port connected RL and VS in series the following manner, this is a very common pattern. There are several other patterns. The voltage divider is a common pattern. We keep running into that again and again. The Thevenin form, a voltage source in series with the resistor is another very common form.

Norton 等效形式，即电流源与电阻并联，也非常常见。我们所有人都应该熟悉这些事物的分析。分压器尤其常见，你需要能够看一看它，然后就能写下分压器的表达式。我也鼓励你去看看分流器。

The Norton equivalent form, which is a current source in parallel with resistor also very common. And it behooves all of us to be familiar with the analyses of these things. Voltage dividers in particular are just so common that you need to be able look at it and boom, be able to write down the expression for voltage dividers. I would also encourage you to go and look at current dividers.

当有两个并联电阻，且有电流流入电阻时，要快速找出一条支路与另一条支路的电流。该表达式类似于分压器表达式。

When you have two resistors in parallel and some current flowing into the resistors to find out current in one branch versus the other very quickly. The expression is analogous to the voltage divider expression.

其中一些非常常见的模式在课程笔记的摘要页面中进行了突出显示，因此最好跟踪这些模式并非常熟悉它们，以便如果您看到它，只需看一眼就可以跳起来并大声喊出答案，而不必做任何数学运算。

And some of these very common patterns are highlighted in the summary pages course notes, so it is good to keep track of those and be extremely familiar with patterns to the point where if you see it should be able jump up and shout out the answer just by looking at it without having to do any math.

MOSFET 处于饱和状态

MOSFET in Saturation

这是一个放大器。

So here was an amplifier.

然后我们注意到，当 MOSFET 处于饱和状态时，它的行为就像一个电流源。当 MOSFET 处于饱和状态时，这个电路会给我们放大。所以我们同意遵守饱和原则，也就是说，我将以一种方式使用我的电路，使 MOSFET 始终保持饱和状态，从而构建放大器等东西。

And then we noticed that when the MOSFET was in saturation it behaved like a current source. And this circuit would give us amplification while the MOSFET was in saturation. So we agreed to adhere the saturation discipline which simply said that I was going to use my circuit in a way that the MOSFET would always remain saturation building things like amplifiers and so on.

通过在整个分析过程中这样做，我可以假设 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。我不必再进行分析，这变得更容易了。我现在不必弄清楚 MOSFET 处于哪个区域？好吧，由于我的纪律，它总是处于饱和状态。但反过来，我们必须进行大信号分析。

And by doing that throughout the analysis I could make assumption that MOSFET was in saturation. I didn’t have to go through Analysis became easier. I didn’t have to figure out now, what region is the MOSFET in? Well, because of my discipline it always going to be in saturation. But turn what we had do was conduct a large signal analysis.

同样，在后续课程中，您将会遇到这样的电路。事实上，这个电路很有可能就是这种情况。您将会看到更复杂的 MOSFET 模型。或者您将会遇到这样的 MOSFET，假设在该课程中，设计人员不遵守饱和原则，在这种情况下，您必须首先弄清楚我的 MOSFET 是处于三极管区域还是饱和区域？

Again, in follow on courses you will be given circuits like this. In fact, this very circuit with a high likelihood. And you will be looking at more complicated models of the MOSFET. Or you will be given the MOSFET like this and, let’s say in that course the designers do not adhere to saturation discipline, in which case you have to first figure out is my MOSFET in its triode region or the saturation region?

根据所在区域，你必须应用不同的方程式。所以它比 2002 年复杂了一步。2002 年，我们通过遵守纪律简化了我们的生活。让我告诉你，遵守纪律是完全可以的。当它简化了我们的生活，我们可以用它做些好事时，这样做是完全可以的。我们不是懦夫或类似的东西

And depending on the region it is in you have to apply different equations. So it is one step more complicated than in 002. In 002 we simplified our lives by following a discipline. And let me tell you that following a discipline is quite OK. When it simplifies our lives and we can do good things with it, it is quite OK to do that. We are not wimps or anything like

有纪律并同意我们将在操场的这个区域玩耍并以这种方式构建电路是完全可以的。通过这样做，我们可以假设 MOSFET 始终处于饱和状态。分析只是使用了电流源模型。同样，重要的是要弄清楚饱和状态下 MOSFET 有效操作的边界是什么？

It is quite OK to have a discipline and agree that we are going play in this region of the playground and build circuits that manner. By doing so, we could assume the MOSFET was in saturation all time. And analysis simply used a current source model. By the same token, what becomes important is to figure out what are the boundaries of valid operation MOSFET in saturation?

为此，我们进行了大信号分析。它包含两个部分。其中之一当然是找出输出与输入响应。它通常会对电路进行非线性分析。如果它是线性电路分析。

To do that we conducted a large signal analysis. And it had two components to it. One of course was figure out the output versus input response. And what this usually does is that it does a nonlinear analysis of this circuit. If it is a linear circuit analysis.

并根据所施加的输入和所选的参数计算出电路中各种电压和电流的值。我们所说的第二步是计算出输入的有效工作范围以及 VO 等其他相关参数的对应范围。您还可以找出电流 IDS 等的对应工作范围。

And figures out what the values of various voltages and currents are in the circuit as a function of applied inputs and chosen parameters. And the second step we said was to figure out valid operating ranges for input and corresponding ranges the other dependent parameters such as VO. You could also find out the corresponding operating range for the current IDS and so on.

因此，通过这样做，您可以首先分析电路，找出“偏置”参数、VI 和 VO 的值等等。然后您可以说没问题，只要 VI 保持在这些范围内，我的假设就成立，即饱和状态，一切都会好起来。这方面的阅读材料是第 8 章。今天我们将进入下一步，重新审视小信号分析。

So by doing this you could first analyze the circuit, find out the “bias” parameters, values of VI and VO so on. And then you could say all right, provided, as long VI stays within these bounds my assumption that this is in saturation will hold and everything be fine. The reading for this is Chapter 8. And today we will take the next step and revisit small signal analysis.

在上节课结束时我向你们展示的演示中，我展示了一个输入三角波。输入三角波产生了一个输出。我们注意到它确实有放大，我的输入很小，输出却大得多。当 MOSFET 处于饱和状态时，我确实有放大，但它是高度非线性的。

In the demo that I showed you at the end of last lecture, I showed an input triangular wave. And the input triangular wave gave rise to an output. And we noticed that did have amplification, I had a small input and much bigger output. I did have amplification when the MOSFET was in saturation but it highly nonlinear.

输入是三角波，输出有些奇怪，它看起来有点像正弦波，但两端被压低并变得有点扁平。它的向上峰值已经缩小。所以这是一种奇怪的非线性行为。我稍后会再次向你展示。所以它放大了，但却是非线性的。还记得我们两周前的目标吗？我们开始制造一个线性放大器。

The input was a triangular wave and the output some funny, it kind of looked like a sinusoid whose extremities had been whacked down and kind of flattened. And its upward going peak had been shrunk. So it was a kind of weird nonlinear behavior. I will show that to you again later on. And so it amplified but was nonlinear. And remember our goal of two weeks ago? We set out to build a linear amplifier.

所以今天我们将沿着这条路走下去，讨论如何构建线性放大器。因此，为了快速回顾输入与输出特性，VI 与 VO，即 VT 和 VS，事物看起来是什么样的。此外，为了快速回顾有效范围，直到某个时间点，放大器处于饱和状态，MOSFET 饱和，在这里的某个地方，我的 VO 等于 VI 减去阈值降。

So today we will walk down that path and talk about building a linear amplifier. So to very quickly revisit the input versus output characteristic, VI versus VO, this is VT and VS, what things looked like. Also to quickly review the valid ranges, until some point here amplifier was in saturation, the MOSFET saturation and somewhere here I had VO being equal to VI minus a threshold drop.

此时，MOSFET 进入三极管区域，我不再遵循饱和定律。因此，这是我的有效工作区域。我们还知道，输出由 VS 减去 K（VI VT）的平方 RL 除以 2 给出。再次假设 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。坚持这一点非常重要，因为只有当我遵循定律时，MOSFET 处于饱和状态时，这才是正确的。

At that point the MOSFET went into its triode region and I no longer was following the saturation discipline. So therefore this is my valid region of operation. We also know that the output was given by VS minus K (VI VT) all squared RL over 2. Again assuming the MOSFET is in saturation. It very important to keep stating this because is true only when the MOSFET in saturation, when I am following the discipline.

请注意，这是一种非线性关系。因此，VO 取决于 VI 的一些有趣的平方律依赖性。这里的关键是我们如何构建放大器？看看这里的这一点。在这一点上，假设我有一个 VI 输入。相应的输出是 VO。焦点是这一点。剩下的就是一条非线性曲线。还记得我们在非线性 Expo Dweeb 示例中使用的技巧吗？

Notice that this is a nonlinear relationship. So VO depends on some funny square law dependence on VI. The key here is how do we go about building our amplifier? Take a look at this point here. At this point here let’s say I have a VI input. Corresponding output is VO. Focus is this point. And left to itself was a nonlinear curve. Remember the trick that we used in our nonlinear Expo Dweeb example?

我们使用了禅法。还记得禅法吗？我们说过，看，这是非线性的，但如果你能将注意力集中在曲线的这一小段上，它看起来或多或少是线性的。如果我看曲线的一小部分，然后我做禅法，放大这里。这看​​起来或多或少是线性的。这意味着如果我能处理非常小的信号并以某种方式应用信号，我也会有某种直流偏移。那么我将处于曲线区域，我将描绘出曲线的一小段，这或多或少是线性的。这是一个小信号技巧。我们在这里要做的只是重新审视小信号模型。

We used the Zen Method. Remember the Zen Method? We said look, this is nonlinear, but if you can focus your mind on this little piece of the curve here this looks more or less linear. If I look at a small itty bitty portion of the curve and I do Zen thing, kind zoom in on here. This looked more or less linear. means that if I could work with very small signals and apply the signal in a way that I also had a DC offset of some sort. Then I would be in region the curve, I would be delineating a small region of the curve which would be more or less linear. This was a small signal trick. And what we will do here is simply revisit the small signal model.

从现在开始，我要做的大部分工作或多或少都会重复您在发光博览会上看到的内容。只是这里我有一个三端设备，稍微复杂一些。方程式不同。我不必求助于泰勒级数展开。我只会对这个表达式进行完全展开，并为您开发小信号值。

Most of what I am going to do from here on will be more or less a repeat of what you saw for the light emitting expo dweeb. Just that here I have a three terminal device, with a little bit more complication. The equation is different. I don’t have to resort a Taylor series expansion. I will just do complete expansion of this expression and develop the small signal values for you.

回想一下小模型。它有以下步骤。第一步将在某个偏置点、VI、VO 以及某些对应点 IDS 处运行。这是第 3 页。然后在较大的偏置上叠加一个小信号 VI。还记得“增强”吗？所以 VI 就是增强。砰。上面是我应用的小信号 VI。我们的主张是放大器对 VI 的响应近似为线性。

Recall the small model. It had the following steps. The first step will operate at some bias point, VI, VO, and of course some corresponding point IDS. This is Page 3. And then superimpose a small signal VI on top of the big fat bias. Remember “boost”? So VI is the boost. Boom. And above have small signal VI that I apply. And our claim is response of the amplifier to VI is approximately linear.

关键技巧在于，对于此处的小信号模型，这是第 3 页和第 2 页。关键技巧在于，使用小信号模型，我会在某个工作点 VO、VI 操作放大器。我将小信号 VI 叠加在大 VI 之上。然后我声称对 VI 的响应近似为线性。

The key trick with this is that for my small signal model here, this is Page 3 and 2. The key trick here is that with the small signal model, I operate my amplifier at some operating point, VO, VI. I superimpose a small signal VI on top of of big VI. And then I claim that the response to VI is approximately linear.

让我再稍微修饰一下这条曲线。请注意，在这种情况下，我的 VI 是偏置电压，这是 VO，即输出偏置，当然，图中未显示的是输出工作电流 IDS。思考这个问题的一个好方法是重新绘制并认为您的坐标轴已经按以下方式移动。这是 VI。也在第 3 页上。VT。请记住，这是工作点，VO 和 VI。请注意，我们在这里传输曲线的这个小范围内操作。实际上，我们所说的是，我将应用 VI 的小变化，并将这些变化称为 delta VI 或小 VI。结果将看起来像 delta VO。

And let me just embellish that curve a little bit more. Notice that in this situation was my VI, which is bias voltage, this is VO, which the output bias, and of course not shown on graph is the output operating current which IDS. One nice way of thinking about this is to redraw and think that your coordinate axes have kind of shifted in the following manner. This is VI. also on your Page 3. VT. Remember this was the operating point, VO and VI. And notice that we were operating in this small regime of our transfer curve here. And in effect what we are saying is that I am going to apply small variations about VI and call those variations delta VI or small VI. And the resulting are going to look like delta VO.

也称为小 V、小 O。因此，这里会有变化。它们会在那里产生相应的小变化。一种看待这种情况的方式是，就好像我们正在使用一个新的坐标系。

Also referred as small V, small O. So I will have variations here. And they give rise to corresponding small variations there. One way to view this is as if we are working with a new coordinate system.

另一种看待这个问题的方式是，大写的 VI 和 VO 对应于我的 VI 和电路中的总电压，但在这个偏置点，我可以想到另一个坐标系，其中有小的 VI 和 VO。对于 的变化，可以找出 VO 的相应小变化。只是我在这里执行的所有分析都是线性的。

Another way to view this is that so the capital VI and VO correspond to my VI and as the total voltages in circuit, but at this bias point I can think of another coordinate system here with small VI and VO out there. And for changes to can figure out the corresponding small changes to VO. Just that all the analysis I perform here is going to be linear.

接下来的几秒钟，我将用几种不同的方法向你们证明这一点。当我在某个偏置点的这个状态下进行小信号分析时。你们之前也见过。

And I will prove it to you in a couple of different ways the next few seconds. When I am doing small signal analysis operating here in this regime at some bias point. You have also seen before.

偏见

Bias

我如何获得偏置？这是我的放大器 RL 和 VS。这是第 4 页。VO。

How do I get a bias? This is my amplifier RL and VS. This is Page 4. VO.

我获得偏置的方法是施加一些直流电压 VI，并在其上叠加我的小信号 VI。这是我的直流偏置，它将信号提升到了一个有趣的值。因此，我可以通过将 VI 改变为具有非常大幅度的小信号，在这里我将获得线性响应。我也可以为您绘制它。

The way I get a bias apply some DC voltage VI and superimpose on top of that my small signal VI. This is my DC bias that has boosted up the signal to an interesting value. And because of that what I can get is by varying VI as a small signal with very amplitude, I am going to get a linear response here. And can draw that for you as well.

这是我的偏置点。如果我像这样改变信号，那么我的输出应该看起来像这样。这是点 VI，这是 VO，这是我的小信号 VI VO 是大写的 VO。所以这里的小东西是 VI。我想给你看一个小演示。我将从上次展示的相同演示开始。

This is my bias point here. And if I vary signal like so then my output should look like this. This is point VI, this VO, and this is my small signal VI VO is capital VO. So this small thing here is VI. I would like to show you a little demo. I will start with the same demo showed you last time.

我向你们展示了放大器。在演示中，我将应用三角波。首先，我从一个大信号开始。你们会看到输出看起来非常老套，看起来像这样。这是大信号响应。然后我将开始处理输入，使其变小，你们可以自己看看它是什么样子。

I showed you the amplifier. In demo am going to apply a triangular wave. And initially I start with a large signal. And you will see that the output looks really corny, is going to look something like this. That’s large signal response. And then I will begin playing with the input making it smaller, and you can see how it looks yourselves.

三角波

就这样。这就是我上次停下来的地方。

There you go. So this is where I stopped the last time.

The last lecture I applied this input, time is going to the right, and the purple curve in background is output. It looks much more like a sinusoid with some flattening of its tips. Nothing like an interesting triangular wave. What I will do next is that let me make sure have enough of a boost here, enough of a DC voltage so that I am operating at some point here.

我相信已经有了。请注意，可以向上移动三角波输入，也可以向下移动。所以让我在这里偏置它。我选择了一个大约的 VI，我忘记了它每格是多少伏，但我在这里选择了一些 VI。我将其偏置为输入。您会得到非线性响应。它被放大了。它要大得多。

I believe already have that. Notice that can shift up the triangular wave input, or I can shift it down. So let me bias it here. I have chosen a VI that’s about, I forget how many volts per division it is, but have chosen some VI here. And I biased it such that this is the input. You get a nonlinear response. It is amplified. It is much bigger.

接下来我要做的是让应用的 VI 越来越小。我已经完成了提升。砰，这是一个提升。所以我已经提升了你的 VI。接下来我要缩小它，希望你会看到，如果我说的都是真的，你会看到一个三角形的响应。让我们去尝试一下。注意黄色。

What I will do next make VI that apply smaller and smaller. I have already done the boosting. Boom, that’s a boost. So I have boosted up your VI already. Next is I am going to shrink it, and hopefully you will see that if all that I am saying is truthful here you will see a triangular response. Let’s go try it out. Watch the yellow.

我要把黄色缩小，让它越来越小。就这样。当大自然按照你期望的方式运作时，感觉很棒。我这辈子从未见过三角波看起来如此美丽。太棒了。看看这个。

I am going to shrink yellow and make it smaller and smaller. There you go. It is great when nature works like you expect it to. I have never seen a triangular wave looks so pretty in my life. It is awesome. Look at this.

线性波

Linear Wave

这是一个微小的三角波。输出也是波动的，但线性更强。是的。问题？那是什么？

Here is a tiny triangular wave. And the output also wave but it is much more linear. Yes. Question? What’s that?

问题是，这里的输出只是以前输入的大倍数。这是个好问题。我在这里做的是向你们展示一个实验室实验。假设这个输入是我从现场的某个传感器获得的输入。假设这是我的输入，而不是我以前的输入。这是我的输入，也是放大的输出。

The question is that the output here only as big input used to be before. That’s a good question. What I have done here is am showing you a laboratory experiment. And let’s assume that this input is the input I am getting from some sensor in field. Assume that this is my input, not what I had before. this is my input to begin with and the amplified output.

我还可以做的是改变偏置。我们将在讲座结束时，也就是讲座的最后十分钟看到这一点。如何选择偏置点？通过改变偏置点，您可以改变放大器的属性，以预览即将到来的景点。让我问你，如果我改变偏置点，你认为会发生什么？

What I can also do is change the bias. And we will see this at the end of lecture, in last ten minutes of lecture. How do you select a bias point? By changing your point you can change the properties of an amplifier to give a preview of upcoming attractions. Let me ask you, what do you think should happen if I change the bias point?

我还没有向你展示数学，所以直观地看你认为会发生什么？如果我增加偏差，你认为会发生什么？是的。很好的见解。更高的偏差将产生更大的放大。让我们看看我们的朋友是否正确。让我设置一个更高的偏差。我想不一定。顺便说一句，你其实是对的。我在捉弄这里的每个人。当我改变我的输入偏差时。

I have not shown you the math yet, so intuitively what do think should happen? If I increase the bias what do you think is going to happen? Yes. Good insight. Higher bias will be more amplification. Let’s see if our friend is correct. Let me set a higher bias. Not necessarily, I guess. You’re actually right, by the way. am playing a trick on everybody here. As I change my input bias.

请注意，在某些情况下，我的输出会变小，失真度也会变大。在其他情况下，我的输出会变小，而且会再次失真。因此，会发生一系列有趣的影响，这些影响会反映在偏置点上，但对于偏置点的适当选择，随着我增加放大率，放大率也会增加。几分钟后我将向您展示这一点。

Notice that under certain conditions my output becomes smaller and gets more distorted. Under other conditions what is going to happen my output that it is becoming smaller and going to get distorted again. So there are a bunch of funny effects happening that reflect on the bias point, but for an appropriate choice of bias point as I increase the amplification should increase. And I will show you that in a few minutes.

但这是一种复杂的关系。是的。这终于变得有趣了。问题来了。阿加瓦尔教授，我们喜欢你的歌舞，但如果你真的想在输出端获得高信号，并且想放大你的大输入，你该怎么做？

But it is complicated relationship. Yes. This is finally getting fun. Here the question. Professor Agarwal, we love your song and dance, but if you really want to get a high signal at the output and you want to amplify your big input how do you it?

所以问题是，假设我这里有一个这么大的输入，如果它很大，我已经向你展示了我如何得到这么大的东西，但如果我的输入很大怎么办？我如何得到这样的输出？好吧，我将使用其中一种通过提问的方法，让你告诉我答案。有人我怎么做？

So the question is let’s say I have an input that is this big here, if it big, I have shown you how I can get things that are this big, but what if my input was big? How do I get an output that is this Well, I will use one of those learned by questioning methods and have you tell me the answer. Someone How do I that?

是的。使用另一个放大器。所以答案是我将使用一个放大器从这里到这里。建议使用另一个放大器从这里到这里。事实上，我相信你可能在这样做时遇到了问题。所以只能怪你自己。那么你如何做到这一点呢？

Yes. Use another amplifier. So the answer is I will use one amplifier to go from here here. And the suggestion is use another amplifier to go from here here. And, in fact, I believe that you may have a problem your set where you will do that. And so have only yourselves to blame. So how do you make this work?

你要做的是，这个 VI 必须比这个的偏置点 VI 小得多。我必须构建一个不同的放大器，选择一组不同的参数，这样 VI prime（这个家伙的 VI）就比 V capital I prime 这个家伙小得多。这是一个设计问题。

What you have to do is this VI has be much smaller than the bias point VI on this one. I have to build a different amplifier, choose a different set of parameters such that VI prime, which is the VI for this guy, much less than V capital I prime this guy. It’s a design question.

您需要以这样一种方式实现它：感兴趣的信号需要比该放大器的偏置电压小得多。因此，您可能需要使用更高的电源电压。我相信我的放大器有 4 伏电源或 5 伏电源。您可能必须使用具有更大电源、不同 RL 值的放大器等等。

You need to it in way that the signals of interest need to be much smaller than bias voltage of this amplifier. So you may have to use much higher supply voltages. My amplifier, I believe, has a 4 volt supply or 5 supply. You might have to use an amplifier with a much bigger supply, different values of RL and so on.

我知道课程笔记中也有一些练习和问题集，其中讨论了更详细的内容。是的。这甚至很有趣。问题是，好问题。为什么你需要这个人？就用这个人，对吧？你为什么需要人？大人物统治，对吧？谁需要小人物？好吧，让我再次使用苏格拉底式方法。你为什么不给出答案？

And I know that the course notes also have some exercises and problem sets that discuss in more detail. Yes. This is even fun. The question is, good question. is why do you need this guy here? 你们很聪明。为什么你们需要小个子？你们需要这里的小个子吗？有人知道答案吗？是的。大个子可能不那么敏感。我喜欢这一点。你知道吗？他几乎是对的。我马上就告诉你为什么。还有其他吗？还有其他原因吗？是的。答对了。这又是一个好答案。所以让我来回答这两个答案。

You guys are smart. Why do you need little guys? do you need the small guy here? Anybody with answer? Yeah. The big guy may not be as sensitive. I like that. You know what? He is almost correct. I will show you why in a second. Anything else? Any other reason? Yes. Bingo. That is another good answer. So let me address both the answers.

给出的答案是，看，这个放大器将信号放大一定量，放大 7 倍。我将其设计为将信号放大 10 倍左右。所以总共我得到了 70 倍的放大率。这将是明年实验室的一个很棒的设计问题。

The answer given was that look, this amplifier is amplifying the signal by a certain amount, by a factor of 7. And I have designed this such that amplifies a signal by factor of maybe 10. So in all I am getting an amplification of 70. This would be a great design question for lab next year.

我给你一堆元件，要求你根据最大放大量约束条件设计一个放大器。事实证明，当你设计放大器时，为了满足饱和度等要求，你必须选择 RL 和 VS 等值，使其符合功率约束条件，这样放大器才不会爆炸等。

I give you a bunch of components and ask to design an amplifier given the constraints with highest amount of amplification. It turns out that when you design your amplifier, in order to meet the saturation discipline and so on, you have to choose values of RL and VS stuff like that be within power constraints so the amplifier doesn’t blow up and stuff.

最后，你只能得到微不足道的 7 倍增益。这里也是一样，为了能够处理非常小的信号并获得一些放大，需要另一组值，然后你才能得到 10 倍。所以它们相乘。制造一个增益更大的放大器要困难得多。你知道吗？

And by the end of it all you are going to get a measly 7X gain out it. The same way here, to be able deal with a very small signal here and get some amplification, another set of values and you get 10X. So they multiply. It is much harder to build one amplifier with a larger gain. You know what?

我刚刚意识到我们将在讲座的最后五到七分钟讨论这个问题。我将向你们展示放大取决于什么。它取决于 K. RL。它取决于 VI。现在的问题是，我有这么多时间来思考如何将敏感度融入其中，我相信可以。

I just realized that we will be looking at this in the last five or seven minutes of lecture. I am going to show you what the amplification depends upon. It upon K. RL. It depends upon VI. Now the question is I have had all this time to think about how stitch in sensitive into this, and I believe can.

事实证明，当你有大电压等实用设备时，你会发现，通过设备的电流越大，它们就越容易产生各种噪声。因此，非常强大的放大器不太擅长处理非常微小的信号，因为它们具有一些固有的噪声能力。所以我想这很敏感。它对噪音很敏感。还有问题吗？是的。再问我这个问题。

It turns out that when you have large voltages and so on you have practical devices, it turns out that the more current you pump through devices they tend to produce noise of various kinds. So very powerful amplifiers are not very good at dealing with really tiny signals because they have some inherent noise capabilities. And so I guess that is sensitive. It is sensitive to noise. Another question? Yes. Ask me the question again.

我没听懂。让我解释一下。事实证明，我无法将其通过大放大器，因为它只会给我 7 倍的增益。但是，如果我有一个这么大的信号，那么可能只需要这个放大器。我不需要小放大器。

I didn’t follow. Let me just explain it. It turns out that I will not be able to pass this through the big amplifier begin with because it is just going to give me a gain of factor 7. However, if I have a signal that is this big to begin with then may just need this amplifier. I don’t the smaller guy.

如果我的信号一开始就这么大，如果我有一个强大的传感器，可以产生强大的信号，是的，我可以只处理一个阶段。我不需要两个阶段。这完全是设计问题。这实际上是一个有趣的设计练习。给定预算，美元，对吧？

If my signal was this big to begin with, if I had a strong sensor that produced a strong signal to begin with, yeah, I can deal with just a single stage. I don’t need to two stages. It is all a matter of design. And it actually fun design exercise. Given a budget, dollars, right?

你去储藏室看看你拥有的零件，然后利用这些零件组装出你需要的东西。所以有时你需要组装两个放大器来获得增益或组装一个信号放大器。这都是设计问题。好的。转到第 7 页。这给我们带来了小信号模型。

You go to your supply room and look at the parts that you have go to build what you have to build with the parts that have. And so sometimes you need to build two amplifiers get the gain or build a signal amplifier. It’s all design thing. All right. Moving on to Page 7. That brings us the small signal model.

第 5 页。我在小演示中向您展示的是，如果此示例 VI 中的信号输入比大写 VI 小得多，那么当我缩小输入时，我能够在输出端获得或多或少线性的响应。因此，重复我在输入端的符号，总输入是工作点输入与小信号输入的总和。这称为总变量。直流偏置。它也被称为工作点电压。这是我的小信号输入。它也被称为增量输入。这更像是一个与增量分析或扰动分析相关的数学术语。因此，VI，可以称为小信号、扰动、增量，随便您喜欢什么。

Page 5. What I showed you up on the little demo was that provided the signal input in this example VI much smaller than capital VI out there as I shrank my input, I was able to get a more or less linear response at the output. And so to repeat my notation at the input, total input is a sum of the operating point input plus a small signal input. This is called the total variable. DC bias. It also called the operating point voltage. And this is my small signal input. It is also variously called incremental input. This is more a mathematical term relating to incremental analysis or perturbation analysis. So VI, call it small signal, perturbation, increment, whatever you want.

类似地，在输出端，我的总变量是工作电压和小信号电压的总和。我不喜欢在符号中使用 O，因为 O 的大小只是你如何书写的函数。这不是很清楚。至于图形，让我为你绘制输入和输出。

Similarly, at the output I have my total variable at the output a sum of operating voltage and the small signal voltage. I do not like using Os in symbols because big O and small is simply a function of how you write them. It is not super clear. And in terms of a graph, let me plot the input and output for you.

假设这是总投入，那是总产出。我可能有一些偏见 VI。

Let’s say this is total input and that is the total output. I may have some bias VI.

偏置电压

Bias Vo

与之相对应，我可能有些偏见。请稍等片刻，我会先预览一下我们将在三四周后讨论的内容。

And corresponding to that I may have some bias VO. Hold thought for a second while I give you preview of something that we will be covering in about three or four weeks.

请注意，当我将放大器连接在一起时，连接在一起的放大器的输出工作点电压将成为该放大器的输入工作点电压，对吗？因此，当他们将输出连接到此输入时，输出工作点电压将耦合到此处的输入，因此它将成为此处的工作点电压。现在我面临一场噩梦。

Notice that as I couple amplifiers together, the output operating point voltage of this amplifier in connection becomes the input operating point voltage of this amplifier, right? So when they connect output to this input, the output operating point voltage becomes coupled to input here so it becomes the operating point voltage here. Now I have a nightmare on my hands.

随着调整这个家伙的偏见，这个家伙的偏见也会改变。两者是相互依赖的。这很麻烦。我们这些工程师想方设法简化我们的生活。大约三四个星期后，你就会学到另一个技巧。

As adjust the bias of this guy, the bias of this guy changes, too. The two are dependent. It is a pain in the neck. And we being engineers find ways to simplify our lives. And you will learn another trick in about three or four weeks.

这个技巧可以让你以一种方式将这两个阶段分离，这样你就可以设计这个阶段的隔离，去喝杯咖啡，然后回到这个阶段，单独设计这个阶段。对于那些想要提前思考如何做到这一点的人，它。你可以使用什么技巧来将它们隔离？继续。

And that trick will let you decouple these two stages in a way that you can design this stage isolation, go have a cup of coffee and then come back to this stage design this stage in isolation. For those of you who want to run ahead and think about how to do it, it. What trick can you use to get them in isolation? Moving on.

接下来我想从数学的角度来解决这个问题。就像我为发光博览会所做的那样，用数学方法分析了这个问题，并向你展示，如果 VI 比 capital 小得多，确实会得到线性响应。这次我不会使用泰勒级数，因为事实证明这个表达式可以完全展开。所以你不必相信泰勒级数等等。

What I would like to do next is address this from a mathematical point of view. And much as I did for the light emitting expo dweeb analyze this mathematically and show you that if VI is much smaller than capital indeed get a linear response. This time around I won’t use Taylor series because it turns out that this expression can be expanded fully. So you don’t have to buy into Taylor series and so on.

我将为您列出所有内容。首先，我们知道放大器的 VO 是 VS RLK/2 (VI VT)^2。我将为此做的，就像 LED 所做的那样，我将为您推导出当 VI 非常小时输出作为输入的函数。换句话说，当我用大写 V I 平方加上小写 VI 代替 VI 时。

I am going to list everything down for you. We know, to begin with, that VO for the amplifier is VS RLK/2 (VI VT)^2. What I am going to do for this, much as did the LED, what I’m going to do is derive for you the output as a function of input when the VI is very small. In other words, when I substitute for VI, V capital I squared plus small VI.

就像 expo dweeb 所做的那样，想要用一个大的 DC VI 代替 VI。所以比小得多，并亲自向你们展示输出响应，V 小 O 将与 VI 线性连接。请注意，让我在这里写另一个等式。这是一个总变量。简单地说，如果输入是 VI，那么输出将是 VO，这意味着工作点输入电压应该满足这个等式，对吗？换句话说，工作点输出电压 V 大写 O 应该等于 VS RLK/2 (VI VT)^2。这是 VI 等于大写 VI。非常简单，但似乎令人困惑。所有这些都表明，看，方程给了我 VI 和 VO 之间的关系。

Much as did for the expo dweeb, want to substitute for VI a big DC VI. So is much smaller than And show you for yourselves that the output response, V small O is going to be linearly connected VI. Notice that, let me write another equation here. This is a total variable. simply says that if the input is VI then the output going to be VO, which means that operating point input voltage should satisfy this equation, correct? In other words, the operating point output voltage V capital O should equal VS RLK/2 (VI VT)^2. This is at VI equals capital VI. very simple but may seem confusing. All this is saying that look, equation gives me the relationship between VI and VO.

因此，如果我将大写字母作为输入，那么相应的输出就是大写字母 VO，因此它们必须满足这个等式，对吗？这些是偏差点值，必须满足这个等式。很简单。我知道。所以记住这个想法。把它藏在你们的脑海里。现在让我进行一些复杂的数学运算，并用这个表达式中的 VI 代替。让我继续做下去。

Therefore, if I apply capital as the input, I’m given that my corresponding output is capital VO, so they must satisfy this equation, right? Those are bias point values and that must satisfy this equation. Simple. I know that. So hold that thought. Stash it away in the back of your minds. Now let me go through a bunch grubby math and substitute for VI in this expression here. Let me go ahead and do that.

VS RLK/2((VI+vi) VT)^2。当我做一些数学以外的事情时，我会叫醒你。我将继续执行一系列纯数学步骤。没有作弊。什么都没有。注意我的手指。当我做任何不是明显的数学的事情时，我都会叫醒你。接下来，我将简单地移动 VT 并将其重写如下，RLK/2((VI VT)+vi)^2。同样，到目前为止我还没有做任何有趣的事情。我只是用这个代替了。我猜我只是想打发时间。好吧。接下来我要做的就是简单地将其展开并以 RLK/2 的方式写出来，将其展开并将其视为一个单位 VS RLK/2((VI VT)^2+2(VI VT)vi+vi^2)。这里没什么花哨的。

VS RLK/2((VI+vi) VT)^2. When I something that is other than math I will wake you up. I will just keep doing a bunch of steps that are pure math. No cheating. nothing. Watch my fingers. When I do anything that is not obvious math I will wake you up. Next I am going to simply move VT over and rewrite this as follows, RLK/2((VI VT)+vi)^2. Again, I haven’t done anything interesting so far. I have just substituted this. am juggling things around just to pass away some time, I guess. All right. Next what I am going to do is simply expand this out and write it way RLK/2, expand that out and treat this as one unit VS RLK/2((VI VT)^2+2(VI VT)vi+vi^2). Nothing fancy here.

数学

Math

这就像是一块诚实的黑板。这里没什么特别的。标准的东西。只有数学。我会转到这块黑板上做一些有趣的 EE 东西。是的。很好。

This is like the honest board. Nothing fancy here. Standard stuff. Only math. I will move to this blackboard here where do some fun EE stuff. Yes. Good.

至少有一个人没有睡着。谢谢。所以这里只是数学。没什么花哨的。普通而简单的数学。我没有做任何花招。我的十个手指还在。现在我要做什么，现在看我。这里不使用泰勒级数，因为这个表达式适合分析。注意这里的 VI 平方。

At least one person isn’t asleep here. Thank you. So just math here. Nothing fancy. Plain old simple math. I have not done any trickery. still all my ten fingers. Now what I am going to do, now watch me. not using Taylor series here because this expression lends itself to analysis. Notice VI squared here.

我假设比大写 VI 小得多，所以我能做的就是假设 VT 足够小，以至于 VI 减去 VT 仍然是一个与 VI 相比很大的数字，我能做的就是忽略它与大写 VI 项的比较。所以我这里有一个大写 VI 项。我将忽略平方。

I made the assumption that is much smaller than capital VI, so what I can do is assuming that VT is small enough that VI minus VT still a big number compared to VI, what I can do is ignore this in comparison to the capital VI terms. So I have a capital VI term here. am going to ignore squared.

例如，如果大写 VI 为 5 伏，小写 VI 为 100 毫伏，那么 0.1 的平方就是 0.01。所以这是在比较 0.01 和 5。我差了 500 倍。现在看我。现在我开始在这里玩一些有趣的游戏。我消除了这一点，因为这样它现在就变得大致相等了。我另外做的是让我写下输出。

So, for example, if capital VI was 5 volts and small VI was 100 millivolts 0.,so 0.1 squared is 0.01. So it is comparing 0.01 to 5. I am off by a factor of 500. So now watch me. Now I begin playing some fun and games here. I eliminate this, and because that it now becomes approximately equal. What I do in addition is let me write down the output.

总变量是直流偏置和输出的一些变化之和。让我简单地展开该项并再次写下来。VS RLK/2(VI VT)^2 RLK/2。我在这里得到了 2。还有 VI VT。这次不会忘记 VI。同样，从这里到那里没有什么花哨的。这是我使用技巧的一步。

The total variable is sum of the DC bias and some variation of output. And let me simply expand that term and write it down again. VS RLK/2(VI VT)^2 RLK/2. I get a two here. And VI VT. won’t forget the VI this time. Again, from here to there nothing fancy. This is the one step where I have used a trick.

我说过小 VI 比大写 VI 小得多，所以我只是把它扩展了一下，写在这里。那么你看出了这里明显的下一个技巧了吗？从星号看这个家伙。我可以从星号中取消它，因为知道在工作点这两个表达式相等，因此我可以取消工作点电压和这个。

I have said small VI is much smaller than capital VI, and so I have simply expanded this out written it here. So do you see the obvious next trick here? From star look at this guy. I can cancel this out from star because know that at the operating point these two expressions are equal, and so therefore I can cancel out the operating point voltage and this.

我剩下的只是小 VO 减去 RLK(VI VT) 乘以 vi。只有一个地方我做了一些有趣的事情。除此之外，它纯粹是数学。所以这就是我得到的。请注意，这整个东西是一个常数，减去 RLK(VI VT)。这整个东西是一个常数。所以 VO 等于某个常数乘以 VI。让我为您定义一些会反复使用的术语。

What I am left with is small VO simply minus RLK(VI VT) times vi. Only one place where I did something funny. Other than that it is purely math. So this what I get. Notice that this whole thing is a constant, minus RLK(VI VT). This whole thing is a constant. And so VO equal to some constant times VI. Let me just define some terms for you that will use again and again.

出于下节课中显而易见的原因，我将把这个术语称为 GM。我将把这个术语称为常数 K(VI VT)。对于给定的偏置点电压，它是一个常数。所以我将把它称为 GM。然后我将把整个东西称为 A。当然，这是 VI。就是这样。我有我的线性放大器。A 是增益乘以小 VI。

For reasons that will be obvious next lecture, I am going to call this term here GM. I am going to call this term a constant, K(VI VT). It is a constant for given bias point voltage. So I am going to call that GM. And then I am going to call this whole thing A. And of course this is VI. There you go. I have my linear amplifier. A is the gain times small VI.

增益中包含这些项。我将其称为 GM。稍后您将了解原因。但请注意，增益与 RL 有关。负载电阻 RL 的大小，它有多大，1K、10K 等等。K，这是一个 MOSFET 参数，VI 减去 VT。对于给定的偏置点电压和较小的 VI，这是一个常数。因此 VO 等于较小的 VI。

And the gain has these terms in it. I just call this GM. You will see why later. But notice that the gain relates to RL. The size of the load resistor RL, how big it is, 1K, 10K, whatever. K, this is a MOSFET parameter, and VI minus VT. That is a constant for given bias point voltage and small VI. So VO equals small VI.

我不会给你图形解释，但我鼓励你去看看课程笔记中的图 8.9。它为你提供了该表达式的图形解释。转到第 7 页。从另一个角度来看，从数​​学上分析它的另一种方式，在这里我进行了全面的扩展并几乎推导出小信号响应。我也可以在这里走捷径。

I won’t give you a graphical interpretation, but I encourage you to go and look at Figure 8.9 in the course notes. And it gives you a graphical interpretation of that expression. Move to Page 7. Another way of looking at this, another way of mathematically analyzing it, here I went through a full blown expansion and pretty much deriving the small signal response. What I can also do is take a shortcut here.

所以让我给你一个捷径。你可能会发现这很方便。VO=VS KRL/2(VI VT)^2。我的捷径如下。我的小信号响应就是这种关系。我找到大写 VI 点的斜率并乘以增量。斜率乘以增量可以得到 VO 的增量变化，如下所示。d/dI (VS KRL/2(VI VT)^2) 在 vI=VI 乘以 vi 时求值。这又是数学。

So let me just give you the shortcut. You might find this handy. VO=VS KRL/2(VI VT)^2. And my shortcut is as follows. My small signal response is simply this relationship. I find the slope at point capital VI and multiply by increment. Slope times the increment gives me incremental change in VO as follows. d/dI (VS KRL/2(VI VT)^2) evaluated at vI=VI times vi. This is math again.

我想要找出 VO 在 VI 较小时的变化，我通过对 VI 取一阶导数来实现，用大写 V 代替 I，然后乘以小变化 delta VI 或小 VI。所以这只是 VI 处 VO 与 VI 曲线的斜率。因此，在这里取导数。这是一个常数，所以它为零。

I want to find out the change in VO for a small VI, and I do that by taking the first derivative of this with respect to VI substituting V capital I and multiplying by the small change delta VI or small VI. So this is simply the slope of VO versus VI curve at VI. And so therefore taking the derivative here of this. This is a constant so it vanishes.

但是用两倍 2 来抵消，所以我得到了 KRL(VI VT) 乘以小 vi，在大写 VI 处求值。所以我得到了两倍 KRL，VI 在大写 VI 处求值，所以它是负 VT 乘以小 VI。同样的事情。哦，我这里有一个减号。我得到了上面为你推导的相同表达式，这只是取它的斜率。正如我之前提到的，这是 A。

But twice 2 to cancel out, so I get KRL(VI VT) times small vi evaluated at capital VI. So I get twice KRL, VI evaluated at capital VI, so it is minus VT times small VI. Same thing. Oh, and I have a minus sign here. I get the same expression that derived for you up there, and this is just taking the slope going with it. And this, as I mentioned before, this is A.

最后几分钟，让我把所有事情都整合起来，并谈谈你们许多问题涉及的问题。所有这些都与如何选择偏向点有关。所以在这里我采用了分析方法。在教学中，我们经常教你给出一些东西，然后分析它，但当你开始掌握它时，你就可以开始设计一些东西，问很多问题等等。

The last few minutes let me kind of pull everything together and also hit upon something that many of your questions are touched upon. And that all relates to how choose the bias point. So here I have taken an analysis approach. When teaching we often teach you are given something, analyze it, but as begin to master it you can begin to design things where ask a lot of questions and so on.

这里我们给出的是给定 RLK、VI 等值的分析。如何选择偏置点更像是一个设计问题。如果您正在设计放大器，请问我该如何选择两个小型放大器还是一个大型放大器，诸如此类的问题？归根结底就是如何选择偏置点？如何选择 VI？如何选择 RL 等？

And here what we have is an analysis given a value of RLK, VI and so on. How to choose the bias point becomes more of a design issue. If you are designing an amplifier, asked me the question, how do I choose two small amplifiers versus one big amplifier, that sort of stuff? It boils down to how do you choose the bias point? How do you choose VI? How do you choose RL and so on?

我想谈一下其中的一些内容。首先，增益或放大。

What I would like to is touch upon some of these things. First all, gain or the amplification.

设计参数

Design Parameters

放大器最重要的设计参数之一是增益。假设您在 Maxim Integrated Technologies 找到了一份工作，他们说我们希望您为手机制造一个线性功率放大器。您可以说我知道怎么做。

One of the most important design perimeters for an amplifier is what the gain? Let’s say you get a job at Maxim Integrated Technologies, and they say we would like you to build a linear power amplifier for cell phones. You can say I know how to do that.

然后他们说下一级需要 100 毫伏的输入。而来自天线的这个东西只有几十或几百微伏。所以你坐下来说，哦，天哪，我需要这么大的放大倍数，然后你去设计一个放大器。所以增益往往是一个关键参数。注意增益与 RL 成正比。它与 VI 减 VT 有关，所以与 VI 成正比。

And then they say the next stage needs a 100 millivolt input. While this thing coming from the antenna is only a few tens or hundreds of microvolt. So you sit down and say oh, my gosh, I need an amplification of so much, and you go design an amplifier. So gain tends to be a key parameter. And notice that gain is proportional to RL. It relates VI minus VT, so proportional to VI.

它也与 RL 有关。第二点是增益决定了我对某物进行偏置的位置。如果我将偏置选择得太高，就会产生失真，如果太低，就会产生失真。因此，根据我如何选择偏置点，当信号上升时，它可能会开始削波或失真。下次我将向您展示该特定示例的演示。

It is also related RL. The second point is the gain determines where I bias something. If I choose my bias too high get distortion, or if too low I get distortion. So depending on how I choose my bias point, as a signal goes up it may begin clipping or distorting. And I will show you a demo the next time on that particular example.

因此，偏置点将决定您可以发送多大的信号而不会产生太多失真。另一件事是，与输入的大小有关，有效输入范围是多少？假设您有一个信号。您希望该信号的正向和负向偏移值相同。然后，​​根据您选择偏置点的位置，您的输入范围可能会变小或变大。我们将在下一讲中讨论放大器的一些设计问题。

So bias point will determine how big of a signal you can send without getting too much distortion. And the other thing is that, relates to how big of an input, what is a valid input range? So let’s say you have signal. And you want that signal to have both positive and negative excursions of the same value. Then, depending on where you choose a bias point, your input range may become smaller or larger. And we will go through these in the context of and amplifier look at some design issues in the next lecture.

Lec 11 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 11 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 50:05 https://youtube.com/watch?v=R4KxlqsuZ0A

我们在这里列出了一些测验数据。平均值约为 75%。我必须告诉你们，这非常令人印象深刻。我想麻省理工学院的本科生总是让我惊叹不已。这不是一个简单的测验。这是一个相对困难的测验。这个平均值意味着你们在相对困难的测验中表现良好。很好。让我们回到关于放大器和小信号电路的最后一堂课。

We have put some of the quiz stats here. The mean was about 75%. And I must tell you that is very impressive. I guess MIT undergrads never cease to amaze me. And this was not an easy quiz. This was a relatively hard quiz. And that average implies that you guys did well on a relatively hard quiz. Good. Let’s get back to our final lecture on amplifiers and small signal circuits.

和往常一样，让我先回顾一下。我们很快就想出了一个符号来表示小信号。我们的符号如下所示。我们的总变量是小的，大写，这是直流偏置，这是小信号。这也称为工作点。小信号也称为增量信号。

And as always let me start with a review. Very quickly we came up with a notation to represent small signals. And our notation looked like this. Our total variable was small and capital, and this was a DC bias and this was a small signal. This is also called the operating point. And the small signal is also called the incremental signal.

一般来说，如果你有某个函数，某个电路中感兴趣的变量，比如总变量 V out，假设它与某个输入变量的关系是 F of VI。因此，从数学上讲，我们可以通过在工作点找到此函数的斜率，然后将其乘以输入的增量变化来找出 V out。黄金标准数学。

In general, if you have some function, some variable of interest in the circuit, say a total variable V out, let’s say it relates to some input variable as F of VI. So mathematically we can find out V out by simply finding the slope of this function at the operating point and then multiplying it by the incremental change in the input. Gold standard math.

因此，我们计算该函数的斜率，并在工作点对其进行评估。这样我们就可以得到该函数的斜率。然后将其乘以小 VI，即增量变化。这是标准数学。这将告诉您，给定该函数给出的 VI 的小变化，该表达式将给出 V 输出的小变化。

So we do the slope of this function and evaluate it at the operating point. So this would give us the slope of the function. And multiply that by small VI, which is incremental change. This is standard math. What this will tell you is given a small change in VI this function gives you, this expression gives you the small change in V out.

到目前为止，我们在课堂上基本上都使用了这种方法，利用数学来达到我们想要的效果。然后，我们提供偏置等的方式是，对于我们的放大器，我们有一个偏置电压，一些小信号值，VS。这是输出，也被赋予一些输出工作点加上一个小的变化，即输出电压的变化。

And in lecture we have pretty much used this method so far, used the math to get to where we wanted it to be. And then the way we provided biasing and so on was for our amplifier in particular we had a bias voltage, some small signal value, VS. And this was output which was also given to be some output operating point plus a small change, which was a change in the output voltage.

因此，我们在这里所做的就是用数学方法计算出小的 V 输出。我在这里向您展示的是，要在电路中获得相同的效果，您可以构建电路，并用直流偏置加上一个小的变化替换以前的总变量。然后您将在这里获得输出。并且此输出将使用此表达式与此输入相关联。所以这是更多的复习。

So what we have done here is mathematically computed small V out. And what I am showing you here is to get the same effect in a circuit is you build your circuit and replace what used to be a total variable with a DC bias plus a small change. And then you will get your output here. And this output will relate to this input using this expression. So this is more review.

继续数学复习，对于我们的放大器，VO 被定义为 VS K/2(vI VT)^2 RL。所以这是放大器的输出与输入关系。从数学上讲，我可以通过简单地对 VI 微分该函数，在大写 VI 处求该函数的值，然后乘以输入的微小变化，得到输出 VO 的微小变化。我们得到的结果是小 VO 的表达式

To continue on with the math review, for our amplifier VO was given to be VS K/2(vI VT)^2 RL. So this was the output versus input relationship for the amplifier. And mathematically I could get the small change in the output VO by simply differentiating this function with respect to VI, evaluating that function, at capital VI and multiplying by the small change in the input. And the resulting expression that we got for small VO

只是减去 K，这是我们的 DC 值，RL 乘以小 VI。所以我们上次推导出了所有这些。到目前为止没有什么新东西。所以我的小信号输出是 K(VI VT)RL 乘以小 vi 给出的某个函数。请注意，这就是 VI 与 VO 的关系。这是相对于 VI 的常数。V 大写 I 是 DC 偏置，所以这是一个常数。

Was simply minus K, this was our DC value, and RL times small VI. So we derived all of this the last time. So nothing new so far. So my small signal output was some function given by K(VI VT)RL times small vi. And notice that this is how VI relates to VO. And this is a constant with respect to VI. V capital I is a DC bias, so this is a constant.

因此，这就是我们想要得到的线性关系。这里的这个术语，出于我们今天将要看到的原因，这里的这个术语 K(VI VT) 称为 gm。跨导。稍后我们将更详细地讨论它。甚至更多复习。所以我可以绘制传递函数并绘制 VO 与 VI 的关系图。

So therefore this is the linear relationship that we had set out to get. This term here, for reasons we will see today, this term here K(VI VT) is called gm. Transconductance. We will look at it in more detail a little later. Even more review. So I can draw the transfer function and plot VO versus VI.

另一种以图形方式查看正在发生的事情的方法是绘制该电路的负载线曲线，因此这是 VI。我说我们首先绘制这些是我们的 MOSFET 曲线。我们知道在某个点 MOSFET 会进入饱和状态，因此该曲线为 iDS=K/2 VO^2。曲线右侧的 MOSFET 处于饱和状态。

Another way to graphically view what is going on is by plotting the load line curve for this circuit, so this is VI. And I said we draw that by first plotting the These were our MOSFET curves. And we know that at some point the MOSFET gets into saturation, so this curve was iDS=K/2 VO^2. And to the right side of the curve the MOSFET is in saturation.

我们说过，我们将遵守饱和规则，并在该状态下运行。当 MOSFET 进入该区域时，它处于三极管区域。然后我们可以在这里绘制负载线。负载线编码了以下关系，iDS=VS/RL VO/RL。这是一条负载线。所以我在设备特性上叠加了一条负载线，现在我将根据此向你们展示一个小演示。

And we said we will adhere to the saturation discipline and operate in this regime. When the MOSFET gets into this region it is in its triode region. And then we could draw the load line here. The load line codified the following relationship, iDS=VS/RL VO/RL. This was a load line. So I have superimposed a load line on the device characteristics, and I am going to show you a little demonstration based on that at this point.

因此，这些曲线是随着 VI 值的增加而绘制的。如果我在这里选择某个工作点，那么这个点将对应于某个偏置，这个偏置点将对应于某个输入电压 VI、相应的输出偏置 VO 和相应的电流 iDS。因此，大写的 iDS、大写的 VO、大写的 VI 代表我们小电路的工作点值。到目前为止，还没有什么新东西。

So these curves were drawn for increasing values of VI. And if I choose some operating point here then this point would correspond to some bias, this bias point would correspond to some input voltage VI, a corresponding output bias VO and a corresponding current iDS. So iDS capitals, VO capitals, VI capitals represent the operating point values for our little circuit. So far there is nothing new.

上次我们指出了放大器的增益，这就是增益 K(VI VT)RL。这是放大器的增益 A。该增益与 VI 相关。增益与 VI VT 成正比。因此，如果我增加 VI，就会获得更多增益。那么问题是我们如何选择偏置点？在我们的特定示例中，假设我们可以自由地使用 VI。

One thing we stopped the last time by pointing out that the gain of our amplifier, this is the gain, K(VI VT)RL. That is the gain A of the amplifier. That gain related to VI. A gain was proportional to VI VT. So therefore if I increased VI would get more gain. So the question is how do we choose a bias point? And in our particular example, let’s say we are free to play around with VI.

因此，我们来研究一下 VI，我可以选择各种偏置点。那么，您在哪里设置偏置点？与我的偏置点相关的电路的各种特性是什么？当然，首先是增益。增益取决于我如何选择 VI。稍后我将向您展示这一点。

So we play around with VI and I can choose various bias points. So where do you set the bias point? What are the various characteristics of the circuit that relate to my bias point? Well, first, of course, is gain. The gain depends on how I choose VI. I will show you that in a moment.

第二个重要的事情，换句话说，如果我选择一个 VI 较小的偏置点，那么我的增益就会更小。如果我选​​择一个 VI 值高得多的偏置点，我的增益就会更大。第二个重要的考虑因素是操作范围。请注意，如果我在这里选择一个偏置点，那么随着输入的变化

The second important thing, in other words, if I choose a bias point that is a small VI then my gain is going to be smaller. If I choose a bias point that’s at a much higher value of VI get a bigger gain. The second important consideration is operating range. Notice that if I choose a bias point here then as the input changes

注意，此图中的 VI 会上升或下降，我会遍历并跟随 MOSFET 特性中的不同线条。随着 VI 的增加，工作点会上升，依此类推。

Notice VI in this graph goes up or down, and I would be traversing and following different lines here in my MOSFET characteristic. And as VI increases the operating point would come up here and so on.

因此，如果我在此工作点附近改变输入电压 VI，那么，假设在此工作点附近，如果我的输入 VI，我的小信号 VI 在小范围内变化，则输出值将相应地在此部分负载线附近变化。因此，现在请注意工作范围，在 MOSFET 超出饱和范围之前，VI 可以变化多远？

So if about this operating point I varied my input voltage VI then, so let’s say about this operating point, if my input VI, my small signal VI varied about a small range then correspondingly the output value would vary about this part of my load line. So notice now that the operating range, how far can VI vary before the MOSFET goes out of its saturation discipline?

好吧，在低端，我的 VI 可以降到这里。我们查看了放大器的工作范围。我可以一直降到 VT。此时输出将到达这里。同样，在高端，VI 可以达到一个高值。我们在上一节课中计算了该值。输入的对应值将在这里。

Well, on the low side my VI can come down to here. And we looked at the operating ranges for an amplifier. And I can come all the way down to VT. At that point the output will come here. Similarly at the high end VI could get up to a high value. And we computed that value in the last lecture. And the corresponding value of the input would be here.

因此，从某种意义上说，我可以从这里一直移动到这儿，让 MOSFET 保持饱和状态。请记住，我们现在讨论的不是线性，而是根据我的定义讨论有效工作范围，即 MOSFET 应保持饱和状态。因此，如果我在这里选择工作点，那么我就会得到这个范围。

So in some sense I can traverse all the way from here to here and have the MOSFET remain in saturation. Remember we are not talking about linearity right now, just about the valid operating range based on my definition which is that the MOSFET should stay in saturation. So if I chose my operating point here then I get this range here.

另一方面，如果我选择工作点在这里，那么对于输入信号的负偏移，在达到截止点之前，我会有非常小的量。因此，如果我选择工作点在这里，那么对于 VI 围绕工作点的负遍历，我会很快达到截止点。

And, on the other hand, if I chose my operating point to be here, for negative excursions of the input signal I have a very small amount before I hit cutoff. So if I chose my operating point here then for negative traversals of VI about the operating point I very quickly hit cutoff.

因此，如果我想要对称摆动，那么这是我在有效输入操作范围内能做到的最好，如果我想要对称摆动，因为这是我的偏置点。另一方面，如果我在这里的某个地方选择我的偏置点，或者非常小心地选择我的偏置点，那么我的输入可以在更宽的区域内变化，并且仍然获得对称摆动。

So if I want symmetric swings then this is the best that I can do in terms of the valid input operating range if I want symmetric swings given that this is my bias point. On the other hand, if I chose my bias point somewhere here, or very carefully chose my bias point then my input can vary on a much wider region and still get symmetric swings.

因此，偏置点的选择也会影响输入信号的最大摆幅范围。我不应该称之为操作范围。我应该称之为输入摆幅范围。我们将有效输入操作范围定义为放大器满足饱和规则的范围。因此，两个关键问题是增益和输入摆幅。

And so therefore the choice of bias point also influences the maximum swing range of my input signal. I shouldn’t call this operating range. I should call it input swing range. We defined the valid input operating range as the range for which the amplifier satisfied the saturation discipline. So the two key issues, gain and the input swing.

让我向您展示一个简短的演示，并尝试在图表上指出一些与我们迄今为止讨论的问题相关的特性。所以我在这里展示的是 MOSFET 的这些曲线。这是 VO，这是 iDS。这是零点。忽略下面的这条线。这条线对应于输出电压 VO。

Let me show you a quick demo and try to point out on a graph some of the characteristics that relate to the matter we have been talking about so far. So what I show here are these curves for the MOSFET. This is VO and this iDS. This is the zero point. Ignore this line down here. This line up here corresponds to the output voltage VO.

我现在要做的是，通过一些仔细的电路改造，我将向你们展示一条负载线和偏置点，并向你们展示如何通过改变输入电压来上下移动偏置点，从而改变相应的输出电压。它在那里几乎看不见。它在那儿吗？好的。它不是很清楚，但请注意，当我增加输入时，我也在增加输入。

What I am going to do now is, through some careful circuit hacking, I’m going to show you a load line and show you the bias point, and show you how the bias point can be moved up and down by changing the input voltage which changes the corresponding output voltage. It is hardly visible out there. Is it there? OK. It is not really clear, but notice that as I increase my input, I am increasing my input.

我的输出不断下降。我希望你的视力比我好，因为我没有看到那里有一个点。我很惊讶。这是我第一次遇到这种情况。没关系。好的。正如你所看到的，当我改变输入值时，输出工作点会发生变化，那里的点会移动，形成一条负载线。我想我必须相信那里有一个点。

My output keeps coming down. And I hope your eyesight is better than mine because I don’t see a dot up there. I am amazed. This is the first time this has happened to me. That’s OK. All right. As you can see, as I change the input value the output operating point changes, and the dot out there traverses, articulates a load line. I guess I have to believe that there is a dot out there.

接下来我要向你展示一些更有趣的东西。我要做的是，除了直流电压的点之外，我还要应用一个输入正弦波。因此，如果我在某个偏置下应用输入正弦波，那么我应该看到与输入相对应的负载线相应区域的清晰度。

Next what I will do is show you some more fun stuff. What I will do is instead of having just a dot by having a DC voltage, let me apply an input sinusoid. So if I apply an input sinusoid at some bias then I should see an articulation of the corresponding region of the load line corresponding to the input.

因此，正如您在此处看到的，现在的底线是，这是我的输入，这是我的输出。请注意，当输入达到此量级时，这是负载线的铰接区域。现在让我们来玩一玩。当我增加输入时，您可以看到负载线的较大部分是铰接的，对吗？就是这样。当我减少输入时，负载线的较小区域是铰接的。

So, as you can see here, now the bottom line, here is my input and this is my output. And notice that this the region of the load line articulated when the input is of this magnitude. Now let’s have some fun. As I increase my input, you can see that a larger portion of the load line is articulated, right? There you go. And as I decrease my input a smaller region of the load line is articulated.

让我们暂时把它留在这里。接下来我要做的是，这是我们正在查看的区域，让我增加偏差。如果我增加偏差，如果我增加 VI，你认为这条线会发生什么？好吧，如果我增加偏差，这条线应该向上，对吗？因为还记得那个点吗？这个点位于此处的中间。

Let’s leave it here for a moment. And what I will do next, this is the region here that we are looking at, let me increase the bias. If I increase the bias, if I increase VI, what do you think should happen to this line here? Well, if I increase the bias, the line should go up, right? Because remember the dot? The dot is in the middle of this thing here.

如果我增加偏置，它应该会在这里向上移动。所以那条线会向上移动。你还指望那条线发生其他什么变化吗？什么？它确实增加了。如果我将偏置点增加到这里，那么这也必须增加，因为我的增益增加了。让我这样做。所以让我增加输入偏置。确实注意到，负载线的区域现在更大了。让我减少偏置。

If I increase the bias this should move up here. So that line moves up. Do you expect anything else to happen to that line? Pardon? It increases, exactly. If I increase the bias point to here then this must also increase because my gain has increased. Let me do that. So let me increase the input bias. Indeed notice that the region of the load line articulated is larger now. Let me decrease the bias.

请注意，由于增益较小，因此所示的小段也较小。到目前为止，我已经向您展示了两件事。第一，当我增加偏置时，线确实会上升，这对应于输入工作点的更高值。第二，当我增加偏置时，输出的摆动会更大。

And notice that because the gain is smaller the little segment shown is also smaller. I have shown you two things so far. One is that I as I increase my bias the line indeed rises up corresponding to a higher value for the input operating point. And the second is that I get a larger swing in the output as I increase the bias.

只是为了向那些像我一样视力不佳的人展示，他们无法看到上面的那个小点，让我获取一些音频，这样您就可以真正听到正弦音调。这很烦人。当我减少偏置时，增益会降低。当我增加偏置时，您可以看到增益会增加，音调会更响亮。让我们玩得更开心，现在让我们播放一些音乐。

Just to show that for those like me who were visually challenged in terms of viewing that little dot up there, let me get some audio so you can actually hear the sinusoidal tone. It is a big annoying. As I reduce the bias the gain is decreased. As I increase the bias you can see that the gain is increased and the tone is louder. Let’s have some more fun and let’s play some music now.

我要用音乐向你们展示的是，我演奏音乐不只是为了好玩。好吧，85% 是为了好玩，15% 是为了学习。我们可以打开它吗？我想做的是，当我们播放音乐时，我播放音乐的 15% 是为了让你听到失真。我希望你听到失真。

And what I am going to show you with the music The reason I play the music is not just for fun. Well, it’s 85% fun and 15% learning. Can we turn it on for a second? What I would like to do is, as we play the music, the reason I am playing the music for that 15% is so you can listen to distortion. I want you to listen to the distortion.

也就是说，当清晰度达到这个水平时，你不会得到太多的失真。但是当我进入截止点时，你应该会得到大量的失真。同样，当你进入三极管区域时，你也应该得到失真，因为放大从这里的非线性变为这两个点的高度非线性。所以让我们播放信号。因此音量增加，或者更确切地说，通过增加偏置，振幅增加。

That is when the articulation is here you are not going to get much distortion. But as I get into cutoff you should be getting a bunch of distortion. Similarly, as you get into the triode region you should also be getting distortion because the amplification from being somewhat nonlinear here becomes highly nonlinear at those two points. So let’s just play the signal. So volume increases, or rather the amplitude increases by increasing the bias.

现在你应该听到音量下降和失真。所以现在注意偏置点在这里很低。所以增益非常低，而且由于截止，还存在失真。现在我要做的是在这里把它放大，你会看到音量上升了，但随后你又会看到失真。让我们看看你是否能忍受这里的音量。即使是 CD 也不喜欢这样。

Now you should hear the volume go down and distortion. So notice now that the bias point is way down here. So the gain is very low, and plus there is a distortion because of cutoff. Now what I will do is blast it up here, and you will see that the volume has gone up but then you see distortion again. Let’s see if you can stand the volume here. Even the CD doesn’t like that.

请注意，当我在这里上升时，音量不断增加，因为增益不断增加，但当我进入三极管区域时，我开始失去增益，因为请记住，放大器在三极管区域没有增益，MOSFET 在三极管区域，我们也会在那里得到一堆失真。最后，事实证明，随着人们制造放大器

Notice that as I went up here the volume kept increasing because the gain kept increasing, but as I got into the triode region I began to lose my gain because, remember, the amplifier doesn’t have gain in the triode region, MOSFET in its triode region, and we also get a bunch of distortion out there. Finally, it turns out that as people are building amplifiers

我想那是在 60 年代中后期50s and。他们说，电气工程师们不会把事情做好。所以他们发明了一种新的音乐，这种音乐对失真的容忍度更高。我会为你播放这种音乐。它被称为硬摇滚。我敢说你敢说它是失真的。我觉得听起来不错。好的。好的。那就行了。谢谢。

I think this was in the mid to late 50s and60s and so on. They said man, electrical engineers are not going to get their thing right. So they invented a new kind of music which was much more tolerant to distortion. And I will play that music for you. It is called hard rock. I challenge you to tell me it is distorting. Sounds good to me. OK. All right. That’ll do it. Thank you.

我希望这里没有硬摇滚音乐家，他们会在讲座后或做其他事情后来殴打我。好吧。信不信由你，大部分内容都是复习。今天除了一些有趣的游戏等之外，没有什么新内容。我让你们休息五秒钟，然后再开始更有趣的事情。我希望你们看一下这里的中间板。

I hope there are no hard rock musicians in here who will come and beat me up after lecture or something. All right. Believe it or not most of that was review. There is nothing new today besides some fun and games and so on. I will give you a breather for five seconds before jumping into something even more fun. I want you to look at the middle board here.

而且，正如我在 6.002 的开头所说的那样，工程学就是要构建有用的系统。工程学不是炫耀数学或说，我的数学真棒。工程学就是要构建有用的系统，而你要找到最简单、最轻松、最便宜的方法来实现它。与数学和理论等深奥领域不同，工程学的美在于简单。

And, as I told you in the beginning of 6.002, engineering is about building useful systems. Engineering is not about showing off at math or saying man, I am really cool in math and stuff. Engineering is about building useful systems, and you want to find the simplest, easiest, cheapest way to get there. Unlike deep areas of math and theory and so on, the beauty is in the simplicity.

所以美学在于我们能以多简单的方式制造东西，同时还能达到我们想要的效果？在整个课程中，你会一次又一次地看到，当事情在数学方面变得太复杂时，我们会退后一步说，哎呀，我们是工程师，还记得吗？让我们找到一种更简单的方法，并运用直觉。

So the aesthetics are in how simply can we make things and still get to where we want to be? All through the course what you will be seeing happening again and again and again is when things begin to get too grovelly in terms of math, we will step back and say oops, we are engineers, remember? Let’s find a much simpler way to do it and use intuition.

因此，我会一次又一次地带你走一条更简单的道路，让你能够通过纯粹的直觉检查来解决问题。大多数电路设计师都是这样做的。所以看看这个。我不喜欢这里这种令人讨厌的区分。这就像高中后期的微积分等等。让我们避开数学，看看你是否能找到一些更简单的方法。

So time and time and time again, I am going to take you on a simpler path where you can solve things by inspection by pure intuition. Most circuit designers do that. So take a look at this. I don’t like this nasty differentiation here. That’s getting into late high school calculus and so on. Let’s avoid the math and let’s see if you find some way of doing it that is even much more simpler.

这就是我接下来要做的，向你们展示所谓的小信号电路视图。一种开发小信号模型的纯电路方式。那么，让我先为你们画出大信号等效电路。我在这里画它的原因在课程结束时会很明显。好的。这是我们的 MOSFET 放大器的大信号等效电路模型。

And that is what I will do next and show you what is called the small signal circuit view. A purely circuit way of developing the small signal model. So let me just start by drawing the large signal equivalent circuit for you. I will draw it here for reasons that will be obvious at the end of the class. All right. This is the large signal equivalent circuit model for our MOSFET amplifier.

VS，这是我的电流源。iDS 与 VI 减 VT 的平方有关。请看一眼。这是一个非线性电路。iDS 与 VI 减 VT 的平方有关。让我先提出以下主张。让我即兴地提出以下宏大的主张，然后我将向您展示如何证明该主张。

VS and here is my current source. iDS relates to the square of VI minus VT. So stare at that for a second. And that is a nonlinear circuit. iDS relates to the square of VI minus VT. Let me start by making the following claim. Let me shoot from the hip here and make the following grand claim, and then I will show you how I can prove that claim.

我即将提出的宏伟主张如下。这里有一堆小装置。这是一个非线性电路。假设我们做一个思想实验。假设我用线性元件等效物替换这里的每个电路元件。换句话说，这是一个 VS 源，这是一个相关电流源，让我用它们的线性等效电路模型替换它们。

The grand claim I am about to make says the following. A bunch of little devices here. It is a nonlinear circuit. Just suppose for a moment we do a Gedanken experiment. Suppose I replace each of my circuit elements here with its linearized element equivalent. In other words, here is a VS source, here is a dependent current source, let me replace them with their linear equivalent circuit models.

换句话说，它们具有相应的小信号元件模型。我马上就向你们展示它们是什么。电阻器具有相应的小信号元件。从属电流源具有相应的小信号行为元件模型。我要做的是保持相同的电路连接，只需取出元件的大信号模型并将其替换为小信号元件模型。

In other words, with their corresponding small signal element models. And I will show you what those are in a second. The resistor has a corresponding small signal element. The dependent current source has a corresponding small signal behavioral element model. And what I am going to do is keep the same circuit connections and simply pull out the large signal model for the element and replace it with a small signal element model.

根据小信号模型的性质，它们都是线性的。所以我剩下的就是一个线性电路，里面有简单的线性电路元件。一旦我有了线性电路，我就应该能够使用方法 1、2 和 3、叠加、戴维南、节点法等来分析该线性电路。
