And by the nature of the small signal model they are all going to be linear. So what I am going to be left with is a linear circuit with simple linear circuit elements in there. And then once I have a linear circuit, I should be able to analyze that linear circuit using methods 1,2 and 3, superposition, Thevenin, node method and so on.

当然还有像叠加和戴维南这样的直观方法，它们让我在处理线性模型时轻松很多，从而可以很快得到我想要的函数。再说一次，我的主张是，我可以用小信号等效模型替换每个大信号模型，然后分析结果电路。我声称我应该能够得到相同的答案。这是一个主张。好吗？

And certainly the intuitive methods like superposition and Thevenin, which make life a lot easier for me with linear models, and thereby get the function that I am looking for very quickly. Again, my claim is that I can replace each of these large signal models by just small signal equivalents and then just analyze the resultant circuit. And I claim that I should be able to get the same answer. That’s a claim. All right?

因此，我将向您提供我为什么可以这样做的非正式证明。我还请您参考课程笔记的第 8.2.1 节，更详细地了解小电路模型的基础。直觉是，还记得 KVL 和 KCL 吗？我可以为该电路中的每个环路和该电路中的每个节点写下 KVL 和 KCL。

So what I will do is give you an informal proof for why I can do that. And I also ask you to refer to Section 8.2.1 of the course notes to go through the foundations of the small circuit model in more detail. The intuition is that, remember KVL and KCL? I can write down KVL and KCL for every loop in that circuit and every node in that circuit.

如果我进行 KVL 和 KCL 运算，最终会得到类似这样的结果。对于输入回路，我应用 KVL 得到 VI 等式。对于输出回路，我应用 KCL 得到 V 等式。然后应用 KCL，我在 iDS 中得到其他方程。因此，以下是该电路的 KVL 和 KCL 方程。

If I do KVL and KCL, I will end up with something like this. For the input loop I get VI something or the other applying KVL. For the output loop I get V out something or the other. And then applying KCL I get some other equation in iDS. So here are my KVL and KCL equations for that circuit.

现在，KVL 和 KCL 只是电路的不同表示，因为在这些 KVL 和 KCL 中编码了电路的拓扑结构。请记住，每个 KVL 方程代表一个环路，每个 KCL 方程代表节点如何连接在一起。因此，KVL 和 KCL 方程在其中编码了我的电路的拓扑结构。

Now, KVL and KCL are simply a different representation of the circuit because within those KVL and KCL is encoded the topology of the circuit. Remember each KVL equation represents a loop and each KCL equation represents how nodes are connected together. So KVL and KCL equations encode within them the topology of my circuit.

我接下来要做的是，比如说，我用偏差加上小信号替换它们中的每一个，这样我就得到了偏差加上小信号，并保持方程不变。我在我的一大组 KVL、KCL 方程中所做的一切，只是用大信号变量和小信号量替换了总变量。接下来是一个关键技巧。

What I do next is, say, I replace each of these with the bias plus the small signal, so I get the bias plus the small signal and keep the equations the same. All I have done in my big set of KVL, KCL equations, I have simply replaced the total variable with the large signal variable and the small signal quantity. Then comes a key trick.

关键技巧在于，由于偏置点变量是电路的有效解决方案。电路处于这种静止状态，而这些是电路的有效解决方案。因此我可以将它们取消。因此，VI，大信号值可以取消，只留下小信号变量。

The key trick is that because the bias point variables, they are a valid solution to the circuit. The circuit is in this quiescent state, and those are valid solutions to circuit. So therefore I can cancel them out. So the VI, the large signal values can be cancelled out leaving just small signal variables in there.

因此，从 KVL、KCL 方程式中，我可以消除大信号值和直流偏置点，因为它们本身满足 KVL 和 KCL。换句话说，我可以写出 VI 加 V 等等。

So from the KVL, KCL equations I can cancel out the large signal values, the DC bias points because they satisfy the KVL and KCL themselves. In other words, I could have written VI plus V out and so on.

由于它们满足条件，我只需从每个方程的两边删除大信号变量，剩下的就是相同的 KVL、KCL 方程，但用小变量代替大变量。这应该告诉你，这个非正式证明应该告诉你，小信号变量应该满足总变量满足的 KVL、KCL 方程的相同形式。

Since they are satisfied I just strike out the large signal variable from both sides of each of these equations, so what is left is the same KVL, KCL equations but with small variables in place of the big variables. What that should tell you, this informal proof should tell you is that the small signal variables should then satisfy the same form of the KVL, KCL equations that the total variables satisfy.

由于 KVL、KCL 方程反映了电路的拓扑结构，这意味着小信号变量也必须满足 KVL 和 KCL。由于这些变量来自小信号元素，这意味着我可以用小元素替换大元素，而 KVL 和 KCL 将适用于最终的电路。

And because the KVL, KCL equations are a reflection of the topology of the circuit, what that says is that the small signal variables must also satisfy KVL and KCL. And since these arrive from the small signal elements that says that I can replace the big elements with the small elements and KVL and KCL will hold for the resulting circuit.

这是一个非常快速的通关，一个非正式的证明，表明我可以用相应的小元件模型替换大元件，然后简单地应用线性技术。请参阅第 8.2.1 节了解更多基础以及有关我们可以这样做的基础的更多讨论。这引出了小信号电路方法。小信号分析的电路方法有三个步骤。第一步是使用 LS 找到工作点。

This is a very quick breeze through, an informal proof to show that I can replace the big elements with the corresponding little element models and then simply apply linear techniques. Refer to Section 8.2.1 for more foundations and more discussion about the foundations for why we can do this. That brings up the small signal circuit method. The circuit method for small signal analysis has three steps. The first step is find operating point by using LS.

首先，分析大信号电路并找到工作点。你必须这样做，因为请记住，小信号模型取决于工作点值。请记住，我们的放大器的增益取决于偏置点。第二步是开发元件的小信号模型。第二步是取出电路中的每个元件，并为每个元件找到其等效的小电路模型。

First you analyze your large signal circuit and find the operating point. You have to do this, because remember, the small signal models depend on the operating point values. Remember the gain of our amplifier depended on the bias point. Second step is develop small signal models of elements. Second step is take each of the elements in your circuit and find their equivalent small circuit model for each of the elements.

第三步是用小信号模型元素替换原始元素。第三步是简单地取大元素并将其替换为小信号等效模型。然后分析结果电路，该电路将是一个线性电路。让我们举个例子。我将仅使用放大器作为此方法的一个例子。

Third step is replace original elements with their small signal model elements. Third step is simply take the large elements and replace them with their small signal equivalent models. Then analyze resulting circuit, and that circuit will be a linear circuit. So let’s do an example. I will just use the amplifier as an example of this method.

并说服你，你最终会得到相同的表达式，但就是这么简单，甚至不需要最少的数学运算。三个步骤。第一步是使用大信号模型找到工作点。让我在这里做这件事。我得到 V out = VS K/2(VI VT)^2 RL。让我把它写在这里。不用担心把它抄下来。

And convince you that you are going to get the same expression at the end, but just so, so simply without even the smallest amount of grubby math. Three steps. The first step is to find the operating point using the large signal model. And let me just do that here. I get my V out = VS K/2(VI VT)^2 RL. Let me just write down that out here. Don’t worry about copying that down.

它位于笔记的最后一页。该方法的第一步只是应用大信号模型并找出该电路的行为以找出偏置点值。第二步是开发我的元件的小信号模型。我该如何开发元件的小信号模型？让我们从 MOSFET 开始。MOSFET 的大信号模型如下所示。

It is on the last page of your notes. The first step of the method simply applies the large signal model and finds out the behavior of that circuit to find out what the bias point values are. The second step is to develop the small signal model of my elements. How do I go about developing the small signal models of elements? Let’s start with the MOSFET. The large signal model for the MOSFET looks like this.

这是我的 Vgs。这是我的栅极。这是我的漏极。这是我的源极。我知道我的 iDS 是 K/2(Vgs VT)^2。所以这是 MOSFET 的大信号模型，同样处于饱和状态。我说的是所有这些模型都属于饱和规则。因此，对于 MOSFET，Vgs 与 iDS 的关系如下。即 iDS 为 K/2，这是我的平方律关系。

Here is my Vgs. This is my gate. This is my drain. This is my source. And I know my iDS to be K/2(Vgs VT)^2. So this is the large signal model for the MOSFET, again in saturation. I am talking about all of these models are under the saturation discipline. So Vgs relates to iDS in the following way for the MOSFET. That is iDS, is K/2 and that is my square law relationship.

那么相应的小信号模型是什么呢？我先从这个开始。相应的小信号模型简单地说，iDS 与 Vgs 的关系如下。我所要做的就是找到一个小信号等效项，我需要找出，如果输入 Vgs 发生微小变化，iDS 的微小变化是多少？

So what is a corresponding small signal model? I go ahead and start with this. The corresponding small signal model simply says that iDS relates to Vgs in the following way. All I have to do is find a small signal equivalent where I need to find out, given a small change in the input Vgs, what is the small change in the iDS?

因此，我可以将我的标准技巧应用到一个更简单的表达式上，也就是 iDS，我简单地对 Vgs 求这个函数的导数。因此，我并没有完全消除这里的数学运算，但这是一个更简单的问题。在 Vgs 等于偏置点乘以小 vgs 时。我可以使用这个表达式找到与输入的小变化相对应的 iDS 的小变化。这给了我 iDS，即简单的 K(Vgs VT) vgs。

So I can apply my standard trick to a much simpler expression here, which is iDS simply, I differentiate this function with respect to Vgs. So I don’t completely eliminate the math here, but it is a much simpler problem here. At Vgs equals the bias point times small vgs. I can find the small change in iDS corresponding to a small change in the input using this expression. That gives me iDS as simply K(Vgs VT) vgs.

我将其称为 gm，稍后我会告诉您原因。那么这个表达式表示什么？这个表达式表示，如果我的 Vgs 有小的变化，那么这将是我的 iDS 的小变化。请注意，由此产生的小信号模型也是一个依赖电流源。它是一个电压控制的依赖电流源。

I call this gm, and I will tell you why in a second. So what does this expression say? This expression says that if I have a small change in Vgs then this will be my small change in iDS. Notice that the resulting small signal model is also a dependent current source. It is a voltage controlled dependent current source.

因此输出是电流，它是一个依赖电流源，它取决于输入电压。好消息是，请注意，这里的表达式 gm 是一个与偏置点值相关的常数。因此，请注意，饱和状态下的 MOSFET 的小信号模型，毫不奇怪，根据以下表达式，是一个线性电压控制电流源。所以 iDS=gm Vgs。

So the output is the current, and it is a dependent current source and it depends on the input voltage. The good news is that notice that this one, this expression here gm is a constant related to the bias point values. Therefore, notice that the small signal model for the MOSFET in saturation, not surprisingly, is a linear voltage controlled current source according to the following expression. So iDS=gm Vgs.

Gm 是 K(Vgs VT) 的表示，称为跨导。之所以称为跨导，是因为在某种意义上，它会根据输入偏转其电导特性。所以它是一种跨导。所以这个值称为 Vgs。因此，我可以按如下方式构建小信号模型。Vgs 是电压控制电流源，iDS 就是 gm Vgs。所以这是我的栅极、漏极、源极。

Gm is a representation for K(Vgs VT) and is called a transconductance. It is called a transconductance because it, in some sense, deflects the conductance properties of this based on the input. So it is a transconductance. So this value is called Vgs. Therefore, I can build the small signal model as follows. Vgs is a voltage controlled current source and iDS is simply gm Vgs. So this is my gate, drain, source.

这就是我的 MOSFET 的小信号模型。下一步，我的电路中还有哪些其他元件？让我们看看。我有一个电压源和一个电阻器，所以让我找出直流电源 VS 的相应小信号模型。这是第 7 页。我将用数学方法为您计算，但很多时候，使用直觉进行健全性检查总是好的。

So that is the small signal model for my MOSFET. As a next step what are the other elements in my circuit? Let’s see. I have a voltage source and I have a resistor, so let me find out the corresponding small signal model for a DC supply VS. This is Page 7. I will do it mathematically for you, but often times it is always good to do a sanity check using intuition.

我问你一下，直流电源的大信号是这样的。电压源的元素定律是 VS 等于某个大写的 VS。它是一个恒定电压。那么你认为电压源的小信号模型是什么呢？换句话说，对于一个小的变化，假设我的电流有一个小的变化，输出 VS 应该变化多少？它不应该改变。它是一个电压源。

Let me ask you, the large signal for a DC supply looks like this. The element law for a voltage source is VS equals some capital VS. It is a constant voltage. So what do you expect to be the small signal model for a voltage source? In other words, for a small change, suppose I have a small change in the current, by how much should the output VS change? It shouldn’t change. It is a voltage source.

那么直觉告诉你电压源的小信号模型是什么？短路。所以这里的关键是电压源在小扰动下表现得像短路。换句话说，如果我以某种方式将流过它的电流改变一点点，输出仍然会保持在 VS。

So what does intuition tell you is a small signal model for the voltage source? A short. So the key here is that a voltage source behaves like a short circuit for small perturbations. In other words, if I change the current flowing through it by a small amount somehow, the output is still going to held at VS.

换句话说，小信号只会快速穿过这个电压源，而不会对电压产生任何影响。或者从数学上讲，我也可以做小 vs 是 del 除以 VS 的 del IS，在 IS 处求值等于某个大写 IS 乘以小 IS。因此 VS 等于零。这意味着我的电压源的小信号模型只是一个短路。

In other words, small signals are simply going to scoot through this voltage source without having any impact whatsoever on the voltage. Or mathematically I could also do small vs is del by del IS of VS evaluated at IS equals some capital IS times small IS. And therefore VS equals zero. What that means is that the small signal model for my voltage source is simply a short circuit.

因此，在小电路中，电压源看起来就像短路一样。最后，我有一个电阻器，我的电阻器 R。让我找出它对应的小信号模型。大信号模型看起来像这个 R、VR、IR。我知道 VR 就是 RIR。为了找到小信号等效值，我将 IRR 的 del 除以 IR 的 del，得到以某个常数值乘以小 IR 计算的 IR。

So in a small circuit voltage sources appear like a short circuit. Finally, I have a resistor, my resistor R. Let me find out its corresponding small signal model. The large signal model looks like this R, VR, IR. And I know that VR is simply RIR. And to find the small signal equivalent I do del of IRR divided by del IR for IR calculated at some constant value times small IR.

我想要做的是找出当电流发生微小扰动时 R 两端电压的变化是多少？再次提醒你，至少要依靠直觉来检查你的答案是否合理。那么你认为这应该是什么样的？这是一个电阻，电流发生了微小变化，你预计电压会变化多少？

What I am looking to do is to find out what is the change in the voltage across R for a small perturbation in the current? Again, let me exhort you to rely on intuition to at least sanity check your answers. So what do you think this should look like? It’s a resistor and I have a small change in the current, by what do you expect the voltage to change?

在接下来的五秒钟里，请思考一下这个小信号模型应该是什么样子，然后我会继续写下答案。通过微分，我只需得到 RIR。换句话说，对于电阻器，小信号模型就是电阻器本身。到目前为止，我所做的只是带您了解我们现在的情况，让您了解一下大局。

Think about, for the next five seconds, what the small signal model for this should look like and then I will go ahead and write down the answer. So differentiating I simply get RIR. In other words, for a resistor the small signal model is the resistor itself. So what I have done so far, let me just take you through where we are right now, give you the big picture there.

我首先建议寻找一种更简单的方法来进行小信号分析。我给了你一个非正式的证明，表明如果我有所有元件的小信号元件模型，我可以在电路中简单地替换它们，然后进行相应的线性电路分析阶段，以获得我想要的结果。该方法有三个步骤。

I began by suggesting that looking to find an even simpler way to do small signal analysis. I gave you an informal proof to show that if I had small signal element models for all of my elements, I could simply replace them in the circuit and then do a corresponding linear circuit analysis phase to get the result I am looking for. There are three steps to the method.

首先，我们为每个元件寻找小信号模型。对于非线性 MOSFET，小信号模型是线性相关电流源。对于电压源，相应的小信号模型是短路。同样，如果我将流过电压源的电流稍微改变一下，这在直觉上是合理的。电压会改变多少？这是一个电压源，傻瓜。电压不会改变。

As a first step we began by finding small signal models for each of our elements. For the nonlinear MOSFET the small signal model was a linear dependent current source. For a voltage source the corresponding small signal model was a short circuit. Again, that makes sense intuitively if I change the current through a voltage source by a small amount. By how much does the voltage change? It is a voltage source, silly. The voltage doesn’t change.

因此，小信号 V，即电压的小变化为零，这与短路是一样的。对于电阻器，如果我将电流稍微改变，电压会改变多少？嗯，它会改变 R 乘以电流变化，这就是电阻器 R 的属性。

So the small signal V, the small change in the voltage is zero, and that is the same thing as a short circuit. For a resistor by how much does the voltage change if I change the current by a small amount? Well, it will change by R times the current change, and that is the property of a resistor, R.

最后一步，在第 8 页，我想快速为您绘制小信号电路，然后对其进行分析。这是大信号电路。那是一个大信号电路。让我画出小信号电路。方法很简单，就是拔出、挖出每个元件。然后简单地用相应的小信号线性等效元件替换每个讨厌的非线性元件。

As a final step what I would like to do, on Page 8, I’d like to very quickly draw for you the small signal circuit and then analyze it. This is the large signal circuit. That is a large signal circuit. And let me draw the small signal circuit. And the method says simply pluck out, gouge out each of these elements. And simply replace each of these nasty nonlinear elements with the corresponding small signal linear equivalents.

让我们这样做。记住，对于输入，你用小信号电压替换输入，因为我告诉你它正在 VI 中产生一个小的变化。所以这就是 VI。然后我用 VS 替换一个短路。我用 RL 替换一个 R，因为对于小信号模型来说，它本身就是一个 RL。然后对于依赖源，我们发现依赖源是一个线性依赖源，其中 ids=gmvi。

So let’s do that. Remember, for the input you replace input with its small signal voltage because I am telling you that it’s sourcing a small change in VI. So that is VI. And then I replace a short for VS. I replace an R for RL because it is an RL itself for the small signal model. And then for the dependent source, we discovered that the dependent source was a linear dependent source given where ids=gmvi.

记住，这是我的小 VO。给你。这里有一个小信号电路，我只需将每个大元件替换为小元件即可创建它。现在这些都是线性元件，所以我可以进行非常简单的线性分析。我们该使用什么方法？好吧，这很简单。我将继续使用节点方法。

Remember, this was my small VO. Here you go. I have a small signal circuit here where I have simply created that by replacing each of the big elements by little rinky dink elements. Now these are all linear elements so I can do a really simple linear analysis. What method shall we use? Well, this is so simple. I will just go ahead and use the node method.

因此，在电压为 VO 的节点处应用节点方法，我要做的是电流上升，VO 除以 RL 等于电流下降 iDS。因此，电流上升是 VO 除以 RL，电流下降是哎呀，我应该这样做。总电流流出为零，因此这两个的总和为零。这是我在这里使用的旧节点方法。

So applying the node method at the node with voltage VO, what I will do is the current going up, VO divided by RL equals the current going down iDS. And so the current going up is VO divided by RL and the current going down is Oops, I should have done this. The total current going out is zero, so the sum of these two is zero. That is my good old node method here.

我知道 iDS 就是 gmvi 等于零。因此，我在这里得到了 VO 和 VI 之间的关系。因此，VO 就是减去 gmviRL。请记住，gm 就是 K VI 减去 VT。我们完成了，好吗？我们在这里得到了什么？我创建了一个线性电路，它只是由每个大元件的小信号模型组成。

And I know that iDS is simply gmvi equals zero. So right there I have the relationship between VO and VI. So VO is simply minus gmviRL. And remember gm was simply K VI minus VT. We are done, OK? What have we here? I created a linear circuit which simply comprised small signal models for each of my big elements.

然后，我使用我所知道的任何一种线性技术进行了简单的线性分析。这很简单，所以我应用了节点方法。我得到了这个节点的方程，简化了它，然后直接得到了答案。在一两个步骤中，我直接给出了作为输入函数的输出。再简单不过了。谢谢。

And then I simply did a straightforward linear analysis using any one of the linear techniques I knew about. This is simple enough so I apply the node method. And I’ve got the equation at this node, simplified it and I directly got the answer. In one or two steps I directly gave you the output as a function of the input. It can’t get any simpler. Thank you.

Lec 12 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 12 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 49:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=COdQmA9g9S8

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 49:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=COdQmA9g9S8

介绍

Introduction

早上好。今天，我们朝着与以往截然不同的方向前进。迄今为止，我们拥有的所有设备，电阻器和电压源，甚至您的数字设备（如与门或逆变器等）都具有非常特殊的属性。我们没有详细讨论该属性，但该属性是这些不是所谓的存储设备。

Good morning. Today we move in the direction that takes a big turn from the direction we have been going in so far. All the devices we have had up until now, resistors and voltage sources, and even your digital devices like the AND gate or the inverter and so on had a very specific property. We didn’t dwell on that property, but that property was that these were not what are called memory devices.

换句话说，任何给定时间的输出都仅取决于输入。换句话说，如果你拿你的反相器或 NAND 门，并构建一个由 50 个 NAND 门组成的电路，这些 NAND 门以我们讨论过的结构连接在一起，你施加一个输入，然后砰的一声，你就得到了一个输出。你的输出仅取决于输入，对吧？电阻器和电压源也是一样。

In other words, the outputs at any given time are a function of the inputs alone. In other words, if you took your inverter or your NAND gate for that matter and you build a circuit comprising 50 NAND gates connected in structures that we have talked about, you apply an input and boom you get an output. And your output is a function of the inputs alone, right? The same thing with your resistors and voltage sources.

在任何给定的时间点，T 的输出 VO 都是 T 的输入 VI 的某个函数。我们今天要讨论一个新元素，它将为我们所有人引入一类全新的有趣内容。这就是所谓的存储。

At any given point in time your output VO of T was some function of the input VI of T. What we are going to do today is discuss a new element which will introduce a whole new class of fun stuff for all of us to deal with. And that is called storage.

换句话说，电路的输出现在不仅取决于输入，还取决于背景或电路过去的状态。所以过去很重要。这是一个非常根本的区别。我想先给你们一点惊喜。

In other words, the output of a circuit is now going to depend not just on the inputs but it is going to depend on the background or it is going to depend on where the circuit has been in the past. So past is going to matter. It is a very fundamental difference. And what I would like to do is start by giving you folks a little bit of a surprise.

我将对你的两个逆变器电路做一个小演示。

I am going to do a little demo taking two of your inverter circuits.

逆变器

Inverters

我首先要使用几个反相器。记住，我在这里使用这个结构作为反相器。我要将它与另一个反相器耦合，并获取输出 C、一些 VS、一些负载电阻 RL、我的 B 端子和我的 A 端子。所以我要在地和我的 A 端子之间应用一些输入。

I am going to start by taking a couple of inverters. Remember, I am using this structure here as an inverter. And I am going to couple this to another inverter and take an output C, some VS, some load resistance RL, my B terminal and my A terminal. So I’m going to apply some input between ground and my A terminal.

为了好玩，我想在输入端应用一个方波。方波介于 0 到 5 伏之间。我的时间流逝如下。假设 VS 为 5 伏。所以我要做的是为您绘制此逆变器的行为。我将为您绘制 A，它看起来像这样。我将为您绘制 B，它将是反转的波形。

And for fun I want to apply a square wave at the input. A square wave between zero and 5 volts. And this is how my time goes. Let’s assume that VS is 5 volts. So what I am going to do is plot for you the behavior of this inverter. I am going to plot for you A, which would look like this. I am going to plot for you B, which would be the inverted wave form.

然后是图 C，它将是看起来像这样的波形。我在这里画一个图。

And then plot C, which would be a wave form that looks like this again. Let me do a plot here.

阴谋

Plot

所以这是 A。等等。时间是这样。假设这是在 0 到 5 伏之间。B 应该是反向波形，看起来应该是这样的。

So this is A. and so on. Time goes this way. And let’s say this is between zero and 5 volts. And B should be an inverted wave form that should look like this.

如果迄今为止我们所相信的关于这个世界的一切都是真的，那么事情就应该如此发展，所以 C 应该是这样的。这就是这个世界应该的样子，如果你所学到的一切都是真的、正确的，而且都是好东西的话。

If all that we believe of the world so far is true then this is how things should behave, so C should look like this. This is what the world should look like and if everything that you learned about is true and correct and all of the good stuff.

让我给你展示一个小演示，看看我是否可以尝试将你迄今为止学到的所有知识抽离出来，并向你展示一些令人惊讶的东西。

Let me show you a little demo and see if I can try to pull the rug out from under all that you have learned so far and show you some surprising stuff.

波形

Waveforms

这是我在这里展示的三种波形。这是我的 A。这是我的 A 波形。这是 B 波形。请注意，正如您所预料的，B 是 A 的反转形式。这是 C。

Here are the three wave forms that I showed you up here. This is my A. This is my A wave form. This is the B wave form. Notice that B, as you expect, is an inverted form of A. And this is C.

我们都预料到了这一点，对吧？但我要做的是扩大时间尺度，以便更仔细地观察这些转变。我只是要扩大时间尺度。就是这样。我所做的只是扩大了时间尺度，并将其稍微展开。你看到的与你的预期完全不同。

We all expect this, correct? But what I am going to do is let me expand the time scale on this so that I can look at these transitions a little bit more carefully. I am just going to expand the time scale. There you go. All I have done is expanded the time scale and spread that out a little bit. And what you see there is quite different from what you expect.

A 是方波，正如预期的那样，但 B 却截然不同。它为零，正如预期的那样，因为这是一个 1。但在这里，我得到了一些非常奇怪的行为，这种行为是地球上没有的。就像你以前从未见过的一样。然后，当然，它最终变成了 1，但这里发生了一些非常非常可疑的事情。到目前为止，你还没有准备好处理这个问题。

A is a square wave as expected, but B is stunningly different. It is a zero as expected because this is a one. But here I get some really strange behavior, behavior that is like nothing on earth. Like nothing you have seen before. And then, of course, it becomes a one eventually, but there’s some really, really shady stuff going on here. And so far you are not prepared to deal with this.

我们没有给你处理这个问题的便利。这有什么问题？我们可以说谁在乎？这有什么问题？让我们看看结果。我正在看这个，我专注于这部分。请注意，它不是急剧上升，而是看起来像这样。它上升得稍微慢一点。这会造成什么样的问题？

We have not given you the facility to deal with his issue. What is the problem with this? We could say who cares? What is the problem with this? Let’s look at the result. I am looking at this, I am focusing on this piece here. And notice that instead of being a sharp rise it looks like this. It is going up a little bit more slowly. What kind of problem would that create?

它造成的问题如下。让我再多研究一下这个图。我要做的就是把这个输出，即 C 输出，与 A 输出对齐。所以我要把 C 波形对齐在 A 波形的顶部。

The problem that it creates is the following. Let me play around with this graph a little bit more. What I am going to do is just take this output here, the C output and line it up against the A output. And so I am going to line up the C wave form on top of the A wave form.

因此，如果真的发生了一些非常奇怪和令人讨厌的事情，您可以自己查看，我只需将 C 波形向上移动并将其对齐即可。那里发生了什么？如果仔细观察，您会发现 C 波形的转换比 A 波形稍晚。看这里。我认为这就是原因。

So you can see for yourself if something really, really strange and nasty is happening, I am just going to move up the C wave form and line it up. What is happening out there? If you look carefully, what you observe is that the C wave form transitions just ever so slightly later than the A wave form. Look here. And I claim that it is because of this.

因此，C 波形会稍微晚一点，而我们看到的那个小东西就是延迟。所以到目前为止你学到的任何东西都无法让你对此有所准备。突然间，我的输出不是完全跟随输入，而是跟随输入，但稍晚一点。

Because of this, the C wave form falls just a little bit later, and that little thing we see out there is a delay. So nothing you have learned so far prepares you for this. Suddenly, instead of the output exactly following the input, my output is following the input but a little bit later.

正是这种生活事实，即事情发生得晚了一点，这就是你们每个人以及我们所有人每隔几年就需要购买新电脑的原因。这是一个简单的基本事实。如果不存在这个生活事实，你就会买一台电脑，然后一辈子都用它。英特尔一年可以赚很多钱，戴尔和 Gateway 等公司也是如此，然后就没了。

And it is this fact of life that things happen a little bit later, is really the reason why each of you and all of us needs to buy new computers every couple of years. This simple basic fact. If this fact of life didn’t exist, you would buy one computer and be done with it for life. Intel would make gobs of money one year, and so would Dell and Gateway and so on, and then no more.

就是这样。就是这样。但是由于这其中的一点小差异，整个半导体技术都在努力解决这个问题。你每年都会购买越来越新的电脑。结果就是这个小东西，叫做延迟，反相器延迟。这是因为我们到目前为止还没有向您展示过的一个特定元素。

That’s it. This is it. But because of this a little itty bitty difference here the entire semiconductor technology is charging along trying to do something about that. You buy newer and newer computers each year. It turns out this little itty bitty thing here, that is called the delay, the inverter delay. And it happens because of a specific element that has been introduced here that we have not shown you so far.

半导体行业和后续课程、设计等的很大一部分都集中在如何使延迟更小，如何才能越来越快？这关系到我们能为 Pentium IV 提供多快的时钟速度。还记得它一直达到 1.3 千兆赫吗？

And a large part of the semiconductor industry and follow on courses and design and so on focuses on how could I make my delay smaller, how can I get to be faster and faster and faster? This relates to how fast we can clock your Pentium IV. Remember it came all the way to 1.3 gigahertz?

小小的

Itty Bitty

现在能买到的最快奔腾是什么？最快的 P4 是什么？哦，3.2 出来了？我不知道。

What’s the fasted Pentium money can buy today? What is the fastest P4? Oh, 3.2 have come out? I don’t know.

Ken 声称是 3.2。但是，没错，就是 3.2 千兆赫。这一切都与这个小小的东西有关。你们第一次在这里看到它。当你们中的一些人成为英特尔等公司的首席技术官时，请记住，这一切都始于 10 月 16 日，从这个小小的东西开始。你们现在要学习的是一些非常酷的东西，它们对生活有着巨大的影响。那么为什么会发生这种情况呢？

Ken claims 3.2. But, yeah, there you go, 3.2 gigahertz. It all has to do with this little itty bitty thing. You saw it for the first time here. When some of you become CTOs at Intel and so on, just remember that it all began on October 16th with this little rinky dink thing here. What you are going to learn now is some really cool stuff that has huge implications for life. So why does that happen?

为什么这种转变发生得稍晚一些？原因是，记住，当这个波形达到 VT（这个 MOSFET 的阈值电压）时，这个东西就会切换，对吧？因此，由于电压上升较慢，VT 会在一小段时间后到达。所以我会稍晚一点到达 VT。

Why did this transition happen just a little bit later? The reason is that remember when this wave form reaches VT, the threshold voltage of this MOSFET, this guy is going to switch, right? So because of the slower rise of the voltage, the VT is going to be reached a small amount of time later. So I am going to hit VT slightly later.

因此，这个家伙的转换会稍微晚一点，因为这个中间波形 B 比较慢。它到达 VT 的时间比它进行瞬时转换的时间稍晚一点。因此，我的输出会稍微晚一点下降，这会导致逆变器的延迟。如果你愿意，我们可以称之为 d，一些延迟。

And because of that this guy is going to transition just a bit later because this intermediate wave form B is slower. It hits VT just a little bit later than if it would have made an instantaneous transition. And therefore my output falls just a little bit later and this gives rise to my delay in the inverter. We can call that d if you would like, some delay.

在您的课程笔记中，第 9 章和第 10 章涵盖了这些内容。这在某种程度上激励了我们为什么要做我们将要做的所有事情。不要让任何人靠近它，即使是无意中。我是认真的。它是相当致命的东西。今天我们将讨论电容器。

In your course notes, this material is covered in Chapters 9 and 10. That was to kind of motivate why we are going to be doing all that you we will be doing. Don’t anybody come within a foot of this even by mistake. I mean it. It is pretty deadly stuff. Today we will talk about the capacitor.

在接下来的几节课中，我将把所有这些结合起来，向你们展示这两者之间的关系。我将向你们展示延迟是如何发生的。你们可以根据接下来几节课中学习的一些简单原理来计算它。我首先要向你们展示的是，我认为延迟的发生是因为某个地方有一个电容器。

And in the next couple of lectures I am going to tie it all together and show you how this relates to that. I will show you exactly how the delay happens. You can compute it based on some simple principles that you will learn about in the next couple of lectures. What I am going to do is first of all show you, I claim that delay happens because of the presence of a capacitor somewhere in there.

我现在要做的是带您仔细观察，仔细观察 MOSFET 并向您展示电容器的位置。这是您迄今为止看到的 MOSFET，漏极、栅极和源极。

What I will do now is take you into a closer look, take a closer look at the MOSFET and show you were the capacitor is. This is the MOSFET that you have seen so far, drain, gate and source.

场效应晶体管

MOSFET

这叫做 n 通道 MOSFET。我要做的就是剖析它，并向你们展示实际发生的情况，以及它在硅片上的样子。这是我的硅片。

This is called an n channel MOSFET. And what I am going to do is dissect this and show you what is actually happening, what this looks like on silicon. So here is my slab of silicon.

它非常薄。就这么说吧，我不会在这里详细介绍。您将在未来的设备类别（如 301 等）中学到更多关于它的知识，但我只想在这里介绍它，让您了解电容器的位置。这是 p 型硅。构建 MOSFET 的方法是创建几个槽，在其中掺杂成 n 型。

It is very thin. And let’s say this is, I won’t go into details here. You will learn a lot more about this in future device classes like 301 and so on, but suffice it to say I will just introduce it here to give you a sense of where the capacitor is. This is p type silicon. And the way you build a MOSFET is you create a couple of tubs in which you dope to be n type.

基本的硅是掺杂的 p 型。而这个是 n 型。你要做的是，在它上面放一层薄薄的氧化层，然后在它上面放一层薄薄的金属层。这是金属层。这是一层薄薄的氧化物，二氧化硅。这是我的 P 基板。现在，这是一层小金属层，实际上是硅上面的一根线。

The basic silicon is dope p type. And this guy here is n type. And what you do is a thin oxide layer is placed on top of that and then on top of that a thin metal layer. This is a metal layer. This is a thin piece of oxide, silicon dioxide. And this is my P substrate. Now this is a little metal layer that is really a wire on top of the silicone.

这个金属层可能是某种在硅表面蜿蜒曲折的导线。这是连接到栅极的导线。这是我的 MOSFET 的栅极。这家伙是漏极。这家伙是源极。这是我的栅极。所以这里有一小块金属。这是这块金属。

This metal layer could be some sort of a wire that meanders around on the surface of silicone. And this is a wire that connects to the gate. This is the gate of my MOSFET. And this guy here is the drain. And this guy here is the source. And this is my gate. So there is a little piece of metal here. This is this piece of metal here.

这里有一片氧化物，然后是硅衬底。注意，这是我的氧化物。当我相对于衬底向这里的栅极施加正电压时，就会产生负电荷。我把电子拉到这个通道区域，这里有相应的正型，这样我就能看到看起来像两块板的视图。

And there is a piece of oxide and then my silicone substrate. Notice that this is my oxide. When I apply a positive voltage to the gate here with respect to the substrate, what happens is that I draw up negative charges. I draw up electrons here into this channel region and I have corresponding plus type out here so that I get a view here that looks like a couple of plates.

最后，中间出现了氧化物。没有连接。两块极板相隔一小段距离，极板上有正 q 和负 q。因此，最终发生的事情是，这块极板的行为就像一个电容器。因此，电容器有两块极板，中间有一层薄绝缘材料，介电常数为 epsilon。所以我在这里得到了一小块电容器。

And I end up with an oxide in the middle. There is no connection. Two plates separated by a small distance with plus q and minus q on the plates. And, because of that, what ends up happening here is that this piece behaves like a capacitor. So a capacitor has two plates with a thin insulating material in the middle with some permittivity epsilon. And so I get a little piece of a capacitor here.

这就是正在形成的电容器。我并没有打算制造那个电容器，但无论如何，电容器还是存在的。因此，当我在栅极施加正电压时，负电子会被拉到这里，从而形成通道，然后电流就可以流动了。这就是 MOSFET 导通的方式。因此，n 型电子回到 n 型，我在这里得到电子流，这就形成了通道。

That is the capacitor that is forming. I did not set out to build that capacitor, but there is a capacitor nonetheless. So when I apply a positive voltage at the gate, negative electrons are pulled up here which forms a channel, and then a current can then flow. And that is how the MOSFET turns on. So n type electrons back to n type, and I get electron flow here and that gives me my channel.

这只是四分钟或更短时间内的设备。如果你愿意，你可以完成整个课程，如果你参加 301。我们所做的是能够捕捉我们刚刚看到的行为，有趣的延迟行为，我们必须增强我们的模型。我们必须引入一个新元素。

This is just kind of devices in four minutes or less. You will do an entire course on this, if you like, if you take 301. What we do is to be able to capture the behavior that we just saw, the funny delayed behavior, we have to augment our model. We have to introduce a new element.

MOSFET 模型

MOSFET Model

所以我们要做的就是 MOSFET、栅极、漏极和源极。

So what we do is here is a MOSFET, gate, drain and source.

请注意，我们在这里通过在栅极和源极之间放置一个小电容器 CGS 来建模。因此，这成为我们的 MOSFET 器件的简单模型，它是过去的老式栅极漏极源极器件，带有一个小电容器 CGS，其 CGS 值可能在 10 的负 14 次方法左右。因此，这是我们在此制造的器件中产生的一个小电容器。

And notice here we model this by putting a little capacitor, CGS between our gate and the source. So this becomes a simple model for our MOSFET device which is the good old gate drain source device from the past with a little capacitor CGS having some value for CGS in maybe ten to the minus 14 or thereabouts farads. So that is a little capacitor that has come about in this device that we fabricated here.

正是这个电容器位于节点 B 和地之间，因为它位于第二个反相器的栅极和源极之间。正是这个电容器在进行我们所看到的游戏。

It is that capacitor that is at between node B and ground because it is between the gate and the source of the second inverter. And it is that capacitor that is playing the games that we saw out there.

线性电容器

Linear Capacitor

让我们来看看理想线性电容器的一些行为。正如我所说，电容器有几块极板。有几块极板。极板之间是一些介电常数，介电常数 epsilon。

So let’s look at some of the behavior of an ideal linear capacitor. A capacitor, as I said, has a couple of plates. There are a couple of plates. Between the plates is some dieletric, permittivity epsilon.

假设板的面积为 A，假设板之间的距离为 D。我在这里得到一些电荷，假设为 q。因此电容器上的 q 和负 q。电容 C 由 epsilon A 除以 D 得出。正如我所说，Epsilon 是电介质的生产率。因此，如果它是自由空间，那么它将是 epsilon 零，即自由空间的介电常数。

Let’s say the area of the plates is A, and let’s say the plates are separated by a distance D. I get some charge here, let’s say q. So q and minus q on the capacitor. And the capacitance C is given by epsilon A divided by D. Epsilon, as I said, is the productivity of the dielectric. So if it is free space then it would be epsilon zero which is the permittivity of free space.

这是法拉电容。符号如下。电容 C。电压 v。电流 i。因此，这很像电阻器、电压源等，现在它成为工具箱中电压源等元素的原始元素。电容，两端的电压为 v，电流为 i。我已根据关联变量规则在此处分配了关联变量。

That is the capacitance in farads. And the symbol looks like this. Capacitor C. Voltage v. Current i. So this, much like the resistor, voltage source and so on, this now becomes a primitive element in your tool chest of elements like the voltage source and so onn. Capacitance with the voltage v across it and a current i. And I have assigned the associated variables here according to the associated variable discipline.

我们要问自己的一个问题是，还记得我们说过我们现在都处于大自然的游乐场中，在这个游乐场中，集中物质理论成立吗？还记得我们说过，要使集中物质理论成立，我们必须做出几个假设。其中一个假设是，所有元素的 dq/dt 应始终为零。那么现在电容器怎么样？

A question to ask ourselves is remember we said we are all now in a playground from all of nature, in this playground where the lumped matter discipline holds? And also remember that we said that for the lumped matter discipline to hold we have to make a couple of assumptions. One of those assumptions was that dq/dt, for all their elements should be zero for all time. So right now what about the capacitor?

它有一些电荷 q。所以电荷一定是以某种方式积累起来的。这是否意味着我一直在撒谎，我们已经不再在这个游乐场了，我们已经因为电容器而被逐出游乐场了，或者我们仍然在电路游乐场中，在这个游乐场中，集中物质定律成立，一切好事都会发生等等？这似乎是一个矛盾，不是吗？

It has got some charge q. So charge must have built up somehow. Does that mean that I lied all along, that we are no longer in this playground, that we have been ejected from the playground because of the capacitor, or are we still in the circuits playground in which the lumped matter discipline holds and all good things happen and so on? It seems like a contradiction, doesn’t it?

我把你从麦克斯韦的操场带到了 EECS 操场，在那里我说集中物质学科是成立的。LMD 的基础之一是，在我们要处理的元素中，dq/dt 应该始终为零。现在，课程还没开始四周，Agarwal 就引入了一个元素，里面有 q。

I took you from Maxwell’s playgrounds to the EECS playground where I said the lumped matter discipline holds. And one of the foundations of the LMD was that dq/dt should be zero for all time inside the elements that we are going to deal with. And right now boom, it’s not four weeks into the course and Agarwal introduces an element and it has q in it.

事实证明，电容器也遵循集总物质定律。请记住，该定律规定，dq/dt 在元件内的所有时间都为零。所以我要聪明一点。我要做的是，我想以一种非常巧妙的方式选择元件边界。请注意，如果我在这块板上有 q，那么我在另一个板上会得到负 q。

It turns out that the capacitor also adheres to the lumped matter discipline. Remember the discipline says that dq/dt is zero for all time within elements. So I am going to be clever. What I am going to do is I want to choose element boundaries in a very cleaver way. Notice that if I have q here on this plate then I get minus q on the other plate.

因此，如果我将整个元件作为一个整体，如果我在封装边界方面非常谨慎，如果我将两个板都放在元件边界内，那么净电荷仍然为零。因此，只要我确保我的元件具有两个板，dq/dt 确实始终为零。

So if I take the whole element, the element as a whole, if I am careful in terms of how I package my boundaries, if I put both my plates inside my element boundary then I still do get the net charge being zero. So dq/dt is indeed zero for all time provided I make sure that my element has both the plates.

因此，如果你遇到其他人给你一个元素，说“我有一个想法”。让我们创建一个新的电气工程分支，在这个分支中，我们将电容器建模为两个板的一个元素，而不是一个元素，而是通过组合两个新元素（两个称为 G1 和 G2 的垃圾元素）来构建一个电容器。G1 就像顶板。G2 是底板。我把它们放在一起，就得到了一个电容器。

Therefore, if you come across somebody else that gives you an element that says I have an idea. Let’s create a new branch of electrical engineering in which we model the capacitor not as one element for two plates, but let’s build a capacitor by combining two new elements, two garbage elements called G1 and G2. G1 is like the top plate. G2 is the bottom plate. I put them together and I get a capacitor.

但请注意，如果我只选择一个板，那么元素 G1 将不会粘附到 LMD。它之所以粘附到 LMD，是因为我选择元素边界的方式是两个板都位于其中。所以这是非常基本和关键的。你可以在课程笔记中阅读更多相关内容。我特意强调这个简单的观点，因为我认为它是基础和重要的。

But notice if I just pick one plate then the element G1 will not adhere to the LMD. It adheres to the LMD because I choose my element boundaries in a way that both plates come within it. So it is very fundamental and key. And you can read a lot more about it in the course notes. I purposely dwelt on that simple point because I think it is foundational and important.

你确实需要明白，电容器确实满足 LMD。我们仍然在美好的旧游乐场。

And you really need to understand that the capacitor does satisfy LMD. We are still in the good old playground.

简单事实

Simple Facts

这里有几个简单的事实。这些都在笔记里。我相信你以前也见过。我可以将电荷与电容和电压联系起来，因为 q 等于 Cv。q 的单位是库仑，这个的单位是法拉，这个的单位是伏特。

A few simple facts here. These are in the notes. And you have also seen this before, I am sure. I can relate the charge to the capacitance and the voltage as q is equal to Cv. And q is in coulombs, this is in farads and this is in volts.

因此，电容器上存储了一些电荷 q，以库仑为单位，q 等于 Cv。因此，我可以将其对时间求导以获得电流，结果为 i=dq/dt。因此，任何给定时间的电流都是 dq/dt。因此，我在这里用 Cv 代替 q。这就是我得到的。因此，电流 i=d(Cv)/dt。6.002 假设，电容通常可以随时间变化。

So there is some charge q stored on the capacitor and it is in coulombs and q is equal to Cv. So I can differentiate this with respect to time to get the current, and that becomes i=dq/dt. So the current at any given time is dq/dt. And so I substitute for q in terms of Cv here. That is what I get. So the current i=d(Cv)/dt. A 6.002 assumption, capacitance in general can be time varying.

我可以得到随时间变化的电容器。事实上，有些传感器是电容式的。当我说话时，我的声波可以改变电容器顶板上的压力。移动电容器的顶板，从而通过移动板来改变电容。记住，当板移动得更近时，我会得到更高的电容。所以除非明确说明，否则我们不会处理随时间变化的电容。

I can get time varying capacitors. In fact, there are some sensors which are capacitive. And, as I talk, my sound waves can change the pressure on the top plate of the capacitor. And move the top plate of the capacitor, thereby changing the capacitance by moving the plate. Remember d here, as the plate moves closer I get a higher capacitance. So we won’t be dealing, unless explicitly said so, with time varying capacitances.

因此，我们可以做的是 6.002 允许我们写入 Cdv/dt。所以我的电流源电容器是 Cdv/dt。我还可以写下能量，电容器储存能量。E=1/2Cv^2。我相信你以前在物理学等课上见过这些。如果电容器中含有电荷 q，这就是电容器中储存的能量。让我为你做个小演示。他们不再像以前那样制造眼镜了。

So what we can do is 6.002 allows us to write Cdv/dt. So my current source capacitor is Cdv/dt. I can also write down the energy, capacitors store energy. E=1/2Cv^2. I am sure you have seen all this before in physics and so on. That is the amount of energy stored in the capacitor if it is holding a charge q. Let me do a little demonstration for you. They don’t make glasses like they used to.

电容游戏

Capacitor Game

我们的朋友 Lorenzo 给这个电容器充电了。这是一个巨大的电容器。它是一个 250 伏的电容器，所以很脏。他给它充电并把它放在那里。为了向你展示它确实含有储存的电荷，它一直放在那里保持电荷。也许第一排应该往后退，退后一秒钟。我想你们会很安全，但我不想冒任何风险。

Our friend Lorenzo has charged up this capacitor. It is a huge capacitor. It is a 250 volt capacitor so it is nasty. He has charged it up and has kept it there. And to show you that it does contain stored charges it has been sitting there holding charge. Maybe the first row should go backwards, just step back for a second. I think you guys would be safe but I just don’t want to take any chances.

它储存了大量电荷。它就在那里。如果我短路端子，它应该会说，哦，我有一条路，让我把电荷释放出来。好的。让我们开始吧。这对我来说总是一个可怕的时刻。在做这件事之前，我会祈祷一下。好吗？好的。天哪，你们一定很想看到我被炸了，对吧？好的。让我们看看。所以它确实含有电荷。

This is holding a bunch of charge. It is kind of sitting there. If I short the terminals it should try to say oh, I’ve got a path, let me get my charge out. All right. Let’s do it. This is always a scary moment for me. And I say a little prayer before I do this. Good? OK. Gee, you guys would love to see me getting fried, huh? All right. Let’s see. So it did contain charge.

所以 Lorenzo 在短路时会将一只手放在口袋里是有原因的，因为人们自然会用双手握住电线，然后啦啦啦啦啦，将其放在电容器上。这样做可以保证你只用一只手触摸它。希望你们能永远记住，电容器可以放置一段时间并保持其电荷。

So there is a reason why Lorenzo puts one hand inside his pocket when he shorts it, because there is a natural tendency to hold the wire with both hands, and la, la, la, la, la and put it across the capacitor. By doing this you are guaranteed that you will just be touching it with one hand. Hopefully you folks will remember for life that a capacitor can sit around and hold its charge for a while.

好了。玩够了。让我们继续做电路的搭建工作。我要做的是，正如我向你们承诺的那样，我将在下一节课进行到一半时完成该示例的循环。

All right. That is enough of fun and games. Let’s get on with our business of building circuits. What I am going to do is, as I promised you, I am going to close the loop on that example by halfway through the next lecture.

我将带您了解一下电容器和电阻器，并进行一些分析，然后我们将在下一节课的中间部分为您结束。接下来我想介绍一个新元素。让我们用这些元素做一些有趣的事情。好吧，您了解电压源，了解电阻器，让我们将它们放在一起，看看它们的行为。

I’m going take you on a bit of a journey involving capacitors and resistors and involving some analysis, and then we will close it all up for you at about the middle of next lecture. What I would like to do next is here is a new element. And let’s do some fun stuff with elements. Well, you know about voltage sources, you know about resistors, let’s put them together and see how they behave.

这里我们假设有一个电容 C、vc(t) 和一些电流 i。一般来说，每当我遇到新东西或奇怪的东西时，比如说一个电容或其他设备，我都会这样做。如果它只包含电阻、电压和线性元件作为戴维南等效元件，那么对后面的其余电路进行建模是很有趣的。让我来做这件事。这是 R，这是 vi。

Let’s have a capacitor here, C, vc(t) and some current i. What I am going to do, in general, whenever I have something new or something strange, let’s say like a capacitor or some other device. It is interesting to model the rest of the circuit behind it if it contains only resistors and voltages and linear elements as a Thevenin equivalent. So let me do that. This is R and this is vi.

后面的东西是我的标准模式，电压源与电阻串联，我将其连接到电容器上。但请记住，尽管您看到了那些有趣的波形等等，但电容器是线性设备。因为您可以从这里看到电流与 dv/dt 相关。这是一个线性操作。您看不到 V 平方和 Vis 之类的东西。它是一个线性设备。

This stuff in the back is my standard pattern, voltage source in series with a resistor, and I connect that across my capacitor. But remember, although you saw those funny wave forms and so on, the capacitor is a linear device. Because you can see from here that the current relates to dv/dt. That is a linear operation. You don’t see V squareds and Vis and things like that in there. It’s is a linear device.

让我们回到我们值得信赖的老方法，即节点法。如果您只是盲目地应用节点法并简单地进行大量数学运算，您应该能够得到答案，即对于某个电压 v 或某种形式的电压 vi，我应该能够找出 vc 是什么样子。所以让我们这样做。这是这里感兴趣的节点，具有未知的节点电压 vc。

Let’s go back to our trusty old method, the node method. If you just blindly apply the node method and simply grunge through a bunch of math, you should be able to get to the answer, that is for some voltage v or some form of voltage vi, I should be able to figure out what vc looks like. So let’s do that. This is the node that is of interest here with the unknown node voltage vc.

因此，让我应用节点方法。(vc vi)/R 是流向这个方向的电流。该值加上流过电容器的电流应等于零。流过电容器的电流是多少？节点方法告诉我，根据元件值获取电流。我们知道电流由 CdvC/dt.=O 给出。只需稍微调整一下，我就可以写出 RC dvc/dt+vc=vi。

So let me apply the node method. (vc vi)/R is the current going this way. That plus the current through the capacitor should equal zero. And what is the current through the capacitor? The node method tells me that, get the current in terms of the element values. We know that the current is given by CdvC/dt.=O. Just shuffling things around a little bit, I can write RC dvc/dt+vc=vi.

我们正在编写节点方程，然后得到表征这个小电路的方程。请注意，这里的单位是伏特。由于这里有时间，所以它也必须有时间单位。让我们开始解决这个小电路并了解它的行为方式。我们将要看的具体示例如下所示。假设时间 T=0 时的电容器电压为 V0。这是给定的。

We are writing the node equation and then getting the equation that characterizes this little circuit. Notice here that this has units of volts. And since I have time here, this also must have units of time. Let’s go about solving this little circuit and understanding how it behaves. The specific example that we will look at looks like this. Let’s say the capacitor voltage at time T=0 is V0. This is given.

因此，在时间 T=0 时，我告诉你电容器包含电荷。因此，电容器两端的电压为 V0。该电容器两端的电压为 250 伏，而我们今天在笔记本电脑等中使用的大多数设备（如 Pentium IV）的电压都在 1.5 伏左右，非常小。因此，这就是电容器中的值，即电压。这被称为状态。

So at time T=0, I am telling you that the capacitor contains a charge. And because of that there is a voltage V0 across it. That capacitor had a voltage of 250 volts across it and most of the devices we deal with in laptops and so on today, like the Pentium IV, voltages are on the order of 1.5 volts, very small voltages. So that is the value in the capacitor, the voltage. That is called a state.

这称为状态，电容器状态。它是电容器的状态。我还告诉你 vi(t)=VI。所以我的电压是 VI。不知何故，我没有告诉你如何做到，但不知何故它安排在时间 T=0 时电容器电压为 V0。现在我想看看 t 大于或等于零时的解决方案。

This is called the state, capacitor state. It is the state of the capacitor. And I also give you that vi(t)=VI. So my voltage is VI. And somehow, I am not telling you how, but some how it arranged to have the capacitor voltage be V0 at time T=0. Now I want to look to the solution to this for t greater than or equal to zero.

此时，我的电压 vi 为某个大写 VI，某个直流电压 VI。因此，我将根据这两个值求解微分方程 RC dvc/dt+vc=vi。输入是直流电压 VI，VC0 是 V0，即电容器中的初始电荷。因此，从现在开始直到讲座快要结束，都将通过求解这个非常简单的一阶微分方程来进行数学运算。

And in that time my voltage vi is at some capital VI, some DC voltage VI. So I am going to solve the differential equation RC dvc/dt+vc=vi given these two values. Input is DC voltage VI and VC0 is V0, the initial charge in the capacitor. So from now until almost to the end of the lecture, it is just going to be math by solving this very simple first order differential equation.

这里的关键是，在整个 6.002 课中，我们将遵循一种方法来解决这些问题。解决微分方程的方法有很多，我们将遵循一种方法。这种方法称为齐次特解法。我相信，在 1802 课中，您可能已经学过这种方法，当然还有其他方法。您可以使用任何方法来解决它。我们将只坚持一种方法。

And the key here will be that throughout 6.002 we will be following one method to solve these. There are many methods to solving differential equations, and we will follow one method. That method is called the method of homogenous and particular solutions. In 1802, I believe, you would have learned maybe this, and certainly other methods. You can use any method to solve it. We will just stick to one method.

课程笔记中也用到了这个方法。在这个方法中，我们通过找到另外两个部分来得到 VC 解。一个部分称为齐次解。然后将其与特定解相加。这就是总解。所以总解是齐次解和特定解的总和。这个方法有三个步骤。

And this is also used in the course notes. In this method what we do is take the solution VC by finding two other components. One is called the homogenous solution. And summing that up with the particular solution. And that is the total solution. So total solution is the sum of the homogenous and the particular solutions. And the method has three steps.

正如我之前所说，我们将在本课程中反复使用这种方法来处理遇到的每个微分方程。而且你不会遇到很多。第一步我们找到特定的解决方案。第二步，找到齐次解。总解是两者的总和。然后找到根据你的方程会有一些未知常数。

As I said before, we will be using this method again and again with every differential equation that we encounter in this course. And you won’t encounter a while lot. The first step we find the particular solution. The second step, find the homogenous solution. The total solution is the sum of the two. And then find There will be some unknown constants depending on the equation that you have.

最后，我们只需应用已有的初始条件即可找到未知常数。嘣，嘣，嘣。特定。同质。找到常数。三件事。所以让我们开始求解这个方程并应用这三个条件。再次记住，接下来的 10 分钟或 15 分钟我要做的是使用你所知道的数学知识来简单地求解这个一阶微分方程。

And in the end we simply find the unknown constants by applying the initial conditions that we have. Boom, boom, boom. Particular. Homogenous. Find constants. Three things. So let’s go about solving this equation and apply those three conditions. Again, remember, what I am doing now for the next 10 minutes or 15 minutes is using math that you know about to simply solve this first order of differential equations.

我在这里要讲的其实没什么新东西。一个是找到特定的解决方案 vCP，然后将其添加到 vCH 中以获得解决方案。因此，找到 vCP 的方法是找到任何满足这个方程的解。这是方程。你找到任何满足它的解。然后找到金钱可以买到的最简单的解决方案。找到它。这就是特定的解决方案。

There is nothing really new that I am going to talk about here. One is to find the particular solution vCP, which will then be added into the vCH to get me the solution. So the way you find the vCP is you find any solution that satisfies this equation. This is the equation. You find any solution that satisfies it. And find the simplest possible solution that money can buy. Find it. That’s the particular solution.

任何解决方案都可以。在这种情况下，一个非常简单的解决方案是 vCP 等于 VI。让我们看看常数是否有效。在微分方程中，你会意识到的一件事是，它们实际上比看起来要简单得多。原因是几乎每次你都必须假设你知道答案，然后你就会检查你假设的是否正确。

Any solution is fine. In this case, a really simple one would be vCP equals VI. Let’s see if a constant works. One thing you will realize in differential equations is that they are actually much simpler than they seem. And the reason is that almost every time you have to assume you know the answer, and then you are checking to see what you assumed was correct.

假设答案是这样的，就像你真的很聪明一样，然后检查一下，然后说哦，是的，那一定是答案。所以在这里我们假设我认为 VI 会起作用，所以让我们试试看。在这里代入。RC dvc/dt 为 0。vi 是一个常数。所以我得到 vi 等于 vi，因此这是一个特定的解决方案。完成。我在这里代入 vi。所以 dvi/dt=0。这消失了，vi=VI。Bingo。

Assume the answer is this like you are really smart, and then check it out and say oh, yeah, that must have been the answer. So here we assume that I think VI is going to work so let’s try it out. Substituting in here. RC dvc/dt is 0. vi is a constant. So I get vi equals vi, so therefore this is a particular solution. Done. I substitute vi here. So dvi/dt=0. This vanishes and vi=VI. Bingo.

因此，VI 是这个方程的一个解。所以我完成了 vCP。一般来说，你要做的就是反复试验。通过反复试验，尝试一堆解决方案，直到你幸运为止。一般来说，对于许多激励，在 6.002 中，一个简单的常数通常就足够了。我们的第二步是找到均匀解。我们也可以很快做到这一点。

Therefore, VI is a solution to this equation. So I am done with my vCP. And in general what you have to do is use trial and error. By trial and error try out a bunch of solutions until you get lucky. In general, again, in all of 6.002 for many of the excitations a simple constant usually suffices. Our second step is to find the homogenous solution. And we can also do that very quickly.

要做到这一点，我们必须找到齐次方程的通解。齐次方程是相同的微分方程，但驱动设置为零。我们希望遵循既定模式来求解这里的微分方程，而既定模式是找到 vCP、vCH，找到常数。为了找到 vCH，我们也将遵循既定模式来找到齐次解。

And to do that we have to find a general solution to the homogenous equation. The homogenous equation is the same differential equation but with the drive set to zero. We want to follow a set pattern to solve the differential equations here, and the set pattern is find vCP, vCH, find constants. And to find vCH we are also going to follow a set pattern to find the homogenous solution.

因此我们将驱动器设置为零，因此 vi 设置为零。我需要找到一个通用解决方案。正如我之前承诺的那样，微分方程非常非常简单，因为我们要解决它们的方法是假设我们知道答案，然后去检查它。所以让我们试试 Ae^st。

So we set the drive to zero, so vi is set to be zero. And I need to find a general solution to this. As I promised earlier, diff equations are really, really simple because the way we are going to solve them is we are going to assume we know the answer and then go check it. So let’s try Ae^st.

让我们尝试看看这是否能解出这个特定方程的 A 和 S 值。我告诉你，解将采用这种形式。假设它。然后继续找到 A 和 S，并通过将其代回方程并找出相应的 As 和 Ss 来做到这一点。让我们继续这样做。我得到了 RC。

Let’s try and see if this can solve this particular equation for some values of A and S. I am telling you that the solution is going to be of this form. Assume it. And then simply go ahead and find me A and S, and do that by substituting it back into the equation and find out the corresponding As and Ss. So let’s go ahead and do that. I get RC.

我将其代入，得到 dAe (st)/dt+Ae st=0。让我将其代入，看看结果如何。我得到 RCAse st+Ae st=0。我想放弃 A 为 0 的平凡解。这是一个平凡解，所以我将放弃它。我要做的是从这里取消 A，假设 A 不为零，并取消这里的 e^st。

I substitute this back up so I get dAe(st)/dt+Aest=0. And let me plug that in and see what comes. I get RCAsest+Aest=0. I want to discard the trivial solution of A being 0. That is a trivial solution so I will discard that. And what I will do is cancel out the As from here, assuming A is not zero, and cancel e^st here.

剩下的就是 RCs+1=0。这句话的意思是，如果我能找到一个 S，使得这个为真，那么 Aest 就是我的齐次方程的通解。这很容易。所以 S= 1/RC。如果我选​​择 S 为 1/RC，那么我所进行的简单数学运算表明这一定是齐次方程的解。或者换句话说，vCH=Ae^( t/RC)。

And what is left is RCs+1=0. What this is saying is that if I can find an S such that this is true then Aest is a general solution to my homogenous equation. This is easy enough. And so S= 1/RC. If I choose my S to be 1/RC then the simple math that I have gone through shows me that this must be the solution to the homogenous equation. Or in other words vCH=Ae^( t/RC).

所有这些都表明 Ae^( t/RC) 是我的齐次方程的解。A 是一个未知常数。A 是某个常数。我还不知道它是什么。注意 RC 又出现了。RC 的妙处在于，这是时间，也有时间单位。我们通常将 RC 表示为某个时间常数 tau，作为时间单位。与该电路相关的是时间常数 tau，即 RC。

All this is saying is that Ae^( t/RC) is a solution to my homogenous equation. A is an unknown constant. A is some constant. I don’t know what that is yet. Notice RC has popped up again. And the cool thing about RC is that, this is time, this also has units of time. We commonly represent RC as some time constant tau, as units of time. Associated with that circuit is the time constant tau, which is simply RC.

我通常将其写为 Ae^(t/tau)。我在这里结束了。我在这里得到了特定解决方案。我在那里得到了均匀解决方案。我需要告诉你一些其他事情。我找到均匀解决方案的方法分为四个步骤。我假设了一个形式为 Ae^st 的解。我在 S 中创建了这个方程。这被称为该电路的特征方程。

I commonly write this as Ae^( t/tau). I am very the end here. I have the particular solution here. I have got the homogenous solution there. I need to tell you about something else. The way I found the homogenous solution was in four steps. I assumed a solution of the form Ae^st. I created this equation here in S. This is called the characteristic equation for that circuit.

对于 RC 和其他形式的电路，我们会一次又一次地看到这一点。假设这种形式的解。构造特征方程。找到特征方程的根。在这种情况下，它是 S 中的一个方程。所以这是根。然后根据该根形成解。四个步骤。Ae^st，特征方程，根，然后写下一般齐次解。

We will see this time and time again for RC and other forms of circuits. Assume a solution of this form. Construct the characteristic equation. Find the roots of the characteristic equation. In this case it is an equation in S. So this is the root. And then form the solution based on that root. Four steps. Ae^st, characteristic equation, root and then write down the general homogenous solution.

整体解决方案

Total Solution

那里有四个台阶。

Four steps there.

最后，我想写下总解。总解就是 vCP+vCH。vCP 是 VI，vCH 是 Ae^(t/tau)。tau 就是 RC。这就是我的解决方案。现在，记住最后一步。最后一步是形成总解并找出剩余的常数。使用我的初始条件找出剩余的常数。在 t=0 时，我知道 vC=V0。我知道。

And finally I want to write down the total solution. And the total solution is simply vCP+vCH. And vCP was VI and vCH was Ae^( t/tau). tau was simply RC. That is my solution. Now, remember the last step. The last step was form the total solution and find out the remaining constants. Find out the remaining constants by using my initial conditions. At t=0, I know that vC=V0. I know that.

因此我可以用 t=0 代入常数。所以我知道 VO=VI+A。t=0，这个东西就变成 1，所以我得到了这个等式，从中我得到了 A=V0 Vi。换句话说，我的解 vC 就是 VI+(VO VI) e^( t/tau)。所以最后 15 分钟只是数学。

And so therefore I can substitute t=0 to find the constant. So I know that VO=VI+A. t=0, this thing becomes 1, and so I get this equation from which I get A=V0 Vi. In other words, my solution vC is simply VI+(VO VI) e^( t/tau). So the last 15 minutes have just been math.

这里没有电气工程，但电气工程止步于你写下这个微分方程、经过大量数学运算并得出解决方案的那一刻。纯粹的数学。所以在这里我只是用数学来给你解决方案。而且，正如我在整个课程中向你承诺的那样，在下一讲中，我将为你提供一种直观的 EE 方法来做到这一点。真正的电气工程师、真正的 EECS 人员不会这样做。

No electrical engineering here, but electrical engineering stopped at the point where you wrote this differential equation down, went through a bunch of math and came up with a solution. Purely mathematically. So here I simply used math to get you the solution. And, as I have been promising you throughout this course, in the next lecture I will give you an intuitive EE method of doing it. Real electrical engineers, real EECS folks don’t do it this way.

真正的 EECS 人员会凭直觉做到这一点。我将在下一讲中向您展示如何在四秒钟内轻松做到这一点。但您需要了解其产生的原因，这就是答案。您还可以获得电流 iC，即 Cdvc/dt。我不会为您做到这一点，但您可以简单地对其进行微分并得到电流。所以我可以为您绘制 vC、时间 t、vC。

Real EECS folks do it intuitively. And I will show you how to do it in four easy seconds in the next lecture. But you need to understand the foundations of how this comes about, and so this is the answer. You can also get the current iC is simply Cdvc/dt. I won’t do that for you, but you can simply differentiate it and get the current. So I can plot for you vC, time t, vC.

直观的观察方法是，我有 VI，它是电压的最终值。当 t 为无穷大时，这部分变为零，因此 vC 就是 VI。

The intuitive way of looking at this is I have VI which is the final value of the voltage. When t is infinity this part goes to zero so the vC is simply VI.

然后有一个分量 V0 VI 会根据这个衰减，从初始值 V0 开始。注意，当 t 为零时，vC 为 V0，您可以在方程中看到这一点，因此它从 V0 开始，最终到达 VI。我从这里开始，最终到达这里。V0 VI 这一部分会随着时间的推移衰减，如下所示。这种衰减由 RC 时间常数或 tau 控制。

And then there is a component V0 VI which decays according to this starting out at an initial value of V0. Notice when t is zero vC is V0, you can see that in the equation, and so it starts out at V0 and ends up at VI. I start here, I end up here. And this portion V0 VI decays out over time like this. And this decay is governed by the RC time constant or tau.

我将快速向您展示几个波形示例，一个波形如下，另一个波形如下。这是当我从某个值 V0 开始并且不应用任何输入时，它应该衰减到零，t、t、vC、vC。如果我将 VI 设为零，那么随着时间的推移，它应该会衰减到零。

I am going to show you very quickly a couple of examples of wave forms, one that goes like this and one that looks like this. This is when I start with some value V0 and I don’t apply any input, it should decay down to zero, t, t, vC, vC. If I apply zero for VI then this should simply decay down to nothing over time.

如果我应用了一些 VI，但电容器中没有状态，那么相同的方程将如下所示。您可以自己去确认，当我应用一些输入但电容器处于零状态时，我从零开始，最后以 VI 结束，我的波形如下所示。就是这样。这是第一个。

And if I apply some VI but there is no state in the capacitor then that same equation is going to look like this. You can go and confirm for yourselves that when I apply some input but the capacitor has zero state, I start at zero, I finish up at VI and my wave form looks like this. There you go. That’s the first one.

第二个例子中，我在电容器上施加了 5 伏电压，但没有输入。假设在时间等于零时，我去掉一个输入，例如将输入电压短接至地，施加零伏电压。您将看到电压从 5 伏衰减到 0 伏。在第一种情况下，我从电容器中的零伏开始，施加 5 伏输入，并注意到在 t=0 时电容器上升到该水平。因此，请注意，这些带有电容器和电阻器的电路的波形呈指数上升和指数衰减。下次我们将看到更多内容。

The second one where I have 5 volts on the capacitor and no input. Assume that at time equals zero I take away an input, short the input voltage to ground for example, apply zero volts. You will see the decay from 5 volts to 0 volts. And in the first case I start with zero volts in my capacitor, I apply input of 5 volts, and notice that at t=0 the capacitor rises up to that level. So notice that these circuits with capacitor and resistors are typified by wave forms that are exponential rises and exponential decays. We will see more of that next time.

好的。早上好。在上一节课中，我为你们做了一个小演示，向你们展示了一对逆变器。并向你们展示了第一个逆变器的输出看起来很奇怪，肯定不像我们迄今为止见过的任何东西。它看起来像是一个缓慢上升的过渡，就像这样。利用这个动机，我们开始研究 RC 电路。今天这节课的题目是“数字电路速度”。

OK. Good morning. In the last lecture I did a little demonstration for you where I showed you a pair of inverters. And showed you that the output of the first inverter looked weird, certainly not like anything we have seen thus far. It looked like a slow rising transition like this. And using that motivation we have begun our study of RC circuits. And in particular for today the lecture is titled “Digital Circuit Speed”.

我们将研究数字电路速度的基础知识。这一切都归结为 RC 延迟。在讲座结束时，我将向你们展示两个数字，你们可以通过观察电路获得这两个数字，将它们相乘，你们就会对电路的运行速度有一个很好的了解。这真是太神奇了。因此，作为快速复习

We are going to look at the fundamentals of digital circuit speed. And it all boils down to an RC delay. By the end of the lecture, I am going to show you two numbers that you can look at a circuit and obtain by observation, multiply them out and you will get a good idea of the speed at which a circuit will run. It is pretty amazing. So as a quick review

与此相关的部分是第 10.4 章。作为复习，我们说过要理解这样的事情，我们需要为 RC 电路打下基础。我介绍的例子是一个非常简单的电路，看起来像这样 这种形式的 RC 电路。我还向您展示了对于形式为的输入，输入在时间 T 等于零时从零步进到 VI。

The relevant section for this is Chapter 10.4. As a review, we said to understand things like this we need to develop the foundations for RC circuits. And the example I covered was that of a very simple circuit that looked like this An RC circuit of this form. And I also showed you that for an input of the form, input that steps from zero to VI at time T equal to zero.

假设电容在时间 T 时的状态为零。这意味着电容从静止状态开始，所以在时间 T=0 时，哎呀，这是 VI，对不起。所以我们假设电容从静止状态开始。在时间 T=0 时，我应用 VI 步骤，大写 VI。然后我想看看电容两端的电压如何变化。我们做了大量分析。

And assuming that the capacitor state at time T equals zero was zero. What this means is that the capacitor starts from rest, so at time T=0, oops, this is VI, I’m sorry. So we assume that the capacitor starts from rest. At time T=0 I apply a VI step, capital VI. And then I want to look at how the voltage across the capacitor behaves. And we did a bunch of analysis.

最后，在上次讲座的最后一个演示中，我向你们展示了电容器的行为方式。它会从……开始。抱歉。这应该是……我们假设它从 VO 开始。我们得到了零的不同方程。因此，假设电容器从 VO 开始，在这种情况下，时间 T=0 时的 VC 是预期的 VO。

And at the end of the day, in the final demo in the lecture last time I showed you that the capacitor would behave like this. It would start off at, oops. I am sorry. This should be, let’s assume that started off at VO. We get a different equation for zero. So let’s say the capacitor started off at VO, in which case VC at time T=0 is VO as expected.

我们展示了输出看起来是这样的。经过很长一段时间后，输出会达到 VI，并且上升的时间常数为 tau=RC。所以我们为这个波形写了方程。当 VI 大于 VO 时就是这种情况。我希望你盯着电路和这里的结果，以便更直观地了解发生了什么。

And we showed that the output would look something like this. After a long period of time this would come up to VI and this rise had a time constant of tau=RC. So we wrote the equation for this waveform. And this is the case when VI is greater than VO. I would like you to stare at the circuit and this result here to get more intuition on what is going on.

在时间 T=0 时，VC 按照预期从 VO 开始，因为我告诉过您情况确实如此，这是初始条件。它从 VO 开始。然后，这个步骤变为 VI。这里没有任何无限转换，因此电容器在时间 T=0 时将其电压保持在 VO。然后，这里的 VI（大于 VO）开始给电容器充电，通过该电阻器给电容器充电。

At time T=0, VC starts off at VO as expected because I am telling you that is the case, that is initial condition. It starts off at VO. Then this one steps to VI. There is no infinite transition anywhere here, and so the capacitor holds its voltage at VO, at time T=0. And then the VI here, which is greater than VO, begins to charge the capacitor up, charge it through this resistor.

因此电容器开始充电。经过很长一段时间后，根据电容器的基本原理，我们知道电容器对直流电来说就像一个长期开路。这是直流电压 VI。因此它看起来像一个开路。因此经过很长一段时间后，VI 出现在最后。从这里到这里，我有一个指数上升，以 t/RC 形式的方程为代表。

And so therefore the capacitor charges up. After a long period of time, from the basic foundations of capacitors, we know that the capacitor appears like a long term open circuit to DC. This is a DC voltage VI. So it appears like an open circuit. So after a long period of time VI appears at the end. And from here to here I have an exponential rise that is typified by an equation of the form t/RC.

这种从较小值上升到较大值的波形可以用这个表达式来表示。我们上次开发方程式时看到了这个表达式。另一方面，如果输入是 VI 小于 VO，那么假设 VI 小于 VO，那么将会发生的情况是，电容器电压将从 VO 开始，因为我告诉你这是初始条件，然后以这种方式衰减到 VI 的最终值，即输入。

This kind of waveform rising from a smaller value to a higher value is typified by this expression. We saw the expression when we developed the equations last time. On the other hand, if the input was such that VI was smaller than VO, so let’s say VI was smaller than VO then what will happen is that the capacitor voltage would start off at VO, because I am telling you that is the initial condition, and would then decay in this manner to the final value of VI which is the input.

它不是以这种方式上升，而是衰减到施加到电路的最终值。同样，时间常数是 RC。但这以某种形式为代表，这是指数上升，这个 e^ t/RC 是指数衰减。要记住的关键是，当您有这种形式的 RC 电路时，您获得的波形要么是 e^ t/RC，要么是 1 e^ t/RC。

Instead of going up this way it decays down to the final value applied to the circuit. Again, the time constant is RC. But this is typified by a form, this is exponential rise and this guy e^ t/RC is an exponential decay. The key thing to remember is that when you have RC circuits of this form, the waveforms that you get are either each of the e^ t/RC or 1 e^ t/RC.

现在您可以开始了解这种波形是如何产生的。我们将举一个例子，坐下来计算反相器延迟。请注意，这里的波形非常典型，或者与我们在此处看到的波形相对应。这里我从 VO 开始。假设这个轴从零开始，这个轴从非常接近零开始，然后上升到某个最终值。

So you can now begin to see how waveforms such as that come about. We will do an example and sit down and compute the inverter delay. And notice that this waveform here is very typical or corresponds to this waveform that we see here. Here I am starting at VO. And assuming this axis starts off at zero, this one starts very close to zero and then rises up to some final value.

到目前为止，我已经为您复习了上次讲过的一些内容。作为第二步，我想给您提供一种更直观的方法，这种方法不需要求解任何微分方程。我这样做的原因是，大多数经验丰富的电路设计师不会每次看到 RC 电路时都坐下来写微分方程。

So far I have reviewed some material for you that I covered the last time. As a second step, I would like to give you a much more intuitive approach that doesn’t involve solving any differential equations. And the reason I do this is that most experienced circuit designers do not sit down and write differential equations each time they see an RC circuit.

当你刚开始学习并看到 RC 电路时，你会说节点法并写出微分方程，但经验丰富的人不会这样做。他们看着它，通过检查就能勾勒出波形。我会向你展示如何做到这一点。一旦我给你一些直觉，它确实非常简单。

When you are starting out and you see an RC circuit, you say node method and you write the differential equation, but experienced people don’t do that. They look at it and they can sketch the waveform out by inspection. And I will show you how to do that. It is indeed incredibly simple once I give you some intuition.

在本课程的剩余部分，我将向你们展示许多这样的例子，首先我会开发一些基础知识，然后向你们展示一种直观的方法，这种方法可以让你快速得到最终答案，或者至少对得到的答案进行合理性检查。这就是经验丰富的电路设计师处理问题的方式。这里有多少人看过这部电影《我爱贝克汉姆》？

Throughout the rest of this course, I will be showing you many such examples where initially I develop the foundations of stuff and then show you an intuitive approach that very quickly lets you either get the final answer or at least sanity check the answer that you have gotten. And this is how experienced circuit designers deal with stuff. How many people here have seen this movie Bend it Like Beckham?

所以你知道贝克汉姆这个角色不会考虑如何投出弧线球。他只是这么做，然后就成功了。他不会坐下来写微分方程来找出抛射轨迹和所有这些东西。你只是这么做。我将要给你的这一系列直觉将与《我像贝克汉姆一样踢球》中的直觉一致。

So you know this Beckham character doesn’t think about how he is going to curve the ball. He just does it and it happens. He doesn’t sit down writing differential equations to find out the projectile trajectory and all of that stuff. You just kind of do it. These series of intuitions I am going to give you is going to be in line with the Bend it Like Beckham kind of intuition.

而这一篇我特别想向您的其中一篇朗诵指导大卫·佩罗特教授致敬。所以这篇直觉将被称为“像佩罗特一样实践”。看看我对其他名字的处理。大卫·佩罗特教授确实是设计非常出色的电源的世界级专家，可以为非常小的芯片等提供电源。他不会为了做这些事情而开始编写微分方程。

And this one in particular I would like to do in honor of one of your recitation instructions Professor David Perreault. And so this piece of intuition is going to be termed “Practice it Like Perreault”. Watch what I do with the other names. Professor David Perreault is really a world expert in designing really incredible power supplies for very, very small chips and so on. He doesn’t start writing differential equations to do this stuff.

他看了看，然后画了个草图。让我给你展示一下他是怎么做的。假设我的电路和之前一样，有 VI、R 和 C，我告诉你 VC(0)=VO。我的输入 VI 是一个步骤，如下所示。VI 是一个步骤。Perreault 教授会怎么做呢？让我们完全凭直觉来做。这里不用数学。好吧。

He looks at it and sketches it out. Let me show you how he would do this. Suppose I have my circuit like before, VI, R and C, and I am telling you that VC(0)=VO. And my input VI is a step that looks like this. VI is a step. How would Professor Perreault do this? Let’s do it completely by intuition. No math here. All right.

我们知道我告诉过你这个家伙从 VO 开始。我告诉你这个。你知道它会从 VO 开始。并且没有脉冲或巨大的无限转换，因此电容器从 VO 开始。我们还从基本电容器特性中知道，经过很长一段时间后，在稳定状态下，这只是一个直流电压。如果你施加直流电，这就是我的电容器。

We know that I have told you that this guy starts off at VO. I am telling you that. You know it is going to start at VO. And there is no impulse or huge infinite transition, and so the capacitor starts off at VO. We also know from basic capacitor properties that after a long period of time, in the steady state, this is but a DC voltage. If you apply a DC and here is my capacitor.

经过很长一段时间后，这个家伙看起来就像是开路。它会充电到某个值，然后看起来就像是开路。因为如果不充电，你就会继续给它充电，它的电压就会不断增加。但事实并非如此，它看起来就像是开路。所以从长远来看，它看起来就像是开路。它两端的电压必须是大写的 VI。

After a long period of time this guy is going to look like an open circuit. It is going to charge up to some value and then is going to look like an open circuit. Because if it didn’t, you would keep charging it and its voltage would keep increasing. That doesn’t happen, it looks like an open circuit. So it looks like an open circuit in the long run. The voltage across it must be capital VI.

如果电路中没有电流流动，那么唯一可能发生的情况就是开路。大写 VI 出现在电容器两端。好吧，经过很长一段时间后，我知道输出一定是这样的。在这种情况下，我假设 VI 大于 VO。因此，经过很长一段时间后，您的曲线上有两个点，VO 和 VI。

If I don’t have current flowing in the circuit then the only way that can happen is This open circuit. Capital VI appears across the capacitor. Well, after a long period of time I know that the output must look like this. In this case, I have assumed VI is greater than VO. So you have two points of your curve, VO and VI after a long period of time.

而且，正如我之前所说的，使用电容器，您会得到两种曲线。两件事。您要做的就是放大。就这样。您就完成了。这具有指数上升。其形式为 1 e^ t/RC。因此，我们可以为其写出如下方程。我们知道 VC 与负 t/RC 有关。这是这种形式，因此其中某处必须有该项。

And, as I told you earlier, with capacitors you get two kinds of curves. Two things. What you do is go zoop. There you go. You’re done. And this has an exponential rise. This is with the form 1 e^ t/RC. So we can write an equation for that as follows. VC we know has something to do with minus t/RC. This is of that form, so there has to be that term in there somewhere.

我从 VO 开始。在时间 T=0 时，这是 1，这是 1，因此该项变为 0。在时间 T=0 时，它变为 0，因此我在这里得到 VO。我要确保这个东西在时间 T=0 时保持为 0，因此我从 VO 开始。现在，随着时间的推移，这里会发生什么？这里的电压，VI VO，如果您查看这个差异。它会随着时间的推移呈指数衰减。

And I start off with VO. At time T=0 this is one and this is one, so this term becomes a zero. At time T=0 that becomes a zero so I get VO here. I am going to make sure this stuff stays zero at time T=0, so I start off with VO. Now, as time wears on what happens here? This voltage here, VI VO, if you look at this difference. That is exponentially decaying over time.

因此，我在这里要做的就是写下 VI VO。这就是答案。我知道曲线的形式。我只是在拟合一个符合这个形式的表达式。它从 VO 开始。当时间 T=0 时，第二个表达式为零，所以它是 VO。这里的这个差异衰减到零。这里的这个差异，VI VO 乘以这里的这个项，这就是我得到的结果。

And so therefore all I have to do here is write VI VO. There is the answer. I know the form of the curve. I am just fitting an expression that meets this form. This starts off at VO. When time T=0 this second expression is zero and so it is VO. And this difference here decays down to zero. And this difference here, VI VO is multiplied by this term here and that is what I get.

您可以证实这一点。在时间 T=0 时，这是零。在时间 T 无穷大时，这变为零，这变为零，剩下 1，VO 和减 VO 相消，我得到 VI。实际上，任何这样的简单电压源、电流源、电阻器、电容器、大多数输入（如步骤等）的电路都可以用这种方式进行分析。初始值、最终值，很简单。

And you can confirm this. At time T=0 this is zero. At time T infinity this goes to zero, this goes to zero leaving a one, and VO and minus VO cancel and I get a VI. Virtually any such simple voltage source, current source, resistor, capacitor, circuit for most inputs like steps and so on can be analyzed in this manner. Initial value, final value, it’s simple.

为了向您展示这很简单，我将以这种方式标记此表达式。它的形式为 1 e^ t/RC。只需记住这一点。现在，同样，如果 VI 小于 VO 会怎样？那也很简单。我会让我的 VI 出现在这里。VI 会在这里。它的形式为。在这种特殊情况下，这是我的 VI，我的起始值，我这样做。

And just to show you that this is simple, I am going to label this expression this way. It is of the form 1 e^ t/RC. Just remember that. Now, by the same token, what if VI had been smaller than VO? Then that is simple, too. I would have had my VI being here. VI would have been here. And that is of the form. In this particular situation, here is my VI, my starting value and I do this.

为了标记它，让我这样标记它。我刚刚告诉过你，对于 RC 电路，你可以这样或那样。所以它在这里。我得到了某种指数衰减。和之前一样，想想这个。这个以 VI 作为基值。两者之间的差是 VO 减去 VI。这个差会衰减。

And just to label that, let me label that this way. I just told you that for RC circuits you go this way or you go this way. So it is down here. I get some kind of an exponential decay. And, like before, think of this one. This one has VI as a base value here. And the difference between the two is VO minus VI. And that difference decays.

所以我这里有一个 VI，这个差值会衰减，所以我得到了 VO VI，它以这种形式衰减。所以我得到了这个差值的指数衰减。再盯着它看一会儿。你应该能够像这样把它弄下来，就像佩罗特教授那样。没有微分方程。只要看着曲线把它写下来就行了。让我们记住这两个，好吗，这些形式？

So I have a VI out here, and this difference decays so I get VO VI and that decays in this form. So I get an exponential decay of this difference here. Just stare at it for a while longer. You should be able to just go and knock it off like this, just like Professor Perreault would. No differential equations. Just write it down by looking at the curve. Let’s keep these two in mind, OK, these forms?

一种是 1 e^ t/RC 形式和 e^ t/RC。两者都有时间常数 RC。为了安全起见，我把它画成虚线。这是我们的第一个直觉。而且，正如我之前指出的那样，在生活中遇到的问题或我们给你的问题中，请随意使用直觉方法。

One is the 1 e^ t/RC form and the e^ t/RC. Both have a time constant RC. Let me just make this a dashed line just to be on the safe side here. That is our first piece of intuition. And, as I pointed out before, in problems you face in life or in ones that we give you, feel free to use the intuitive method.

或者你可以应用数学方法，然后使用你的直觉来检查你的答案。接下来我想做的是应用你到目前为止学到的知识来弄清楚我们要弄清楚的问题，即我的逆变器的延迟。我曾向你保证，在本讲座结束时，我将完成那个小演示的闭环。

Or what you can do is apply the mathematical method and then check your answer by using your intuition. What I would like to do next is apply what you have learned so far to figure out what we set out to figure out, which is the delay of my inverter. I had promised you that by the end of this lecture I was going to close the loop on that little demo.

我要为您闭合我们之前看到的这个小电路的循环，一个逆变器驱动另一个逆变器。这是 A，这是逆变器 X，这是我的节点 B。您看到的绿色曲线，中间的曲线显示了一个过渡。我接下来要做的是使用我们迄今为止得到的结果来计算一个数字。

I was going to close the loop for you on this little circuit that we had looked at, one inverter driving another inverter. This was A, this was inverter X, and this was my node B. The green curve you see out there, the middle one has a transition shown up there. And what I am going to do next is use the results we have gotten so far to compute a number.

我们将计算上升转换的延迟数。我们将称上升转换的延迟为 DR。我们将计算下降转换的延迟为 DF。请记住，这是急剧下降的输入。中间节点 B 上升得要慢得多。而且由于它的上升速度要慢得多，所以这里的节点在此转换之后下降了一点，因此存在延迟。

We are going to compute a delay number both for a rising transition. We will call that delay DR for rising transition. And we will compute a delay for the falling transition DF. Remember, that this is the input that falls down sharply. The intermediate node B rises much more slowly. And because this rises much more slowly this guy here falls a little after this transition here, and so there is a delay.

我将运用我们目前学到的知识，举个例子，找出延迟是多少。这是在构建数字电路时始终需要进行的绝对基础计算。令人惊讶的是，在设计甚至最复杂的电路时，也会使用如此简单的东西，以便快速了解当我让某个子电路驱动其他子电路时，我的延迟会是什么样子。

And I am going to apply what we have learned so far and do an example for you and figure out what that delay is. This is an absolute foundational calculation done in building digital circuits all the time. It is remarkable that something so simple is used in designing even the most complex of circuits to obtain very quick ideas of what my delay will look like when I have some subcircuit driving some other piece of subcircuit.

我先画几个等效电路给你。内部电路如下。这是我的反相器 X、A，我的节点 B。注意，我有这个电容 CGS。因为我对这个节点感兴趣，所以我给你展示一下，这个电容，确切地说，是因为这里的电容，因为栅极和源极之间的这个 MOSFET 而产生的。

Let me just draw a few equivalent circuits for you. The internal circuit looks like this. This is my inverter X, A, my node B. And notice that I have this capacitor CGS. Since I am interested in this node, let me show you that, this capacitor explicitly, it is because of this capacitor here that arises because of this MOSFET here between the gate and the source.

那个电容器产生了我们看到的这个 RC 现象。这是 RL，这是 RL、VS、VS。假设，就像上面那样，在时间 T=0 时，我得到一个这样的转换，在节点 A 处从 5 伏到 0 伏的下降转换。这是这里的 VA。它显示在那里。VB 我们曾预计 VB 会像这样。

And that capacitor gives rise to this RC thing that we are seeing. This is RL, this is RL, VS, VS. And let’s say, just as up there, at time T=0 I get a transition like so, a falling transition from say 5 volts to 0 volts at the node A. This is VA here. That is shown up there. And VB We had expected that VB would look like this.

我们原本以为 VB 是瞬时的，看起来是那样的，但由于电容器的存在，VB 却看起来像这样。再次记住，这是 1 e^ t/RC 的形式。我们将通过检查写下答案。从这里，让我通过向您展示另一个小图 t、VB、零来绘制与电路延迟的联系。我要向您展示的是 5 伏。

We expected VB to be instantaneous and looking like that, but instead because of the capacitor VB looks like this. And remember, again, this is of the form 1 e^ t/RC. And we will write down the answers by inspection. From this let me draw the connection to circuit delay by showing you another little graph here t, VB, zero. And what I am going to show you, this is 5 volts.

因此输出从接近零变为 5 伏。它接近零。因为，至少对于我们在实验室等地方看到的反相器，反相器的 RON 与 RL 相比非常非常小。所以它在这里几乎为零。那么延迟是多少？我提到有两个值得关注的延迟。一个是上升延迟。

And so the output goes like this from close to zero to 5 volts. It is close to zero. Because, at least with the inverters we have been seeing in lab and so on, the RON for the inverter is very, very small compared RL. So it is virtually zero down here. And so what is the delay? I mentioned there are two delays of interest. One is the rising delay.

那是最后的逻辑值，如果我等待足够长的时间，它就是一个逻辑值。延迟简单地定义为从这里开始，这个输出需要多长时间才能达到有效输出？在什么电压下我可以说这个转换对应于逻辑转换？在什么电压下我可以说它代表有效转换？有什么想法吗？是的。这取决于学科，宾果。

That is the logical value at the end, if I wait a long enough period of time, is a logical one. Delay is simply defined as starting from here how long does this output take to get to a valid one? At what voltage here can I say that this transition corresponds to a logical one? At what voltage here can I say that represents a valid one? Any ideas? Yes. It depends on the discipline, bingo.

所以这取决于学科。现在让我们更具体一点。既然这取决于学科，那么基于学科中的某项值，我可以说这个东西是合乎逻辑的吗？记住，这是一个输出。VOH，宾果。某个地方有一些 VOH。而且需要一些时间才能得到有效的逻辑 1 输出，因此存在延迟。这就是 tR。

So it depends on the discipline. Now let’s get more specific. Since it depends on the discipline, at what value based on something in the discipline can I say this thing is a logical one? This is an output remember. VOH, bingo. There is some VOH somewhere. And it takes some amount of time to get to a valid logical one output, ergo there is your delay. This is tR.

我将其称为逆变器 X 的上升延迟。有趣的是，根据我们的模型，逆变器 X 的上升延迟取决于该逆变器的参数以及它所驱动的设备的参数。因此请记住，延迟不一定只是逆变器本身的属性，而是取决于上下文。

And I call this the rising delay of the inverter X. It is interesting that the rising delay of inverter X, based on our model, depends on the parameters of this inverter and the parameters of whatever it is driving. So remember that the delay is not necessarily just the property of the inverter itself, but it depends on the context.

如果我将我的逆变器放在另一个逆变器前面，那么根据我们的模型，该逆变器上的电容会告诉我延迟会是什么样子，当然，除了 RL 之外。我们将在几秒钟内进行计算。同样，如果我将这根电线连接到不是一台逆变器而是十台其他逆变器，我预计电容等于 CGS 的十倍。

If I stick my inverter before another inverter like this, it is the capacitance on that inverter by our model that tells me what the delay is going to look like, of course in addition to RL. And we will do the math in a few seconds. By the same token, if I had this wire connecting not to one inverter but going to ten other inverters, I expect to have a capacitance equal to ten times CGS.

因此，这个东西应该上升得更慢，对吗？这里的电容越多，上升得越慢。很简单。如果我通过在该线路上放置越来越多的 MOSFET、越来越多的逆变器，在该线路上放置越来越多的负载，那么上升速度就会变慢。在我们的示例中，我只有一个，所以让我们继续计算延迟。这称为 X 的上升延迟。

And so therefore this thing should rise even more slowly, correct? The more capacitance on here the slower it rises up. Simple. If I put more and more load on this line by putting more and more MOSFETs on that line, more and more inverters this will rise slower. In our example I just have one, so let’s go ahead and compute the delay. This is called the rising delay of X.

也就是说，这个节点从输出值变为有效值（即 VOH）需要多长时间？请注意，如果这个电容为零，那么您会看到瞬时转换。如果有瞬时转换，则请注意上升延迟为零。这是我们在学习电容器之前研究过的模型。所以让我们继续计算这个数字。
