That says that for this node here to go from its output value to a valid one, which is VOH how long does it take? Notice that if this capacitor was zero then you would have seen an instantaneous transition. If you have an instantaneous transition then notice that the rising delay was zero. That was the model we had looked at up until learning about capacitors. So let’s go ahead and compute the number.

我可以画一个等效电路来计算上升延迟。上升延迟的等效电路如下所示。VS 电压源，带有电阻 RL 和电容 CGS，因为当我关闭这个东西时，这个东西已经关闭了，因此就这个节点的上升时间而言，我可以查看这个电路，接地通过 CGS 通过 RL 通过 VS 回到接地。

I can draw an equivalent circuit for computing a rising delay. The equivalent circuit for the rising delay looks like the following. The VS voltage source, with a resistor RL and a capacitor CGS, because when I turn this guy off, this guy has gone off, and so as far as the rise time of this node is concerned I can look at this circuit, ground through CGS through RL through VS back to ground.

为了简单起见，让我以我们理解的形式绘制它。CGS。让我用它作为我的接地节点。这是电压 VB。这是 RL。一旦发生这种转变，V 就是 VS。我的其他方程式是 VI=VS。VB(0) 是什么？VB(0) 是这个节点的起始值吗？

And just for simplicity, let me draw this in a form that we understand. CGS. Let me use this as my ground node. And this is the voltage VB. And this is RL. And V is simply VS once that transition happens. My other equations here, VI=VS. And what is VB(0)? VB(0) is at what value does this node start out?

请注意，为简单起见，如果此 RON 比 RL 小得多，则此节点将非常接近地面。所以我将继续说 T=0 时的 VB 近似为零。然后我想知道从零开始然后向前的时间值是多少？好吧，我们现在已经成为这方面的专家了。让我们在这里进行直觉判断。从零开始。

Notice that for simplicity here if this RON is much, much smaller than RL, then this node would be very close to ground. So I will just go ahead and say that VB at T=0 is approximately zero. And then what I want to find out is what does the value look like for time starting from zero and then going forward? Well, we have become experts at this now. Let’s do the intuition here. Start off with zero.

很好。因为我的初始值为零，所以我从这里开始。最终值是多少？经过很长一段时间后，由于这是直流电压，经过很长一段时间后 VB 的值会是多少？什么？VS。如果我等待足够长的时间，那么它将处于 VS。这大于初始值，所以我们完成了。这是我的 1 e^ t/RC 形式。我花了三秒钟。这很酷。

That’s good. Because my initial value is zero, I start off here. What is the final value? After a long time, since this is a DC voltage, what would be the value at VB after a long time? Pardon? VS. If I wait long enough then it is going to be at VS. This is greater than the initial value, so we’re done. That is my 1 e^ t/RC form. It took me three seconds there. It’s pretty cool.

我们可以为此添加表达式。表达式是，我取起始值，即零，然后加上这个差值 VS，再乘以这个形式。就这样。记住，我从上面的上升形式得到这个。V0=0，这是零，所以它只是 VI 乘以它，VI=VS。我真的希望你能明白这个直觉。

We could add the expression for this. And the expression was I take my starting value, which is zero, and I add to that this difference VS and I multiply that by this form. There we go. And remember I get this from that rising form up here. V0=0, this is zero, so it is simply VI times that, and VI=VS. I really would like you to get this intuition.

如果我有两个选择，一个是你理解直觉并能够将其勾勒出来，另一个是你在睡梦中能够解微分方程并得到答案。如果非此即彼，我更希望你得到直觉。这很简单。从零开始，我去扔，然后砰的一声，我得到了 VS，这是我的 1 e^ t/RC 形式。我需要计算 tR。

If I had two choices, one is that you understand the intuition and are able to sketch that versus in your sleep be able to solve the differential equation and get to the answer. I would much rather you get the intuition, if it is one or the other. It is very simple. Start off at zero, I go chuck, and boom, I get to VS and this is my 1 e^ t/RC form. I need to compute tR.

tR 是达到 VOH 所需的时间。VB 达到 VOH 需要多少时间，T 是多少？我想要找到 tR。tR 是多少？从该方程式中，它简单地告诉我 VB 随时间变化的轨迹。所以我需要找出 T 是多少，此时 VB 为 VOH？我写 VOH=VS (1 e^ t/RC)。因此，在上升时间之后，我的输出将为 VOH。

And tR is the time that this takes to get to VOH. For what value of time, for what T, does VB reach VOH? I want to find tR. What’s tR? From that equation, that simply tells me the trajectory of VB as a function of time. And so I need to find out what is T for which VB is VOH? I write VOH=VS (1 e^ t/RC). So after a rise time my output is going to be VOH.

那么让我继续找到 tR。让我们看看。我把它带到左边，用 VOH 除以 VS，然后我移动一些东西，最后得到的是 tR/RC，在另一边我得到 ln(1 VOH/VS)。用 VOH 除以 VS，就是这个，把它移到另一边，把 e^ t/RC 移到这一边。然后对两边取对数。这就是我得到的结果。

And so let me go ahead and find tR. Let’s see. I bring this to this left hand side and divide VOH by VS, and then I move things around and what I end up getting is tR/RC and on the other side I get ln(1 VOH/VS). Divide VOH by VS, that is this, move this to the other side, and move e^ t/RC to this side. And take logarithms on both sides. This is what I get.

因此，TR 是 RLCGS ln(1 VOH/VS)。这是我的上升时间。您可以通过检查来做到这一点。这非常简单。只需用数字等给出一些直觉。假设 RL=1K、VS=5 伏、VOH=4 伏、CGS=0.1 pF。这种情况经常发生，我们经常称之为“puff”。0.1 puff。它是 pF，被称为 puff。如果它是 nF，我不知道他们为什么不称之为“nuff”。

TR is therefore RLCGS ln(1 VOH/VS). That is my rise time. You can just do this by inspection. It is just so awfully simple. Just to give to some intuition with numbers and so on. Let’s say that RL=1K, VS=5 volts, VOH=4 volts, CGS=0.1 pF. This happens so often that we often time call it “puff”. 0.1 puff. It is pF, it’s called puff. If it is nF, I don’t know why they didn’t call it “nuff”.

他们只是称之为纳法拉。对于皮法拉 ln(1 4/5)，这些数字的 TR 为 1 乘以 10 的 3 倍，1 乘以 10 的负 12 倍。如果你算一下，就会发现它下降到了 0.16 纳秒。这意味着，如果我有一个这样的逆变器驱动另一个逆变器，那么我的输出转换将延迟 0.16 纳秒。

They just call it nanofarads. TR for these numbers gets to be one times ten to the three times point one times ten to the minus twelve for pico farads ln(1 4/5). And if you do the math you get this down to 0.16 nanoseconds. This means that if I had an inverter like that droving another inverter then my output transition would be delayed by 0.16 nanoseconds.

相信我，当英特尔制造微处理器或 Broadcom 制造其电缆调制解调器芯片时，他们必须使用计算机工具或手工以某种方式完成芯片中几乎每个小子电路的计算。这就是您获得延迟或某种近似值的方法。我还想让您做的是，出于任何特殊原因，我将为您计算以下数量 RLCGS。

Trust me, when Intel builds microprocessors or when Broadcom builds its cable modem chips, they have to do this one way or the other using a computer tool or by hand for virtually every little subcircuit in their chip. That is how you get the delays or some approximation thereof. What I want you also to do is, for no particular reason, I will just compute for you the following quantity RLCGS.

该电路的时间常数毫无理由。我只是要计算它并把它贴在这里。而 RLCGS 1 K 乘以 1 pF 只是 0.1 纳秒。我只是把它写下来并贴在那里，没有什么特别的原因。下一步让我们做下降延迟，DF。那是上升延迟。

The time constant of that circuit for no reason at all. I am just going to compute it and stick it here. And RLCGS 1 K times 1 pF is simply 0.1 nanoseconds. I am just writing it and sticking it there for no particular reason. The next step let’s do the falling delay, DF. That is the rising delay.

而且，虽然我没有在演示中向您展示这一点，但下降时间确实有相应的延迟。它不会立即下降，而是下降得相当缓慢。让我们画出节点 X 下降时的等效电路。请注意，在我这里的反相器中，这个节点一开始处于 VS。这是高的。

And, although I didn’t show this to you in the demo, there is a corresponding delay of the fall time. It doesn’t fall instantly, but rather it falls rather slowly. Let’s draw the equivalent circuit for when the node X falls. Notice that in my inverters here, this node starts off being at VS. This is high.

它会下降，因为当我打开这个晶体管时，它会把这个节点拉到地，否则它就会下降。等效电路是什么？等效电路是接地通过电容器到这个节点。在这个节点，我有 RON 连接到地，我有 RL 通过 VS 连接到地。让我给你画出那个小电路。

And this is going to fall because when I turn this transistor on it is going to pull this node to ground or it is going to fall down. And what is the equivalent circuit? The equivalent circuit is that ground through capacitor to this node. At this node I have RON connecting to ground and I have RL connecting to ground through VS. Let me draw that little circuit for you.

请记住，生命始于存储元件，也终于存储元件，所以我会先画出它们。我的存储元件 CGS。那是 VB。而且，正如我所说，这是节点 X，它从 RON 接地，它也通过 RL 经过 VS 接地。在这种特殊情况下，VB 为零，在接下来的延迟中，VB 从 VS 开始，因此 VB 为零就是 VS。至于最终的输出，我还不确定。

Remember life begins and ends on storage elements, so I will draw them first. My storage element CGS. That is VB. And, as I said, this is node X, it goes from RON to ground, and it also goes through RL through VS to ground. And in this particular situation VB of zero for the following delay, VB starts off at VS so VB of zero is VS. And the final output I am not sure yet.

这个节点的电压最终值是多少？我还不知道。我需要计算一下。所以我会做的是，每当你看到类似的东西时，电容器连接到线性的东西，或者非线性元件连接到线性的东西。你至少应该想想什么？想想戴维宁，没错。然后看看你是否可以使用戴维宁方法来简化你的生活。

What is the final value of the voltage at this node? I don’t know that yet. I need to compute that. So what I will do is whenever you see something like this, a capacitor connecting to linear stuff, or a nonlinear element connecting to linear stuff. For no apparent reason you should at least think about what? Think Thevenin, exactly. And then see if you can use the Thevenin method to simplify your life.

电容器，这里有一堆东西，我需要找出初始值。哦，我知道了。那是 VS。完成了。我需要使用我的直观方法找到最终值。对于最终值，我只需查看一下就可以做到，但我想加入戴维宁。嘿，让我试试戴维宁等效值，看看这是否会让我的生活更轻松。VTH。

Capacitor, a bunch of stuff here, I need to find out the initial value. Oh, I know that. That is VS. Done. I need to find the final value using my intuitive method. For the final value, I could do it just by looking at this, but I wanted to throw in Thevenin. Hey, let me try to the Thevenin equivalent and see if that makes my life any easier. VTH.

戴维南方法说，你可以用戴维南等效电路替换此电路，以便确定在给定线性的情况下此节点上发生的情况。因此，我需要找出它，以便确定在节点 X 上发生的情况。我必须用它的戴维南等效电路替换它。现在我需要找出 RTH 和 VTH。

The Thevenin method says that you can replace this circuit here with a Thevenin equivalent of the sort for the purpose of determining what happens at this node given that is linear. So I need to find out that for the purpose of determining what happens at the node X. I have to replace this with its Thevenin equivalent. And I now need to find out RTH and VTH.

因此，我通过查看这里，短路这个，然后查看电阻来获得 RTH。因此，我像这样查看，然后短路这个，然后我得到 RL 与 RON 并联，因为这个短路接地。因此，RTH 只是 RL 与 RON 并联。这是 RL 与 RON 并联的方便符号。你们都知道它的值。

So I get RTH by looking in here, shorting this guy and looking at the resistance. So I look in like this, then I short this guy here and I get RL in parallel with RON because this one shorts to ground. So RTH is simply RL in parallel with RON. This is a convenient notation for RL being in parallel with RON. And you all know the value of that.

这是我们的另一个非常简单的模式，例如分压器等。并联电阻可以计算为 RL RON 除以 RL 加 RON。VTH 是多少？VTH 是这里的开路电压。如果我取出这个电容器，我想知道这里的电压是多少。啊哈，分压器。VS，这里的分压器，RL 和 RON。我可以把它写成 VS 乘以 RON/(RL+RON)。

It is another one of our very simple patterns like voltage divider and so on. Resistances in parallel can be computed as RL RON divided by RL plus RON. What is VTH? VTH is the open circuit voltage here. If I take out this capacitor, I want to find out what the voltage here is. Ah ha, voltage divider. VS, the voltage divider here, RL and RON. I could write this down as VS times RON/(RL+RON).

请记住，您会在 6.002 或任何您学习的电路知识中一次又一次地看到它们，您会在戴维南电路中看到它们。分压器、分流器、串联电阻、并联电阻、RC 电路等等。因此，如果您只记住这 10 到 15 个直观的模式，那么您的生活就很完美了。它会一次又一次地出现。并联电阻。分压器。

Remember you will see again and again and again and again in 6.002 or any circuit stuff that you do, you will see them all over Thevenin. Voltage dividers, current dividers, resistances in series, resistances in parallel, RC thing a ma jigs like this. So if you just remember those 10 to 15 intuitive patterns then you are pretty much set for life. It just comes on again and again and again. Parallel resistors. Voltage dividers.

你应该能在睡觉时写下一个分压器。这就是我所拥有的。现在让我直观地写下我期望节点 X 通过检查做什么。让我们看看。电容两端电压的初始值是多少，直观的方法？这是佩罗特教授的做法，记得吗？他会先说啊哈，初始值是 VS，因为我被告知它是 VS。

You should be able to write down a voltage divider in your sleep. So this is what I have. Let me now write down intuitively what I expect the node X to do just by inspection. Let’s see. What is the initial value of the voltage across the capacitor, intuitive method? This is how Professor Perreault would do it, remember? He would start off by saying ah ha, initial value is VS because I am told it is VS.

我从 VS 开始。所以我从这里开始。根据这里的电路，经过很长一段时间后，其值是多少？V Thevenin。经过很长一段时间后，这是一个直流电压，因为这是一个直流电压。经过很长一段时间后，电容器看起来像是开路。VTH 出现在那里，所以它只是 V Thevenin。然后当你看到这两个时，伙计，我喜欢这样做，你就像这样。

I start off with VS. And so I start off here. What is the value after a long, long time based on this circuit here? V Thevenin. After a long time this is a DC voltage because that is a DC voltage. The capacitor looks like an open circuit after a long time. And VTH appears there so it is simply V Thevenin. And then when you see those two, boy, I love doing this, you go like this.

这是最酷的部分。然后我就完成了。这很简单。三秒钟或更短的时间，我能够完全凭直觉告诉你逆变器的延迟是多少。我的意思是我没有做任何解决。只是通过观察。拿下这个电路，让我的生活变得轻松，戴维南，查看 RTH、VTH，然后通过检查绘制草图。

That is the coolest part. And then I am done. It is so simple. Three seconds or less, I am able to tell you what the delay of an inverter is purely by intuition, completely intuitively. I mean I haven’t done any solving. It is just by observation. Took this circuit, made my life easy, Thevenin, looked at RTH, VTH and then sketched it by inspection.

再说一次，如果你发现事情真的、真的、真的很简单，不要感到惊讶。一旦你对概念有了一定的理解，事情确实非常简单。你只需盯着事物试图建立直觉，就可以省去很多数学运算。下一步我可以做的是写下 VB 的表达式。我写下下降过渡的表达式。我怎么做？它是什么？

Again, if you find that things are really, really, really simple don’t be surprised. Once you get some conceptual understanding things are indeed very simple. You can eliminate a lot of math just by staring at things attempting to build up the intuition. As a next step what I can do is write down the expression for VB. And I write down the expression from a falling transition. How do I do it? What was it?

方法是什么？我在这里取最低的关注值。那就是 VTH。然后我加上这个呈指数衰减的差值。这个差值就是 VS VTH。它呈指数衰减。这个形式是 e^t/RC 形式。然后，砰，我完成了。你们中的许多人都在想，阿加瓦尔教授，如果生活如此简单，你到底为什么要让我们摆弄那些微分方程才能到达这里？

What is the method? I take the lowest value of interest here. That is VTH. And then I add to that this difference decaying exponentially. And that difference is simply VS VTH. And that decays exponentially. This form is the e^ t/RC form. And, boom, I am done. Many of you are wondering, Professor Agarwal, if life was so simple, why on earth did you have us mess around with those differential equations to get here?

你向我们展示了微分方程，然后你就不再使用它们了。嗯，这是个好问题。答案是你需要了解基础知识。一旦你理解了基础知识，你就可以找到简化技术来达到你需要的目的，但你需要理解基础知识。你至少需要至少一次看到为什么事情会这样。

You show us differential equations and then you don’t use them anymore. Well, that is a good question. The answer to that is that you need to understand the foundations. Once you understand the foundations you can find simplifying techniques to get to where you need to be, but you need to understand the foundations. You need to at least see why things are the way they are at least once.

理解基础知识，然后找到直观的方法来获得答案。现在我的下降延迟是，我从 VOS 开始，我需要一直计算到要计算的值。在某个时刻，这是一个有效的值，在某个时刻，VB 成为输出的有效零。那就是我停止 tF 块的时候。这里的值是多少才能使其成为有效的零？

Understand the foundations and then find intuitive ways of getting your answers. So now my falling delay here is, I start off with VOS and I need to get all the way down to what value to compute. At some point here, this is a valid one, at some point VB becomes a valid zero for the output. And that is when I stop my tF block. What is the value here for this to be a valid zero?

不要一下子大喊大叫。VOL。我只需要弄清楚时间的值是多少，这是第 7 页，这个表达式衰减到 VOL。所以它是 VTH+(VS VTH) e^ tF/RC。然后我简化它。我怎么做呢？VOL VTH。然后我将其除以 VS VTH。所以 VOL VTH。将其除以 VS VTH。对两边取对数，然后乘以 RC。所以我得到 tF 是 RC 的对数。

Don’t all yell at once. VOL. I simply had to figure out what is the value of time, this is Page 7, for which this expression decays down to VOL. So it is VTH+(VS VTH) e^ tF/RC. Then I simplify this. How do I do that? VOL VTH. Then I divide that by VS VTH. So VOL VTH. Divide that by VS VTH. Take logarithms on both sides and then multiply by RC. So I get tF is RC log of that.

这是 R Thevenin，这是 CGS。我是如何得到这个值的？VOL VTH 除以 VS VTH。对两边取对数。然后将整个值乘以 1/RC，我得到了 tF。完成。让我们对相同的设置数字进行操作，只是我们添加了 10 欧姆的 RON。我将对 10 欧姆的 RON 执行此操作并为您计算值。tF= RTH。RTH 是 RON 并联 RL。这是 10 欧姆。即 1K。

This is R Thevenin and this is CGS. How did I get this? VOL VTH divided by VS VTH. Take logs on both sides. And then multiply throughout by 1/ RC and I get my tF. Done. Let’s do it for the same set numbers, just that we add an RON of 10 ohms. I will do this for RON of 10 ohms and compute the value for you. tF= RTH. RTH is RON parallel RL. This is 10 ohms. That is 1K.

因此，10 欧姆与 1K 并联大约为 10 欧姆。所以我就使用大约 10 欧姆。1 pF，即 RC 乘以 VOL 的 ln。哦，我需要给你一个 VOL。假设我的规则是 VOL 为 1 伏。因此，我最终得到 VOL VTH 除以 VS VTH。

So 10 ohms in parallel with 1K is approximately 10 ohms. So let me just use approximately 10 ohms. 1 pF, that is RC times ln of VOL. Oh, I need to give you a VOL. Let’s say my discipline has VOL being 1 volt. And so therefore I end up getting a VOL VTH divided by VS VTH.

由于 RON 比 RL 小得多，因为 RON 为 10 欧姆，而这是 1K，所以大部分 VS 会压降到 RL 上。这比 VOL（1 伏）小一百倍，VTH 非常非常小。VTH 约为 0.05，因此我只需在此处写下 VOL，并假设 VTH 约为零，我就会得到 VS VTH。

Since RON is much, much, much smaller than RL, since RON is 10 ohms and this is 1K, most of VS will drop across RL. This is a hundred times smaller.compared to VOL, which is 1 volt, VTH is very, very small. VTH will be on the order of 0.05, and so therefore I simply write down VOL here and say VTH is approximately zero, and I get VS VTH.

这大约是 5。所以我只说这是大约。如果你这样做，你会得到 1.6 皮秒。同样，只是为了好玩，让我写下电路的相应 RC 时间常数，即 RTHCGS。因此 RTH 大约为 10 欧姆，CGS 为 1 pF，所以这是 1 皮秒。现在你会明白为什么我一直写下这个时间常数。

This is approximately 5. So let me just say this is approximately. And if you do it you will get 1.6 pico seconds. Again, just for fun, let me write the corresponding RC time constant for the circuit, which is RTHCGS. So RTH is approximately 10 ohms and CGS is 1 pF, so this is 1 picosecond. Now you will understand why I have been writing this time constant down.

事实证明，时间常数是一个非常非常重要的数字。因此，您看到一个 RC 电路，并计算出像这样的 RLC 连接的时间常数，它是串联电阻乘以电容器。时间常数是一个非常重要的数字。通常电路延迟在时间常数值的附近。在这种情况下，这是 1 pS。即 1.6 pS。

It turns out that the time constant is a very, very important number. So you see an RC circuit, and you compute its time constant for an RLC connection like this, it is the series resistance times the capacitor. The time constant is a very important number. And usually the circuit delays are in the neighborhood of the time constant value. In this case this is 1 pS. That is 1.6 pS.

在这种情况下，我们有 0.1 nS 和 0.16 nS。因此，时间常数本身可以很好地指示您的延迟情况。如果您没有时间，您早上正在吃麦片，并且您需要非常快地知道逆变器的延迟时间，您有三秒钟。只需执行 RC，这是一个很好的初步近似值。

And in this case we had 0.1 nS and 0.16 nS. So the time constant itself is a good indicator of what your delays are going to be like. If you have no time, you are sloshing your cereal down in the morning and you need to know how long the delay of the inverter very quickly, you have three seconds. Just do the RC and that is a good first approximation.

在最后三四分钟里，我想为你们准备一个小演示，供你们背诵，然后你们的背诵将涵盖它。这是一个真实的故事。这真的、真的发生过。在这所西海岸的学校里，我们不会透露名字，他们有一个芯片，他们制造了一个芯片。芯片上有一堆针脚，你可以想象得到。

What I would like to do next in the last three or four minutes is set up a little demo for you for your recitation, and then your recitation will cover it. This is a true story. This really, really happened. In this West Coast school, which shall remain nameless, they had a chip, they built a chip. And the chip had a bunch of pins, as you might imagine.

引脚，就像电路板上的走线、电路板上的电线一样，在电线和地之间会有一些电容。这就是电容器。他们称之为负载电容。它可能是 0.1 pF 或 0.01 pF 或类似的值。他们在制造这个芯片时发现了什么

And the pin, as you have a trace on a board, a wire on a board there are some capacitance attached to wires, between the wire and ground. And that is a capacitor. And they just called it a load capacitance. It could have been 0.1 pF or 0.01 pF or something like that. What they found when they built this chip

他们发现，他们预期这里的电压应该是这样的，这个计算机科学抽象等等，从零到一的转换，砰，它应该是这样的。但由于我们今天看到的原因，观察到的转换要慢得多，看起来像这样。所以学生们说，啊哈，让我们加快这个芯片的速度。我们可以通过查看我的驱动逆变器的 RL 和 RON 来加快芯片的速度。

What they found was that the voltage here they expected to look like this, this computer science abstraction and so on, zero to one transition, boom, it should look like this. But for the reasons we saw today the observed transition was much slower and looked like this. So the students said ah ha, let’s speed up this chip. We can speed up the chip by looking at the RL and RON of my driving inverters.

如果我把 RL 设小，注意如果我把 RL 设小，我的延迟就会很小。如果我把 RON 设小，我的下降延迟就会很小。所以让我们把 RL 和 RON 设得非常小，让我们都玩得开心。不幸的是，他们观察到，通过把 RL 和 RON 都设小，RC 时间常数也设小，他们预计会看到更陡峭的上升时间。这是原始情况。但实际发生的是

And if I make RL small Notice if I make RL small my delay is small. If I make RON small my falling delay is small. So let’s make really small RLs and RONs and let’s all have fun. Unfortunately, what they observed was that by making RL and RON both small, the RC time constant small they expected to see a much sharper rise time. And this was the original. But what really happened was

他们预计这种情况会发展得更快，看起来就像这样，但结果却是灾难降临。他们观察到的就是这样的情况。这是一个真实的故事。所以他们没有得到这样的结果，而是得到了这样的结果。这为什么是个问题呢？

They expected this to get faster and kind of look like this, but what happened was disaster struck. What they observed was something like that. This is a real life story. And so instead of getting something like this they go something like this. And why is that a problem?

这是个问题，因为请注意，当我预期为零时，我得到了一些高于 VIL 的尖峰，进入了禁区，这对我造成了不利影响。所以让我给你看一个小演示，向你展示电路的确切行为。请注意，这是我所期望的，但这是我看到的。看看这里的紫色曲线。注意那里出现的这些尖峰。

That is a problem because notice when I expect to be at a zero, I got some spikes that went higher than VIL into the forbidden region and did bad things to me. So let me show you a little demo and show you that’s exactly how the circuit is behaving. Notice that this is what I expect but this is what I see. Look at the purple curve here. Notice these spikes that are showing up there.

这是真的。他们亲眼目睹了这一切。为什么会发生这种情况？原来，发生这种情况是因为两个引脚彼此相邻。我会在这里向你展示一个小演示。让我们看看你是否能弄清楚为什么会发生这种情况。把它们想象成两个引脚，并且引脚彼此靠近。我只是用一根电线来模拟这两个引脚。

This is true. They saw it happen. And why is this happening? It turns out that what was happening was that the two pins were next to each other. And I will show you a little demonstration here. Let’s see if you can figure out why this was happening. Think of these as two pins and the pins are close together. I am just modeling the two pins with a role of wire.

我要做的是将电线分开，并将它们分开。这就像将我的针脚分开一样。嘿，猜猜发生了什么？那些讨厌的尖刺消失了。但是我无法将芯片上的针脚分开 1 米。你的笔记本电脑看起来会有 20 码长。

And what I am going to do is I am going to separate the wires and keep them far apart. It is like keeping my pins far apart. Hey, guess what happened? Those nasty spikes went away. But then I cannot keep my pins 1 meter apart on a chip. Your laptops are going to look 20 yards long.

您希望引脚彼此非常接近，这样芯片上就可以有很多引脚，从而拥有非常小的系统。但是，你看，我得到了尖峰。知道为什么会发生这种情况吗？为什么当引脚靠得很近时我得到了那些尖峰？有什么想法吗？有点吗？我们刚刚学习了电容器，所以这一定与电容器有关。引脚之间确实存在寄生电容器。

You want the pins to be very close to each other so that you can have many pins on chips and therefore have very small systems. But then look, I get the spikes. Any idea why that is happening? Why is that when the pins are close together I get those spikes? Any ideas? Somewhat? We just learned about capacitors, so this must have to do with capacitors. There is this parasitic capacitor between the pins, exactly.

实际情况如下。这是我所期望的。我期望输出端出现漂亮的方波。但我旁边有一个引脚。驱动它的波形更快。因此这里有一个寄生电容。因此我得到了所谓的“串扰”。串扰的模型是寄生电容产生的一些合成电阻，我得到了那些尖峰。

Here is what is happening. Here is what I expect. I expect a nice square wave at the output. But instead I have a pin next to me. And I have a faster wave form driving it. And so therefore there is a parasitic capacitor here. And because of that I get something called “crosstalk”. And the model for crosstalk is some resultant resistance with the parasitic capacitor and I get those spikes.

6.002 专家看到了解决方案。他们说我们该如何解决这个问题？6.002 专家说我们解决这个问题的方法如果速度慢一点可能会更好。与其使用尖锐的过渡，不如让我用较慢的过渡来驱动它。让我们再次切换到演示。您将在复习中看到这一点，但我会很快向您展示演示。

And the 6.002 experts saw the solution. They said how do we fix this problem? 6.002 experts said the way we fix this problem if it is slow it may be better. Instead of having sharp transitions let me drive it with slower transitions. Let’s switch to the demo again. You will see this in recitation, but I will show you the demo very quickly.

我有一个输入的急剧过渡，就是那个黄色的东西。我要让过渡慢一点。切换到三角波。你会注意到尖峰消失了。哦，不。那是错的。另一个。就是这样。当我切换到较慢的过渡时，尖峰消失了。你想切换回正方形吗？就是这样。6.002 专家看到了解决方案。较慢的过渡。明天您将在部分中详细讨论这个例子。谢谢。

I have a sharp transition of the input, which is that yellow thing out there. I am going to make the transition slower. Switch to a triangular wave. And you will notice the spikes go away. Oh, no. That is the wrong one. The other one. There you go. The moment I switch to a slower transition boom, the spikes go away. You want to switch back to square? There you go. The 6.002 experts saw the solution. Slower transitions. And you will do this example in detail in Section tomorrow. Thank you.

Lec 14 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 14 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 48:00 https://youtube.com/watch?v=bX8i2yECWaU

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 48:00 https://youtube.com/watch?v=bX8i2yECWaU

介绍

Introduction

今天我将代替 Agarwal 教授，因为他不在。对于那些没见过我的人来说，我是复习老师之一。今天我们将讨论 RC 网络的一个巧妙应用，并将其扩展到 MOS 内存系统中的应用。为了联系一切，我们将回到我们迄今为止讨论过的基本电路。

I will be replacing Professor Agarwal today because he is away. I am one of the recitation instructors for those of you who have not seen me. We will talk today about a neat application of RC networks and expand those to application in MOS memory systems. To connect with everything, we will get back to the basic circuit that we have been discussing so far.

大家还记得我们一直在研究的电路，即输入电压函数为 t 的典型 RC。我们已经明确指出，我们针对阶跃输入或 at=0 的情况解决了这个问题。当 t 大于或等于零时，vI 等于某个大写的 VI 值，该值目前为常数。

And you recall the circuit that we have been studying, the canonical RC with an input voltage function of t. And we had specified that we solved this problem for the case of a step input or a condition in which a t=0. At t greater or equal to zero vI is equal to some capital VI value that for now on is constant.

我们讨论的另一个条件是时间 t=0 时电容器上的电压值。我们将其称为 vc(0)。一般来说，这里有一个有限值。它可以是零，也可以不为零。

And the other condition that we discussed was the value of the voltage on the capacitor that would exist at time t=0. Let’s call that vc(0). And in general there is some finite value here. It can be zero or it can be different from zero.

鉴于此，我们学会了如何直接写下来，而无需处理微分方程，电容器电压 vc(t) 的答案，让我在这里定义我的 vc，等于 VI，最终值，加上 vc(0)，电容器的初始值，减去最终值，e^ t/RC。

Given that, we learned how to write down directly, without messing around with differential equations, the answer for the voltage on the capacitor vc(t), let me define also my vc right here, is equal to VI, the final value, plus vc(0), the initial value on the capacitor, minus the final value, e^ t/RC.

这是我们代入的标准方程，如果 VI 大于 VC，则它为上升指数，如果 VI 小于 VC，则它为衰减指数。这些都应该很熟悉。而且，正如笔记中指出的那样，今天的阅读是 10.3，对于新材料，您应该查看第 11 章，我们在那里讨论内存。这是我们上次所处的位置。

This is our standard equation to which we plug in, and it’s either a rising exponential if VI is larger than VC or a decaying exponential if VI is a smaller value than VC. This should all be familiar. And, again, as pointed out in the notes, the reading for today is 10.3 and for the new material you should look at Chapter 11 where we discuss memory. This is where we stood as of last time.

现在，我想进一步讨论一下电容器中的电荷存储。以及我们如何利用它来存储逻辑状态。我相信您一定知道的一件事是，也许产量最大的芯片之一实际上是所谓的 DRAM，您可以在任何地方的每台 PC 和每台计算机中找到它。

Now, I would like to discuss a little bit more about the storage of charge in capacitors. And how we can take advantage of that for storing logic state. One of the things that I am sure you must be aware of is that one of the perhaps most massively produced chips is actually the so called DRAM which you find in every PC and every computer that exists anywhere.

这种 DRAM 是一种动态随机存取存储器，我们可以在其中存储状态，并在以后的任何时间返回查看，只要我们不关闭机器。基本存储元件中的逻辑状态存储在电容器中，而每个芯片中有近 1 千兆个元件。所以今天我们将稍微玩一下这个概念。

This DRAM is dynamic random access memory in which we can store a state and come back and look at it at any time later, provided we don’t power off our machine. The logic state in the basic memory elements, of which instead there are close to 1 giga elements per chip, are stored on capacitors. And so we will play a little bit with that concept today.

虽然我们不打算讨论 DRAM 的具体示例，但您很快就会在演示中看到 DRAM 的基本元素。这就是我这里的网络对 t=0 时发生的输入 VI 的一般响应。现在，您立即意识到的一件事是，当 t 小于零时，VI 的值实际上并不重要。

And, although we’re not going to discuss the specific example of the DRAM, the basic elements of the DRAM you will see actually in a demo shortly. So that’s the general response of this network that I have here to an input VI that happens at t=0. Now, the one thing that you recognize immediately is that it really doesn’t matter what the value of VI was for t less than zero.

隐式语句

Implicit Statement

真正重要的是 t=0 时 VI 的值。这就是我们感兴趣的值。现在，这里面有一个隐含的陈述。这个陈述就是，网络在 t=0 时以某种方式出现。因此，那里必须有一些开关，你会看到，这基本上在 t=0 时将我的条件启动到那个状态。因此 VI 的历史实际上并不重要。

What really counts is the value of VI at t=0. And that’s the value that we’re interested in. Now, there is an implicit statement in that. And that statement is that somehow that network appears like this at t=0. So, there has to be some switch there, and you will see that, that basically starts my condition to that at t=0. And so the history of VI really doesn’t matter.

按照我们上面这个方程，响应将取决于初始值，也就是这里的 vc(0)。这是当时电容器上的电压。然后假设 VI 是一个大于 vc(0) 的值，将有一个上升的指数，直到达到这个值。这是时间常数 RC，这是时间。

The response following that equation that we have there will depend on the initial value which is vc(0) here. Now that is the voltage on the capacitor at that time. And then assuming that VI is a value that is larger than vc(0) will have a rising exponential that will come to this value. And this is the time constant RC and this is time.

因此，电容器从这里的某个电压开始，然后变为由输入施加的新电压，持续时间大于零。我们可以在任意时刻定义电容器的状态，比如这个时间、这个时间、这个时间、这个时间。状态。

So, the capacitor starts with some voltage here and goes to a new voltage that is imposed by the input for time greater than zero. We can define at any one time, say this time, this time, this time, this time the state of the capacitor. The state.

状态

State

电容器的状态是什么？状态是与预测未来相关的所有输入的总结。

What is the state of the capacitor? The state is the summary of all inputs that are relevant to predicting the future.

如果我知道这次电容器的状态，我就能预测它在未来会如何变化，给出这里的响应 VI。所以，预测未来。现在，电容器上的状态变量是什么？电容器上实际存储的是什么？你可以说，嗯，存储的是电压。

If I know the state of the capacitor this time, I can predict what it is going to go given a response VI here in the future. So, predicts the future. Now, what is the state variable on the capacitor? What is actually stored on the capacitor? You can say, well, what is stored is voltage.

存储的实际物理量是电荷 q，对于线性电容器，它与电压有关，让我正确地写成 vc，像这样。因此，实际状态变量是这样的。但是对于线性电容器，由于两者之间存在一对一的关系，因此 v 也是一个状态变量。好的，让我们回到原始电路。我们有

The real physical quantity that is stored is the charge q which is for linear capacitors related to the voltage, let me actually write it correctly, vc like this. So, the real state variable is this. But for a linear capacitor, since there is one to one relationship between the two, v is also a state variable. OK, so let’s then go back to our original circuit. What we have is

Vc(t)，即电容器电压的未来值，是 vc(0)、初始值和未来时间的变量输入的函数。对于 vI(t) 为常数 VI（t 大于或等于零）的情况，我们有刚刚描述的方程。没什么新鲜的。时间 t 小于或等于零时电容器的所有过去输入都总结在这个值中。

Vc(t), so that’s the future value of the voltage on the capacitor, is a function of vc(0), the initial value and the variable input now in the future time. And for the case of vI(t) being constant VI for t greater or equal than zero we have the equation that we just described. Nothing new. All the past inputs to the capacitor for time t less or equal to zero is summarized in this value.

并且 vi 是常数，因此未来是根据该常数进行预测的。所以，这就是状态的概念。电容器有一个初始状态。然后当实际达到平衡时，就会达到最终状态。

And vi being constant the future is predicted from that. So, that’s the concept of the state. There is an initial state on the capacitor. And then there is a final state that will be reached when equilibrium actually is achieved.

文中对此进行了大量的讨论，我们在此不做详细介绍，但在许多情况下，查看线性网络在两种不同条件下的响应不仅方便分析，而且也很有趣。因此，我们对两种情况感兴趣。

There is a fair amount of discussion in the text, and we don’t go in great detail here, but it is both convenient for analysis and also it’s interesting in many cases to look at the response of a linear network for two different conditions. So, we’re interested in two cases.

零状态响应

Zero State Response

一个是所谓的零状态响应。那么，零状态响应是什么呢？

One is the so called zero state response. Now, what is the zero state response?

它是对条件的响应，在该条件下，我们施加输入，同时施加电容器的初始值、初始状态为零的条件。那么我们要问它如何响应 vi(t)？那么，从零状态的电容器开始，响应是什么？它使我们能够将初始条件与对输入的响应分离。现在，您将看到这实际上非常有用。

It’s the response to a condition in which we impose an input and impose also the condition that the initial value, initial state of the capacitor is zero. So then we ask how does it respond to vi(t)? So, starting with a capacitor at zero state what is the response? It allows us to decouple the initial conditions from the response to the input. Now, you will see that this is actually very useful.

我们也非常感兴趣的第二个条件是所谓的零输入响应。那是什么？即 vi(t)=0。现在，这是没有输入的条件。vi(t)=0。这里的问题是它如何放松？我们从初始状态开始。那么，这个状态如何在电路中放松。

The second condition to which we’re also very interested is the so called zero input response. What is that? That is vi(t)=0. Now, it’s the condition under which there is no input. vi(t)=0. The question here is how does it relax? We’re starting with an initial state. So, how this state relaxes out in the circuit.

现在，零状态响应，这里是 Z，也就是我们所说的 SR，我会这样写，vC，ZSR 只是一个上升的指数。我们从零开始，然后到 VI。所以，它是 VI VI e^ t/RC。所以，这就是 ZSR。ZIR，零输入响应是这样的。它是电容器上的初始电压衰减到零或平衡。从 vC(0) 开始，我们像这样衰减。

Now, the zero state response, this one here is Z so called SR for our case, which I will write like this, vC, ZSR is simply a rising exponential. We start from zero and we go to VI. So, it’s VI VI e^ t/RC. So, that’s the ZSR. The ZIR, the zero input response is like this. It’s the decay of the initial voltage on the capacitor to zero or to equilibrium. Starting from vC(0) we’re decaying like this.

现在，从黑板上 ZIR 和 ZSR 以及最终的完整答案来看，你是否看到了一些相当明显的信息？它们是具体情况，但它们与完整答案有何关系？它们是总和。它们是两者的叠加。我们在这里看到的基本上是，这实际上是一个一般性陈述，即 vC = vC,ZSR + vC,ZIR。

Now, do you see something that’s rather obvious from what’s on the board in terms of ZIR and ZSR and the final complete answer which is there? They are specific cases, but how do they relate to the full answer? It’s the sum. It’s the superposition of the two. What basically we see here And that’s actually a general statement, is that vC = vC,ZSR + vC,ZIR.

现在，你可能会说这很简单，因为我们从那里开始，然后又回到那里，最后得到了一些非常简单的观察结果。然而，我们并不总是为阶跃响应求解网络。输入电压可能是一个斜坡。我们在复习课上就是这么做的。或者，它可能是一个脉冲。或者，它可能是一个更复杂的函数。有了这个观察结果，我们实际上可以相当巧妙地解决问题。

Now, you may say this is trivial because we started from that, ended back in that from some very simple observations. However, we are not always solving networks for responses that are steps. The input voltage may be a ramp. We did that in recitation. Or, it could be an impulse. Or, it can be a more complicated function. Having this observation in place actually allows us to solve the problem rather neatly.

如果最后有时间，我可能会再谈这个问题。所以，这是我开始时使用的相同方程，是从两个不同解的叠加原理得出的。状态的一个应用可以是，因为我们这里有能量存储元件，电容器，可以存储在电容器上的是内存。你可能会问，那么为什么我们需要一个内存节点来执行逻辑呢？

If I have time at the end, I might come back to this. So, this is the same equation as I started with, arrived at from a principle of superposition of two different solutions. One application of state which can be, since we have energy storage element here, the capacitor, which can be stored on the capacitor is in memory. And you may ask, so why do we need a memory node to perform logic?

嗯，有些情况下，结果取决于之前的结果。因此，计算会随着时间而进行。为了做到这一点，我们需要存储中间结果并继续进行。一个很好的例子是，如果你在计算器上进行连续求和，你会不断地将东西放入内存中。M+ 按钮，对吧？然后你不断地添加一系列数字。

Well, there are cases in which a result depends on previous results. So, a computation proceeds in time. In order to do that, we need to store intermediate results and proceed forward. One good example is if you’re doing a continuous summation, say, on your calculator, you keep putting things in the memory. The M+ button, right? And you keep adding a series of numbers.

每次我们存储前一个运算的总和时，我们都会添加另一个数字，依此类推。显然，我们需要某种方式来存储状态。对于一个完整的计算系统，我们需要组合逻辑和内存。事实上，这是任何类型的计算系统都必不可少的两个基本元素。我们需要记住中间结果。我们需要记住瞬时输入。

Every time we store the sum of the previous operation we add another number and so on. Clearly we need some way of storing state. For a complete computing system, we need combinational logic and we need memory. In fact, these are the two basic elements that are essential for any kind of computing system. We need to remember intermediate results. We need to remember transient inputs.

这就是计算机中大量内存的作用。基本内存抽象如下。

And that’s the role that all these enormous amount of memory that comes to play in computers is doing. The basic memory abstraction is as follows.

记忆

Memory

想象一个需要由晶体管、电阻器、电容器或任何元件填充的块。它有一个控制输入，我们将其称为存储。它有一个状态输入，我们将其称为 dIN，并有一个输出 dOUT。

Imagine a block which needs to be populated by transistor, resistor, capacitor, whatever elements. And it has a control input, which we will call the store. It has a state input that we will call dIN and has an output dOUT.

当我们告诉这个元素，好的，现在是存储时间了，它会查看输入 dIN 并将其存储，原则上，存储时间是无限的。如果我们要绘制这个图，画出它的样子，假设，让我在一个轴上完成所有这些。所以，时间就这样移动。

When we’re telling this element, OK, now it’s time to store, it looks at the input dIN and stores it for, in principle, an infinite amount of time. If we were to make a drawing of this, of what this looks like, let’s suppose, let me do all this in one axis. So, time moves this way.

假设我们有一个如下所示的输入 dIN，并且存储命令以逻辑形式出现。我们实际上建议这是逻辑 1，这是逻辑 0。并且，尽管这不是绝对必要的，我们还定义存储命令以逻辑 1 的形式出现在此存储输入中。假设存储如下所示。那么在这种特定情况下，输出是什么样子的？

Let’s suppose that we have an input dIN that looks like this, and the store command comes in the form of a logic. Let’s actually suggest here this is logic one, this is logic zero. And, although this is not absolutely necessary, let’s also define that the store command comes in the form of a logic one at this store input. Store, let’s say, looks like this. What does the output look like then in this particular case?

假设输出为 dOUT，存储元素在存储之前为零，则输出将如下所示。这是 dOUT。如您所见，它会记住此时看到的元素。事实上，无论此存储单元中存储了什么，它都会这样做。例如，假设它存储的是 1，而输出没有变化，它仍然是 1。

Assuming that the output was dOUT, the stored element was zero prior to the store, then the output would look like this. This is dOUT. As you can see, it would remember the one that it saw at this point. In fact, it would do that irrespective of what was stored in this memory cell. For example, suppose it was storing one and the output didn’t change, it’s still one.

如果它存储的是零，它会翻转为一。如果我们有另一个存储，比如这里，会发生什么？然后它会回到零，因为现在我们采样了一个零输入，我们翻转了状态。这就是记忆元件或单元能为我们做的事情。它会记住输出状态。不仅如此，原则上它应该是不可干扰的。

If it was storing a zero, it would flip to a one. If we had another store, let’s say here, then what happens? Then it would go back down to zero because now we sampled an input that is zero and we flipped the state. That’s what a memory element or cell would do for us. It would remember the output state. And, not only that, but in principle it should be undisturbable.

换句话说，我可以对这个 dOUT 做一些事情，但它不应该翻转状态。这种情况经常发生。因为在实际的集成电路存储器中，这个单元有很多很多最近的邻居，当它们翻转时，会与单元产生交叉耦合。单元必须设计得足够坚固，以免翻转，实际上不会发生耦合。好的。

In other words, I may do something to this dOUT but it should not flip the state. And that comes about quite a bit. Because in actual integrated circuit memory there is lots and lots and lots of nearest neighbors to this cell which, when they’re flipped, have a cross coupling to the cell. The cell must be designed robust enough that it doesn’t flip, that no coupling actually occurs. All right.

现在我们要尝试运用迄今为止学到的知识来发明一种基本的存储元件。信不信由你，这正是 DRAM 的关键。让我们在电路中实现它。假设我这里有一个这样的开关。

Now we’re going to try to apply what we’ve learned so far to invent a basic memory element. And, believe it or not, this is the key to the DRAM. Let’s implement this in a circuit. Suppose I have a switch here like this.

店铺

Store

我会放一个电容器。我把 dOUT 放在这里。这是 dIN。开关由我们称为 store 的命令操作。当 store 为 1 时，它会上升。

And I will put a capacitor. I take my dOUT here. This is dIN. And the switch is operated by a command here that we will call store. When store is one it goes up.

当存储为零时，它就在这里。这是电容器 C。这是存储节点。在这种情况下我们实际上存储的是什么？假设这里的电压是 5 伏。我将开关拨到 1，然后将其拨回 0。这里这个电容器的电压是多少？5 伏。

When store is zero it is down here. That’s capacitor C. This is the storage node. What are we actually storing in this case? Let’s suppose that this voltage here is 5 volts. I flip the switch up to one and I flip it back down to zero. What’s the voltage in this capacitor here? 5 volts.

现在电容器的电压为 5 伏，我将 dIN 接地，将开关调高，然后调低至其已知的存储状态。电容器中的电压是多少？它正好是零。因此，它确实存储了它看到的电压值，五或零，高或低。它存储它是因为它存储电荷。这实际上是存储的物理量。它表现为我们看到的电压。好的。

Now the capacitor is at 5 volts, I put dIN to ground, flip the switch back up and then back down to its known storing condition. What’s the voltage in the capacitor? It’s zero, exactly. So, it does store the value of the voltage that it saw, five or zero, high and low. It stores it because it stores charge. That’s actually the physical quantity that’s stored. It’s manifested as a voltage, which we see. All right.

现在，在我离开这里之前，这是。DRAM 中的基本单元是什么？你出去买的数十亿个单元是什么？它实际上是这样的。唯一的区别是这里的开关被 MOSFET 取代了。

Now, is this, oh, before I move from here. What is the basic cell in a DRAM, one that you go out and buy by the billions of cells? It’s actually this. The only difference is that this switch here is replaced with a MOSFET.

场效应晶体管

MOSFET

这就是全部了。因此，MOSFET 充当开关的角色。当栅极为高电平时，它就是一个电阻器，并将输入连接到电容器。

And that’s all it is. So, a MOSFET plays the role of the switch. When the gate is high this is a resistor and connects the input to the capacitor.

当栅极电压低于阈值电压时，就会出现开路，正如我们所见，它会将晶体管与输出隔离开来。这就是基本的存储元件。正如我所说，它是 DRAM 的关键。好的。现在让我们考虑一下这个东西的运行条件。让我在两种条件下画出电路。

And when the gate voltage is below the threshold voltage this is an open, as we’ve seen, and it isolates the transistor from the output. So, that’s the basic memory element. And, as I said, it’s the key to a DRAM. OK. Now let’s consider a little bit the conditions of operation of this thing. Let me draw the circuit in two conditions.

一个用于存储，一个用于采样，一个用于存储。不要重绘这个东西。假设我有一个 MOSFET，当 store=1 时，我会在这里设置导通电阻。现在，原则上，输出连接到某个负载电阻。我们稍后会进一步讨论这个负载电阻。这是 store=1 时的情况。

One in which it is storing, one in which it is sampling and one in which it is storing. Not to redraw this thing. Assuming that I have a MOSFET there, I would have the on resistance in place here when store=1. Now, in principle, the output is connected to some load resistance. We’ll talk a little bit more about this load resistance in a minute. This is the situation when we are at store=1 situation.

例如，假设 dIN 为 5 伏。那么，store=0 的情况是什么？这很简单。我们有电容器 C 和 dOUT，这里我们有一个电阻。开关打开。这是 store=0 的情况。在这种情况下，我们遇到的问题与我之前讨论的问题类似。如果你愿意的话，这是一个 ZIR 情况。

For example, let’s suppose that dIN is 5 volts. Now, what is the situation for store=0? It’s very simple. We have the capacitor C and dOUT and here we have a resistance. The switch is open. This is store=0 condition. What we have in this case is we have a problem similar to what I was discussing earlier. It is a ZIR, if you like, situation.

如果我们从电容器上的零电荷开始，你可以将其视为 ZSR，但我对这部分感兴趣。在这种情况下，我从 vC(0)=5 伏开始。我问自己这个单元将保存该值多长时间？事实上，这实际上是动态 RAM 中发生的情况。电容器上的值不会永久存储。

And this you can think of as a ZSR if we’re starting with zero charge on the capacitor, but I’m interested in this part. In this case, I am starting with a vC(0)=5 volts. And I’m asking myself how long will this cell hold the value? And, in fact, that is actually what happens in a dynamic RAM. The value on the capacitor is not stored forever.

事实上，这就是我们称其为动态的原因，因为我们必须时不时地回来恢复它。我们要储存电荷多长时间？开关拨动后，t 大于零时，vc 的响应是什么？这很简单。vc 等于 5 伏特 e 减 t 除以 RC，对吗？这就是响应。我们有衰减。并应用于我们知道的东西。

In fact, that’s why we call it dynamic because we have to come back and restore it every once in a while. For how long are we going to store the charge? What’s the response of vc for t greater than zero after the switch flicked? It’s very simple. It’s vc is equal to 5 volts e to the minus t over RC, right? That’s the response. We have a decay. And applying to the things we know.

我们从 5 伏开始，假设这里，我有一个衰减过程，直到接近零，在某个点，我们将越过高阈值。如果电容器存储的是 1，那么我获得有效输出的唯一时间段就是此处的这个时间段。

We start from 5 volts, let’s say here, I have a decay going down towards zero, at some point we are going to cross the threshold for high. The only period in which I have a valid output, if the capacitor was storing a one, is this period here.

这是我存储有效数据的唯一时间段，因为一旦超过此处的大写 T，我就超过了法定限制，即判断高输出的阈值。从那时起，输出不再有效。因此，只要时间少于大写 T，此内存就是好的。这不是电容器可以永远保持电荷的情况。

This is the only period in which I have valid stored one because, once I go beyond capital T here, I have crossed the legal limit, threshold for discriminating a high output. And from then on the output is no longer valid. So, this memory is good provided time is less than capital T. It’s not a case in which the capacitor can hold charge forever.

事实上，我们可以计算，也就是说，我们可以在这个特定情况下求解 T。它在你的笔记里。没有什么特别深奥的东西。T 等于减去 RC log VOH 除以 5 伏。所以，这基本上就是响应。现在，这里有一个隐含的假设，即存储脉冲宽度比 RON C 大得多。

In fact, we can calculate, that is we can solve for T in this particular case. It’s in your notes. Nothing really profound. T is equal to minus RC log VOH over 5 volts. So, this is basically what the response is going to be. Now, there is an implicit assumption here, which is that the store pulse width is much, much larger than RON C.

换句话说，当我们想从零开始存储一个 1 时，我们最好在开关连接这里的时间内将其充电至 5 伏。相关的时间常数是多少？它将是 RON C。事实上，它实际上是 RON 与 RL 并联 C。但通常 RON 比 RL 小得多，所以我们不必担心这一点。

In other words, when we want to store a one here starting from zero, we better charge it all the way up to 5 volts in the time that our switch is connected here. And what is the relevant time constant? It’s going to be the RON C. In fact, it’s actually the RON parallel RL with C. But typically RON is much, much less than RL so we don’t have to worry about that.

主要时间常数是 RON C。因此，只要这些事情发生，我们就有记忆。

Dominant time constant is RON C. So, provided these things are happening, we have a memory.

缓冲

Buffer

现在，我们可以尝试稍微改进一下。我们在这里看到，在时间 T 内，我们将衰减到无效状态。我们如何改进呢？改进的一种方法是使用缓冲器。这是我们的存储元件。这是电容器。这是存储节点。现在我要添加缓冲效果。

Now, we can try to improve things a little bit. We see here that we will have a decay to an invalid state in time T. How can we improve things? One way to improve things are the buffer. Here is our memory element again. Here is the capacitor. This is the storing node. Now I am going to put the buffering effect.

我要在这里放置两个缓冲器。应该说是两个反相器，因为如果我在这里存储一个 1，那么我也希望能够在这里看到一个 1。在这种情况下，我要查看的是缓冲器的 RIN。原则上，我在这里有 RL。

I am going to put two buffers here. Two invertors, I should say, because if I am storing a one here I want to be able to see a one here as well. And, in this case, what I am looking at is the RIN of the buffer. And, in principle, I have out here the RL.

现在，这更好，因为如果 RIN 比 RL 大得多，那么时间 T 在这种情况下会比没有缓冲器的情况大得多。因此，我们缓冲了 VL 的影响。这可以是我们在复习中看到的这些简洁电路之一，例如源极落差，或者它可以只是一个反相器，在这种情况下，您只会看到晶体管的输入。所以，现在可以满足这个条件了。

Now, this is better because if RIN is much larger than RL then the time T, in this case, is much larger than the case without buffer. So, we buffer the effect of VL. This could be one of these neat circuits we saw in recitation like a source faller, for example, or it can be just an inverter in which case you just see the input of a transistor. So, now this condition can be satisfied.

让我举几个例子，这些数字是动态 RAM 的典型值。我们讨论的典型时间是 RIN 约为 1 千兆欧姆，存储节点电容约为 1 飞法拉到 1 皮法拉。现在，如果你能心算一下，也就是乘法，你会看到时间常数 RC 在 1 毫秒到 1 微秒之间。

Let me give you some cases which are some numbers that are typical for a dynamic RAM. Typical times we’re talking about is RIN on order of 1 gigaohm and storage node capacitor on order of 1 femtofarad to one picofarad. Now, if you can do the math in your head, which is just multiplication, you will see that the time constant, the RC is between 1 millisecond to 1 microsecond.

对于 DRAM，我们实际上会尝试将其保持在毫秒级。这就是我们谈论的时间。如果我有这种电路，那么就必须有额外的电路返回，在这里采样电压并恢复它。这实际上就是 DRAM 中发生的事情。我的笔记本电脑在那里工作，它的 DRAM 每隔几毫秒或无论什么条件都会不断刷新。

And for DRAMs, actually, we try to be in the order of milliseconds. These are the times we’re talking about. If I have this kind of circuit, somehow there has got to be additional circuitry that comes back, samples the voltage here and restores it. And that is actually what is happening in a DRAM. And my laptop is working there and its DRAM keeps getting refreshed every, say, millisecond or whatever the condition is.

静态 RAM

Static RAM

但是，在我们的例子中，我们将进行稍微不同的情况，其中我们将创建静态存储器。首先，让我们实际看一下放电的情况。请注意，让我在这里实际打破循环。这是我的电容器。这是一个与电容器串联的电阻器，如您在此处看到的。

But, in our case, we are going to do a slightly different case in which we will create a static memory. Let’s actually look at, first of all, the case of the discharge. Pay attention to, let me actually break the loop here. This is my capacitor. This is a resistor that is in series with a capacitor like you see here.

实际上，即使在这种情况下，我也会将该电阻与电容器串联，因为我将其用于示例的第二部分。我将电容器充电至 5 伏。您可以看到这里会亮起，我希望每个人都能看到，这与我这里的电压成正比。从这里开始，它都是逻辑电平。因此，这里的光强度将始终相同。

Actually, I am going to keep that resistor in series with the capacitor, even in this case, because I have it for my second part of my example. I charge the capacitor to 5 volts. And you can see here this lights up, I hope everybody can see it, proportional to the voltage that I have here. From here on it’s all logic levels. So, the intensity of light here will always be the same.

它要么亮，要么不亮。现在我正在给电容器充电。事实上，让我们看看。也许我可以先给电容器放电。这里电容器放电了。如你所见，输入为零，输出为一，然后这个逆变器的输出为一。我有两个串联的逆变器。我要给电容器充电。

It’s either lit or it’s not lit. Right now I am charging the capacitor. In fact, let’s see. Maybe I can discharge the capacitor first. Here the capacitor is discharged. As you can see, the input is zero, the output is a one, and then the output of this inverter here is a one. I have two inverters in series. And I am going to charge the capacitor.

我给它充电到 5 伏，然后这个亮了，当然这个不亮了，这是一个反相器，这是一个有效的零，产生一个有效的零。现在我要把输入取出来。如你所见，它被存储了。事实上，我们必须等待很长时间。

I charged it to 5 volts and this lit up, this is off of course, that’s an inverter, this is a valid zero, produce a valid one. And now I am going to take the input out. As you can see it’s stored. In fact, we have to wait for a very long time.

我们没有足够的时间等待它放电，所以我现在要做的是添加电阻。现在我要翻转与电容器并联的电阻，以模拟输入电阻时发生的情况。您看到电容器放电了。这个输入电平下降了。这里的电压翻转为 1。

We don’t have enough time to wait for this to discharge, so instead what I am going to do now is I am going to add also the resistor. Now I am going to flip the resistor in parallel with the capacitor to imitate what happens when we have an input resistance. You saw that there was a discharge of the capacitor. This input level went down. Voltage here flipped over to a one.

现在让我再做一次，将电阻放在适当的位置。将电荷存储在电容器上。这是存储命令。现在，不要存储。我的时间少了，大约一秒钟。这里的元件是 20,000 微法拉和 100 欧姆，这给了我两秒的时间常数。

Let me do it again now with a resistor in place. Storing charge on the capacitor. That’s the store command. Now, don’t store. I have less, about a second. The element here is 20,000 microfarads and 100 ohms which gives me a time constant of two seconds.

假设 VOC 的数量级为，比如说，我不知道这个例子中 VOC 是多少，2.5，对数约为 0.5，因此基本上将时间缩短到大约 1。所以，如果我的计算正确的话，它持续大约一秒钟。实际上，它比一秒钟稍长一点，对不起，但重点是电荷消失了。

Assuming a VOC of the order of, let’s say, I don’t know what it is for this case, 2.5, the log would be about 0.5, so it cuts basically the time to about one. So, it lasts about one second, if my math is all correct. It’s actually a little longer than a second, excuse me, but the point is that the charge is gone.

补充

Complement

但是，请注意，我可以在这里做一件事，那就是假设我拿一个开关或一个开关，把它带回来，并提供一条从输出到输入的路径。当这个关闭时，这个开关打开，当这个打开时，这个开关关闭。所以，这基本上是对商店的补充。

Now, notice, however, that there is something I can do here, which is that suppose I take the switch or a switch and bring it back and provide a path from the output to the input here. And this switch is open when this is closed and closed when this is open. So, this basically is the compliment of store.

我现在要做的是在这里放置一个电荷，它会在此时产生一个有效电荷，然后我将这个有效电荷反馈给输入端。如您所见，即使电阻很高，这也允许我长时间存储该值。在这种情况下，我要做的是连接输出，如您在此处所见。

What I am doing now is I put a charge here, it produces a valid one at this point, and then I am feeding this valid one back to the input. As you can see, this will now allow me, even though I have a high resistance, to store the value for a long time. In this case, what I am going to do is I am going to connect the output, as you can see here.

我把电阻放进去。我在这里存储零，存储 5 伏。现在我要拨动开关。基本上，我的意思是不存储，不看的情况。您会注意到它变暗了一点。抱歉。不，我想要电阻。在那里。是的。好的，所以输出保持值。它变暗了一点，但输出保持正常。好的。所以，我们提供了反馈。现在我们创建了一个静态内存。

And I have my resistor in. And I am storing zero here, storing 5 volts. Now I am going to flip the switch. Basically, I mean the don’t store, don’t look case. You notice this dims a little bit. Sorry. No, I want the resistor in. There. Yes. OK, so the output remain value. This dimmed a little bit but the output has remained OK. All right. So, we’ve provided a feedback. Now we’ve created a static memory.

只要电路通电，它就会保持电荷。现在，这种配置还有一个小问题。那就是如果我干扰这个输出，电荷可能会改变，状态可能会改变。所以，例如，假设我通过靠近它来干扰它，那么让我们再次给它充电。好的。我扳动了开关。我从输出端扳动了状态。

This will hold charge for as long as the circuit is powered up. Now, there is still one little problem that I have with this kind of configuration. And that is if I disturb this output the charge may, the state may change. So, for example, let’s say that I have I disturbed it by coming close to it, so let’s charge it again. OK. I flipped the switch. I flipped the state from the output.

这是一个无效条件。我不应该这样做。我该如何避免这种情况？我该如何避免您刚刚看到的这个问题？好吧，我还需要另一个缓冲区。答案就在您的笔记中。如果我不在这里获取输出，而是在这里获取输出，或者如果我不想要反转输出，如果我不想要反转输出，我可以在那里放置另一个元素。

That is an invalid condition. I shouldn’t be able to do that. How do I avoid that? How can I avoid this problem that you just saw? Well, I need yet another buffer. The answer is in your notes. If I don’t take the output here but rather take the output here, or if I don’t want an inverted output, if I don’t want an inverted output, I could put yet another element there.

那么情况就好了。在这种情况下，让我再做一次。充电。为什么这个不亮？坏了？现在，当然我们扰乱了输入。现在，当然我可以在这里做任何我想做的事情。什么都没有发生，但你可能会说这是一个微不足道的情况，因为这已经是零了。所以，我要改变状态。这是改变后的状态。看。我可以展示一下。上面什么都没有发生。

Then the situation would be fine. In this case, let me do it again. Charge. Why isn’t this lit? A bad one? Now, of course we disturbed the input. Now, of course I can do anything I want here. Nothing happens, but you may say this is a trivial case because this is already zero. So, I am going to change the state. Here’s is the changed state. See. I can show this. Nothing happens up there.

内存示例

Memory Example

所以，这是一个有趣的情况，我缓冲输出，这样输出就不会反馈到输入。总的来说，在设计电路时，我们会这样做。现在，在剩下的三分钟里，我们有一个例子。我们可以把笔记本电脑放在这里吗？好的，这里有一个例子，说明如何将内存组合在一起以创建更复杂的东西。

So, this is an interesting situation in which I am buffering the output so that the output does not feed back to the input. And, by and large, in designing circuits this is something that we do. Now, in the remaining three minutes there is an example that we have. Can we put the laptop here? OK, so here is an example of how memory can be put together now to create something a little bit more complicated.

您可以看到我们在这里讨论的存储单元。它们有四个，所以这是一个四位存储器。这里开头有一个解码器，它解码每个单元的地址，所以这里的输入将告诉我需要寻址哪个单元。让我们看看真值表。这是解码器的真值表。

And you can see the memory cells that we were discussing here. There’s four of them, so this is a four bit memory. There is a decoder at the beginning here which decodes the address of each cell, so the input here will tell me which cell I need to address. Let’s look at the truth table. This is the truth table for the decoder.

如您所见，根据我这里的地址，这是二进制系统中的零、一、二和三，只有 A、B、C 或 D 处于上升沿，处于高位。这意味着这里的结束操作只允许呈现给所有单元的输入，即通过这里的与门的内容出现在输出端。

As you can see, depending on the address that I have here, this is zero, one, two and three in a binary system, only A, B, C or D is up, is high. Which means that this end operation here only allows the input that is presented to all of the cells, what is going through the AND gate here to appear at the output.

例如，如果我们有一个 1，即零，那么唯一会处于高位的终端输入就是这个。这意味着当存储出现时，唯一会查看输入的单元就是这里的单元。此时，它将存储输入单元上的任何内容，因为这是一个 AND 操作。这是一个内存的简单示例。按照这种简单的安排，您可以构建非常大的内存系统。所以，这就是我今天要讲的全部内容。星期二见。

If, for example, we have a one, zero, the only end input that is going to be high is going to be this one. And that means the only cell that will look at the input when the store comes up is going to be this one here. At that point it will store whatever is on the input cell because that’s an AND operation. That is a simple example of a memory. And following that simple arrangement you can build incredibly large memory systems. So, that’s all I had for today. And I will see you on Tuesday.

Lec 15 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 15 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 50:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=ypX20WnHNQw

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 50:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=ypX20WnHNQw

介绍

Introduction

好的。大家早上好。所以，如果你愿意的话，我们今天又向前迈进了一大步，进入了一个新的理解层面。在过去的一个半星期里，我们的重点是存储元件或称为电感器和电容器的存储元件。电容器存储变化，电感器本质上将能量存储在磁场中，即磁通量。电感器的状态变量是电流，而电容器的状态变量是电容器电压。

All right. Good morning, all. So we take another big step forward today and get onto a new plane of understanding, if you will. In the last week and a half, our focus was on the storage element or storage elements called inductors and capacitors. And capacitors stored change and inductors essentially stored energy in the field, the magnetic flux. And the state variable for an inductor was the current while that for a capacitor was the capacitor voltage.

我们还研究了包含单个存储元件的电路、RC 电路以及包含单个电感器的电路。这是一个带有电阻器和电流源或电压源等的单个电感器。我们今天要做的是做所谓的“二阶系统”。

We also looked at circuits containing a single storage element, we looked at RC circuits and we also looked at circuits containing a single inductor. And this was a single inductor with a resistor and a current source or a voltage source and so on. What we are going to do today is do what are called “second order systems”.

二阶系统

Second Order Systems

所以他们现在正在下一班飞机上。

So they are on the next plane now.

对于这种二阶系统，它们的特点是电路包含两个独立的储能元件。它们可以是一个电感器和一个电容器，也可以是两个独立的电容器。最后你会看到我所说的两个独立电容器是什么意思。如果我有两个并联的电容器，它们可以表示为一个等效电容器，这样就不算数了。它必须是两个独立的储能元件、电阻器和电压源等等。

And with this second order of systems, they are characterized by circuits containing two independent storage elements. They could be an inductor and a capacitor or two independent capacitors. And you will see towards the end what I mean by two independent capacitors. If I have two capacitors in parallel, they can be represented as a single equivalent capacitor so that doesn’t count. It has to be two independent energy storage elements and resistors and voltage sources and so on.

我们最终得到的是所谓的“二阶动力学”。就像一阶电路用一阶微分方程表示一样，这种电路最终会得到二阶微分方程。在深入讨论之前，我想先解释一下，并举一个例子来说明为什么研究这一点很重要。有很多例子，但我只举一个例子。

And what we end up getting is what is called “second order dynamics”. And much as first order circuits were represented using first order differential equations, this kind you end up getting second order differential equations. Before we go into this, I would like to start motivating this and give you one example of why this is important to study. There are many, many examples but I will give you one.

逆变器

Inverters

我想做的是让大家注意我们老式的逆变器驱动第二个逆变器。我们用来推动 RC 研究的电路相同，一个逆变器驱动另一个逆变器。让我画出电路。这是一个逆变器。假设电压为 5 伏，电阻为 2 千欧姆。我将这个逆变器的输出连接到第二个逆变器。

What I would like to do is draw your attention to our good old inverter driving a second inverter. The same circuit that we used to motivate RC studies, one inverter driving another. So let me draw the circuit. Here is one inverter. This is, let’s say, 5 volts and this is, let’s say, 2 kilo ohms. And I connect the output of this inverter to a second inverter.

我们在前几节课中看到，在这个特定示例中，有一个寄生电容或与该 MOSFET 栅极相关的电容。这可以通过在 MOSFET 栅极和地之间放置一个电容 CGS 来建模。我们看到这里的波形，如果我这里有某种阶跃。比如说，从高到低的阶跃。

And what we saw in the last few lectures was that in this specific example there was a parasitic capacitor or a capacitor associated with the gate of this MOSFET. And that could be modeled by sticking a capacitor CGS between the gate of the MOSFET and ground. And we saw that the waveforms here, if I had some kind of step here. Let’s say, for example, a step that went from high to low.

然后在这里，我会有一个过渡，它不是像这样快速上升，而是稍微缓慢地过渡。这种过渡的特点是 RC 时间常数。这就是导致最终输出延迟的原因。这就是我们之前看到的，单个储能元件。

Then out here I would have a transition that instead of going up rapidly like this would transition a little bit more slowly. And this transition was characterized by an RC time constant. And this is what gave rise to a delay in the eventual output. So that is what we saw previously, single energy storage element.

今天我们要做的就是观察同一条赛道，完全相同的赛道，并且享受其中的乐趣。

Today what we are going to do is we are going to look at the same circuit, the exact same circuit, and have some fun with it.

RC 电路

RC Circuit

我们要说的是，你看，这个东西速度很慢，所以我想做的是，我们为什么不继续把它放上去呢？我们将看到的是，黄色波形是此处输入的波形。

What we are going to say is look, this thing is pretty slow, so what I would like to do is why don’t we go ahead and put that up. What we are going to see is that the yellow waveform is the waveform at the input here.

这里的绿色波形是这个中间节点的波形。请注意，这里的波形具有 RC 电路典型的缓慢上升特性。这里还有一些其他奇怪的现象，比如一个小凸起之类的。你现在可以忽略所有这些。

And the green waveform here is the waveform at this intermediate node. And notice that this waveform here is characterized by the slowly rising characteristics that are typical of an RC circuit. There are some other weirdnesses and so on going on here like a little bump and stuff like that. You can ignore all of that for now.

这是因为某些其他非常微妙的电路效应，你不会处理这些效应，称为米勒效应等，你不会在 6.002 中处理这些效应。所以请关注这部分。它非常慢。由于上升速度缓慢，我得到了非常缓慢的转换，并且我的反相器也出现了一些延迟。所以你会说，啊哈，我们在 6.002 中学习过这个，我可以让它运行得更快。

It happens because of certain other very subtle circuit effects that you won’t be dealing with, called Miller effects and so on that you won’t be dealing with in 6.002. So focus then on this part here. It is pretty slow. And because of that slow rising, I get a very slow transition and I get some delay in my inverter. So you say ah ha, we learned about this in 6.002, I can make it go faster.

如何让电路运行得更快？你能做什么？它上升得非常慢。如何让它运行得更快？有人能做到吗？实际上，你有多种选择。你在这里的选择是什么？对不起。减少时间常数。你如何减少时间常数？电容连接到这里的 MOSFET 栅极。我一开始并不想要它，但它就在那里，我无能为力，所以我可以减少电阻。

How can you make the circuit go faster? What could you do? This is rising very slowly. How can you make it go faster? Anybody? You have multiple choices, actually. What are your choices here? Pardon. Decrease the time constant. And how would you decrease the time constant? The capacitance is connected to this MOSFET gate here. I didn’t want it in the first place but it is there, I cannot help it, so I can decrease the resistance.

很好。让我继续做。我要做的是，我要把这个吸盘敲掉，然后插入一个新的电阻，比如说 50 欧姆，一个小得多的电阻。这样应该会加快速度，对吧？这应该会让事情进展得更快，因为这是一个较小的时间常数，因为 R 较小，对吗？好的，让我们开始做吧。让我们看看我们是否能得到我们期望的结果。

Good. Let me go ahead and do that. What I will do is I am going to knock this sucker out and stick in a new resistance that is say 50 ohms, a much smaller resistance. That should speed things up, right? That should make things go much faster because this is a smaller time constant because R is smaller, correct? OK, let’s go do it. And let’s see if we get what we expect.

这里有一个小开关。使用这个开关，我将接通这个小电阻。哇，那里到底发生了什么？这太有趣了。我所做的是在这里接通一个小电阻来降低时间常数，但看起来我得到了一大堆我没有想到的废话。

I have a little switch here. And using that switch, I am going to switch in this little resistance. Whoa, what on earth is happening out there? This is so much fun. What I did is I switched in a small resister here to decrease the time constant, but it looks like I got a whole bunch of crapola that I did not bargain for.

这当然非常快，它上升得非常快，但我不确定它会去哪里。让我们再看一会儿。让我为你扩大时间尺度。看看这个。不是平滑地上升。我得到的是这样的。它看起来像正弦曲线。

This is certainly very fast, it goes up really fast, but I am not sure where it is going, though. Let’s stare at that a little while longer. Let me expand the time scale for you. Look at this. Instead of a nice little smooth thing going up. I get something that looks like this. It looks something like a sinusoid.

它看起来是正弦波，但它是一条正弦波，它会逐渐减弱、逐渐疲劳、逐渐消失。对吧？它会逐渐消失。所以到目前为止，你所学到的一切都无法让你为此做好准备。相信我，很久很久以前，当我第一次自己做一些电路设计时，我就被它迷住了。

It looks sinusoidal, but then it is a sinusoid that kind of gives up and kind of gets tired and kind of goes away. Right? It kind of dies out. So nothing that you have learned so far has prepared you for this. And, trust me, when I first did some circuit designs myself a long, long time ago I got nailed by that.

我查看了我的电路，结果发现所有转换处都有这些尖锐的线条。当我查看示波器时，我本以为会看到漂亮的小方波，但我看到那里有一些令人讨厌的小尖峰。然后，当我更仔细地观察它时，这些尖峰实际上是正弦波，似乎有点疲倦并消失了。

I looked at my circuit, and what ended up happening was I was noticing these sharp lines at all my transitions. When I looked at my scope, I expected to see nice little square waves but I saw these little nasty spikes sitting out there. And then when I stared at it more carefully, those spikes were really sinusoids that seemed to kind of get tired and kind of go away.

所以这些事情很可怕，这些事情是真实存在的，而且它们一直在发生。我们今天要做的就是尝试深入研究并理解为什么会出现这种情况。我们将了解如何通过设计来消除这种情况。顺便说一句，这是一个真正的问题。而这之所以是一个真正的问题，原因如下。看看这个。往下看。

So those are nasty, those are real and they happen all the time. And what we will do today is try to get into that and understand why that is the case. We will understand how to design that away. And that is a real problem, by the way. And the reason that is a real problem is the following. Look at this. Look down here.

因为这个中间电压蜿蜒地流经这里的整个乡村，所以在这个特定点，中间电压会下降得相当低。因为它下降得相当低，所以看看输出。输出在这里有一个凸起。这个输出凸起现在很有可能进入禁区。或者更糟。如果这里的摆动更高，它实际上可能会达到 1，所以我会在这里得到一个错误的 1 脉冲。

Because this intermediate voltage is meandering all over the countryside here, at this particular point the intermediate voltage dips quite low. And because it dips quite low look at the output. The output has a bump here. And it is quite possible for this output bump to now go into the forbidden region. Or worse. If this swing here was higher, this could have actually gone onto a one, so I would have gotten a false one pulse here.

我不会得到一个从一到零的过渡，而是会得到从一到零，哦，回到一，哦，回到零，然后再回到零。所以这是很糟糕的事情，真的很糟糕。我们今天要做的是了解为什么会出现这种情况，看看我们能否解释它。这里发生了什么？这里真正发生的事情是看看这里的电路。

Instead of having a nice one to zero transition, I would have gotten a one to zero, oh, back to one, oh, back to zero and then back down to zero. So this is nasty stuff, really, really nasty stuff. What we will do is understand why that is the case today and see if we can explain it. What is going on here? What is really going on here is take a look at this circuit here.

我将看一下这里的路径。这是您的 VS 电压源。路径像这样绕一圈。事实证明，这个电路是一个环路。当有电流流动时，回到基础物理学，您会记得我也封闭了一些量。因​​此，环路中会有电流流动。因此，这里有一个有效电感。

I will take a look at this path here. So this is your VS voltage source. Path kind of goes like this and around. It turns out that this circuit is a loop here. And when there is current flow, going down to basic physics you remember that I also enclose some amount. So there is a current flowing in a loop. And because of that there is an effective inductance here.

事实上，任何流过接地平面上方导线的电流都可以用电感来表征。所以我可以通过在这里粘一个小电感来模拟它。所以我的真实电路不完全是一个电阻和一个电容，但我的真实电路也是一个电感，它因为这条导线而发挥作用。每根导线，当有电流流动时，都会有一个与之相关的电感。

And, in fact, any current flowing through a wire above a ground plane, for that matter, can be characterized by the inductance. So I can model that by sticking a little inductor here. So my real circuit is not exactly a resistor and a capacitor, but my real circuit is an inductor as well that comes into play because of this wire. Every wire, when there is a current flow, has an inductance associated with it.

因此，真正的电路由电阻器、电感器和电容器组成。所以我现在有两个存储元件，它们的动态与单个存储元件的动态非常不同。这只是我们研究电感器很重要的一点动机。我可以在这里画一个快速电路。如果你看一下电路，从地线开始，电压为 VS，这里有一个电阻器。

And because of that the real circuit is resistor, inductor and capacitor. So I end up with two storage elements now, and the dynamics of that are very different from that with a single storage element. That is just a bit of motivation for why our study of inductors is important. And I can draw a quick circuit here. If you look at the circuit, start from ground, the voltage VS and there is a resistor here.

然后我有一个电感器，然后我有一个电容器。所以它是一个电压源、电阻器、电感器和电容器。整个星期我们将研究这样的电路。今天我想做的是从非常简单的开始，从最简单的形式开始，这样你就可以开始积累你的洞察力，然后进入更复杂的情况。

And then I have an inductor and then I have a capacitor. So it is a voltage source, resistor, inductor and capacitor. For this whole week we will be looking at circuits like this. Today what I would like to do is start very simple, start with the simplest possible form of this so that you can begin building up your insight and then go into more complicated cases.

今天，我将从没有电阻的情况开始，简单研究一下电压源、电感器和电容器，了解这里的电压是什么样子。所以我们来看看像这样的小系统的动态。在我们继续之前，我想提醒你一些事情。

Today what I will do is simply begin with a case where I don’t have a resistor here and simply study a voltage source, an inductor and a capacitor and understand what the voltage looks like out here. So we look at the dynamics of a little system like this. Before we go on, I want to caution you about something.

我在这里介绍基于寄生电容的电容器和基于寄生电感的电感，这纯属偶然。我不希望给你们留下电感和电容器“不好”的印象。因为当你想到寄生时，你知道，寄生虫。这些都是寄生的。你没想到它们会出现在那里，没想到这里会出现，所以我们得到了奇怪的行为。所以寄生对它们来说有不好的含义。

It is just happenstance that I have introduced for you capacitors based on the parasitic capacitance here and inductance based on parasitic inductance. I would hate to leave you with the impression that inductors and capacitors are “bad”. Because when you think of a parasitic, you know, parasites. These are parasitic. You didn’t expect them there, didn’t expect this here and we got the weird behavior. So parasitics have a bad connotation to them.

我不想让您对电容器和电感器产生不好印象，认为它们只是坏东西。我们必须处理它们，处理二阶微分方程和所有这些东西，因为它们只是坏东西，我们必须处理它们。我不希望您最终一辈子都讨厌电容器和电感器。

I do not want to leave you with a bad taste in your mouth about capacitors and inductors that these are just bad things. We just have to deal with them and deal with second order differential equations and all that stuff because they’re just bad stuff and we just have to deal with them. I don’t want you to end up going through life hating capacitors and inductors.

只是因为我选择的例子，所以才将它们作为电容器来介绍。我想指出，这些本身就是基本的集总元件。它们是非常重要和有用的电路，我们设计电容器和电感器是因为我们希望它们在其中。我们将研究许多电路，我们真正希望在其中使用电感器。

Just because of my choice of examples, it just happened to be introducing them as capacitors. I want to point out that these are fundamental lumped elements in their own right. They are very, incredibly important and useful circuits where we designed capacitors and inductors because we want to have them in there. There are many circuits that we will look at where we really want the inductor in there.

我们将通过在线圈中缠绕导线来设计电感器，从而获得更大的电感等。请记住，在某些情况下这可能是寄生现象，但在很多情况下这是好事，电感器是好的，所以坚持这个想法就好。这些大多是好的，所以不要到处讨厌它们。好吧。让我们继续分析这样的基本电路。

We will design an inductor by wrapping wire around in a coil and get bigger inductances and so. Just remember that this can be parasitic in some cases, but in many cases it’s good, inductors are good, so just stick with that thought. These are mostly good so don’t go around hating them. All right. Let’s go on and analyze a basic circuit like this.

基础

Foundations

在接下来的一个小时里，我想讲讲这类事情的基础。我将带你了解这些基础，让你了解它是如何运作的。和往常一样，我最终会打下基础，帮助你理解我们为什么会走到今天这一步，然后帮助你建立直觉。

And what I would like to cover in the next hour are the foundations of something like that. I will take you through the foundations so you understand how it works. And, as always, what I am going to end up with is build up the foundations, help you understand why we got where we were and then help you build intuition.

然后向你展示一种非常简单直观的做事方式，就像专家做事一样。EECS 真正酷的地方在于，按照专家的方式做事，最终事情真的非常简单。但你需要建立一些直觉才能达到这一点。

And then show you a really, really simple intuitive way of doing things in terms of how experts do it. And the real cool thing about EECS is that the way experts do things, things are really, really very simple in the end. But you need to build up some intuition to get there.

电路

Circuit

因此，就我的两个存储元件而言，我们的电路看起来是这样的。

So our circuit looks like this in terms of my two storage elements.

我有一个电压 vI、电感器 L、电容器 C，我将查看电容器两端的电压和流过电容器的电流。因此，v(t) 是电容器两端的电压，而电流是通过此环路的电流，它与流过电容器的电流或流过电感器的电流相同。

I have a voltage vI, inductor L, capacitor C and I am going to look at the voltage across the capacitor and my current through the capacitor. So v(t) is the voltage across the capacitor and my current is the current through this loop here, which is the same as the current through the capacitor or the current through the inductor.

我们将以与一阶微分方程完全相同的方式进行，写下方程，然后砰砰砰砰，按照相同的步骤进行，但只是到达不同的地方。我们将从为这个节点写一个节点方程开始。这是我唯一一个电压未知的节点。

And we are going to proceed in exactly the same manner as we did for first order differential equations, write the equations down and just boom, boom, boom, boom, go down the same sets of steps but just get to some place different. We are going to start by writing a node equation for this node here. That’s the only node for which I have an unknown voltage.

这里的节点是 vI，所以我需要找到它，只有一个未知的节点电压。

The node here is vI, so I need to find this, there’s just one unknown node voltage.

元素定律

Element Laws

我需要一些元素定律。对于电容器，我知道 iV 关系由电容器的 I 给出，即 Cdv/dt。为了显示电容器，我将其称为 dvc/dt。同样，对于电感器 L，电感器两端的电压由 Ldi/dt 给出。

And I am going to need some element laws. For the capacitor I know the iV relation is given by the I for the capacitor is Cdv/dt. And just to show the capacitor I am just calling it dvc/dt. Similarly, for an inductor, L, the voltage across the inductor is given by Ldi/dt.

这是电容器的 vI 关系，电感器的 vI 关系。我们也适合用积分形式来写。所以如果我把这个等式的两边都积分，然后把 L 移到这一边，我最终会得到这样的结果，1/L 减去无穷大到 t，VLdt，这就是 iL。我只是用积分形式来代替它。

So this is the vI relation for the capacitor, the vI relation for an inductor. It also suits us to write this in an integral form. So if I integrate both sides of this equation and I bring L down to this side, I end up getting something like this, 1/L minus infinity to t, VLdt, and that is simply iL. I am just simply replacing this with an integral form.

这是电感的 VI 关系，这是电容的 VI 关系。现在让我继续将节点法应用于我的电路。这里，对于节点法，我必须使进入节点的电流相等，或者将进入节点的电流相加并将其相等为零。当我这样做时，我只是使用元素定律将电流替换为相应的电压。

So this is a VI relationship for the inductor and this is for the capacitor. So let me now go ahead and apply the node method for my circuit here. Here, for the node method, I have to equate the currents coming into the node or sum the currents coming into the node and equate that to zero. And while I do that I simply replace the currents by the corresponding voltages using the element laws.

那么我得到了什么？我得到了流过电感器的电流等于流过电容器的电流。流过电容器的电流是多少？就其 v 关系而言，它是 Cdv/dt。流过电感器的电流由这里的这个关系给出，即 1/L 减去无穷大到 t。电容器两端的电压就是 (vI v)dt。

So what do I get? I get the current going in here to the inductor is equal to the current going through the capacitor. What is the current going the capacitor? In terms of its v relationship it is Cdv/dt. And the current going to the inductor is given by this relation here, which is simply 1/L minus infinity to t. The voltage across the capacitor is simply (vI v)dt.

我刚刚在这里写下了此节点的节点引号。现在我将应用一些数学知识并简化它并得到结果方程。我能做的就是在这里对 t 进行微分。并将其变为 Cd 2v/dt 2，即 v 的二阶导数。这里我最终得到的是 1/L(vI v)。所以我在这里用 d/dt 对整个方程进行微分。然后我将 L 移到这里。

I have just written down the node quotation for this node here. Now I will just apply a bit of math and simplify it and get the resulting equation. What I can do is simply differentiate with respect to t here. And get this to be Cd2v/dt2, the second derivative of v. And here what I end up getting is 1/L(vI v). So I just differentiated the whole thing by d/dt here. And then I just move L up here.

我把 d 2v/dt 2 带到这里。然后我在这里得到一个负 v，这将等于，哦，对不起。让我把这个留在这里。把负 v 移到这边，这样它就变成了正 v，而 vI 留在这边。所以我最终得到了 LCd 2v/dt 2。我把 L 带到这里。然后我把 v 带到另一边。加上 v，把 vI 留在这里，这样我就得到了 vI。

I bring d2v/dt2 out here. And then I get a minus v here, and that will be equal to, oh, I’m sorry. Let me leave this here. Bring the minus v to this side so it becomes a plus and leave vI on this side. So I end up getting LCd2v/dt2. I bring L up here. And then I take v to the other side. Plus v and leave vI here so I get vI.

这是控制电压 v 特性的二阶微分方程。在我们的 RC 电路中，电容器两端的电压是一个状态变量，在我们的 RL 电路中，流过电感器的电流是一个状态变量，而在这里，流过电感器的电流和电容器两端的电压都是我的两个状态变量。因此，这里我的电压 v 有一个二阶方程。

That is second order differential equation that governs the characteristics of the voltage, v. So much as the voltage across the capacitor was a state variable in our RC circuits or the current through the inductor was a state variable in our RL circuits, out here both the current through the inductor and the voltage across the capacitor are my two state variables. And so here I have a second order equation in my voltage, v.

再次重申，在讲完基础知识后，我现在要讲一大堆数学知识。之前讲的是电路分析，现在我要讲数学。接下来的三四块黑板只讲数学。你可以用任何你想要的方式解这个二阶微分方程。

Again, going through the foundations here, I am now going to go through a bunch of math. Up to here it was circuit analysis, and now I am just going to do math. For the next three or four blackboards just math. You can solve this second order differential equation any which way you want.

但为了尽可能简单，我在 6.002 中求解了所有微分方程，事实证明我们很幸运能够做到这一点，使用完全相同的方法一遍又一遍地重复，可以应用相同的方法。我们用来求解它的方法是齐次和特定解法。因此，第一步我们要找到特定解 vP。

But just to keep things as simple as possible, in 6.002 I solve all the differential equations, it turns out we are fortunate enough we can do that, using the exact same method again and again and again, the same thing can be applied. And the method that we use to solve it is the method of homogenous and particular solutions. So the first step we are going to find the particular solution, vP.

第二步，我们找到齐次解，vH。第三步，我们将找到总解，即总和，v 就是特定值加上齐次解，然后根据初始条件和施加的电压求解常数。让我们写下初始条件。

Second step we find the homogenous solution, vH. And the third step we are going to find the total solution as the sum of, v is simply the particular plus the homogenous solution and then solve for constants based on the initial conditions and the applied voltage. So let’s write down initial conditions.

为简单起见，我们假设我的初始条件只是电容器两端的电压为零，而电感器中的电流在开始时也为零。现在，这就是所谓的“零状态”。v 和 I 均为零，因此我的电路对某些输入的响应将称为 ZSR。您可能在某堂课中听过这个术语。

Let’s assume, for simplicity, that my initial conditions are simply the voltage across the capacitor is zero to begin and the current through my inductor is also zero as I begin life. Now, this is what is called “zero state”. v and I are both zero, and so the response of my circuit for some input is going to be called ZSR. You’ve probably heard this term in one of your recitations.

因此，零状态响应只是说我从静止的电路开始，然后观察它对某些给定输入的行为。这是一个你最终可能会用到的小术语。接下来是我的输入。我将使用以下输入。t 的 vI 将是一个步骤，看起来像这样。我的输入是在 t=0 时，v 从零变为某个电压 VI，然后保持在该电压。

So zero state response simply says I start with my circuit at rest and looks at how it behaves for some given input. That is a little term you may end up using. My input next. I am going to use the following input. vI of t is going to be a step, is going to look like this. My input is at t=0 v is going from zero to some voltage VI and then stay at that voltage.

这将是一步。轰隆隆。您可以看到我为什么要使用这组变量，因为我想让这种情况尽可能接近我们在那里观察到的有趣行为。还记得我们有一个步骤，并且由于这个步骤，我们在那个节点上有一些行为吗？所以我会尽量让你接近那个。

It is going to be a step. Kaboom. And you can see why I am going with this set of variables, because I want make this situation as close as possible to the funny behavior we observed there. Remember we had a step, and because of the step we had some behavior at that node? So I will try to bring you as close to that.

在明天的讲座中，我将对此进行闭环，并为您推导出我们在示波器上看到的确切行为。为了实现这一点，我将尝试尽可能接近演示中的常量和其他参数。因此 VI 是一个步骤和零状态。仅从符号方面来说，这种步骤输入经常出现。

In tomorrow’s lecture, I am going to close the loop around that and derive for you exactly the behavior we saw on the scope. And to get there I am going to be try to be as close as possible to the constants and other parameters in the demo. So VI is a step and zero state. Just in terms of notation, this kind of a step input occurs pretty frequently.

我们只是用一个特殊的符号来表示它。我们简单地称它为 VI，它是这里的最终值。我们称之为 u(t)。所以 VIu(t)，u(t) 只是表示时间 t=0 时的一个步骤，从零伏到 VI。这只是一些在某个时候会派上用场的符号。现在更多的是数学。三个步骤，特定解、同质解、总解/常数。这几乎就像是这里的咒语，就像合唱。

And we just have a special notation for it. We simply call it VI is the final value here. And we call it u(t). So VIu(t), u(t) simply represents a step at time t=0, steps from zero volts to VI. That is just a little more notation that will come in handy at some point. More math now. Three steps, particular solution, homogenous solution, total solution/constants. This is almost like a mantra here, like a chorus.

我们使用四步法计算齐次解。对于齐次解，四步法的结果恰好适用于我们在课程中看到的所有方程。第一步是假设解的形式为 Ae^st。与 RC 完全一样。如果你闭上眼睛，按照你对 RC 所做的那样做，你就会到达你想要的地方。

Homogenous solution we compute using a four step method. And four step method for homogenous solutions, it turns out that it happens to be that way for all the equations we will see in our course. The first step would be assume a solution of the form Ae^st. Exactly as with RCs. If you close your eyes and do exactly what you did for RCs you will get to where you want to be.

你假设一个解的形式为 Ae^st。将其代入齐次方程。得到特征方程。求根。然后写下你的齐次解。一遍又一遍地重复同样的步骤，直到你厌倦得要死。特定解。对于特定解，我只需要找到一个解，任何解，如果不是最一般的解，而是任何满足特定方程的解。LCd 2vP/dt 2+vP=VI。

You assume a solution of the form Ae^st. Substitute that into your homogenous equation. Obtain the characteristic equation. Solve for the roots. And then write down your homogenous solution. Same sort of steps again and again and again until you get bored to tears. Particular solution. For the particular solution, I simply need to find a solution, any solution, if not the most general one but any solution that satisfies the particular equation which satisfies that equation. LCd2vP/dt2+vP=VI.

我的输入是一个步骤，我将寻找时间 t 大于零的解。请注意，对于时间 t 小于或等于零的情况，v 将为零。所以我正在寻找大于 t=0 的解。在这里，如果我代入 vP=VI，那就是一个特定解。因为如果我在这里代入 VI，它会变为零，然后我得到 VI=VI，所以这是可行的。

My input is a step and I am going to look for the solution for time t greater than zero. Notice that for time t less than or equal to zero, v is going to be zero. So I am looking for a solution greater than t=0. Here, if I substitute vP=VI, that is a particular solution. Because if I substitute VI here this goes to zero and then I get VI=VI, so this works.

我向你保证过这会很简单。你不可能找到比这更简单的了。我已经完成了第一步。我找到了特定解决方案。VI 是一个足够好的特定解决方案，所以我会使用它，我会接受它。作为我的第二步，我将找到 vH 或齐次方程的解。齐次方程就是将驱动设置为零的方程。

I promised you this was going to be simple. You cannot get any simpler than that. I have done my first step. I found the particular solution.
