And VI is a good enough particular solution so I will use it, I will take it. As my second step I am going to find vH or the solution to the homogenous equation. And the homogenous equation is simply that equation with drive set to zero.

我在这里得到的是 LCd 2vH/dt 2+vH=0。这是我的齐次方程。我只需将驱动设置为零。为了找到这里的解决方案，我采用了我的四步法。同样，在 6.002 中，遵循奥卡姆原理，我们只向您展示达到您想要的目标所需的绝对最小值。

What I get here is LCd2vH/dt2+vH=0. That is my homogenous equation. I simply set the drive to be zero. And to find the solution here, I go through my four step method. Again, in 6.002 following the kind of Occam’s principle, we just show you the absolute minimum necessary to get to where you want.

绝对最小必要条件是，事实证明，我们可以使用齐次解和特定解的方法解决我们在这里使用的所有微分方程。每个齐次解都可以通过四步法解决。这几乎是最小的了。所以没有多余的东西。四步法，四个步骤。第一步是假设一个形式为 vH=Ae^st 的解。

The absolute minimum necessary is it turns out that we can solve all our differential equations that we use here by using the methods of homogenous and particular solutions. And every homogenous solution can be solved by a four step method. That is about as minimal as it can get. So no extraneous stuff there. The four step method, four steps. The first step is assume a solution of the form vH=Ae^st.

我注意到，刚开始学习的学生通常害怕微分方程。我知道我学生时代就是这样。微分方程的诀窍在于它完全是心理问题。仅仅因为你看到一些曲线和一堆数学公式，你就会说，哦，那一定很难。

What I have noticed is that students starting out are usually scared of differential equations. I know I was when I was a student. And the trick with differential equations is that it is all a matter of psych. Just because you see some squigglies and squagglies and a bunch of math and so on you say oh, that must be hard.

但微分方程其实是最简单的方程，因为在大多数情况下，解微分方程的方式是假设你知道答案，然后别人告诉你答案。然后你只需将答案代入方程，找出使其成为答案的常数。这只是一个心理学问题。

But differential equations are actually the simplest thing there is because in a large majority of cases the way you solve them is you assume you know the answer, someone tells you the answer. And then all you are left to do is shove the answer into the equation and find out the constants that makes it the answer. Just a matter of psych.

你们要相信这东西很简单，因为我正在告诉你们解决方案是什么。你们所要做的就是代入并验证。如果你以这种方式思考微分方程或其中的大多数方程，那么只要你能克服这里的弯弯曲曲，它就真的非常简单。只要克服弯弯曲曲，然后简单地坚持一些简单的东西，它就会起作用。我的意思是它再简单不过了。

Psych yourselves that this stuff is easy, because I am telling you what the solution is. All you have to do is substitute and verify. If you think about differential equations that way or a large majority of them, it really is very simple if you can just get past the squigglies here. Just get past the squigglies and then just simply stick in some simple stuff and it works. I mean it just cannot get any easier.

我想不出还有哪个领域会采用假设自己知道解决方案并将其粘贴进去的方式来寻找解决方案。我从来没有觉得这有什么意义，但事实就是如此。因此，我们假设解决方案的形式为 Ae^st，将其粘贴进去，然后您必须找出使其成为 A 的 A 和 s。没有比这更简单的了。

I cannot think of any other field where the way you find a solution is assume you know the solution and stick it in. It has never made any sense to me but that is how it is. So we assume the solution to the form Ae^st, you stick it in there, and you have to find out the A and s that make it so. It cannot get any simpler than that.

让我们把这个吸盘放在这里，看看我们能得到什么。代入这里的 Ae^st，我得到 LCA 和二阶导数，所以它是 ^2 e^st。而这里的 Ae^st。它等于零。然后让我求解我能找到的任何值。假设我不采用 A=0 的简单情况，我取消了这些。剩下的只是 LCs^2+1=0。换句话说，我最终得到的是 B，s^2= 1/LC。

Let’s stick the sucker in here and see what we can get. Substitute Ae^st here I get LCA, and second derivative, so it’s^2 e^st. And Ae^st on this one here. And that equals zero. And then let me just solve for whatever I can find. Assuming I don’t take the trivial case A=0, I cancel these guys out. And what I am left with is simply LCs^2+1=0. In other words, what I end up getting is B, s^2= 1/LC.

我的第一步是，我给你解决方案，把它们放在那里，假设一个这种形式的解决方案。第二步是得到特征方程。得到特征方程的方法是简单地把这个东西放在那里。你最终得到的是 s^2 中的某个方程。你还记得你得到的一阶电路是什么吗？s 是什么？s 是什么？

My first step was, I am giving you solutions, stick them in there, assume a solution of this form. Second step is get the characteristic equation. And the way you get the characteristic equation is that you simply stick this guy in there. And what you end up getting is some equation in s^2. Do you remember what you got for first order circuits? What s was? What is s?

对于一阶电路，你得到的特征方程是什么？s+1/RC=0。同样的事情。只要记住盲目地应用这些步骤。它会引导你找到答案。这被称为“特征方程”。这非常重要。从现在起大约几周后，你就会发现，一旦你写下电路的特征方程，它就会告诉你关于电路的所有知识。

For first order circuits, what did you get as a characteristic equation? s+1/RC=0. The same thing. Just remember to blindly apply the steps. It will lead you to the answer. This is called the “characteristic equation”. This is incredibly important. You will see in about a couple weeks from now that once you write the characteristic equation down for a circuit, it tells you all there is to know about the circuit.

而且很多时候你可以在这里停止求解。对于经验丰富的电路设计师来说，这告诉了我所有需要知道的事情。这真的很关键。这就是为什么它被称为特征方程。我相信在本周即将发布的作业中的第三个问题中，这正是你要做的。

And often times you can stop solving right here. To experienced circuit designers this tells me everything there is to know. This is really key. That’s why it’s called a characteristic equation. I believe in problem number three of the homework that will be coming out this week, that is exactly what you are going to do.

我将给你一个电路，让你快速找到特征方程，然后从那里直观地找到解决方案。写下特征方程，然后直观地找到解决方案，就这么简单。所以，步骤 A，假设一个形式的解决方案，步骤 B，写下特征方程。让我稍微简化一下。我继续寻找我的根源。

I am going to give you a circuit, ask you to get to the characteristic equation quickly and then from there intuit the solution. Write the characteristic equation and then just intuit solution, it’s that simple. So, step A, assume a solution of the form, step B, write the characteristic equation down. And let me just simplify that a little bit. I go ahead and find my roots.

这里的根，记住 j 是负一的平方根。所以我最终得到的是，这里的两个根是，加上 1/LC 的 j 个平方根和减去 1/LC 的 j 个平方根。两个根。就像我对 RC 的简写一样，我对 RC 的简写是什么？Tau。

And my roots here, remember that j is the square root of minus one. And so what I end up getting is, my two roots here are, plus j square root of 1/LC and minus j square root of 1/LC. Two roots. And just as a shorthand notation, much like I had a shorthand notation for RC, what was my shorthand notation for RC? Tau.

正如 tau 在一阶中很大一样，我们有一个在二阶中很大的对应物，那就是 omega nought。Omega nought 就是平方根 1/LC。正如 tau 是 RC 一样，omega nought 在这里是一种简写。因此 s 就是加上或减去 j omega nought。

Just as tau was big in first order, we have a corresponding thing that is big in second order and that is omega nought. Omega nought is simply square root 1/LC. Just as tau was RC, omega nought is a shorthand here. And so s is simply plus or minus j omega nought.

请注意，在这个方程中，如果你取 LC 的平方根，它有时间单位，所以除以它，它有频率单位。请注意，这个单位是弧度。我最终得到了齐次方程的根，这是我的第三步。

Notice that in this equation here, if you take the square root of LC there that has units of time, so one divided by that has units of frequency. Notice that this guy is a frequency in radians. I end up getting my roots of the homogenous equation, and that is my third step.

作为我的第四步，我只需将齐次解写下来，用它的根代替 s，并写出该解的最一般可能形式，即 A1e^(j omega nought t)+A2e^( j omega nought t)。完成。某个常数乘以这个解，再加上某个其他常数乘以另一个解。加上零 omega nought。记住它来自这里，Ae^st。

And as my fourth step, I simply write down the homogenous solution as substituting s with its roots and writing the most general possible form of the solution, and that would be A1e^(j omega nought t)+A2e^( j omega nought t). Done. Some constant times this solution plus some other constant times, the other solution. Plus zero omega nought. Remember it comes from here, Ae^st.

我假设解的形式是这种，所以在这个最普遍的情况下，我的解将是 s 在一种情况下是 j omega nought，在另一种情况下是减去 j omega nought，我将两者相加得到最普遍的解。所以快马加鞭。我现在有了我的齐次解。作为解微分方程的第三步，我写下总解，v=vP+vH，特别是加上齐次解。

I assume the solution of this form, so my solution in this most general case would be s being j omega nought in one case, minus j omega nought in the other case, and I sum the two to get the most general solution. So blasting ahead. I now have my homogenous solution. And as my third step of solution to differential equations I write down the total solution, v=vP+vH, particular plus the homogenous solutions.

而 v=VI 是我的特定解决方案，+A1e^(j omega nought t)+A2e^( j omega nought t) 是我的完整解决方案。最后一步，写下总解决方案并从初始条件中找出常数。要从初始条件中找出常数，让我们从电压为零开始。这个方程控制 v 的特性，所以我需要找到初始条件。

And v=VI, was my particular solution, +A1e^(j omega nought t)+A2e^( j omega nought t) is my complete solution. The final step, write down the total solution and find the constants from the initial conditions. To find the constants from the initial conditions, let’s start with, the voltage is zero to begin with. This equation governs the characteristics of v, so I need to find the initial conditions.

首先，我知道 v(0)=0。然后我代入 t=0。这样这个变为 1，这个变为 1，最后我得到 0=VI+A1+A2。这是我的第一个表达式。然后我还知道 i(0)=0。所以我也能得到这个。我怎么得到 i？这就是 v。

First of all, I know that know that v(0)=0. From there I substitute t=0. And so this goes to one, this goes to one, and I end up getting 0=VI+A1+A2. That is my first expression. And then I am also given that i(0)=0. And so I can get that as well. How do I get i? This is v.

我知道 i=Cdv/dt，所以我只需乘以 C 并根据 t 求导即可得到 I。我得到 C，这个家伙消失了，所以我得到了这个的 d/dt。所以它是 CA1(j omega nought) e^(j omega nought t)+CA2( j omega nought)e^( j omega nought t)。从这里我得到它是零，因此这个家伙变成了一，这个家伙变成了一，j omega nought，j omega nought 抵消。

I know that i=Cdv/dt, so I can get I by simply multiplying by C and differentiating this with respect to t. I get C, this guy vanishes so I get d/dt of this. So it is CA1(j omega nought) e^(j omega nought t)+CA2( j omega nought)e^( j omega nought t). From here I am given that is zero, and so therefore this guy becomes a one, this guy becomes a one, j omega nought, j omega nought cancel out.

我最终得到的结果是 A1=A2。从第二个初始条件我得到 A1=A2。从这两个，如果我在这里代入 A2，我得到 VI + 2A1 = 0，或 A1= VI/2。这也等于 A2。因此，我现在可以用我得到的常数的实际值来表示我的总解。我得到 VI VI/2。所以 A1 和 A2 相等。我把它们拉到外面就行了。

What I end up getting is A1=A2. From the second initial condition I get A1=A2. From these two, if I substitute here for A2, I get VI + 2A1 = 0, or A1= VI/2. That is also equal to A2. Therefore, my total solution now can be written in terms of the actual values of the constants I have obtained. I get VI VI/2. So A1 and A2 are equal. I just pull them outside.

我把 VI 2 拉到外面，把这两个东西放在括号里。我再次向你保证，从现在开始直到最后一块电路板或类似的东西，不再有电路。这都是数学，所以那里没有太多其他事情发生。更多的数学。如果你愿意，我可以一直跳到最后并向你展示答案。但我只是喜欢在黑板上写方程式，所以让我先过一遍。

I pull VI 2 outside and I stick these two guys in parenthesis in. Again, I promised you no more circuits from here on until the very last board or something like that. It is all math, so not much else happening there. More math. If you would like, I could skip all the way to the end and show you the answer. But I just love to write equations on the board so let me just go through that.

我将在这里进一步简化这一点。我们应该记住欧拉关系中的这种形式，ejx=cos x+j sin x。同样，(e^jx + e^ jx)/2=cos x。你们都应该从欧拉关系中知道这一点。所以我们在这里使用这个公式，ej^x + e^ jx=2cos x。

I am going to simplify this a little further here. And we should remember this form by the Euler relation, ejx=cos x+j sin x. And by the same token, (e^jx + e^ jx)/2=cos x. You all should know this from the Euler relation. So were are using this guy here, ej^x + e^ jx=2cos x.

因此，这个是 2 欧米伽零点 t 的余弦，2 和 2 相消，剩下的就是 v(t)=VI VI cos( 欧米伽零点 t)。电流是 Cdv/dt，也就是 CVI sin( 欧米伽零点 t)。只要记住欧米伽零点是 1/LC 的平方根。我们就完成了。事实上，我没有给予这个答案应有的重视，所以让我画出来。好了。这样更好。数学够了。

And so this one is 2 cosine of omega nought t, 2 and 2 cancel out, and what I am left with is v(t)=VI VI cos( omega nought t). And the current is Cdv/dt, which is simply CVI sin( omega nought t). Just remember that omega nought is the square root of 1/LC. We are done. In fact, I did not give that answer the importance that was due so let me just draw. There. That is better. Enough math.

简而言之，我们做了什么。我们编写了节点方法，这是一个非常简单的电路，写下控制该电路的方程。然后我们进行了大量的数学运算。这里没有太多。它非常简单。最后得到了一个关系，该关系表明，对于阶跃输入，假设为零状态，电容器两端的电压是一个常数 VI VI cos omega t。

In a nutshell, what did we do. We wrote the node method, it’s a very simple circuit, to write down the equation governing that circuit. And then we grunged through a bunch of math. Not a whole lot here. It is pretty simple. And ended up with a relation that says the voltage across the capacitor for a step input, assuming zero state, is a constant VI VI cos omega t.

请注意，即使我有一个阶跃输入，电路动态也会在其中得到余弦。现在您可以开始看到这些余弦来自哪里。它们来自这里。如果您还记得我之前向您展示的逆变器电路示例，还记得有一个衰减的余弦，它正在失去能量并逐渐消失吗？所以您可以看到余弦来自哪里。

Notice that even though I have a step input, the circuit dynamics are such that I get a cosine in there. You can begin to see where these cosines are coming from now. They come in here. And if you recall the example I showed you earlier of the inverter circuit, remember there was a cosine that decayed, that was sort of losing energy and kind of dying out? So you can see where the cosines are coming from.

这里我先画个小草图。我先画出 v 和 I，然后画出 omega t、pi/2、pi 等等。我再画出 VI。当时间 t=0 时，VI=0，余弦 omega t 为 1，因此 VI VI=0。这只是一个从零开始的余弦，在 pi 处我得到余弦 omega t 为负 1，因此我在另一边得到正 VI。

And just to draw you a little sketch here. Let me draw v and I for you and let me plot omega t, pi/2, pi and so on. Let me plot VI. When time t=0, VI=0, cosine omega t is one, and so VI VI=0. That is simply a cosine that starts out at zero here, and at pi I get cosine omega t is minus one, so I get plus VI on the other side.

所以我最终得到了 +2VI。此时电压就在这里。注意这个家伙看起来像这样。它是一个余弦，向上平移，因此它的平均值不是零而是 VI。它只是余弦的向上平移。同样，在这种情况下，对于电流来说，它是一个正弦特性。它看起来像这样，峰值由 CVI 给出，哦，我搞错了。

So I end up at +2VI. At this point the voltage is here. And notice that this guy looks like this. It is a cosine that is translated up so that its mean value is not zero but VI. It is just a translation up of a cosine. Similarly, in this case for the current it is a sinusoidal characteristic. And it looks something like this where the peak is given by CVI, oh, I messed up.

当我区分这一点时，却错过了那里的 omega nut。

When I differentiated this is missed the omega nought out there.

演示

Demo

我现在想做的是这是阶跃输入的输出形式。接下来我想做的是向您展示一个演示。但在向您展示演示之前，我总是觉得很奇怪，我有一个阶跃输入，然后我有两个小元素，我怎样才能从输出中获得正弦波？

What I would like to do now This is the form of the output for a step input. What I would like to do next is show you a demo. But before I show you a demo, I always found it strange that I have a step input and then I have two little elements, how can I get a sine coming out of the output?

我想直观地了解为什么事物会这样表现。我可以去祈祷来找到答案，但我先给你一些非常基本的见解，说明为什么它会这样表现。让我在这里为你画出电路。这是我的电感器 L 和电容 C。记住这是 v。

I would like to get some intuition as to why things behave the way they are. I could go and pray to find out, but let me just give you some very basic insight as to why this behaves the way it does. Let me draw the circuit for you here. And this is my inductor L and capacitance C. Remember this is v.

让我来告诉你那里发生了什么，让你理解这一点。现在，你以前见过正弦波。如果你写下钟摆的运动方程，你知道，你有一个钟摆，你把它移到一边，然后放开。它也受正弦特性的支配。

Let me just walk you through what is happening there and get you to understand this. Now, you have seen sines occur before. If you go and write down the equation of motion of a pendulum, you know, you have a pendulum, you move it to one side, let go. It is also governed by sinusoidal characteristics.

你会发现控制其运动的方程形式非常相似，你会得到正弦波，其中能量在最大势能和最大动能之间来回晃动，从零势能回到最大势能，零动能。所以能量来回晃动。这里也是一样。电容器和电感器储存能量。让我们来看看会发生什么。

And you will find that the equation governing its motion is very much of the same form, and you get the sinusoid where you have energy that is sloshing back and forth between maximum potential energy to maximum kinetic energy and zero potential energy back to maximum potential energy, zero kinetic. So it is energy sloshing back and forth. The same way here. Capacitors and inductors store energy. Let’s walk through and see what happens.

我从它们两个都处于零级、零电流、零电压开始。我在这里施加一个步骤。砰，步骤立即到达 VI。我注意到，除非有某种无限脉冲，否则电容器电压无法立即改变，所以这个家伙无法立即改变。因此它的电压从零开始。所以这里的整个电压，KVL 无论如何都必须为真。它们是麦克斯韦方程的绝对基本原理。

I start off with both of them having the stage zero, zero current, zero voltage. I apply a step here. Boom, the step comes instanteously to VI. I notice that the capacitor voltage cannot change instantly unless there is an infinite pulse of a sort, so this guy cannot change instantly. And so its voltage starts off being zero. So the entire voltage here, KVL must be true no matter what. They are absolutely fundamental principles from Maxwell’s equations.

KVL 必须成立，这意味着整个电压 VI 必须出现在电感器上。我在电感器上施加一个大电压，它的电流开始增加。就是这样。电感器上的电压，它的电流开始增加。当电流开始增加时，电流也必须流过电容器。当电流流过电容器时，它会将电荷存入电容器。

KVL must hold, which means that the entire voltage VI must appear across the inductor. I put a big voltage across the inductor and its current begins to build up. There you go. A voltage across the inductor, its current begins to build up. As its current begins to build up that current must flow through the capacitor, too. And as current flows through a capacitor it is depositing charge into the capacitor.

当电容器上开始积聚电荷时，其电压开始上升。让我们看看这里发生了什么。它的电压不断上升。在某个时刻，电容器两端的电压等于 VI。但随后 VI 等于这里的 VI。因此，当两者变为 VI 时，电感器两端的电压为零伏。因此不再存在导致该方向电流增加的电位差​​。

As the capacitor begins to get charge deposited on it, its voltage begins to rise. Let’s see what happens here. Its voltage keeps rising. At some point, the voltage across the capacitor is equal to VI. But then VI equals this VI here. So when the two become VI, the inductor has zero volts across it. So there is no longer a potential difference that is increasing the current in that direction.

此时，当 pi 除以 2 时，有一些电流进入电感器，因此不再有压力迫使更多电流通过电感器，因为该电压达到了 VI。但请记住，电容器喜欢坐在那里保持电压。只要记住那个演示。那个破旧的电容器顽固地坐在那里保持电压。最后它产生了巨大的火花。它只是坐在那里保持电压。

At that point, at pi divided by 2, I have some current going into the inductor so there is no longer a pressure that is forcing more current through the inductor because this voltage reaches VI. But remember capacitors like to sit around holding voltages. Just remember that demo. That rinky dink capacitor sat there stubbornly holding its voltage. And it had a huge spark towards the end. It just sat there holding its voltage.

同样，电感器也喜欢保持电流。它们会尽一切可能让电流流过。它有电流通过。地球上几乎没有力量可以改变这一点。因此，即使电容器电压为 VI，电感器两端的电压降为零，它仍然会继续提供电流。它有电流。它有惯性。它继续前进。

In the same manner, inductors love to sit around holding a current. They will do whatever they can to keep the current going through them. It has got the current going through. And few forces on earth can change that. And so therefore, even though the capacitor voltage is VI and the voltage drop across the inductor is zero, it still keeps supplying a current. It has got the current. It’s got inertia. It keeps going.

这就像一列失控的火车。你可能不会从后面推火车，但一旦火车开动，它就会获得动能，无论如何都会继续运行至少一段时间，即使你拿走火车上的力。所以我拿走了推动更多电流通过的力，但它有动能。

It is like a runaway train. You may not be pushing the train from the back, but once it is running it has got kinetic energy and is going to run no matter what for a least some more time, even if you take away the force on the train. So I have taken away the force on the punching more current through, but it has kinetic energy.

有电流流过它，所以它继续提供电流。因为它继续提供电流，所以电容器电压不断增加。这是一个非常微妙的见解，绝对令人惊叹，即使电压为零，它仍然继续泵送电流。电容器电压上升了。你猜怎么着？这边的电压现在更高了，但这家伙仍然在泵送电流。

It has current flowing through it so it continues to supply a current. Because it continues to supply the current the capacitor voltage keeps increasing. This is a subtle insight which is absolutely spectacular that with zero volts across it, it still keeps pumping that current. Capacitor voltage has gone up. And guess what? The voltage on this side is higher now but this guy is still pumping a current.

伙计，我生来就是干这个的，你知道，我要泵送电流。然而，因为这里的电压现在已经逐渐上升，电流开始逐渐减小。所以电容器很担心。你给我泵送电流，我的电压就会上升。在某个时刻，就像一列失控的火车，它停了下来。通过电容器的电流耗尽，现在变为零，电容器电压达到 2VI。

Man, I have been born to do this, you know, I shall pump a current. However, because the voltage has now gone up here gradually the current begins to diminish. So the capacitor is concerned. You pump a current into me, my voltage goes up. At some point, like a runaway train, it comes to a halt. The current through the capacitor drains and now goes to zero and the capacitor voltage reaches 2VI.

所以现在这是 2VI，这是 VI。现在情况并不平衡。此时流经它的电流为零，但你猜怎么着？我现在有一个 VI 朝这个方向泵送。我有相同的 VI 朝这个方向冲击。所以你猜怎么着？它的电流现在必须朝这个方向积聚，并且它的电流开始朝那个方向积聚。

So this is at 2VI now and this is at VI. Now the situation is not in equilibrium. At this point there is zero current through it, but guess what? I have a VI pumping in this direction now. I have the same VI punching in this direction. So guess what? Its current must now build up in this direction and its current begins to build up in that direction.

这开始对电容器放电，然后电容器变为负电流，或者电流下降到最大负电流，这个过程继续。你在这里看到的是能量。它在两者之间来回晃动，这是关键。我会快速放一个演示，你可以在走出去时观看。使用阶跃输入，注意绿色是电容器两端的电压，橙色是通过电容器的电流。

That begins to discharge the capacitor and the capacitor then goes on to a negative, or the current goes down to a maximum negative current, and this process continues. What you are seeing here is energy. It is sloshing back and forth between the two, and that is kind of a key. I will just quickly put up a demo that you can watch as you are walking out. With a step input, notice the green is the voltage across the capacitor and the orange is the current through the capacitor.

Lec 15b | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 15b | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 50:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=-gRXU-O1FY4

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 50:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=-gRXU-O1FY4

今天开始之前，我想先花五分钟向你们展示一下我过去三年一直在研究的一些有趣的东西。这和 6.002 和电路以及所有这些东西有关，但这是完全可选的，这是为了好玩，这是为了培养你的直觉，这是为了检查你的答案，无论你想要什么。这不是课程的必修部分。只是为了好玩。

Before I begin today, I thought I would take the first five minutes and show you some fun stuff I have been hacking on for the past three years. This has to do with 6.002 and circuits and all that stuff, but this is completely optional, this is for fun, this is to go build your intuition, this is to check your answers, whatever you want. This is not a required part of the course. Just for fun.

这里有我放在这里的 URL。过去三年我一直在研究这个系统，今年是第一次尝试，非常谨慎地将它介绍给学生。这里的想法是，它有点不集中。有没有可能让它集中一点？这个想法是，它是一个基于 Web 的交互式模拟包，是我整理出来的。

There is this URL out here that I put down here. I have been hacking on this system for the past three years, and for the first time this year and very tentatively and gingerly introducing it to students. The idea here is that it is a, that is kind of defocused. Any chance of focusing that a little bit better? The idea of this is that it is a Web based interactive simulation package that I have pulled together.

你可以做的是调出一堆电路。注意这里的 URL 是 euryale.lcs.mit.edu/websim。还有指向它的指针。所以你可以玩很多有趣的东西。我们已经在课堂上讲过了所有这些内容。让我们选择 MOSFET 放大器。你来到这个页面。这是你在课堂上看到的东西。让我们玩这个小电路。

And what you can do is you can pull up a bunch of circuits. Notice that the URL is up here. It is euryale.lcs.mit.edu/websim. And there is the pointer to it. So you have a bunch of fun things you can play with. And we have gone through all of these things in lecture. Let’s pick the MOSFET amplifier. You come to this page. This is something you have seen in class. And let’s play with this little circuit.

你看到鼠标了吗？很好。你可以设置一堆参数。你可以设置 MOSFET 参数 VT 和 K。你可以设置电阻的 R 值，可以建立偏置电压，还可以获得输入电压 vIN。因此，你可以应用一堆输入电压。你可以应用零输入、脉冲单位、步进单位、正弦波、方波。

And you see the mouse? Good. You can set up a bunch of parameters. You can set up the MOSFET parameters VT and K. You can set up the value of R for your resistor, you can establish a bias voltage, and you can have an input voltage vIN. So you can apply a bunch of input voltages. You can apply a zero input, unit in pulse, unit step, sine wave, square waves.

或者说这是我花了最长时间才搞定的部分。你也可以输入一堆音乐。到目前为止，我只有两个剪辑，所以听它们你会觉得无聊。很好。所以你也可以输入音乐。你可以做的是，你可以观看波形，你可以听输出，还可以做一堆有趣的事情。

Or this was the part that took me the longest to get right. You can also input a bunch of music. And so far I just have two clips, so you are going to get bored listening to them. Good. So you can also input music. And what you can do is you can watch the waveforms, you can listen to the output and do a bunch of fun stuff.

我希望你们尝试一个实验。再次提醒，这完全是可选的。只是为了好玩。你可以应用一些输入。例如，将输入阶跃到 RLC 电路，花 30 秒思考输出应该是什么样子。我推测输出应该是这样的，然后这样做，看看你的想法是否正确。玩弄它很有趣。

One experiment I would love for you guys to try out. Again, remember, this is completely optional. Just for fun. You can apply some input. Step input, for example, to an RLC circuit and spend 30 seconds thinking about what should the output look like. I divine that the output should look like this and then do this and see if what you thought was correct. And it’s fun to kind of play around with it.

首先，举个例子，假设我输入古典音乐。假设我想听听这里的输出，即 MOSFET 漏极端子的电压。为了进行收听，它设置了一个默认的收听时间范围，因此您可以继续进行收听。这会向您显示一段音乐的时间域波形，然后您就可以收听它了。

Let me start with, just as an example, let’s say I input classical music. And let us say I would like to listen to the output here that is the voltage at the drain terminal of the MOSFET. For listening it sets up a default timeframe to listen to, so you go ahead and do it. This shows you the time domain waveform of a clip of the music and then you can listen to it.

失真很多，对吧？如您所见，失真很多。这是意料之中的，因为峰峰值电压为 1 伏，偏置为 2.5，所以这是在低端削波，而且 MOSFET 是非线性的。您可以尝试很多东西，您会获得很多乐趣。

Lot’s of distortion, right? As you can see, there is a bunch of distortion. And that is as you expect because the peak to peak voltage is 1 volt, the bias is 2.5, and so this is clipping at the lower end, plus the MOSFET is nonlinear. You can play around with a bunch of things and you can have a lot of fun.

我创建这个项目的原因是麻省理工学院正在将很多课程放到网上。这类课程最热门的一点就是实验室部分。如果你要将课程传送到第三世界国家或其他地方，你如何让人们建立庞大的实验室基础设施？

And the reason I created this is that MIT is putting a bunch of its courses on the Web. And one of the hottest things about courses like this is the lab component. If you are beaming a course to, say, a Third World country or something, how do you get people to set up the massive lab infrastructure?

我知道你讨厌示波器，我知道你讨厌电线，我知道你讨厌夹子，但事实上你有它们。我知道很多地方组装这些东西的成本太高，这就是为什么我一直在创建这种基于 Web 的交互式实验室，以便人们可以通过 Web 学习这些东西。让我们快速再举一个例子。假设你学过，好吧，让我们做 RC 电路。

I know you hate your oscilloscopes, I know you hate your wires, I know you hate the clips, but the fact is you have them. I know a lot of places those are way too expensive to pull together, which is why I have been creating this Web based kind of interactive laboratory so that people can learn this stuff over the Web. Let’s go do another example very quickly. Let’s say you learned about, well, let’s do RC circuits.

这是并联 RC 电路。您可以设置电容值、电阻值，还可以设置输入。这里，让我看一下电容两端电压的时域波形。这次让我播放一个单位步长。让我们看看输出会是什么样子。您可以在脑海中想象输出应该是什么样子，然后就可以绘制它了。就这样。

Here is the parallel RC circuit. And you can set up capacitor values, resistor values, you can set up input. Here, let me look at the time domain waveform for the voltage across the capacitor. And this time around let me play a unit step. And let’s see what the output is going to look like. You can think in your minds what should the output look like, and then you can go and plot it. There you go.

这就是输出的样子。所以你可以尝试一下，玩得开心。这些都是好消息。坏消息是，到目前为止，我只有一台 Pentium III 机器。这是一台 Linux 机器，所以不要一下子就尝试。

That’s what the output looks like. So you can play around with it and have fun. That’s all the good news. The bad news is that so far I just have one Pentium III machine behind us. It is a Linux box, so don’t all of you try it at once.

但是，我还做了一件事，那就是在教授们能用来破解东西的那点时间里，我又花了六个月的时间破解了一个极其复杂的现金系统，这样一旦班上的任何人尝试了某种参数组合，它就会将所有输出都储存起来。如果其他人输入相同的参数集，它就会获取所有输出并将其回放给您。

However, what I have also done, and that took me another six months of hacking in the small amount of time professors have to hack on stuff, I’ve hacked an incredibly elaborate cashing system so that once anyone in class tries out some combination of parameters it goes and squirrels away all the outputs. If anybody else types in the same sets of parameters it will just get all the output and play it back to you.

因此，如果你们中有足够的人玩这个软件，我们最终可能会将所有重要的波形、音乐片段和所有这些东西都保存起来。我已经分配了几 GB 的存储空间，所以我希望它能正常工作。继续吧。玩吧。这完全是我的错，所以如果有任何错误或任何问题，只需将它们通过电子邮件发送给我。这是第一次实现这个功能，所以请耐心等待。

So if enough of you play with over time, we may end up cashing all the important waveforms and music clips and all of that stuff. I have allocated a few gigabytes of storage, so I am hoping that it may work. Go forth. Play with it. And this is completely my fault, so if there are any bugs or anything simply email them to me. This is the first time this is coming alive so bear with it.

现在让我回到今天安排好的演讲。好的，希望并祈祷这能奏效。是的。很好。我打算用视图图进行今天的演讲。我这样做的原因是，我更喜欢用视图图进行演讲，而不是像往常一样在黑板上演讲，我更喜欢用黑板进行演讲。

Now let me switch back to the scheduled presentation for today. All right, hope and pray that this works. Yes. Good. I am going to do today’s lecture using view graphs. And the reason I am going to do that and not do my usual blackboard presentation which I way, way, way prefer to a view graph presentation.

我今天要讲这个，甚至可能还要讲一堂课，唯一的原因是这堂课里有大量的数学知识。我想做的是快速讲完这些知识，但你们会把这些知识都记在你们的笔记里，这样你们就不会在课堂上浪费时间看着我笨拙地处理各种数学符号和波浪线之类的东西。

The only reason I am going to do this for today, and maybe one more lecture, is that there is just a huge amount of math grunge in this lecture. What I want to do is kind of blast through that, but you will have it all in the notes that you have, so that you don’t waste time in class as you watch me stumbling over twiddles and tildes and all that stuff.

这里的关键是，这个见解其实非常简单。开头和结尾联系非常紧密，非常简单。中间有一些数学问题，我们将要解决这些问题，而且，这完全遵循了旧有的既定模式。所以，从这个意义上说，这里面真的没有什么戏剧性的新东西。

The key thing here is that the insight is actually very simple. The beginning and the end are connected very tightly and very simple. There is a bunch of math grunge in the middle that we are going to work through and, again, follows a complete old established pattern. So, in that sense, there is really nothing dramatically new in there.

接下来的五分钟，我将为您回顾一下我们是如何走到这一步的，到目前为止我们讲了什么，并设置演示。我将快速浏览前十个视图图表，并告诉您我们在 LC 和 RLC 电路方面处于什么位置。我首先向您展示了这个小演示，两个逆变器，一个驱动。我可以用一个小电感器模拟这里的电感，这里的栅极电容器。

Let me spend the next five minutes reviewing for you how we got here, what have we covered so far and set up the presentation. The first ten view graphs I am going to blast through and just tell you where we are in terms of LC and RLC circuits. I began by showing you this little demo, two inverters, one driving. I can model the inductance here with a little inductor, the capacitor of the gate here.

回想一下，当我想通过引入 50 欧姆的小电阻来加快速度时，我得到了一些非常奇怪的行为。只是提醒你，对于周二的讲座，如果你快速回顾一下课程笔记中关于复杂代数的附录会有所帮助。还记得所有实数和虚数 j 和 omega 的内容吗？快速浏览一下会很好。它只有几页。还记得这个演示吗？

And recall that when I wanted to speed this up by introducing a 50 ohm smaller resistance, I got some really strange behavior. Just to remind you, for Tuesday’s lecture it would help if you quickly reviewed the appendix on complex algebra in the course notes. Remember all the real and imaginary j and omega stuff? It would be good to very quickly skim through that. It is a couple of pages. Remember this demo?

我们感兴趣的相关电路是这里的电路。它有一个电阻器，一个电感器和一个电容器。这是第 3 页。我将快速浏览前十个视图图。它们都是旧东西。然后我们观察到以下输出。我们将此输入应用于 VA，我们得到了此输出，由于 RC 瞬态，波形上升非常缓慢。

And the relevant circuit that is of interest to us is this one here. It is the resistor, there is the inductor and there is a capacitor. This is Page 3. I am just going to blast through the first ten view graphs. It is all old stuff. Then we observed the following output. We applied this input at VA and we got this output, a very slowly rising waveform because of the RC transient.

因此，您会看到延迟。请注意，此延迟是由于缓慢上升的瞬态电压造成的。此波形需要一些时间才能达到相邻晶体管的阈值。所以我们说，啊哈，让我们尝试通过降低第一个反相器集电极的电阻来加快这个吸盘的速度。所以我有了这个输入。

And because of that you saw a delay. Notice that this delay was because of the slowly rising transient. This waveform took some time to hit the threshold of the neighboring transistor. So we say ah ha, let’s try to speed this sucker up by reducing the resistance in the collector of the first inverter. And so I had this input.

现在，令我惊讶的是，我并没有看到一个更高、更快的转换电路，而是看到了一个更快的转换电路，但我在输出上看到了我感兴趣的所有这些奇怪的行为。正因为如此，如果这些偏移足够低，我实际上可以触发输出并在这里得到一大堆错误输出，因为这些负偏移实际上不应该存在。

Now, to my surprise, instead of seeing a nice little much higher and much faster transitioning circuit, well, I did see a much faster transitioning circuit but I got all this strange behavior on the output that I was interested in. And because of that, if these excursions were low enough, I could actually trigger the output and get a whole bunch of false ones here because of these negative excursions which should not really be there.

这有点奇怪。在上一节课中，我们说让我们一步一步来。我们不要跳进 RLC 电路。让我们一步一步来。让我们从 LC 开始，了解其行为。我们从这种 LC 电路开始，并使用节点方程表明这是控制电路行为的方程。

That was kind of strange. In the last lecture we said let’s take this one step at a time. Let’s not jump into an RLC circuit. Let’s go step by step. Let’s start with an LC, understand the behavior. We started off with an LC circuit of this sort, and using the node equation we showed that this was the equation that governed the behavior of the circuit.

然后我们说，对于阶跃输入和零初始条件，即零状态响应，让我们找出输出，电容器两端的电压是什么样的。所以我们得到的总体解决方案是这样的。这里面有一个正弦项。欧米伽零是 LC 的平方根之一。这就是电路。

And then we said that for a step input and for zero initial conditions, that is the zero state response, let’s find out what the output, the voltage across the capacitor looks like. And so we obtained the total solution to be this. And there was a sinusoidal term in there. And the omega nought which was one by square root of LC. And this was the circuit.

因此，对于这一步输入，请注意输出如下所示。到目前为止，输入步骤的输出如下所示。请注意，输出电压确实有可能超过输入值 VI。这有点不直观，但确实可能发生。因此，这个波形上下跳动。但稳定状态值，如果你愿意的话，平均而言，是 VI。

And so for this step input notice that the output looked like this. So far an input step I had an output that went like this. Notice that it is indeed possible for the output voltage to actually go above the input value VI. This is kind of non intuitive but this can happen. So this waveform jumps up and down. But the steady state value, on average if you will, is VI.

另一方面，它确实有正弦偏移，而且这种情况会持续下去，因为电路内部没有任何东西可以耗散能量。顺便说一句，电容器电压高于输入电压这一事实实际上是一个非常重要的特性。我们不会在 6.002 中详细讨论它，但请把它藏在你的大脑中。

On the other hand, it does have sinusoidal excursions and this kind of goes on because there is nothing to dissipate the energy inside that circuit. By the way, the fact that the capacitor voltage shoots above the input voltage is actually a very important property. We won’t dwell on it in 6.002, but just squirrel that away in your brain somewhere.

我保证，你一生中总有一天会需要在某个地方设计一个需要比直流输入更高的电压的小装置。你可以利用这个基本事实来实际产生比给定电压更高的直流电压，然后以某种方式使用它。事实上，有一个完整的研究领域，即所谓的直流-直流转换器，即电压转换器。

I promise you that some time in your life you will have to create a little design somewhere that will need a higher voltage than your DC input. And you can use this primitive fact to actually produce a DC voltage higher than you are given, and then use that somehow. In fact, there is a whole research area of what are called DC to DC converters, voltage converters.

假设您有 1.5 伏电池，即 AA 电池，但假设电路需要 1.8 伏。例如，奔腾 III 需要 1.8 伏。几年前，Strong Arm 是需要 1.8 伏的另一款芯片，但 AA 电池的电压为 1.5 伏。如何从 1.5 伏获得 1.8 伏？好吧，您必须以某种方式将其提高。

Let’s say you have 1.5 volt battery, a AA battery, but let’s say a circuit needs 1.8 volts. The Pentium IIIs, for example, needed 1.8 volts. And the strong arm is another chip that required 1.8 volts a few years ago, but the AA cell was 1.5 volts. How do get 1.8 from 1.5? Well, you have to step it up somehow.

这个电压可以跃升至输入之上的基本原理实际上被使用，当然还有附加电路，以获得更高的电压。这是一个你可以隐藏起来的关键点。这基本上就是我们在上一节课中讲到的内容。这是今天内容的开始。

And this basic principle where the voltage can jump up above the input is actually used, of course with additional circuitry, to kind of get higher voltages. It is a really key point that you can squirrel away. This was pretty much where we got to in the last lecture. This starts off the material for today.

我们要做的是采用相同的电路，但在这里放入一个小电阻。这就是我们要分析的。有关详细信息，您可以阅读课程笔记第 13.6 节。这里的绿色曲线是 LC 电路的行为。我们今天要展示的是，当我们引入 R 时，这里的正弦波会变湿。它会损失能量。

What we are going to do is take that same circuit, but instead we are going to put in this little resistor here. This is what we set out to analyze. And for details you can read the course notes Section 13.6. The green curve here was the behavior of the LC circuit. And what we are going to show today is that the moment we introduce R this sinusoid here gets damp. It kind of loses energy.

我将向您展示行为将如下所示。通过引入 R，这个家伙不会永远振荡。相反，它开始振荡，然后失去能量，变得疲惫，并在 VI 处稳定下来。记住演示。这正是您在演示中看到的。您有一个步骤输入，并且您有这种有趣的行为。

And I am going to show you that the behavior is going to look like this. By introducing R this guy doesn’t keep oscillating forever. Rather it begins to oscillate and then kind of loses energy and kind of gets tired and settles down at VI. And remember the demo. This is exactly what you saw in the demo. You had a step input and you had this funny behavior.

对于 RLC 来说，情况确实如此。所以今天的讲座将结束您在演示中看到的内容和奇怪的行为，今天我将向您展示其中的数学基础。让我们继续分析 RLC 电路。

And for the RLC that is exactly what it was. So today’s lecture will close the loop on what you saw in the demo and the weird behavior, and I am going to show you the mathematics foundations for that today. Let’s go ahead and analyze the RLC circuit.

我特意让整个演示尽可能贴近 RC 网络和 LC 网络的讨论，这样数学就完全一样了。数学中的步骤与分析的阐述完全相同。不同的是结果，因为电路不同。所以不要陷入数学的泥潭。

I purposely created the entire presentation to follow as closely as possible both the discussion of the RC networks and the LC networks so that the math is all the same. Exactly the same steps in the mathematics are in the exposition of the analysis. What’s different are the results because the circuit is different. So don’t get bogged down or whatever in the mathematics.

只需记住，您将要应用的是同一套步骤。我们首先写下元素的元素规则。这里没有什么新东西。对于电感器，V 是 Ldi/dt。积分形式就是 1/L 积分 vLdt=i。我们上次见过这个。对于电容器，流过电容器的电流就是 Cdv/dt。这些是电容器和电感器的两个元素规则。

Just remember it is the same set of steps that you are going to be applying. We start by writing down the element rules for our elements. Nothing new here. For the inductor V is Ldi/dt. The integral form which is simply 1/L integral vLdt=i. We saw this the last time. And for the capacitor, the current through the capacitor is simply Cdv/dt. Those are the two element rules for the capacitor and inductor.

当然，电阻的元件规则是 V=iR。你知道的。对于电压源，我们也知道电压是常数。只需遵循相同的既定模式即可。顺便说一句，为了让你知道，我在演示中设置了一些陷阱，以防止你睡着。你看到这里的虚线了吗？只要你看到虚线，就需要把这些内容抄下来。不要被它绊倒。

The element rule for the resistor, of course, is V=iR. You know that. And for the voltage source we know that, too, the voltage is a constant. Just follow the same established pattern. By the way, just so you are aware, I have booby trapped the presentation a little bit to prevent you from falling asleep. You see the dash lines here? Whenever you see a dash line, that stuff needs to be copied down. Don’t trip over that.

别说我没警告过你。我们先使用通常的节点方法。在这种情况下，我有两个节点。与 LC 电路不同，我有两个未知节点。一个是这里的节点，节点电压为 vA，第二个节点是电压为 vT 的节点。让我从 vA 开始，并为此写出节点方程。

Don’t say I didn’t warn you. We start by using the usual node method. And I have two nodes in this case. Unlike the LC circuits, I have two unknown nodes. One is this node here with the node voltage vA and the second node is the node with voltage vT. Let me start with vA and write the node equation for that.

它只是 1/L，节点方程是电流朝这个方向流动，是 vI vA 积分，等于朝这个方向流动的电流，即 vA v/R，节点方程。然后我为节点 v 写出节点方程，对于此处的这个节点，它只是 (vA v)/R=Cdvdt。这就是我这里的两个节点方程。

It is simply 1/L, the node equation for this is the current going in this direction with is vI vA integral and that equals the current going this way which is vA v/R, node equation. I then write the node equation for the node v, for this node here, and that is simply (vA v)/R=Cdvdt. And that is what I have here, two node equations.

让我为您总结一下结果，然后向您展示一个视图图，其中我仔细计算了数学运算，以了解我如何得到这个结果。这是我将得到的结果。如果我采用这两个节点方程式并进行一些数学运算，我将得到这个结果。我马上就向您展示。

Let me summarize the results for you and then show you a view graph where I grind through the math as to how I got the result. Here is the result I am going to get. If I take these two node equations and I massage some of the mathematics, I am going to get this result. And I will show you that in a second.

通过一些数学运算，解出这两个方程，并用 v 来表示，我得到了一个二阶微分方程，d^2v 等等等等。请注意，这与 LC 的这个术语不同。每一步你都可以检查一下我是在撒谎还是正确。我会在这里用一个小故事来满足你，更确切地说是满足我自己。理查德·费恩曼是一位众所周知的聪明人。

By grinding through some math and solving these two equations and expressing this in terms of v, I get a second order differential equation, d^2v blah, blah, blah. Notice that this is different from the LC in this term. Every step of the way you can check to see if I am lying or I am correct. I will indulge you, indulge myself rather with a little story here. Richard Fineman was a known smart guy.

他之所以能做到这一点，其中一个原因是，在谈话中，他总是站起来提出一些最奇怪、最难的问题，然后说，啊哈，这个证明中有一个错误，或者这个方程式中有一个错误，这个错误不对。通常他都是对的。所以他这样做是有技巧的，这也是他成为知名聪明人的原因之一。

And one of the reasons that he was that was in the middle of talks he was known to get up and ask some of the darndest, hardest questions and say ah ha, you have a bug in this proof here or a bug in this equation that is not right. And usually he would be correct. So his trick in doing this and which is one reason how he became a known smart guy.

他会做的是，随着演讲者继续讲话，他会跟着讲，想出一个简单的初始原始情况。在这种情况下，我有一个 RLC 电路。所以想出一个更简单的情况。一个更简单的情况是 R=0。每当您将 R 设置为零时，您都应该得到我们在上一节课中得到的结果，对吗？这就是 Fineman 会做的事情。

What he would do is, as the speaker went on talking he would kind of follow along and think of a simple initial primitive case. In this case, I have an RLC circuit. So think of a simpler case of this. A simpler case of this is R=0. Whenever you set R to be zero, you should get exactly what we got in the last lecture, correct? That is what Fineman would do.

他会把这个归结为一个更简单的情况，做一些假设，然后跟着做。每当他发现这里的数学和他的简单情况有差异时，他就会说，哦，那里有一个错误。如果你愿意，你可以用这种方式抓住我。在这里，Fineman 会做的是将 R 替换为零，然后注意，这里的这个等式正是我们上次在 R 为零时得到的。

He would boil this down to a simpler case, make some assumptions and just follow along. And whenever he found a discrepancy between the math here and his simple case he would say oh, there is a bug there. If you want you can catch me that way. Here, what Fineman would do is replace R being zero, and notice then this equation here is exactly what we got the last time with R being zero.

记住 Fineman 技巧。这是我们得到的方程，其中有一个 R 项的二阶微分方程。让我仔细研究一下数学知识，并向你们展示我是如何得出这个结果的。所以再次回到两个节点方程。我所做的是，首先取这两个方程，然后对 t 求导，这就是我得到的结果。

Just remember that Fineman trick. This is the equation we get, the second order differential equation with an R term in there. And let me just grind through the math and show you how I got this from this. So the two node equations again. And what I do is I start by taking these two equations and differentiating this with respect to t and this is what I get.

同时，我用这个项替换了这里的 (vA v)/R。我用这个替换这个并进行区分。然后我只需将整个值除以 C。然后我取这里的这个表达式并写下 vA 等于这里的这个值。接下来我要用这个替换 vA 并消除 vA。所以我取这个 vA，把吸盘放在这里，从而消除 vA 并得到这个。

And, at the same time, I have replaced (vA v)/R here by this term. I replace this with this and differentiate. Then I simply divide the whole thing by C. Then I take this expression here and write down vA is equal to this stuff here. Next I am going to substitute this back for vA and eliminate vA. So I take this vA, stick the sucker in here, and thereby eliminate vA and get this.

然后我将其简化，这就是我得到的结果。这就是我得到的结果。我只需仔细研究这两个方程式即可得到该结果。因此，就像一张卡住的唱片一样，我将在这里重复我们的咒语，这就是我们如何解决本课程中遇到的方程式，相同的三个步骤。找到特定解。找到均匀解。找到总解，然后使用初始条件找到常数。

And then I simplify it and here is what I get. That is what I get. I just grind through the two equations and get that result. So like a stuck record I will repeat our mantra here, which is here is how we solve the equations that we run across in this course, the same three steps. Find the particular solution. Find the homogenous solution. Find the total solution and then find the constants using the initial conditions.

相同的步骤。你可以在睡梦中背诵这些步骤。使用另外四个步骤可获得齐次解。让我们来看一下并将此方法应用于我们的方程并得到结果。vP 是特定解，vH 是齐次解。有了特定解，哦。在我继续执行此操作之前，让我先设置我的输入和状态变量。我的输入将是一个步骤。

Same steps. You could recite this in your sleep. And the homogenous solution is obtained using a further four steps. Let’s just go through and apply this method to our equation and get the results. vP is a particular solution and vH is the homogenous solution. With a particular solution, oh. Before I go on to do that, let me set up my inputs and my state variables. My input is going to be a step.

请记住，我试图带您回到演示结束的位置。演示有一个阶跃输入，所以我将使用一个上升到 vI 的阶跃输入。我将使用初始条件全为零。

Remember, I am trying to take you to the point where the demo left off. The demo had a step input, so I am going to use a step input rising to vI. And I am going to with the initial conditions being all zeros.

因此，电容器电压为零，电感器电流，另一个状态变量也为零，因此这也被亲切地称为 ZSR 或零状态响应，因为只有一个输入但状态为零。再次记住这里的虚线。不要说我没有警告过你。让我们从一个特定的解决方案开始。这很简单。我只需写下特定的方程式并粘贴我的具体输入。

So the capacitor voltage is zero, inductor current, another state variable is also zero, and therefore this is also fondly called the ZSR or the zero state response because there is only an input but zero state. Again, remember the dashed lines here. Don’t say I didn’t warn you. Let’s start with a particular solution. This is as simple as it gets. I simply write down the particular equation and stick my specific input.

请记住，特定方程的解可以是任何旧解，它不必是通用解，任何满足它的旧解。我将在这里找到一个简单的解决方案。V 特定是一个常数 VI。它有效。因为请记住，这一直有效。我将继续推动这一点，看看它是否有效，直到课程结束。猜猜怎么着？它会的。

And remember the solution to the particular equation is any old solution, it doesn’t have to be a general solution, any old solution that satisfies it. And I am going to find a simple solution here. And V particular is a constant VI. It works. Because remember this has been working all along. And I am going to keep pushing this and see if this works until the end of the course. Guess what? It will.

所以这就是解决方案。我完成了。这是我的具体解决方案。很简单。第二，我去做我的齐次解决方案。记住，齐次方程是相同的旧微分方程，驱动设置为零。请记住，有时这个驱动设置为零的方程是你在输入为零的情况下必须处理的整个方程。

So this is a solution. I’m done. That is my particular solution. Simple. Second, I go and do my homogenous solution. And the homogenous equation, remember, is the same old differential equation with the drive set to zero. Remember that sometimes this equation with the drive set to zero is the entire equation you have to deal with in situations where you have zero input, for example.

或者在其他情况下，输入端有一个脉冲。脉冲只是设置初始条件，比如电容器中的电荷或类似的东西。所以我们将快速完成这个四步方法。该方法简单地说，四个步骤，我将假设一个形式为 Ae^st 的解决方案。如果你认为你以前见过这个，是的，你以前已经见过很多次了。

Or in other situations in which you have an impulse at the input. And the impulse simply sets up the initial conditions like a charge in the capacitor or something like that. So we are going to blast through this four step method. The method simply says that four steps, I am going to assume a solution of the form Ae^st. And if you think you’ve seen that before, yes, you have seen it many times before.

你会一遍又一遍地看到它。我们需要找到 A 和 s。我们要形成特征方程，找到方程的根，然后将齐次方程的通解写下来。还是老样子。让我在这里介绍一下这些步骤。步骤 A，假设解的形式为 Ae^st。因此，我将 Ae^st 替换为方程的暂定解。

And you will see it again, again and again. And we need to find A and s. We want to form the characteristic equation, find the roots of the equation and then write down the general solution to the homogenous equation as this. Same old same old. Let me just walk through the steps here. Step A, assume a solution to the form Ae^st. And so I substitute Ae^st as my tentative solution to the equation.

再次提醒你，我们在这里解决的微分方程非常简单，因为你解决它们的方式是首先假设你知道解，然后把它代入方程，找出是什么让它成立。我将 Ae^st 代入这个微分方程，结果就是 A。

Again, let me remind you that the differential equations that we solve here are really easy because the way you solve them is you begin by assuming you know the solution and stick it in and find out what makes it work. I am going to stick Ae^st into this differential equation, and A comes out here.

对这个 d 平方求导，我得到 s 平方，A s，然后它就和 1/LC 系数一起固定在这里。下一步，我开始消除我能消除的，所以我消除了 A，然后消除了 e^st，最后我得到了这个方程。我得到了这个方程。这是我的特征方程。它是 s 中的方程。大家还记得我们得到的 LC 电路的特征方程吗？

Differentiate this d squared, I get s squared down here, A s here and this simply gets stuck down here with the 1/LC coefficient. The next step I begin eliminating what I can, so I eliminate the A’s, then eliminate the e^st’s, and I end up with this equation here. I end up with this equation. This is my characteristic equation. It is an equation in s. Do people remember the characteristic equation we got for the LC circuit?

还记得 Fineman 的技巧吗？没错，LC。S^2+1/LC=0。这个东西以前没有。你只需要跟着 R 走就行了。只要跟着 R 走就行了。只要想象这是一个美元符号，然后跟着它走就行了。你就会明白 LC 和 RLC 之间的区别。所以这是特征方程。

Remember the Fineman trick? That’s right, LC. S^2+1/LC=0. This thing wasn’t there. All you do is simply follow the R. Just follow the R. Just imagine this is a dollar sign and kind of follow it. And you will see what the differences are between the LC and the RLC. So this is the characteristic equation.

我要做的，就像我写 LC 电路的特征方程一样，用 omega nought 平方代替 1/LC。让我在这里做同样的事情，但也为 R 和 L 引入一些东西。我要做的是让我给你这个标准形式。我小时候学到的第一个二阶方程是这个，S 2+2AS+B 2 或类似的。

What I am going to do, iss much as I wrote the characteristic equation for the LC circuit, by substituting omega nought squared for 1/LC. Let me do the same thing here but introduce something for R and L as well. What I will do is let me give you this canonic form. The very first second order equation I learned about when I was a kid was this one, S2+2AS+B2 or something like that.

让我以这种形式写出来，得到 2 个 alpha 加上 omega 零平方。再次提醒，alpha 是由 R 产生的。因此 omega 零平方是 1/LC，alpha 是 RL/2。Omega 零平方是 1/LC，R/L 等于 2 个 alpha。我只是用更简单的形式写出来，这样从现在开始我只需要处理 alpha 和 omega 零。

Let me write it in that form where I get 2 alpha s plus omega nought squared. Again, remember the alpha comes about because of R. So omega nought squared is 1/LC and alpha is RL/2. Omega nought squared is 1/LC and R/L is equal to two alpha. I am just writing this in a simpler form so that from now on going forward I am just going to deal with alphas and omega noughts.

一旦我得到这个特征方程，我就可以给你一个通用的解决方法。根据你拥有的电路类型，串联 RLC（这就是我们拥有的）或并联 RLC，我们将获得不同的 alpha 项系数。这将保持不变，但这个项看起来会有所不同，alpha 看起来会有所不同。这里有一个真正的模式。

Once I get to this characteristic equation, after that I can give you one generic way of solving it. And depending on the kind of circuit you have, a series RLC, which is what we have, or a parallel RLC we will simply get different coefficients for the alpha term. This is going to stay the same but this term will look different, alpha is going to look different. There is a real pattern here.

我所做的只是关注重要的事情，即模式之间的差异。您了解了 LC 情况和 RLC 情况。鉴于此，我现在可以写下来，我只是简单地将其替换为处理 alpha 和 omega 的特征方程。稍后我将向您介绍 alpha 的物理意义。您还记得 omega nought 的物理意义吗？那是振荡频率。

And what I am doing is simply focusing on what is important, what the differences are between the pattern. You learned the LC situation and the RLC situation. Given this I can now write down, I am just simply replacing this as my characteristic equation in dealing with alphas and omegas. I will give you a physical significance of alpha in a little bit. Do you remember the physical significance of omega nought? That was the oscillation frequency.

换句话说，给定一个电感器和电容器，你给电容器充入一些电荷，然后观察它，它就会振荡。它的振荡频率将是 LC 的平方根。初始条件的幅度将决定振荡的高度或开始时的相位，但频率将保持不变。

In other words, given an inductor and capacitor, you put some charge on the capacitor and you watch it, it will oscillate. And its oscillation frequency will be one by a square root of LC. The magnitude of the initial conditions will determine how high are the oscillations or what the phase is in terms of when it starts, but the frequency is going to be the same.

第三步，为了解齐次方程，需要找到方程的根，s1 和 s2，这就是我的根。这是二阶方程的根，这里是小 s 平方方程。最后，既然我有了根，我就可以写下一般齐次解。所以一般解就是 A1e^s1t，A2e^s2t。就是这样。这就是解决方案。

Step three, to solve the homogenous equation, is find the roots of the equation, s1 and s2, and here are my roots. Good old roots for a second order, little s squared equation here. Finally, given that I have the roots, I can write down the general homogenous solution. So general solution is simply A1e^s1t, A2e^s2t. That’s it. That’s the solution.

这看起来又大又老套，但我们会进行一些简化，并表明它最终归结为某个 cos omega t。数学有点复杂，但我们归结为一个非常简单的东西，余弦。保留这个通解。从那里，作为微分方程解的第三步，我写下了总解。

This looks big and corny, but we are going to make some simplifications as we go along and show that it ends up boiling down to something cos omega t. The math is kind of involved but we get down to something very simple, a cosine. Hold this general solution. From that, as a step three of the differential equation solution, I write the total solution down.

我的总解是特有项和同质项之和，因此我得到了这个。VI 是我的特有项，这里的这个项是我的同质项解。现在，如果我不是在做电路，而是简单地尝试用数学方法解决这个问题，我会这样做。我会从初始条件中找到未知数，所以我知道 v(0)=0。因此，如果我用零代替 V(0)，我会得到这个。

And my total solution is the sum of the particular and the homogenous, so therefore I get this. VI was my particular and this term here is my homogenous solution. Now, if I wasn’t doing circuits and simply trying to solve this mathematically here is what I would do. I would find the unknown from the initial conditions, so I know that v(0)=0. And so therefore if I substitute zero for V(0) I get this.

如果我在这里代入零，t 为 0，t 为 0，所以我会得到 V1+A1+A2。让我快速完成，因为我将以不同的方式重做。i=Cdv/dt。这就是我得到的。我代入零，这就是我得到的。我匆匆完成了这个。别担心。我会再做一次。

If I substitute zero here, t is 0, t is 0, so I simply get V1+A1+A2. And let me just blast through because I am going to redo this differently. i=Cdv/dt. And so that’s what I get. I substitute zero and this is what I would get. I hurried through this. Don’t worry. I’m going to do it again.

如果你只是用数学方法，你可以解出这个方程和 a1 和 a2 中的这两个联立方程，得到系数，你就大功告成了。但这并没有让我们深入了解这些项的行为。我现在要做的就是忽略这一点。忽略我所做的，而是尝试走一条更直观的路。

If you just do it mathematically, you can solve this equation here and these two simultaneous equations in a1 and a2 and get the coefficients and you are done. But it doesn’t give us a whole lot of insight into the behavior of these terms here. What I am going to do for now is kind of ignore that. Ignore I did that and instead try to go down a path that is a little bit more intuitive.

让我们看看我们得到的总解的表达式。这就是我们得到的表达式。我所做的就是，我把 alpha 放在那里，我只是把 alpha 拉到外面。所以这是我的总解，V1 A1e^(alpha t) 其他东西和其他东西。根据 alpha 和 omega nought 的相对值，需要考虑三种情况。如果 alpha 大于 omega nought，那么我在这里得到一个实数。

Let’s stare at this expression we got for the total solution. That is the expression we got. All I did is, I had alpha in there, I simply pulled out the alpha outside. So this is my total solution, V1 A1e^( alpha t) something else and something else. Three cases to consider depending on the relative values of alpha and omega nought. If alpha is greater than omega nought then I get a real quantity here.

一个正数的平方根，我得到一个实数，这个数将加到负 alpha，我将得到一个看起来像是，哦，对不起的解。让我做一点不同的事情。这里有三种情况。一种是 alpha 大于 omega nought。一种是 alpha 等于 omega nought。一种是 alpha 小于 omega nought。

The square root of a positive number, I get a real number, and that number will add up to the minus alpha and I am going to get a solution that will look like, oh, I’m sorry. Let me just do it a little differently. There are three situations here. One is alpha greater than omega nought. Alpha equal to omega nought. Alpha less than omega nought.

Alpha 大于，alpha 小于，alpha 等于平方根符号内的这个项。出于您很快就会明白的原因，我们将其称为“过阻尼”情况、“欠阻尼”情况和“临界阻尼”情况。当 alpha 大于 omega 零时，这个项会给我一个实数，我得到的就是这么简单。请记住，对于串联 RLC 电路，alpha 是 R/2L。

Alpha is greater, alpha is less, alpha is equal to this term inside the square root sign. For reasons you will understand shortly, we call this “overdamped” case, the “underdamped” case and the “critically damped” case. When alpha is greater than omega nought this term gives me a real number, and I get something as simple as this. Remember, for the series RLC circuit, alpha was R/2L.

因此，如果 R 很大，换句话说，如果在我的 RLC 电路中 R 很大，那么我就会得到这种情况。我的电容器上的输出电压将看起来像这样，两个指数的总和。如果我为您快速绘制它，对于 VI 步骤，V 将看起来像这样。所以 v 看起来就是这样，因为它是几个指数的总和。

So if R is big, in other words, if in my RLC circuit R is huge then I am going to get this situation. My output voltage on the capacitor is going to look like this, the sum of two exponentials. And if I were to plot it very quickly for you, for a VI step, V would look like this. So v would simply look like this because it is the sum of a couple of exponentials.

好的。现在，alpha 为正。记住 alpha1 和 alpha2 都是正的。由于这个常数 VI，这两个相加会产生以下增加的结果。让我们看看 alpha 小于 omega nought 的情况，其中平方根符号内的项为负。我能做的就是把负号拉出来并这样表达。

All right. Now, alpha is positive here. Remember alpha1 and alpha2 are both positive. These two added up, because of this constant VI, give rise to something that increases in the following manner. Let’s look at the situation where alpha is less than omega nought, where the term inside the square root sign is negative. What I can do is pull the negative sign out and express it this way.

我要做的是，由于 alpha 小于 omega 0，我要将这两个反转并将负 1 的平方根拉到外面。这就是我得到的结果。我只是在玩弄它，这样平方根符号下面的任何东西最终都会给我一个正实数。所以我把 j 拉到外面，这就是我得到的结果。

What I am going to do is since alpha is less than omega nought, I am going to reverse these two and pull out square root of minus one to the outside. This is what I get. I am just playing around with this so that whatever is under the square root sign ends up giving me a positive real number. So I pull the j outside and this is what I get.

现在，让我快速计算一下数学知识，最后得出一个非常简单的公式，适用于这种欠阻尼的情况。让我定义几个其他术语。我将把 omega nought 减去 alpha 平方，即它的平方根。我将其称为 omega d。这就是我得到的结果。所以我现在为你定义了三个东西，alpha、omega nought 和 omega d。 

Now, let me blast through a bunch of math and end up with something very, very simple for this underdamped case. Let me define a few other terms. I am going to call omega nought minus alpha squared the square root of that. I am going to call it omega d. And here is what I get. So I have defined three things for you now, alpha, omega nought and omega d. 

我得到了这个关于 alpha 和 omega d 的方程。然后，还记得你那古老的欧拉关系吗？e 到 j omega d 就是余弦加 aj 正弦。我要快速讲解一下一堆数学知识。

And I get this equation in terms of alpha and omega d. And then, remember from your good old Euler relationship? e to the j omega d is simply cosine plus a j sine. I am just going to blast through a bunch of math rather quickly.

一旦我将其替换为 a 余弦和正弦、余弦和 aj 正弦，然后将所有系数收集在一起，我就会得到一个 VI 形式的方程，加上某个常数 e 到负 alpha t，余弦，常数 e 到负 alpha t 的总和，正弦。请记住，正弦和余弦已经出来了，但由于我的 RI，我在这里得到了这个有趣的 alpha，e 到负 alpha。

Once I replace this in terms of a cosine and sine, cosine and a j sine and then collect all the coefficients together, I get an equation of the form VI plus some constant e to the minus alpha t, cosine, the sum of the constant e to the minus alpha t, sine. Remember the sines and cosines are coming out, but because of my R I am getting this funny alpha here, e to the minus alpha here.

所以我得到了正弦和余弦的和。K1 和 K2 是一些常数，我需要根据我的初始条件确定它们。我将继续这样做，并不断简化它，因为正如我向你承诺的那样，我想得到一个余弦值。我想沿着这条路走下去。我不会讨论这种情况，即临界阻尼的情况。

So I am getting sums of sine and cosine. And K1 and K2 are some constants which I will need to determine for my initial conditions. I am going to continue on with this and keep on simplifying it because, as I promised you, I want to get to something that is just a cosine. I want to go down this path. I am not going to cover this case, the critically damped case.

我稍后会谈到这一点，但不会详细阐述。让我继续讨论欠阻尼的情况，这就是我们所得到的。继续数学运算，让我们从初始条件开始，v nought 等于零，这给了我 K1 就是 VI。因此，在 v(0)=0 时 t 为零，因此这个项消失，余弦变为 1，e^(alpha t) 消失，K1=VI。

And I will touch upon it later but not dwell on it. Let me continue down the path of the underdamped case, and this is what we have. Continuing with the math, let’s start with the initial conditions, v nought equals zero, and that gives me K1 is simply VI. So at v(0)=0 t is zero, so this terms goes away, the cosine becomes a 1, e^(alpha t) goes away, and K1= VI.

然后我知道 i(0) 和 I 就是 Cdv/dt。我得到了这个难看的表达式。我代入 t=0，得到了类似这样的结果。我知道 K1 是什么，因此 K2 就是 V1alpha 除以 omega nought。我采用了这个表达式，其中可以找到未知数 K1 和 K2。

Then I know that i(0) and I is simply Cdv/dt. And I get this nasty expression. I substitute t=0 and I get something that looks like this. I know what K1 is, and so therefore K2 is simply V1alpha divided by omega nought. I have taken this expression where the unknowns K1 and K2 are to be found.

我将初始条件设置为 t=0，得到 K1 和 K2，如下所示，这给出了以下解决方案。这是我得到的不再有任何未知数的解决方案。请记住，omega d 和 alpha 与电路参数直接相关。Alpha 是 R/2L，omega d 是 alpha 平方减去 omega nought 平方的平方根。

I set the initial conditions down at t=0 and I get K1 and K2 as follows, which gives me the following solution. This is the solution I get where I do not have any unknowns anymore. Remember that omega d and alpha are directly related to circuit parameters. Alpha was R/2L and omega d was square root of alpha squared minus omega nought squared.

** omega d = sqrt(alpha^2 omega_0^2) ** 而 omega 零的平方等于 LC 的平方根 1。所以我现在知道了。我这里还有正弦和余弦，所以我要进一步简化一下。哦，在我继续这样做之前，让我们再做一次 Fineman 技巧，看看我是否仍然忠于上次做的 LC 电路。

** omega d = sqrt(alpha^2 omega_0^2) ** And omega nought squared was 1 by square root of LC. So I know it all now. I still have sines and cosines here, so I am going to simplify this a little further. Oh, before I go on to do that, let’s do the Fineman trick again and notice if I am still true to the LC circuit I did the last time.

记住，当 R 趋于零时，alpha 也趋于零。因为 alpha 等于 R 除以 2L。如果 alpha 为零，会发生什么？如果 alpha 为零，这个数就会趋于一，整个项就会趋于零，而 omega dt 现在最终变为 omega 零，我在这里得到了这个项。我得到了 VI VIcosine(omega t)，这正是我在方程式中期望的。这与我得到的 LC 情况相同。

Remember when R goes to zero alpha goes to zero. Because alpha is R divided by 2L. If alpha was zero what happens? If alpha was zero, this guy goes to one, this whole term goes to zero and omega dt now ends up becoming omega nought, and I get this term here. I get VI VIcosine(omega t), which is exactly what I expected in my equation. This is the same as the LC case that I got.

让我们回到这种情况，并简单地进一步讨论。如果你查看课程笔记中的附录 B.7，附录 B.7 是关于三角学的快速教程。在该三角学教程中，你会看到，而且你可能也多次看到过，正弦的缩放和也是正弦。这是正弦波的一个非常酷的事实。

Let’s go back to this situation and simply if further. If you look at Appendix B.7 in your course notes, Appendix B.7 is a quick tutorial on trig. And in that trig tutorial you will see that, and you have probably seen this before, too, multiple times, the scaled sum of sines are also sines. This is an incredibly cool fact of sinusoids.

如果你取两个频率相同的正弦波，以任意方式缩放它们，然后将它们相加，你最终也会得到一个正弦波。这很难令人相信，但这是真的。这是正弦波的一个令人难以置信的特性。取任意两个正弦波，以任意方式缩放它们，频率相同，将它们相加，你就会得到一个正弦波。

If you take two sinusoids of the same frequency and you scale them up in any which way and add them up you also end up with a sinusoid. It is hard to believe but it is true. It is an incredible property of sinusoids. Take any two sinusoids, scale them in any way you like, same frequency, add them up, you will get a sinusoid.

这句话的意思是，看，这是一条正弦曲线，这是一条正弦函数，我正在以某种方式将它们放大。所以我应该能够将它们相加，并将其表示为单正弦。为了确保你能做到，请查看附录，其中有一个表达式，a1 sinX 加 a2 cosX 等于 blah、blah、blah 的余弦。这就是你得到的。

What that is saying is that, look, here is a sinusoid, here is a sinusoidal function, and I am scaling them up in some manner. So I should be able to add them up and be able to express that as single sine. And to be sure you can, look at the Appendix, and there is an expression for a1 sinX plus a2 cosX is equal to a cosine of blah, blah, blah. This is what you get.

这里没有魔法。只有数学。我从这里直接得到这个。看看我得到的。这绝对令人难以置信。v(t) 只是 VI，这里有一个常数，这是负 alpha 项的 e，还有一个余弦。再次使用 Fineman 技巧，如果这个 alpha 在这里变为零，那么您最终会得到 LC 情况的表达式。

No magic here. Just math. From here I directly get this. And look at what I have. It is absolutely unbelievable. v(t) is simply VI, there is a constant here, this an e to the minus alpha term and there is a cosine. Again, to pull the Fineman trick, if this alpha were to go to zero here then you would end up with the expression you had for the LC situation.

让我们再看一会儿。有一个常数加上一个负数，即余弦项，因此输出端有一个正弦波，负 alpha 有一个 e，最终会给你之前看到的衰减。换句话说，对于阶跃输入，LC 电路会给你一个正弦波。如果 alpha 为零，LC 电路就会这样做。

Let’s stare at this a little while longer. There is a constant plus a minus, a cosine term, so there is a sinusoid at the output, and there is an e to the minus alpha which ends up giving you the decay you have seen before. In other words, to a step input, the LC circuit would give you a sinusoid. That is what the LC circuit would do if alpha was zero.

但是由于这里的 alpha 项，即 e 减去 alpha t，会产生阻尼效应，因此随着时间的推移，这个东西会变得越来越小，直到 t 等于无穷大时该项变为零。这个东西会衰减，因此最终会得到您看到的曲线。

But because of this alpha term here, e to the minus alpha t, that gives rise to a damping effect, so this causes this thing to become smaller and smaller as time goes by until this term goes to zero at t equals infinity. This guy damps down and so therefore you end up getting the curve that you saw like this.

花了二十分钟的时间解决二阶微分方程，但最终得到的是相同的正弦波，但它以以下方式衰减，即频率（而不是振幅）不断衰减，直到从零开始，然后稳定在 vI。这正是您在我们之前向您展示的演示中看到的。临界阻尼的情况，我不会在这里讲。

Twenty minutes of juggling math solving a second order differential equation, but what ends up is the same sinusoid but it is damped in the following manner such that the frequency, rather the amplitude keeps decaying until it starts off at zero and then settles down at vI. This is exactly what you saw in the demo that we showed you earlier. The critically damped case, I am not going to do it here.

我将向您指出以下见解。欠阻尼的情况看起来是这样的。它是一个衰减的正弦波。这是欠阻尼的情况。然后我向您展示了过阻尼的情况。过阻尼的情况看起来是这样的。正如您可能预料的那样，临界阻尼的情况介于两者之间，看起来是这样的。

I am going to point you to the following insight. The underdamped case looked like this. It was a sinusoid that kind of decayed out. That is the underdamped case. And then I showed you the overdamped case. The overdamped case looked like this. And, as you might expect, the critically damped case is kind of in the middle and looks like this.

因此，过阻尼的情况会像这样，欠阻尼的情况会像这样，临界阻尼的情况会上升，然后几乎立即稳定下来。这是当 alpha 等于 omega 0 时的情况。我不会在这里讨论这种情况，但我只会指出第 13.2.3 节。为了把事情联系在一起，回想一下我们昨天在课堂上向您展示的这个演示。

So the overdamped case would look like this, underdamped like this, and the critically damped case kind of goes up and kind of settles down almost immediately. This is when alpha equals omega nought. I won’t do that case here, but I will simply point you to Section 13.2.3. Just to tie things together, recall this demo here that we showed you in class yesterday.

这正是您看到的由于该输入步骤而形成的正弦波形式。如果您想查看反相器对的完整分析并查看由此产生的延迟等，您可以查看第 170 页和示例 898。在接下来的五六分钟里，我想做的是观察 RLC 电路。

This is exactly the kind of form of the sinusoid you saw because of that input step. If you want to see a complete analysis of inverter pairs and look at the delays and so on because of that, you can look at Page 170 and example 898. In the next five or six minutes, what I would like to do is stare at the RLC circuit.

就像我向您展示的一些获取 RC 响应的直观方法一样，我们将对 RLC 做同样的事情。在 RLC 情况下，与 RC 情况非常相似，专家们不会在每次看到 RLC 电路时都写 15 页微分方程并求解它们。他们盯着它看，然后砰的一声，响应就出来了，草图就出来了。

And much like I showed you some intuitive methods to get the RC response, what we are going to do is do the same thing for the RLC. In the RLC situation, much like the RC situation, experts don’t go around writing 15 pages of differential equations and solving them each time they see an RLC circuit. They stare at it and boom, the response pops out, the sketch pops out.

这篇文章将与我们的《像贝克汉姆一样踢球》系列类似。这篇文章是为了纪念 Leslie Kolodziejski。我称之为“像 Kolodziejski 一样征服它”。再次重申，正如我所说，专家不会到处求解冗长的微分方程，也不会花上十页笔记来试图得到正弦波。他们会查看电路并绘制响应。我也会向你展示如何做到这一点。

This one is going to be another one like our Bend it Like Beckham series here. And this one is in honor of Leslie Kolodziejski. And I call it “Konquer it like Kolodziejski”. Again, as I said, experts don’t go around solving long differential equations and spending ten pages of notes trying to get a sinusoid. They look at a circuit and sketch response. I am going to show you how to do that, too.

你可以做的是，为了练习，去 Websim 尝试各种输入和初始条件的组合并绘制草图，自己计时，给自己 30 秒或一分钟的时间，然后绘制草图并根据 Websim 响应进行检查。如果不匹配，要么是你错了，要么是 Websim 中存在错误。

And what you can do is, to practice, go to Websim and try out various combinations of inputs and initial conditions and sketch it, time yourself, give yourself 30 seconds or a minute if you like, and sketch it and check it against the Websim response. If it doesn’t match either you are wrong or there is a bug in Websim.

我要做的是，临界阻尼和欠阻尼情况的响应很容易画出来。你从初始条件开始，稳定在 VI，然后就这样画出来。有趣的情况是欠阻尼的情况，这就是我要讨论的。在我们继续并向你展示直观方法之前，作为第一步，我想建立一些直觉。

What I am going to do is, the response to the critically damped and underdamped case was very easy to sketch out. You started with an initial condition, you settled at VI and just kind of drew it like that. The interesting case is the underdamped case, and that is what I am going to dwell on. Before we go on and I show you the intuitive method, as a first step I would like to build some intuition.

让我们看看这里的响应，并尝试了解发生了什么。这是我们看到的响应。您看到振荡发生的事实也称为“振铃”。您说您的电路正在振铃。好的。您会看到一些有趣的事实。您会看到振铃的频率由 omega d 给出。这是余弦 omega d，所以这就是频率 omega d。 

Let’s stare at this response here and try to understand what is going on. This is the response that we saw. And this fact that you see an oscillation happening is also called “ringing”. You say that your circuit is ringing. All right. You see some interesting facts. You see that frequency of the ringing is given by omega d. This cosine omega d, so that is the frequency omega d. 

因此，时间是 2 pi 除以 omega d。振荡频率是 omega d，但 omega d 只是 omega 零平方减去 alpha 平方。一旦 R 值很大，alpha 就会变得非常小，omega d 通常等于或非常接近 omega 零。因此，omega d 和 omega 零通常非常接近。当发生这种情况时，该频率直接等于 omega 零。

So the time is 2 pi divided by omega d. The oscillation frequency is omega d, but omega d is simply omega nought squared minus alpha squared. Once you have a big value of R alpha becomes very small and omega d is very commonly equal to, very close to omega nought. So omega d and omega nought very commonly are very close together. And when that happens this frequency is directly omega nought.

Alpha 控制正弦波衰减的速度。对于 alpha t，这是控制正弦波衰减速度的包络。请注意，这些项中的每一个，alpha 和 omega nought，都直接来自我的特征方程。这意味着，一旦你得到了你的特征方程，你就不需要做太多其他事情了。

Alpha governs how quickly your sinusoid decays. e to the alpha t here is the envelope that governs how quickly my sinusoid decays. And notice that each of these terms, alpha and omega nought, comes directly from my characteristic equation. Which means that once you get your characteristic equation you really don’t have to do much else.

到目前为止，您仍然需要写出微分方程才能得到特征方程，因此您仍然需要做一些微分方程的工作，但在两堂课中，我将向您展示一种方法，您甚至可以通过检查写下特征方程。看看您的电路，在 15 秒或更短的时间内写下特征方程。这绝对令人难以置信。这里还有哪些有趣的因素？

And up until now you still have to write the differential equation to get the characteristic equation, so you still have to do some differential equation stuff, but in two lectures I am going to show you a way that you can even write down the characteristic equation by inspection. Look at your circuit and boom, in 15 seconds or less write down the characteristic equation. It is absolutely unbelievable. What are the other factors that are interesting here?

当然，我需要找出初始值。我从零开始。这是我的电容电压。如果没有无限尖峰或脉冲，我的电容电压会试图保持原样并从零开始。最终值由 VI 给出，电容器是长期开路，因此 VI 出现在电容器两端。从长远来看，我的最终值将是 VI。

Of course I need to find out initial values. I start off at zero. This is my capacitor voltage. If I don’t have an infinite spike or an impulse my capacitor voltage tries to stay where it is and starts off at zero. And the final value is given by VI, the capacitor is a long term open so therefore VI appears across the capacitor. In the long term my final value is going to be VI.

还有一个有趣的参数，今天我将简单定义它，但一周后我会详细讨论它，这个参数称为 Q。你们中的一些人可能听说过这个术语，哦，这是一个高 Q 电路。Q 表示电路的振幅。Q 定义为 omega nought 乘以 2 alpha。它被称为“品质因数”。

There is one other interesting parameter, which I will simply define today but dwell on about a week from today, and that is called the Q. Some of you may have heard the term oh, that’s a high Q circuit. Q is an indication of how ringy the circuit is. And Q is defined as omega nought by 2 alpha. It is called the “quality factor”.

事实证明，Q 大约等于振铃周期数。因此，如果 Q 值较高，振铃时间较长；如果 Q 值较低，振铃时间较短。这称为品质因数，由 omega nought 乘以 2 alpha 定义。请注意，Q、omega nought、alpha、omega d 均来自特征方程中的项。

And it turns out that Q is approximately the number of cycles of ringing. So if you have a high Q you ring for a long time and if you have a low Q you ring for a very short time. That is called the quality factor defined by omega nought by 2 alpha. Notice that Q, omega nought, alpha, omega d, all of these come from the terms in the characteristic equation.

我们稍后会花更多时间讨论 Q。有了这种洞察力，我就可以非常快速地勾勒出响应的形式。这是我的电路。我想勾勒出 vI 阶跃输入的响应形式。这里是零到 vI 阶跃输入，我想找出此时发生的情况。课程笔记中的第 13.8 节将向您更详细地描述这一点。

We will spend more time on Q later. With this insight here is how I can go about very quickly sketching out the form of the response. Here is my circuit. I want to sketch the form of the response for a step input at vI. Zero to vI step input here, I want to find out what happens at this point. This is described to you in a lot more detail in Section 13.8 in your course notes.

让我们来看看这些步骤。我们先来处理非常简单的情况。为了好玩，我们还假设 v(0) 一开始是某个正值。某个 v(0) 是一个正数。而且，为了让我们自己更难理解，我们假设 i(0) 一开始是某个负数。所以 i(0) 是某个负电流。我知道的第一件事是 v(0)，电容电压从这里开始，可能会突然改变。

Let’s go through the steps. Let’s do the really simple situation first. Let’s also assume for fun that you are given that v(0) starts out being some positive value. Some v(0) which is a positive number. And, to make it harder on ourselves, let’s say i(0) starts out being some negative number. So i(0) is some negative current. The first thing I know is v(0), the capacitor voltage starts out here, which can change suddenly.

我还知道，从长远来看，这是一个开路。因此，从长远来看，这个电压 vI 将直接出现在电容器两端。所以我从 v(0) 开始，到 vI 结束，这也是一半。我知道曲线的起点和终点。然后我知道这里的某个地方一定有一些有趣的旋转，因为请记住，我正在处理欠阻尼的情况。

And I also know that in the long term this is an open circuit. So that this voltage vI will appear directly across the capacitor in the long term. So I get starting out at v(0), ending at vI am also half the way there. I know the initial and ending point of the curve. And then I know that somewhere in here there must be some funny gyrations here, because remember I am dealing with the underdamped case.

你可以通过 alpha 和 omega nought 来确定这一点。如果 alpha 小于 omega nought，你就知道你处于欠阻尼的情况，这就是你得到的结果。让我们计算并写下特征方程。从今天起一周后，你将通过检查来写出它，但现在你将通过写下微分方程来做到这一点。

And you can determine that from alpha and omega nought. If alpha is less than omega nought, you know that you are in the underdamped case and this is what you get. Let’s compute and write the characteristic equation down. A week from today you will write it by inspection, but for now you will do it by writing down a differential equation.

从特征方程中，你将得到 omega d、alpha、omega nought 和 Q。因此，omega d 给出了振荡频率。现在我知道了振荡频率。从 Q，我知道它响了多长时间，因为我知道它响了大约 Q 个周期。我知道响铃大约在这里停止。

And from the characteristic equation you will get omega d, you will get alpha, omega nought and Q. So omega d gives you the frequency of oscillations. My frequency of oscillation is now known. From Q I know how long it rings, because I know it rings for about Q cycles. I know that ringing stops approximately here.

然后我知道在起点和终点之间我的曲线看起来是这样的，就像这样。我们已经完成了 95%。唯一的问题是我不知道它是像这样还是像这样。我还不太确定它是一开始走高还是一开始走低。不太清楚。我也不知道最大振幅是多少。

And then I know that between that the start and end point my curve kind of looks like this, something like this. Right there we are 95% of the way there. The only question is I do not know if it goes like this or it goes like this. I am not quite sure yet if it starts off going high or starts off going low. Not quite clear. I also do not know what the maximum amplitude is.

事实证明，这很难确定，所以我们就不处理了。只需简单地画一个草图即可。问题是它从哪里开始？我可以留给你思考。是的，让我来做。它在本页上给出，所以不要看它。想想它，想想你如何确定它是向上还是向下。

It turns out this is rather complicated to determine so we won’t deal with that. Just simply so you can draw a rough sketch. The questions is which way does it start? I could leave it for you to think about. Yeah, let me do that. It is given on this page so don’t look at it. Think about it, and think about how you can determine whether it goes up or down.

事实证明，在这种情况下，它会先停机然后响铃。看看你们能否自己弄清楚，然后我们下周再讨论。

It turns out that in this case it is going to down and then ring. See if you can figure it out for yourselves and then we will talk about it next week.

Lec 16 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 16 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 52:08 https://youtube.com/watch?v=3GdMaDzIUeQ

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 52:08 https://youtube.com/watch?v=3GdMaDzIUeQ

介绍

Introduction

好的。早上好。我们开始吧。和往常一样，我将从回顾开始。今天，我们将开始分析集总电路的另一个重要里程碑。它被称为“正弦稳态”。同样，我相信这将是我使用视图图的第二次也是最后一次讲座。

OK. Good morning. Let’s get going. As always, I will start with a review. And today we embark on another major milestone in our analysis of lumped circuits. And it is called the “Sinusoidal Steady state”. Again, I believe this will be the second and the last lecture for which I will be using view graphs.

这里的想法是，就像上一堂课一样，有很多数学难题需要解决。今天我想用一张小图表展示一下解决基于时域微分方程的一些问题所需的努力程度，就像上一堂课一样，今天的内容略有不同，而周四的内容要好得多。

And the idea here is that, just like in the last lecture, there is a bunch of mathematical grunge that needs to be gone through. And I want to show you a sequence in a little chart today that talks about the effort level in doing some problems based on time domain differential equations, as in the last lecture, something slightly different today and something much better on Thursday.

因此，从某种意义上说，周四的讲座和今天的讲座涉及讨论某些类型电路行为的基础。有这些基础作为背景知识对你有好处，但当你真正去解决电路问题时，你不会完全使用这些方法。你会使用更简单的技术，我将在下周四讨论这些技术。让我们先快速回顾一下，然后我们将进入正弦稳态。

And so, in some sense, Thursday’s lecture and today’s lecture involve talking about the foundations of the behavior of certain types of circuits. And it is good for you to have this foundation as background, but when you actually go to solve circuits you don’t quite use these methods. You use much easier techniques, which I will talk about next Thursday. Let’s start with a quick review, and then we will go into sinusoidal steady state.

上一节课我们讨论了该电路，在周二的两节课前我们也进行了同样的讨论。

The last lecture we talked about this circuit and we did the same two lectures ago on Tuesday.

最后一堂课

Last Lecture

我们有一个逆变器驱动另一个逆变器。我们说地线上的电线有一些电感。CGS 是栅极电容，R 是第一个逆变器漏极的电阻。如果你看一下这个电路，你会发现这个电路形成了一个 RLC 模式。

We had one inverter driving another inverter. And we said that the wire over ground had some inductance. CGS is the capacitor of the gate and R is the resistance at the drain of the first inverter. And if you look at this circuit, that circuit formed an RLC pattern.

我们所做的是，让我们在输入端用 1 到 0 的转换来驱动它。输入端 1 到 0 的转换会导致该晶体管关闭，然后该节点将从非常低的值变为高值。因此，就好像在这个输入端应用了 5 伏的阶跃。

And what we did was we said let’s drive this with a one to zero transition at the input. And the one to zero transition at the input would cause this transistor to switch off, and this node would then go from a very low value to a high value. So it as if a 5 volt step was applied at this input.

我们还看到，使用时域微分方程，通过在此处应用阶跃输入，输出看起来是这样的。当我们有电容器和电感器时，输出会表现出一些振荡行为。我还向您介绍了它为什么会这样振荡。您在复习中也听到过，这种振荡的原因是这两个存储元件。每个存储元件都试图保留其状态变量。

We also saw that using time domain differential equations that by applying a step input here the output looked like this. The output would show some oscillatory behavior when we have a capacitor and inductor. I also gave you some insight as to why it oscillates like this. And you also heard in recitation that the reason for this oscillation was because of these two storage elements. Each of these storage elements tries to hold onto its state variable.

例如，电容器试图维持其电压，而电感器试图维持其电流。并且，就像来回摆动的钟摆一样，它在这里交换势能和动能，并来回摆动。

For example, the capacitor tries to maintain its voltage while the inductor tries to maintain its current. And, much like a pendulum which oscillates back and forth, it swaps potential energy versus kinetic energy down here and swings back and forth.

同样，在这样的 LC 电路中，能量在势能和动能之间来回交换，而动能又在电感器中存储的能量和电容器中存储的能量之间来回交换，来回晃动。由于这个电阻器的存在，能量最终会消散，最终会得到一个对应于此处出现的 5 伏的最终值。这是为什么呢？

In the same way, in an LC circuit like this, energy swaps back and forth between a potential energy and a kinetic energy equivalent, which swaps back and forth between energy stored in the inductor and energy stored in the capacitor and sloshes back and forth. And because of this resistor the energy eventually dissipates and you end up getting a final value which corresponds to the 5 volts appearing here. And why is that?

这是因为请记住，对于直流电来说，电容器是长期开路的。它是直流电压。经过很长时间，这个电容器看起来像是开路，电感器看起来像是完全短路，理想电感器是直流电的完全短路。因此，从长远来看，就好像这个家伙是短路的，这个家伙是开路的，所以这里只出现了 5 伏电压。这是瞬态行为。

That is because remember the capacitor is a long term open for DC. It is a DC voltage. After a long time this capacitor looks like an open circuit and the inductor looks like a complete short circuit, an ideal inductor as a complete short circuit for DC. And so therefore in the long term it is as if this guy is a short, this guy is an open, so 5 volts simply appears here. And this is the transient behavior.

然后我们只需关闭第一个晶体管。

Then we just switch the first transistor off.

直观分析

Intuitive Analysis

在上一节课中，我结束了直观分析。让我快速介绍一下，并为您重做直观分析。我上次让您思考瞬态响应是从下降开始还是从上升开始。今天我将介绍这一点。这是我们分析的电路。这里有一个带阶跃的 VI 输入和一个 RLC。

In the last lecture, I left off with intuitive analysis. Let me quickly cover that and redo the intuitive analysis for you. I left it the last time by having you think about whether the transient response would begin by going down or begin by going up. And I will cover that today. This was the circuit that we analyzed. A VI input with a step and an RLC out here.

我们绘制了电容器电压。直观地，我们可以按以下方式绘制它。我还为您标记了课程笔记中讨论此直观分析的章节编号（第 13.8 节）。我们先做简单的事情。请注意，电容器想要保持其电压。

And we were plotting the capacitor voltage. And intuitively we can plot this in the following way. I have also marked for you the section number in the course notes which has a discussion of this intuitive analysis, (Section 13.8). Let’s do the easy stuff first. Notice that the capacitor wants to hold its voltage.

因此，鉴于这里没有任何无限脉冲，我将从电容器电压所在的位置开始。初始条件已提供给您。已知电容器电压在 v 为零时开始为正，电流在时间零时开始为负。

And so given that we don’t have any infinite impulse here, I am going to start out with the capacitor voltage being where it is. And the initial conditions are given to you. You are given that the capacitor voltage starts out being positive at v zero and the current starts out being negative at time zero.

所以我告诉你，在时间 t=0 时，电容器两端的电压为 v，并且有电流流动。由于 I 为负，因此最初有电流沿与此处箭头相反的方向流动。I 零点为负。鉴于此，我可以凭直觉开始绘制曲线。

So I am telling you that there is a voltage v across the capacitor at time t=0 and there is a current that is flowing. Since I is negative there is a current initially that is flowing in the opposite direction to this arrow here. The I zero is negative.
