In light of that, I can start plotting my curve here by intuition.

我首先说，在时间 t=0 时，我被告知电容器的初始电压为零。这几乎是最简单的了。完全直观。我还知道，经过很长一段时间后，有人能告诉我经过很长一段时间后电容器末端的电压是多少吗？你应该能够通过观察得到它？VI。为什么是 VI？

I start by saying at time t=0 I am told that the initial voltage of the capacitor is at zero. This is about as simple as it gets.completely intuitive. I also know that after a long time, can someone tell me after a long time what the voltage will be at the end of the capacitor? You should be able to get his by observation? VI. And why is it VI?

这是 vI，因为这是直流值 VI。经过很长一段时间后，这个家伙对直流的表现就像开路一样。这个家伙对直流的表现就像短路一样。因此，由于这是一个开路，VI 会在很长时间后出现在这里。因此，经过很长一段时间后，电容器电压将为 VI。我刚刚向你展示了这一点。就是这样。

It is vI because this is a DC value VI. And after a long time this guy behaves like an open circuit to DC. This guy behaves like a short circuit to DC. So since this is an open circuit, VI will appear here after a long time. And so therefore, after a long time, the capacitor voltage is going to be at VI. And I just showed you that. There you go.

您已经完全通过观察和直觉确定了曲线的两个端点。没有 DE，什么都没有。只需盯着它并了解简单的原始电路元件如何工作的基本原理。绝对简单的东西。所以你现在已经确定了两端，中间的东西就不会出错。让我们看看。下一步我要做的是了解这里的电路动态是什么样的。

You already have the two endpoints of your curve completely by observation, intuition. No DEs, no nothing. Just by staring at it and understanding the fundamentals of how simple primitive circuit elements work. Absolutely simple stuff. So you’ve nailed the two ends now and you cannot go wrong with the stuff in the middle. Let’s see. As a next step what I do is I need to understand what the dynamics of the circuit looks like here.

动态分析

Dynamic Analysis

我所做的是开发特征方程。首先，您将写出微分方程，然后代入 e^st 并得到此特征方程。但您也可以将其记为一种模式。对于串联 RLC 电路，您总是会得到这种形式的方程。如果这是 R、L 和 C。

What I do is I develop the characteristic equation. And initially you will write the differential equation and then substitute e^st and get this characteristic equation. But you could also remember it as a pattern. For a series RLC circuit you always get an equation of this form, always. If this were R, L and C.

无论您在这里看到的是 L 还是 C，只要您看到的是电容器电压，电容器电压的表现都会相同。对于此电路，串联 RLC 的特征方程也保持不变。就是这样。我将标准规范形式写为 s 平方加两个 alpha s + omega nought 平方。

And whether you are looking at L up here or C up here, as long as you’re looking at the capacitor voltage, the capacitor voltage is going to behave the same. And for this circuit the characteristic equation remains the same as well for a series RLC. It is exactly this. And I write the standard canonic form as s squared plus two alpha s + omega nought squared.

而 omega nought 就是 LC 的平方根 1，alpha 就是 R 除以 L，分母也是 2。然后我得到 omega d，即 omega nought 平方减去 alpha 平方得到的阻尼频率。Q 简称为品质因数。我们将在今天的几节课中更详细地了解 Q。

And omega nought is simply one by square root of LC and alpha is simply R divided by L and I have two in the denominator as well. And then I get omega d which is my damped frequency given by omega nought squared minus alpha squared. And Q is simply called the quality factor. And we will learn about Q in a lot more detail in about a couple of lectures from today.

这是用 omega nought 除以 2 alpha 得到的。alpha、omega nought、Q 和 omega d 这些参数几乎代表了我需要了解的有关电路的所有其他信息。首先，omega d 是振荡频率。因此，由于 omega d 是振荡频率，所以我知道振荡的时间周期是 2 pi 除以 omega d。Omega 以弧度为单位。

That is given where omega nought divided by two alpha. These parameters, alpha, omega nought, Q and omega d pretty much characterize everything else that I need to know about the circuit. First of all, omega d is the frequency of oscillation. And so since omega d is a frequency of oscillation then I know that the time period of oscillation is two pi by omega d. Omega is in radians.

请注意，对于此类电路的典型值，当 R 非常小时，alpha 平方将非常小。对于欠阻尼电路，omega d 或多或少等于 omega nought 是一种常见情况。通常情况就是这样。此频率由 LC 控制。如果 R 很大，则由此处的 omega d 控制。所以我得到了振荡频率。

Notice that for typical values of circuits like this when R is pretty small, alpha squared is going to be very small. It’s a common case for underdamped circuit that omega d will more or less be equal to omega nought.commonly that is going to be the case. This frequency is governed by LC. And if R is large it is governed by this omega d here. So I have the frequency of oscillation.

我还知道 Q 与振荡频率除以 alpha 有关。它是频率除以 I 被阻尼的程度的比率。因此，这是振荡频率和现在 I 被严重阻尼之间的斗争。该比率表示 I 振铃的周期数。因此 Q 告诉我振铃大约在 Q 个周期后停止。

I also know that Q is related to the frequency of oscillation divided by alpha. It is a ratio of the frequency divided by how badly I am being damped. So it is a fight between the frequency of oscillation and now heavily I damp. And the ratio of that is an indication of how many cycles I ring. So Q tells me that the ringing stops approximately after Q cycles.

这四个值，omega d、Q、alpha 和 omega nought 现在告诉我的信息越来越多。所以我得到了这两个因子。所以我现在知道，基于 omega d 和 Q，它看起来会像这样。这里响起一些铃声，然后我停在了这一点。

These four values, omega d, Q, alpha and omega nought are telling me more and more now. So I have got these two factors. So I know now, based on omega d and Q, that it is going to look something like this. Some ringing here and then I stop at this point.

现在我要做的最后一件事是弄清楚我是从向下走还是向上走。我是从向下走还是向上走？我还不知道。上一节课我讲到这里，让你想想如何盯着电路，直观地弄清楚这是向下走还是向上走。

The last thing that is left to do here for me for now is to figure out whether I start out going down or I start out going up. I start out going down or I start out going up? I don’t know that yet. And I stopped at this point in the last lecture and let you think about how you can stare at the circuit and intuitively figure out whether this goes down or that goes up.

这就是洞察力。让我们纯粹凭直觉看一分钟。电容器两端的电压为 v，对吗？那是因为我告诉你它有一个初始电压 v。现在，我想知道在 t 等于零时，电容器电压朝哪个方向变化？增加还是减少？我该怎么做？让我看看电感器电流。

So here is the insight. Let’s stare at this for a minute purely through intuition. The capacitor has a voltage v across it, right? And that is because I am telling you that it has an initial voltage v. Now, I want to find out at prime t equals zero plus, in which direction does a capacitor voltage go? Increase or decrease? What do I do? Let me take a look at the inductor current.

我被告知电感电流为负，这意味着我被告知电感电流最初朝这个方向流动。电感电流正朝这个方向流动。现在，请记住，就像电容器是一个顽固的螺母试图保持其电压一样，电感器也一样顽固。它试图保持其电流。它试图维持其电流。并且它的初始电流 i(0) 朝这个方向流动。

I am told that the inductor current is negative which means I am told that the inductor current is going in this direction initially. The inductor current is pushing in this direction. Now, remember, just as the capacitor is one stubborn nut trying to hold its voltage, the inductor is as stubborn. It is trying to hold its current. It is trying to maintain its current. And its initial current i(0) is in this direction.

电容器在此处有一个电压，即 v(0)，电感器将电流拉向该方向。那么电容器电压最初应该会发生什么？如果我处于 v(0) 并且有人将电流拉出，至少最初是朝那个方向，电容器电压的初始动态应该是什么样子？请问？

Capacitor has a voltage here, that is v(0), and the inductor is yanking the current in that direction. So what should happen to the capacitor voltage initially? If I am at v(0) and someone is yanking current out, at least initially in that direction, what should the initial dynamics of the capacitor voltage look like? Pardon?

它应该下降，这意味着如果初始电流被拉向那个方向，电容器电压必须首先下降。完全凭直觉。这里没有数学。这意味着 i(0) 为负。就好像 i(0) 以这种方式被拉出，所以电容器电压必须下降才能开始工作。因此，动态看起来有点像这样。

It should drop, which means that if the initial current is being pulled in that direction the capacitor voltage must droop to begin with.completely through intuition. No math here. This means that i(0) is negative. It is as if i(0) is being pulled out in this manner, so the capacitor voltage must drop to begin life. Therefore, the dynamics look somewhat like this.

请注意，这非常让人联想到我们在第二个反相器的门节点处看到的振铃。关于 RLC 的时间域分析，我们就到此为止吧，今天让我们再向前迈一大步。

Notice that this is very reminiscent of the ringing that we saw at the gate node of the second inverter. Let’s stop here in terms of time domain analysis of RLC, and today let’s take another big step forward.

时域分析

Time Domain Analysis

今天标志着这里的生活又一次转变。

Today marks another transition in life here.

这实际上是一个巨大的转变，所以我想暂停一下，休息十秒钟，以便清楚地表明我们即将迎来一个巨大的转变。这一转变的关键是，今天我想看看网络对正弦驱动的稳定状态响应。从今天开始，我们将在新的旅程中做两件不同的事情。

This is actually a huge transition so I want to just pause and take like ten seconds of a breather just to clearly demarcate the fact that we have a huge transition coming up. The key to this transition is that I want to look at today the steady state response of networks to a sinusoidal drive. We are going to do two things differently starting today on this new journey of ours.

过去，我们研究电路的时域行为。例如，对于 RLC，我们研究瞬态响应。当我打开某个东西的瞬间，会发生什么？瞬态响应。今天，我们将研究稳态响应。稳态响应表示，如果我等待足够长的时间，电路在生命之初想要做的任何事情都会消失。

In the past, we looked at time domain behavior of circuits. For RLC, for example, we looked at the transient response. And what happened the instant I turn something on? The transient response. Today we are going to look at a steady state response. Steady state response says that if I wait long enough, for whatever the circuit wants to do in the beginning of life to die out.

如果我等待的时间足够长，那么经过很长一段时间后电路会如何表现？我马上会告诉你为什么这很重要。我先看看稳态行为。其次，今天我将看看正弦驱动。有两件事与我过去十分钟讲过的内容不同。在过去十分钟里，我讲了两件不同的事情。

If I wait long enough, how is the circuit going to behave after a long time? I will tell you why that is important in a second. I look at the steady state behavior. Second, I am going to look today at sinusoidal drive. Two things that are different from, say for example, what I covered in the past ten minutes. In the past ten minutes I covered two things which were different.

一是，我研究了瞬态响应，然后是稳定状态。还记得对于直流输入，对于直流电压，稳定状态是电容器两端的直流电压，对吗？所以稳定状态相当无聊，它是稳定状态直流。但我们今天要做的是，我们将通过正弦输入来驱动电路，而不是使用直流输入或阶跃输入，这些输入会在一段时间后稳定为直流值。

One is that I looked at the transient response and then steady state. And remember for a DC input, for a DC voltage the steady state was a DC voltage across the capacitor, correct? So the steady state was pretty boring, it was steady state DC. But what we are going to do today is instead of having DC inputs or step inputs which settle to a DC value after some time, we are going to drive a circuit through the sinusoidal input.

所以你可能会问我，阿加瓦尔，你疯了吗？你为什么要用正弦输入来驱动某些东西？为什么不直接用直流电等等？这已经够痛苦了。为什么是正弦的？为什么不做三角波，或者为什么不做其他指数衰减的东西，或者一些很酷的东西，比如疯狂的音乐信号？正弦波有什么特别之处？要意识到的关键是，好吧，让我先问你一个问题。

So you may ask me, Agarwal, are you nuts? Why do you want to drive something with a sinusoidal input? Why not just steps in DC and so on? That was painful enough. Why sinusoidal? Why not do triangular or why not do some other exponentially decaying stuff or something really cool like a whacko music signal? What is special about sinusoidal stuff? The key thing to realize is that, well, let me ask you a question first.

这里有多少人知道傅里叶级数？很好。看来你们中的一些人已经完成了先决条件。很好。我还需要多说为什么这很重要吗？这个问题应该能给你答案，对吧？你已经学过傅里叶级数了。当你学习傅里叶级数时，你会想我们到底为什么要学习傅里叶级数？

How many people here know about Fourier series? Good. It looks like some of you have taken the prerequisites. Good. Need I say more as to why this is important? Just that question should give you the answer, right? You’ve learned about Fourier series. And when you learned about Fourier series you were wondering why on earth are we learning about Fourier series?

谁在乎你能将周期信号表示为一系列正弦波的总和？为什么这很有趣？你为什么告诉我我可以取一个方波并将其表示为周期方波的总和并将其表示为正弦波的总和？谁在乎我是否可以取一系列具有固定周期的脉冲并将其表示为正弦波的总和？

Who cares that you can represent the periodic signals as a summation of a series of sine waves? Why is that interesting? Why are you telling me that I can take a square wave and represent that as a summation of periodic square waves and represent that as a summation of sines? Who cares that I can take a sequence of pulses with a fixed period and represent that as a sum of sines?

谁在乎我能取一个三角波并将其表示为正弦波之和？我不确定你的数学教授在教你傅里叶级数时给了你什么答案。但在数学上他们是纯粹主义者。他们不关心应用。答案很可能是因为它美观。我的意思是，你能将脉冲序列表示为正弦波之和难道不酷吗？

Who cares that I can take a triangular wave and represent that as a sum of sines? I am not sure what answer your math professors gave you when they taught you Fourier series. But in math they are purists. They don’t care about applications. The answer could well have been because it is aesthetically pleasing. I mean isn’t it cool that you can represent a sequence of pulses as a sum of sines?

这对于数学家来说已经足够好了。但我是一名工程师。如果我看不出它在短期内如何帮助人类，那么我可能不会太在意它。让我给你一些实际意义。事实证明，因为我们知道我们可以用正弦和来表示周期信号。

That is good enough for mathematicians. But I am an engineer. If it I cannot see how it helps humanity in the short term then I probably don’t care too much about it. Let me give you some practical significance of this. So it turns out that, since we know that we can represent periodic signals with sums of sines.

这意味着，如果我能弄清楚网络对正弦输入的行为，如果我能理解如何分析网络对正弦输入的反应，这意味着如果电路是线性的，我就可以计算电路对任何周期波形的响应。这就是论点。我可以将任何周期波形表示为正弦的总和。还记得傅里叶级数吗？

What this means is that if I can figure out the behavior of networks to a sinusoidal input, if I can understand how to analyze a network for a sinusoidal input that means that if the circuit is linear I can then compute the response of the circuit to any periodic waveform. Here is the argument. I can represent any periodic waveform as a sum of sines. The Fourier series, remember?

如果我只需计算出我的网络对正弦波的响应，那么如果这是一个线性网络，我就可以计算对任何正弦缩放和序列的响应。A 某个正弦，B 是两个正弦，Omega 什么的，C 是某个正弦或其他的。我可以简单地取一个正弦的响应。

If I just figure out the response of my network for a sine wave, then if this is a linear network, I can compute the response to any sequence of scaled sum of sines. A some sine, B sine two, omega whatever, C sine something or the other. I can simply take the response of the one sine.

然后我就可以继续了，知道正弦波的响应，我就可以计算出对正弦波总和的响应。这很酷。因此，对正弦驱动进行此操作非常重要。为什么现在要稳定状态？希望我已经说服了你，查看电路对正弦驱动的响应很重要而且很有趣，因为我们可以从那里走很远。那么稳定状态呢？

And from there I can go ahead, and knowing the response of a sine wave I can compute the response to a sum of sines. That is pretty cool. Therefore, doing it for sinusoidal drives is really important. Why steady state now? Hopefully, I have convinced you that looking at the response of circuits to sinusoidal drive is important and interesting because we can long ways from there. What about steady state?

好吧，事实就是如此，我将向你展示，当你听音乐时，你有一个放大器，你听音乐时，你观察到的基本上是放大器的稳定状态行为。你正在听音乐很多秒或很多小时。而我们大多数常见电路中使用的瞬态，瞬态会很快消失。所以瞬态相当复杂，它们会很快消失。

Well, it turns out that, and I am going to show you, when you listen to music, you have an amplifier and listen to music, what you are observing by and large is the steady state behavior of the amplifier. You are listening to something over many seconds or many hours. And the transients used for most of our common circuits, the transients die out pretty quickly. And so the transients are quite complicated and they die out quickly.

我们说我们是工程师。让我们专注于实际重要的事情。我们将稳定状态行为作为我们分析的很大一部分，当我们关心对正弦输入的响应时，我们完全忽略瞬态响应。瞬态响应将消失，我将在几秒钟内以数学方式向您展示这一点。让我们专注于稳定状态，因为这是我大部分时间会听到的。

We say we are engineers. Let’s focus on what is practically important. And we focus on the steady state behavior as a large part of our analysis and just completely ignore the transient response when we care about the response to sinusoidal input. The transient response will die away, and I will show that mathematically to you in a few seconds. And let’s focus on the steady state because that what I am going to hear most of the time.

我要听取长时间内的平均值。这就是我这样做的动机。让我从这个角度来解释一下。现在这应该会给你带来一些回忆。这就是我们所处的游乐场。这是这里的集总电路游乐场。

I am going to listen to an average over long periods of time. That’s the motivation behind this. And let me put this in perspective for you. By now this should bring memories to your mind. This is the playground that we are in. This is the lumped circuit playground here.

记得我们从自然界来到了 EECS 的游乐场，在那里我们从麦克斯韦方程式飞跃到集总电路，这就是集总电路抽象。在那里，我们在过去几个月的大部分时间里都在研究线性电路。我们还分析了非线性电路。还记得 MOSFET 大信号分析的放大器电路是非线性的吗？好吧，有线性和非线性。

Remember we came from the playground of nature to the playground of EECS where we made the big leap from Maxwell’s equations to lumped circuits, that’s lumped circuit abstraction. And within there we spent a large part of the last couple of months doing linear circuits. We also analyzed nonlinear circuits. Remember the amplifier circuit of the MOSFET large signal analysis was nonlinear? Well, there is linear and nonlinear.

在线性方面，我们还表明，如果你采用一个数字电路（至少是我们所理解的数字电路），并绘制给定一组开关设置的子电路，如果我以给定方式设置开关，剩下的就是针对所有开关设置的给定值的另一个线性电路。我的小信号分析也是线性的。如果我专注于小信号，我也会进行线性分析。

Within linear we also showed that if you take a digital circuit, at least as we understood them, and draw the subcircuit for a given set of switch settings, if I set the switches in a given way what I was left with was another linear circuit for a given value of all the switch settings. My small signal analysis was also linear. If I focused on small signals I also had linear analysis.

今天我们要做的就是这个。我们将阐明操场的不同部分。这是一个很大的线性操场。我们已经做到了这一点。我们已经做到了这一点。我们将探索这个领域。这是操场的那个领域，其中我们有正弦输入电路。此外，我们将研究该区域的稳定状态子电路。我们将研究正弦输入和稳定状态。

Today what we are going to do is this. We are going to articulate a different part of the playground. This was a big linear playground. We’ve done this. We’ve done this. We are going to explore this territory. This is that territory of the playground in which we have sinusoidal inputs to circuits. Furthermore, we are going to look at a subcircuit of that region which is steady state. We will look at sinusoidal input and in the steady state.

所以这将是我们接下来两三节课的重点，只是为了让您了解我们所处的位置。

So that is going to be our focus for the next two or three lectures just to give you a perspective of where we are.

放大器电路

Amplifier Circuit

为了激发这个动机，我想做的是考虑你的放大器。这是我们的朋友放大器电路，这部分在这里。记住，即使这是一个放大器，我在这里使用的是 MOSFET。正如你所知，MOSFET 具有这个栅极电容 CGS。

To motivate this, what I would like to do is consider your amplifier. This is our friend the amplifier circuit, this part here. And remember, even though this is an amplifier, I am using a MOSFET here. And a MOSFET, as you know, has this gate capacitance CGS.

我在这里明确地为您画出它。我将用偏置电压加上一些小信号 vI 来驱动它，这是放大器的常用模板。并且有一些戴维南电阻连接到该源。我将把我的源建模为偏置电压、小信号加上一些源电阻。我想在这里应用正弦波，我将看看它是什么样子。

I am explicitly drawing it out for you here. And I am going to drive this with a bias voltage plus some small signal vI, the usual template for amplifiers. And there is some Thevenin resistance attached to that source. I am going to model my source as a bias voltage, a small signal plus some source resistance. And I want to apply a sine wave here and I am going to look at what this looks like.

您可能会想，看，这是一个线性放大器。因此，如果我在这里应用正弦波，我应该会看到一些响应，如果我在任何频率上输入相同的振幅，那应该是相同的振幅。但让我们看看会发生什么。请继续看，切换到该视图图，我在这里向您展示一个小演示。

You may think, look, this is a linear amplifier. And so if I apply a sine wave here I should see some response here, and that should be the same amplitude if I feed the same amplitude here over any frequency. But let’s see what happens. Keep a look at, switch over to that view graph while I show you a little demonstration here.

您在这里看到的是三个正弦波，黄色正弦波是这里的输入，绿色正弦波是 MOSFET 栅极的输入 vC，然后您会看到蓝色正弦波是这里的输出。现在只需关注黄色和蓝色。黄色是输入，蓝色是输出。

What you see here are three sine waves, a yellow sine wave which is the input here, you see a green sine wave which is the input vC at the gate of the MOSFET, and then you see the blue which is the output here. For now simply focus on the yellow and the blue. The yellow is the input and the blue is the output.

所以我应用了一些输入，然后我得到的输出看起来或多或少是这里输入的线性函数。这是一个小信号。我要做的是改变输入的频率。记住，我要查看电路对正弦波的响应。我在这里输入正弦波。我查看响应。我要改变频率。

So I apply some input and I get an output that looks more or less some linear function of this input here. It is a small signal. What I am going to do is I am going to change the frequency of the input. Remember, I want to look at the response of the circuit to a sinusoid. I am feeding a sinusoid here. I look at the response. I am going to change the frequency.

这是我们正在进行的重大转变，因为我们在上一节课中绘制的曲线与时间变化有关。现在我将重点介绍正弦波并改变其频率。我将改变频率。当我增加频率时，请盯着蓝色曲线，想想您可能会期待什么。

That is a big shift that we are making in that the curve that we drew in the last lecture had to do with varying time. Now I am going to focus on sinusoids and vary their frequency. I am going to change the frequency. Stare at the blue curve as I increase the frequency and just think of what you might expect.

根据您目前掌握的知识，您可能会认为，当我改变频率时，频率应该会改变，但我应该看到相同的振幅。好的，但请看一下。让我增加输入的频率。您在输出端看到了什么？我正在增加频率。您看到那里发生了什么？如果您没有看到任何变化，您需要去看验光师。我们在这里看到了什么？

Based on the knowledge you have so far you would expect that look, as I change the frequency, the frequency should change but I should see the same amplitude. OK but take a look. Let me increase the frequency of the input. What do you see at the output? I am increasing the frequency. What do you see happening there? If you don’t see anything changing there you will need to see an optometrist. What do we see here?

当我改变频率时，当我增加频率时，蓝色发生了什么变化？蓝色的振幅不断减小。你会说哇，这里发生了什么？我们没有工具来处理这个问题。我预计当我改变频率时，这里的频率当然会改变，但为什么振幅会改变？这里发生了什么？这很奇怪。

As I changed the frequency, as I increased the frequency what happened to the blue? The blue kept decreasing in amplitude. And you are saying whoa, what is happening here? We don’t have the tools to deal with this. I expected that when I changed my frequency, my frequency here should change of course, but why is the amplitude changing? What is happening here? That is weird.

我注意到这个振幅变小了，因为绿色的振幅变小了。记住绿色是电容器两端的电压。所以这是你的 RC。这是我的输入。我的输入有振幅，我将其保持或多或少不变。请注意，随着我增加频率，vC 的值会减小。记住这一点。随着我增加输入频率，输出的振幅不断减小。

I noticed that this amplitude became smaller because the amplitude of the green became smaller. And remember the green was the voltage across the capacitor. So this is your RC. And here is my input. My input has the amplitude, which I am holding more or less constant. And notice that vC decreased in value as I increased my frequency. Just hold that thought. As I increased the frequency of my input the amplitude of the output kept diminishing.

换句话说，随着频率的增加，系统的增益似乎有所降低。今天我们将研究为什么会这样以及如何分析。这里不太明显的另一件事是存在相移。我要做的是尝试看看我们是否可以在此处观察到相移。注意这里。

In other words, the gain of the system seemed to have decreased as I increased by frequency. And today we will look at why that is so and how we can analyze that. The other thing that is not so obvious here is there is a phase shift. What I am going to do is try to see if we can observe the phase shift here. Notice here.

我们习惯于在放大器的输出端获得完全反转。反转意味着正弦波的相位差为 180 度，对吗？这个峰值应该在这里，但请注意峰值有一个偏移。换句话说，如果黄色是我的输入，那么当输入达到最大值时，我的输出应该达到最小值。

What we have been used to is for the amplifier we get a complete inversion at the output. Inversion means a phase difference of 180 degrees for a sine wave, right? This peak should have been here, but notice that there is a shifting of the peak. In other words, if the yellow was my input my output should have had its minimum when the input had its maximum.

但请注意，信号发生了偏移，输出达到最大值，但不是在输入最小值时，而是稍晚一点。这也很奇怪。这个小电路不仅不知何故失去了增益，而且似乎还改变了信号的相位。这很奇怪。

But notice there is a shifting of the signal such that the output is a maximum, not quite at the point where the input is a minimum but a little bit after that. Also weird. Not only has this little circuit here lost its gain somehow, but also it seems to have shifted the signal in phase. That is weird.

今天，我们将研究为什么会这样，并尝试理解这个小子组件的频率行为。请注意，vC 与 vO 的相位正好相差 180 度。因此，vO 忠实地是输入 vC 的反相放大形式。然而，vC 本身应该与 vI 相同，但看起来却大不相同。让我们来了解一下为什么会这样。

And today we will look at why that is so and try to understand the frequency behavior of this little subcomponent here. Notice that vC is exactly 180 out of phase with vO. So vO is faithfully an inverted amplified form of the input vC. However, vC itself should have been the same as vI but it looks quite different. So let’s understand why that is so.

要建模的子电路是由源、电阻和电容组成的子电路。我在这里只是向你展示这一点。我有一个 vI、一个电阻和一个电容。我将了解它们的行为方式。它是一个一阶电路，单个电容。我的输入是 vI 的 omega t 余弦。当 t 大于零时，vI 是一个实数。

The subcircuit to model is the subcircuit comprising the source, resistor and the capacitor. And I am just showing that to you here. I have a vI, a resistor and capacitor. And I am going to understand how this behaves. And it is a first order circuit, single capacitor. My input is a vI cosine of omega t. vI is a real number for t greater than zero.

我告诉你，电容电压一开始为零。我的 vI 是正弦波。这次不是阶跃。它是正弦波。所以 vI 是正弦波，我想知道 vC 是什么样子。这里的行为告诉我，我会给你答案，当我输入正弦输入时，随着频率的增加，vC 应该以某种方式减少，并且相位也会发生变化。

And I am telling you that the capacitor voltage starts out being zero. And my vI is a sinusoid. It’s not a step this time. It’s a sinusoid. So vI is a sinusoid and I want to find out what vC looks like. The behavior here tells me, I will give you the answer, that when I feed a sinusoidal input as the frequency increases, vC should be decreasing somehow and also be shifting in phase.

让我们进行推导，看看会发生什么。为了让你了解如何分析这个问题，让我画一个小图来说明这样做的努力程度。为了确定 y 轴上的 t 的 vC，这里是我们的努力。我们需要付出多大的努力才能解决这个电路的正弦输入问题？在这张图上，下面是容易的，上面是纯粹的痛苦。

Let’s do the derivation for that and see what happens. To give you some insight as to how to go about analyzing this let me draw a little graph as to the effort level of doing this. To determine vC of t on the y axis here is our effort. How hard do we have to work to solve this circuit for a sinusoidal input? And on this graph, down here is easy and up here is pure agony.

这里是纯粹的痛苦。所以这是努力程度的尺度，从容易到完全痛苦。这是时间轴。时间轴从 11 点开始，这是今天讲座的早期部分，大约在 12 点结束，这是今天的讲座，这是下一讲。我今天要向你们展示的是一种使用通常微分方程方法的方法，这将是纯粹的痛苦。

Sheer agony up here. So it’s the scale of effort level ranging from easy to complete agony. And this is the time axis. And the time axis starts out at 11 o’clock, the early part of today’s lecture, and ends at roughly 12, that is today’s lecture and this is next lecture. What I am going to show you today is a method that uses a usual differential equation approach, and this is going to be pure agony.

如果你认为上周四是痛苦的，那就看看今天吧。这将是纯粹的、纯粹的、纯粹的地狱。所以我要用垃圾来度过这段时间，我想我会半途而废，因为这对我来说太痛苦了。然后我要做的是，在本次讲座结束时，我将向你们展示一种我给它起了一个可爱名字的方法。我称之为“偷偷摸摸的方法”。

If you thought last Thursday was agony watch today. This is going to be sheer, sheer, sheer hell. So I am going to grunge through that, and I think I will sort of give up halfway because it’s just too painful even for me here. Then what I am going to do is at the end of this lecture I am going to show you an approach that I give a cutesy name. I call it the “sneaky approach”.

我们会偷偷地把一些东西放进去，这样会容易得多。然后在下一讲中，我将向你们展示一种更偷偷的方法，这绝对是一种幸福。所以让我们从这里开始吧。请允许我讲一下痛苦的部分。

We are going to sneak something in there it is going to be a lot easier. And then in the next lecture I am going to show you an even sneakier approach that is just going to be absolute bliss. So let’s start here. Indulge me as I go through the agony part.

我要快速讲解，因为这不是我们要做的事情，但你只需要知道这很痛苦。让我们采用通常的微分方程方法。步骤一、二、三和四。建立微分方程，找到特定解，找到齐次解，将两者相加并求解未知数。这是一个咒语。四步咒语。让我们开始吧。第一步，写出微分方程。这很容易。

I am going to blast through it because that is not of how we are going to do things, but you just need to know that is agony. Let’s do a usual differential equation approach. Steps one, two, three and four. Set up differential equation, find the particular solution, find the homogenous solution, add up the two and solve for the unknowns. It’s a mantra. The four step manta. Let’s do it. Step one, write the DE. That’s easy.

我们在 RC 电路之前已经做过这个了。它是 RC dvc/dt+vc=vI。这和你从带有阶跃输入的 RC 电路得到的结果没什么不同，只是我的输入是 VI 的 omega t 余弦。它不仅仅是直流电压 VI。盯着它看。趁着还算轻松的时候好好享受吧。

We have done this before the RC circuit. It’s RC dvc/dt+vc=vI. This is no different from what you got from what you got from your RC circuit with a step input, just that my input is VI cosine of omega t in this case. It is not just a DC voltage VI. Stare at that. Enjoy it while the going is easy.

这就像穿越急流，在到达五级之前，那里有平静和汹涌的水流，你会坐在那里说，哦，这里的风景看起来真的很好等等。你所做的就是在潜入五级之前停下来。几秒钟后我们就会到达五级急流，所以尽情享受吧。RC dvc/dt+vC=vI。你以前见过这个。没什么特别的。好东西。

It’s like traversing rapids, and before you come to a class five, you have calm and raging waters there, you kind of sit there saying oh, the scenery around here looks really good and so on. All you are doing is stalling before you have dive down to class five. We will get to class five rapids in a few seconds here, so just enjoy this. RC dvc/dt+vC=vI. You’ve seen this before. Nothing fancy. Good old stuff.

VI 欧米伽 t 的余弦。你想系好安全带吗？好的。让我们找到余弦输入的特定解决方案。让我们使用我们的标准方法。我要做的是，上面会有太多废话，所以我要让你注意 vP，这就是我们想要得到的，我只是要用红色在 vP 周围画一个框。

VI cosine of omega t. You want to hold onto your seatbelts? OK. Let’s find the particular solution to the cosine input. Let’s use our standard method. What I will do is just so, there is going to be so much crapola up there, so that I draw your attention to vP, which is what we are trying to get, I am just going to put a box around vP in red.

如果您看到各种垃圾出现，只需查找红色方块。这就是我们想要得到的。这就是等式。让我们试试。第一次尝试，A 以前有效。恒定值 A 以前对 DC 输入有效。让我们再试一次。如果它有效，那么现在可能有效。

If you see like all sorts of garbage appear, just look for the red square. That is what we are trying to get at. That’s the equation. Let’s try. First try, A worked before. A constant value A worked before for DC inputs. Let’s try that again. If it worked then it may work now.

如果我使用 A（一个常数值）并将其代入这里，我会得到 dA/dt 趋于零，vP 为 A，但在右边我有 VI 余弦 omega t。因此，显然 A 不起作用。抱歉。我失败了。好吧，这里是余弦 omega t，让我们尝试 A 余弦 omega T 作为我的特定解决方案。现在事情变得有点难了，有点痛苦了。所以在这里用 A 余弦 omega t 代替。

If I use A, a constant value, and I substitute it here, I get dA/dt goes to zero, vP is A, but on the right hand side I have VI cosine omega t. So clearly A doesn’t work. Sorry. I struck out. Well, cosine omega t here, let’s try A cosine omega T as my particular solution. Things are getting a little harder now, a little more painful. So substitute A cosine omega t here.

因此，我确实得到了 vP 的 A 余弦 omega T，但在这里我得到了 RCA 正弦 omega t 乘以 omega 乘以减一。因此，我得到了一个正弦和一个余弦，并且在右侧有一个余弦。抱歉，它不起作用。不，也不行。好吧，让我们试试 A 余弦 omega t 加 phi。我们现在正进入这里的急流。您可以开始感受到压力。

So I do get A cosine omega T for vP, but out here I get RCA sine omega t times omega times minus one. So I have a sine and a cosine, and I have a cosine on the right hand side. Sorry, it doesn’t work. Nope, doesn’t work either. Well, let’s try A cosine omega t plus phi. We are now embarking into the rapids here. You can begin feeling the pressure.

只是为了重温一下正弦和余弦。A 是余弦的振幅。Omega 是频率。Phi 是相位。还记得我之前给你展示的信号吗？如果正弦的振幅发生改变，相位也会发生改变。A 余弦 omega t 加 phi。让我把它代入这里，按照标准做法进行。这是我得到的结果。

Just to refresh your memories of sines and cosines. A is the amplitude of the cosine. Omega is the frequency. Phi is the phase. Remember the signal I showed you earlier? If something happens to the amplitude of the sine, something happens to the phase. A cosine omega t plus phi. Let me plug it in here and go by standard practice. Here is what I get.

我把 A 余弦 omega t 代入这个方程，得到的结果如下。我对其进行区分。我得到 omega out 减去正弦，即负 d 的正弦加上 phi，A 余弦 omega t 加上 phi 等于 VI 余弦 omega t。这可能有效。现在我们进入第五类的第六类部分。所有第五类都有一点第六类急流。

I plug in A cosine omega t to this equation, and this is what I get. I differentiate it. I get omega out minus sine, sine of negative d plus phi, A cosine omega t plus phi equals VI cosine omega t. That might work. Now we get into the class six part of the class five. All class fives have a little bit of class six rapids.

请记住，急流呈指数级上升，就像地震一样。我现在做的是展开正弦欧米茄 t 加 phi，等等等等，它不断继续。我可以继续说下去，但这甚至让我感到疲倦。这可以奏效，但我不确定我是否想让我们所有人都经历这场三角学噩梦。

Remember, the rapids go up on an exponential scale so it like earthquakes. What I do now is expand out sine omega t plus phi, blah, blah, blah, it goes on and on. I could go on and on, but this is even tiring me. This can be made to work, but I am not sure I want to put all of us through this trig nightmare here.

如果我真的非常非常讨厌，我可以把这个当作家庭作业或其他东西交给你，但我没有那么讨厌，所以你不会看到这一点。但如果我沿着这条路走下去，我会找到答案，但我必须尽快通过六级、七级急流才能到达我想要的地方。

If I am really, really nasty I could give this to you as a homework assignment or something, but I am not that nasty so you won’t see that. But if I go down this path it will get me to the answer, but I would have to soon negotiate class six, class seven rapids to get to where I want.

偷偷摸摸的方法

Sneaky Approach

所以让我放弃这个念头，让我从头开始。

So let me punt on it, let me start from scratch.

我现在已经到了第二步，让我从头开始。相反，我想做的是让我们在这里偷偷摸摸。与其穿越五级急流，我们可以说，啊哈，我们可以乘独木舟跳上岸，跑下去，然后回到河上。我们这样做吧。这就是所谓的偷偷摸摸的方法。

I am at step two, let me start from scratch. Instead what I would like to do is let’s get sneaky here. Rather than negotiating the class five rapids, what we can say is ah ha, we can take our canoes and jump onto shore and run down and then get back onto the river. Let’s do that. That is called the sneaky approach.

这样，我们身后的朋友都会以为我们正在穿越急流，但我们要做的是偷偷摸摸地走岸边的路。让我们偷偷摸摸地走下岸边，看看那里有什么。我想在这里做一些完全奇怪的事情。我想通过岸边法来求解这个方程。S 代表岸边或 S 代表偷偷摸摸，随你便。

So that all our friends who are behind us think we are negotiating the rapids, but what we are going to do is get sneaky and take the shore path. Let’s get sneaky, just walk down the shore and see what is there. I want to do something completely weird here. I want to look at solving this equation through the shore method. S stands for shore or S stands for sneaky, whatever you want.

我要做的不是试图求解 VI 余弦欧米茄 t，而是说让我们一起尝试不同的输入。你马上就会明白为什么。这就像我是独木舟的船长，我告诉我的队友，嘿，我们不要冒险穿越急流，去探索海岸吧。

What I am going to do is rather than trying to solve for VI cosine omega t. I am going to say let’s try a different input all together. And you will understand why in a second. It’s like I am the captain of my canoe and I tell my teammates, hey, let’s not negotiate the rapids, let’s go and explore the shore.

也许沿着岸边我们可以找到一条更容易到达对岸的路。所以现在我和我的同事们抬着独木舟上岸，走一条偷偷摸摸的小路。这不是我要解决的问题。我不知道这会把我引向何方。但让我们看看这条岸边的小路会把我们引向何方。我想试着解这个方程 Vie^st。

Maybe down the shore we can find a path that gets us across to the other side more easily. So here is me and my colleagues carrying our canoe and getting onto shore and taking a sneaky path. This is not what I set out to solve. I don’t know where this will lead me. But let’s see where the shore path leads us. I want to try solving this equation Vie^st.

S 代表海岸或潜行或任何你想要的。我不知道我要去哪里，但让我们看看这会把我们引向何方。让我们探索一下。假装你是哥伦布或什么的。我不知道。让我们使用常用技术，看看结果如何。让我们尝试一个特定的解决方案，Vpe^st。我的输入是 Vie^st。我正在尝试为不同的输入解决电路问题。

S stands for shore or sneaky or whatever you want. I don’t know where I am going, but let’s see where this leads us. Let’s explore. Make believe you are Columbus or something. I don’t know. Let’s use the usual techniques and see how this works out. Let’s try a particular solution, Vpe^st. My input is Vie^st. I am trying to solve the circuit for a different input.

让我尝试解决 Vpe^st，看看效果如何。我在这里将 Vpe^st 代入方程式，因此 RCVpe^st 等等。我在这里得到的是 Vie^st，Vpe^st 保持不变，但这里 vP 出来了，s 出来了，e^st 保持不变。这是指数的良好属性。这就是我得到的。指数的一个非常酷的属性是，当我对其进行微分时，我会得到指数。

And let me try solution Vpe^st and see if that works out nicely. I substitute Vpe^st into my equation here, so RCVpe^st blah. What I get here is Vie^st, Vpe^st stays the same, but here vP comes out, s comes out and e^st stays the same. That is nice property of exponentials. This is what I get. A really cool property of exponentials is that when I differentiate it I get the exponential back.

与余弦不同，我得到的是正弦，而对于正弦，我得到的是余弦。指数非常简单明了，直截了当。所见即所得。你对其进行区分。你得到相同的东西，得到缩放 vP、S 等等，以及这里的一些缩放。你在这里得到 S 缩放，但基本形式保持不变。这非常好。

Unlike a cosine I got a sine, and for a sine I got a cosine. Exponentials are very plain and simple, are straightforward. What you see is what you get. You differentiate it. You get the same thing, you get scaling vP, S and so on, and some scaling here. You get S scaling here, but the basic form stays the same. This is quite nice.

我在这三个地方都有 e^st，所以我可以将它们取消，然后得到这个表达式。我得到了这个。哇。所以如果我沿着海岸走，我很快就会到达某个地方。我还不知道我在哪里，但无论我做什么，都很容易。我只是在探索这条路，沿着海岸走。我正在取得进展。我还不知道我到了哪里。

I have e^st in all three places, so I can cancel those out and I get this expression. And I get this. Wow. So if I go down the shore I get some place fast. I don’t know where I am yet, but whatever I did, it was easy. I am just exploring this path, down the shore path. I am making progress. I don’t know where I have gotten yet.

我们马上就会看到我们得到了什么，但我很快就得到了一些结果。我能够求解这个输入 Vie^st 并很快得到这个解决方案。那么这里发生了什么？我假设解决方案的形式为 Vpe^st，将其代回，并发现如果 vP 等于 Vi/(1+sRC)，则 Vpe^st 是一个解决方案。

We will see where we got to in a second, but I got some place quickly, fast. I was able to solve for this input Vie^st and get this solution very quickly. So what happened here? I assumed the solution of the form Vpe^st, substituted it back, and found that if vP were equal to Vi/(1+sRC) then Vpe^st is a solution.

我在这里所做的是，Vi/(1+sRC) 是该方程对于输入 Vie^st 的一个特定解。我把它放在一个方框里，因为这很重要。这很容易。我们顺着海岸走下去，说让我们试试这个其他输入。我们在岸上进展很快，我到达了某个地方。我还不知道我在哪里。我明白了。让我在这里停下来，让我给你最终的答案。

What I have done here is that Vi/(1+sRC) is a particular solution to this equation for the input Vie^st. I put a box around it because this is important. This was easy. We went down the shore, and said let’s try this other input. We made rapid progress on shore and I got some place. I don’t know where I am yet. I got this. Let me pause here and let me give you the final answer.

在接下来的五分钟里，我将向你们展示这就是我们的答案。你们已经看到了答案。我是一支队伍，我沿着一条海岸小路走，我们到达了某个地方。我们看到了那条河，所以事实证明我们正好在我们想去的地方，就在急流之后。

I am going to show you over the next five minutes that this is our answer. You are staring at the answer already. I am a party, I have taken a shore path and we have gotten some place. We see the river there, so it turns out we are exactly where we want to be, just after the rapids.

现在我要做的就是带我的同事们和我一起坐独木舟下河，这样我们就完成了。你们还不知道。我和我的同事坐在岸边看着这条河。我们已经到达了某个地方。那里没有急流。我们已经到达了某个地方。我们不太清楚这是否刚好在急流之后。我们还不知道，但我很快就到了那里。

All I have to do now is get my colleagues into the river with myself in the canoe and we are done. You don’t know that yet. My colleagues and I are sitting on the shore looking at the river. We’ve gotten some place. There are no rapids there. We have gotten some place. We don’t quite know is this just after the rapids or not. We don’t know yet, but I got there very quickly.

我现在就告诉你，这就是我们想要去的地方。接下来的五张视图我将一一展示。我会用更多的痛苦和煎熬来告诉你为什么会这样。我认为我是哥伦布，并向我的同事证明这就是我们想要去的地方。

And I will tell you right now, that is the place we wanted to go to. The next five view graphs I am going to blast through. There is going to be more pain and agony to show you why that is the case. It’s me thinking I am Columbus and proving to my colleagues that this is where we want to be.

然后拿出我的六分仪、指南针等制图师和人们用来向同事证明这就是我想要去的地方。这就是答案。接下来的五个视图将证明这确实是答案，或者足够接近答案，我们会感到满意。这难道不壮观吗？

And pulling out my sextant, and the compasses and so on that cartographers and people use to prove to my colleagues that this is where I want to be. This is the answer. The next five view graphs will be demonstrating that this is indeed the answer, or close enough to the answer that we will be satisfied. Isn’t this spectacular?

大约五分钟后，我将向你们展示，这为我们提供了计算该微分方程的正弦稳态响应所需的所有信息。让我把这些写下来，让你们知道。让你们记住。我要在岸边放一个标记，标明这就是我们现在的位置。现在让我向你们证明。

I am going to show you in about five minutes that this gives us all the information we need to know to compute the sinusoidal steady state response to this differential equation. Let me write that down here just so you know. Just so you remember. I am going to put a marker on the shore that says this is where we are right now. Now let me prove to you.

正如我刚才所说，vPS 是 Vi，它乘以 e^st 就是 Vie^st 的解。这个是 Vie^st 的解，而 vP 只是乘以 e^st 的系数。同样，如果我代入 S 等于 j omega。我告诉过你五个地狱般的视图图，但我只是想向你证明这就是它。我代入 S 等于 j omega。

As I just said, vPS is Vi, it’s this stuff here multiplied by e^st is the solution to Vie^st. This guy here is a solution for Vie^st and vP is simply the coefficient that multiplies e^st. Similarly, if I substitute S equals j omega. I told you five view graphs of more hell, but I am just going to prove to you that this is it. I am substituting S equals j omega.

这是哥伦布在最后发表的重要演讲，说服他的同事们我们已经到达了我们想要去的地方。我用 j omega 代替 S，这就是我得到的结果。这是 e 到​​ st 的解，所以这是 e 到​​ j omega t 的解。让我把这个记下来，作为需要记住的东西。Vi/(1+j omega RC)。

This is Columbus giving a big speech at the end convincing his colleagues that we are where we want to be. I substitute j omega for S and this is what I get. This is a solution for e to the st, and so this is a solution for e to the j omega t. And let me mark this for you as something to remember. Vi/(1+j omega RC).

就这一点而言，我用 j omega 代替 S。这是一个复数。它是一个复振幅。由于这里的 j，它是一个复数，它将 e 乘以 j omega t。只要记住这一点。所以这很容易。步骤很简单。我仍然在向你证明这就是我们想要的。现在让我把连接拉回到 vP。

In terms of that, I am substituting j omega for S. And this is a complex number. It is a complex amplitude. It is a complex number because of j here, and it multiplies e to the j omega t. Just keep this in mind. So that was easy. The steps were easy. I am still proving to you that this is where we want to be. Now let me draw the connection back to vP.

第一个事实是，找到 Vie^(j omega t) 的响应很容易。我们知道这一点。第二个事实是以下观察结果：Vi cosine omega t 只是这个数字的实部。因此，Vi cosine omega t 只是欧拉关系中 Vie^(j omega t) 的实部。因此，cosine omega t 只是这个家伙的实部。灯泡开始熄灭了吗？

And the first fact was that finding the response to Vie^(j omega t) was easy. We know that. Second was the following observation that Vi cosine omega t is simply the real part of this number here. So Vi cosine omega t is simply the real part of Vie^(j omega t) from the Euler relation. So cosine omega t is simply the real part of this guy. Light bulbs beginning to go off?

第一个要点是，找到 Vie^(j omega t) 的响应很容易。响应是这样的，对吧？将 e 乘以 j omega t。这很容易。好的。第二个要点是，这个的实部是 Vi 余弦 omega t，这是我们的输入。绘制两个步骤之间的联系。找到 Vie^(j omega t) 的响应很容易。其中的实部是我们关心的输入。

The first fast was that finding the response to Vie^(j omega t) was easy. And the response was this, right? Times e to the j omega t. That was easy. All right. And the second part is that the real part of this is Vi cosine omega t was our input. Draw the connection between two steps. Finding the response to Vie^(j omega t) was easy. The real part of that was the input we cared about.

灯泡熄灭了吗？让我在这里画一个小图来告诉你发生了什么。对 vI 的响应是 vP。这是我们正在寻找的特定响应。还记得红色方块吗？但是我们输入了一个隐蔽的输入 vIS，并形成了对它的响应 vPS。这一步很容易。这一步很难。vI 到 vP 很难，三角学噩梦，还记得吗？但 vIS 到 vPS 很容易。

Are light bulbs going off? Let me draw you a little picture here to show you what is happening. Response to vI is vP. It’s the particular response we are looking for. Remember the red square? But we threw in a sneaky input vIS and we formed the response vPS to that. This step was easy. This step was hard. vI to vP was hard, trig nightmare, remember? But vIS to vPS was easy.

这是一个简单的 Vpe^st 问题。我们还知道 vIS 的实部是 vI。这个实部就是 vI。如果你有一个实数电路，如果你有一个实数线性电路，对于线性电路，如果这个实部的结果是 vI，那么解的实部应该会得到 vP。因此计算 vPS 很容易。

It was a simple Vpe^st thing. We also know that the real part of vIS is vI. The real part of this is simply vI. If you have a real circuit, if you have a real linear circuit, for a linear circuit, if the real part of this gives me vI then the real part of the solution should give me vP. So computing vPS was easy.

如果我取这个的实部，我就会取这个的相应实部。这有点像逆叠加论证。我说的叠加，取 A 的响应，取 B 的响应，将它们相加，就会得到 A 加 B 的响应。

If I take the real part of this, I take the corresponding real part of this. This is sort of an inverse superposition argument. Superposition, I said, take the response for A, take the response for B, add them up and you get the response for A plus B.

这里我们说的是，得到 A 加 B 或 A 加 jB 的响应，输入的实部将产生输出实部给出的响应。所以这是一个逆叠加论证。

Here what we are saying is that get the response to A plus B, or to A plus jB and the real part of the input will produce the response given by the real part of the output. So this is an inverse superposition argument.

如果它是一个线性电路，那么如果 vI 是这个隐秘输入的实部，那么我找到对隐秘输入的响应并取其实部，我应该得到 vP。哥伦布，我在这里，凝视着这条河的入口。我刚刚向我的同事们证明，我们所要做的就是取我们所拥有的实部。

If it is a linear circuit, then if vI is the real part of this sneaky input then I find the response to the sneaky input and take its real part I should get vP. Here I am, Columbus, staring down at the entrance to this part of the river. I just proved to my colleagues that all we have to do is take the real part of what we have.

我们可以直接跳回河里，回到 vP。我接下来要做的就是仔细计算，然后向你们展示。我会快速完成。这并不重要，但你们的笔记里有。我告诉你们，vP 只是潜行输出的实部。我将 vP e 的实部取到 j omega t。

We can just jump right back into the river and get back to vP. And what I am going to do next is just grind through the math and just show you that. I will just blast through it. It is not important, but you have it in your notes. I am telling you that vP is simply the real part of the sneaky output. And I take the real part of vP e to the j omega t.

我取实部。这里只是一堆数学运算。我只是取实部并进行一堆复杂的数学运算。记住 vP 是由这里的这个量给出的。我取实部，最终得到的 vP 就是这个量乘以余弦 omega t 加 phi，其中 phi 由 omega RC 的 tan 倒数给出，这是乘以余弦的系数。

And I take the real part. And just a bunch of math here. I am just taking the real part and doing a bunch of complex math. Remember vP was given by this quantity here. And I take the real part and I end up with vP is simply this quantity multiplied by cosine omega t plus phi, where phi is given by is given by tan inverse of omega RC, and this is the coefficient multiplying the cosine.

因此，通过采用隐秘路径，然后取输出答案的实部，我能够非常快速地到达我想要的位置。所以从这里到这里只是数学。回想一下，那个 vP，红色的东西就是我们要找出的，它是对 VI 余弦 omega t 的特定响应。请记住，two grunge 就是这些东西。

So by taking the sneaky path and then taking the real part of that output answer, I was able to very quickly get to where I wanted to be. So from here to here it is only math. Recall, that vP, the thing in the red was what we set out to find out, which was the particular response to VI cosine of omega t. And remember that two grunge is all of this stuff.

我将快速浏览两三个视图图表，它们只会为您提供更多见解和数学知识，没有什么特别的。请记住，要解方程，我们还必须找到一个齐次解。但请记住，RC 电路的齐次解的形式为 Ae^ t/RC。这意味着随着时间的推移，这部分会变为零。

I am going to blast through two or three more view graphs that just give you more insight and more math, nothing particular. And remember to solve the equation we have to find a homogenous solution, too. But recall that the homogenous solution for an RC circuit is of the form Ae^ t/RC. This means that as time becomes very large this part goes to zero.

随着稳定状态下的时间变长，还记得我关心的是稳定状态吗？这会趋于零。我不关心均匀解。这不是很棒吗？我们将要处理的大多数电路（纯振荡电路除外）的均匀部分都会消失。您会看到 e 到 t 之类的东西。它只是消失了。它消失了。所以总解是 vH 消失。我最终得到的只是 vP。

As time becomes large in the steady state, remember I care about the steady state? This goes to zero. I don’t care about the homogenous solution. Isn’t that fantastic? Most the circuits we will deal with, except for purely oscillatory ones, the homogenous part dies away. You have something like e to the t whatever. It just dies away. It’s gone. So the total solution has vH going away. And what I end up with is just vP.

在稳定状态下，我的总解就是 vP。A 就是我们刚刚计算出来的。我还有很多见解要讲，你可以在笔记中查看。我只想向你展示一个非常简短的总结。总之，我们计算了 vP。这是一个复杂的系数。所有这些步骤，2 grunge、3 和 4 都是浪费时间。

My total solution in the steady state is simply vP. And A is given by this that we just calculated. I just have a bunch more insight that I talk about that you can look through in your notes. And I just want to show you a very quick summary. In summary, what we have is we computed vP. It was a complex coefficient. And all these steps, 2 grunge, 3 and 4 were a waste of time.

我向您展示的是，对于输入 VI，系数 vP 是复数。我也可以采用该比率并以此方式表示。然后，根据 vP，我可以计算余弦的乘数，如下所示。我在这里除以 vP。

And what I showed you was that for the input VI the coefficient vP was complex. And I can take the ratio and represent it in this manner as well. And from vP, I can then compute the multiplier for the cosine as follows. I divide by vP here.

记住，在我执行的数学步骤中，余弦乘以 VI 除以 1 加上这个值，所以我可以按照以下方式获得该电路传递函数的幅度和相位。为了快速总结，下次我将再次介绍这一点，并向你们展示一个幅度图。请注意，如果我绘制 Vp/Vi。记住这里是 Vp。这就是答案。

Remember the cosine was multiplied by, in the mathematical step that I did, VI divided one plus, this stuff here, so I could get the magnitude and phase of the transfer function of this circuit in the following manner. And to wrap up very quickly, I am going to cover this again the next time and show you a magnitude plot. Notice here that if I plot Vp/Vi. Remember this was Vp here. That’s the answer.

幅度看起来是这样的。在对数刻度上，对于小频率，Vp/Vi 的 omega 为 1，但随着 omega 的增加，Vp/Vi 不断减小。这就是输出。还记得 Vp 是输出的幅度吗？它一直在减小。这就是原因。随着频率的增加，我的输出余弦的幅度不断减小。我也可以为您绘制相位图。

The magnitude looks like this. On a log scale Vp/Vi for small frequencies omega is at one, but as omega increases Vp/Vi keeps decreasing. That is the output. Remember Vp was the amplitude of the output? That keeps decreasing. And this is the reason why. As I increase the frequency, the amplitude of my output cosine kept decreasing. I could also plot the phase for you.

相位，与 omega 增加的方式相同，我的相位也从最初的零一直移动到最后的 pi/2。让我在这里停下来，下次再从这里开始，再回顾一下。不幸的是，我没有时间做演示。下次我会给你展示。

And the phase, in the same manner as omega increased, my phase also kept shifting from zero initially to pi/2 finally. Let me stop here and start with this the next time and revisit this. Unfortunately, I won’t have time for the demo. I will show it to you next time.

Lec 17 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 17 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 49:32 https://youtube.com/watch?v=Km9YIdkc2Oo

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 49:32 https://youtube.com/watch?v=Km9YIdkc2Oo

介绍

Introduction

早上好。好的。今天我们将重新审视一下我们在前两堂课中讲过的一些内容。在学习这堂课时，我希望你们记住这张图，以便了解接下来的内容。这是时间。上周二的课我们讲了一些内容。

Good morning. All right. Today we are going to take a fresh look at some of the stuff we covered in the last two lectures. And the graph I want you to keep in mind as we go through this lecture in terms of what to expect. This was time. And last Tuesday’s lecture we covered some stuff.

我谈到了一种治疗正弦波反应的方法，这种方法非常痛苦，我警告过你们，这种方法会非常痛苦，但在最后，我向你们展示了另一种方法，这种方法要容易得多，但仍然相当困难。我向你们保证，今天将有一种新的方法，它将非常简单，实际上几乎是陈词滥调。想象一下。

I talked about a method for the sinusoidal response which was agony, I warned you it will be agony, and then towards the end I showed you another method that was quite a bit easier but still pretty hard. And I promised you that today there will be a new method which is going to be so easy,actually almost trite. Just imagine.

我现在要说的是，我认为你们都会觉得难以置信。我要说的是，想象一下你的 RLC 电路，电阻器、电感器和电容器，并联形式或串联形式。想象一下，你可以在 30 秒或更短的时间内通过观察写下它的特征方程。想象一下。

I am going to make a statement right now that I think you will all find hard to believe. What I am going to say is just imagine your RLC circuit, your resistor, inductor and capacitor, a parallel form or series form. Imagine that you could write down the characteristic equation for that by observation in 30 seconds or less. Just imagine that.

通过观察，砰，写下几乎任何 RLC 电路或 RC 电路或任何其他电路的特征方程。我们都知道，一旦有了特征方程，您就可以非常轻松地直观地从那里转到时域响应或正弦稳态响应。所以只要记住这个想法。想象一下 30 秒。这就是你在今天的讲座中应该期待的。

By observation, boom, write down the characteristic equation for virtually any RLC circuit or RC circuit or whatever. And we all know that once you have the characteristic equation you could very easily go from there to the time domain response intuitively or to the sinusoidal steady state response, too. So just keep that thought in mind. Imagine 30 seconds. And that is what you should expect in today’s lecture.

学生们经常问我，如果这些事情真的那么简单，你为什么要带我们走这条曲折的道路？我们是不是太卑鄙了？我们是不是只想让你告诉你事情有多难，然后再告诉你简单的方法？我每年都在和自己争论，是否要直接给出简单的方法，就这样。

Students often ask me, if this stuff is actually so easy why do you take us through this tortuous path? Are we just mean? Do we just want you show you how hard things are and then show the easy way? I have argued with myself every year as to whether to just go ahead and give the easy path and that’s it.

但我认为我们之所以要介绍基本原理，是因为它能让你获得一定的洞察力，如果我直接跳到简单方法，你就不会获得这种洞察力。所以你需要了解基础知识，而且至少要看过一次。其次，一旦你以困难的方式做某事，你就会更加珍惜简单的方法。好吧。

But I think the reason we cover the basic foundations is that it gives you a level of insight that you would not have otherwise gotten if I directly jumped into the easy method. So you need to understand the foundations and you need to have seen that at least once. And second, once you do something the hard way, you appreciate all the more the easy method. All right.

审查

Review

今天我们讨论所谓的“阻抗模型”。

Today we cover what is called “The Impedance Model”.

首先，让我来回顾一下，因为前两节课的内容量很大。我使用视图图来复习。我通常不喜欢这样做，但即便如此，还是很匆忙。所以，让我快速总结一下要点。周二，我们一直在研究正弦稳态响应。也被亲切地称为 SSS。

First let me do a review just because of the large amount of content in the last two lectures. I did them using view graphs. I usually don’t like to do that, but even then it was quite rushed. So let me quickly summarize for you kind of the main points. We have been looking at, on Tuesday, the sinusoidal looking at the sinusoidal steady state response. Also fondly denoted as SSS.

这方面的阅读材料是第 14.1 章和第 14.2 章。我们说的是，如果你拿这个示例电路为例，我们将 omega t 的余弦作为输入，我们有一个 R 和一个 C，假设我们关心输出响应，我们关心电容器电压。我们讨论的重点是正弦稳态响应。这意味着首先要关注稳态。

And the readings for this were Chapters 14.1 and 14.2. what we said was if you took this example circuit and we fed as input cosine of omega t, we have an R and a C, and let’s say we cared about the output response and we cared about the capacitor voltage. What we talked about was focused on the sinusoidal steady state response. And what that meant was first of all focus on steady state.

换句话说，只是为了捕捉 t 在很长一段时间后趋于无穷时的稳定状态行为。对于我们考虑的大多数电路，由于 R 或任何电阻的存在，同质响应通常会消失，因为同质响应通常为 t 减 t 的形式。当 t 趋于无穷时，这个项趋于零。我们只是在看稳定状态。

In other words, just to capture the steady state behavior when t goes to infinity after a long period of time. And for most of the circuits that we consider, because of the R or presence of any resistance, the homogenous response usually would die out because the homogenous response is usually of the form minus t by tau. And as t goes to infinity this term tends to go to zero. We are just looking at the steady state.

因此，由于我们研究的电路，我们可以忽略同质响应。我们剩下要做的就是找到这种形式的正弦波的特定响应。其次是关注正弦波。我们说这样做的原因是，假设我们并不特别关心我刚打开放大器时发生了什么。

And therefore, because of the circuits we looked at, we can ignore the homogenous response. All we are left to do is to find the particular response to sinusoids of this form. And second was focus on sinusoids. We said the reason for this was that, let’s say we did not care particularly What happened when I just turned on my amplifier.

我刚打开放大器，经常会看到一些失真的声音出现几秒钟，然后听到更清晰的声音。最初的部分是由于瞬态响应。假设我们不关心这一点。我们关心稳定状态。其次，我们关注正弦波，因为根据您之前的傅立叶级数经验，我们可以将重复信号表示为正弦波的总和。

I just turned on my amplifier, often times you see some distorted sound coming out for a few seconds and then hear a much clearer sound. And that initial part is due to the transient response. And let’s say we don’t care about that. We care about the steady state. Second we focus on sinusoids because based on the Fourier series experience that you had previously, we can represent repeated signals as a sum of sines.

因此，当输入为正弦波时，了解这些电路的行为非常重要。重要的是，这引入了一种观察电路的新方法，即频率视角。当我们观察瞬态响应时，我们将响应绘制为时间函数。当我们观察正弦稳态时，将响应绘制为频率函数（欧米茄函数）就变得很有趣了。

And therefore it is important to understand the behavior of these circuits when the input is a sinusoid. And what was important was this introduced a new way of looking at circuits, and that was the frequency viewpoint. When we looked at transient responses, we plotted response as a function of time. And when we look at sinusoidal steady state, it becomes interesting to plot the response as a function of the frequency, a function of omega.

我将绘制一个小图表，以便您直观地了解我们经历的各种过程。我们可以将获得正弦稳态响应比作遵循以下步骤。这是我的输入。我第一步做的是将我的输入输入到通常的电路模型中。我的元件是集总元件，构建电路并写下元件的 VI 关系。

What I will do is draw a little chart for you to sort of visualize the various processes we have been going through. We can liken obtaining the sinusoidal steady state response to following these steps. Here is my input. What I did as a first step was fed my input to a usual circuit model. My elements were lumped elements, built the circuit and wrote down the VI relationship for the element.

第二步，我建立了微分方程。这是四个步骤中的第一步，建立一个微分方程。然后我首先走的路充满了真正噩梦般的三角学。到最后它仍然会给出答案。这可能是一场噩梦。但我会得到一些余弦欧米茄 t 加一些东西，一些相位。我可以通过三角学来解决。

As a second step I set up the differential equation. This was the first of four steps, set up a differential equation. And then the path that I took first was fraught with real nightmarish trig. By the end of the day it would still yield an answer. It could be a nightmare. But I would get something cosine omega t plus something, some phase. I could grunge through the trig.

我在课堂上半途放弃了，但如果你愿意，你可以把它搞砸。你会得到答案是某个具有振幅和相位的正弦波。所以 Vi 余弦 omega t 会产生一个响应，即某个余弦 omega t 加上某个相位。我们说这太痛苦了，所以让我们放弃它。相反，我们说我们会绕道而行，走一条更容易的路。

And I gave up halfway in class here, but you could grunge through it if you would like. And you would get the answer to be some sinusoid with some amplitude and some phase. So Vi cosine omega t would produce the response that was something cosine omega t plus some phase. We said this was too painful so let’s punt this. Instead, what we said we would do is take a detour, take an easier path.

更简单的方法看起来是这样的。我说让我们偷偷地加入 Vie^(j omega t) 驱动器。这只是想象，进行数学运算，就好像您输入的不是 Vi cosine omega t，而是 Vie^(j omega t)。从欧拉关系中，您知道实部是 Vi cosine omega t。

And the easier path looked like this. I said let’s sneak in Vie^(j omega t) drive. That is just imagine, do the math as if you had fed in not a Vi cosine omega t but a Vie^(j omega t). And from Euler’s relation you know that the real part is Vi cosine omega t.

所以我们说我要偷偷摸摸地把这个东西放进去，找到响应，然后只取它的实部，因为输入的实部给了我这个。所以这是我的“偷偷摸摸的路径”。我在那里做的是，一旦我们输入 e^(j omega t)，由于指数的性质，e^(j omega t) 就会在我的方程中抵消。剩下的是一些相当简单的复杂代数。

So we said that I am going to sneak in this thing, find the response and just take the real part of that because the real part of the input gives me this. So this is my “sneaky path”. And what I did there, as soon as we fed in the e^(j omega t), because of the property of exponentials, the e^(j omega t) cancelled out in my equation. And what was left was some fairly simple complex algebra.

最后，在我对一些相当简单的复杂代数进行分析后，我得到了一些像这样的响应。Vpe^(j omega t)。我发现对于输入 Vie^(j omega t)，我会得到一个响应 Vpe^(j omega t)。然后我说我们要做的就是取实部。为什么要取实部？因为这是一个假的、狡猾的输入。

And at the end of the day, after I grunged through some fairly simple complex algebra, I ended up with some response that looked like this. Vpe^(j omega t). What I would find is that for the input Vie^(j omega t), I would get a response Vpe^(j omega t). And then what I said we would do is take the real part. Why take the real part? Because this is a fake, a sneaky input.

我真正关心的输入是隐秘输入的实部。所以这是我的隐秘输出。我关心的是隐秘输出的实部。这有点像我在周二提出的逆叠加论证，如果我关心的是这个输入的实部，那么我只需取实部即可得到我关心的输出。

The input I really care about is the real part of the sneaky input. So this is my sneaky output. And what I care about is the real part of the sneaky output. That is sort of the inverse superposition argument that I made on Tuesday that if what I care about is the real part of this input, then I just take the real part and get the output that I care about.

所以我取实部。注意这里的 Vp，在我们做的例子中，我们做了一个 RC 示例。这里的 Vp 是一个复数。所以我可以用很多方法将该复数表示为。这是 e^(j omega t)。我可以用振幅表示 Vp，作为相量，实际上是极坐标。我可以说它相当于 Vpe 到 j 角 Vp。Vp 是一个复数。

So I take the real part. Notice that Vp here, in the examples we did, we did an RC example. The Vp here was a complex number. So I could represent that complex number as, in many ways. This is e^(j omega t). I could represent Vp in an amplitude, as a phasor, actually polar coordinates. I can say that the equivalent to Vpe to the j angle Vp. Vp is a complex number.

如果你看一下课程笔记中的复数附录，我可以将复数表示为振幅乘以 e，然后乘以 j 乘以某个相位。这是简单的复数代数。然后我能做的就是取它的实部。当我取它的实部时，结果就是 Vp。

If you look at the complex appendix in your course notes, I can represent a complex number as an amplitude multiplied by e raised to j times some phase. It’s simple complex algebra. And then what I could do here is take the real part of that. And when I took the real part of that what came about was that this was simply Vp.

请注意，角度 Vp 在此处，因此它变为 j 乘以 omega t 加上角度 Vp。它是 Vp 振幅乘以 e 升至 j omega t 加上 j 角度 Vp。它的实部就是 Vp 余弦。我最终得到的是 Vp 余弦 omega t 加上 Vp。

Notice that the angle Vp goes in here so it becomes j times omega t plus angle Vp. It is Vp amplitude times e raised to j omega t plus j angle Vp. And the real part of that is simply Vp cosine of that stuff. What I end up getting here is Vp cosine omega t plus Vp.

值得注意的是，一旦我在这里找到这个答案，我就可以立即根据 Vp 写下输出。换句话说，一旦我有了 Vp，我就可以立即停止我的数学运算。我在这里很快就得到了 Vp。经过两个代数步骤后，这一步很快就产生了 Vp。然后从这里我可以直接将答案写下来，即 Vp 余弦 omega t 加角 Vp 的齐次式。砰，就在那里。

The cool thing to notice was that once I found out this response here, I could immediately write down the output based on Vp. In other words, once I had Vp, I could stop right there in my math. I got Vp very quickly here. This step produced Vp very quickly, after two algebraic steps. And then from here I could directly write down the answer as homogenous of Vp cosine omega t plus angle Vp. Boom, right there.

所以这是一条更短的路径。我在这里向你描述了如何得出 Vp 和角度 Vp 的表达式。对于我们的例子，Vp 是 1/(1+j omega RC)。我们经常写一个简写符号 1+sRC，其中 S 就是 j omega。我们通常在简写符号 S 和 j omega 之间来回切换。

So this was a much shorter path. And here I just described to you how this yields an expression for Vp and angle Vp. And for our example Vp was 1/(1+j omega RC). And we often times write a shorthand notation 1+sRC, where S is simply j omega. We commonly jump back and forth between the shorthand notation S and j omega.

S 还有其他一些基本原理，还有另一个基本意义，你们将在以后的课程中学习，但现在 S 只是 j omega 的缩写形式。这是我们走的路。有一条艰难的路和一条更容易的路。今天我要说，即使这样也太难了。还有一条更简单的路。

S has some other fundamental, has another fundamental significance you will learn about in future courses, but for now S is simply a short form for j omega. This was the path that we took. There is a hard path and an easier path. Today I am going to claim that even this was too hard. There is an even easier path.

今天我要告诉你们的是，从这里开始，我们只需迈出一步就能到达这里。今天我要告诉你们，我们不会这样做，我们不会这样做，不会这样做，不会这样做，什么都不会做。迈出一步，我们就能得到答案。所以，让我们这样做吧。

And today what I am going to show you is that from here we are going to take one step and get here. I am going to show you today that we won’t do this, we won’t do this, not this, not this, none of this. One step and then we are going to get the answer. So let’s do that.

在我们进入阻抗法并开始进行该操作之前，我只想为您绘制此函数，以便我们能够更好地了解到底发生了什么。

Before we jump into the impedance method and get into doing that, I just would like to plot for you this function here just so we can understand a little bit better exactly what is going on.

传递函数

Transfer Function

正如我之前提到的，我们电路的输出 vO 就是 Vp 欧米伽 T 的余弦加上角度 Vp。哦，那是 Vp，所以这里应该是 Vi。

As I mentioned to you, the output vO for our circuit there was simply Vp cosine of omega T plus angle Vp. Oh, that’s Vp so this one should be Vi here.

我向您展示的是 Vp，所以里面有一个 Vi。Vp/Vi=1/(1+j omega RC)。这是一个复数，它只是一个数字，与 Vi 相乘后得到输出。这也称为传递函数，表示为 H(j omega)。这是一个传递函数，很像我的放大器的增益。与输入相乘后得到输出。

I am showing you Vp so there is a Vi in there. Vp/Vi=1/(1+j omega RC). This is a complex number, and it is simply a number that when multiplied with Vi gives me the output. This is also called a transfer function and represented as H(j omega). This guy is a transfer function, much like the gain of my amplifier. Which when multiplied by the input to get me the output.

这个家伙是一个复杂的乘法器，当它与 Vi 相乘时，得到 Vp。因此，我们称它为传递函数 H(j omega)。我们可以绘制这个函数。请注意，这是一个 omega 函数。请记住，我们采用的是频域视图，那么时间消失在哪里了？请记住，我们采用的是稳态视图。

This guy is a complex multiplier which when multiplied by Vi gives me Vp. And as such we call it a transfer function H(j omega). And we can plot this function. Notice that this a function of omega. Remember we are taking the frequency domain view, so where has time vanished? Remember that we are taking the steady state view.

因此，我们说在稳定状态下，如果我等待足够长的时间，我的电路就会这样运行，这就是电路的行为方式。瞬态响应已经消失，我的输出中有时间，所以我的输出是余弦。但这本身并不是很有趣。它是具有一定幅度和一定相位的余弦。

So we are saying in the steady state, if I wait long enough this is how my circuit is going to behave, this is how a circuit is going to behave. And the transient responses have died away and I have time in my output here so my output is a cosine. But that in itself is not very interesting. It is a cosine of some amplitude and has some phase.

我们将在此绘制此属性，即 Vp 作为频率的函数。Vp 依赖于频率。例如，我可以绘制 Vp/Vi 的绝对值，即其与 omega 的模量。请注意，当 omega 再次为零时，绘制此属性的直观方法是查看零时的值并查看大 omega 时的值。

What we will plot is we are going to plot this property here, Vp as a function of the frequency. Vp is frequency dependent. As an example, I could plot the absolute value of Vp/Vi, the modulus of that versus omega. And notice that when omega is zero again intuitive ways of plotting this is to look at the value at zero and look at the value at large omega.

对于较小的 omega，omega 趋向于零，即 1，因此它从这里开始。当 omega 非常大时，它比这里的 1 大得多，因此它会下降。远处这个看起来像 1/omega RC。假设我的 X 轴和 Y 轴上有线性刻度，则此函数看起来像这样。我们也通常使用对数对数刻度来绘制它。

For small omega, omega goes to zero this is one, so it starts off here. And when omega is very large then it is much bigger than one here, so this goes down. Far away this one looks like 1/omega RC. And this function, assuming I have linear scales on my X and Y axes looks like this. We also commonly plot this using log log scales.

当你对数对数刻度进行对数运算时，你会得到一条直线，然后你实际上会得到一条斜率为负 1 的直线，因为这个对数会给你一条斜率为常数的线，它的斜率为负 1，所以它变成了一条向下的直线。另一个有趣的事情是，这个量级只是一个接一个地加上欧米伽平方 R 平方 C 平方，也就是这个的平方根。

And when you do log log scales you get a straight line here, and then you actually get a straight line of slope minus one because the log of this gives you a line with a constant slope, it’s a slope of negative one so it becomes a straight line going down. The other interesting thing to realize is that this magnitude is simply one by one plus omega squared R squared C squared, the square root of this.

这就是幅度。注意当 omega 等于 1/RC 时，分母变为 2 的平方根 1。当 omega 等于 1/RC 时，输出是输入的 2 的平方根 1。这是一个有趣的点。这被称为“中断频率”。

That’s the magnitude here. And notice when omega equals 1/RC, this thing, the denominator becomes one by square root of 2. Somewhere here when omega equals 1/RC. The output is one by square root 2 times the input. It’s an interesting point. And this is called the “break frequency”.

您可以将其视为频率，在此频率下，我将从 1 过渡到较低的值，输出是输入值的 1 的平方根 2 倍。现在您可以回想一下我们之前向您展示的演示。在演示中，请记住，随着我增加输入正弦波的频率，我的输出变得越来越小。

You can view it as a frequency where I am getting this transition from one to a lower value, and it is where the output is one by square root two times the value of the input. Now you can think back on the demo we showed you earlier. And in the demo remember that as I increased the frequency of my input sinusoid my output kept becoming smaller and smaller and smaller.

您会注意到，随着我增加欧米茄，您可以看到振幅逐渐减弱或衰减。让我回顾一下。您所做的是，我们将向同一电路应用一堆正弦波，并绘制频率响应，即输出与输入之比作为频率的函数。并继续应用各种频率。

And you notice that you can see this dying out or decaying of the amplitude as I increase my omega. Let me go back. What you have done is that, we’re going to apply a bunch of sinusoids to the same circuit and plot the frequency response, the ratio of the output versus input as a function of frequency. And kept applying a variety of frequencies.

因此，您可以听频率经过时的声音，我们会在屏幕上为您绘制振幅。为了好玩，我们将播放 10 赫兹到 20 千赫兹之间的频率。弄清楚在什么时候您听不到频率会很有趣。我们将播放 10 赫兹到 20 千赫兹之间的频率。并找出您的耳朵在哪里停止。

So you can listen to the frequencies as they go by, and we will plot the amplitude up on the screen for you. Just for fun we are going to play frequencies between, say, 10 hertz and 20 kilohertz. It will be fun for you to figure out at what point you stop hearing the frequencies. We are going to play from 10 hertz to 20 kilohertz. And figure out where your ears cut out.

这会告诉你耳朵的断点频率是多少。你可以看到振幅被清晰地表达出来。下面的图是相位。这是频率轴。这是振幅，对数对数刻度。我不确定你的情况，但我听不到了。如果你把你的狗朋友带到课堂上，它们很可能会在这里的某个地方发狂。

That will tell you what the break frequency of your ear is. You can see the amplitude being articulated. The bottom figure is the phase. This is the frequency axis. This is the amplitude, log log scales. I am not sure about you but I cannot hear anymore. If you bring your canine friends to class it is quite possible that they would go berserk somewhere here.

正如我向你承诺的那样，当我在对数对数刻度上绘制它时，我会在这里得到一条直线，在那里也得到一条直线，底线为你提供了相位。现在，你也可以访问 Websim。Websim 现在已链接到你的课程主页。你可以访问 Websim，并可以使用各种 L、C 和 R 值。

As I promised you, when I plot this on a log log scale I get a straight line here and a straight line out there as well and the bottom line gives you the phase. Now, what you can also do is you can also go to Websim. Websim is now linked on your course homepage. You can go to Websim and you can play with various L and C and R values.

如果你绘制频率响应，如果你点击频率响应按钮，砰的一声，它就会给出与此完全相同的电路频率响应。你可以去尝试一下。谢谢。好的。作为下一步，我承诺向你展示一条更简单的路径。让我们建立一些见解。有没有更简单的方法来实现我们想要的目标？

And if you plot frequency response, if you click on the frequency response button, boom, it will give you frequency responses for your circuit that look exactly like that. You can go and play around with that. Thank you. All right. As the next step I promised to show you an easier path. And let’s build some insight. Is there a simpler way to get where we would like to get?

具体来说，有没有更简单的方法来获得 Vp？让我们关注 Vp。为什么是 Vp？因为记住 Vp 是 e 到​​ j omega t 的复振幅。一旦我知道了 Vp，我就知道了这里的这个表达式。还请注意，这里的分母只是 RC 电路的特征方程，我想知道你们中有多少人注意到了这一点，这只是 RC 电路的特征方程。

In particular, is there a simpler way to get Vp? Let’s focus on Vp. Why Vp? Because remember Vp was the complex amplitude of e to the j omega t. And once I know Vp then I know this expression here. Also notice that this here, the denominator is simply the characteristic equation for, I wonder how many of you noticed it, is simply the characteristic equation for the RC circuit.

如果我能写下 Vp，我就能写下特征方程，它将在分母中。我也可以通过取 Vp 的幅度和相位非常轻松地写下频率响应。因此，Vp 包含了人类对这些电路所需的所有信息。有没有更简单的方法来获取 Vp？为了带来一些见解，让我们继续写下

If I can write down Vp, I can write down the characteristic equation, it will be in the denominator. I can also write down the frequency response very easily by taking the magnitude and phase of Vp. So Vp has all the information humankind needs for those circuits. Is there a simpler way to get Vp? To bring some insight, let’s go ahead and write down

让我们再看一会儿，看看我们脑海中是否灵光一闪。当然，我可以把它写成 Vi/(1+sRC)。我只是替换了 aj omega 的简写符号。然后我只是在整个过程中除以 SC。所以我得到了 Vi 乘以，我在整个过程中除以 SC。这是 Vi。我有一个除以 SC，一个除以 SC 加 R。灯泡开始熄灭了吗？

Let’s stare at this for a while longer and see if light bulbs go off in our minds. Of course, I could write this as Vi/(1+sRC). I just replaced the shorthand notation for a j omega. And I simply divide by SC throughout. So I get Vi times, I simply divide by SC throughout. Here is Vi. I have one by SC, one by SC plus R. Light bulbs beginning to go off?

这里的形式是 1/SC，是我的电容除以连接到我的电容的某个东西加上 R 的某个函数。这是 Vi 乘以连接到电容的某个东西除以连接到电容的某个东西加上 R。回想一下你的电路。这让人想起什么？这让你想起了什么？分压器？嗯。这里有一些分压器的东西。我只是不能完全确定它。

The form we have here is 1/SC, some function of my capacitance divided by something connected to my capacitance plus R. This is Vi multiplied by something connected to capacitance divided by something connected to capacitance plus R. And remember your circuit. What is that reminiscent of? What does that remind you of? Voltage divider? Hmm. There is some voltage divider thing going on here. I just cannot quite pin it.

这是关于电容器、电容器加升压器、一些分压器之类的东西。我们将尝试找出答案。我将用 Zc 替换这些项。Zc 加 Zr。如果我能以某种方式找出 Zr 和 Zc，我就可以通过检查分压器动作、通过我所知道的欧姆定律的某些推广来记下 Vp。

It is something about the capacitor, capacitor plus booster, some voltage divider thingamajig happening here. We will try to figure that out. What I will do is replace those terms with something called Zc. Zc plus Zr. If I can find out the Zr and Zc somehow, I can write down the Vp by inspection by the voltage divider action, by some generalization of the good old Ohm’s law that I know about.

让我们继续，看看我们能否在这两者之间建立某种联系。如果我能建立联系，那么砰的一声，我就完成了。我只需要使用分压器，就可以了。好的，让我们玩一玩，看看。这里面有一些东西。现在你应该知道我们非常接近了。

Let’s proceed further and see if we can make some kind of a connection between this and this. If I can make the connection then boom, I’m done. I will just use voltage dividers and I am home. OK, so let’s play around and see. There is something in there. By now you should know that we are very close.

电阻器

Resistor

那里有事情发生。我只需要得到那股火花。

There is something going on in there. I just need to get that spark.

我只需要制造火花，这样我就可以弥合真正简单的事情与我所处位置之间的差距。让我们看看电阻。我的电阻上有电压 vR 和电流 iR。记住，要达到任何一种稳定状态，你将要处理形式为 vI e 到 j omega t 的驱动器，即指数驱动器。

I just need to make that spark so I can bridge the gap between something that is really easy versus where I am. Let’s take a look at the resistor. I have my resistor with the voltage vR across it and a current iR. Remember to get to any sort of steady state you are going to be dealing with the drives of the form vI e to the j omega t, exponential drives.

通过取实部，我知道我得到了输入，而输出的实部给了我实际的输出。假设我的 iR 就是 Ire^st，而我的 vR 就是 Vre^st。S 再次是 j omega 的简写符号。如果我的当前 Ire^st（此处和此处显示的指数形式）是 Vr，我需要找出 Vr 和 Ir 之间的关系，以便确定电阻器要保持的元素关系。

And by taking the real part, I know I get the input, and the real part of the output gives me the actual output. Let’s say my iR is simply Ire^st and my vR is Vre^st. The S is, again, a shorthand notation for j omega. If my current Ire^st of the exponential form shown there and here is Vr, I need to find out what relates Vr and Ir for the element relationship for the resistor to hold.

一般来说，Ir 和 Vr 是复数。对于电阻，我知道 Vr=RIr。我在这里用我的复数驱动器代替。所以是 Vre st=RIre st。我只是用这些驱动器代替，欧姆定律应该适用，我取消了 e^st。所以我得到 Vr=RIr。有趣。

In general, Ir and Vr are complex numbers. For the resistor, I know that Vr=RIr. And I substitute using my complex drives here. So it is Vrest=RIrest. I am just substituting for these drives, Ohm’s law should apply, and I cancel off e^st. And so I get Vr=RIr. Interesting.

对于电阻，我发现，根据电阻作用的基本原理，电压的复振幅与输入的复振幅仅通过比例因子 R 相关。换句话说，对于电阻，正如时间域 V 和 I 通过比例常数 R 相关一样，复振幅 Vr 和 Ir 也以相同的方式相关。这很有趣。现在让我们看看电容器。

For the resistor I find that, based on the fundamental principles of resistor action, the complex amplitude of the voltage simply relates to the complex amplitude of the input by the proportionality factor R. In other words, for the resistor Just as the time domain V and I were related by the proportionality constant R, the complex amplitudes Vr and Ir are also related in the same way. That’s interesting. Now let’s look at the capacitor.

一些电流 ic 流过它，电压为 vc。假设电流为 Ice^st，电压为 Vce^st。让我们将它们代入电容器的元件定律，看看我们能否找到一种关联 vc 和 ic 的方法。我知道 ic 就是 Cdvc/dt。所以我用 Ice st=Cd/dt(vce st) 替换它，也就是 Ice st=CsVce st。所以我可以再次取消它。有趣。Ic=CsVc。非常有趣。这里有什么有趣的？

Some current ic flowing through it and a voltage vc. Let’s say the current is Ice^st and the voltage is Vce^st. Let’s plug these into the element law for the capacitor and see if we can find out a way of relating vc and ic. I know that ic is simply Cdvc/dt. So I replace this with Icest=Cd/dt(vcest), which is simply Icest=CsVcest. So I can cancel this out again. Interesting. Ic=CsVc. Very interesting. What is interesting here?

请注意，在时间域中，Ic=Cdvc/dt，这是电容器的元素定律。所以我说让我们使用指数驱动，Ice^st，Vce^st，这是一个指数驱动，并尝试找出复杂振幅之间的关系。

Notice that in the time domain Ic=Cdvc/dt, the element law for the capacitor. So I said let’s use exponential drives, Ice^st, Vce^st, that’s an exponential drive, and try to find out what the relationship between the complex amplitudes are.

指数驱动

Exponential Drive

我把它们插上，结果是什么？我发现，如果我的输入是 Vce^st，Vc 是输入的幅度，那么电流就是某个值乘以 Vc 得到的。

I plug them and what do I find? I find that if my input is Vce^st, and Vc is the amplitude of the input, then the current is simply given by something multiplied Vc.

它的形式与我在这里看到的非常相似。电阻器，Vr=RIr。对于电容器，Vc=Ic/sc。1/sc 起到 R 的作用。换句话说，电容器周围的复振幅与 Vc 等于某个常数乘以 Ic 有关。几乎就像一种有趣的欧姆定律关系，其中 Vc 和 IC 是复振幅。对于电感器来说，情况也一样，iL、vL 和 L。假设 iL=Ile^st 和 vL=Vle^st。

It’s very similar in form to what I saw here. The resistor, Vr=RIr. For the capacitor, Vc=Ic/sc. 1/sc kind of plays the role of R. In other words, the complex amplitudes around the capacitor are related by Vc equals some constant times Ic. Almost like a funny Ohm’s law kind of relationship where Vc and IC are complex amplitudes. For the inductor it is the same way, iL, vL and L. Let’s say iL=Ile^st and vL=Vle^st.

将电感器的值代入其元件关系中。我知道 vL=LdiL/dt。因此，代入复振幅就是 L。而 diL/dt 就是 Ilse^st。所以我取消了指数。我们能够做到这一切的原因仅仅是指数的非凡之美。指数绝对美得令人惊叹。

Substitute the values for the inductor into its element relationship as well. I know that vL=LdiL/dt. Therefore, substituting the complex amplitudes is L. And diL/dt will simply be Ilse^st. So I cancel out the exponentials. The reason we’re able to do all of this is simply the remarkable beauty of exponentials. Exponentials are absolutely stunningly beautiful.

原因是当我对它们求导时，我得到的是指数乘以某个常数，而这个常数的分子乘以 t。这就是指数的美妙之处。如果这是正弦，那么我会得到余弦和正弦。有了指数，它们就会抵消，剩下的就是 LsIl。同样，对于电感器，电感器两端的电压与某个常数 Ls 乘以 Il 有关。

The reason is that when I differentiate them what I get back is the exponential times some constant, and the constant was in its numerator multiplying t. And that’s the beauty of exponentials. If this was a sine then I would get cosine and a sine. With exponentials these cancel out and what I am left with is something that is LsIl. Again, for the inductor, the voltage across the inductor relates to some constant Ls here times Il.

这绝对令人惊叹，几乎看起来像是欧姆定律的一种形式。我要做的是，让我们给它命名为 Zr。让我们给这个 1/sC 命名为 Zc。让我们给它命名为 ZL。它的行为有点像电阻器，所以电阻器就变成了 Zr。而 1/sC 的行为就像电阻器，所以我把它叫做 Zc。这是一个 ZL。这些被称为“阻抗”。

This is absolutely stunning and almost looks like a form of Ohm’s law here. What I am going to do is let’s give this the name Zr. Let’s give this 1/sC the name Zc. And let’s give this the name ZL. It kind of behaves like a resistor, so the resistor simply becomes Zr. And 1/sC behaved like a resistor so I called it Zc. And this is a ZL. These are called “impedances”.

换句话说，对于电容器而言，就复杂的输入和输出而言，如果将 Vc 和 Ic 馈送到它，则可以用阻抗 Zc 代替电容器，其中我可以将 Vc 和 Ic 之间的关系写为 Vc=ZcIc。

In other words, for a capacitor, as far as complex inputs and outputs are concerned, if Vc and Ic is fed to it, the capacitor can be replaced by an impedance Zc where I can write the relationship between Vc and Ic as Vc=ZcIc.

复杂输入

Complex Inputs

其中 Zc 就是 1 乘以 sc。类似地，对于电感器，我可以将其阻抗 ZL 写为 sL，得到 Vl=ZLIl。最后，对于电阻器，这非常简单。

Where Zc is simply one by sc. Similarly, for an inductor I can write its impedance ZL as sL and I get Vl=ZLIl. And finally for a resistor it is pretty simple.

我的意思是，如果我在操场区域，如果我将自己限制在操场区域，我的输入是 Vi e 到 j omega t 或指数，那么现在在操场的那个小区域，我越来越关注操场的细小部分，所以我现在有点被限制住了。在操场的那个区域，这适用。

What I am saying is that if I am in the region of the playground, if I constrain myself in the region of the playground where my inputs are something Vi e to the j omega t or exponentials, in that little region of the playground now, I am focusing more and more on small parts of the playground so I am kind of boxed in right now. In that region of the playground this applies.

在操场的那个区域，我可以用阻抗代替电阻器，阻抗值为 1/sC 的电容器。在操场中，分析的美妙之处在于，在操场的那个区域，输入的形式为 Vie^st，事实证明，元素定律只是欧姆定律的概括。这绝对令人惊叹。这是学习电路时最大的哈利路亚时刻之一。这真的很重要。

In that region of the playground, I can replace resistors by impedances, capacitors with impedances of value 1/sC. And within that playground the beauty of analysis there is that in that region of the playground where the inputs are of the form Vie^st, it turns out that the element laws are simply generalizations of Ohm’s law. That is absolutely stunning. It is one of the biggest hallelujah moments in learning circuits. This is really big.

我认为这几乎与认识到您可以采用非线性电路，在给定的工作点上操作它一样重要，您可以坐下来做禅修，观察其中的小扰动，它们将呈线性相关。这是 6.002 中最重要的时刻之一。这与小信号响应呈线性的程​​度相同。这是完全非直观的。

And I think this is almost as big as the realization that you can take a nonlinear circuit, operate it at a given operating point, and you can sit around doing Zen things, looking at small perturbations in there, those are going to be linearly related. This is one of the big hallelujah moments in 6.002. And this is of the same magnitude as the small signal response being linear. It is something that is completely non intuitive.

这是你只有亲眼看到才会知道的事情。这里也是一样。这非常重要，所以我会再重复一遍。我把自己限制在操场的这个小区域内，我所关心的只是正弦输入和稳态响应。所以我专注于复杂的输入，Vi e 到 j omega t。

It is something that you just would not have known until you had seen it happen. The same way here. This is very important so I will repeat it again. I have boxed myself into this small region of the playground where all I care about are sinusoidal inputs and steady state responses. So there I focus on complex inputs, Vi e to the j omega t.

我刚刚向你展示了我可以用电感器、电容器、电阻器来代替它们的阻抗。它们周围相应信号的幅度仅通过简单的欧姆定律（类似阻抗关系）来关联。我有点被困在这个游乐场里了，对吧？在我的游乐场里，一切都是关于 e 到 ij 欧米茄 t。e 到 ij 欧米茄 t 到处都是隐含的。我只是没有展示它。

And I have just shown you that I can replace inductors, capacitors, resistors with their impedances. And the amplitudes of the corresponding signals around them are related by just a simple Ohm’s law like relationship using impedances. I am sort of boxed into this playground, right? In my playground it is all about e to the ij omega t. e to the ij omega t is implicit everywhere. I just don’t show it.

如果我想和麻省理工学院这个小区域以外的人交谈，那一切都会变得非常困难。如果我想和外面的人交谈，离开麻省理工学院，离开这个操场，我还能做什么？我必须参加真正的活动。别忘了这一点。

If I want to talk to somebody else outside but within MIT in this small region, it’s all e to the ij omega t in there. If I want to talk to somebody outside, get out of MIT, get out of this playground, what else do I have to do? I have to take the real part. Don’t forget that.

请记住，以这里的 Vc 为例，Vc 就是这个，所以这一切隐含着，如果我在某个地方测量 Vc，它实际上将是 Vce 到 j omega t。如果我们取余弦，即实部，那么我必须取它的实部。而它的实部将是 Vc 余弦 omega t 角 Vc。这部分在这里有点不言而喻。

Remember that, take for example Vc here, so Vc is this, so implicit in all of this is that if I measure Vc at some place it is really going to be Vce to the j omega t. And if we the cosine, the real part, then I have to take a real part of this. And the real part of that would Vc cosine of omega t angle Vc. This piece here kind of goes unsaid.

我们同意我们必须这样做，但我们跳过了这一步，因为它很明显。我们现在只处理 Vcs 和 Vls。所以一个新的符号肯定被你偷偷摸摸地记下来了，那个符号看起来像一个大写字母和一个小写字母。记住，你已经看到了 vL，这是总行为，你已经看到了 vl，这是一个小信号行为，现在你看到了这个，Vl，大写 V，小写 l。

We will agree that we have to do it, but we just skip that step because it is obvious. We just deal with Vcs and Vls now. So a new notation certainly sneaked by you, and that notation looks like a big letter and a small letter. Remember you have seen vL, this is the total behavior, you have seen vl, that’s a small signal behavior, and now you see this, Vl, capital V small l.

我们还有 DC，我们将工作点值标记为 VL，大写 V，大写 L。我们还剩下一件事，所以没有人会去发明新东西，因为我们会遇到麻烦。这是大写 V，小写 l，这只是我的操场上小方框区域中的“复杂振幅”，好事发生在这里，指数飞涨。

And we also have DC, we have labeled operating point values as VL, capital V, capital L. We have one thing left so nobody go out there inventing something new because we would be in trouble. This is capital V, small l, and this is simply “complex amplitude” in the small boxed region of my playground where good things happen and exponentials fly.
