每当有人给你一个变量，大写 V，小写 l，记住它是一个复振幅，一个复数，你知道如何从那里进入时间域。你取这个数字，取实部，将数字乘以 e 到 j omega t 并取实部，这等于幅度余弦 omega t 加上该数字的角度。实际上，你知道吗？让我们把它发送上去。

Whenever someone gives you a variable, capital V, small l, remember it’s a complex amplitude, a complex number, and you know how to get to the time domain from there. You take that number, take the real part, multiple the number by e to the j omega t and take the real part, which is tantamount to magnitude cosine omega t plus angle of that number. Actually, you know what? Let’s send this up.

主电路

Main Circuit

回到一个例子。

Back to an example.

哦，对不起。对不起。这不好。这是我的时域电路。记住这是我的时域电路。vI 输入。vC 输出。我想分析一下。我现在要告诉你的是，让我们在这个阻抗运动场中把自己框起来。在阻抗运动场中，输入变成输入的复振幅，我的电阻被一个盒子 Zr 取代，我的电容器被一个盒子 Zc 取代。

Oh, I’m sorry. I’m sorry. This is not good. This is my time domain circuit. Remember this was my time domain circuit. A vI input. A vC output. I wanted to analyze this. What I am telling you now is let’s box ourselves in this impedance playground. And in the impedance playground the input becomes the complex amplitude of the input, my resistance gets replaced by a box Zr, my capacitor gets replaced by a box Zc.

我关心的电压是 Vc。Zr = R 且 Zc=1/sC。现在，我们开始吧。我可以使用分压器动作写下 Vc，因为 Vc 只是 Zc/(Zc+Zr)，然后乘以 Vi。这样我得到 1/sC 除以 1/sC+R，再乘以 sC，我得到 1/1+sCR，其中 S 是 j omega。再简单不过了。我花了多长时间完成这个？30 秒。

And the voltage I care about here is Vc. Zr = R and Zc=1/sC. Now, there we go. I can write down Vc using a voltage divider action as Vc is simply Zc/(Zc+Zr), done, times Vi of course. And that gives me 1/sC divided by 1/sC+R and multiplying throughout by sC I get 1/1+sCR where S is j omega. Just cannot get any simpler. How long did I take to do this? 30 seconds.

我在周二花了一整节课的时间研究第一个三角函数，中途放弃并崩溃，然后向你展示了一条仍然相当痛苦的秘诀，但 30 秒后，砰的一声。这些东西非常漂亮。这里真正酷的地方是，在这个线性电路的阻抗域中，你所有的老把戏都适用。你的戴维南、诺顿、叠加，随便什么都可以适用于这个线性电路。

Where I spent a whole lecture on Tuesday grinding through first trig, giving up halfway and collapsing, and then showing you the sneaky path which was still pretty painful, but 30 seconds, boom. This stuff is spectacularly beautiful. The really cool thing here is that in this impedance domain for linear circuits all your good old tricks apply. Your Thevenin, your Norton, your superposition, name it and it applies for this linear circuit.

如果你闭上眼睛，假装 Zr 就像 R，然后简单地应用你迄今为止在这个线性操场上学到的所有技巧。最后只需要一点小技巧，这就是复杂的振幅。如果你想转到时间域部分，那么你可以做通常的事情。模数 Vc 余弦 omega t 加角度 Vc。只要记住这一点。

If you close your eyes and make believe that Zr is like an R and simply apply all the techniques you have learned so far in this linear playground. Just a little hack at the end where this is the complex amplitude. And if you want to go to the time domain part then you do the usual thing. Modulus Vc cosine omega t plus angle Vc. Just remember that.

这就是回到时间域的跳转。为了向你展示这不仅适用于这里的一个小小的电路，让我来看一下更复杂的电路。

That’s the jump to get back to the time domain. Just to show you that this not just works for one little rinky dink circuit here, let me take a more complicated circuit.

RLC 系列

Series RLC

如果我相信自己的 BS，我应该能够将这个理论应用到我的串联 RLC 电路中，这是一个非常痛苦的电路，大约一周前我们用微分方程来计算。我们开始吧。我有一个电感器、一个电容器和一个电阻器。

If I believe in my own BS, I should be able to apply this theory to my series RLC, the big painful circuit that we did differential equations for about a week ago. Let’s do it. I have an inductor, a capacitor and a resistor.

我要做的是用阻抗模型替换它。输入 Vi。假设这是 vI。假设我关心 vR。L、C 和 R。阻抗模型将只是 Vi。电感器的阻抗是多少？SL。对于电容器，它是 1/sC。对于电阻器，它只是 R。

What I am going to do is replace this with the impedance model. Input Vi. Let’s say this was vI. Let’s say I cared about vR. L, C and R. The impedance model would simply be Vi. What’s the impedance of an inductor? SL. And for the capacitor it is 1/sC. And for a resistor it is simply R.

请记住，如果我能找出 VR，那么对于形式为 Vi 余弦 omega t 的输入余弦，输出将由 |Vr| omega t 的余弦加上角度 Vr 给出。只需记住这最后一步。但 Vr 本身很容易确定。它是分压器作用再次乘以 Vi。分压器作用在分母中，我将这些小东西相加，因此 ZL+ZC+ZR，ZR 在分子中。而 Zr 就是 R。

And just remember, if I can find out VR then for an input cosine of the form Vi cosine omega t the output will given by |Vr| cosine of omega t plus angle Vr. Just remember this last step. But Vr itself is trivially determined. It is the voltage divider action again times Vi. And the voltage divider action is in the denominator I sum these thingamajigs, so ZL+ZC+ZR, ZR in the numerator. And Zr is simply R.

ZL 是 sL。Zc 是 1/sC。R 是 R。Vi。我将其乘以，在这种特定情况下，乘以 s/L。我想将其变成您之前看到的相同形式。将分子和分母乘以 s/L，我得到什么？我得到 RS/L，在这里我最终得到 S 平方加 1/LC，然后我得到加 R/L S。我完成了。看看那个。

ZL is sL. Zc is 1/sC. And R is R. Vi. And I multiply through by, in this particular situation, by s/L. I want to get it into the same form as you’ve seen before. Multiply throughout, the numerator and denominator by s/L, what do I get? I get RS/L and out here I end up getting S squared plus 1/LC, and I get plus R/L S. I am done. Look at that.

嗯，30 秒多一点。也许一分钟。这是什么？你以前在哪里见过这个？这个表达式的分母是什么？啊，RLC 的特征方程。还记得我在一开始向你承诺过，当我们用一个简单的一分钟表达式结束一天的工作时，我会写下特征方程吗？砰，这就是我得到的。有人听到里面有回声吗？

Well, a little more than 30 seconds. Maybe a minute. What is this? Where have you seen this before? The denominator of this expression here? Ah, characteristic equation for the RLC. Remember I promised you in the beginning that when we come to the end of the day using a simple one minute expression I am going to write down the characteristic equation? Boom, here is what I get. Did somebody hear an echo in there?

请注意，只需做一个简单的分压器，我就能得到这个表达式。现在我可以通过替换 s 等于 j omega 来写下频率响应。更漂亮、更令人惊叹的是，还记得我教过你的直观方法吗？特征方程给出 alpha、omega nought、omega d 和 Q。基于这些，我们甚至可以绘制时域响应。猜猜怎么着？RLC 电路现在通过了。你只需写下这个东西就可以了，30 秒或更短。没有 DE，没有触发器，什么都没有。好的。

Notice that just by doing a simple voltage divider thingamajig, I got this expression. And now I can write down the frequency response by replacing s is equal to j omega. Even more beautiful and what is even more stunningly pretty here is that remember the intuitive method I taught you about? The characteristic equation gives you alpha, omega nought, omega d and Q. And based on those we can sketch even the time domain response. Guess what? RLC circuits are passÈ now. You can just write this thing down and you’re done, 30 seconds or less. No DEs, no trig, no nothing. OK.

Lec 18 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 18 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 48:00 https://youtube.com/watch?v=WT-qzgaKeGI

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 48:00 https://youtube.com/watch?v=WT-qzgaKeGI

介绍

Introduction

好的。让我们开始吧。早上好。今天，如果一切顺利，我们会为你们带来一些乐趣。我希望一切顺利。我们拭目以待。我今天要做的是频率响应和电路频域分析的一个非常重要的应用。这个应用领域被称为滤波器。滤波器领域通常需要一门或几门完整的课程。

All right. Let’s get moving. Good morning. Today, if everything works out, we have some fun for you guys. I hope it works out. We’ll see. What I am going to do today is a very major application of the frequency response and the frequency domain analysis of circuits. And this application area is called filters. The area of filters often times demands a full course or a couple of full courses all by itself.

滤波器非常有用。它们几乎以某种形式用于所有电子设备。它们用于收音机调谐器。我们今天将向您展示一个演示。它们还用于您的手机。每部手机都有一组滤波器。那么，例如，您如何选择对话？您可以通过选择某个频率并从那里获取数据来选择对话。它们也用于广域网无线发射器。

And filters are incredibly useful. They’re used in virtually every electronic device in some form or another. They’re used in radio tuners. We will show you a demo of that today. They’re also used in your cell phones. Every single cell phone has a set of filters. So, for example, how do you pick a conversation? You pick a conversation by picking a certain frequency and grabbing data from there. They are also in wide area network wireless transmitters.

这里有接入点吗？我没有看到，但你见过无线接入点。同样，它们里面有过滤器。因此，几乎每个电子设备都包含一个过滤器。所以，今天我们将研究频域分析的这一主要应用。在讨论之前，我想先做一点回顾。

Do we have an access point here? I don’t see one, but you’ve seen wireless access points. Again, there they have filters in them. So, virtually every single electronic device contains a filter at some point or another. And so, today we will look at this major, major application of frequency domain analysis. Before we get into that, I’d like to do a bit of review.

审查

Review

今天的阅读内容与课程笔记中的第 14.4.2、14.5 和 15.2 章相对应。好的。让我们从复习开始。上周五我们研究了这个电路，我说过，对于我们的分析，我们将重点关注操场的这个小区域。操场这个区域的特别之处在于我将重点关注正弦输入。

The readings for today correspond to Chapter 14.4.2,14.5 and 15.2 in the course notes. All right. Let’s start with the review. We looked at this circuit last Friday where I said that for our analysis, we are going to focus on this small, small region of the playground. And what’s special about this region of our playground is that I am going to focus on sinusoidal inputs.

其次，我将重点介绍稳态响应。如果我等待很长时间，响应会是什么样子？然后我们说，全面的时域分析很难。还记得，这是一种痛苦的方法吗？然后我在上一节课中教了你阻抗方法，它非常简单。在阻抗方法中，我们说过我们要做的就是

And, second, I am going to focus on the steady state response. How does the response look like if I wait a long, long time? And then we said that the full blown time domain analysis was hard. This was, remember, the agonizing approach? And then I taught you the impedance approach in the last lecture, which was blindingly simple. And, in that impedance approach, what we said we would do is

我现在就应用这个方法，并在几秒钟内为你得出结果。但基本思想是我们说过我们要做的就是假设我们将把 Vi e 形式的输入应用于 j omega t。无论你在哪里看到大写字母和小写字母，旁边的 j omega t 都有一个隐含的 e。我不会向你展示这一点。

I will apply the approach right now and in seconds derive the result for you. But the basic idea was we said what we are going to do is assume that we are going to apply inputs of the form Vi e to the j omega t. Wherever you see a capital and a small, there is an implicate e to the j omega t next to it. I’m not showing you that.

我上次和上一节课展示的是，一旦你找出了振幅，一旦你找出了将 e 乘以 j omega t 的乘数，它就是一个复数，你就拥有了所需的所有信息。一旦你有了这个，你只需取它的模数，或者取它的振幅和相位就可以得到角度，从而找出时域响应。

And what I showed last time, and the class before that was once you find out the amplitude Once you find out the multiplier that multiplies e to the j omega t, it’s a complex number, you have all the information you need. And once you have this, you can find out the time domain response by simply taking the modulus of that, or the amplitude and the phase of that to get the angle.

这样就得到了时域响应。因此，我们的重点是这些数量。阻抗方法表示我要做的是用阻抗替换这些。然后相应的阻抗模型如下所示。我用 ZR 替换 R。我用 ZC 替换电容器。这是我的 Vc。

And that gives you the time domain response. So, our focus has been on these quantities. The impedance method says what I am going to do is replace each of these by impedances. And then the corresponding impedance model looks like this. Instead of R, I replace that with ZR. And instead of the capacitor, I am going to replace that with ZC. And this is my Vc.

ZR 就是 R，ZC 就是 1 除以 sC，其中 s 只是 j omega 的简写。基于此，一旦我将所有元素转换为阻抗，我就可以继续应用所有优秀的旧线性分析技术。今天我将讨论其中的很多技术。

ZR is simply R and ZC was going to be one divided by sC where s was simply a shorthand notation for j omega. Based on this, once I converted all my elements into impedances, I can go ahead and apply all the good old linear analysis techniques. I will discuss a bunch of them today.

频率响应

Frequency Response

举个例子，我可以用简单的分压器关系来分析这一点。Vc 就是 ZC 除以 ZC 加上 ZR 乘以 Vi。

As an example, I could analyze this using my simple voltage divider relationship. Vc is simply ZC divided by ZC plus ZR times Vi.

反过来，假设我将其除以 Vi，这样我就可以得到响应关系，即 ZC 除以 ZC 加上 ZR。我知道 ZC 等于 1 除以 j omega C，加上 R。再乘以 j omega C，我得到 1 除以 1 加上 j omega CR。这非常简单。这简称为频率响应。

And that, in turn, is, well, let’s say I divide this by Vi so I can get the response relation, is ZC divided by ZC plus ZR. And ZC I know to be one by j omega C, plus R. And multiplying throughout by j omega C, I get one divided by one plus j omega CR. It’s incredibly simple. This is simply called the frequency response.

它是一个传递函数，表示输出复振幅与输入之间的关系。我们也可以绘制它。请注意，在我们的整个分析中，我们不仅假设了正弦输入，而且我们还说让我们只在稳定状态下观察它。因此，我们将等待时间变得非常非常大，然后查看响应。

And it’s a transfer function representing the relationship between the output complex amplitude with the input. We can also plot this. Notice that in our entire analysis we have not only assumed sinusoidal input, but we’re also saying that let us look at this only in the steady state. So, we will wait for time to be really, really large, and then look at the response.

因此，我们将绘制响应，而不是将其绘制为时间函数，而是将其绘制为欧米茄函数。我们要说的是，我将输入一个正弦波，我的输出将是另一个正弦波。由于我要等待很长时间才能看到输出，因此时间不再有意义。

And so, therefore, we will plot the response not as a function of time, but rather we are going to plot the response as a function of omega. What we are going to say is I am going to input a sinusoid and my output is going to be some other sinusoid. And since I’m waiting for a long time to look at the output, time doesn’t make sense anymore.

相反，我的自由变量将是我的频率，所以我将改变我应用的输入的频率。因此，我将把它绘制为 omega 函数。这代表了电路的完全互补视图，即时域视图，然后是频域视图。频域视图表示当我应用不同频率的正弦波时，该电路如何表现？

Rather, my free variable is going to be my frequency, so I am going to change the frequency of the input that I apply. And so, I am going to plot this as a function of omega. This represents a completely complimentary view of circuits, the time domain view and then there is a frequency domain view. The frequency domain view says how did this circuit behave as I apply sinusoids of differing frequencies?

我可以像这样在图中绘制这种关系，这种关系只是由传递函数的参数边给出，它是欧米茄函数。我还可以绘制它的绝对值。让我们看看它是什么样子的。因此，我可以查看这样的函数并快速绘制响应。

I can plot that relationship in a graph like this, and this relationship is simply given by a parameter edge the transfer function, it’s a function of omega. And I can also plot the absolute value of that. And let’s take a look at what it looks like. So, I can look at functions like this and very quickly plot the response.

我将通过观察电路和类似这样的表达式来绘制一大堆图表。今天你们将会看到很多图表。首先，绘制这些图表的方法是寻找 omega 非常小和 omega 非常大时的值。当 omega 非常非常小时，这个项就消失了。因此，对于非常小的 omega 值，输出仅为 1。

I am going to do a whole bunch of plots just by staring at circuits and staring at expressions like this. And you will see a number of them today. First of all, the way you plot these is look for the values where omega is very small and when omega is very large. When omega is very, very small this term goes away. And so, for very small values of omega the output is simply one.

Vc 乘以 Vi 等于 1。这部分消失了。当 omega 非常非常大时会发生什么？当 omega 非常大时，这部分占主导地位，远大于 1。如果我忽略与这个家伙相关的 1 并取其绝对值，那么当 omega 非常大时，我只需得到 1 除以 omega CR。因此，当 omega 非常大时，我得到的衰减形式为 1 除以 omega CR。

Vc by Vi is simply one. This part goes away. What happens when omega is very, very large? When omega is really large, this part dominates, is much greater than one. If I ignore one in relation to this guy and take the absolute value of that then I simply get one divided by omega CR when omega is very large. So, when omega is very large, I get a decay of the form one over omega CR.

我知道小欧米茄的值，而非常大的欧米茄的值是这样的。如果你把它画出来，它看起来会是这样的。让我们再盯着这个表格看一会儿。让我们画出它的一些属性。首先，你注意到了其他的东西。当欧米茄 CR 等于一时，换句话说，当欧米茄乘以 RC 等于一时，注意输出是一加 j。

I know the value for small omega, and it looks like this for very large omega. And, if you plot it out, this is how it’s going to look like. Let’s stare at this form for a little while longer. And let’s plot some properties off it. First of all, you notice something else. When omega CR equals one then, in other words, when omega equals one by RC, notice that the output is given by one plus j.

它的绝对值就是 1 除以 2 的平方根。换句话说，当 omega 为 1 除以 RC 时，当 omega 为 1 除以 CR 时，输出就是 1 除以 2 的平方根，当 omega 非常非常小时。所以，这是一条小信息。

And the absolute value of that is simply one divided the square root of two. So, in other words, when omega is one by RC When omega is one by CR then the output is one by square root two times its value when omega is very, very small. So, that is one little piece of information.

如果你看一下这个表格，我希望你盯着它看几分钟，试着理解它代表什么。这表明，对于非常低的频率，响应的幅度实际上与输入的幅度相同。换句话说，如果我应用某个幅度的非常低频正弦波，那么输出幅度将与该幅度相同。这就是 1。

If you look at the form of this, I would like you to stare at it for a few minutes and try to understand what this represents. This says that for very low frequencies the response is virtually the same as the input in amplitude. In other words, if I apply some very low frequency sinusoid of some amplitude then the output amplitude is going to be same as that amplitude. And that’s a one.

现在，它还表示，当我施加非常高的频率时，它会在非常高的频率下衰减。所以，这张图表示，我将通过低频而不进行任何衰减，不会对其进行锤击，但我将破坏高频，并在输出端给出一个非常低幅度的信号，但在低频下输入几乎无衰减地通过。

Now, it also says when I apply a very high frequency, at very high frequencies it decays. So, this graph which says I am going to pass low frequencies without any attenuation, without hammering it, but I am going to clobber high frequencies and give you a very low amplitude signal at the output but pass through, almost without attenuation, the input at low frequencies.

这就是所谓的低通滤波器或 LPF 的一个例子。这意味着这里的小电路就像一个低通滤波器。它是一个低通滤波器，因为它可以不衰减地通过低频，但会消除高频。如果我拿一些音乐，你会在实验室里用它做实验。第三个实验室什么时候开始？人们现在正在做第三个实验室，对吧？

And so this is an example of what is called a low pass filter or LPF. What this is saying is that this little circuit here acts like a low pass filter. It’s a low pass filter because it passes low frequencies without attenuation but kills high frequencies. If I take some music, and you will do experiments with this in lab. When is lab three? People are doing lab three right now, right?

第三个实验现在正在进行，下周初也会进行。在第三个实验中，您将观察不同类型的滤波器对音乐的响应。如果在这里应用一些音乐，您将看到输出将通过低频，但实际上会衰减高频。您将听到很多低音基音等，但会衰减很多高频。好的。

Lab three is going on right now and early next week as well. And, in lab three, you will play with looking at the response to music of different types of filters. If apply some music here, you will see that the output will pass low frequencies but really attenuate high frequencies. You will hear a lot of the low sounding base and so on but attenuate a lot of the high frequencies. All right.

我鼓励您做的另一件事是 Websim 为大量此类电路内置了页面。您可以进入其中，针对各种电路调整 RC 或 L 的值。而且，如果您单击频率响应，您实际上还可以获得幅度响应和相位。

The other thing that I encourage you to do is Websim has built in pages for a large number of such circuits. You can go in there and play with the values of RC, or L for that matter, for a variety of circuits. And, if you click on frequency response, you actually get both the amplitude response and the phase as well.

您可以使用各种 RLC 值并查看每个电路的频率响应。

You can play with various values of RLC and see how the frequency response looks like for each of the circuits.

阻抗

Impedance

下一步，我想做的是让您了解阻抗是如何组合的。鉴于它们的行为就像电阻一样，这并不会让人感到惊讶，但无论如何，了解一下还是有好处的。假设，只是为了建立一些洞察力，假设我有两个串联的电阻。好的。

As a next step, what I would like to do is just give you a sense of how impedances combine. This won’t be very surprising given that they behave just like resistors, but it’s good to go through it nonetheless. Suppose, just to build some insight, suppose I had two resistors in series. All right.

R1 和 R2。这分别是我的 A 和 B 端子。假设电压的复振幅为 Vab。那么我可以关联，假设 Iab 是电流，我可以关联这些电阻。或者，我可以按以下方式关联 Vab 和 Iab。只需将 Vab 除以 Iab 等于 R1 加 R2。我知道这一点。同样的事情也适用于被视为阻抗的 R。

R1 and R2. And this was my A and B terminals respectively. And let’s say the complex amplitude of the voltage was Vab across this. Then I could relate, let’s say Iab was the current, I can relate these resistances. Or, I could relate Vab and Iab as follows. Simply Vab divided by Iab equals R1 plus R2. I know that. And the same thing applies to R viewed as an impedance.

它仍然是阻抗 R，因此这个仍然适用。我可以尝试的第二件事是这种形式的电路。A、B，在这种情况下，我有一个 R1 和一个 L。我能做的是，在阻抗模型中，我可以将其视为值为 j omega L 的阻抗。我还可以将它们组合起来以获得 A 和 B 之间的阻抗。

It’s still impedance R, and so this one still goes ahead and applies. The second thing I can try is the circuit of this form. A, B, and I have an R1 and an L in this case. And what I can do is, in the impedance model, I can view this as an impedance of value j omega L. And I can also combine them to get the impedance between A and B.

就像我得到 A 和 B 之间的电阻一样，我也可以得到 A 和 B 之间的阻抗，即 Vab 除以 Iab。这将由 ZR1 加上 ZL 给出，也就是 R1 加上 j omega L。同样，我可以做一个更复杂的电路。所以，电阻。这里我有一个与电阻串联的电容器，然后我将电感器应用于它。

Much as I got a resistance between A and B, I can get an impedance between A and B as Vab divided by Iab. And that will be given by ZR1 plus ZL, and that is simply R1 plus j omega L. Similarly, I can do an even more complicated circuit. So, resistance. And here I have a capacitor in series with the resistance, and then I apply inductor to it.

这是 A、B、Iab 和正、负 Vab。我将其称为 R1，将其称为 R2，这是 C 和 L。我可以按照与串联并联简化中组合电阻相同的方式组合它们。

This is A, B, Iab and plus, minus Vab. And let me call this R1 and let me call this R2 and this is C and L. I can go about combining these in much the same manner that I combine my resistances in the series parallel simplifications.

我可以将 A 和 B 端子之间的阻抗 Zab 定义为 ZR1 加上该组合的 Z，该组合的阻抗，即 C 和 R2 的阻抗彼此并联。我得到 Zc 与 ZR2 并联。请注意，此符号只是表示查看与电阻并联的电容器的阻抗。然后，最后，我将电感器 ZL 的串联阻抗添加到该阻抗上。

I can define an impedance Zab between the A and B terminals as ZR1 plus Z of this combination, impedance of this combination, which is simply impedance of C and that of R2 in parallel with each other. I get Zc in parallel with ZR2. Notice that this notation simply says that look at the impedance of the capacitor in parallel with a resistor. And then, finally, I add to that the series impedance of the inductor ZL.

正如你对电阻所做的那样，如果所有这些电阻，你会说这个部分的 R 加上并联组合的 R 加上这里的 R。这一次我们有了阻抗。用值替换它，这是 R1。我知道对于 ZL 来说，它是 j omega L。

Exactly as you would have done for resistances, if all of these resistances you would have said R of this piece plus the R of the parallel combination plus the R of whatever was here. This time around we have impedances. And replacing this with the values, this is R1. I know for ZL it’s j omega L.

因此，对于 ZL，并联 ZR2 等于 ZCZR2 除以 ZC 加上 ZR2，这里就是 R1 和 j omega L。让我代入这里的值。我知道 ZR2 就是 R2，ZC 就是 1 乘以 j omega C，然后 1 乘以 j omega C 加上 R2。我可以继续进一步简化它并得到阻抗 Zab。注意分析变得多么简单。

And so, for ZL, parallel ZR2 it is given by ZCZR2 divided by ZC plus ZR2, which is simply R1 here and j omega L. And let me just substitute the values here. I know that ZR2 is simply R2, ZC is one by j omega C, and then one by j omega C plus R2. And I can go ahead and simplify that further and get my impedance Zab. Notice how simple analysis has become.

使用这种技术，使用阻抗法，我们成功地将我们的分析从求解微分方程转变为回归代数。我们在电路中所做的大部分工作是看看我们如何才能回归到非常简单的代数，并尝试巧妙地处理事情。所以，就分析而言，这就是全部了。

Using this technique, using the impedance method we’ve managed to convert our analysis from solving differential equations to going back to algebra. A large part of what we do in circuits is see how we can get back to really simple algebra and try to be clever about how we do things. So, this is as far as analysis is concerned.

在接下来的五分钟里，我想让你深入了解如何构建不同类型的阻抗。我不会讲得太详细，但会告诉你如何了解你想要设计的滤波器类型。

In the next five minutes, I want to give you some insight into how you can build different kinds of impedances. And I won’t go into too much detail but give some insight into how you can get a sense for the kind of filters you want to design.

或者，至少，给定一个滤波器，你如何快速了解它是什么类型的滤波器、它的性能如何、它的频率响应是什么等等。而这一次，这个直觉将是为了纪念 Umans。回到我们的 Bend it Like Beckham 系列，我称之为“像 Umans 一样释放”。

Or, at the very least, given a filter, how can you very quickly get some insight into what kind of filter it is, how it performs, what its frequency response is and so on. And, this time around, this piece of intuition will be in honor of Umans. And back to our Bend it Like Beckham series, I call this “Unleash it like Umans”.

该领域的专家所做的是，他们不会坐在那里写微分方程，而是利用大量洞察力来解决这些问题。因此，为了纪念乌曼斯，我将把这个命名为“像乌曼斯一样释放它”。让我们深入了解一下各种元素的响应是什么样的。举个例子，我有一些阻抗 Z。

What experts in the field do is they don’t go about sitting around writing differential equations, but rather use a lot of insight into how to solve these things. And so in honor of Umans, I will label this unleash it like Umans. Let’s get some insight into how the response of various elements look like. Let’s take, for example, I have some impedance Z.

假设这可能是一个电阻器，也可能是一个电感器或电容器。让我们看看这些元件的频率响应是什么样的。换句话说，Z 本身的频率依赖性是什么？让我绘制每个元件的阻抗与频率的关系图。让我取它们的阻抗的绝对值。注意，它是一个复数。

Let’s say this could be a resistor, it could be an inductor or it could be a capacitor. Let’s take a look at what the frequency response of just these elements look like. In other words, what are the frequency dependents of Z itself? Let me just plot the impedance of each of these elements as a function of frequency. Let me just take the absolute value of their impedance. Notice that it’s a complex number.

对于电感器，它是 j omega L。让我取该情况下的绝对值 omega L 并为您绘制。并用它来获得一些见解。让我们先做一个简单的例子。如果 Z 是电阻值 R，那么无论频率如何，我的值都是 R。

For the inductor it’s j omega L. And let me take the absolute value omega L in that case and plot it for you. And use that to develop some insight. Let’s do a simple case first. If Z is a resistance of value R then no matter what the frequency my value is going to be R.

如果我有一个电感器，其阻抗将为 j omega L，因此我将 omega L 作为其阻抗。其依赖性简单地说，对于低 omega，阻抗非常小。对于 omega 零，阻抗为零，并且它随 omega 线性增加。因此，电感器为 omega L。随着频率的增加，阻抗线性增加。那么对于电容器呢？

If I have an inductor of value L then the impedance is going to look like j omega L, and so I am going to omega L for that. And the dependence of that simply says that for low omega the impedance is very small. For omega zero the impedance is zero and it increases linearly with omega. So, it’s omega L for the inductor. Impedance increases linerally as I increase the frequency. What about for the capacitor?

对于电容器，阻抗是 1 除以 j omega C。因此，我得到了与 omega C 相关的依赖关系。这意味着对于非常高的频率，阻抗非常低，但对于非常低的频率，阻抗非常高，我得到的行为模式类似于此。它以 1 除以 omega C。由于 omega 非常大，我的阻抗非常小。

For the capacitor, the impedance is one divided by j omega C. And so, therefore, I get the dependence being related to omega C. Which says that for very high frequencies impedance is very low, but for very low frequencies the impedance is very high and I get a behavior pattern that looks something like this. It goes as one by omega C. As omega is very large, my impedance is very small.

如果欧米茄非常小，我的阻抗就会趋向于开路。这并不奇怪。你以前就知道这个，对吧？电容器的行为就像直流电的开路。电感器的行为就像直流电的短路。请注意，这里的零频率对应于直流电。电容器看起来像直流电的开路，阻抗非常高。电感器看起来像直流电的短路，阻抗非常低。

If omega is very small, my impedance goes towards that of an open circuit. This is not surprising. You’ve known this before, right? That a capacitor behaves like an open circuit for DC. An inductor behaves like a short circuit for DC. Notice that zero frequency here corresponds to DC. The capacitor looks like an open circuit for DC, very high impedance. The inductor looks like a short circuit for DC, very low impedance.

在非常高的频率下，情况正好相反。虽然 R 始终是常数。让我们利用这一点来深入了解我们的电路可能是什么样子。让我来举个例子。假设我有一个 Vi，我测量电阻上的响应。因此，我测量 Vr 除以 Vi，取绝对值，看看它会是什么样子。

And the opposite is true at very high frequencies. While R is a constant throughout. Let’s use this to build some insight into how our circuits might look. Let me do this example. Let’s say I have a Vi and I measure the response across the resistor. So, I measure Vr divided by Vi and take the absolute value and take a look at how it’s going to look like.

我希望你帮我看一下这个，帮我看看响应会是什么样子。我们以极高的频率为例。在非常高的频率下，这个频率非常高，电容器在非常高的频率下是什么样子的？它是开路还是短路？短路。在非常高的频率下，电容器看起来像短路。

I want you to stare at this for me and help me with what the response is going to look like. Let’s take incredibly high frequencies. At very high frequencies, this has a very high frequency, what do the capacitor look like to very high frequencies? Is it an open or is it a short? A short circuit. At very high frequencies the capacitor looks like a short circuit.

然后 Vi 就会出现在电阻上，这意味着在非常高的频率下，输出非常接近输入。在非常低的频率下会发生什么？在非常低的频率下，电容器看起来像是开路。如果这看起来像是开路，那么这个电阻上的电压降会很小，因为大部分电压都会降到电容器上。

Then Vi simply appears across the resistor, which means that at very high frequencies the output is very close to the input. At very low frequencies what happens? At very low frequencies the capacitor looks like an open circuit. If this looks like an open circuit then very little voltage will drop across this resistor here because most of it is going to drop across the capacitor.

会发生的情况是，对于非常低的值，我将在这里查看一些东西。因此，我的响应看起来像这样。这与您之前看到的形式不同。在这种情况下，我通过高频但衰减低频。毫不奇怪，这被称为高通滤波器。

What is going to happen is, for very low values, I am going to be looking at something out here. And, because of that, my response looks like this. And this is of a different form than the one you saw earlier. In this case, I pass high frequencies but attenuate low frequencies. Not surprisingly, this is called a high pass filter.

您需要开始能够从高频和低频特性的角度来思考电容器和电感器。而且，如果您培养了这种直觉，一旦您形成了关于电容器和电感器及其频率关系的直觉，那将是 002 的一大进步。如果您获得了这种洞察力，那么您将在了解如何解决问题和能够快速绘制响应方面取得长足进步。是的。

You need to begin to be able to think about capacitors and inductors in terms of their high and low frequency properties. And, if you develop that intuition, once you develop the intuition about capacitors and inductors and their frequency relationship, that will be a big step forward in 002. If you get that insight, you will go a long way in terms of knowing how to tackle problems and being able to quickly sketch responses. Yes.

在这种情况下，如果我们得到类似 j omega L 的东西，你可以做的就是在 omega 趋于零时取极限。如果是 omega L，那么请注意它将开始呈线性。另一方面，如果当获得非常高的频率时，例如，如果你得到 omega C 的东西，那么这是一个双曲关系，所以它会继续看起来像这样。

In the case of, if we get something like j omega L, what you can do is take the limit as omega goes to zero. If it is omega L then notice that it is going to start linear. And, on the other hand, if when you get very high frequencies, for example, if you get one by something omega C then this is a hyperbolic relationship, so it is going to go ahead looking like this.

因此，您可以查看这些函数在非常低的值时的样子，看看它们在那个点的样子。好的。我想为您绘制的下一个是这样的。例如，假设我有一个电感器 L 和一个电阻器 R，我想看看它们是什么样子。在这个特定示例中，我有 H，取绝对值。

So, you can take a look at a lot of these functions at their very low values and see how they look like at that point. All right. The next one I would like to draw for you is something that looks like this. Let’s say, for example, I have an inductor L and a resistor R and I want to see what that looks like. In this particular example, I have H, take the absolute value.

那么，这会是什么样子呢？我要看看这里的电阻值。在这里，我会发现，在非常低的频率下，这个家伙是短路的。由于这个家伙是短路的，所以电阻上的所有电压都会下降，所以它看起来会像这样。

So, what is this going to look like? I am going to look at the value across the resistor here. Here what I am going to find is that at very low frequencies this guy is a short circuit. Since this guy is a short circuit, all the voltage drops across the resistor so it’s going to look like this.

在非常高的频率下，我会发现电感器看起来像是开路。因此，所有电压几乎都会在电感器上下降。它将是 R 除以某个值加上欧米茄 L。因此，在高频下，这个家伙会逐渐减小到零，看起来像这样。这又回到了我的低通滤波器。

And, at very high frequencies, what I am going to find is that the inductor is going to appear like an open circuit. And so, therefore, all the voltage is going to pretty much drop across the inductor. It will be R divided by something plus omega L. So, at high frequencies this guy is going to taper off to zero and is going to look like this. And this is back to my low pass filter.

回到之前的问题，你怎么知道它是什么样子的？我可以很快写下 j omega 的 H 表达式。如果这是 VR，这仅仅是 R 除以 R 加上。VR 仅仅是 R 除以 j omega C 的 1。我在分子和分母中将其乘以 j omega C。

Just to go back to a question asked earlier, how do you know what this looks like? I can very quickly write down the expression for H of j omega. This is simply going to be R divided by R plus if this is VR. VR is simply R divided by one by j omega C. I multiply it out by j omega C in the numerator and the denominator.

我要在这里找到 j omega C，然后我要在这里得到 j omega C 的 1。而像这样的事情将会发生，当 omega 变得非常小的时候，我会忽略它。当 omega 变得非常小的时候，我可以忽略它，然后我得到 R j omega C。考虑到这一点，我在这里画的是正确的还是错误的？

I’m going to find j omega C here and I am going to get one by j omega C here. And what is going to happen with something like this is that as omega becomes very small then I am going to ignore this. When omega becomes very small, I can ignore this with respect to one, and I get R j omega C. Given that, is what I’ve drawn here correct or wrong?

这对 1 来说就消失了。剩下的是 R j omega C，对吗？对于非常低的频率。根据我在这里画的，这是正确的还是错误的？嗯，很难说。对于非常非常低的频率，它一开始是线性的，因为它是欧米茄关系，然后它像这样上升，然后就消失了。让我再举一个例子。

This goes away with respect to one. I am left with R j omega C, right? For very low frequencies. Given what I have drawn here, is that correct or is that wrong? Well, it’s hard to say. For very, very low frequencies it starts out being linear because it’s an omega relationship, and then it goes up like this and then goes out there. Let me go onto another example.

让我再举一个例子，比如我需要确保我不会犯错。如果我得到 R j omega C 乘以 R j omega C，你知道吗，这最终会成为一个一阶系统，所以看起来会像这样。我把它搞砸了。回到这里的这个系统。

Let me do another example here which is something like I need to make sure I don’t make a mistake here. If I get R j omega C by R j omega C, you know what, this ends up being a first order system, and so is going to look like this. I blew it there. Back to this system here.

如果我有一个 L 和一个 R，我查看这个方程来查看 L 上发生了什么，您可以再次绘制它。对于非常低的频率，这里的振幅为零，对于非常高的频率，这将是一个开路，因此响应将看起来像这样。这最终将成为您的高通滤波器。

If I have an L and an R and I look at this equation to look at what happens across L, you can plot that again. And for very low frequencies it is going to be zero amplitude here and for very high frequencies this is going to be an open circuit, and so the response is going to look something like this. That’s going to end up being your high pass filter.

再举一个例子，我想做一个串联 RLC 电路，并试着让你了解一下输出是什么样子的。让我们利用我们的直觉，首先写下它是什么样子的，然后去做一些数学运算，看看数学运算是否符合我们的直觉告诉我们的。我想绘制 Vr 相对于 Vi 的图。我想在那里绘制它。

As another example, I would like to do a series RLC circuit and try to get you some sense of what that output looks like. Let’s use our intuition and first write down what this looks like and then go and do some math and see if the math corresponds to what our intuition tells us. I want to plot Vr with respect to Vi. I want to plot it there.

对于这样的情况，在非常低的频率下会发生什么？我们只是想非常粗略地了解这张图会是什么样子。非常粗略地了解这张图会是什么样子。假设我取的是 VR 两端的电压，在非常低的频率下会发生什么？在极低的频率下，电感器看起来像短路，而电容器看起来像开路。

For something like this, what happens at very low frequencies? We are just looking to get very, very crudely what this graph is going to look like. Very, very crudely what this graph is going to look like. Given that I am taking the voltage across VR, what happens at very low frequencies? At incredibly low frequencies, the inductor looks like a short circuit, but the capacitor looks like open circuit.

开路与短路串联，短路最终看起来像开路。因此，我的所有电压都落在 VR 上。现在，在非常高的频率下会发生什么？在非常高的频率下，电容器看起来像是短路。但是电​​感器现在看起来像是开路，对吗？只需记住，电容器在高频下是短路，电感器在高频下是开路。因此，这最终具有非常高的阻抗。

An open circuit in series with a short circuit that ends up looking like an open circuit. And so, therefore, all my voltage falls across VR. Now, what happens at very high frequencies? At very high frequencies the capacitor looks like a short. But the inductor looks like an open circuit now for very high frequencies, correct? Just remember, capacitor is short for high frequencies inductor open for high frequencies. So, this ends up having a very high impedance.

在非常高的频率下，这个家伙的阻抗非常高。因此，对于高频率值，我最终会以这种方式进行。这种行为在这里具有电容器的效果。对于非常高的频率，我得到电感器的效果。因此，这意味着我在低频时具有非常低的值，在高频时具有非常低的值。并且，随着频率的增加，我会做类似的事情。

At very high frequencies this guy has a very high impedance. And, because of that, for a high value of frequency, I end up going in that manner. This behavior has the effect of the capacitor here. And for very high frequencies I get the effect of the inductor. And so this means that I have very low values for low frequencies, very low values for high frequencies. And, as the frequency increases, I do something like this.

我不断增加，然后电感开始发挥作用，然后我再次逐渐减小。这种滤波器可以消除低频和高频并传递中频，称为带通滤波器，BPF。这意味着它传递某个频段的频率。让我们通过写下方程式来对此进行更深入的了解。因此，Vr 除以 Vi 就是 R。

I keep building up, then the inductor begins to play a role, and then I taper off again. This kind of a filter where I kill low and high frequencies and pass intermediate frequencies is called a band pass filter, BPF. This means that it passes frequencies in some band. Let’s get some more insight on this by writing down the equations. So, Vr divided by Vi is simply R.

使用阻抗关系，它是 R 除以 j omega L 加上一除以 j omega C 加上 R。我稍后会用到这个等式，所以让我把它藏在我的堆栈上，并在那里做一点标记。我将在整个过程中乘以 j omega C。

Using the impedance relation it is R divided by j omega L plus one divided by j omega C plus R. I am going to use this equation later, so let me stash it away on my stack and put a little notation there. I am going to multiply throughout by j omega C.

我最终得到的结果是 j omega RC 除以 1 加上 R j omega RC，然后这里，我得到 j 乘以 j 为负 1，所以我得到了负 omega 平方。让我这样重写它。我得到了负 omega 平方。所以，j 为负 1，omega 乘以 omega 等于 omega 平方，然后我得到了 LC。这就是我最终得到的结果。

And what I end up getting is j omega RC divided by one plus R j omega RC, and then here, I get j times j is minus one, so I get minus omega squared. Let me rewrite it this way. I get minus omega squared. So, j is minus one, omega times omega is omega squared, and then I get an LC. That’s what I end up getting.

如果我在这里取绝对值，我最终会得到，回到你的复数代数，这个实数平方加上虚数平方的平方根。所以，一减欧米伽平方 LC 加上欧米伽 RC 平方。这是从哪里来的，你可以在课程笔记中的复数代数附录中查找它。

And if I take the absolute value here, I end up getting, back to your complex algebra, the square root of this real value squared plus imaginary value squared. So, one minus omega squared LC plus omega RC squared. This is from, you can look it up in your complex algebra appendix in the course notes.

这里只是 omega RC，然后是实值的平方加上虚值的平方，然后取平方根。通过观察这个，你会注意到你意识到了一个非常重要的属性。当 omega 等于 LC 时。对不起。当 omega 等于一除以 LC 时，会发生什么？对不起，LC 的平方根。当 omega 等于一除以 LC 的平方根时，omega 平方乘以 LC 等于一。

It’s simply omega RC here, then square of the real value plus the square of the imaginary value, and take the square root of that. By staring at this, you can notice that you realize a really important property. When omega equals LC. I’m sorry. When omega equals one divided by LC, what happens? Sorry, square root of LC. When omega is one divided by square root of LC then omega squared times LC becomes one.

当这是真的时，它就变成 1，1 加 1 就抵消了。不仅如此，当它们抵消时，这两个在那个点上也抵消了，所以我最终得到一个 1，这意味着当 omega 等于 omega 时，零等于 1 乘以 LC 的平方根，我最终得到一个值为 1 的值。这真是太神奇了。

When this is true then this becomes one, and one and one cancel out. And, not only that, when these cancel out, these two cancel out at that point, so I end up getting a one, which means that when omega equals omega nought equals one by square root of LC and I end up getting a value that is one. It’s pretty amazing.

这意味着，如果我以 omega 零驱动它，如果我的正弦波具有 omega 零频率，其中 omega 零是 LC 的平方根之一，如果我坐在这里，右边是一个黑匣子，我以 omega 零等于 LC 平方根之一的频率驱动它，整个电路对我来说是什么样子的？我坐在那里，黑匣子在这里。

Which means that if I drive this at omega nought, if my sinusoid has a frequency omega nought where omega nought is one by square root of LC, if I’m sitting here and this is a black box on the right hand side, and I drive this at a frequency omega nought equals one divided by square root of LC, what does this entire circuit look like to me? I’m sitting there, the black box here.

我以 omega 零驱动它，等于 LC 的平方根 1，频率为该频率。那个电路是什么样子的？是的。它看起来像一个电阻器。这非常神奇。这意味着，即使我这里有一个 L 和一个 C，如果我碰巧以 omega 零驱动它，那么电路看起来就是纯电阻的，它似乎给我在输出端出现的相同输入。

I’m driving it at omega nought equals one by square root of LC at that frequency. What does that circuit look like? Yes. It looks like a resistor. It’s pretty amazing. It means that even though I have an L and a C here, if I happen to drive this at omega nought then the circuit looks purely resistive and it seems to give me the same input appearing at the output.

换句话说，这两者的效果相互抵消。这个方面称为在谐振点驱动电路。谐振是指在 LC 的 0 乘以 1 的平方根时驱动电路。

In other words, the effect of these two cancels out. And that aspect is called driving the circuit at its resonance point. Resonance is when you’re driving the circuit at omega nought equals one by a square root of LC.

草图

Sketches

我将很快为您概述几种观察电路的其他方法。

I will very quickly sketch for you a couple of other ways of looking at circuits.

假设我在这里查看这个值 Vlc，我查看电感器和电容器两端的值，频率响应会是什么样子？我正在查看串联电感器和电容器两端的电压。让我们看看。让我们回到我们通常的口头禅。当你这样做时想想史蒂夫·乌曼斯。他会怎么做？他会说啊哈，在非常低的频率下，电容器看起来像一个开路。

Supposing I looked at this value here, Vlc, I looked at the value across the inductor and the capacitor, what will the frequency response look like? I am looking at the voltage across the inductor and the capacitor in series. Let’s see. Let’s go back to our usual mantra. Think about Steve Umans when you do this. What would he do? He would say ah ha, at very low frequencies the capacitor is going to look like an open circuit.

在我的分压器中，我测量的是开路两端的电压，因此整个 Vi 必须跨电感器和电容器下降。同样，在非常高的频率下，电感器现在看起来像一个开路，所以它看起来像这样。在非常高的频率下，电感器是一个开路。而且，我再次查看跨近无限电阻阻抗的分压器，因此我在这里也得到了一个高值。

In my voltage divider, I am measuring the voltage across an open circuit, so the entire Vi must drop across the inductor and capacitor. Similarly, at very high frequencies the inductor looks like an open circuit now, so it looks like this. At very high frequencies inductor is an open circuit. And, again, I’m looking at the voltage divider across the near infinite resistance, impedance, so I get a high value here as well.

好吧，在中间，值会下降，我得到了类似这样的结果。所以，这个东西叫做带阻滤波器。在这里，我可以确定任何特定的频率，只要频率大致落在那个范围内。还有一个例子。我研究这么多例子的原因是，对于专家来说，他们所做的大部分工作就是查看电路，然后给出一个粗略的形式。

Well, in the middle the value dips and I get something like this. So, this thing is called a band stop filter. Here I can nail any specific frequency, as long as the frequency falls in roughly that regime. Yet another example. The reason I’m working on so many examples is that to experts, a large part of what they do is look at a circuit and boom, give a rough form of how it looks like.

这可以帮你完成大部分工作。它看起来怎么样？如果我取电压 Vo 与 Vi，我们来看看。在非常低的频率下，电感器看起来像短路，对吗？我说的是短路两端的电压，所以它看起来像这样。

That can get you half the way there in most of what you’re going to do. How did this look like? If I take the voltage Vo versus Vi, let’s take a look. At very low frequencies, the inductor looks like a short circuit, correct? I am talking the voltage across a short circuit, so it looks like this.

在非常高的频率下，我会在并联组合上取电压，但电容器现在是短路。所以，它看起来像一个电容器。这看起来像是一个电感器，而这是一个在这里占主导地位的电容器。因此，在中间某处，它会像这样上升和下降。所以，它是一个带通滤波器。

At very high frequencies, I am taking a voltage across a parallel combination, but the capacitor is now a short circuit. So, that looks like a capacitor. This looks like an inductor out here and this is a capacitor holding sway here. And so, somewhere in the middle it goes up and comes down like that. So, it’s a band pass filter.

令人惊奇的是，你可以采用相当复杂的电路，只需快速分析在极低频率下发生的情况，在极高频率下发生的情况，你就可以粗略地勾勒出响应。除此之外，你应该做的是，如果它是二阶电路，就假设它会在其共振频率处做一些有趣的事情，在 LC 的欧米茄零等于一的平方根处。

What is amazing is that you can take fairly complicated circuits, and just by doing a quick analysis of what happens at very low frequencies, what happens at very high frequencies, you can roughly sketch the response. And then what you should do, in addition to that, is if it’s a second order circuit, just assume that it’s going to do something interesting at its resonance frequency, at omega nought equals one by square root of LC.

有趣的事情即将发生。看看吧。对于一阶电路，RC 或 RL，重要的数字是时间常数 RC。通常，当你以 1 乘以 RC 驱动它时，欧米茄等于 1 乘以 RC，那么你最终得到的值往往是 1 乘以平方根 2 乘以我们在此处查看的电路中的输入值。

Something interesting is going to happen. Check it out. And for circuits that are first order, RC or RL, the important number is the time constant RC. Usually, when you’re driving it at one by RC, omega equals one by RC then what happens is that you often times end up getting a value that is one by square root two times the input value in the circuits we looked at here.

接下来，我要讲一下滤波器的一个主要应用。那就是 AM 接收器。让我花 30 秒讲解一下无线电 101。

Next, what I am going to do is talk about a major, major application of filters. And that is an AM receiver. Let me do Radios 101 for 30 seconds.

收音机

Radios

这些家伙有天线。你在这里接地。你在天线上接收信号。这里也有隐含的接地。你要做的第一件事就是现在开始处理信号。

These guys have an antenna. You take a ground here. You pick up a signal at your antenna. There is an implied ground as well. And what you do, as a first step, is you begin processing the signal now.

我们在这里放置了一个小滤波器，它看起来就像这样。它是一个并联的电感器和一个电容器。这个电容器实际上是你的调谐器，你可以用它来调谐无线电频率。然后你在这里需要进行一系列其他处理，最后得到扬声器。

What we place right there is a little filter that looks like this. It is a inductor and a capacitor in parallel. And this capacitor is really your tuner that you can tune to radio frequencies. And then what you have here is a bunch of other processing and end up with your speaker.

这里发生的处理是，你有一个解调器、一个放大器和一堆其他东西，我们现在不必担心它们。我们在这里做的是天线接收信号。所以，从某种意义上说，这部分电路是你的源。我可以用它的戴维南等效电路替换它，如下所示。所以，你的收音机的前端看起来像 Vi、R、L 和 C。

And the processing that happens here is you have a demodulator, you have an amplifier and a bunch of other things that let’s not worry about them for now. What we do here is the antenna picks up a signal. So, in some sense, this part of the circuit here is your source. I could replace it with its Thevenin equivalent as follows. So, the front end of your radio looks like a Vi, R, L and a C.

你以前在哪里见过这个？就在那里。那是收音机的前端。让我告诉你为什么我需要收音机中的带通滤波器。生活的工作方式如下。我有自己的频率。现在让我用千赫兹而不是弧度来做这件事，让我绘制你的无线电信号强度。

Where have you seen this before? Right there. That’s the front end of radios. Let me tell you why I need a band pass filter in a radio out here. The way life works is as follows. I have my frequency. Let me do this not in radians but in kilohertz for now, and let me plot your radio signal strength.

在波士顿地区，信号范围在 540 千赫到 1600 千赫之间。在某些地区，我们已经开始为一些新电台使用 1700 额外波段。这是感兴趣的频率范围。如果你看看你的收音机调谐器，你会看到 540 千赫一直到 1600 千赫，你可以调谐你的 AM 收音机。

In the Boston area, the signals go between 540 kilohertz and they go all the way to 1600 kilohertz. In some areas we have begun to use the 1700 extra band as well for some new stations. This is the frequency range of interest. If you look at your radio tuner, you will see 540 kilohertz all the way up to 1600 and you can tune your AM radio.

它的工作原理是，每个电台在这里都有 10 千赫兹的频谱。因此，这是 1000 千赫兹、1010 千赫兹等等。每个电台都在该点的正负 5 千赫兹范围内传输信号。这个电台在这里传输，这个电台在这里传输，等等。这是 1030。对于收听 WBZ 新闻广播的人来说，这就是 1030。

The way it works is that each station is given 10 kilohertz of spectrum here. And so, this is at 1000 kilohertz, 1010 kilohertz and so on. And each station transmits its signal in plus or minus 5 kilohertz around that point. And this station transmits it here and this station transmits it here and so on. This is 1030. This guy is WBZ News Radio 1030, for those of you who listen to it.

实际情况是，在 10 千赫兹时，每个电台都会收到 10 千赫兹，因此 WBZ 在 1030 左右以 10 千赫兹的频率传输。请注意，电台传输的每个信号都发生在小波段内。现在，您将学到更多关于调制的知识，以及如何让信号进入小波段等等。

What happens is that at 10 kilohertz, each station gets 10 kilohertz, and so WBZ transmits in the 10 kilohertz around 1030. Notice that each of these signals transmitted by radio stations happen within small bands. Now, you will learn a lot more about modulation and how do you get a signal to go in a small band and all that stuff.

您将在 6.003 中学习到这一点。现在，不要担心我是如何做到这一切的。您如何收听该电台？收听该电台的方法是在这里放置一个低通滤波器。您放置一个低通滤波器，它可以执行以下操作。假设我想听 WBZ 1030。如果我将整个信号通过该滤波器。

You will learn about that in 6.003. For now, don’t worry about how I did all of this. How do you listen to that station? The way you listen to that station is you put a low pass filter here. You put a low pass filter that does the following. Let’s say I want to hear WBZ 1030. If I pass this entire signal through that filter.

如果我安排将滤波器的 omega 零点设置在 1030。如果我可以安排将 omega 零点设置在 1030，那么这就是我的滤波器的响应。我要选出这个，然后剪掉其他一切。我只得到这个。让我们听一会儿这个电台。所以，你可以看到我可以调到 WBUL 电台。

And if I arrange to have the omega nought of my filter at 1030. If I can arrange to have the omega nought at 1030 then this is the response of my filter. And I am going to pick out this guy and cut out everything else. I am just going to get this. Let’s listen to the station for some time. So, you can see I can tune to the station WBUL.

Lec 19 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 19 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 52:32 https://youtube.com/watch?v=V0z_f7qxLcY

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 52:32 https://youtube.com/watch?v=V0z_f7qxLcY

介绍

Introduction

好的。大家早上好。今天我们将开启我们工作的另一个新篇章。主题是我们将讨论一种称为运算放大器的东西。在我开始讲课之前，我想指出几件事。第一，你们将在今天的讲座中听到两个大词。两个大而非常重要的词。

All right. Good morning all. Today we embark on another new chapter in what we do. And the topic is going to be We will talk about this thing called an Operational Amplifier. Before I get into the lecture, I want to point out a couple of things. One is that you are going to hear about two big words in today’s lecture. Two big and incredibly important words.

我现在想向你们提及这些词，这样当我在讲座中提到它们时，你们可以说，好吧，我最好非常仔细地听，这些都是重要的词。好的。其中一个是抽象。第二个是反馈。两个非常重要的概念。

And I want to mention those words to you right now so that when I come to them in lecture you can say OK, I better pay really close attention, these are important words. All right. One of them is abstraction. The second one is feedback. Two incredibly important concepts.

在本课程中，您已经多次看到过抽象，一次是在开始时，我们通过专注于较小的操场抽象出麦克斯韦方程，并简单地使用 KVL、KCL 代替这些方程。一个很大的抽象。事实证明，几乎所有 EECS 都基于不同级别的抽象。在第一堂课中，我还向您展示了我们构建的一层又一层的抽象，以便能够构建有趣的系统。

Abstraction, you have been seeing a couple times during this course, once in the beginning where we abstracted out Maxwell’s equations by focusing on a smaller playground and simply using KVL, KCL in place of those equations. A big abstraction. It turns out that almost all of EECS is based upon abstractions at various levels. In the first lecture, I also showed you the layer upon layer of abstraction that we built to be able to build interesting systems.

第二件大事是反馈。我将把它与汽车防抱死制动系统联系起来。所以，你可以等着看我们如何做到这一点。这是一个非常重要的概念。在我们深入讨论放大器抽象之前，让我先谈谈你所知道的事情。从你知道的东西开始，然后介绍运算放大器及其电路。你知道 MOSFET 放大器。

The second big thing is feedback. And I am going to relate this to anti lock breaks in cars. And so, you can wait and see how we do that. It’s an incredibly important concept. Before we dive into the amplifier abstraction, let me first talk about something that you know. Start with something that you know and then lead up into the operational amplifier and its circuits. You know about the MOSFET amplifier.

MOSFET 放大器

MOSFET Amplifier

您所知道的 MOSFET 放大器看起来是这样的。它基于 MOSFET。有一个 VS 电源。有一个 vI 输入、一个 vO 输出，以及我所说的 VS 电源。所以，这是一个您之前见过的 MOSFET 电路。一种查看方法是，该电路有三个主要端口。这是带有电压 vI 的输入端口。

The MOSFET amplifier that you know about looked like this. It was based on a MOSFET. There was a VS supply. There was a vI input, a vO output and, as I said, a VS supply. So, this was a MOSFET circuit that you’ve seen before. One way of viewing this is that this circuit has three major ports. This here is the input port with voltage vI.

这里，漏极端子和地线之间是输出端口。我将输出端接在漏极端子和地线之间。最后，我们还有第三个端口，也就是这个。它被称为电源端口。我将 VS 接在漏极端子和地线之间。这样我们就得到了电源端口。这里的设备是一个三端口设备。输入端口或控制端口、输出端口和电源端口。

This here, between the drain terminal and the ground, is the output port. I take the output between the drain terminal and ground. And, finally, we have a third port, which is this one. It is called the power port. I apply VS between this terminal here and the ground terminal. And that gives us the power port. This device here was a three port device. Input port or control port, output port and a power port.

因此，我们查看了电路并对其进行了大量分析。那么我现在能做的就是，既然您已经看到了这一点，那么考虑将其抽象成某种构建块通常很有趣。就像在软件中一样，您编写一个过程，然后在过程声明和您进行的调用中抽象出过程的内部细节。

And so we looked at the circuit and did a whole bunch of analyses of it. Then what I can do at this point, now that you’ve seen this, it’s often times interesting to think about abstracting this out into some kind of a building block. Much like in software, you write a procedure and you abstract out the internal details of the procedure in the procedure declaration and in the call that you make.

同样，我们可以把这个小设备抽象成以下抽象。我们可以把它抽象成如下所示的设备。我有输入端口、输出端口和电源端口。因此，我可以在这里应用 VS。请注意，我在这里取了这六个端子，一、二、三、四、五和六，并在它们周围放了一个盒子。

In the same way, we can take this little device here and abstract that out into the following abstraction. We could abstract that out as a device that looks like this. I have my input port, I have my output port and I have my power port. So, I can apply VS here. Notice that I’ve taken these six terminals here, one, two, three, four, five and six, and put a box around it.

只需向您展示终端即可。我需要告诉您更多关于内部属性的信息，但只需说您可以开始使用这个小块即可。对于许多应用程序来说，更简单的版本可能看起来就像这样，vI 和 vO，其中有一个共享的接地，这在图中是隐含的。

And just exposed the terminals to you. And I need to tell you a little bit more about the internal properties, but suffice it to say that you can begin working with this little block. An even simpler version of this for many applications might just look like this, vI and vO where there is a ground that is shared among them that is implicit in this picture.

而 vI 和 vO 可以简单地表示这些节点处的节点电压。这是该放大器的逐渐抽象的表示。我们可以做的是，只要我们知道，我们就可以抽象出该块的相关属性并将它们暴露在外部。相关属性可能是，假设这里的属性可能是 I in 始终为零。我还可以向您表达该放大器的增益。

And vI and vO can simply be the node voltages at these nodes. This is a progressively more abstract representation of this amplifier. What we can do is, provided we know, we can abstract out the relevant properties of this block and expose them outside. And the relevant properties might well be that, let’s say here the properties may be that I in is always zero. I can also express to you the gain of this amplifier.

我可能还会告诉你输出的戴维南等效公式。我可以给你一些属性，让你可以抽象地使用这个构建块。今天，我们要做的是介绍一种放大器类型的强大抽象。

I may also be able to tell you the Thevenin equivalent for the output. There are some properties that I can give you that will let you use this building block abstractly. Today, what we will do is introduce a powerful abstraction of a type of amplifier.

运算放大器

Operational Amplifier

这被称为运算放大器，或简称“运放”。

This is called the operational amplifier or “op amp” for short.

我要做的是给你一个比我在这里展示的稍微复杂一点的构建块。但可以说，这个想法是一样的。这个构建块看起来像这样。这个构建块有一个输入端口。这个构建块还有一个用于连接电源的端口或电源端口。

What I am going to do is give you a slightly more involved building block than the one I have shown you there. But suffice it to say that the idea is going to be the same. This building block looks like this. This building block has an input port. This building block also has a port in which to connect power or the power port.

我连接电源的方式是，在这里连接一个正 VS 电源。这将是我的接地节点。我将在这里连接一个负 VS 电源。因此，这两个电压都是 VS。我想在这里应用一个正 VS，在这里应用一个负 VS。

And the way I am going to connect power, I am going to connect a plus VS supply here. That is going to be my ground node. And I am going to connect a minus VS supply to this node here. So, these voltages are both VS. I want to apply a plus VS here and a negative VS out here.

我将把运算放大器的接地节点和输出节点之间的输出称为 vO。这是输出端口。因此，输入端口、输出端口和电源端口。将其视为一种模式，其中我有一个输入端口，我将输入连接到该端口。

And I am going to take the output between the ground node and the output node of the operational amplifier and call that a vO. This is the output port. So, input port and output port and a power port. Think of this as a pattern where I have an input port across which I connect the input.

我有一个电源端口，我通过它连接正 VS 和负 VS 电源，然后我接上输出端和接地端（由我的电路的外部元件定义），并将其用作参考节点。请记住，接地只是一个参考节点。我将使用它作为参考节点。这两个幅度相等。并将其作为我的输出。

I have a power port across which I connect a plus VS, minus VS supply, and then I take the output terminal and take a ground terminal, which is defined by external components of my circuitry, and use this as my reference node. Remember ground is just a reference node. I am going to use this as a reference node. These two are equal in magnitude. And take this as my output.

当我做这样的事情时，我可以构建一个更简单的，所以这是一个抽象的差分输入放大器。换句话说，这个放大器将放大我在输入端应用的任何东西。这个更抽象的表示看起来像这样。vOUT 和加/减 vIN。这是一个更抽象的表示，请记住，我们将一次又一次地画出它，在本课程中可能至少画 38 或 39 次。

And when I do something like this, I can build an even simpler, so this is an abstract differential input amplifier. In other words, this amplifier is going to amplify whatever I apply at the input. A slightly more abstract representation of this looks like this. vOUT and plus/minus vIN. This is a slightly more abstract representation where, remember, we are going to draw this again and again, maybe at least 38 or 39 times in this course.

请记住，每次绘制时，请记住有一个隐式电源端口，即连接的正/负电源，但我们没有显示出来。我记得很久以前我第一次了解它时，一开始我感到很困惑。它是如何工作的？电源从哪里来？只需记住，电源来自正/负电源，而我们只是没有在这个抽象中显示出来。

And, remember, each time you draw it, remember that there is an implicit power port, a plus/minus supply that is connected which we don’t show. And I remember when I first learned about it a long time ago there was a confusion in me initially. How does this work? Where is the power coming from? Just remember that power comes from a plus/minus supply, and we just don’t show that in this abstraction.

现在，很多细节都在课程笔记的第 16 章中。这就是阅读材料。另外，这款放大器还有一些其他关键特性。让我快速讨论一下这些特性。

Now, the details, a lot of details are in Chapter 16 of your course notes. That’s the reading for that. The other thing is that there are some other key properties of this amplifier. And let me discuss those very quickly.

理想放大器

Ideal Amplifier

首先，我可以画一个放大器的电路模型。这里留出一些空间。这是我们所说的理想运算放大器的电路模型。

First of all, I can draw a circuit model for the amplifier. Make some room for myself here. And this is a circuit model for what we call the ideal operational amplifier.

电路模型看起来会像这样。这是一个抽象设备。为了分析它在电路中的行为，我将向你展示如下所示的抽象电路。一些输入 v 被应用到这两个端子上。这个端子称为我的 v 正端子，这称为我的 v 负端子，因此这对应于这两个端子。

And the circuit model is going to look like this. This is an abstract device. And, in terms of analyzing how this behaves in a circuit, I am going to show you this abstract circuit that looks as follows. Some input v is applied at these two terminals here. And this terminal is called my v plus terminal and this is called my v minus terminal, so this corresponds to these two terminals.

我告诉你，流入的电流将为零，因此 I plus 将为零，I minus 将为零。I plus 是流入此处的电流，I minus 是流入 v minus 端子的电流，这两个电流在此设备中都将为零。输出将如下所示。

I am telling you that the current going in is going to be zero, so I plus is going to be zero and I minus is going to be zero. I plus is the current in here and I minus is the current into the v minus terminal, and both these currents are going to be zero in this device here. The output is going to look like this.

为了与此处保持一致，我将其称为 vOUT。并以地面为参考。输出只是 Av。换句话说，我要做的是将其建模为在其输出端具有从属源的设备。此处的从属源是电压控制的电压源。

Let me just call it vOUT to be consistent with this here. And taken with ground as my reference. The output is simply Av. In other words, what I am doing is I am going to model this as a device that has a dependent source at its output. And the dependent source here is a voltage controlled voltage source.

它是一个受控源，是一个电压控制的电压源，输出电压是输入电压 v 的 A 倍。这其实很简单。想想我在这里向你展示的这三个终端。我在这些终端上施加输入。输出将是 A 乘以我施加的值。A 将趋向于无穷大。A 将非常大。

It is a dependent source, it is a voltage controlled voltage source such that the output voltage is A times the voltage v across its input. This is actually very simple. Think of these three terminals I have shown you here. I applied input across these. And the output is going to be A times whatever I applied. And A is going to tend towards infinity. A is going to be huge.

A 的具体值可能是十万或一百万或诸如此类。在这个抽象的放大器中，A 是巨大的。除此之外，其他属性是它将具有无限的输入电阻。这意味着看起来就像一个开路。这里是开路的事实意味着这个端口上的输入电阻是无限的。这里的输出呢？记住，这是一个电压源。

And specific values for A might be a hundred thousand or a million or things of that sort. Huge A in this abstract amplifier. In addition to that, the other properties are that it is going to have infinite input resistance. That means looking in this looks like an open circuit. The fact that this is open here implies the infinite input resistance across this port. What about the output here? Remember, this is a voltage source.

而且我们的输出电阻为零，这意味着无论负载如何影响它，当我施加负载时，它都会表现得像一个理想的电压源，并根据我在此处建立的任何函数保持电压恒定。而且 A 几乎是无限的。让我在这里暂停几秒钟，仔细讨论一下，这样您就能理解什么是基本设备。

And we have a zero output resistance, which means that no matter how the load affects this, as I apply a load this is going to behave like an ideal voltage source and keep holding the voltage constant based on whatever the function I establish here. And A is virtually infinite. Let me pause there for a few seconds and just dwell on this so you just understand what the basic device is.

根据这个基本定义，我将构建一大堆有趣的小电路。分析将非常简单，但这是一个巨大的概念飞跃，因为里面有一些电路。包含电阻器、MOSFET，里面有一大堆东西。我不会告诉你里面有什么。

Following this basic definition, I am just going to build a whole bunch of fun little circuits. The analysis will be pretty straightforward, but this is a big conceptual leap here where there is some circuitry inside. Containing resistors, MOSFETs, a whole bunch of stuff in there. I am not telling you what is inside it.

就像我可以构建一个抽象的放大器一样，我可以把一个抽象的盒子放在你之前看到的放大器周围，我想把一个盒子放在一些电路周围。我没有告诉你电路是什么。如果你好奇，你应该看看你的课程笔记的第 581 页。

Much like I could build an abstract amplifier, I could put an abstract box around the amplifier you saw earlier, I want to put a box around some circuitry. I am not telling you what the circuitry is. And, if you are curious, you should look at page 581 of your course notes.

差分放大器

Differential Amplifier

有一个例子已经解决。该例子是差分放大器。这是小信号分析章节。

There is an example solved. The example is for a differential amplifier. This is the small signal analysis chapter.

在该示例中求解的差分放大器通常是运算放大器电路的第一级。该差分放大器是输入端的第一级。顾名思义，该差分放大器放大的不是单个电压，而是差分电压。请注意，这个放大器放大了这两个端子之间的电压差。这就是这里的 v。v 等于 v 加减 v 减。

That differential amplifier that’s solved in that example is usually the first stage in an operational amplifier circuit. That differential amplifier is the first stage at the input. And that differential amplifier, as the name implies, amplifies not a single voltage but amplifies a differential voltage. Note that this guy amplifies the voltage difference between these two terminals. That’s v here. And v is simply the same as v plus minus v minus.

它是此处的节点电压减去此处的节点电压。这就是被放大的。它放大了差值。因此，它被称为差分放大器或差动放大器。输入级就是运算放大器内部的部分。它还有一堆其他电路，如电平转换器等。输出端有一个缓冲器。

It’s the node voltage here minus the node voltage here. That is what’s amplified. It amplifies a difference. Therefore, it is called a difference amplifier or a differential amplifier. And so that input stage is what is inside the op amp. It’s got a bunch of other circuitry like level shifters and so on. And at the output it has got a buffer.

在输出端，它具有一些类似于源极跟随器电路的东西，您在复习课上学习过，在课堂笔记和家庭作业中也解决了一个例子。而且您在测验的第二题中也解决了源极跟随器的一个变体。因此，输出端出现了一个看起来像这样的电路。请记住，对于源极跟随器，从输出端看到的电阻非常非常小。

At at the output it has something that is reminiscent of the source follower circuit that you learned about in recitations, solved an example in the course notes and in your homework as well. And you solved a variant of the source follower on your quiz as well in problem two. So, a circuit that looks like that appears at the output. Remember, for the source follower, the resistance looking in from the output was very, very small.

您已经看到了放大器内部的一些部件，但我们将把它作为一个构建块来处理，并使用这个抽象的小电路简单地表示它。再详细讨论一下，这个小设备是模拟行业的主力。就像您的原始门抽象、反相器和 NAND 门等一样，就像您的原始反相器或 NAND 门来自数字行业的基础一样。

You have seen some of the pieces that go inside the amplifier, but we will deal with this as a building block and simply represent it using this abstract little circuit. To dwell on this a little longer, this little device here is the workhorse of the analog industry. Much like your primitive gate abstraction, your inverter and NAND gate and so on, much as your primitive inverter or NAND gate was from the foundations of the digital industry.

还记得我们学过如何构建这种称为 NAND 门或反相器的小型抽象设备吗？我们注意到，它们构成了非常复杂的微处理器的基础。它们是数字行业的基石。同样，这里的这个小东西也是模拟行业的基石。

Remember we learned how to build this little abstract device called a NAND gate or an inverter? We noticed that those form the foundations of very complicated microprocessors. Those were the building blocks of the digital industry. In the same way, this little beast here is the building block of the analog industry.

举个软件方面的类比，当你用 C++ 或其他语言编程时，可以将这个抽象的小设备视为函数库中的一个库例程。有人能举一个我们一直使用的非常流行的例程的例子吗？这个例程可能被称为软件行业的主力？什么意思？一个抽象，一个抽象的过程。一个例子可能是 printf 之类的东西。

Just to give you an analogy from software, think of this abstract little device as a library routine from a library of functions when you program in C++ or whatever. Can someone give me an example of an incredibly popular routine that we use all the time that may be called the workhorse of the software industry? Pardon? An abstraction, an abstract procedure. One example might be something like a printf.

Printf 是一个抽象的名称，指的是一个可以为你执行某些操作的程序。令人惊讶的是，我们竟然将低级的 printf 视为理所当然。我将 printf 插入到我的程序中，它包括标准 IO 库，它会打印一个值。你不会相信 printf 有多复杂。当你开始学习更高级的软件主题时，实现 printf 就是一场噩梦。它非常复杂。想象一下。

Printf is an abstract name for a procedure that goes and does something for you. It is amazing how we take the lowly printf for granted. I stick my printf into my program, it includes the standard IO library and it goes and prints a value. You won’t believe how complicated the printf is. As you go into learning more advanced software subjects, implementing the printf is a nightmare. It is horrendously complicated. Just imagine.

你给它一个字符串，它必须把它打印到你的终端或 Windows 系统上。想想它要经历的复杂步骤。但是，就你而言，这很简单。只需打印出一些东西就完成了。同样的方式。把它想象成模拟业务的 printf。

You give it a string and it has to go and print that on your terminal or on your Windows system or whatever. Think of the complicated steps it has to go through. But, as far as you’re concerned, it’s simple. Just print out something and you’re done. The same way. Think of this as the printf of the analog business.

它真的很简单，分析起来也非常简单，简单到令人难以置信，但如果你深入研究它的内部，天知道会发生什么。告诉你，进入库例程之一中的 STDIO 点，然后仔细研究 printf。世界上最糟糕的宏就在那里。我的意思是它太糟糕了。就像运算放大器内部一样，它太糟糕了。你不想去那里。

It is really simple, and the analysis is going to be incredibly simple, it will be mind bogglingly simple, but inside it, heavens forbid if you look inside it. Tell you what, go into to S T D I O dot in one of the library routines and just pore through printf. The world’s worst horrendous macros are in there. I mean it is just nasty. The same way inside the op amp, it is nasty. You don’t want to go there.

就像你在课堂上学习 C 语言编程一样，你可以在不完全了解 printf 实现方式的情况下使用它。可能是麻省理工学院的某位大神或某位重点毕业生实现了它，但一旦实现了它，你只需根据简单的抽象规则来使用它，了解它的行为方式。你不必知道它里面有什么就可以使用它。运算放大器也是一样。

Much like in your C programming in your classes, you were able to use printf without fully knowing how it was implemented. Probably some MIT god or some key graduate implemented it, but once it was implemented you just used it based on simple abstract rules as to how it behaved. You didn’t have to know what was inside it to use it. The same way with the operational amplifier.

所以，当你看到这个时，就想想 printf，想象一下使用它是多么简单。你可能认为我花了太多时间，十分钟来思考这个抽象概念，但我喜欢思考那些我认为非常重要的事情。

So, just think of printf when you see this and just imagine how simple it is going to be to use it. You may think that I spend way too much time, ten minutes dwelling on this abstract concept, but I like to dwell on things that I think are incredibly important.

抽象

Abstraction

抽象的概念非常重要。而且它不仅仅存在于软件中。抽象的概念遍布整个 EECS。

The concept of abstraction is very important. And it’s not just in software. The concept of abstraction pervades all of EECS.

如果我给你一个项目，让你去问每一位教授，你认为哪个词最能描述整个 EECS？就选一个词。去问你认识的每一位教授。什么是单个词？如果你只用一个词来描述整个 EECS，这个词会是什么？在我看来，这个词就是 A 词，抽象。它无处不在。

And if I were to give you a project to say go and ask every professor what is the one word that you think best describes all of EECS? Just pick one word. Go ask every single professor you know. What is a single word? If you were to characterize all of EECS with just one word, what might that word be? In my mind, it is the A word, abstraction. It is all over.

如果你对你在这里四年里所有教授使用过的所有单词进行 grep，我保证你第一个会是 know。第二个会是 abstraction。检查一下。看看我说的是否正确。它无处不在。在 6.001 中，你认为 abstraction 这个词在 6.001 中使用了多少次？它无处不在。

If you do a grep on all the words used by all your professors in your four years here, I promise you the first one will be know. And the second one will be abstraction. Check it out. See if what I am saying is true or not. It is all over the place. In 6.001, how many times do you think the word abstraction was used in 6.001? It’s all over the map.

到处都是 A 字。想象一下，当你看到它在 002 中被使用时你会多么震惊，因为同样的概念也适用。我们通过抽象出较小对象的细节来构建更复杂的系统，然后使用它们来构建更复杂的系统。抽象是一种非常强大的处理复杂性的机制。

It’s the A word all over. Imagine your shock when you see it being used in 002 because the same concept applies. We build more complicated systems by abstracting out the details of lesser objects, and then using those to build the more complicated systems. Abstraction is a very powerful mechanism of dealing with complexity.

运算放大器

Op Amp

下一步是如何使用运算放大器？让我向您展示它在示波器上的样子。

Next step is how do I go about using the op amp? Let me show you how it looks on a scope.

我要做的是将输入应用到运算放大器，然后查看输出，将电阻 RL 接地并查看输出。在这里，我将应用正 VS，在这里应用负 VS。再次提醒，正 VS 看起来就像这样，负 VS 看起来就像这样。

What I am going to do is apply input to the op amp, I am going to look at the output, place the resistor RL to ground and look at the output. And here I am going to apply a plus VS and out here a minus VS. Again, remember that a plus VS simply looks like this and a minus VS simply looks like this.

这里只是应用了一个倒置的 VS，因此我在此输入端得到一个负 VS。首先，我想要做的是，当我改变 vIN 时，我将为您绘制 vOUT 的样子。vIN 和这是 vO。我将以微伏为单位绘制 vIN，以伏为单位绘制 vO。

It’s just an inverted VS applied here so I get a minus VS at this input. First of all, what I would like to do is as I change vIN, I am going to plot for you how vOUT looks. vIN and this is vO. I am going to plot vIN in terms of microvolts and vO in volts.

VIN 会非常小，刻度将以微伏为单位，因为请记住，它的增益是巨大的。它大约是十的六次方。它非常大。vIN 的微小变化将导致 vO 的巨大变化。我在 X 轴上有一个非常精细的刻度。如果我以某种方式神奇地让 vIN 精确为零，会发生什么？

VIN is going to have a very small, the scale is going to be in microvolts because remember the gain of this is huge. It’s on the order of ten to the sixth. It’s huge. Small changes in vIN are going to cause massive changes in vO. I have a very fine scale on the X axis. What is going to happen if I somehow magically make vIN exactly zero?

如果我短接这两个端子，如果这是一个完全理想的运算放大器（但它从来都不是），那么我的输出应该为零。当我增加 vIN 时，输出应该是 A 乘以 vIN。对于某个较小的 vIN 值，较小的 v，比如说 1 微伏，输出应该是 1 伏。A 是一个常数，所以这看起来像一条直线。

If I short these two terminals, if this was a completely ideal op amp, which it never is, if it’s a completely ideal op amp, then my output should be zero. As I increase my vIN the output should be A times vIN. For some small value of vIN, small v, let’s say one microvolt, the output should be one volt. A is a constant so this would look like a straight line.

假设我的电源电压为 12 伏减 12 伏，如果这是一个理想的放大器，我不必担心电源，那么这种情况就会一直持续下去。但我有一个正 12 伏电源和一个负 12 伏电源。我的输出不能超过这些限制。因此，我的输出在这两个点趋于平稳。这被称为触及轨道。

And let’s say my supply voltages are 12 volts minus 12 volts, if this were an ideal amplifier and I didn’t have to worry about the supply, this would just go on extending forever. But I have a plus 12 volt supply and a minus 12 volt supply. My output cannot go past those limits. And so, therefore, my output kind of flattens out at these two points. And it is called hitting the rails.

输出上升，您会听到砰的一声，然后击中了轨道。当您在下一个实验室中玩运算放大器时，如果您非常仔细地听，您可能会听到它。所以，这会饱和。毫不奇怪，输出在电源处饱和的这个区域称为饱和区。记住，不要混淆。它与 MOSFET 中的饱和不同。这是完全不同的东西。

Output goes up and you hear a thunk sound and you hit the rails. When you play with op amps in your next lab, if you listen really, really carefully you may hear it. So, this saturates out. Not surprisingly, this region where the output saturates at the supply is called the saturation region. Remember, don’t confuse it with. It’s not the same as your saturation in the MOSFET. It is a totally different thing.

我们恰好将其称为饱和。如果您愿意思考，可以将其视为 thunk 区域。这可能更适合将其与 MOSFET 中的饱和区域区分开来。毫不奇怪，这个区域被称为有源区域。我们在这个区域中使用运算放大器。在这里，它已经撞上轨道，并悬在那里。

It is just happenstance that we call this saturation. And if you would like to think about it, you can think of it as the thunk region. That’s probably more appropriate to distinguish it from the saturation region in the MOSFET. And, not surprisingly, this one is called the active region. And it is in this region that we use the op amp. Here it has hit the rails and is kind of dangling out there.

它对我们来说用处不大。我们在这个活动区域使用它，因为在这里可以看到增益。现在，事实证明这是一个非常高增益的设备。它非常不稳定。这种增益是一种非常有趣的东西。它取决于一系列因素。这可能与温度有关。这里的增益和这条曲线完全不稳定。它可能取决于温度。

It’s not much use to us. It’s in this active region that we use it because this is where the gain is seen. Now, it turns out that this is a very high gain device. It is very skittish. This gain is kind of a really funny thing. It’s dependent on a bunch of factors. This could be temperature dependent. This gain here and this curve is just completely skittish. It could depend on temperature.

这可能取决于一天中的时间。这可能取决于放大器正在服用什么药物。这可能取决于它的情绪波动。谁知道呢？这有点不稳定。尤其是 A 非常不稳定。它肯定会很大，但可能是 10 的 6 次方，在下雨天，它可能是 2 乘以 10 的 6 次方。

It could depend on time of day. It could depend on what medication this amplifier is on. It could depend on its mood swings. Who knows what? This is kind of unstable. And A in particular is highly unstable. It is going to be big, that’s for sure, but it could be ten to the six, on a rainy day it might be two times ten to the six.

如果感觉很无聊，它可能是 0.5 乘以 10 的 6 次方。它很大，但我不能依赖它。让我给你举个例子。我想给你展示这个 MOSFET 的曲线，应用一个输入并绘制输出。我要做的就是看看这条曲线。

If it feeling sleepy it may be point five times ten to the sixth. It is big but I cannot rely on it. Let me show you an example. I want to show you this curve for this MOSFET, apply an input and plotting the output. What I will do is take a look at this curve.

然后我要用热风枪加热运算放大器，你会看到整个图上的变化。如果你还记得上周的情况，你们中的一些人可能还记得在某个类似的情况下，你得到的 MOSFET 的 gm 也取决于温度等因素。这是一种非常常见的情况。

Then what I am going to do is use a heat gun to heat the op amp and you are going to see this vary all over the map. If you still remember last week, some of you may remember that from some place in a similar situation where the gm for the MOSFETs you were given was also dependent on temperature and stuff like that. It is a very common occurrence.

对于 MOSFET 来说确实如此。

And that is certainly the case for the MOSFET.

应用输入

Applying an Input

让我们应用输入。让我们这样做。这是放大器的 vIN 与 vOUT。请注意，这是正 12 伏，这是负 12 伏。每格大约 2 伏。我相信，这里的轴以微伏为单位。对于非常小的变化，对于几十微伏，我有一个非常高的增益。请注意，这里的增益非常高。

Let’s apply input. Let’s do this. This is vIN versus vOUT for the amplifier. Notice that this is plus 12 volts, this is minus 12 volts. It is about two volts per division. This axis here is in microvolts, I believe. For a very small change, for a few tens of microvolts, I have an incredibly high gain. Notice that this has an incredibly high gain here.

增益是这条线的斜率，几乎是一条垂直线。接下来我要做的是，玩点有趣的东西，我要加热运算放大器。为了向你展示 A 确实有点不稳定，而且它没有完全达到零，它会做各种奇怪的事情，我要加热运算放大器。然后让我们看看这条曲线是如何波动的。

The gain is the slope of this line, almost a vertical line. What I am going to do next, is to have some fun, is I am going to heat the op amp. To show you that A is kind of really skittish and also the fact that it doesn’t quite hit zero, it does all kinds of weird things, I am going to heat the op amp. And then let’s take a look at how that curve fluctuates.

你看到的是，当我加热运算放大器时，它的行为开始变得非常奇怪。它有时会做出非常奇怪的行为，比如偏离中心等等。它还做了许多其他奇怪的事情，但我们不会深入讨论这些细节。这与本课程无关。但重点是输入端的增益和偏移取决于温度。

What you saw there was that the op amp began to behave really weirdly as I heated it. Instead of doing this it sometimes did this really weirdly, like getting an offset from the center and so on. And it does a bunch of other weird things, but we won’t go into those details. It’s not relevant for this course. But the point is that the gain and the offset at the input are dependent on temperature.

我们正在寻找方法让它更少地依赖温度。下一步，我想做的是建立一个电路。

And we look for ways to make it less dependent on temperature. As the next step, what I would like to do is build a circuit.

建立电路

Building a Circuit

这是您的 Hello World 程序的模型等效项。我们将使用 printf 并在 printf 上构建一个小程序。

This is model equivalent of your Hello World program. We are going to use the printf and build a small program on the printf.

您不必担心 printf 是如何实现的，我们只需基于设备的简单抽象，用这个极其复杂的函数构建非常有趣的电路即可。我们将构建的电路称为非反相放大器。从现在开始，我不会向您展示正/负 VS。我不会展示电源端口，但它就在那里。它隐藏在抽象层之下。

You don’t have to worry about how printf is implemented, just that we can build very highly interesting circuits with this horrendously complicated function based on a simple abstraction of the device. The circuit that we will build is called a noninverting amplifier. From now on, I am not going to show you the plus/minus VS. I am not going to show the power port, but it is in there. It’s hidden under the abstraction layer.

这是我的运算放大器。我将构建以下电路。这是我的 v plus，这是我的 v minus。我要做的是，对于 v plus，我将应用 vIN。让我也谈谈接地。接地通常被视为我连接 VS 和负 VS 电源的点。它位于中点。

This is my op amp. And I am going to build the following circuit. This is my v plus and this is my v minus. What I am going to do is for the v plus I shall apply a vIN. Let me talk a little bit about ground as well. Ground is commonly taken as the point at which I connect my VS and minus VS supply. It is kind of at the midpoint.

如果 VS 和负 VS 经过非常仔细的调整，那么当输入为零时，输出也将处于相同的接地参考点。因此，接地定义为我连接正/负 VS 电源的点。我在这里应用我的 vIN。然后我要做的是，这是我的输出 vO。

And if VS and minus VS are very carefully tuned then the output is also going to be at that same ground reference when the input is zero. So, the ground is defined as the point at which I connect my plus/minus VS supplies. I apply my vIN out here. Then what I am going to do, here is my output vO.

我将在这里放置一个电阻分压器接地，并将它们标记为 R1 和 R2。我要在这里做的是将其反馈回输入端，即 v 减输入端。我将在这里采样电压并将其输入到这里。所以，这是我的抽象模型，这是我的 Hello World 程序。我们要做的只是分析这个小程序的行为方式。

I am going to have a resistive divider to ground here and label these R1 and R2. And what I am going to do here is feed this back to the input, to the v minus input. I am going to sample the voltage here and feed that into here. So, this is my abstract model and this is my Hello World program. What we are going to do is simply analyze how this little program behaves.

这就是我的等效电路模型。分析这些模型的方法是，在分析完一两个示例后，你只需查看、检查，就能直接分析它。但是，就像我们对其他部分所做的那样，让我先绘制等效电路图，然后仔细分析，然后向你展示一种更简单的方法。

So, my equivalent circuit model. The way to analyze these is after one or two of these examples, you will be able to directly analyze this just by looking at it, by inspection. But, much as we did for the other pieces, let me grunge through drawing the equivalent circuit and grinding through the analysis, and then show you the much simpler way of doing it.

即使在这里，即使有这种繁琐的分析，无论如何它都会非常简单。因此，我将用其等效电路模型替换运算放大器。其等效电路是 v 正，v 负。因此，这就是运算放大器的等效电路模型，只是这一部分。我为您画了出来。然后我要做的是将 v 连接到这里。

And even here, even with this grinding analysis, it is going to be pretty simple in any case. So, I will replace the op amp with its equivalent circuit model. Its equivalent circuit was v plus, v minus. So, that was the equivalent circuit model of the operational amplifier, just this piece. I draw that for you. Then what I am going to do is I connect my v in here.

请记住，我这里有一个 R1、R2 电阻分压器。这个分压器连接到那里的这个端子。我还知道 I plus 为零。我还知道 I minus 为零。我所做的只是用其等效电路替换了放大器。现在让我们继续分析该电路。让我们继续分析该电路。实际上，这将非常简单。

And, remember, I have an R1, R2 resistive divider here. And this one gets connected to this terminal there. I also know that I plus is zero. I also know that I minus is zero. All I’ve done is simply replaced the amplifier with its equivalent circuit. Let’s go ahead and analyze that circuit now. Let’s go ahead and analyze that circuit. And it’s going to be pretty simple, actually.

我要向你们展示的是比较难的方法。我会向你们展示一种更简单的方法，但这种困难的方法本身却非常简单。我想要做的是根据 vIN 找到 vO。还会涉及很多其他因素，包括 R1 和 R2、A 等。让我们来分析一下。vO，让我们看看那个电路。

What I am going to show you is the hard way of doing it. I will show you a much easier way, but the hard way itself is pathetically easy. What I want to do is find vO in terms of vIN. And there will be a bunch of other factors thrown in, including things like R1 and R2, A and stuff like that. Let’s go and analyze it. vO, let’s look at that circuit.

顺便说一句，现在让我花 30 秒时间说几句话。当你看到这样的电路时，我也在第二个测验中看到过这种情况，出于某种原因，当你看到一种新型电路时，不要完全发狂或僵住或诸如此类。根本没有理由这样做。你知道节点方法。节点方法是我们业务的主力。如有疑问，请应用节点方法。

By the way, let me take 30 seconds and make a little speech at this point. When you see circuits like this, and I saw this happen in quiz two as well, for some reason, when you see a new kind of circuit, don’t completely go berserk or freeze or whatever. There is just no reason to. You know the node method. The node method is the workhorse of our business. When in doubt apply the node method.

它只是工作。不要僵住。不要想哦，天哪，我需要应用我已经知道的模式。我一定在某个地方见过这个。有疑问时，应用节点方法。在这个电路中，我只有一个未知的节点电压。我知道 v 正的电压，我需要计算电压 vO。有两个未知数，vO 是未知数，v 负的电压是另一个未知数。

It will simply work. Don’t freeze. Don’t think oh, man, I need to apply a pattern that I know already. I must have seen this somewhere. When in doubt boom, apply the node method. This circuit here, all I have here is one unknown node voltage. I know the voltage of v plus, I need to compute the voltage vO. There are two unknowns, vO is an unknown and the voltage here at v minus is another unknown.

这是一个非常简单的电路，涉及一个依赖电压控制的电压源，您需要使用节点方法找出 vO 和 v 减。只需应用它。很简单。不要僵住。只要看一下它并说我可以做到并应用节点方法。它会简单地起作用。所以，让我们这样做。我在这里可以做的是 vO 是 A 乘以 v 加减 v 减。这实际上非常简单。

This is a very simple circuit involving a dependent voltage controlled voltage source, and you need to find out vO and v minus using the node method. Just apply it. It’s simple. Don’t freeze. Just look at it and say I can do it and apply the node method. It will simply work. So, let’s do that. What I can do here is vO is A times v plus minus v minus. This is actually really simple.

然后，如果我在这里取 v 正，我知道 v 正就是 vIN，所以我会立即进行替换。所以，v 正就是 vIN。v 负是什么？v 负是 vO。v 正是什么？对不起，是 v 负。v 负就是 R1 和 R2 之间的电压。请注意，没有电流流入 v 负节点。没有电流流入。

And then, if I take v plus here, I know v plus is simply vIN so I will just make that substitution right away. So, v plus is simply vIN. What is v minus? v minus here is vO What is v plus? I’m sorry, v minus. v minus is simply the voltage that is between R1 and R2. Notice that no current flows in to the v minus node. There is no current flowing in.

v 减号处的电压就是电阻分压器给出的电压，即 vO 乘以 R2 除以 R1 加 R2。再盯着它看一秒钟。此处此节点处的电压就是电阻分压器给出的。因为没有电流沿此方向流动。没有电流流入，因为我根据我的抽象告诉你那里没有电流。我告诉你 I 减号为零。

Voltage at v minus is simply the voltage given by the resistive divider, which is vO times R2 divided by R1 plus R2. Stare at that for another second. The voltage at this node here is simply given by the resistive divider. Because no current is flowing in this direction. And no current flows in because I am telling you there is no current there based on my abstraction. I am telling you I minus is zero.

该电压就是电阻分压器的电压。因此我可以进一步简化它，将其写为 vO。因此我得到，这里有一个 1。我将这个东西移到这边，这样我得到 1 加 A 乘以 R2 除以 R1 加 R2。这等于 AvIN。
