That voltage is simply the voltage at this resistive divider. And so I can simplify it further and write this as vO. So I get, there is a one here. And I move this thing over to this side so I get one plus A times R2 divided by R1 plus R2. And that is equal to AvIN.

再进一步简化一下，我得到 vO 等于 AvIN 除以 1 加上 AR2 除以 R1 加上 R2。注意这是多么简单，这是困难的方法。我所做的就是使用您在课程第一周学到的基本电路分析原理来分析电路，我已经为您准备好了输出。我只是非常仔细地记录了抽象中各个元素之间的关系。

And simplifying it some more, I get vO is AvIN divided by one plus AR2 divided by R1 plus R2. Notice how simple this is, and this is the hard method. All I have done is analyze the circuit using the basic circuit analysis principle that you learned the first week of the course, and I have the output for you. I just noted very carefully what the relationships were between the various elements in the abstraction.

注意这里我被告知 A 非常大。A 的数量级是 10 的 6 次方，等等。假设情​​况确实如此，让我再写下来。vO 是 AvIN，一加 AR2，R2。假设 R1 和 R2 大致相当，A 是 10 的 6 次方，这是一个巨大的数字，所以这个整数比一大得多。

Notice here that I am told that A is extremely large. A is on the order of ten to the six and so on. And suppose it is the case that, let me write that down again. vO is AvIN, one plus AR2, R2. Suppose R1 and R2 are more or less comparable and A is ten to the six, it’s a huge number, so this whole number is much, much greater than one.

如果它比 1 大很多，我可以做的是将其写成如下形式。我可以说这或多或少等于 AvIN 除以 AR2 除以 R1 加 R2。我在这里忽略了 1。

If it is much huger than one, what I can do is I can then write this as follows. I can say that this is more or less equal to AvIN divided by AR2 divided by R1 plus R2. I am ignoring the one here.

一旦我这样做，请注意我可以取消 A，并且我得到的 vO 大约等于 vIN 乘以 R1 加上 R2 除以 R2。现在请注意，当增益非常大时，输出是输入乘以某个数字的函数。

As soon as I do that, notice I can cancel out A and I get vO to be approximately equal to vIN times R1 plus R2 divided by R2. Notice now that when the gain is very large the output is a function of the input multiplied by some number.

这里的妙处在于，当 A 非常大，或者这个表达式非常大时，A 会抵消，在这个关系中没有 A。这意味着，即使基本放大器非常不稳定，这里的输出也会基于我能控制的组件与输入相关。这些都是我军队中的士兵。我控制着他们。

The beauty of this thing here is that when A is very large, or this expression is very large, A cancels out and there is no A in this relationship. This means that even though the basic amplifier was very skittish, the output here relates to the input based on components that I have control over. These are soldiers in my army. I control them.

因此，为了让大家对这里的一些数字有个概念，假设 A 是 10 的 6 次方。我选择 R1 为 9R。R 为某个 R。那么 vO 就是 10 的 6 次方 vIN 除以 1 加上 10 的 6 次方 R 除以 9R 加上 R。所以，这就是 10 的 6 次方 vIN 除以 1 加上 10 的 6 次方除以 10。好的。

So, to give you a sense of some numbers here, suppose A was ten to the six. And I choose R1 to be 9R. And R to be some R. Then vO is ten to the sixth vIN divided by one plus ten to the six R divided by 9R plus R. So, that is ten to the six vIN divided by one plus ten to the six divided by ten. All right.

如果我忽略这里的 1，十的六次方和十的六次方会抵消，最终得到 10vIN。因此，我得到了一个非常好的放大器，其输出只是输入的十倍，并且仅由一些电阻值决定。这次让我再给你展示一个快速演示，并再次向你展示放大器，但电阻器是这样连接的。

If I ignore the one here, the ten to the six and ten to the six cancel out, this ends up giving me 10vIN. So, I get a really nice amplifier whose output is simply ten times the input and determined solely by some resistor values. Let me show you another quick demo this time and show you the amplifier again, but with resistors connected like that.

然后我向你展示，我想将放大器加热到极限，将运算放大器加热到极限，但 vO 将绝对稳定。让我们试试看。这一次，这是传递函数，vO 与 vIN。

And then I show you that I want to heat the amplifier to the wazoo, the op amp to the wazoo, but vO is going to be absolutely rock solid. Let’s try that out. This time around, this is the transfer function, the vO versus vIN.

请注意，这一次我在 X 轴和 Y 轴上有类似的刻度，并且斜率为 10。这是放大器在正 12 伏时饱和的点，这是负 12 伏，而此处的此点为零。

And notice that this time around I have similar scales on the X and Y axes, and this has a slope of 10. This is the point where the amplifier saturates at plus 12 volts, and this is minus 12 volts, and this point here is a zero.

因此，这是 vIN、vOUT，加 12，减 12，斜率为 10。我现在要做的是将运算放大器加热到极限，这不会改变，因为这是我的外部电阻器，它独立于 A 的值控制它，前提是 A 继续非常大。我只是阐明了 vOUT、vIN 曲线。让我开始加热运算放大器。请注意，它非常稳定。

So, this is vIN, vOUT, plus 12, minus 12 and this slope is 10. What I am going to do now is heat the op amp to the wazoo and this ain’t going to change because it’s my external resistors that control it independent of the value of A, provided A continues to be very large. I am just articulating the vOUT, vIN curve. And let me start heating the op amp. Notice that it’s pretty stable.

它不会改变，因为它与放大器值无关。我现在所做的是通过以这种方式连接这些电阻器，我有一个增益为 10 的优质放大器。您可能会问自己为什么？这里面有一个小吸盘，它想将东西射高 10 到 6。想将东西从一条轨道或负轨道上撞下来。

It doesn’t change because it is independent of the amplifier values. What I have done now is by connecting these resistors in this way, I have a nice amplifier with a gain of ten. The question you may ask yourselves is why? There is this little sucker in there that wants to shoot things up by ten to the sixth. Wants to knock things off the one rail or the negative rail.

为什么它在这里表现得像一只温顺的羔羊，无论我对它做什么，它都会给我们带来十倍的收益？它为什么会这样？背后的直觉是什么？我会在黑板上画一些东西，但接下来的十秒钟我希望你思考一下。看看你是否能想出一些关于它为什么这样做的见解。为什么正好是十？

Why is it that it’s behaving like a docile lamb here and giving us a nice little factor of ten gain no matter what I do to it? Why is it doing that? What is the intuition behind it? I will draw something on the board, but for the next ten seconds I want you think about it. See if you can come up with some insight as to why is it doing that. Why is it exactly ten?

为什么十的六次方不会让我难受呢？为什么无论发生什么事我都会得到十？看看你是否能想出一些直觉，然后我会告诉你它是如何运作的。

Why isn’t the ten to the sixth kind of killing me somehow? Why am I getting exactly ten no matter what happens? See if you can come up with some intuition and then I will show you how it works.

例子

Example

我会重新画出电路图。我看看能不能给你一些直观的印象。这是我的电路，假设这是 R，这是 R。

I will redraw the circuit in the meantime. Let me see if I can give you some intuition. This is my circuit, and let’s say this is R and this is R.

举个例子，假设输入为 5 伏，vIN 为 5 伏。如果 R 和 R 相等，输出应该是多少？是 R 和 R，所以是 R1 加 R2 除以 R2，对吗？是 2R 除以 R，所以增益为 2。我的放大器增益为 2，因为 R1 加 R2 除以 R2，也就是我的增益，是 R 加 R 除以 R 等于 2。

As an example, let’s assume that the input is 5 volts, vIN is 5 volts. If R and R are equal, what should the output be? It’s R and R, so it’s R1 plus R2 divided by R2, right? It’s 2R divided by R, so it has a gain of two. My amplifier has a gain of two because R1 plus R2 divided by R2, which is my gain, is R plus R divided by R equals two.

所以，这将是 10 伏。如果是 10 伏，这将是 5 伏，对吗？这个 R 和 R，分压器，这是 5，所以我在这里得到 5 伏。这是 v 正。这是 v 负。我得到 R 和 R，这里是 5 伏，这就是电路的样子。现在让我们了解发生了什么。请仔细听。

So, this will be 10 volts. If that is 10 volts this is going to be 5 volts, correct? This R and R, voltage divider, this is five, so I get 5 volts here. This is v plus. This is v minus. I get R and R, 5 volts here, that’s how the circuit looks. Now let’s understand what is going on. And listen very carefully.

这将是我希望你们一生都牢记的一个关键见解。这真的非常关键。我认为你们将看到的是 6.002 中的第三个重大顿悟时刻。就像小信号分析，就像我们看到的频域内容，我认为这是接下来 30 或 40 秒内的第三个重大顿悟时刻，这些内容要么完全不直观，但就它们能为您做些什么而言，却非常了不起。让我们拭目以待。

This is going to be a key insight that I hope you will carry with you for the rest of your lives. This is really, really key. What you are going to see is, I think, the third big ah ha moment in 6.002. Like small signal analysis, like the frequency domain stuff we saw, I think this is the third big one in the next 30 or 40 seconds, things that are completely either not necessarily intuitive but are just spectacular in terms of what they can do for you. Let’s see.

假设因为我加热了它，假设 A 突然有增加的趋势。它想要增加是因为我加热了它。A 说我想摆脱这里的这个模具，并开始突破这里的束缚。假设，作为一个思想实验，它试图将电压提高到 12 伏。它试图将其推得更高。这只是一个思想实验。

Let’s suppose that because I am heating it, let’s suppose that A suddenly tends to increase. It wants to increase because I have heated it. A is saying I want to get out this mold here and starts to break through its shackles here. Let’s say, as a Gedanken experiment, that it tries to shoot up this to 12 volts. It tries to push it up higher. This is just a Gedanken experiment.

向上的箭头表示 A 的增加试图暂时提高 vO。让我们看看会发生什么。它试图暂时提高 vO，因此假设它假设为 12。如果变为 12，那么这个伏特节点应该变为多少？确切地说是 6。这将变为 6 伏。如果变为 6，那么 v- 变为多少？还是 6 伏。因此，v- 变为 6 伏。

The up arrow says that the increase in A is trying to push up vO momentarily. Let’s see what happens. It is trying to push up vO momentarily, so let’s say this goes to 12 hypothetically. If that goes to 12, what should this volt node go to? Six, exactly. This goes to 6 volts. If that goes to six, what does v minus go to? 6 volts again. So, v minus goes to 6 volts.

现在，在输入端，正极电压为 5 伏，负极电压为 6 伏，那么输出应该去哪里呢？输出应该下降，因为负极电压更高。因此输出为 A 乘以正极电压减去负极电压。由于这个下降了，这个上升了，它会试图将输出拉低。

Now at the input I have 5 volts at v plus and 6 volts at v minus, so where should the output go? The output should go down because the voltage of the negative terminal is higher. And so the output is A times v plus minus v minus. And because this has gone down, this has gone up here it is going to try to pull the output down.

这会将输出拉低，比如说拉低到 9 伏特左右。Cachunk，这里有一场大战。A 上升了，它已经将其提升到 12，但当它上升到 12 时，这个下降到 6，这个下降到 6，运算放大器输出现在必须下降到 9 伏特，因为这里的输入更高。

That is going to pull the output down let’s say to 9 volts or something. Cachunk, there is a big battle going on here. A has gone up, it has boosted it up to 12, but the moment that goes to 12, this goes to 6, this goes to 6, and the op amp output has to go down to 9 volts now because this input is higher here.

如果这个达到 9，这个就达到 4.5。如果那个达到 4.5，这个就达到 4.5。现在会发生什么？如果这个达到 4.5，会发生什么？它想回升。它不能下定决心吗？这个家伙现在想回升，因为 v plus 高于 v minus。我在这里看到了什么？这里的整个电路就像我的小儿子，我的 9 岁孩子一样。

If this goes to 9, this goes to 4.5. If that goes to 4.5, this goes to 4.5. What happens now? If this goes to 4.5, what happens? It wants to go back up. Can’t it make up its mind? This guy wants to go back up now because v plus is higher than v minus. What am I seeing here? This whole circuit here behaves like my little son, my 9 year old.

如果说要这样做，他却想做完全相反的事情。所以，让他们为你做事有一个技巧。看看这个。由于这种电路布置，当 A 试图将输出推高时，电路的其余部分会试图将其拉回到原来的位置。

If say do this, he wants to do the exact opposite. So, there is a trick in how you make them do things for you. Look at this. Because of this arrangement of the circuit when A tries to push the output up, the rest of the circuit tries to pull it back down to where it used to be.

如果电路试图不遵循真实路径，电路的其余部分就会试图将其调整为真实路径。发生这种情况是因为，在这种安排下，我将部分输出反馈到负输入。我将部分输出反馈到负输入。

If the circuit tries not to follow the true path, the rest of the circuit tries to whack it into shape so it follows a true path. And what’s happening is because, in this arrangement, I have fed back a portion of the output to the negative input. I have fed back some of the output to the negative input.

通过将输出的一部分反馈给负输入，我将其安排成负反馈。负反馈的作用是，如果这个电路想变得疯狂，电路就会给它提供一些负反馈，就像你刚才看到的一样。反馈，一个大词。

And by providing this feedback of a portion of the output to the negative input, I have arranged it in a way that I have something called negative feedback. What negative feedback does is that if this wanted to go wild and crazy, the circuit provides it with some negative feedback like you just saw. Feedback, a big word.

如果对所有 EECS 教师进行民意调查，我猜想反馈至少会成为 EECS 中第九或第十个最重要的词。如果摘要是第一位的，我认为它会排在第九或第十位。所以，这就是它奏效的原因。在最后几分钟，让我根据您所知道的一些知识，给您一些关于反馈如何运作的见解。

If you take a poll of all the EECS faculty, I suspect that feedback would rank at least as the ninth or tenth most important word in the EECS. If abstract is number one, I think this would rank like a nine or a ten or something. So, that’s the reason why it worked. In the last couple of minutes, let me give you some insight, based on something that you know, on how feedback works.

这是一条路。我们来看看防抱死刹车。这是我的轮胎。假设我有一套盘式制动器。当汽车向前行驶时，如果我踩刹车，轮胎就会停止滚动，但如果我踩刹车太猛，轮胎就会被锁住，整个汽车就会打滑。防抱死刹车的工作原理如下。这里有一个控制器。

This is a road here. Let’s look at anti lock breaks. This is my tire. And let’s say I have a set of disk brakes here. As the car is moving forward, if I apply the brakes the tire stops rolling, but if I apply the breaks too hard it can lock up the tire and the whole car can skid. The way anti lock breaks work is as follows. There is a controller that sits here.

一个小人看着车轮，看它是否在转动。所以，这是一个反馈。它会说它在转动吗？是的。或者，它不转动吗？不。这个看着轮胎的人所做的就是说它在转动还是不转动。就是这样。这是一个负面反馈。所以，如果它是否定的，如果它是肯定的。

And there is a little person looking at the wheel and seeing is it turning. So, this is a feedback. And it is saying is it turning? Yes. Or, is it not turning? No. All this person watching the tire is doing is saying is it turning or is it not turning. That is it. That is a negative feedback. And so, if it is no and if it is yes.

如果答案是肯定的，那么它的作用是更用力地施加制动。它在转动，所以我可以施加更多制动。但如果它说哎呀，它停止转动，它的作用是简单地释放，控制器释放制动器。当控制器释放制动器时，这个制动器往往会松开一点，轮胎又开始转动。

If it is yes then what this does is it applies the brakes even more strongly. It is turning so I can apply more brakes. But if it says oops, it stopped turning, what it does is it simply releases, the controller releases the brakes. And when the controller releases the brakes this one tends to loosen up a little bit and the tire starts turning again.

因此，这样你就可以始终将轮胎保持在临界摩擦区域，这样它就可以不断移动。静摩擦力适用于你能用多大的力度刹车，它才不会开始打滑。事实上，如果你开车出去，我不是说你要这样做。

So, this way you are constantly keeping the tire in its region of critical friction so that it is constantly moving. And static friction applies to how hard you can brake and it doesn’t start skidding. In fact, if you take your car out, and I don’t say you do this.

假设在隆冬时节来到查尔斯河，在湖上开车，在冰面上猛踩防抱死刹车，你会注意到有持续不断的声音，好像里面有什么东西在振动。这正是正在发生的事情。哎呀，轮胎被锁住了。松开刹车。车轮在转动。踩下刹车。这正是正在发生的事情。

Let’s say go onto the Charles River in the dead of winter and you drive on the lake and you slam your anti lock brakes on, on an icy patch, you will notice that there is a constant sound that looks like something is vibrating in there. That is exactly what is happening. Oops, the tire is locked. Release the brakes. The wheel is turning. Jam the brakes on. That is exactly what is happening.

就像外面一样，你会注意到，哎呀，输出上升了，把它拉低，哎呀，它下降了，把它拉高。因此，存在持续的负反馈，可保持输出稳定。一个非常重要的概念。我会请你的复习老师讲解第 9 页上的非常简单的方法。

The same way as out there, you notice that oops, the output is going up, pull it down, oops, it’s going down, pull it up. So, there is constant negative feedback that is keeping the output stable. A very important concept. And I will ask your recitation instructors to cover the very simple method that is on page 9.

Lec 20 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 20 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 49:52 https://youtube.com/watch?v=2SwT6JnfCq8

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 49:52 https://youtube.com/watch?v=2SwT6JnfCq8

好的。早上好。我们开始吧。在今天的讲座中，我们继续讨论运算放大器，简称“op amp”。我们要做的是使用运算放大器构建一堆有趣的构建块。快速回顾一下，为了快速回顾我们已经了解的运算放大器，我们将运算放大器表示为一个看起来像这样的设备，其中放大器具有极高的增益。

All right. Good morning. Let’s get going. In today’s lecture we continue with the operational amplifier, “op amp” for short. And what we are going to do is just build up a bunch of fun building blocks using the op amp. As a quick review To quickly review what we’ve seen about the op amp We represented the op amp as a device that looked like this where the amplifier had an incredibly high gain.

因此，如果这里的电压差很小，我称其为相对于地的 v 正，v 负。如果这里的电压差很小，那么这里的增益会将差值乘以一个大数，从而得到比这个差值大一百万倍的输出。

So, if I had a small voltage difference here I call this v plus and this v minus with respect to ground. And if I had a small voltage difference then this gain here would multiply the difference by a large number and thereby giving me an output that was on the order of a million times greater than this difference.

因此，当我在没有任何负反馈的情况下以这种模式使用运算放大器时，输出通常会上升到正轨或负轨。我们还看到它具有无限的输入电阻，因此流入此处或此处的电流为零，并且输出电阻也为零。

And because of that when I use the op amp in a mode like this without any negative feedback the output would usually crank up to the positive rail or the negative rail. We also saw that it had infinite input resistance so that the current flowing in here or here was zero and also had zero output resistance.

这是我的理想运算放大器，无论我在这里连接什么负载，运算放大器都会提供几乎任何电流。现在，在实际运算放大器中情况并非如此。但可以说，当用作理想运算放大器时，输出阻抗、输出电阻将为零。运算放大器是模拟行业的一大主力。

This is my ideal op amp where irrespective of what load I connect here the op amp would supply pretty much any current. Now, in practical op amps that’s not the case. But suffice it to say that when used as an ideal op amp the output impedance, the output resistance is going to be zero. The op amp is a huge workhorse of the analog industry.

您将根据周二和周三以及今天的所做工作发现，使用运算放大器构建电路非常非常简单。使用放大器时，您不必担心非线性分析之类的问题。您不必担心我是否真的满足饱和极限的标准等等？

You will see based both on what you’ve done on Tuesday and Wednesday but also today that it’s very, very simple to build circuits using the op amp. When you use the amplifier, you don’t have to worry about things like nonlinear analysis. You don’t have to worry about am I really meeting the criteria for saturation limits and so on?

在某种程度上，你也必须考虑运算放大器的这一问题，因为如果输出达到正轨或负轨，它的表现将不会像你预期的那样。但从根本上说，有了这个原始模型，这个理念模型，用运算放大器构建电路就变得非常简单。因此，它已成为电路的关键构件。

To some extent you have to think about that with the op amp, too, because if the output hits the positive rail or negative rail it isn’t going to behave like you expect it to. But fundamentally with this primitive model, this idea model it becomes really simple to build circuits with the op amp. Therefore it has become a key building block for circuits.

当电路设计师构建模拟电路时，他们的基本构建块通常实际上是这种放大器、运算放大器、电阻器、电容器和一些其他基本构建元素。如果你看一下课程笔记，你会发现第 16 章中有很多示例得到解决。你会发现，使用运算放大器确实可以构建看起来或多或少像理想电流源的电流源。

When circuit designers build analog circuits very often their primitive building blocks are really an amplifier of this sort, an op amp, resistors, capacitors and some of our other primitive building elements. If you look at the course notes the readings are There are a bunch of examples solved in Chapter 16. And you will see that using the op amp it is indeed possible to build current sources that look like more or less ideal current sources.

还可以构建电压源等。这是一个非常简洁的构建块，您可以使用它来做各种很酷的事情。在本课程中，您将看到大量使用运算放大器的示例电路。在今天的讲座中，您将看到减法器之类的东西。您还将看到积分器和微分器。

It is also possible to build voltage sources and so on. It is an incredibly neat building block using which you can do all kinds of cool stuff. In this course you will see a whole bunch of example circuits using the op amp. In today’s lecture you will see things like a subtractor. You will also see integrators and a differentiator.

然后在你的实验室，也就是第四个实验室中，你将构建一个非常有趣的混合信号电路，其中涉及数字和模拟元件。你将使用运算放大器构建所谓的数模转换器。当然，我可以构建所有我们常用的放大器和此类电路。在后面的讲座中，你还将看到如何使用运算放大器构建滤波器。

And then in your lab, lab four, you will build a really fun mixed signal circuit involving both digital and analog components. And you will build what is called a digital to an analog converter using the op amp. And of course I can build all our good old amplifiers and circuits of that sort. In a later lecture you will also see how we can build filters using an op amp.

这将使用您学到的有关连接电阻器、电容器和电感器以及进行频域分析的知识，我们可以在其中放入运算放大器并构建滤波器。这只是让您预览即将到来的景点。今天我将重点介绍这些电路。

This is going to be using the knowledge you learn in terms of connecting resistors, capacitors and inductors together and doing a frequency domain analysis, well we can throw the op amp in there and build filters, too. This is just to give you a preview of upcoming attractions. For today I am going to focus on these circuits.

我不会介绍任何新理论或任何新基础知识，但基本上会采用我向您解释过的有关运算放大器的简单属性。使用这些简单属性可以非常快速地构建一堆电路，您可以使用它们以各种方式分析信号。让我们从以下电路开始。对于运算放大器，我从这个小家伙开始。

I won’t be covering any new theory or any new set of foundations but pretty much take the simple properties that I have explained to you about the op amp. And using those simple properties very quickly build up a bunch of circuits that you can use to analyze signals in a variety of ways. Let’s start with the following circuit. With op amps I start with this little guy.

我要做的是使用两个电压源，v1，这是一个电阻器，而不是电感器。值 R1，值 R2。因此，我有一个通过分压器连接到正输入的电压，分压器。我将通过以下方式提供一些负反馈。

And what I am going to do is use two voltage sources, v1, and this is a resistor, not an inductor. And value R1, value R2. So, I have a voltage connected by a divider, voltage divider to the plus input. And I am going to provide some negative feedback in the following way.

这将是 R2，与这里的电阻 R1 相同。然后是电压源 v2，我将其连接到这里。所以请注意，哦，我在这里取出输出 vOUT。当然，vOUT 是相对于地的，而 R2、v1 和 v2 也连接到地。

This is going to be R2, the same as this one here, a resistor R1. And then a voltage source v2 that I connect out here. So notice that Oh, and I take the output vOUT out here. And that vOUT of course is with respect to ground, and R2, v1 and v2 are also connected to ground.

我要做的是用两种不同的方式分析电路，并在分析过程中向你们描述一些其他有趣的特性。在上一讲中，我用来分析运算放大器的技术是将运算放大器替换为其理想模型，该模型涉及一个依赖源等，增益 A 较大，并展示了这一点。

What I am going to do is analyze the circuit it two different ways, and as I analyze it describe some other interesting properties to you. In the last lecture the technique I used to analyze op amps was one in which I replaced the op amp with its ideal model involving a dependent source and so on with a large gain A and showed that.

我写了表达式，然后让 A 无限增加到极限，得到了一个与 A 无关的表达式。昨天的复习课上你们已经学习了另一种技术，它使分析运算放大器变得简单得多。让我快速回顾一下这种方法。我们亲切地称其为技术，它没有正式的名称，但我们亲切地称之为 v 加或多或少等于 v 减法。

I wrote the expression and then I let A increase to infinity to the limits and got an expression that was independent of A. And then in recitation yesterday you would have covered another technique which makes it much simpler to analyze op amps. Let me very quickly review that method. We fondly call that technique, there is no formal name for it, but we fondly call that v plus more or less equal to v minus method.

这种方法也有各种不同的叫法，比如虚拟接地法等等，但我们称之为 v plus 或多或少等于 v minus 法。这里的见解是，每当我使用运算放大器时，我都会给它负反馈，所以我会将输出的一部分馈送到它的负输入。我给它负反馈。这是一个属性。

This is also variously called the virtual ground method and so on, but we shall call it the v plus more or less equal to v minus method. The insight here is that whenever I use the op amp in a way in which I am giving it negative feedback, so I am feeding some portion of the output to its negative input. I am giving it negative feedback. That’s one property.

第二个特性是，我的输入 v1 和 v2 以及我的电阻值选择得当，使得输出不处于饱和状态。因此，运算放大器不在正 VS 轨或负 VS 轨。而是在其有源区域的中间某处。当发生这种情况时，我们声称运算放大器的 v 负和 v 正大致相等。

Second property is that my inputs, v1 and v2, and my resistance values are chosen such that the output is not in saturation. So, the op amp is not at the plus VS rail or minus VS rail. Rather it’s somewhere in the middle in its active region. When that happens we claim that the v minus and v plus for the op amp are more or less equal.

为了让您直观地了解为什么会这样，假设输出为 6 伏，我的电源为正负 12。这是 6 伏，放大器的增益为一百万，即十的六次方。要维持 6 伏的输出，我只需要 6 微伏的差值。六除以十的六次方就是 v 正值和 v 负值的差值。

And to give you some intuition as to why that is so, let’s say the output is 6 volts and my supply is plus/minus 12. This is 6 volts and the amplifier is a gain of a million, ten to the six. To sustain 6 volts at the output all I need is a difference of 6 microvolts here. Six divided by ten to the six is the difference between v plus and v minus.

它非常非常小。小到使 v 正或负大致相等。这里只需要一个非常小的差分电压就可以在输出端产生 6 伏电压。需要观察的关键是负反馈下，当运算放大器未处于饱和状态时，v 正等于 v 负的性质成立。它的工作原理并不是一个神奇的性质。

It’s very, very, very small. It’s so small as to make v plus more or less equal to v minus. All it takes is a very small differential voltage here to give you 6 volts at the output. The key thing to observe is under negative feedback, when the op amp is not in saturation the property that v plus equals v minus holds. And the way it works is that it’s not that it’s a magical property.

简单来说，当我应用负反馈时，负反馈会迫使此处的 v 减节点的电压与 v 正节点的电压大致相同。记住，如果有疑问，只需回过头来想想我们上次做的防抱死制动示例。例如，如果 v 正节点增加，输出将增加，此处的电压也将增加，并趋向于使这两个节点相等。

It is simply that when I apply negative feedback the negative feedback is such that it will force this v minus node here to be at more or less the same voltage as v plus. Remember the when in doubt simply go back and think about the anti lock brakes example we did last time. For example if v plus increases the output will increase and so will the voltage here and tend to make these two equal.

我们可以做的是，这里比较棘手，我们要做的是说看，如果我们知道在负反馈下运算放大器将设计这两个节点电压或多或少相等，那么为什么我不直接从这个事实开始并分析我的电路假设它是真的。

What we can do, being rather tricky here, what we’ll do is say look, if we know for a fact that under negative feedback the op amp is going to engineer these two node voltages to be more or less equal then why don’t I just use that fact to begin with and analyze my circuit assuming that it’s true.

这只是一点反向逻辑，说看，电路将实现这一点。如果电路将实现这一点，以分析电路的稳定状态，为什么我不直接假设这一点呢？这又回到了我们想成为工程师，做任何简单的事情，找到最简单的方法来实现目标。

This is just a bit of inverted logic here that says look, the circuit is going to make that happen. If the circuit is going to make that happen to analyze the circuit in its steady state, why don’t I just go ahead and assume that to begin with? This again goes back to us wanting to be engineers here and do whatever is simply and find the simplest possible way of getting some place.

我想使用那个方法，即 v 加等于 v 减法。让我先写下我知道的一些值。我知道 v 加在这里只是一个分压器关系。即 v1 乘以 R2 除以 R1 加 R2。通过 v 加等于 v 减法，我知道这将等于 v 减。

I want to use that method, the v plus equals v minus method. Let me just first write down some values that I know about. I know that v plus is simply a voltage divider relation here. That’s v1 times R2 divided by R1 plus R2. And by the v plus equals v minus method I know that this is going to be equal to v minus.

这是正确的，因为我在这里给你的是负反馈。我们将设计 R1、R2、v1 和 v2 的值，以使运算放大器不饱和。所以，我们知道这一点。接下来我们知道的是，假设这是电流 i。这个电流 I 流过这里。知道这里没有电流流入。

And this is going to be true because I am giving you negative feedback here. And we are going to engineer the values of R1, R2, v1 and v2 such that the op amp is not in saturation. So, we know that. The next thing that we know, let’s say this is a current i. This current I flows here. Know that there is no current going in here.

运算放大器具有无限大的输入电阻，因此没有任何东西进入其中。那里没有电流。如果这里没有电流，i 会发生什么？请记住，从宇宙的基础来看，麦克斯韦方程以及 KVL 和 KCL 都成立。KVL 和 KCL 直接来自大自然。你我都不能干扰它。如果你干扰它，就会有坏事发生。所以，大自然、麦克斯韦方程、KVL、KCL。

Op amp has an infinite input resistance so there is nothing going in there. There is no current going in there. If there is no current going in here, what must happen to i? Remember, from the foundations of the universe Maxwell’s equations and therefore KVL and KCL hold. KVL and KCL simply come straight from nature. You and I cannot mess with that. Bad things happen to you if you do. So, nature, Maxwell’s equations, KVL, KCL.

这只是自然现象。所以 KCL 适用于此。电流从这里流入。那里什么也没有。不要争论。电流必须流到这里，就这样。没有如果、并且或但是。I 从这里流入，那里什么也没有，所以电流必须流到这里。它别无选择。这是来自基本自然。我可以写下我的当前 I 将会是什么样子。I 将会是什么样子？好吧，我知道 v2，我知道 v 减。

It’s simply nature. So, KCL applies here. Current comes in here. Nothing goes there. Don’t argue. The current has to go here, period. No if, ands or buts. There is I coming in here, nothing goes there, so that current must flow here. It has no choice. It’s from basic nature. I can write down what my current I is going to look like. What is I going to look like? Well, I know v2, I know v minus.

V 减与 v 加相同。v 加是此处给出的 I 表达式。因此，我可以将 I 写为 v2 减 v 减除以 R1。让我跟踪这两个，然后继续计算 vOUT。

V minus is the same as v plus. And v plus is the I expression given here. So, I can write I as v2 minus v minus divided by R1. Let me keep track of those two and then go ahead and compute vOUT.

因此，我人生的目标是计算 vOUT 作为两个输入电压 v1 和 v2 的函数。为了好玩，我继续计算了一些中间节点电压和电流。我该如何写 vOUT？vOUT 是什么？vOUT 就是 v 减去 KVL。vOUT 就是 v 减去该电阻上的压降。

So, my goal in life is compute vOUT as a function of the two input voltages v1 and v2. And just for kicks I have gone ahead and computed some of the intermediate node voltages and currents. How do I write vOUT? What is vOUT? vOUT is simply v minus from KVL. vOUT is simply v minus the drop across this resistor.

因此，该电阻上的压降就是 iR2。根据第一讲中的 KVL，电压减去电阻上的压降等于 vOUT。因此，它就是 v 减去 iR2。我现在就告诉您，需要非常小心的一件事是，这里的输出与电阻 R2 上电压的反转有关。如果电阻上的电压影响 vOUT，并且带有负号，则要非常非常小心。请注意，iR2 是 R2 上的电压，而 vOUT 与该电压的负值有关。要非常小心。

So, the drop across that resistor is simply iR2. From good old KVL from the first lecture, a voltage minus the drop across the resistor is equal to vOUT. Therefore it’s simply v minus iR2. One thing to be very cautious about, I will tell you right now, is that the output here relates to the inversion of the voltage across this resistor R2. Be very, very careful in that if I have a voltage across this resistor here that impacts vOUT with a minus sign attached to it. Notice that iR2 is the voltage across R2 and vOUT relates to the negative of that. Be very cautious.

这是我见过人们在解决此类问题时犯的最常见愚蠢错误之一。让我们继续。我知道 v 减，但不知道 i。让我暂时代入 I，即 v2 减 v 减除以 R1 乘以 R2。让我继续收集所有的 v 减。v 减，我在这里得到一个 1，减号变成一个加号，所以我得到了 R2 除以 R1。

That’s one of the commonest silly mistakes I have seen people make in solving problems like this. Let’s go ahead. I know v minus and I don’t know i. Let me substitute for I for now, and that is v2 minus v minus divided by R1 times R2. Let me go ahead and collect all the v minuses. v minus, I get a one here, minus becomes a plus, and so I get R2 divided by R1 out there.

然后我减去 v2 R2 除以 R1。这就是 vOUT。现在让我继续代入 v 减。这仅仅是 v1 R2 除以 R1 加上 R2。这就是 v 减。这里的这个字符简化为 R1、R1 加上 R2 减去 v2 R2 除以 R1。我们得到什么？

And then I minus v2 R2 divided by R1. That is vOUT. Now let me go ahead and substitute for v minus. And that is simply v1 R2 divided by R1 plus R2. That is v minus. And this character here is simplified to be R1, R1 plus R2 minus v2 R2 divided by R1. What do we get?

我把这两个吸盘相消，最后得到的结果是 v1 R2 除以 R1 减去 v2 R2 除以 R1，也就是 R2/R1(v1 v2)。有趣的是，我最终构建的是一个非常原始的减法器。

I cancel these two suckers out and what I end up with is v1 R2 divided by R1 minus v2 R2 divided by R1, which is simply R2/R1(v1 v2). What is interesting here is that what I have ended up building is a very primitive subtractor.

因此，我的输出与 v1 减去 v2 乘以 R2 除以 R1 得出的常数因子有关。同样，正如我在本讲座开始时向你指出的那样，今天没有新的基础，没有新的理论，没有新的学科，没有新的定律。我们只是要把你学到的三个简单的东西，无限增益，无限输入电阻，零输出电阻，加上这个新的东西 v 加等于 v 减。

So, my output relates to v1 minus v2 multiplied by the constant factor given by R2 divided by R1. Again, as I pointed out to you at the beginning of this lecture, no knew foundations today, no new theories, no new disciplines, no new laws. We are just going to take what you have learned Three simple things, infinite gain, infinite input resistance, zero output resistance, plus this new thing v plus equals v minus.

只要掌握了这四项原则，我们就可以开始分析一堆电路了。今天，这纯粹是智力和应用。这是一种方法。还有另一种解决方法。我们可以解电路。记住，每当你看到一个线性电路，看到两个或三个源时，就想想叠加，对吧？当你看到一个线性电路和两个或三个源时，想想叠加。

And just being armed with those four principles we are just going to charge ahead and analyze a bunch of circuits. It is purely intellectual and pure applications today. This is one way of doing it. There is another way of solving it. We can solve the circuit. Remember, whenever you see a linear circuit and you see two sources or three sources, just think superposition, right? You see a linear circuit and two or three sources, think superposition.

我们应该能够将叠加应用到这个。运算放大器只是另一个构建块。它是一个线性电路。所以，让我们看看我们是否得到相同的答案。让我们尝试使用叠加来解决电路，看看我们是否得到相同的答案。要进行叠加，我要做的是构建两个子电路。一个子电路中的 v1 为零，该子电路如下所示。

We should be able to apply superposition to this. The op amp is simply another building block. It’s a linear circuit. So, let’s see if we get the same answer. Let’s try to solve the circuit using superposition and see if we get the same answer. To do superposition what I am going to do is build two subcircuits. One subcircuit in which v1 is zero, and that subcircuit looks like this.

如果我将 v1 设置为零，那么我得到的是 R1 并联 R2 接地。因此，如果将 v1 设置为零，那么 R1 接地。我在这里得到的是 R1 并联 R2。当然，我得到的是 v2，与之前一样。这是 R1，这是 R2，我将其称为 vOUT1。哦，对不起。让我将其称为 vOUT2，对应于与 v2 单独作用相关的输出分量。还记得叠加吗？

If I set v1 to be zero then I get R1 parallel R2 going to ground. So, if v1 is set to zero then R1 goes to ground. And I get R1 parallel R2 here. And of course I have v2 as before. And this was R1, this was R2, and let me call that vOUT1. Oh, I’m sorry. Let me call it vOUT2 corresponding to that component of the output that relates to v2 acting alone. Remember superposition?

构建两个子电路，一个依赖于 v2，另一个依赖于 v1。让我们也做第二个。第二个是 v2 趋于零。这是我的小运算放大器。我要做的就是简单地翻转运算放大器，看看你是否能识别出一些有趣的模式。只需翻转运算放大器。这是之前的 v1。

Build two subcircuits, one that depends on v2 and another one that depends on v1. Let’s do the second one, too. Second one is v2 going to zero. Here is my little op amp. And what I will do is simply flip the op amp just to see if you can identify some interesting patterns. Just flip the op amp around. And this is v1 as before.

回想一下，v1 通过电阻 R1 连接到正极节点。然后我将 R2 接地。然后让我将 v2 短接至地。当我将 v2 短接至地时会发生什么？当我将 v2 短接至地时，发生的事情是 R1 的尾部接地。

And recall that v1 was going to the plus node through a resistor R1. And then I had a R2 to ground. And then let me short v2 to ground. And when I short v2 to ground what happens? When I short v2 to ground what happens is that the tail of R1 here goes to ground.

因此，输出就像通过电阻连接到节点 v 负，输出就像通过电阻连接到负输入。我们将这样画。负输入通过电阻 R1 接地。

And so it is as if the output is connected to the node v minus through a resistor, so it as if the output v R2 is connected to the minus input through a resistor. We will draw it like this. And the minus input goes through a resistor R1, to ground.

如果您认为模式在课程早期的分压器模式、分流器模式和放大器模式、源极跟随器模式中很重要，那么运算放大器就是模式。您应该记住两三个简单的模式，并且能够通过观察写下这些模式的表达式。所以，这是您在第一堂课中见过的一种常见模式。

If you thought that patterns were important in the earlier part of the course doing voltage divider patterns and current divider patterns and amplifier pattern, the source follower pattern, op amps is all about patterns. You should remember two or three simple patterns and be able to write down the expression for those just by observation. So, this is one common pattern that you have seen before in the very first lecture.

我只是用这种方式写下来。让我继续解决这个电路。事实证明，这也是一种模式。我今天会分析它，但将来 v2 会通过 R1 到达这个节点，然后通过 R2 到达输出。你可能也在复习课上看到过这个。这被称为反相连接，而这里的这被称为非反相连接。

And I just wrote it down in that manner. Let me go ahead and solve this circuit. It turns out that this is also a pattern. I will analyze it today but in the future v2 going to this node through R1 and then R2 to the output. You have probably also seen this in your recitation. This one is called an inverting connection and this one here is called a non inverting connection.

我们继续计算 vOUT2。vOUT2 的计算公式如下，注意，由于这是地线，这里没有电流流过，所以电压为零。如果电压为零，根据 v 加等于 v 减的方法，电压为零。如果电压为零，流经此处的电流为 v2 除以 R1。同样的电流也必须流过电阻 R2。

Let’s go ahead and do vOUT2. vOUT2 is simply given by, notice that since this is ground, no current flowing here, this voltage is zero. If this voltage is zero, this voltage is zero by the v plus equals v minus method. If this is zero, the current that goes through here is v2 divided by R1. And that same current must flow through the resistance R2 as well.

如果电流 v2 除以 R1 流过该电阻，则该电阻上的压降等于，让我先隐藏一下，等于 v2。因此，v2 除以 R1 就是这里的电流。这是零。因此，该电阻上的压降等于 v2 R1 乘以 R2。这是该电阻上的压降。该电压等于零减去电阻上的压降。

If the current v2 divided by R1 flows through this resistor, the drop across this resistor is simply given by, let me hide this for a second, is simply given by v2. So, v2 divided by R1 is the current here. This is zero. So, the drop across this resistor is v2 R1 multiplied by R2. That’s a drop across this resistor. This voltage is simply zero minus a drop across the resistor.

因此，它是零减去电阻两端的压降，得到 v2。再次提醒，当我想转换它以获得输出电压时，这个减号会出现。这是一种非常常见的模式。它被称为反相连接，其中输出是输入电压的某个因子，该因子由 R2 除以 R1 给出。现在让我们继续分析这个家伙。vOUT1 等于多少？

So, it’s zero minus the drop across the resistor and that gives me v2. Again, remember this minus sign comes in when I want to convert this to get the output voltage from that. This is a very common pattern. It’s called an inverting connection where the output is some factor of the input voltage and the factor is given by R2 divided by R1. Let’s go ahead and analyze this guy now. What is vOUT1 equal to?

我应该将其称为 vOUT1，因为它与 v1 相关。vOUT1。这里有 av plus。从我们的第一堂课中，我知道 vOUT1 与 v plus 的关系如下。我知道它是 v plus 乘以电阻之和除以 R1。根据第一堂课，这是正确的。

I should have called this vOUT1 because it relates to v1. vOUT1. There is a v plus here. From our first lecture I know that vOUT1 relates to v plus in the following way. I know that it is v plus times the sum of the resistances divided by R1. Based on the first lecture this is true.

VOUT1 只是 v plus 的放大版本，放大倍数由 R1 加 R2 除以 R1 得出。我知道 v plus 在这里只是一个分压器动作。我可以在这里采取简单的分压器动作，因为流入的电流为零。从这里看，这就像是一个无限电阻，所以好像这个元件根本不存在。

VOUT1 is simply an amplified version of v plus where the amplification factor is given by R1 plus R2 divided by R1. And I know v plus is simply a voltage divider action here. And I can take a simple voltage divider action here because the current going in is zero. Looking in here this is as if it’s an infinite resistance, so it is as if the element simply does not exist.

这里的电压就是 v1 除以 R1 加上 R2 乘以 R2，这是我们的分压器模式。因此，我得到 v1 乘以 R2 除以 R1 加上 R2 乘以 R1 加上 R2 除以 R1。这两个值抵消，得到的 vOUT1 就是 v1 R2 除以 R1。为了得到 vOUT，我将两者相加。vOUT 就是 vOUT1 加上 vOUT2，这是我的目标。

The voltage here is simply v1 divided by R1 plus R2 multiplied by R2, our voltage divider pattern. So, I get v1 times R2 divided by R1 plus R2 times R1 plus R2 divided by R1. These two cancel out which gives me vOUT1 is simply v1 R2 divided by R1. To get vOUT I add up the two. vOUT is vOUT1 plus vOUT2, which is my goal.

这只是 v1 R2 乘以 R1 减去 v2 R2 乘以 R1。幸运的是，我们这里得到的和这里是一样的。同样，我今天要讲的其实没什么新东西。只需应用、应用、应用四个简单的原则。这里我使用了叠加，并向你展示了一个电路。所以，事实证明，对于运算放大器，你应该真正记住这个模式。你会一次又一次地看到它。

And that is simply v1 R2 by R1 minus v2 R2 by R1. Thankfully what we have here is the same as here. Again, there is really nothing new that I am going to cover today. Simply apply, apply, apply, four simple principles. Here I have used superposition and I am showing you a circuit. So, it turns out with op amps you should really remember that pattern. You will see it again and again and again.

每次看到它，你都可以节省六分钟的时间，而不必在不知道模式的情况下解决电路问题。所以，记住这个模式。通过记住这个模式，你可以再节省三到四分钟。这个模式就是 v2 R2 除以 R1。把这两个模式印在你的脑子里。好的，这些是使用运算放大器的几个简单电路。我们建立了一个减法器。

And each time you see it, it will save you six minutes of having to solve the circuit without knowing the pattern. So, remember this pattern. You can pick up another three or four minutes by remembering this pattern here. This pattern is simply v2 R2 divided by R1. Imprint those two patterns into your brains. OK, so those are a couple of simple circuits using the op amp. We built a subtractor.

下一步，让我们继续尝试构建一个积分器。使用这个小构建块，我们可以继续尝试构建一堆电路。我们可以构建滤波器、A 到 D 转换器等等。让我们构建一个积分器。抽象地说，我需要构建这个盒子。当输入一个 vI 时，我希望这个盒子进行积分，并给我一个 vO，它是 vI 随时间积分的结果。这就是我想要构建的。

The next step, let’s go ahead and try to build an integrator. Using this little building block we can go ahead and try to build a bunch of circuits. We can build filters, A to D converters and so on. Let’s build an integrator. Abstractly I need to build this box. Which when fed a vI want that box to integrate and give me a vO which is vI integrated over time. That is what I want to build.

我该如何构建它？接下来我想做的是给你一些设计灵感。你如何用运算放大器设计东西？既然你还不知道这个模式，你如何设计东西？好吧，让我们从以下直觉开始。

How do I go about building it? What I would like to do next is give you some flavor for design. How do you go about designing things with an op amp? Knowing that you do not know the pattern for this yet, how do you go about designing things? Well, let’s start with the following intuition.

我一开始的直觉是，如果我有电流 i，请记住电容器和电感器与之相关，当我们处理电容器和电感器时，您会看到微分和积分。所以，我认为我们必须在这里调用一个电容器或一个电感器。在这个例子中，我调用了一个电容器。注意，如果我在这里放一个电容器，这个电流是 i，电容 C，那么我的电压 vO 由什么给出？

The intuition that I begin with is that if I have a current i, and remember that capacitors and inductors related to, you saw differentiation and integration happening when we dealt with capacitors and inductors. So, I think we have to invoke a capacitor here or an inductor. In this example I invoke a capacitor. Notice that if I stick a capacitor in here this current is i, capacitance C, then my voltage vO is given by what?

电压只是流过它的电流的积分，反之亦然。I 是 C dv/dt。如果 I 是 C dv/dt，那么 v 就是一乘以 C 的积分。如果我可以让电流通过电容器，那么电容器两端的电压一定是电流。请注意，vO 与 I dt 相关。

Voltage is simply the integral of the current flowing through it or vice versa I is C dv/dt. If I is C dv/dt then v is simply one by C integral. If I can pass the current through a capacitor then the voltage across the capacitor must be a current. Notice then that vO is related to I dt.

我有一些乘法常数等等，但从根本上讲，我发现如果我能让电流通过电容器，那么电容器两端的电压与电流的积分有关。好的，这很有趣。所以，我有一个积分。但我有电流。注意我的目标是积分电压。我弄清楚了如何做的是，如果我能把电压变成电流

I have some multiplying constants and so on, but fundamentally what I have found is if I can stick a current through a capacitor then the voltage across the capacitor relates to the integral of the current. OK, that’s interesting. So, I have an integral in there. But I have a current. Notice my goal was to integrate a voltage. What I figured out how to do was if I can turn that voltage into a current

如果我能将该电压转换为成比例的电流，然后将该电流泵入电容器，我将获得我想要的积分。如何将 vI 转换为 i？我该怎么做？好吧，让我们试一试。这是我的 vI。让我们取电阻器 R。记住我需要将电容器粘在这里。我这里有一些电流 I。我还不知道电流是多少。

If I can turn that voltage into a proportional current and then pump that current through a capacitor I will get the integration that I want. How do I convert my vI to i? How do I do that? Well, let’s take a stab at it. Here is my vI. Let’s take the resistor R. And remember I need to stick the capacitor here. I have some current I here. I don’t know what the current is yet.

我在这里放置一个电压。我想做的是看看如果我将电压和电阻串联起来，电流和电压之间是否存在某种关系。回想一下，我试图让这个电流与电压 vI 成正比。但事实证明，这里的 I 不等于 vI 除以 R。

And I stick a voltage here. And what I am trying to do is trying to see if I stick a voltage and a resistance in series then there is some relationship between the current and this voltage. Recall that I am trying to make this current be directly proportional to the voltage vI. But it turns out that I here is not equal to vI divided by R.

如果我是 vI 除以 R，那么就完成了。如果我是 vI 除以 R，通过某种魔法，那么我已经将电压转换为电流，我将电流通过电容器，vO 就是我要寻找的积分。但不幸的是，I 不等于 vI 除以 R。你知道的。I 与 vI 减去电容器电压除以 R 有关。

If I was vI divided by R somehow, I am done. If I was vI divided by R, by some magic, then I have converted my voltage to a current, I feed that current through my capacitor and vO is my integral that I am looking for. But unfortunately I is not equal to vI divided by R. You know that. I relates to vI minus the capacitor voltage divided by R.

因此，I 并非永远只是 vI 除以 R，而是实际上 vI 减去电容电压除以 R。事实上，当我们做 RC 电路时，你会写下这个方程来表示电路的动态，RC dvO 除以 dt 加上 vO 等于 vI。我们写下这个一阶 RC 电路，写下这个一阶 RC 电路的方程。

So, I is not simply vI divided by R for all time but I is really vI minus the capacitor voltage divided by R. And, in fact, when we did RC circuits you wrote this equation to represent the dynamics of the circuit, RC dvO by dt plus vO equals vI. We wrote down this circuit for a first order RC, wrote this equation for a first order RC circuit.

现在，事实证明，为了结束我们之前进行的徒劳无功的追逐，事实证明，如果这里的这个项比那个项大得多。如果这个项比那个项大得多，那么我可以忽略那个项，并写下 RC dvO x dt 大致等于 vI。

Now, it does turn out, to wrap up on this wild goose chase that we went on, it does turn out that if this term here is much bigger than that term. If this term is much bigger than that term then I can ignore that term and write down RC dvO by dt more or less equal to vI.

如果那是真的，那么这个就是真的，然后 vO 或多或少会等于 1 乘以 vI dt 的 RC 积分。同样，如果这是真的。如果这一直都是真的，那么 vO 就是 vI dt 的积分。再次提醒，记住这都是徒劳无功的。只需在那里写下 WGC，这样你就不会感到困惑。

If that were true, this would be true, and then vO would be more or less equal to one by RC integral of vI dt. Again, if this were true. If this were true for all time then vO would be integral of vI dt. Again, remember this is all a wild goose chase. Just write down WGC there just so you don’t get confused.

我在这里徒劳无功地寻找一种方法，从电压中获取电流，然后将其馈入电容器。这是我所知道的一件事，但这不是我想要的。但当 vO 非常非常小时，这确实是我想要的。所以，我看到了一些希望的曙光，但并不完全如此。

I am on this wild goose hunt here trying to find a way to get a current from a voltage which I can then feed into a capacitor. This was one thing I knew, but this was not what I want. But it does turn out to be what I want when vO is very, very small. So, I see some glimmer of hope but not quite.

结果是，在 R 和 C 中，如果我将 R 和 C 做得非常非常大，如果我有一个巨大的时间常数，在一个巨大的时间常数下，电压 vO 看起来就像 vI 的积分，但只有当我有一个非常大的时间常数时才如此。所以，我放弃了那条路。相反，我尝试了其他方法。再试一次。

It turns that in R and C, if I make R and C very, very big, if I have a huge time constant, with a huge time constant the voltage vO looks like an integral of vI, but only when I have a very huge time constant. So, I give up on that track. Instead I try something else. Another try.

我想让你注意一下，如果你拿来你的运算放大器，这是你的运算放大器，如果你拿来这个运算放大器，并将正极接地，在合理的反馈下，在合理的负反馈下，你会注意到电流有什么变化吗？如果我有电流 I 流过这里，你会注意到什么？看看这张图片。

I would like you to notice if you take your op amp, here is your op amp, if you take this op amp and you stick the positive terminal to ground, under reasonable feedback, under reasonable negative feedback what do you notice about the current? If I had a current I flowing here what did you notice? Look at this picture.

这里有电流 I 流入，v2 除以 R1。由于这个电阻是无穷大，所以所有电流都流过上端。所以，这是零伏。根据 v 加等于 v 减的方法，这也大致等于零。这里有电流 I 流入，这里什么也没有，所以 I 必须流到那里。

I had a current I flowing in here, v2 divided by R1. And because this resistance was infinite all the current went through the upper terminal. So, this is zero volts. And by the v plus equals v minus method this is also more or less equal to zero. And I have a current I flowing in here, nothing goes here, so then the I must flow up there.

所以，我在这里所做的就是引起来自这个接地节点的电流的反射。我的电流在通过这个边缘后被反射到这里的上边缘，或者说偏转。这很有趣。我们离关键的洞察只有一步之遥了。我有一个 I 从这里进来，一个 I 从那里出去。注意，正如我之前所说，这是零伏。

So, all I am doing here is causing a reflection of the current from this grounded node. My current is being reflected into, or deflected if you feel like it, the upper edge here after coming in through this edge. That is interesting. We are just one step away from the key insight. I have an I coming in here, an I going out there. Notice that, as I said before, this is zero volts.

如何让电压 vI 看起来像电流，与电流成比例？现在很简单。我只需设置一个电压 vI 并在那里放置一个电阻 R。如果我这样做，并且由于它为零，电流 I 等于 vI 除以 R。我已经达到了我想要的效果。

How do I get my voltage vI to look like a current, to become proportional to a current? It is simple now. All I do is put a voltage vI and put a resistor R out there. If I do that, and since this is zero, the current I is given by vI divided by R. I have gotten to where I want to be.

因此，通过使用运算放大器，并利用这里的负节点（当存在负反馈时，v 负与 v 正处于相同的电位）这一事实，我可以在这里放置一个电阻。由于这是零，因此这里的电流就是 vI 除以 R。我已经得到了第一个结果。

So, by using an op amp and using the fact that the minus node here, v minus is at the same potential as v plus when there is negative feedback then I can stick a resistor here. And because this is zero the current here is simply vI divided by R. I have gotten to the first place.

现在我需要做的就是将电流泵入电容器，然后我得到电压的积分，电压变成电流的积分。这很容易。我把电容器放在这里，然后我得到的答案就是 vO。注意，当我这样做时，假设这是正/负 VC。这是零。所以，vO 是负 VC。

Now all I need to do is simply pump this current through a capacitor and I get the integral of the, the voltage becomes an integral of the current. That is easy. I stick my capacitor here and I get my answer out there as vO. Notice that when I do this, let’s say this is plus/minus VC. This is zero. So, vO is minus VC.

再次强调，在整个课程中，我大概会强调 17 次，如果这是零，那么这里的输出与这个电压的负数有关，这是很常见的错误。如果我看到这个错误出现在未来的任何家庭作业或期末考试中，我会非常沮丧。这不应该发生。所以，vO 在这里是减号 VC。

Again, I will keep emphasizing it maybe 17 times throughout this course that if this is zero then the output here is related to the negative of this voltage, common, common, common mistake. I will be very upset after doing all this if I see this mistake happen in any of the future homeworks or finals or whatever. This should not happen. So, vO is a minus sign here VC.

我知道，如果电流 I 通过电容器，VC 是多少？如果电流 I 通过电容器，那么这仅仅是 t I dt。而 I 的设计是，所以，我有积分器。这是一个两步过程。我在这里放了一个电阻，所以电流等于 vI 除以 R。

And I know that if I have a current I through a capacitor what is VC? If I have current I through a capacitor than this is simply t I dt. And I by design is So, I have my integrator. It is a two step process. I stuck a resistor here, so the current became equal to vI divided by R.

然后我把这个电流通过这个端子泵入一个电容器，电流为 I 时电容器两端的电压由这个表达式给出。这是电容器 101。好的，电容器 101 说电容器两端的电压就是 1 乘以 C 的积分 I dt。另一种看待它的方式是电容器两端的电压是 C，对不起，流过电容器的电流是 C dv/dt。

Then I took that current and pumped it through a capacitor through this terminal here, and the voltage across the capacitor for a current I is given by this expression. This is Capacitors 101. OK Capacitors 101 says that the voltage across the capacitor is simply one by C integral I dt. Another way of looking at it is the voltage across the capacitor is C, I’m sorry, the current through a capacitor is C dv/dt.

这只是该方程的积分形式。我的积分器已经完成了。所以，这是另一个非常常见的构建块。记住这一点。我们将看到的大多数带有运算放大器的电路只是这里涉及一些东西，那里涉及一些东西。并且此反相连接中的输出是输出乘以，如果它是一个电阻，它只是 R2 除以 R1，如果它是一个电容器，我得到的积分形式如下所示。

This is simply the integral form of that equation. And I am done with my integrator. So, this is another very common building block. Remember this. Most of the circuits we will be seeing with op amps simply involve something here and some there. And the output in this inverting connection is the output times, if it is a resistance it is simply R2 divided by R1, if it’s a capacitor I get the integral form looking like this.

是的。有人能告诉我负号去哪儿了吗？黑板上写满了。好主意。在讲了这么多关于注意负号的课之后。在犯了这么一点小错误之后，如果你们犯了那个错误，我会加倍生气。好吧。现在我们已经建立了积分器，我可以把它作为家庭作业问题。你应该能够根据你在这里学到的知识设计一个微分器。

Yes. Can someone tell me where the negative sign went? The blackboard ate it up. Good catch. After all that lecture about watching the negative sign. And you should be able to design a differentiator based on what you’ve learned here.

现在您已经拥有了进行此类设计的工具，但我们没有其他作业了，所以我想我会继续为您解决这个问题并为您进行设计。我们需要的构建块如下所示，d/dt 在此处。让我拿一个 vI 并将它粘在那里。这就是我想要构建的。我在这里构建的是不同的积分器盒。

You now have the tools to go and do some design like this, but we don’t have any more homeworks left so I guess I will go ahead and solve this for you right here and do the design for you. 我现在想做的是构建一个微分器盒。我该怎么做呢？我会慢慢讲，这样你们就有时间自己思考，看看你们是否已经是精通运算放大器电路的设计师，是否拥有正确的直觉。再说一次，当你看到微分积分时，想想电容器或电感器，这并不重要。

And what I would like to do now is build a differentiator box. How do I go about doing it? I will go really slow here so you will have some time to think about it for yourselves and see if you folks are crack op amp circuit designers already, if you have the right instincts here. Again, when you see differentiation integration think capacitors or inductors, it doesn’t matter.

事实上，作为一项家庭作业练习，你可能想回过头来看看如何使用电感器获得类似的效果。你能用电感器玩弄并获得类似的效果吗？所以，电感器是电容器的对偶器件。无论我们用电容器做什么，电感器都必须有相应的方法。你可以在业余时间尝试一下。让我们回到这里的这个。

In fact, as a homework exercise, you may want to go back and see how you can get a similar effect using inductors. Can you play with inductors and get a similar effect? So, inductors are devices that are a dual of the capacitor. Whatever we will do with capacitors, there must be a corresponding way with inductors. You can try it out in your spare time. Let’s go back to this one here.

我将坚持使用电容器的观察方法。我现在需要进行区分。记住这一点。如果我有一个 vI，我将它放在一个电容器上，我有电流 C 和电容器上的某个电压 vc，我与什么相关？I 就是 C dv/dt，而 vc 在这种情况下就是 C dvI/dt。

I will stick with the capacitor way of looking at things. I need a differentiation now. Remember this. If I have a vI and I stick this across a capacitor, I have a current C and some voltage vc across the capacitor, what does I relate to? I is simply C dv/dt and vc in this case is simply C dvI/dt.

如果我可以将电压固定在电容器上，如果我的输入电压固定在电容器上，那么产生的电流与 dvI/dt 有关。这里我们有一个相反的问题。通过这个简单的技巧，我可以获得具有正确形式的电流。现在我需要做的是以某种方式将该电流转换为电压，因为我需要的抽象是电压到电压。

If I can stick a voltage across a capacitor, if my input voltage is stuck across a capacitor then the resulting current relates to dvI/dt. Here we have the opposite problem. By doing this simple trick, I can obtain a current that has the right form. Now what I need to do is somehow convert that current into a voltage because the abstraction that I need is a voltage to voltage.

下一步，我需要做的是以某种方式将电流转换为电压。我该怎么做呢？再次记住，对于运算放大器，如果这里有电流 I 流过，那么由于反射特性，I 会被推到这个边缘，前提是整个电路都在下降的负反馈下工作。有了这个技巧，我能做的就是说，看，假设我这样做了。

The next step, what I need to do is somehow convert a current to a voltage. How do I go about doing that? Again, remember for the op amp, if I have a current I flowing here then by the reflection property I gets pushed up into this edge, provided that the whole circuit is working with descent negative feedback. Given this trick what I can do is say look, suppose I did this.

记住，我的目标是如何将电流转换为电压？我有电流 I 流入这里，我可以将其转换为电压，因为我知道电流必须从这里流出，我知道这个电流必须从那里流出。我所要做的就是在那里放一个电阻。如果我在那里放一个电阻，vO 等于多少？vO 就是 iR，对吗？没错。

Remember, my goal here is how do I convert a current to a voltage? I have a current I coming in here, and I can turn that into a voltage because I know the current must come out here, I know this current must come out there. All I have to do is stick a resistor in there. If I stick a resistor in there what is vO equal to? vO is simply iR, right? That’s right.

VO，我在这里得到 I，因此 I 从这里泵出。请记住，进入这里的电流必须反射回来，因为进入这里的电流为零。所有的 I 都必须从这里流出。因此，我必须通过这个电阻泵出。这个电阻上的压降是 iR。这就是电阻上的电压降。由于这是虚拟接地，因此这里的输出就是零减去这个压降，也就是减去 iR。

VO, I get I here, so I pumps through here. Remember, what comes in here must get reflected up because the current going in here is zero. All the I must come out here. So, that I must pump through this resistor. The drop across this resistor is iR. That’s the voltage drop across that resistor. And since this at a virtual ground the output here is simply zero minus this drop which is minus iR.

所以，我已经达到了我想要的目标。我将电流转换为电压。我获取了电流，然后通过在这里插入一个电阻器将其转换为电压。最后一步，我只需要产生电流。这很容易做到。抽象地说，我需要做的是，再次强调，这是设计，所以我们将讨论抽象的东西。

So, I have gotten to where I want to be. I have my current I being converted to a voltage. I have taken my current, and I have been able to convert that into a voltage by sticking a resistor in here. As a final step, I simply need to produce the current. And that is pretty easy to do. Abstractly what I need to do, again, this is design here so we will talk about abstract stuff.

如果我有电压 vI，则需要产生与 C dvI/dt 相关的电流。我知道我只需这样做就可以做到这一点。通过这样做，我知道我的 I 是 C dvI，对吗？如果我能得到这种效果，我会将其放在引号中，因为这是我的模式。我正在寻找一种模式，其中电压 vI 直接施加在电容器上。当发生这种情况时，电流与 C dv/dt 相关。

If I had a voltage vI need to produce a current which relates to C dvI/dt. And I know I can do that by simply doing this. By doing this I know my I is C dvI, correct? If I can get this effect, I put this in quotes because that’s my pattern. I am looking for a pattern, where a voltage vI is directly applied across a capacitor. And when that happens the current relates to C dv/dt.

让我们回到这里的运算放大器模式，运算放大器电路。到目前为止，我已经实现了这一点，我只是在那里重复了这一点。因此，我需要以某种方式采用这个模式，并从中学习并在这里应用这个模式。那么，我能做的是，这是一个接地节点，对吗？现在，可怜的小电容器，它关心什么，它是接地节点还是虚拟接地节点？

Let’s go back to our op amp pattern here, op amp circuit. So far I have achieved I just repeated this out there. And so somehow I need to take this pattern here and learn from that pattern and apply the pattern here. So, what I can do is, this is a ground node, correct? Now, the poor little capacitor, what does it care, whether it’s a ground node or a virtual ground node?

只要这里是零伏节点，它又在乎什么呢？我要做的是把这个点粘在这里，不是这里，而是虚拟接地节点。我要抓住那个点，把它拿到这里，然后粘在这里。可怜的小电容器不知道区别。我真的把这个小家伙给骗了。这是 vI。记住这一点。我通过电容器的 I 与 C dv/dt 成正比。

As long as it’s a zero volt node down here what does it care? What I am going to do is stick this point, not here but into a virtual ground node. I am going to grab that point, take it here and stick it here. The poor little capacitor doesn’t know the difference. I have really suckered the little beast. This is vI. Remember this. My I through the capacitor is proportional to C dv/dt.

相反，我所做的是把这个东西粘在这里，得到类似这样的结果。只要记住这四五个小技巧。然后你一次又一次地将它们应用到运算放大器电路中。所以，这是 vI，这是我的虚拟地。就这个可怜的小电容器而言，它以为自己连接到地，正在愉快地运转。

Instead what I have done is taken this guy and stuck it here to get something like this. Just remember these four or five little tricks. And you apply them in op amp circuits again and again and again and again. So, this is vI, this is my virtual ground. As far as this poor little capacitor is concerned, it is chugging along merrily thinking that it is connected to ground.

它几乎不知道这只是一个虚拟接地，对吧？但这里的电流 I 只是 C dvI/dt。而那个电流，即 C dvI/dt，那个电流流过这里并给我 vO 作为 iR。所以，vO 只是减去 R。让我用 C dvI/dt 代替那里的 I。好的，那么请注意，我的 vO 现在与 dvI/dt 成比例。所以，vO 是某个 RC 时间常数乘以 dvI/dt。因此，我有我的微分电路。

Little does it know it is only a virtual ground, all right? But the current I here is simply C dvI/dt. And that current, the C dvI/dt, that current flows through here and gives me vO as iR. So, vO is simply minus R. Let me substitute for I there, C dvI/dt. OK, so notice then that my vO is now proportional to dvI/dt. So, vO is some RC time constant times dvI/dt. Therefore, I have my differentiator circuit.

记住这一点作为结束语。记住这个 v 加或多或少等于 v 减的技巧。尽可能简单地使用这个技巧来分析反馈下的运算放大器电路，而不是饱和的运算放大器电路。只要记住这两个。快速演示一下，我这里有一个方波输入到运算放大器，这是我的积分器的 vI。这是输出 vO。

Remember this as a closing thought. Remember this v plus more or less equal to v minus trick. And to the extent possible simply use that trick to analyze op amp circuits under feedback and not in saturation. Just remember these two. Very quickly for the demo, I have a square wave input here to the op amp, that’s my vI to the integrator. And this is the output vO.

如您所见，方波的积分是三角波。我们将对微分器执行相同的操作。对于微分器，我将方波输入到此微分器电路。我得到这个，无论哪里有急剧上升，我都会得到这个巨大的负尖峰和一个正尖峰，因为有负号。所以，这是微分器电路。然后我将其输入运算放大器。好的。谢谢。

The integral of a square wave is a triangular wave, as you can see. And we will do the same thing for a differentiator. And for the differentiator, I input the square wave to this differentiator circuit. And I get this, wherever there is a sharp rise, I get this huge negative spike and a positive spike because of the minus sign. So, this is the differentiator circuit. Then I feed this into the op amp. OK. Thank you.

Lec 21 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 21 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 51:14 https://youtube.com/watch?v=ke3SL_R92ys

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 51:14 https://youtube.com/watch?v=ke3SL_R92ys

介绍

Introduction

好的。大家早上好。你们有两份讲义、讲义和一篇关于混合信号芯片的文章。混合信号代表同时具有模拟和数字元件的电路。我给你们讲义的原因是实验 4 和你们的最后一份作业涉及设计和构建混合信号电路。这是一项非常有趣的练习。

All right. Good morning, all. You have two handouts, lecture notes and an article on mixed signal chips. A mixed signal stands for circuits that have both analog and digital components to them. The reason I am giving you the handout is that Lab 4 and also your last homework involve designing and building a mixed signal circuit. It’s a real fun exercise.

我只是想告诉你，根据过去的经验，参加过 6.002 课程的人通常认为最后一个实验室是他们在 6.002 课程中做过的最有趣的事情。所以，当你进入实验室 4 时，你应该告诉自己我应该玩得开心，我应该玩得开心，我应该玩得开心。你必须积极地激励自己。否则，它就会过去。

And I just wanted to tell you that from past experience people who have taken 6.002 often view the last lab as the single most fun thing they did in all of 6.002. So, as you go into Lab 4, you should be telling yourself I should be having fun, I should be having, I should be having fun. You have to positively psych yourself. Otherwise, it’s going to go by.

然后你会说，这太有趣了，我希望自己能好好享受做这件事的那一刻。好吧。让我们看看。我们今天做什么？今天的讲座实际上会很有趣。我们将快速讲解很多有趣的事情。有些事情你完全没有准备。到目前为止，在上两节关于运算放大器的讲座中，我们讨论了负反馈。

And then you’re going to say boy, that was fun, I wish I had savored the moment as I was doing it. All right. Let’s see. What do we do today? Today’s lecture is actually going to be a fair amount of fun. We are going to blast through a bunch of fun things. And some things that you will be quite unprepared for. Until now, in the last two lectures with op amps we talked about negative feedback.

就是将输出电压的一部分施加到负输入端，这样我就可以控制这个高度敏感的设备，我的运算放大器。今天，我们要做的就是尝试了解如果我们使用正反馈会发生什么。这通常是好奇的孩子。你告诉他们这样做，他们当然也会尝试这样做。

That is applying some portion of the output voltage to the negative input so that I could control this high strung device, my op amp. Today, what we are going to do is try to get a handle on what happens if we use positive feedback. It’s the usual curious child. You tell them to do this, and of course they’re going to try to do this as well.

我们将尝试这样做，看看会发生什么，看看我们是否可以构建一些有用的电路。今天，为了激励大家，让我快速回顾一下现在应该以标准模式固定在你们大脑中的电路。

And we are going to try to do that and see what happens and look to see if we can build some useful circuits. Today As motivation, let me do a quick review of a circuit that should now become affixed in your brains in a standard pattern.

负面和正面反馈

Negative and positive feedback

这是一个提供负反馈的电路。R1 和 R2。我应用了一个 vIN。现在你应该能够看到这个模式了。

This is a circuit that gives you negative feedback. R1 and R2. And I apply a vIN. By now you should be able to look at this pattern.

这是您的反相放大器模式。因此，您应该能够通过检查记下这只是 vIN 或减去 vIN 乘以 R2 除以 R1。这是一个放大器，其增益由 R2 和 R1 的比率控制。这是一个负反馈电路，因为做直觉的事情总是很有趣，并且说看，如果这个电压趋向于比我关心的更正，那么这个负输入就会比我关心的更正。

And this is your inverting amplifier pattern. So, you should be able to write down by inspection this is simply vIN or the minus vIN times R2 divided by R1. This is an amplifier whose gain is controlled by the ratio of R2 and R1. This is a negative feedback circuit because it is always fun to do the intuition thing and say that look, if this voltage tends to go more positive than I care then this negative input goes more positive than I care.

如果该值变得更正，则负输入 v minus 在正输入中变得更正，从而将输出拉低。因此，存在一个很好的抵消力，可保持输出稳定。让我们看看这个电路。作为好奇的工程师，让我们看看这里的相反情况，我在这个运算放大器中给自己一些正反馈。

If that goes more positive then the negative input v minus becomes more positive in the plus input which yanks the output down. So, there is a nice counteracting force that keeps the output stable. Let’s look at this circuit. Being curious engineers, let’s look at the opposite here where I give myself some positive feedback in this op amp.

分析这一点将会很有趣，因为我们从表面上看到的并不是它的实际行为。今天我们将花大部分时间去理解这种电路的动态，看看我们能否基于这种正反馈构建一些有趣的电路和系统。

And it is going to be interesting to analyze this because what we find out on the face of it is not quite actually how it behaves. We are going to spend most of the lecture today on understanding the dynamics of circuits that look like this and to see if we can build some fun and interesting circuits and systems based on this kind of positive feedback.

这是正反馈，因为我将输出的一部分反馈给了正输入。你应该能够盯着这个，并且已经开始直觉地知道会发生什么。让我们想一想。这是零。记住，有了正反馈，著名的 v 加等于 v 减方法就不再适用了。让我们应用非常简单的分析。

It is positive feedback because I am feeding back a portion of the output to the positive input. And you should be able to stare at this and already begin to intuit what should happen to this. Let’s think about it. This is zero. Remember, with positive feedback, the famous v plus is equal to v minus method doesn’t apply anymore. Let’s apply very simple analyses.

如果该值为零，那么假设该输出趋向于稍微正一些。由于某些噪声或扰动，该输出趋向于稍微上升。如果该输出稍微上升，则由于反馈，该节点趋向于稍微上升。

If this is zero, let’s say for example that this output tends to go a little bit more positive. This output, due to some noise or perturbation, tends to go up a little bit. If that goes up a little bit then because of feedback this node tends to go up a little bit.

如果这个节点有上升趋势，就会加剧这里的正输入，而这个节点就会突然冲撞到正极轨上。让我们从另一个角度直观地看待它。如果这个节点试图下降一点会怎么样？如果它下降一点，那么正极端的输入也会下降一点。

If this node tends to go up a little bit this exacerbates the positive input here and this one goes cachunk, whacks into the positive rail. Let’s take the other point of view and look at it intuitively. What if this one tries to droop a little bit? If it droops a little bit then the input at the plus terminal droops a little bit.

如果这个趋势稍微下降，输出就会进一步下降，并进入负轨。我可以看到，由于正反馈，这个电路想要进入正轨或进入负轨。这就像你一直给予令人难以置信的积极反馈，我说的积极反馈是指鼓励孩子做他们正在做的事情的反馈。

If that tends to go down a little bit, that makes the output droop further and it goes and hits into the negative rail. I can see that this circuit wants to hammer into the positive rail or hammer into the negative rail because of the positive feedback. It is like if you give incredibly positive feedback all the time, and by positive feedback I mean feedback encouraging the child to do whatever the child is doing.

如果他做了坏事，你就会给予很多积极的反馈；如果他做了好事，你也会给予很多积极的反馈，那么你肯定会有一个非常好的孩子或一个非常坏的孩子。你不会有任何介于两者之间的人。这里也是一样。通过给予积极的反馈，你会把这件事推向积极的轨道或把它推向消极的轨道。

It could be if he does bad stuff you give a lot of positive feedback or good stuff you give a lot of positive feedback then you are guaranteed to have a very good child or a very bad child. You are not going to have anybody in the middle. Same way here. By giving positive feedback you’re going to drive this into the positive rail or drive this into the negative rail.

现在，我将分两步来分析。首先，我将使用您之前见过的方法来分析，即用等效电路替换运算放大器并进行静态分析。通过静态分析，我们将展示简单的静态分析将产生以下表达式。我将其放在引号中，原因您很快就会看到。

Now, I am going to analyze this in two steps. First I am going to analyze this using a method you’ve seen before which is replace the op amp with its equivalent circuit and analyze it statically. And by analyzing it statically we are going to show that the simple static analysis will yield the following expression. I put this in quotes, well, for a reason you will see shortly.

当我应用简单明了的静态分析时，我发现了以下情况。让我们继续分析，看看这两者有什么根本区别。首先，我将向您确认，我们迄今为止看到的简单分析将产生该表达式。那么，让我们继续分析该电路。

When I apply a plain and simple static analysis here is what I find. Let’s go ahead with the analysis and see what is basically different about these two. And, first of all, I will confirm for you that our naive analysis we have seen so far will give rise to that expression. So, let’s go ahead and analyze that circuit.

电路分析

Circuit analysis

为了分析该电路，我将用其等效电路替换运算放大器。

And to analyze that circuit what I will do is replace the op amp with its equivalent circuit.

如果您还记得，运算放大器的特征如下：A 乘以 v+ 减去 v，vOUT。这是我的运算放大器的等效电路。让我把这个外部电路强加到这个运算放大器上。我已将 v 端子接地。我的 v+ 端子经过电阻和电源，v 接地，即电阻 R1。此端子通过电阻 R2 到达输出。所以，这是等效电路。

If you remember the op amp is characterized by the following circuit, A times v+ minus v , vOUT. This is the equivalent circuit of my op amp. And let me just impose that external circuit on this op amp. I have grounded my v terminal. My v+ terminal goes through a resistor and a supply, the v into ground, it’s the resistance R1. This terminal goes to the output through a resistor R2. So, this is the equivalent circuit.

我可以将我在整个课程中学到的相同的老方法应用到这个电路上，看看 vOUT 是什么样子。很简单，vOUT 就是这个表达式 A 乘以 v+ 减去 v，由于我的接地，v 为零。然后让我继续用与 vOUT 和 vIN 相关的电压替换 v+。v+ 是什么？

And I can apply the same good old techniques I have learned about all through this course to this circuit and see what vOUT looks like. Very simply, vOUT is this expression here A times v+ minus v And because of my ground connection v is zero. Then let me go ahead and replace v+ with the voltage that relates vOUT and vIN. What is v+?

V+ 就是流过这部分电路的电流，流过这里的电流乘以电阻 R1。这样就得到了 R1 上的压降。再加上 vIN，就得到了 V+。然后当然，我将其乘以这里的增益。所以，让我把这个表达式写下来。流过的电流就是 vOUT 减去 vIN。这就是这两点之间的电压降。

V+ is simply the current through this part of the circuit, the current flowing here times the resistance R1. That gives me the drop across R1. And to that I add vIN and that will give me V+. And then of course I multiply this by the gain here. So, let me write down that expression. The current through this is simply vOUT minus vIN. That is the voltage drop between these two points.

我将其除以电阻 R1 和 R2 之和。这样就得到了流过此处的电流。乘以 R1 就是电阻 R1 两端的压降。再加上 vIN，就得到了电压 v+。所以，这就是 v+。这仅仅是 vIN 加上电阻 R1 两端的压降。让我把所有 vOUT 项都放到这边。

I divide that by the resistance R1 plus R2. That gives me the current flowing through here. That times R1 is the drop across resistor R1. And to that I add vIN and that gives me the voltage v+. So, this is v+. That is simply vIN plus the drop across the resistance R1. Let me shuffle things around and put all the vOUT terms on this side here.

我得到该 vOUT 的 1+，让我将 AR1 除以 R1 加 R2 移到左侧。然后我得到一个减号。因此，我得到 AR1 除以 R1 加 R2。我得到这个结果。在左侧符号上我最终得到 vIN，而此处的 vIN 是我此处 vIN 的函数。我有一个 A，它将两个 vIN 相乘。

I get a 1+ for that vOUT and let me move AR1 divided by R1 plus R2 to the left hand side. And I pick up a minus sign. So, I get AR1 divide by R1 plus R2. I pick up that. And on the left hand sign I end up with vIN, and my vIN here is a function of the vIN that I have here. I have an A multiplying both the vINs.

然后我得到这个 vIN 的 1，并且有一个减号，所以我得到一个减号 R1 除以 R1+R2。这就是我的表达式。让我继续进一步简化它，并将整个东西移到这里。这给了我作为 vIN 函数的表达式。我要做的是，让我继续。vOUT=vIN A(1 R1/(R1+R2))。

And then I get a one for this vIN here and there is a minus sign, so I get a minus R1 divided by R1+R2. That is the expression that I have. Let me go ahead and simplify that a little further and move this whole thing down here. That gives me my expression as a function of vIN. What I will do is, let me continue here. vOUT=vIN A(1 R1/(R1+R2)).

顺便说一句，你可能想知道我为什么要费力地完成一个看似非常简单的练习。我想这样做的原因是，我想非常仔细地向你展示这个练习产生的结果就是这样。这里没有魔法。没有作弊。我们将得到完全一样的结果。然后盯着它说，嗯，这是怎么发生的？

By the way, you may be wondering why I am going through so laboriously what is seemingly a very simple exercise. The reason I want to do is it I want to very carefully show you that the result produced by this exercise is exactly that. No magic here. No cheating. We are going to get exactly that. And then stare at it and say huh, how did that happen?

然后我们将尝试弄清楚它在此之后的实际表现。我将其除以 1 AR1/(R1+R2)。现在您应该熟悉在出现大数字时忽略小数字的技巧。因此，AR1/(R1+R2) 可能比 1 大很多，因为 A 非常大。因此，我可以忽略那里的 1。

And then we are going to try to figure out how it actually behaves following that. I divide this by 1 AR1/(R1+R2). And by now you should be familiar with the technique of ignoring small numbers when I have a big number next to it. So, AR1/(R1+R2) can be very much larger than one because A is very large. So, I can ignore my one there.

然后我要做的是将分子和分母乘以 R1+R2。哦，这个 A 和这个 A 会抵消。然后这个 A 和这个 A 会抵消。然后我将分子和分母乘以 R1+R2，所以这个 R1+R2 消失。我在这里得到 R1+R2。R1+R2 减去 R1 就是 R2。然后在这里我得到 R1，然后我有一个减号。

And then what I am going to do is multiply the numerator and denominator by R1+R2. Oh, this A and this A is going to cancel out. This A and this A will then cancel out. And then I multiply the numerator and denominator by R1+R2, so this R1+R2 vanishes. I get R1+R2 here. R1+R2 minus R1 is simply R2. And then down here I get a R1 and then I have a minus sign out there.

请注意，我们发现 vOUT 等于 vIN R2 除以 R1。这没错。这是正确的。从技术上讲这是正确的。但几秒钟后你就会发现，在实践中，这种情况很少发生。我们将尝试理解为什么会这样。

Notice that vOUT we have found to be equal to vIN R2 divided by R1. That is not wrong. That is correct. Technically that is correct. But you will see in a few seconds that in practice that’s rarely what you are going to see happen. And we will try to understand why that is so.

到目前为止，如果您仔细观察这两个面板，我们所做的就是，首先，我们知道反相放大器的 vOUT 表达式在上面。通过这项艰苦的练习，我们还表明，即使有正反馈，如果我对电路进行静态观察，如果我对电路进行快照并将其简单地分析为静态电路，我也会得到相同的 vOUT 表达式。

What we have done so far, if you stare at these two panels here, first of all, we know that the inverting amplifier has the expression for vOUT up there. And through this laborious exercise we have also shown that even with positive feedback, if I take a static view of the circuit If I take a snapshot of the circuit and simply analyze it as a static circuit, I get the same expression vOUT.

但是我们要做的就是，当我向你解释，你看，vOUT 中的一个小扰动将驱动运算放大器到正轨和负轨时，这就是洞察力开始显现的地方。如果一切都是神奇的，我可以以某种方式准确地保持一切，这样就会成真。我将能够构建正反馈电路，其中输出等于 R2/R1 vIN。

But what we are going to do is when I explain to you that look, a small perturbation in vOUT is going to drive the op amp to the positive and negative rail, that is where the insight begins to show. That if everything were magical and I could somehow exactly keep things just so that will be true. I will be able to build that positive feedback circuit where the output is equal to R2/R1 vIN.

但请记住，即使是轻微的扰动也会使运算放大器突然偏向正轨或负轨。我们如何分析这一点？我们如何分析基于小扰动开始移动到一个位置或另一个位置的电路​​的行为？我们要分析运算放大器的动态。

But remember even the slightly amount of perturbation is going to send the op amp scurrying off to the positive rail or the negative rail. How do we analyze that? How do we analyze the behavior of a circuit that based on a small perturbation begins to move one place or another? We want to analyze the dynamics of the op amp.

为了分析动态，我需要做的是给你一个稍微更详细的运算放大器视图。如果运算放大器不是在正轨和负轨之间瞬时移动，我需要给你一个更详细的模型来封装运算放大器的行为。让我来做这件事。如果你想研究运算放大器的动态

And to analyze the dynamics what I need to do is give you a slightly more detailed view of the operational amplifier. If the operational amplifier is not moving instantaneously between the plus and minus rail, I need to give you a more detailed model that encapsulates the behavior of the op amp. And so let me do that. If you want to study the dynamics of an op amp

所谓动态，是指当我扰动输入或输出等时，运算放大器如何移动。为了捕捉运算放大器的动态，我们构建了一个稍微复杂的电路，因此 v+ 和 v 这是我们之前看到的，两个端子和从属源，可大幅放大此处的差分输入。

By dynamics I mean how an op amp moves as I perturb the input or the output and so on. To capture the dynamics of the op amp we build a slightly more involved circuit, so v+ and v This is what we’ve seen before, two terminals and dependent source that amplifies the difference input here by a large amount.

相反，我们在这里要做的是稍微不同的事情，在中间插入以下电路。这是运算放大器的动态模型。我们将在这里施加一个小的 RC 电路。这是 R。这是 C。我将把电容两端的电压称为 v*。

Instead what we are going to do here is something slightly different and interpose the following circuit in the middle here. This is a model of the dynamics of an op amp. We are going to impose a small RC circuit in here. This is R. This is C. And I am going to call the voltage across the capacitor v*.

请注意，我所做的不是说这是 Av+ 减去 v，而是将其分解为两个相关源，第一个相关源，即 v+ 减去 v，并且周围有一个 RC 时间常数，然后在这里我简单地添加了我的增益 Av*。

Notice what I have done is rather than say this is Av+ minus v I am breaking it apart in two dependent sources, the first dependent source, which is simply v+ minus v , and there is a RC time constant surrounding it and then here I simply add on my gain Av*.

请注意，如果这里的电阻为零，那么 v+ 减去 v 就会出现在 v* 上，这就是 A(v+ v )，也就是您之前看到的。查看电路并查看当某个元件达到极值时会发生什么情况总是好的。这将为您提供基本的运算放大器电路。

Notice that if it turned out that the resistance here, for example, was zero then v+ minus v would appear across v* and this would be A(v+ v ), what you have seen before. It is always good to take a look at circuits and look at what happens when some component goes to an extreme value. This would give you your basic op amp circuit.

接下来我想做的是分析以下电路，以了解正反馈和负反馈如何协同工作。通过理解这一点，然后能够解释正反馈电路或负反馈电路如何工作。这就是我要做的。这部分只是对应于我的正反馈电路，R2，R1。所以，这是我的正反馈电路。我将在这边做同样的事情。

What I would like to do next is analyze the following circuit to understand how positive and negative feedback work together. And by understanding that then be able to explain how a positive feedback circuit works or a negative feedback circuit works. Here is what I will do. This part simply corresponds to my positive feedback circuit, R2, R1. So, that is my positive feedback circuit. And I will do the same thing on this side.

我所做的就是通过 R2 和 R1 应用正反馈，通过 R4 和 R3 应用负反馈，并表示运算放大器的动态，然后退后一步，好吧，让我们看看会发生什么。所以，我把正反馈、负反馈、运算放大器的动态都贴在这里，让我们看看会发生什么。

All I am doing is applying both a positive feedback through R2 and R1 and negative feedback through R4 and R3 and representing the dynamics of the op amp and then standing back and ee, all right, let’s see what happens to you. So, I am sticking positive feedback, negative feedback, the dynamics of the op amp here and let’s see what happens.

我想做的是把这个电路加到这个运算放大器模型上。为了省点力气，我直接修改这个电路。我在这里得到一个 R2，在这里得到一个 R1，然后在这里得到一个 R4，在这里得到一个 R3。数学计算会有点混乱，但结果实际上相当惊人。

What I would like to do is impose this circuit on top of this op amp model. To save myself some effort, let me just go ahead and modify this circuit directly. I get an R2 here, an R1 here, and then up here I get an R4, R3 here. The math is going to be just a little bit grubby but the result is actually pretty spectacular.

所以，我所做的就是用内部电路替换运算放大器。现在我们将看看当有小扰动时运算放大器的动态会发生什么。让我们使用已知的技术来开发包含电容器的电路方程。

So, all I have done is replace the op amp with its internal circuit out here. And now we are going to take a look at what happens to op amp dynamics when there is a small perturbation. Let’s develop an equation of this circuit containing a capacitor using techniques that we already know.

为了让您对将要看到的内容有更深入的了解，请注意，如果我对电容器两端的电压进行小幅扰动，假设我对电容器电压进行小幅扰动，比如说通过在电容器上应用某种初始条件。然后假设输出变为某个值 K。因此，电容器上的变化一定是 K 除以 A。

Just to give you some insight into what you’re going to see, notice that if I make a small perturbation in the voltage across the capacitor, let’s say I make a small perturbation to the capacitor voltage let’s say by applying some initial condition kind of thing onto the capacitor. Then let’s say that the output changes to some value K. So, the change on the capacitor must have been K divided by A.

您将要看到的是，当电容器的初始条件使得输出被扰动到值 K 时，运算放大器会发生什么情况。让我们为这个小电路写一个方程，看看会发生什么情况。回想一下，我们的目标是了解当我稍微扰动输出时会发生什么情况。在这里，我扰动输出，使其值变为 K。

And what you are going to see is what happens to the op amp when the initial condition on the capacitor is such that this output gets perturbed to the value K. Let’s write an equation for this little circuit and see what happens. Recall our goal was to understand what happens when I perturbed the output a little bit. Here I perturbed the output such that its value goes to K.

我可以通过改变电容器上的情况来扰动输出。现在让我写出这个电路的方程式，以便了解如果我在对这个电容器电路进行小幅扰动后放开它，会发生什么情况。

And I can perturb the output by changing what happens at the capacitor. Let me write the equation for this circuit now and then to understand what happens to this capacitor circuit if I let go after giving it a small perturbation.

方程

Equation

我首先要为这个小电路写出一个经典的方程。这个方程就是这里的电压 v+ 减去 v 等于 RC 两端的电压。

What I am going to do is let me start by writing the good old equation for this little circuit here. And that equation is simply the voltage here v+ minus v equals the voltage across the RC.

因此，v+ 减去 v 等于电阻两端的电压降加上电容两端的电压降。电容两端的电压为 v 。电阻两端的电压为流过电容 C 的电流 dv /dt 乘以 R。因此，v* 加上 RC dv/dt 等于 v+ 减去 v。RC dv /dt 加上 v等于 v+ 减去 v。你之前已经做过数百万次了，但还是要再做一次。

So, v+ minus v will be equal to the voltage drop across the resistor plus that across the capacitor. The voltage across the capacitor is v. The voltage across the resistor is the current through the capacitor C dv/dt times R. So, v* plus RC dv/dt is equal to v+ minus v RC dv/dt plus v is v+ minus v You have done this millions of times before, but yet again.

这里的电压等于这两个电压之间的压降，这两个电压之间的压降是 v ，C 上的压降加上流过电容 C 的电流 dv/dt 乘以电阻 R。或者您也可以应用节点方法并得到相同的表达式。现在，我们还知道 vO 除以 A 等于 v。我可以继续用 v* 替换这里，用 vO 除以 A。RC/A dvO/dt。

This voltage here is equal to the drop across these two, and the drop across these two is v, the drop across C, plus the current through the capacitor C dv/dt times the resistance R. Or you can apply the node method as well and get the same expression. Now, we also know here that vO divided by A is v. I can go ahead and replace this guy here, v* by vO divided by A. RC/A dvO/dt.

回想一下，我想要 vO 的动态，所以让我得到一个 vO 表达式。所以，我得到 vO 除以 A 加 v+ 减 v 等于。现在，我想要一个 vO 表达式，一个 vO 方程，所以我需要用 vO 来表达 v+ 和 v。这些表达式是什么？

Recall, I want the dynamics of vO so let me just get an expression in vO. So, I get vO divided by A plus v+ minus v equals. Now, I want an expression in vO, an equation in vO, so I need to express v+ and v in terms of vO. What are these expressions?

表达式

Expressions

v 的表达式为 vO 和此分压器，因此为 vOR3/(R3+R4)。为了简单起见，我将其称为某个常数伽马减法。

The expression for v is vO and this voltage divider, so it’s vOR3/(R3+R4). And just for simplicity, let me call this some constant gamma minus.

这是某个分数 R3/(R3+R4)。我称该分数为 gamma 减。类似地，v+ 是 vO R1/(R1+R2)。我称该分数为 gamma 加。我所做的就是用 vO 替换 v+ 和 v。因此，实际上，我这里得到的是 v+ 是 vO 的某个分数。这是最直观的思考方式，是 vO 的某个分数。v 也是 vO 的某个分数。我只需粘贴它们即可。

This is some fraction R3/(R3+R4). And let me call that fraction gamma minus. Similarly, v+ is vO R1/(R1+R2). And let me call that gamma plus. All I am doing is replacing v+ and v in terms of vO. So, effectively, what I have here is v+ is some fraction of vO. That’s the best intuitive way of thinking about it, some fraction of vO. And v is some fraction of vO as well. And I just stick these.

我现在在 vO 中有一个表达式。不要被 gamma plus 和 gamma minus 迷惑。如果你愿意，可以简单地把它读作 F1 和 F2。因此，vO 乘以某个分数减去 vO 乘以某个其他分数。我将输出的某个分数反馈到正极端子和负极端子。然后，只需稍微移动一下，将其除以 A 再除以 RC。

I now have an expression in vO. Don’t get psyched by gamma plus and gamma minus. Simply read this as if it is an F1 and F2 if you would like. So, vO times some fraction minus vO times some other fraction. I am feeding back some fraction of the output to the positive and to the negative terminals. Then, just moving things around a little bit, dividing throughout by A divided by RC.

因此，我将 A 除以 RC。再加上 vO 除以 RC。我马上要做的是，vO gamma 加减 gamma 减。我一直用 A 除以 RC。最后，收集所有 vO 项，我得到 vO 乘以 1 除以 RC 加上 A 除以 RC。

So, I divided by A divided by RC. Plus vO divided by RC. And what I am going to do here in a second, vO gamma plus minus gamma minus. And I have multiplied by A divided by RC throughout. Finally, collecting all the vO terms I get vO times one divided by RC plus A divided by RC.

这里有一个加号，所以我只需将这两个符号反转，gamma 减 gamma 加等于零。我在这里所做的只是通过一些数学运算来用 vO 来表达这个方程。为了使其更简单，我将用 1 除以 T 来替换这个数字，就像我们对一阶方程所做的那样。

I got a plus sign here so I will just reverse these two guys in there, gamma minus gamma plus equals zero. All I have done here is simply grunged through some math to express this equation in terms of vO. And just to make it even simpler, I will just replace this thing by one divided by T, much as we did for first order equations.

最终得到的结果是 dvO/dt+vO/T=0。

What I end up with is dvO/dt+vO/T=0.

表达

Expression

尽管有这么多的麻烦，我最终还是得到了我们都非常熟悉的东西。我经过多次尝试来代替 v+、v 和 v*，但最终我得到了一个简单的表达式，即 dvO/dt+vO/T=0。其中大写 T 是电路的时间常数，电路的时间常数与其中的表达式 1/RC+A/RC（gamma 减去 gamma 加）有关。

Despite all the grubbiness, I end up with something that is very, very familiar to all of us. I went through a bunch of gyrations to substitute for v+, v and v*, but at the end of the day I got the simple expression which was dvO/dt+vO/T=0. Where capital T is the time constant of the circuit, and the time constant of the circuit relates to the expression in there 1/RC+A/RC(gamma minus gamma plus).

伽马负值和伽马正值分别是反馈到负输入和正输入的输出部分。现在，众所周知，基于非常简单的直觉，一旦我们知道电容器的初始条件是什么，并且知道时间常数，我们就可以完全预测 RC 电路一阶的行为。就是这样。

The gamma minus and gamma plus are the respective portions of the output fed back to the negative input and the positive input.
