Now, as we all know, based on very simple intuition that we can completely predict the behavior of a first order of an RC circuit once we know what the initial condition of the capacitor is and once you know the time constant. That’s it.

我们知道，我们非常了解电容器的行为方式。它将呈指数增长。我知道时间常数大写 T。这是什么？这只是初始条件。没有驱动输入。我没有用任何输入来驱动它。这里没有任何输入驱动。这只是系统的自然动态。

We know, we are masters at the fact that the capacitor is going to behave like this. It is going to be exponential. And I do know that the time constant capital T. What’s here? It is simply the initial condition. There is no drive input. I am not driving this with any input here. There is no input drive anywhere here. This is simply the natural dynamics of the system.

回想一下，我首先提高电容器电压，使输出从 K 开始。就是这样。您应该能够根据此简单地写下此表达式和响应形式。因此，这就是我通过扰动电容器电压将输出提高到的结果。基于此方程的输出响应将如下所示。让我们尝试理解这意味着什么。

And, recall, I start off with bumping the capacitor voltage such that the output starts off being K. That is it. You should be able to write down this expression and the form of the response simply based on this. So, this is what I bumped up the output to be by perturbing the capacitor voltage. My output response based on this equation is going to look like that. Let’s try to understand what that means.

这其实很有趣。我们如何绘制该响应？你们都知道绘制响应的方法是绘制初始值，绘制最终值，然后开始 cachoock，对吧？这很简单。我将从 K 开始。我知道。我将从 K 开始，然后找出稳定状态值。

It is actually quite a lot of fun. How do we plot that response? You all learned that the way to plot the response is plot the initial value, plot the final value, and go cachoock, right? It’s pretty simple. I am going to start at K. I know that. I am going to start at K and I am going to go and find out what the steady state value is.

有趣的东西就在这里。电容器的最终值在很大程度上取决于 T 是正数还是负数。在我研究的 RC 电路中，T 是多少？在非常简单的 RC 电路中，我们研究了大写 T 是多少？时间常数是多少？RC。这是 RC。这是一个正量。当大写 T 为正时，我的输出将如下所示。当 T 为正时。

Here is where the interesting stuff comes in. The final value on the capacitor depends a lot on whether T is positive or negative. In my RC circuits that I looked at what was T? In the very simple RC circuit we looked at what was capital T? What was the time constant? RC. This was RC. This was a positive quantity. When capital T is positive my output is going to look like this. When T is positive.

当该表达式为正时，T 为正。如果 A 很大，我可以忽略 1/RC 项，如果 A 非常大，我可以忽略这里的左边项，那么当伽马负大于伽马正时，T 为正。因此，当伽马负大于伽马正时，我有一个稳定的电路，这是我们以前见过的好东西。现在事情开始变得有意义了。

And T is positive when this expression is positive. And if A is so large that I can ignore the 1/RC term, if A is very, very large and I can ignore the left hand term here then T is positive when gamma minus is greater than gamma plus. So, when gamma minus is greater than gamma plus, I have a stable circuit, this is the good old stuff we have seen before. Now things begin to make sense.

直观地讲，我在这里要说什么？抛开所有伽马和其他废话不说，我在这里用英语到底要说什么？我在这里要说的是，如果馈送到负输入的输出部分大于馈送到正输入的部分，那么我就有净负反馈。我有净负反馈。我将输出反馈给正输入和负输入。

Intuitively, what am I saying here? All the gammas and other pieces of crapola aside, what am I really saying here in English? What I am saying here is that if the portion of the output fed to the negative input is greater than that fed to the positive input then I have net negative feedback. I have net negative feedback. I am feeding the output back to both the positive and negative inputs.

如果我的负输入有更强的影响，那么我将看到运算放大器输出衰减到我预期的零值。请注意，由于我在这里没有应用任何输入，我预计这个稳定点是输出变为零。我在那里没有任何输入。让我们看看另一种情况。当情况相反时会发生什么？

And if my negative input has a stronger effect then I am going to see the op amp output decay down to a value that I expect which is going to be zero. Notice that since I am not applying any input here, I expect the stable point for this to be output going to zero. I don’t have any input there. Let’s take a look at another situation. What happens when the opposite is true?

当伽马负值小于伽马正值时会发生什么？当我反馈更多时，当伽马正值大于伽马负值时会发生什么？事实恰恰相反。这意味着我更多地反馈正输入。正输入的比例大于负输入的比例。然后会发生什么？然后大写的 T 变成负数。

What happens when gamma minus is less than gamma plus? When I feedback more, what happens when I do this, when gamma plus is greater than gamma minus? The opposite is true. This means that I am feeding back more to the positive input. A bigger proportion goes to the positive than the negative. What happens then? Then what happens is capital T becomes negative.

我们无法在 RC 电路上看到这种情况，因为大写 T 等于 RC，但这里我们有一个更复杂的电路，大写 T 可以变为负数。如果大写 T 变为负数，那么指数中的整个东西就会变为正数。如果变为正数，输出应该是什么样子？它应该飞向梦幻岛。就是这样。

We cannot see this happening on the RC circuit because capital T is equal to RC, but here we have a more complicated circuit and capital T can go negative. If capital T goes negative then this whole thing in the exponent there goes positive. If that goes positive what should the output look like? It should take off into never never land. There we go.

我从零开始，做一个小扰动，输出应该是 t 除以大写 T。

I start off at zero and a make a small perturbation, and the output should go as t divided by capital T.

局势稳定

Stable Situation

这种动态会变得狂暴，所以这是净正反馈。这被称为稳定情况。这是不稳定的。当大写 T 趋于无穷时会发生什么？当大写 T 趋于无穷时，花五秒钟思考一下这在物理上意味着什么。

The dynamics of this it goes berserk, so it is net positive feedback. This is called a stable situation. This is unstable. What happens when capital T goes to infinity? When capital T goes to infinity, spend five seconds thinking about what it means physically.

RC 电路的时间常数趋于无穷大意味着什么？这意味着你的 R 和 C 非常非常大。这意味着电路将变得非常非常迟缓。想想大象。一个很大的时间常数。我想移动一条腿。这需要一段时间。想想大一点。大时间常数。所以，一切都会发生得很慢。就像在糖蜜中移动一样。大时间常数。

What does it mean for the time constant of an RC circuit to go to infinity? That means that your R and C are very, very, very large. That means that circuit is going to be very, very sluggish. Think elephant. A big time constant. I want to move a leg. It takes a while to do that. Think big. Big time constant. So, everything is going to happen really slowly. It’s like moving in molasses. Big time constant.

一切都会非常非常缓慢地发生。如果伽马负值大于伽马正值，并且时间常数很大，那么它看起来会像这样。输出看起来会像这样。我让 T 更大。好吧。它会像这样。我让它们变得如此之大，以至于 T 趋向于零，T 趋向于无穷大，在这种情况下我会得到这种情况。输出会变成这样。好吗？非常慢。

Everything is going to happen really, really slowly. If gamma minus is greater than gamma plus with a huge time constant it is going to look like this. And the output is going to look like this. I make T even larger. All right. It is going to like this. I make these so large that T tends to zero, T tends to infinity in which case I get this situation. The output goes dah. OK? Very slow.

非常迟钝。时间常数很大。T 趋向于无穷大。因此，如果这是稳定的，这是不稳定的，这被称为对应中性。所有这些都有一个机械类比。你可以证明这种情况类似于，假设我有一个这样的物理井，里面有一个球。我把球放开。然后球会落到这里并稳定下来。

Very lethargic. Big time constant. T tends to infinity. And so if this is stable, this is unstable, this is called corresponding neutral. And there is a mechanical analog to all of this. You can show that this situation is akin to let’s say I had a physical well of the sort and I had a ball in there. I let the ball go. Then the ball will come down here and settle down in a stable state.

球受到任何微小的扰动都会让它落下来并稳定在这里。不稳定的情况是，我有一个球坐在这里，任何微小的扰动都会让它快速落到正轨或负轨。所以，这是一种不稳定的平衡情况。我们在静态情况下进行这种分析的确切原因就是这种情况可能发生。

Any small perturbation of the ball will get it to come down and settle down here. The unstable situation is this situation where I have a ball sitting up here where any small perturbation will get it to zip down to a positive rail or to a negative rail. So, this is an unstable equilibrium situation. And exactly the reason we got this analysis in the static situation is that this can happen.

如果我在这里做这个电路并且不对其进行扰动，那么我可以让输出保持在零，但是最轻微的扰动，砰，它就会下降或上升。中性平衡状态呢？可以将其建模为桌面，球就在这里。无论你去哪里都没关系。你在那里。有多少人看过 Buckaroo Bonzi 的事情？可能在你之前就看过了。好的。

If I do this circuit here and don’t perturb it then I could get the output sitting at zero, but the slightest perturbation, boom, it is going to fall down or go up. What about the neutral equilibrium state? That can be modeled like a table top and the ball is here. It doesn’t matter where you go. There you are. How many people saw the Buckaroo Bonzi thing? Possibly well before your time. OK.

这里有一张桌子。无论我对它做什么，它都会停留在原处，这就是中性平衡。但这可以让你对运算放大器的动态有一个有趣的了解，因为我对它做了一些小的扰动。

I have this table here. No matter what I do to it, it just goes and settles down where it is, and that is neutral equilibrium. But what this gives you is a fun view of the dynamics of the operational amplifier as I make small perturbations to it.

理论

Theory

这里更有趣的是，您可以使用基于一阶 RC 分析的工具来分析简单运算放大器电路的动态。

And the even more interesting thing here is you have the tools based on your first order RC analysis to analyze the dynamics of a simple op amp circuit.

好了，理论就讲这么多。现在让我们开始行动吧。好吧。很好。这确实很漂亮，很好，等等，但是你能为我做什么呢？这个属性对我有什么好处？我能做什么？我们要做的是查看运算放大器电路并关注我有净正反馈的情况。

OK, so much for theory. Now let’s get to some action here. All right. Fine. That is really pretty, good and so on, but what can you do for me? What good does this property do for me? What can I build? What we will do is look at the op amp circuit and focus on the situation where I have net positive feedback.

具体来说，只需查看带有 R1 和 R2 的电路，并将两者发送到无穷大即可。因此，我没有负反馈，我将这个端子接地，看看带有正反馈的电路会发生什么，看看我是否可以构建一些有趣的电路。您要做的是在称为基本比较器的电路上进行构建。那是什么？

In particular just look at this circuit with R1 and R2 and send both to infinity. So, I have no negative feedback and I ground this terminal here and take a look at what happens to a circuit with positive feedback and see if I can build some interesting circuits. What you are going to do is build on a circuit called the basic comparator. What is that?

如果我有一个像这样的运算放大器，并且记住那里有一个 VS 轨和负 VS 电源，这是 v+，这是 v ，我可以通过执行以下操作构建一个非常基本的比较器。我将向您展示的所有电路都将基于这个基本的小电路构建。

If I have an op amp that looks like this, and remember a VS rail and minus VS supply there, this is v+, this is v , I can build a very basic comparator by doing the following. All the circuits I am going to show you are going to build on this basic little circuit.

我要做的是考虑将输入应用到 v 终端，应用某种输入并查看输出的行为。因此，我应用一些输入 vIN。如果我这样做，如果这是 v+ 减去 v，那么我将得到类似这样的结果。

What I am going to do is consider applying an input to the v terminal, applying some sort of an input and taking a look at how the output behaves. So, I apply some input vIN. And if I just do that, if this is v+ minus v here then I am going to get something that goes like this.

也就是说，当这里为正时，这个家伙将进入 VS 轨道，而这个家伙将进入负 VS 轨道。就此而言，如果我绘制相同的图形，就 vIN 而言，这是 vOUT，如果我绘制 vIN 方面的图形，那么请注意，随着 vIN 的增加，这个家伙应该进入负轨道。

That is when this is positive here then this guy is going to go to the VS rail and this guy is going to go to the minus VS rail. In terms of the, if I plot the same thing, in terms of vIN, and this is vOUT, if I plot the thing in terms of vIN then notice that as vIN increases this guy should go to a negative rail.

因此，就 vIN 而言，它看起来是这样的。这意味着，当输入越来越正并施加到 v 时，输出变为负 VS，如果输入越来越负，则输出变为 VS。这就是所谓的非常基本的比较器电路。

So, in terms of vIN it looks like this. What this says is that as the input becomes more and more positive applied to v then the output goes to minus VS, and if the input becomes more and more negative then the output goes to VS. This is what is called a very basic comparator circuit.

它比较两个输入，如果输入在一个方向，它就上升，如果输入在相反方向，它就上升到另一条轨道。所以假设我输入了这个，我可以绘制出它是时间函数。假设我绘制了 vIN。假设我在这里输入了一些 vIN。我把它叫做。

It compares the two inputs and goes up if the input is in one direction and goes to the other rail if the input is in the opposite direction. So supposing I feed this I can plot this is a function of time. Let’s say I plot vIN. Let’s say I feed some vIN here. Let me just call this.

我在这里将一些 vIN 馈入此电路，那么你期望输出是什么样子的，输出波形是什么？对于所有正 vIN，输出都是负的。因此，只要 vIN 为正，我的输出 vO 就会为负。当 vIN 变为负时，它就会上升并表现如下。这是负 VS。那是正 VS。这是我的输入 vIN。

I feed some vIN to this circuit here, then what do you expect the output to look like, the output wave form? For all positive vINs the output is negative. So, my output vO is going to be negative as long as vIN is positive. And when vIN becomes negative this one shoots up and behaves like this. This is minus VS. That is plus VS. This is my input vIN.

那么这个家伙就是我的输出。由于 vIN 为正，输出猛烈冲击负轨。当 vIN 变为负时，输出猛烈冲击正轨。所以，这很好。所以这样的电路对我来说非常有用。比如说，我想建立一个小型数字电路，输入 1 和 0。

Then this guy is going to be my output. As vIN is positive output slams to the negative rail. When vIN becomes negative the output slams to the positive rail. So, that is quite nice. And so such a circuit is pretty useful to me. Let’s say, for example, I want to build a little digital circuit that is fed ones and zeros.

我可以使用比较器将我的 vIN 电压转换为 1 和 0 的序列。当 vIN 为正时，我产生一个 0，当 vIN 为负时，我产生一个 1。我可以得到这个 1、0、1、0 序列，对应于 vIN 的值大于或小于 0。现在，这样的一个问题是，在以下情况下，这个电路可能会非常混乱。

I can use a comparator to turn my vIN voltage into a sequence of ones and zeros. When vIN is positive I produce a zero and when vIN is negative I produce a one. I can get this one, zero, one, zero sequence coming out corresponding to the values of vIN being greater or less than zero. Now, one problem with something like this is that this circuit can be quite messy in the following situation.

假设我在 vIN 中叠加了少量噪音。具体来说，假设 vIN 上有一些噪音。我在这里得到了一堆噪音。会发生什么情况是，在这个点上，值变为负值，我确实会增加。但是当我的输入再次超过零时，这个输出又会下降，在这里它又会上升。

Suppose I superimpose a small amount of noise in vIN. In particular, let’s say that I have some amount of noise on vIN. I get a bunch of noise sitting around here. What happens is that at this point where the value goes negative, I do bump up. But when for a second I have my input going above zero again this output comes down again and out here it goes up again.

当输入接近零时，我得到了这种令人讨厌的行为。当输入接近零时，由于噪声，输入在零附近徘徊，输出上出现大量上下波动。这不太好。我们将做一个小电路来尝试解决这个小问题。我们要做的是使用正反馈。

I get this nasty behavior at the point where the input is around zero. When the input is around zero, the input is meandering around zero because of noise, I get a huge amount of up and down glitches on the output. That’s not very nice. And we will do a little circuit that attempts to fix that little problem. What we are going to do is use positive feedback.

我将为您构建一个电路，该电路显示我们可以消除输入端的小噪声。那么，让我们构建以下电路。因此，我仍然将 vi 馈送到负输入端，但这次我给它一些正反馈。因此，我给它一些正反馈。我要做的是将 vO 的一部分反馈到正输入端。这是正反馈。

And I am going to build you a circuit that shows that we can eliminate this for small noise on the input. So, let’s build the following circuit. So I still feed vi to the negative input, but this time around I give it some positive feedback. So, I give it some positive feedback. And what I am going to do is feedback a portion of vO to the positive input. This is positive feedback.

具体来说，我们假设 VS 等于 12 伏。我将 VS 连接到负极。这个值将在 12 和 12 之间。相应地，由于这两个值相等，这个值将在 6 和 6 之间。这将是 12 或 12。记住，顶部导轨和底部导轨。

And, in particular, let’s assume that VS equals 12 volts. And to the negative one I connect VS. This guy is going to go between 12 and 12. And correspondingly because these two are equal this one is going to go between 6 and 6. This is going to be a 12 or 12. Remember, the top rail and the bottom rail.

这个将是 +6 或 6。让我们来了解一下当我应用输入 vIN 时该电路是如何工作的。首先假设我的输入暂时为零。假设我的输出最初为 12 伏。输出为 12 伏，那么这里的输入将是 6 伏。在这种情况下，v+ 将是 6 伏。

And this one is going to be a +6 or 6. And let’s understand how this circuit works when I apply an input vIN. Let’s start by saying that assume my input is zero for a moment. And let’s say my output starts off being 12 volts. The output is 12 volts then the input here is going to be 6 volts. In this case v+ is going to be 6 volts.

输出为 12，v+ 将为 6 伏。而我的电路什么也不做。现在，它开始为零。假设 vIN 增加。当 vIN 开始增加时会发生什么？嗯，直到 vIN 达到 6 伏时什么也不会发生。由于这是 6，vIN 必须升至 6 伏，必须等于这个电压，然后我才能翻转电路。

The output is 12, v+ is going to be 6 volts. And my circuit is sitting out there doing nothing. Now, this started off being zero. Let’s say vIN increases. As vIN begins to increase what happens? Well, nothing until vIN reaches 6 volts. Since this is 6, vIN has to go up to 6 volts, has to equal this voltage before I can flip the circuit.

当 vIN 大于 6 伏时会发生什么？如果 vIN 超过 6 伏，则负极端子上的电压大于正极端子上的电压，因此运算放大器会翻转其状态。vO 达到 12 伏。当 vi 超过 6 伏时，vO 达到 12 伏。v+ 达到多少？在此状态下，v+ 达到 12 的一半，即 6 伏。

What happens when vIN is greater than 6 volts, if vIN goes above 6 then I have more voltage on a negative terminal than the positive so the op amp flips its state. And vO gets to 12 volts. When vi goes above 6, vO gets to 12 volts. And what does v+ go to? In this state v+ goes to half of 12 which is 6 volts.

现在，这家伙处于 6，而那家伙处于 12。如果这一个继续上升，什么也不会发生，所以输出可以保持在 12。所以我很安全。然后假设 v 开始下降。当 v 开始下降时，当 v 再次达到 6 时会发生什么？如果 v 等于 6 会发生什么？什么也不会发生，因为现在它是 6。

Now, this guy is sitting at 6 and this guy is sitting at 12. If this one keeps rising nothing happens, so output can stay at 12. So I am pretty safe. Then let’s say v begins to come down. As v begins to come down, does anything happen when v gets to 6 again? If v is equal to 6 what happens? Nothing because this is at 6 now.

因此，从 v+ 到 v，这里仍然有巨大的净负电压，因此我处于 12。哦，好吧，我一直往下走，直到达到 6。当我达到 6 时，这两个就相等了。当它小于 6 时会发生什么？

So, there is still a huge net negative voltage here from v+ to v And so therefore I sit at 12. Oh, well, I keep coming down until I reach 6. When I reach 6 here these two become equal. And what happens when this becomes less than 6?

V 变得小于 6。如果这个电压低于这个值，这个就是 6，这个就是 7。v+ 和 v 之间有一个净正电压，所以这个输出会像这样摆动到正轨。我们将在接下来的几分钟里花更多时间来真正强调这一点。

V becomes less than 6. If this one goes below this voltage, this is 6 and this is 7. There is a net positive voltage between v+ and v , so this output swings to the positive rail like so. We will spend a lot more time on this in the next few minutes to really hammer the point home.

滞后

Hysteresis

有趣的是，尽管 vi 一超过 6，我就摆动到了正轨，然后我必须一路回到 6 才能改变状态。我必须走得很远才能再次翻转。我们如何利用这一点？

What is interesting about this is that even though the moment vi became more than 6, I swung to the positive rail, and then I had to go all the way back down to 6 before I could change state. I had to go way down before it could flip again. How can we make use of that?

好吧，让我给你画一个 vi 与 vO 的小图，然后谈谈这对我们有什么用。这是 vi，这是 vO，这是零。假设这是 12、12、6、+6。让我们在屏幕上绘制它，看看它是什么样子。正如我所说的，输出一开始是 12 伏，我的输入是零。所以我的输入一直在增加。

Well, let me draw you a little vi versus vO diagram and then talk about how that can be useful to us. This is vi, this is vO, this is zero. Let’s say this is 12, 12, 6, +6. Let’s plot that on the screen and see what it looks like. As I told you, the output was at 12 volts to begin with and my input was at zero. So, my input kept increasing.

当输入达到 +6 时，我的输出发生了什么变化？我的输出下降到 12。随着输入不断增加，什么也没有发生。这是第一步，这是第二步，第三步。我的输入不断增加，输出保持在 12 伏。然后我说，好吧，让我们把输入降低。所以，我的输入开始下降，第四步，变得越来越负。

When the input hit +6 what happened to my output? My output swung down to 12. As the input kept increasing nothing happened. This was step one, this was step two, step three. My input kept increasing and output stayed at 12 volts. Then what I said was well, let’s bring the input down. So, my input began to go down, step four, became more and more negative.

在我达到 6 之前什么都没发生。当我达到 6 时，我转向正方向，第五步。再一次，一、二、三、四、五。我要往上走。它来到这里。在我达到 6 之前什么都没发生，但在 6 时，我切换到正轨道。随着我变得越来越负，我停留在那里。然后，当我再次开始增加时，在我达到 +6 之前什么都没发生。把它当作你的第七步。

Nothing happened until I reached 6. When I reached 6 I swung positive, step five. Again, one, two, three, four, five. I am going up here. It came up here. And nothing happens until I reach 6, but at 6 boom, I switch to the positive rail. And as I get more and more negative I stay there. Then again, as I start increasing again, nothing happens until I reach +6. Think of that as your seventh step.

这件事最神奇的地方在于，我似乎有一个电路，现在它知道它来自哪里。如果它来自这里，它会在 +6 处切换，但如果它来自这里，它会在 6 处切换。因此，电路的行为似乎存在某种滞后或电路中的某种记忆特性。这种行为称为滞后。

What is spectacular about this is that I seem to have a circuit that now has some knowledge of where it came. If it is coming from here it switches at +6, but if it is coming from here it switches at 6. So, there seems to be sort of a lag in the behavior of the circuit or some memory property in the circuit. This kind of behavior is called hysteresis.

这个词来自磁路，或者说是您要磁化的元素。如果您拿一块磁铁并将其移到一块金属上，它可能会留下一些剩磁。同样，这被称为磁滞。这里也是一样。随着电压的增加，它似乎会在电路中留下一些残余，因此当电压发生变化时会产生影响。

The word comes from magnetic circuits where, or rather elements that you’re trying to magnetize. Where if you take a magnet and move it over a piece of metal it may leave some residual magnetism in it. And, in the same way, that is called hysteresis. Same way here. As the voltage increases it seems to leave some residual in the circuit so that it effects when it shifts.

好消息是，现在，如果我采用与之前相同的噪声波形并执行此操作，如果这是 vi，那么对于 vO，此时我将为负值。这里什么也没有发生，因为我必须达到 6 或 +6 才能发生任何事情。

The good news with this is that now, if I take the same kind of noisy wave form that I had before and do this If this is vi then what is going to happen is for vO I am going to be negative at this point. Nothing happens here because I have to get to 6 or +6 before something happens.

在这里我达到 6，然后切换状态并上升到 +12。然后这个值略高于 6。什么也没有发生，因为只有当输入达到 +6 时才会发生下一个变化。所以，如果最终输入达到 +6，那么我将再次改变状态。

Out here I get to 6 and I switch state and go up to +12. And then this one comes up above 6 very slightly out there. Nothing happens because the next change will happen only when the input goes to +6. So, if eventually the input gets to +6 and then I am going to change state again.

演示

Demo

它实际上是一个非常酷的属性，而且是完全不明显的属性。

It is actually a really cool property and something that is completely non obvious.

在最后 30 秒，让我向你们展示一个简短的演示。基于这种滞后特性，我实际上已经构建了一个小电路。让我先做这个。请注意，我在这里向你们展示了 X 轴上的输入 vi 和 Y 轴上的 vO。请注意输出如何在 +6 伏时切换，并在 6 伏时切换到 +12 或 12。这就是滞后特性。

In the last 30 seconds let me show you a quick demo. And, based on this property of hysteresis, I have actually built a little circuit. Let me do that first. Notice here that I am showing you the input on the X axis vi and vO on the Y axis. Notice how the output switches at +6 volts and switches at a 6 volts to +12 or 12. That’s the hysteresis property.

我们实际上可以利用这个特性来构建一个时钟电路，如第 9 页所示，构建一个振荡器，它位于那里并自行振荡。明天的复习课上你会看到相关细节。

And we can actually use this property to build a clock circuit, which is on page 9, build an oscillator that sits there and oscillates by itself. And you will see details of that in recitation tomorrow.

Lec 22 | MIT 6.002 电路与电子学，2007 年春季

Lec 22 | MIT 6.002 Circuits and Electronics, Spring 2007

17 年前 (2008 年 1 月 17 日) — 51:43 https://youtube.com/watch?v=wNuBD4PYWvs

17 years ago (Jan 17, 2008) — 51:43 https://youtube.com/watch?v=wNuBD4PYWvs

早上好。好的。今天的主题是能源和电力。本学期大部分时间，至少到目前为止，我们都将重点放在速度上。我们一直是速度狂人，一直在研究信号切换速度有多快，时域波形是什么样的？我们还研究了电路的频率响应。本周我们将讨论一些略有不同的内容，这些内容与能源和电力有关。

Good morning. OK. The topic for today is Energy and Power. Most of the time this semester, up to now at least, we focused a lot on speed. We have been truly speed freaks looking at how fast can we switch the signal, what does a time domain waveform look like? We also looked at frequency responses of circuits. This week we will spend on something a little bit different, and that relates to energy and power.

能源和电力无疑在近十年内变得越来越重要，未来也将如此。我将在讲座的最后举一个小例子。你会看到，如果你做事不够谨慎，你的手持设备、手机、笔记本电脑等就会爆炸。

Energy and power is gaining a lot more importance in certainly this decade, and will do so in the future. And I am going to work out a little example towards the end of the lecture. And there you will see that if you do things naively, your handheld devices, your cell phone, laptops and so on will just up and explode.

在如何管理能源和电力方面，你必须要小心一点。在开始之前，我想先快速回顾一下我们上周讲过的内容。上周我们通过研究使用运算放大器的模拟电路中的正反馈来结束。特别是，我们制作了一个振荡器。我们制作了一个振荡器，它允许我们给电容器充电。

You have got to be a little bit careful in terms of how to manage energy and power. Before I get into that, I just want to wrap up with a quick review of what we covered last week. We ended last week by looking at positive feedback in analog circuits using an op amp. And, in particular, we built an oscillator. We built an oscillator that allowed us to charge a capacitor.

当电容器两端的电压等于负极电压时，它会翻转并持续翻转。输出端的波形如下。输出方波。在整个课程中，我们讨论了如何获得方波输入。这是一个示例，说明如何使用电容器、电阻器和运算放大器从基本原理产生方波。

And when the voltage across the capacitor equaled that at the minus terminal it would flip and keep doing so. And at the output you would get a waveform that looked like this. You would get a square wave output. Now, throughout the course we have talked about getting square wave inputs. And this is one example of how you can actually produce a square wave pretty much from first principles using a capacitor, resistors and an op amp.

现在，我只想通过讨论振荡器的一个应用来结束这个小项目。振荡器的这个应用确实很好地完成了我们在本课程中涵盖的与数字电路相关的知识体系。我想简要讨论的是一个带有发送器和接收器的小型数字系统。

Now, I just wanted to wrap up this little item here by talking about one application of an oscillator. And this application of the oscillator really nicely closed the loop on the body of knowledge relating to digital circuits that we have covered in this course. What I want to talk about briefly is a small digital system with a sender and a receiver.

发送者发送信号，接收者接收信号，在本课程中，我们讨论了发送者发送一系列 1 和 0。例如，发送者想要发送这样的信号。我们已经看到这是一个非常合法的信号。由于与电线相关的电感和电容，我们得到了某种振荡行为。

And the sender is sending a signal, the receiver receives a signal, and in this course we have talked about senders sending a sequence of ones and zeros. Say, for example, the sender wants to send some sort of a signal like this. We have seen that this is quite a legitimate signal. We get some kind of oscillatory behavior because of the inductance and capacitance associated with the wire.

而你所做的就是，当我说这实际上对应于 1、1、0 时，你几乎相信了我的话。发送者想要向接收者发送 1、1、0 信号，接收者收到了它。所以这是 1，这是 1，这是 0。但如果我是接收者，我会查看方波。

And what you have done is that you pretty much believed me when I said that this really corresponds to a one, one, zero. The sender wants to send a one, one, zero signal to the receiver, and the receiver gets it. So this is a one, this is a one, this is a zero. But if I am a receiver, I am going to look at the square wave.

不存在在电线上发送 1 的情况。您无法在电线上发送 1。您通过电线发送电压信号或电流信号。因此，接收器接收电压信号。它会在一段时间内为零，然后可能是 5 伏或 3 伏或任何您认为的最高值，然后再次为零。我的接收器如何知道它是 1、1、0？

There is no such thing as sending a one on a wire. You cannot send a one on a wire. You send a voltage signal or a current signal on a wire. So, the receiver receives a voltage signal. It is going to be zero for some time and then maybe 5 volts or 3 volts or whatever is your high and then zero again. How does my receiver know it’s a one, one, zero?

为什么不能是一、一、一、一、零、零、零？它不知道。接收器如何知道它是一、一、零序列，而不是 50 个一后面跟着 40 个零？它不知道。我们需要的是为了让发送者能够与接收器通信，我们需要某种约定的时间，接收器采样传入的信号并确定它是一还是零。

Why can’t it be a one, one, one, one, zero, zero, zero? It doesn’t know. How does the receiver know it’s a one, one, zero sequence and not 50 ones followed by 40 zeros? It doesn’t know. What we need is For senders to be able to communicate with receivers, we need some kind of agreed upon time when receivers sample the signal coming in and decide whether it’s a one or a zero.

它们都必须就何时查看输入的特定时间基准达成一致。处理此问题的一种方法是，我可以使用时钟，即我们在数字系统中称为时钟的方波信号，并以以下方式将其发送到另一端。此时钟信号可以应用于此发送方和此接收方。

They both have to agree on certain time bases when to look at the input. One way to deal with this is I can have a clock, a square wave signal that we call a clock in digital systems and ship it to the other side in the following manner. This clock signal can be applied to this sender and to this receiver.

有关这方面的更多详细信息，我推荐课程笔记第 735 页，其中详细讨论了在数字系统中使用时钟的示例。我能做的是创建一个看起来像方波的时钟。时钟为电路提供了时间概念。我有某种时钟信号发生器。我将其连接到发送器并将其连接到接收器。

For more details on this, let me recommend Page 735 of the course notes that talks about a detailed example of the use of a clock in a digital system. What I can do is create a clock that looks like the square wave. The clock provides a notion of time to the circuit. And I have some kind of a clock signal generator. And I connect that to the sender and connect that to the receiver.

现在，接收方和发送方都有了时间概念。我能做的是，我可以告诉我的接收方，发送方和接收方之间可以达成协议，即在时钟上升沿时查看输入端的信号。每当时钟上升时，当您看到上升沿时，查看线路中的值，这就是我发送的值。

And now both the receiver and the sender have a notion of time. And what I can do is I can tell my receiver, the sender and the receiver can have an agreement between them that says that look at the signal at your input when on the rising edge of the clock. Whenever the clock rises, when you see a rising edge look at the value in the wire and that’s the value I sent.

通过这样做，我可以做的是，接收器可以查看信号。在这个上升沿，它看到一个零，这是 vOH，向上看，在这里看到一个一，在这里看到一个一，看到一个零。因此，它在接收端正确地采样了 1、1、0。一旦我们有了这个时间基准，发送器就可以在这里发送相同的序列。

By doing so, what I can do is that the receiver can look at the signal. At this rising edge it sees a zero, this is vOH, looks up here, sees a one here, sees a one here and sees a zero. So, it correctly sampled one, one, zero at the receiving end. And the sender can send the same sequence here once we have this time base.

这个简短的电路入门只是为了给你一个可以产生方波的电路应用。我可以创建一个带有时间基准的时钟。此外，有趣的是，更基本的是，我们在整个课程中研究了各种抽象概念。我们通过查看集中信号讨论了离散空间。

This little brief foray circuits was simply to give you an application of a circuit that can produce a square wave. I can create a clock with a time base. Also, interestingly much more fundamental is we looked at various abstractions throughout the course. We talked about discretizing space by looking at lumped signals.

我还想指出的是，时钟可以看作是数字领域的另一个基本抽象，而我所做的就是离散化时间。我的意思是，在数字领域，我们已经将值离散化为零和一，但到目前为止我们仍然拥有连续的时间。而在数字系统中，你要做的就是说，看，让我们把一切都数字化，或者更确切地说，把一切都离散化。

What I also want to point out is that a clock can be viewed as another fundamental abstraction in the digital domain where what I am doing is discretizing time. What I am saying is that, look, in the digital domain we have already discretized value into zeros and ones, but we still had continuous time until now. And what you do in digital systems is to say that look, let’s digitize everything, or rather discretize everything.

让我们将时间也离散化为时钟上升沿上发生的这些点，这意味着电路有意义，信号只有在时钟上升时才有意义。这倾向于将时间离散化，这意味着我真的不关心信号在这段时间内发生了什么，只要在时钟的上升沿我得到正确的值即可。这个概念称为离散化时间。

And let’s discretize time as well into these points that happen on the rising edge of the clock which means that the circuit has meaning, signals have meaning only when the clock is rising. That tends to discretize time which means that I really don’t care what happens to signals in this time, as long as on the rising edge of the clock I get the right value. This concept is called discretizing time.

时钟可以让你做到这一点。请记住，在数字系统中（你将在 004 中学习），我实际上是在离散化两个事物，将值离散化为零和一，同时还将时间离散化为采样事物的时间和我忽略线路上的值的时间。

And a clock lets you do that. Remember that in digital systems, which you will learn about in 004 I am really discretizing two things, discretizing values into zeros and ones, and at the same time also discretizing time into a time when I sample things and a time when I ignore values on the wires.

我认为大约一个月后您将在 6.004 中学习时钟，因此最初您只需要关注系统的静态特性，而不必担心电路中引入的任何动态时钟。好的，这只是一个简短的小插曲。接下来，让我开始讨论今天的主题：能量和功率。为什么这很重要？这很重要的原因是，什么真正决定了您的手持设备的尺寸？

I think you will get to clocks in 6.004 after about a month, so initially you would just be focusing on the statics of the system without worrying about any dynamic clock introduced in the circuit. OK, that’s just a brief little interlude. With that let me get into today’s topic of energy and power. Why is this important? The reason this is important is that what really determines the size of your handheld?

您可能会想，哦，天哪，手持设备中还有电子设备。有些人可能会想，哦，手持设备中还有天线。不。真正决定手持设备、PDA、手机、笔记本电脑等的大小和重量的，基本上是电池。

You may think oh, gee, electronics in the handheld. Some of you may think, oh, the antenna in the handheld. No. What really, really determines the size and weight of your handheld devices, your PDAs, your cell phones, your laptops and so on is by and large the battery.

在第 2 页，我画了一幅小漫画，向你们展示，如果我们不让你们了解能源和电力，我们所有人在使用手机时都会这样做。毫不奇怪，最早的无线电话最终出现在汽车上，因为汽车有大电池。所以你只能在汽车上使用这些无线电话。

On Page 2 I have a little cartoon that shows you that if we did not have you learn about energy and power, that’s what we would all be doing in order to use cell phones. Not surprisingly the very first wireless phones ended up in automobiles because you had a big battery. And so you had these wireless phones only in cars.

通过大量的研究，基于我在今天的讲座和周四的讲座中要讲到的知识和技术，您将看到非常简单和优雅的方法来减少所需的电池量，以便能够从模拟或数字设备中实现某种功能。

Because of a huge amount of research based on the knowledge, the technologies I am going to talk about in today’s lecture and Thursday’s lecture, you will see very simple and elegant ways of reducing the amount of battery you need to be able to get some kind of function out of analog or digital devices.

我还希望你们看一下我在这里给你们的讲义的第 2 页，即讲义 63。这份讲义讨论了目前最新的数字制造技术。这不是 IBM 的付费广告。IBM 有一项名为 CU08 的技术。它被称为 Blue Logic。它被称为 Copper 08 Process。

I also want you to take a look at Page 2 of the handout that I have given you here, handout 63. This handout talks about the absolute latest in digital fabrication technology out there. This is not a paid commercial for IBM. IBM has a technology called CU08. It is called Blue Logic. It is called the Copper 08 Process.

在这个过程中，如果你看一下第 1 页，IBM 声称它可以在单个芯片中构建多达 7200 万个门。借助这项技术，他们能够构建 7000 万到 8000 万个门，除非另有说明，否则门基本上定义为两个输入 NAND 门等效物。因此，你的反相器、NAND 门等都算作一个门。

And in this process, if you look down on Page 1, for example, IBM claims that it can build up to 72 million gates in a single chip. With this technology they are able to build 70 to 80 million gates where a gate is, unless otherwise mentioned, pretty much defined as a two input NAND gate equivalent. So, your inverter, your NAND gate and so on count as a gate.

他们可以在一块芯片上构建近 8000 万个这样的小吸盘。想象一下。他们能制造的最大芯片边长约为 18 到 19 毫米，大约两厘米。在大约一平方英寸的芯片上。你可以放置 8000 万个门。实际上，今天更重要的是第 2 页上的内容。

And they can build close to 80 million of these little suckers on a single chip. Just imagine that. And the biggest chip they can build is on the order of 18 to 19 millimeters on a side, roughly two centimeters on a side. On a chip that’s about one square inch. You can put down 80 million gates. What is more important for today is what is on Page 2, actually.

我在第 2 页圈出了两件事。我圈出的第一件事是电源范围在 0.7 到 1.3 伏之间。请注意，这些芯片的电源电压明显低于我们在本课程中通常讨论的 5 伏。如有疑问，我们的问题使用的是 5 伏。

I have circled two things on Page 2. One thing that I have circled is power supply range in the 0.7 to 1.3 volts. Notice that voltage, the power supply voltage for these chips is significantly lower than the 5 volts that we have been normally talking about in this course. When in doubt our problems have used 5 volts.

但请注意，在这项技术中，他们谈论的是使用 0.7 到 18 之间的电源电压 VS。00:11:47,000 > 00:00:01,300 为什么会低这么多？好吧，你会找到答案的。我圈出的第二件事是所谓的功率耗散。你说功率耗散是每兆赫每门 0.006 微瓦。它说功率耗散是每兆赫每门 6 纳瓦。

But notice that in this technology they’re talking about using voltages for the power supply VS in the range of 0.7 to 18.00:11:47,000 > 00:00:01,300 Why is it so much lower? Well, you will find out. The second thing I’ve circled is something called power dissipation. And you say power dissipation is said to be 0.006 microwatts per megahertz per gate. It says power dissipation is 6 nanowatts per megahertz per gate.

也就是说，电路中的每个门电路都会以 1 兆赫的频率耗散这么多的功率。这意味着，您应该能够根据门电路的数量、运行电路的频率、使用的电压等，将该数字转换为您可能构建的任何芯片中的功率耗散。

What that says is that each gate off your circuit will dissipate this much power at a 1 megahertz frequency. And the implication of that is that you should be able to convert that single number to the power dissipation in any chip that you might build depending on the number of gates that you have, the frequency you run the circuit at, the voltage that you use and so on and so forth.

在今天的讲座结束时，您将能够利用这个数字并将其与您可能想要构建的任何芯片的功耗相关联。这只是一个动机，在讲座结束时，您将了解如何在五秒钟或更短的时间内快速计算出一个芯片的功耗，哦，是的，它应该消耗大约 30 瓦的功率。

By the end of today’s lecture you will be able to take this number and correlate that into the power dissipation of any chip that you might want to build with this. That just serves as the motivation that by the end of this lecture you will understand how to very quickly in five seconds or less, boom, given a chip, oh, yeah, that should consume about 30 watts of power.

你还将根据这里的一些示例估算奔腾 IV 之后的芯片（我们称之为奔腾 V）在 1 千兆赫下运行时的功耗。我们将根据你所学的知识得出一些绝对令人震惊的数字。带着这种动机，让我开始讨论一些理论，并深入探讨能源和电力的基础。

And what you will also do, based on some examples here, estimate the power of not the Pentium IV but a chip following the Pentium VI, let’s call it the Pentium V would consume if it ran at 1 gigahertz. We will come up with some absolutely shocking numbers based on what you have learned. With that kind of motivation let me get into talking about some theory and get into the foundations of energy and power.

让我们转到第 3 页。为了推动理论讨论，我想重点讨论 MOSFET 栅极中耗散的能量。从根本上讲，我们将讨论包含开关、电阻器和电容器的电路中的能量和功率。MOSFET 栅极只是推动理论的一个说明性示例。

Let’s go to Page 3. To drive the theoretical discussion, I would like to focus on the energy dissipated in a MOSFET gate. And fundamentally we will talk about looking at energy and power in circuits containing switches, resistors and capacitors. The MOSFET gate is simply an illustrative example to drive the theory.

但从根本上讲，今天我要向您展示或引导您完成的是，我将告诉您如何在电路中有电容器、电阻器、电压源和开关时计算功率和能量。我们将看一个如下所示的电路。您的普通逆变器电路。我的逆变器。我在这里应用了一些 vIN 信号。它可能是一个方波。它可能是一些 1 和 0 的序列。

But fundamentally what I am going to show you, or lead you through today, I will tell you how to compute the power and energy when you have capacitors, resistors, voltage sources and switches in your circuit. We will look at a circuit that looks like this. Your vanilla inverter circuit. My inverter. I apply some vIN signal here. It could be a square wave. It could be some sequence of ones and zeros.

这是我们都知道并喜欢的逆变器。这个家伙被卡在了一个电容器里。这个电容器用于模拟这个逆变器驱动的输入门电容以及通向该门的电线的电容等等。这只是一个我卡在那里的集总电容器。我想确定几件事。其中之一就是我们所说的待机功率。

And this is an inverter that we all know and love. And this guy here is, stuck in a capacitor here. And this capacitor is meant to model the input gate capacitance of whatever this inverter drives plus any capacitance of the wire leading up to that gate and so on. It is just a lumped capacitor that I have stuck on there. I am interested in determining a few things. One is what we call the standby power.

您将在手机等产品中看到所有这些术语的使用。在您的手机中，手机制造商会为您提供两个数字。当然，两者都过于夸张，但他们还是会为您提供两个数字。一个数字是手机电池在待机模式下可以使用的天数，对吗？这就是待机的由来。

You will see all these terms being used in cell phones and so on. In your cell phone, your cell phone manufacturer gives you two numbers. Of course both are over exaggerations, but they give you two numbers nonetheless. One number is the number of days that the cell phone battery will last when in standby mode, right? That’s exactly where standby comes from.

在待机模式下，你的手机有多少电量，或者电池能用多久，这就是待机电量。第二个就是我们所说的活动使用电量。活动使用是指你打电话等时，消耗的电量是多少？同样，你的手机制造商会给你一个更小的手机活动使用电量数字。

In standby mode, how much power does your cell phone or how long will the battery last, that’s the standby power. And the second thing is what we call active use power. Active use is when you are making a phone call and so on, what is the power consumed? And there again your manufacturer of your cell phone will give you a much smaller number for the active use power of your cell phone.

为了便于讨论，我将假设逆变器由以下类型的方波信号驱动。这是 vIN。我将使用以下类型的信号来驱动它。在输入端应用周期，因此我将打开和关闭逆变器，打开和关闭，打开和关闭。T1 秒为高电平，T2 秒为低电平。

What I am going to do is assume for discussion that the inverter is driven by a square wave signal of the following sort. This is vIN. And I am going to drive this with a signal of this sort. The period applied at the input, so I am switching the inverter on and off, on and off, on and off. And T1 seconds for the high, T2 seconds for the low.

这是逆变器，这是输入信号，我们会反复讨论这个问题。我不想直接采用这个电路并分析其功率，而是想以稍微迂回的方式进行。我想做的是向你们展示一些非常简单的电路并分析它们的待机功率和有功功率。

This is the inverter, this is the input signal, and we’ll keep coming back to that again and again. Rather than directly taking this circuit and analyzing its power, I would like to do things in a slightly roundabout manner. What I would like to do is show you some very simple circuits and analyze their standby and active powers.

然后向你展示这个电路只是一些你见过的简单东西的组合。示例 1。我想举一个像这样的简单电路。电压源 V 施加在电阻 R 上，电流 I。如果我在这个电阻上施加一个电压，这个电压就会出现在电阻上。

And then show you that this circuit simply is a combination of some of the simple things that you have seen. Example 1. I would like to take a simple circuit that looks like this. A voltage source V applied across a resistor R, some current I. And if I apply a voltage across this resistor, that voltage would simply appear across the resistor.

功率由 VI 给出，即 V 平方除以 R。这是第一章的 6.00.101。这是该电阻消耗的功率，即 V 平方除以 R。这是电阻消耗的功率。功率从何而来？电压源提供功率。所以，这家伙提供功率，这家伙消耗功率。

And the power is simply given by VI which is simply V squared divided by R. This is 6.00.101 in the very first chapter. That is the power that is dissipated by this resistor, simply V squared divided by R. That’s the power dissipated by the resistor. Where does that power come from? The voltage source supplies the power. So, this guy here supplies this power and this guy here dissipates it.

我在 T 时间内耗散的能量是多少？请记住，功率是能量耗散的速率。因此，能量就是功率乘以时间。对于这样的电路，在时间 T 内耗散的能量就是 VIT。对于我们的门，请记住我们有两种情况。我们有 VS，我们有 RL，我们有 RON、vO 和 vIN。因此，vIN 很高。

What is the energy that I dissipate in T time? Remember, power is the rate of energy dissipation. And so energy is simply power multiplied by time. For a circuit like this, energy dissipated in time T is simply VIT. For our gate remember we have two situations. We have VS, we have RL we have RON, vO and vIN. So, vIN is high.

如果 vIN 相对于地高，则 RON 和开关接通，这就是我看到的电路。在这种情况下，消耗的功率只是 V 平方除以这里的电阻。它只是 VS 平方除以 RL 加上 RON。让我用星号标记它。我稍后会提到这一点。同样，当 vIN 低时，MOSFET 关断。功率为零。

If vIN is high with respect to ground then RON, the switch is on, and this is the circuit that I see. In this situation the power consumed is simply V squared divided by the resistance here. It is simply VS squared divided by RL plus RON. Let me mark that with an asterisk. I will refer to this later. Similarly, when vIN is low the MOSFET is off. And the power is simply zero.

没有电流流过，功率为零。这绝对是基本的东西。绝对基本。所以，当我打开 MOSFET 时，对于您到目前为止看到的逆变器类型，功率就是逆变器消耗的功率。这里的星号只是为了记住这个想法，我们稍后再讨论。让我举第二个例子。

I have no current flowing down and the power is zero. Absolutely basic stuff. Absolutely basic. So, the power, when I have the MOSFET on, for the kind of inverters you have seen so far, this is the power consumed by the inverter. And this asterisk here is simply to say hold that thought, we will get back to it a little later. Let me work out a second example.

在第二个例子中，我想考虑以下电路，电压源 VS 具有奇怪的开关排列，S1 带有电阻 R1，电容器 C 以这种方式，开关 S2 和电阻器 R2。现在不用担心电路是如何产生的。假设我已经为您绘制了电路。我想要做的是计算特定条件下的功率。

In this second example, I would like to consider the following circuit, a voltage source VS with a strange arrangement of switches, S1 with a resistance R1, a capacitor C in this manner, a switch S2 and a resistor R2. For now don’t worry about how the circuit comes about. Just assume that I have drawn the circuit for you. And what I want to do is compute the power under certain conditions.

请注意，如果这个关闭，这个关闭，则这个环路或这个环路中都没有电流流动，电路消耗的功率为零。但是有些开关布置确实会消耗功率。所以让我向你展示一下这种开关布置。我要做的是假设开关按照以下周期性循环打开和关闭。

Notice that if this is off and this is off, there is no current flowing either in this loop or this loop, and the power dissipated by the circuit is zero. But there are some arrangement of switches for which I do consume power. And so let me show you that arrangement of switches. And what I am going to do is assume that the switches open and close with the following periodic cycles.

我们假设当它为高电平时，S1 闭合，S2 断开；当它为低电平时，S1 断开，S2 闭合。我们假设这是 T，这是 T1，这是 T2。该序列应该让人想起我馈送到该逆变器的输入。我在这里要告诉您的是，我给您的是电路。我想计算电路的功耗。

Let’s assume that when this is high S1 is closed and S2 is open, and when this is low assume that S1 is open, S2 is closed. And let’s assume this is T, this is T1, this is T2. That sequence should be reminiscent of this input that I am feeding to this inverter. All I am telling you here is that I am giving you the circuit. I want to compute the power consumption of the circuit.

我要告诉你的是，在频率为 T 的时间段内，前 T1 秒这个开关是闭合的，后半段是打开的。所以，这个电路适用。在时钟的后半段，这个开关是打开的，所以这个电路适用。我感兴趣的是，在每个时间周期 T 中消耗的能量是多少？

And what I am telling you is that with the frequency, with a time period of capital T, for the first T1 seconds this switch is closed and that is open. So, this circuit applies. In the second half of the clock this switch is open so this circuit applies. And what I am interested in finding out is what is the energy dissipated in each cycle of time capital T?

我还想找出平均功率。只需花大约五秒钟盯着它，就能直观地了解这里发生了什么。我首先在这里放置一个电压源，然后关闭开关。这是打开的。首先关闭它，会发生什么？当我关闭开关时，VS 将给这个电容器充电。

And I also want to find out the average power. Just spend about five seconds just staring at this and kind of intuit what is going on here. I start by putting a voltage source here and I close the switch. That is open. Start by closing this, what happens? When I close the switch VS is going to charge up this capacitor.

电流流过我的电阻，所以我要给这里的电容充电。然后假设我让 T1 尽可能大，这样这个电容就会充电到 VS 的全部。经过很长时间，这个家伙就会变成电容中的 VS。当它充电时，电流会流过电阻，所以它就在那里耗散功率。

I get current flowing through my resistor, so I am going to be charging up this capacitor here. Then let’s say I allow T1 to be as large as possible, and so this capacitor is going to be charged up to all of VS. After a long time this guy gets to be VS in the capacitor. And as it is charging up I have current flow through the resistor, so it is sitting there dissipating power.

请注意，这个吸盘不会耗散能量。它只是储存能量。因此，电压源提供的能量进来，其中一些被储存在电容器中，一些被电阻耗散。这让我到了 T1 的末尾。在 T2 的末尾，我打开开关并关闭这个开关。

Notice that this sucker does not dissipate energy. It simply stores energy. So, the energy supplied by the voltage source comes in, some of it gets stored in the capacitor and some of it is being dissipated by the resistor. That gets me to the end of T1. At the end of T2 I open the switch and close this switch.

当我关闭开关时，电容器上有一些能量，电容器两端的电压开始驱动电流通过电阻器 R2。现在电容器提供其存储的能量，然后其存储的能量开始通过电阻器 R2 耗散。如果 T2 非常长，则电容器中的所有电荷都会耗尽。最后电容器中的电压将为零。

When I close the switch I have some energy on the capacitor, and the voltage across the capacitor begins to drive a current through this resistor R2. And now the capacitor supplies its stored energy, and its stored energy then begins to dissipate through resistor R2. And if T2 is very long then all the charge in the capacitor drains out. And the voltage in the capacitor at the end will be zero.

所以，这只是对发生的事情的一种高级描述。现在让我们继续从第一原理计算这个小电路的能量。让我们看看整个周期大写 T，第一步看看 T1。当 T1 到位时，S1 闭合，S2 断开。因此，适用的电路如下所示。

So, that is just sort of a high level description of what goes on. Now let’s go ahead and compute from first principles the energetics of this little circuit. Let’s look at the entire period capital T, and as a first step look at T1. When T1 is in place S1 is closed and S2 is open. Accordingly, the circuit that applies looks like this.

我有 VS，S1 是闭合的，所以是闭合的，我有这个电阻 R1，我有这个电容 C，电容两端有电压 VC。您可以继续假设 VC 为零。我开始生活时电容两端没有电压。

I have VS, S1 is closed, so that is closed, and I have this resistance R1, I have this capacitance C, some voltage VC across the capacitor. You can go ahead and assume that VC of zero is zero. That I start off my life with no voltage across the capacitor.

首先，让我绘制波形图并写下表达式，然后计算电压源提供的能量，然后查看能量流向何处。你们都知道，或者现在应该知道，如果我将 VC 绘制为时间函数，请记住，这真的很容易做到。VC 作为时间函数如下。

First of all, let me plot the waveforms and write the expressions down and then compute the energy supplied by the voltage source and then look at where the energy goes. You all know, or should know by now, if I plot VC as a function of time, remember, this is really easy to do. VC as a function of time goes like this.

当时间 T 等于零时，我告诉你电容器电压为零。我告诉你这一点。所以，它为零。然后电容器充电直到达到 VS。我还知道经过很长时间后，这将是 VS，经过很长时间后，这将是 VS，在这两者之间，我有一个如下所示的上升函数。我可以同样为你绘制电流图。

At time T equal to zero I am telling you that the capacitor voltage is zero. I am telling you that. So, it is at zero. And then the capacitor charges up until it reaches VS. I also know that after a long time this will be VS, after a long time that will be VS, and between those two I have a rising function that looks like this. I can similarly plot the current for you.

当时间 T 等于零时，电容器瞬间看起来像是短路，因此我开始时的电流将是 VS 除以 R1。电容器两端的电压为零。所有电压都落在电阻器 R1 两端。因此，VS 除以 R1 是初始瞬时电流。经过很长时间后，由于 VC 达到 VS，电流将为零。

At time T equal to zero instantaneously the capacitor looks like a short, and so the current that I start off with is going to be VS divided by R1. The voltage across the capacitor is zero. All the voltage falls across the resistor R1. So, VS divided by R1 is the initial instantaneous current. And after a long time, because VC reaches VS, the current is going to be zero.

在这两点之间，我得到了一个指数衰减。我可以很快写下电流的表达式。它只是初始值 VS 除以 R1 乘以指数衰减减去 T 除以电路 R1C 的时间常数。你之前已经看过这些东西了。接下来是我们现在关心的部分。让我们找出源提供的总能量是多少。

And between those two points I get an exponential decay. I could very quickly write down the expression for the current. And that is simply the initial value VS divided by R1 times the exponential decay minus T divided by the time constant for the circuit R1C. You have seen this stuff before. Here comes the part that we care about for now. Let’s find out what is the total energy provided by the source.

在处理能量计算时，你必须非常小心这里的这些词，供给、提供与耗散。耗散意味着电阻器正在消耗能量。提供意味着源正在提供该能量。因此，源在 T1 期间提供的能量。让我们继续快速计算一下。源提供的能量只是源两端的电压乘以源提供的电流。这就是 i。

When dealing with energy computations you have to be incredibly careful of these words here, supply, provided versus dissipated. Dissipated implies that the resistor is burning energy. Provided means that the source is supplying that energy. So, energy provided by source during T1. Let’s go ahead and compute that very quickly. The energy supplied by the source is simply the voltage across the source multiplied by the current being supplied by the source. This is i.

记住，根据关联变量惯例，如果某个元件上有电压，并且流入该元件的电流为正，则该元件会耗散功率。如果这里的电压为 1 伏，并且它正在提供电流，如果 I 朝另一个方向流出，则它正在提供功率。在这种情况下，电流 I 将在外部，流向外部。

Remember, by associated variables convention, if I have a voltage across some element and the current into the element is positive then that element dissipates power. If the voltage here is, say, 1 volt and it is supplying current, if the I is out in the other direction then it is supplying power. In this case, the current I is going to be on the outside, heading outside.

总能量将是瞬时功率随时间积分的结果，也就是 VS。请记住，瞬时功率是 VS 乘以电流 i，因此瞬时功率就是 VS 乘以 i，这就是瞬时功率。

The total energy is going to be the instantaneous power integrated over time, and that is simply VS. Remember, the instantaneous power is VS times the current i, so the instantaneous power is simply VS times i, that is the instantaneous power.

为了得到电源提供的能量和某个时间，我必须在感兴趣的时间段 T1 内对瞬时功率进行积分。这样就可以得到电源在 T1 期间提供的能量。让我继续用这里的这个表达式代替 I。它是 VS 乘以 i，I 是 VS 除以 R1 乘以这里的这个表达式。这样就可以得到 (VS 2/R1)e ( t/R1C) dt。让我在那里进行积分。

To get the energy provided by source and some time, I have to integrate that instantaneous power over the period of interest T1. That gives me the energy supplied by the source during T1. And let me go ahead and substitute for I with this expression here. It is VS times i, and I is VS divided by R1 times this expression here. That gives me (VS2/R1)e( t/R1C) dt. Let me carry out the integration there.

我得到 1/RC，因此我得到了这个。我还可以写下来，哦，让我更仔细一点。VS^2/R1 出来了，我在分子中得到了 R1C。如果我对它进行微分，那么我在分母中得到了 R1C。我得到了一个积分。然后我写下 e^ t/R1C、零和 T1。因此，这个 R1 和这个 R1 抵消了。

I get 1/RC, so I get this outside. And I also get to write down, oops, let me do that a little bit more carefully. VS^2/R1 simply comes out and I get a R1C in the numerator. If I differentiate it then I get R1C in the denominator. I have an integral that comes up here. And then I write down e^ t/R1C, zero and T1. So, this R1 and this R1 cancel out.

我最终得到了类似这样的结果。我得到了 CVS^2。因此这里有一个减号，所以当这个数字为零时，它会变成 1，所以我得到了 1。由于有减号，我得到了 T1/R1C 的 e。我在这里所做的只是通过数学运算来做这个积分。

And I end up getting something that looks like this. I get CVS^2. And so there is a minus sign out here, so at zero this thing goes to a one, so I get a one. And because of minus sign I get e to the T1/R1C. All I have done here is simply go through the math to do this integration here.

我还要假设，如果 T1，如果开关闭合的时间比电路的时间常数大得多，T1 比 R1C 大得多，如果 R1C 比 R1C 大得多，那么这个项将变为零。这或多或少等于 CVS^2。我们这里得到了什么？

What I am also going to do is assume that if T1, if the time that the switch is closed is much, much bigger than the time constant of the circuit, T1 is much, much greater than R1C, if this is much, much greater than R1C then this term goes to zero. And this becomes more or less equal to CVS^2. What do we have here?

我们现在知道的是，如果我让开关长时间保持关闭状态，而 S 保持打开状态，那么电压源将提供一定量的能量。该能量将等于 CVS^2。电容器两端的电压将为 VS，所有能量都将由这个家伙提供。让我在这里提出以下难题。

What we have here is that if I let the switch stay closed for a long time and S to be open then the voltage source is going to supply some amount of energy. That energy will equal CVS^2. The voltage across the capacitor will be VS and all that energy would have been supplied by this guy. Let me pose the following conundrum here.

如果电容器两端的电压为 VS，因为我们知道电容器中存储的能量是 CV^2 的一半。因此，电容器中的能量是 CVS^2 的一半。归根结底，由于电容器两端的电压为 VS，因此 ΩCV@2 就是此处存储的能量。但是从这个计算中我们知道，电源提供了 CVS^2。电源提供了两倍的能量。

If the voltage across the capacitor is VS, because we know the energy stored in the capacitor is half CV^2. So, the energy in the capacitor is half CVS^2. At the end of the day, since the voltage across the capacitor is VS, ΩCV@2 is the energy stored here. But we know, from this calculation, the source has supplied CVS^2. Source has supplied twice that energy.

这个家伙提供了两倍的能量，但只有一半储存在这里。谁消耗了另一半？正是电阻。电阻消耗了一半的能量。我来给你演示一下。它消耗了 ΩCVS^2。这很有趣。这是一个非常简单的结果。

This guy has supplied twice that energy and only half of that is stored here. Who ate up the other half? The resistor, exactly. The resistor has walloped half the energy. Let me just show it to you. It dissipated ΩCVS^2. It’s pretty interesting. It’s a pretty simple result.

如果 T1 与时间常数相比非常大，那么一半的能量在电容器中，另一半已被 R1 消耗。这些能量并没有被消耗。它们只是被储存起来了。它们被电容器储存起来了。如果你在这里做简单的能量守恒计算，电阻中消耗的能量加上电容器中储存的能量等于源提供的能量。好的。现在我们来讨论 T2。

If T1 is very large compared to time constant then half the energy is in the capacitor and half of it has been burned by R1. This energy has not been burned. It is simply stored. It is stored by the capacitor. And if you do simple energy conservation arithmetic here, the energy dissipated in the resistor plus that stored in the capacitor equals the energy supplied by the source. All right. Let’s go to T2 now.

在 T2 时，S2 闭合，S1 断开。让我们看看周期的第二部分，此时 S1 断开，S2 闭合。现在将要发生的是，可以忽略电路的左侧部分，我可以专注于这一部分。因此，S2 闭合。这是 RC，我的电容器，这是 vC。这是感兴趣的电路。它的初始条件是什么？

At T2, S2 is closed and S1 is open. Let’s look at the second part of the cycle when S1 is open and S2 is closed. And what is going to happen now is the left hand part of the circuit can be ignored and I can focus on this part. So, S2 is closed. This is RC, my capacitor, this is vC. This is the circuit of interest. What is the initial condition on this?

最初的 vC 值是多少？首先，因为请记住，我让这个电容完全充电，因此最初我在电容器上有 VS。因此，电容器上的能量最初是 ΩCVS^2。这就是电容器上的能量。

What is the value of vC initially? Start off, because remember, I allowed this capacity to charge up fully, and so initially I have VS on the capacitor. And so the energy on the capacitor initially is ΩCVS^2. That is the energy on the capacitor.

这次我不会进行这样的积分过程，但如果你愿意，你可以以类似的方式进行，现在假设 T2 远大于这个时间常数。如果 T2 远大于 R2C，这个时间常数。

This time around I won’t go through an integration process like that, but you can if you like, and do it in a much similar manner to say that now let’s suppose that T2 is much greater than this time constant. If T2 is much greater than R2C, this time constant.

如果该时间远大于整个时间，则初始电压 VS 会驱动电流通过电阻器，经过一段时间后，电容器两端的电压将变为零，并且电容器中的所有能量都会在 R 中消散。

If that time is much greater than this entire, the initial voltage VS drives a current through the resistor, and after some amount of time the voltage across the capacitor goes to zero and all the energy in the capacitor gets dissipated in R.

因此，如果 T2 远大于 R2C，则 R2 中耗散的能量就是 ΩCVS^2。请注意，在前半周期中，R1 中耗散的能量是 ΩCVS^2，而在 T2 期间的后半周期中，如果 T2 足够大，则所有这些能量都会耗散在这个电阻器 R2 中。我这里有这个表达式。

So, if T2 is much greater than R2C then energy dissipated in R2 is simply ΩCVS^2. Notice that the energy dissipated in R1, in the first half cycle is ΩCVS^2 and the second half cycle during T2, if T2 is large enough, all this energy gets dissipated in this resistor R2. And I have that expression here.

假设这是 E1，假设这是 E2。因此，在后半个周期中，E1 消耗在电阻器中，而 E2 消耗在 R2 中。此时需要注意一些有趣的事情。其一是 E1 和 E2 与 R 无关。

So let me just say that this is E1 and let me say that this is E2. So, E1 is dissipated in the resistor and E2 is dissipated in R2 in the second half cycle. A couple of interesting things to note at this point. One is that E1 and E2 are independent of R.

如果时间常数与我给电容器充电的时间相比足够小，那么一半的能量就会大量进入电阻器，也就是 ΩCVS^2。如果我让它完全放电，那么通过哪个电阻器放电就无关紧要了。这就是直觉。如果我这里有一定的能量，并且让它完全放电，那么这个电阻器是什么就无关紧要了。无论大小，都没关系。

If the time constant is small enough compared to the time that I charge the capacitor then half the energy gets lots in the resistor, and that is simply ΩCVS^2. And if I let this discharge completely it doesn’t matter what resistor I am discharging it through. That’s the intuition. If I have certain energy here and I let it discharge completely it doesn’t matter what this resistor is. Small or large, it doesn’t matter.

所有这些能量都在那里消散了。能量消散的速度将根据 R2 而变化。如果 R2 非常小，那么我最初会获得一阵能量，然后迅速衰减，但如果 R​​2 非常大，那么我的能量释放速度就会慢得多。但足以说明，能量消散，T2 中的总能量只是 ΩCVS^2。好吧。

All this energy gets dissipated there. The rate at which the energy gets dissipated will change depending on R2. If R2 is very small then I get a burst of power initially and then a rapid decay after that, but if R2 is very large then I have a much slower release of energy. But suffice it to say that the energy dissipated, the total energy in T2 is simply ΩCVS^2. All right.

让我们将 T1 和 T2 放在一起，看看总能量耗散。总能量耗散。E 就是 E1 加 E2。在每个周期内耗散。假设 T1 和 T2 远大于各自的时间常数。我知道这是 ΩCVS^2，ΩCVS^2，所以这只是 CVS^2。如果我有这样的开关和电容器布置，我会给电容器充电，给电容器放电，给电容器充电，给电容器放电。

Let’s put T1 and T2 together and look at the total energy dissipated Total energy dissipated. E is simply E1 plus E2. Dissipated in each cycle. Assuming T1 and T2 are much larger than the respective time constants. And I know that this is ΩCVS^2, ΩCVS^2, so this is simply CVS^2. If I have an arrangement of switches and capacitors like that, I charge the capacitor, discharge the capacitor, charge the capacitor, discharge the capacitor.

它的意思是，在一个充电/放电周期中，我消耗了 CVS^2 的能量。充电时消耗 ΩCVS^2，放电时消耗 ΩCVS^2。这就是我得到的。让我们计算一下平均功耗，一个周期的平均功率 P 就是 E/T，其中 T 是我向您展示的方波序列的周期。这只是 CVS^2 除以 T。

What it is saying is that in a charge/discharge cycle I am using up CVS^2 of energy. ΩCVS^2 when I charge it up and ΩCVS^2 when I discharge it. That is what I get. Let’s compute the average power dissipated, P average in a cycle is simply E/T where T is the period of the square wave sequence that I have shown you out there. This is simply CVS^2 divided by T.

如果方波的周期是大写 T，我可以将其表示为频率。例如，假设方波的周期是 T，那么假设方波的频率就是 1/T。我也可以将其表示为 C(VS^2)f。这说明了什么？让我将其标记为要记住的事情，第二件要记住的事情。一个是功率，即静态功率。

If the period of the square wave is capital T, I can express that as a frequency. Let’s say for example the period of the square wave is T, so let’s say the frequency of the square wave is simply 1/T. I can also express this as C(VS^2)f. What does this say? Let me mark that as a thing to remember, the second thing to remember. One was the power that was the static power.

第二，这个功率与频率 f 以及上面显示的那个小电路中的电容器的充电和放电有关。因此，这个平均功率是 CVS^2f。这意味着，如果 f 很高，如果我对电容器进行充电和放电的频率很高，那么我就会更频繁地充电和放电，因此我会消耗更多的功率。

And second is this power relating to this frequency f and the charging and discharging of the capacitor in that little circuit shown up there. So, this average power is CVS^2f. What this is saying is that if f is high, if I have high frequency of charging and discharging the capacitor then I am charging and discharging much more frequently so I am going to consume more power.

请注意，在任何给定时间，电源和地面之间都没有直接连接。我所做的是，我的电容器是一个中介。我将一些电荷倾倒在电容器中，电容器将电荷倾倒到地面。它的行为就像电容器的开关。它所做的是以频率 f 进行充电和放电。 

Notice that at any given time there is no direct connection between the power supply and the ground. What I am doing is my capacitor is an intermediary. I am dumping some charge in the capacitor and the capacitor is dumping the charge into ground. It behaves like a switch to capacitor. And what it is doing is it is being charged and discharged at frequency f. 

因此，我泵送的平均电流量与我给电容器充电和放电的频率有关，这是有道理的。同样，平均功率也与电容器的值有关。如果 C 较大，我会耗散更多能量。电压也是一样。

So, it makes sense that the amount of average current that I am pumping through relates to the frequency at which I am charging and discharging the capacitor. And similarly the average power also relates to the value of the capacitor. If C is larger I dissipate more energy. And the same way with the voltage.

如果电压较高，则该周期内的功率或平均功率与 CVS^2 有关。花几秒钟时间看一下这两个表达式。这里的功率仅与电源和地之间的连接有关，而外面的功率与电容器的充电和放电有关。现在让我们回到我们的逆变器。这是我们的逆变器电路。假设我用这里显示的波形驱动输入。

If the voltage is higher then the power in that period, or the average power relates to CVS^2. Spend a few seconds staring at the two expressions. This power here relating to just this connection between the power supply and ground and that power out there relating to charging and discharging capacitors. Let’s get back to our inverter right now. This is our inverter circuit. Let us say that I drive the input with the waveform shown here.

好吧，我回到与这里相同的情况。我用方波驱动输入，T1 和 T2 分别作为高时间和低时间。这个等效电路与我们在那里看到的并不完全相同。这个等效电路看起来是这样的。我有一个 VS。VS 电源通过 RL 连接，VS 通过 RL 连接到电容器 C。这是我的电压 vO。

Well, I go back to the same situation as here. I drive the input with a square wave, with T1 and T2 as the high time and the low time. The equivalent circuit for this is not exactly what we saw there. The equivalent circuit for this would look like this. I have a VS. And the VS supply is connected through RL, VS connected through RL to a capacitor C. This is my voltage vO.

因此，VS 始终以这种方式通过该电阻和电容接地。然后我这里有一个电阻 RON，与该 MOSFET 相对应。我在这里以在 T1 期间打开并在 T2 期间关闭的方式打开和关闭它。因此，这里的情况与我在那里计算的简单情况略有不同。

So, VS is always connected to ground through this resistor and capacitor in this manner. And then I have a resistor here RON corresponding to that MOSFET. And there I am switching it on and off in a way that it is on during T1 and off during T2. So, the situation here is a bit different from that simple situation I computed there.

就像我计算该电路中的功率耗散一样，我可以继续计算该电路中的总功率耗散。我不会在这里做这件事。代数运算往往比我经历过的要复杂得多。并且足以说明，您可以证明平均功率由 (VS 2)/(2(RL+RON))+(CVS 2)f (RL 2)/(RL+RON) 2 给出。好吗？有关详细信息，我建议您查看课程笔记的第 12.3 节。

Much like I computed the power dissipation in that circuit, I can go ahead and compute the total power dissipated in this circuit. I won’t do it here. The algebra tends to be a big more grubbier than what I have been through. And suffice it to say that you can show that the average power is given by (VS2)/(2(RL+RON))+(CVS2)f (RL2)/(RL+RON)2. OK? And for details I suggest that you look at section 12.3 of the course notes.

第 12.3 节通过代数计算了该特定电路消耗的总功率，下面是我们得到的表达式。让我们以 RL 远大于 RON 的特定情况为例。如果 RL 远大于 RON，那么我可以忽略这里的 RON。我得到了这个。在这里，如果我忽略 RON，那么 RL 和 RL 将抵消，我得到 CVS^2f。

Section 12.3 goes through the algebra to compute the total power dissipated by this specific circuit, and here is the expression we get. And let’s take the specific situation where RL is much greater than RON. If RL is much greater than RON then I can ignore this RON here. And I get this. And out here, if I ignore RON, then RL and RL will cancel out and I get CVS^2f.

如果我忽略 RON 与 RL 的比较，这就是我得到的表达式。现在您可以明白我为什么要举这两个例子了。这正是电源与地之间的连接所消耗的功率。而这个 CVS^2f 是电容器充电和放电所消耗的功率。如果您看一下这里的电路，它消耗了两种功率。

If I ignore RON compared to RL this is the expression I get. Now you can see why I went through those two examples. This is exactly the power consumed by the connection between power supply and ground. And this CVS^2f is the power consumed in charging and discharging the capacitor. If you look at the circuit here it is consuming two kinds of power.

一种功率是由于电流直接从 VS 流经 RL 和 RON 到地。哦，顺便说一下，这也假设 T1 等于 T2。因此，在这个电路中有两种功率。一种是当开关打开时产生的功率，电流从 VS 流经 RL 再流到地。注意，我在这里的分母中得到了一个额外的 2 倍因子。

One kind of power is due to the current flowing directly from VS through RL and RON to ground. Oh, this also assumes, by the way, that T1 is equal to T2. So, in this circuit there are two kinds of power. One is the power when the switch is on and I have a current flowing from VS to RL to ground. Notice I get an extra factor of two in the denominator here.

之所以有 2，是因为接地只发生一半的时间。因为只有当开关打开时，我才接地，所以那里的功率是那个的一半。而且这种情况只发生一半的时间，因此我得到了 VS^2/2RL。然后 CVS^2f 就是我消耗的功率，因为​​我正在给电容器 C 充电和放电。请注意，在这个逆变器电路中有两种功率。

And that two comes about because the connection to ground only happens half the time. It’s half that power out there because I am connected to ground only when the switch is on. And that happens only half the time, and so therefore I get the VS^2/2RL. And then CVS^2f is simply the power that I consumed because I am charging and discharging the capacitor C. Notice that in this inverter circuit there are two kinds of power.

一个是待机功率，即电路消耗的静态功率，第二个功率是动态功率，因为​​电路在上下切换。这与星型有关，也与双星型有关。为了说明这一点，我这里有一个带有逆变器的小演示。我将提高驱动逆变器的平方方式的频率。

One is called the standby power which is static power being consumed by the circuit, and the second power is the dynamic power because the circuit is switching up and down. This relates to star and this relates to the double star. And to demonstrate that, I have a little demonstration here that has an inverter. And I am going to up the frequency of the square way of driving the inverter.

我将向你们展示一些数字，所以请在本演示结束后稍等两分钟。我会给出一些数字，但我希望你们继续根据我们在这里看到的内容计算这些数字。我向你们保证，你们会对此印象深刻。这是馈送到逆变器的输入。这是逆变器的输出。

I am going to show you a few numbers so hang on for two minutes after this demo. I will give you some numbers, but I want you to go ahead and compute the numbers based on what we have seen here. And you will get suitably impressed, I promise you. This is the input fed to the inverter. This is the output of the inverter.

请注意，由于输出驱动电容器，逆变器的输出反映了某种 RC 时间常数，这里也是一样。我首先向您展示，在左侧我只是测量电路消耗的功率。请注意，消耗的功率由此处的指针表示。

Notice that the output of the inverter reflects some sort of an RC time constant because of the output driving the capacitor, and the same way here. I start off by showing you that on the left hand side I am simply measuring the power being consumed by the circuit. Notice that the power being consumed is expressed by the needle being at this point here.

这是非常低的频率，所以这几乎是逆变器消耗的所有待机功率。逆变器有一半的时间处于开启状态，当它开启时会消耗功率。我现在要做的就是增加频率。当我增加驱动逆变器的频率时，这个指针会发生什么？当我增加频率时，波形应该越来越接近。指针会发生什么？

This is a very low frequency so this is almost all standby power consumed by the inverter. The inverter is on half the time, and when it is on it is consuming power. What I am going to now is increase the frequency. As I increase the frequency driving the inverter what should happen to this needle? As I increase the frequency there that waveform should become closer and closer together. And what should happen to the needle?

那应该开始上升。如果我增加频率，它应该会消耗越来越多的功率，指针应该开始上升。所以，让我来帮你做这件事。就数字而言，它位于中间刻度上的四个顶部。我将非常缓慢地增加频率。不幸的是，采样示波器弄乱了波形。现在先忽略波形。

That should begin to go up. If I increase the frequency it should consume more and more power and the needle should start going up. So, let me do that for you. In terms of numbers there it is on top of the four on the scale in the middle. I am going to increase the frequency very slowly. Unfortunately, the sampling scope messes up the waveform. Ignore the waveform for now.

当我增加频率时，只需查看仪表。请注意，我已将频率增加了约 2 或 3 倍。请注意，此处仪表已移动。指针已移至右侧。我可以继续这样做，指针会继续向右移动，因为我消耗的电量越来越多，因为我驱动逆变器的速度越来越快。

Just look at the meter as I increase the frequency. Notice that I have increased the frequency by about a factor of 2 or 3. And notice here that this meter has moved. The needle has moved to the right. And I can keep doing that and the needle keeps moving to the right as I am consuming more and more power because I’m driving the inverter faster and faster and faster.

这应该能说服你，存在待机功率，并且存在一些与频率相关的功率组件。这与您手机的待机功率有关。这涉及主动使用。让我向您展示一些数字，您可以自己将这些数字代入，看看这个转换器将消耗多少功率，看看它是否有意义。假设我有一个有 10^8 个门的芯片。F 是 1 千兆赫。

That should convince you that there is a standby power and there is some power component related to frequency. This relates to your standby power in your cell phone. This relates to active use. Let me show you some numbers, and you can plug those numbers in yourself and see how much power this converter is going to consume and see if it makes sense. Assume that I have a chip with 10^8 gates. F is 1 gigahertz.

即 10^9。假设 C 为 0.1 飞法拉，即 10^16 法拉。假设 VS 为 5 伏。假设 RL 为 10 千欧姆。使用这些数字。将这些数字代入此处，并了解如果我们的现代电路使用该逆变器，包含 10^8 个此类门的芯片将消耗多少功率？

That is 10^9. Assume C is 0.1 femtofarads which is 10^ 16 farads. Assume VS is 5 volts. Assume RL is 10 kilo ohms. Use these numbers. Plug these numbers in here and get a sense if our modern day circuitry used that inverter, what would be the power consumed by a chip that contains 10^8 of these gates?

你会发现，你可能不得不使用核反应堆来真正驱动这个芯片，但请自己去看看。在下一讲中，我们将看到我们的手机是如何工作的，尽管有如此可怕的计算，生活是如何继续的。

You will find out that you may have to use a nuclear power reactor to actually drive that chip, but go check it out for yourselves. In the next lecture we will see then how do our cell phones work, how does life go on despite this horrendous calculation here.
